title: Data Engineer / Data Scientist
description:
b"

Australian start up success story requires a data specialist to join their Sydney Team. You will be working within a team of Data expects providing the next generation of algorithms to address today's and tomorrow's challenges.

Responsibilities

  • Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our core products
  • Partner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities
  • Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions
  • Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor performance\xc2\xa0
  • Mine massive amounts of data and extract useful product insights

Experience

\xc2\xa0

  • Experience in applying data mining and machine learning techniques to big data.
  • Strong programming skills in R, Python, and/or C++.
  • Knowledge of data analysis tools.
  • Good communication, problem solving and research skills.
  • Degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, engineering or computer science).
  • Familiarity with big data tools such as Hadoop, Hive and MapReduce.
  • Experience with NOSQL databases such as Cassandra and MongoDB

This position can be contract or permanent\xc2\xa0

"

title: Data Analyst
description:
b'The Customer Data Analyst will support the Customer Data Analytics Manager to implement and maintain the proactive data-driven capability across all brands and product portfolios [Consumer Finance (Credit Cards and Personal Loans), Everyday Banking (Consumer Deposits) and Home Ownership (Mortgages)] within the Consumer Bank (CB).
\xc2\xa0
This is a 12month contract position.
The role will require working closely with key stakeholders from the Product teams from as well as Data Analysts and Business Performance Analytics.
\xc2\xa0
Scope:
\xc2\xa0
Westpac is building new capability to better understand customer behaviour and how we can improve the way our products are designed, sold, used and serviced. This is core to building trust with customers.
When customers come to Westpac, they expect to be on a product that is suited to them and performs in a fair way \xe2\x80\x93 there is value received for the cost paid. Over time and in different circumstances this can change. We want to anticipate and know these changes so that we can help customers make better and more informed decisions.\xc2\xa0
Help may come in a variety of ways \xe2\x80\x93 informing customers on how to best use a product, maximise their benefits or helping them switch to better options.
\xc2\xa0
The Customer Data Analyst will support the Customer Data Analytics Manager to implement a new data-driven monitoring program across Consumer Bank products. The Customer Data Analyst will be responsible for:
  • Designing and executing the code required to proactively mine through customer data in search of insights.

  • Revising and validating analysis based on feedback and new learning obtained through testing hypotheses.


  • Capturing the program/code used through each review such that it can be operationalised and re-run.


  • Analysing the findings and packaging them into insights that can be presented to CB product teams to be enable decision making.\xc2\xa0
Outcomes
\xc2\xa0
The Product Quality team is tasked with ensuring the following outcomes for Consumer Bank Products:

  • Strong risk and compliance culture and tone at the top, where staff clearly understand first line roles and responsibilities, monitor risk and control performance, and communicate the importance of control practices.


  • Robust product management process and controls design and operation, to prevent and detect product quality issues.


  • Our staff understands and commit to delivering products that are fair and suitable for customers, and understand the underlying policies, frameworks, process and controls and deliver to these.


  • Three lines of defence work in an integrated, simple and seamless way and make it simple for product teams to manage and deliver their risk, control and compliance outcomes.


  • When we make a mistake, we put the customer back in the right position


  • Design and execute the codes required to proactively mine through data in order to test hypotheses set during each review. Revise analysis based on feedback and new learning obtained through testing hypotheses.


  • Record Keeping: Ensuring that all work completed with respect to each proactive data review is comprehensively documented to include all data sources used, the methodology applied for analysis and any assumptions and constraints. All codes developed as part of the review should also be stored such that they can be systematically referenced and re-used.


  • Documentation: of the scope of all reviews as agreed with key stakeholders. The scope document should clearly outline the objectives and outcomes from each data driven review.


  • Reporting: On a regular and ad-hoc basis, providing key stakeholders with updates regarding the progress of each review.
Experience
  • Extensive knowledge of data extraction and analysis from large customer bases using SAS applications, SQL and advanced Excel

  • Experience Qlikview, Tableau or other similar Data Visualisation tools is desireable.


  • Use of data warehouses and core databases, with knowledge of Westpac and St George data and systems an advantage but not essential


  • Ability to turn quantitative and qualitative analysis into business insights, opportunities and solutions


  • Product knowledge of Mortgages, Deposits and/or Credit Cards and loans is desirable


  • Sound communication, influencing and negotiation skills


  • Sound stakeholder management experience


  • Effective communication of work using PowerPoint and Word


  • Proven ability in supporting the development of strategic and operational plans


  • Proven skills in organising, prioritising, problem\xc2\xa0 solving and decision making


  • Previous experience with P&L and balance sheet analysis and interpretation


  • Knowledge of accounting principles


  • Knowledge of finance principles


  • Financial industry experience


  • Previous experience with remediation programs is desirable

'

title: Media Data Analyst
description:
b'

Are you looking to join massive digital media & advertising brand? Do you have an absolute passion\xe2\x80\xa6 no, obsession for data marketing, digital analytics and insights? Big Wave digital is thrilled to have such a successful partnership with this advertising technology platform and digital media firm; and keen to recruit their newest hire; Media Data Analyst to join their data marketing team.

The role is supporting the Head of Media, and will be responsible for data analysis, developing and delivering commercial insights and digital reporting.

The ideal candidate will have Post Grad qualifications in Stats, Economics, or relevant and come from an analytics, data and digital insights background, perhaps within marketing, technology or competitor industry.\xc2\xa0 You\xe2\x80\x99ll need excellent general computer skills and experience with large business databases, ideally using packages like SQL server, SPSS, Oracle or Alteryx. If you\xe2\x80\x99ve had previous exposure to product management and marketing, that would be a huge plus!

Key duties will include:

  • Working across digital media and data projects such as segmentation, classification and profiling
  • Digital reporting (GA, GfK etc) translating key internal and external digital trends, to help the business shape their digital & data strategy
  • Supporting commercial teams with the data & insights to assist with business outcomes
  • Management of Salesforce CRM to ensure compliance
  • Manage pre and post-sales support engagement process to drive new and existing analytics business
  • Project management of complex analytical solutions

The best fit candidate for this business will be resourceful, with high attention to detail and a curious mind. You will be committed to working in a team environment, passionate about growing yourself professionally, with the absolute best communication and interpersonal skills. \xc2\xa0Your stakeholder management experience will need to be second to none, and your ability to turn numbers into actionable business outcomes will be your key strength. It is essential that you have Advanced MS Excel skills and a strong working knowledge of Google Analytics.

If you believe you fill the brief, send your application through via the link below, marked attention to Dayna Stewart| Head of Digital & Data Recruitment| Dayna@bigwavedigital.com.au | www.bigwavedigital.com.au \xc2\xa0all applications will be held in confidence.\xc2\xa0

'

title: Data Engineer
description:
b"
  • One of Australia's leading general insurers
  • Full-time or contract positions available
  • Career development opportunities

\xc2\xa0

About Us

IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, with a growing presence in Asia. IAG owns some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC, WFI and Swann Insurance.

At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:

  • #Proud to be me \xe2\x80\x93 we value difference, not sameness
  • #Together \xe2\x80\x93 harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to bring our best for our customers & each other
  • #No boxes \xe2\x80\x93 it's not about labels, boxes or categories, rather it's about building a diversity, inclusion & belonging mindset into everything we do

In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.

\xc2\xa0

The Role

The Data Engineer position reports in to our Data & Product Engineering Director and is based in our Sydney CBD Head office.

This role plays a critical role in ensuring that data pipelines are scalable, repeatable, and secure, and can serve 1000's of users.

This role will include developing prototypes and proof of concepts for the selected solutions, and implementing complex data projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, analysing and visualising large sets of data using multiple platforms. You will also have the capability to architect highly scalable distributed systems, using open source tools.

The Data Engineer role is a technical job that requires substantial expertise in a broad range of software development and programming skills. The Data Engineer will have knowledge of data analysis, end user requirements analysis, and business requirements analysis to develop a clear understanding of the business needs and to incorporate these needs into technical solutions. In addition you will have a solid understanding of physical database design principles, and the software development life cycle.

\xc2\xa0

Role Responsibilities

  • Selecting and integrating tools and frameworks required to provide requested capabilities, with a focus on open source
  • Implementing ELT process
  • Monitoring performance and advising any necessary infrastructure changes

\xc2\xa0

Keys skills and experience required

  • Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles
  • Extensive coding and programming in a range of languages such as Python, Scala, Java, R, etc.
  • Proficiency with open source data storage platforms such as Hadoop
  • Experience with building stream-processing systems, using solutions such as Storm or Spark-Streaming
  • Experience with NoSQL databases, such as Cassandra
  • Knowledge of various ELT techniques and frameworks, such as Flume
  • Experience with various messaging systems, such as Kafka
  • Good understanding of Lambda Architecture, along with its advantages and drawbacks

\xc2\xa0

How to Apply

To submit your interest in this role, please click the \xe2\x80\x98Apply' button below.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Data Scientist
description:
b'

The NRMA was born to keep people moving, and we have been doing this for nearly 100 years. Our vision is to create indispensable connections with our Members\xe2\x80\x99 mobility through my car, my journey and my destination.

Our Members enjoy our legendary roadside assistance, car servicing and repairs, Thrifty car and truck rentals, the latest fuel prices and more via the mynrma app, discounted travel and accommodation at our Holiday parks, Travelodge and Hotel Kurrajong Canberra

Your opportunity

Data is an incredibly important area of growth for the NRMA. This year we have made a significant investment in our people and technology and have already had a fantastic response for the real-time Fuel and Parking features which we launched in the MyNRMA app late last year. But this is just the beginning.

The Data Scientist will have a stronger focus on expanding and enriching our member-customer data assets & capability, through close collaboration with Technology and Product Management.

Here is where you come in!

  • Support the continuous expansion and enrichment of Data Assets and Capabilities
  • Perform predictive analytics and build models for customer engagement, retention, lifetime value
  • Grow data and business knowledge of Membership and Group Businesses
  • Ensure timely and accurate delivery of reports for designated stakeholder groups
  • Hands on analysis and visualization of complex web based data utilizing a variety of tools
  • Manage the campaign data design, build, delivery, and measurement of all Member and Customer communications

Your experience

You will have the customer experience at the heart of what you do and be able to demonstrate:

  • Tertiary related qualification in computer science, statistics, marketing, or IT related discipline
  • Minimum 7 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in an analyst role responsible for campaign, reporting, and analysis
  • Advanced SQL skills and experience dealing with large and complex data sets
  • Ability to adapt and navigate through complex systems
  • Strong analytical, business acumen, and problem solving skills
  • Possess a positive \xe2\x80\x9ccan-do\xe2\x80\x9d attitude couples with excellent communication skills
  • Experience in data warehousing, data modeling, propensity modeling and scoring, statistical inference and validation, segmentation, clustering, regression and response modeling

Your benefits

We offer a competitive remuneration and our benefits include 50% discount on insurance, free NRMA Premium Care Membership , product and travel discounts, 50% discount on Village Roadshow Theme Parks, plus many more!

We moved to a brand new office in Sydney Olympic Park. Here you will enjoy the convenience of free parking or being on the doorstep of the train station, plus the atmosphere of vibrant cafes and restaurants to appease your appetite.

Your journey with us starts here, so get in the driver\xe2\x80\x99s seat and take control of your career. Apply now.

'

title: Data Analyst
description:
b'

The NRMA was born to keep people moving, and we have been doing this for nearly 100 years. Our vision is to create indispensable connections with our Members\xe2\x80\x99 mobility through my car, my journey and my destination.

Our Members enjoy our legendary roadside assistance, car servicing and repairs, Thrifty car and truck rentals, the latest fuel prices and more via the mynrma app, discounted travel and accommodation at our Holiday parks, Travelodge and Hotel Kurrajong Canberra

Your opportunity

Are you analytical, highly driven and possess a \xe2\x80\x9ccan-do\xe2\x80\x9d attitude? Then this is the role you have been waiting for. The NRMA are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to work as a valued member of the data team. You will be responsible for delivering data solutions, data-driven campaign execution, reporting, and business insights to our stakeholders in the Sales & Marketing division.

On a typical day, as our Data Analyst you should expect to:

  • Manage the campaign data design, build, delivery, and measurement of all Member and Customer communication
  • Hands on analysis and visualization of complex web based data utilizing a variety of tools
  • Clearly communicate actionable insights to inform marketing, sales, and product strategies
  • Own the entire reporting lifecycle for Enterprise and Operational dashboards
  • Work closely with Technology and stakeholders in expanding and improving data assets and capabilities
  • Understand data opportunities at the NRMA and how to unlock opportunities
  • Manage stakeholder relationships and promote a data driven decision culture
  • Grow data and business knowledge of Membership and Group Businesses

Your experience

You will have the customer experience at the heart of what you do and be able to demonstrate

  • A minimum of 7 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in an analyst role responsible for campaign, reporting, and analysis
  • Advanced SQL skills and experience dealing with large and complex data sets
  • Possess a positive \xe2\x80\x9ccan-do\xe2\x80\x9d attitude coupled with excellent communication skills
  • Experience with reporting and visualization tools such as OBIEE, Google Analytics, Tableau
  • Advanced use of Microsoft Office Suite

Your benefits

We offer a competitive remuneration and our benefits include 50% discount on insurance, free NRMA Premium Care Membership , product and travel discounts, 50% discount on Village Roadshow Theme Parks, plus many more!

We have moved to a brand new office in Sydney Olympic Park. Here you will enjoy the convenience of free parking or being on the doorstep of the train station, plus the atmosphere of vibrant cafes and restaurants to appease your appetite.

Your journey with us starts here, so get in the driver\xe2\x80\x99s seat and take control of your career. Apply now.

'

title: Data Scientist
description:
b"

At Caltex, we\xe2\x80\x99re with you all the way. We keep millions of people moving every day, and continue to be Australia\xe2\x80\x99s leading transport fuel supplier and convenience retailer. We\xe2\x80\x99re a diverse, multi-faceted business full of people ready to make a difference. Our growing and changing business means we\xe2\x80\x99ve got career opportunities across different parts of the business. Where do you come in?

You will be responsible for providing advanced analytics and machine learning to derive insights from large and disparate data sets. Partnering with a range of key business stakeholders, you will define, design and build statistical and analytical modelling strategies to provide organisational solutions. You will contribute to improve visibility of big data analytics across the organisation whilst driving business performance.

As the successful candidate you will have a relevant tertiary qualification in mathematics, statistics, computer science or actuarial science or similar; coupled with working experience in advanced analytics and machine learning with large complex data sets. You will have sound communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts simply and present large data sets in a compelling descriptive analysis.

Knowledge of open source tools for distributed computing (i.e. Spark), programming in python and R coupled with Cloud Based Infrastructure and Machine Learning would be essential.

Caltex is renowned for an excellent team environment and passion for customer service. If this is what you are looking for, please click 'Apply Now' or visit our Careers website at https://jobs.caltex.com.au/. Applications close 18th May 2017.

Caltex Australia acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the lands on which we work. As part of our efforts to leave a sustained positive footprint in the communities and broader economies in which we operate, we strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to apply.

"

title: NA
description:
b'

Clayton Utz


\xc2\xa0


Clayton Utz is Australia's leading commercial and pro bono law firm, with 170 partners and 1,445 employees across six offices. We have a reputation for standing out - and for being outstanding - with confident, innovative and incisive legal advice, and an unshakeable sense of what's possible for our clients and our people.


\xc2\xa0


In 2016, we have been named as Law Firm of the Year by the Australasian Law Awards and most Innovative firm by the Australasian Lawyer. These awards recognise the firm's excellent client service, leading expertise across practice areas and experience in acting on large complex transactions and disputes as well as our professional excellence, pro bono commitment and broader community involvement.


\xc2\xa0


The Forensic and Technology Services team


The first integrated forensic and legal service offering in Australia.


Our forensic and legal teams work together to help you identify, mitigate and manage the ambit of commercial, regulatory and reputation risks in your business.


\xc2\xa0


The Forensic and Technology Services practice will offer clients the complete package of forensic investigation, forensic accounting, forensic technology and front-end forensic transaction services and will be complementary to the firm's full service legal offering. The new practice is headed by Paul Fontanot who has 20 years' experience working internationally as a forensic accountant in a global accounting firm.


\xc2\xa0


The practice has been established in response to demand from clients, and will enable Clayton Utz to manage fraud, anti-bribery, corruption, cyber risk, supply chain risk, and regulatory investigations, and to build compliance programs at an early stage.


\xc2\xa0


In addition, the group will leverage its expertise in structured and unstructured data analytics to assist clients with a range of big data challenges for improved commercial outcomes.


For further information, please visit our Forensic and Technology Services showcase page.



The role


\xc2\xa0


We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Forensic Data Analytics professional to join our Forensic and Technology Services (FTS) team located in either Melbourne or Sydney, on a full time basis.


\xc2\xa0


Key responsibilities



Join the FTS leadership team during an exciting phase of growth and innovation. The role will see you working with industry leading professionals and top end clients, on some of the biggest fraud, anti-bribery, corruption, cyber risk, supply chain risk, and regulatory investigations in Australia. You will be responsible for leading and growing the Forensic Data Analytics function, working closely with the Directors of Legal Technology Services, Forensic Accounting and Projects.\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


Oversee multiple projects encompassing various responsibilities, including: providing oversight of the engagement strategy/approach; overseeing client deliverables; preparing final deliverables; managing client's expectations; and assuming responsibility for engagement economics to achieve revenue goals.


Develop/maintain strong working relationships with key business decision makers.


\xc2\xa0


Develop people. Successfully delegate to all levels of staff. Assume a leadership role in training, development, and instruction, and contribute to practice-wide recruiting efforts. Foster teamwork and innovative thinking.


Generate new business opportunities. Achieve growth by understanding CU national practice groups and actively assessing/presenting opportunities for CU to provide quality services.\xc2\xa0 Develop long-term relationships and networks.



Skills & Experience



To be successful in this role, you will have extensive experience in leadership and Forensic Data Analytics. You will have strong technical skills and possess strong client-facing capability.


\xc2\xa0


To qualify, it is preferable that the candidates have:


\xc2\xa0


\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0a bachelor's degree and approximately 8 years of related work experience; or a master's degree and approximately 7 years of related work experience


\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0in-depth data analysis experience\xc2\xa0 preferably as a manager or above with a professional services firm, a boutique firm, or a technology or communications, company
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0in-depth knowledge of Data Analytic environments such as:


\xc2\xa0


-SQL - MS SQL including T-SQL, MySQL and Oracle
-\xc2\xa0SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
-Tableau - Visualizations/ Dashboarding.
-\xc2\xa0SAS
-\xc2\xa0Oracle and SAP
-\xc2\xa0R - (incl. Machine Learning)
-\xc2\xa0Trifacta



\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0demonstrated business development and client service skills; the ability to lead in business development, client management, communications and practice development
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0demonstrated ability to manage large engagements, supervise/motivate staff, and prioritize projects
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0strong financial, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0excellent written and verbal communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0substantial knowledge of PC-based tools, including databases (Access) and spreadsheets (Excel)


\xc2\xa0


Current contacts with industry CEO's, COO's, and CFO's are a plus. The successful candidate must be a highly motivated professional, a self-starter, and be willing and able to travel.


\xc2\xa0


Why Clayton Utz?
As a leading law firm with global connections, Clayton Utz offers exciting opportunities.


\xc2\xa0


In our Forensic and Technology team, you will have the opportunity to contribute to major projects and cutting-edge matters across all industries, while working with some of the biggest clients and the sharpest minds in the legal profession.


We value the unique skills, insights and experience you will bring, and offer in return an open, friendly and supportive environment - one where you will feel emboldened to build an exceptional career and excel in your chosen profession.


\xc2\xa0


How to apply?


To submit your interest in this role, please click the \xe2\x80\x98Apply\xe2\x80\x99 button or contact Mona Rangar on 02 9353 5572 / Kate King on\xc2\xa0 02 9286 6752 for more information.


\xc2\xa0


For more information on Clayton Utz, please visit www.claytonutz.com or follow us on LinkedIn here



Clayton Utz is an inclusive employer that supports flexible work arrangements.\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0

'

title: Data & Market Analyst
description:
b'

  • Contribute to the analysis of renewable and energy markets
  • Communicate market trends and insights
  • Outstanding opportunity to build on your technical skills
  • Location: Sydney, NSW
  • Application close date: 22nd May 2017

ORIGIN - AUSTRALIA\xe2\x80\x99S LEADING INTEGRATED ENERGY COMPANY

An integral part of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.
Origin is the largest energy retailer in Australia, and with 4.3 million customers we\xe2\x80\x99re constantly evolving and changing to better suit their needs. Our activities include power generation, energy trading, the sale of LPG, electricity, natural gas and solar as well as the development of new and emerging technologies. Consider your possibilities with Australia\xe2\x80\x99s leading integrated energy company.

The Role

The Portfolio Development team sits within the Future Energy and Business Development business function and is responsible for assisting the organisation in achieving its growth objectives by understanding and quantifying the markets in which Origin operates, and seeking out, evaluating and advising on energy market investments, acquisitions and other portfolio development activities, including the decarbonisation of energy markets.

As a key part of this team, you will contribute to the qualitative and quantitative analysis of a decarbonising energy market, including the markets they will create, the new technologies they will bring forward at the distributed and utility scale levels, and the impact and way forward for both energy markets and for Origin\xe2\x80\x99s business.

The role involves operating and developing models, market research and data management which contribute to the analysis of renewable and energy markets and how they will impact Origin.

Your key accountabilities will include:

  • Modelling of carbon and renewable prices, supply and demand forecasts for Australian energy and carbon markets to be used throughout the business
  • Build internal databases to analyse and store key market and forecast data, using data visualisation tools to communicate key insights to internal stakeholders
  • Provide market research and analysis to a range of different stakeholders including the Portfolio Development team and other stakeholders primarily within Future Energy and Business Development
  • Operate and help develop financial and carbon pricing models to forecast mid to long term carbon and renewable markets pricing and supply/demand
  • Preparation of presentations and analysis for communication of findings to key internal stakeholders

Is This You?

You will be tertiary-qualified in Economics, Information Technology or a numerate or quantitative related discipline and have commercial experience in modelling and analysis of markets, technologies and commodities.

As the position also requires database management and data analysis and visualisation, you will have experience with SQL/Oracle, SAS and Tableau and can demonstrate expertise in data management and programming skills.

As a proactive, self-motivated and collaborative individual, you will have exceptional written communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to grasp, communicate and comment upon new, complex issues.

We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

MAKE AN IMPACT ON AUSTRALIA'S ENERGY FUTURE

If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.

For more information, please contact Iain Pratt on 03 8665 7325.

Job Requisition: 46522

'

description:

Mozo is an online product comparison business. To power our site, we gather information on a wide range of products. Mostly we deal with banking and insurance products, but if you are the right person for this job you'd probably be equally happy whether we were comparing home loans or home theatre systems.

title: Data Analyst - Data Analytics, Customer Insight, SQL Reporting
description:
b"

In this role, you will develop a data plan for building a scaleable solution that arms the wider business with insights to make business decisions. \xc2\xa0You will use your technical SQL skills to set it up, roll it out and empower people within the business derive their own insights. \xc2\xa0You'll be the expert in how the business works, how the data is captured and stored, and how to wrangle it to draw out meaningful insights to better understand customers, improve conversion in the customer journey or efficiency in how we serve customers. \xc2\xa0

Responsibilities

  • Develop a scaleable plan for setting up the right infrastructure to support business requirements around marketing, product and service performance, and customer insights.

  • Manage a roadmap of data projects, prioritise and provide transparency on delivery of data projects

  • Work directly with development team to build out the data solution, setting up a data reporting layer including data table structure and connecting disparate data sources to meet business reporting and analysis needs

  • Automate reporting using tableau reports and dashboards

  • Deeply understand the data structure, systems, schemer and maintain glossary of terms

  • Be the expert and owner of the reporting and analytics tools for the business, primarily SQL, Tableau, Segment, Service platform, but also Amplitude, Intercom, Google Analytics\xc2\xa0

  • Work with key stakeholders to ensure reporting is set up for any new product development

  • Set up, train and educate the wider team on using reporting tools including Tableau

  • Provide service, product, marketing and business stakeholders with standardised reporting that delivers transparency into business performance

  • Set up dashboards and manage day to day reporting across the business including board reporting, weekly and daily reporting

  • Proactively identify gaps in reporting, set up, automate and visualise to aid comprehension, decision making and communication of information

  • Standardise a process for managing ad hoc data requests - develop a data briefing template, manage a roadmap of data requests, prioritise and provide transparency on timing and delivery of insights

  • Coach and challenge the requestor to ensure the right questions are being asked

  • Write SQL queries to extract the right data and visualise information to aid comprehension, decision making and communication of information

  • Proactively analyse customer quality, customer journey, event stages, pathways, channels, conversion, ROI, etc to identify gaps and opportunities in the business

  • Actively communicate insights to the wider organisation


Skills & experience

\xc2\xa0

You need to have:

    • 2 years data analyst experience with a track record in setting up a customer data analysis solution working with postgres databases, running SQL queries and analysis for digital transactional or ecommerce businesses

    • SQL and Tableau gun

    • Relevant Bachelor Degree

    • Experience with Google Analytics, Segment, Amplitude, or similar will be highly regarded

    • Strong at understanding and building out the right data structure, SQL tables and linking disparate data sources

    • Analytical and curious by nature. \xc2\xa0Proactive insights led decision maker who enjoys being hands-on with data to drive smarter business outcomes

    • Interest in and good at data visualisation

    • Self-starter \xe2\x80\x93 used to working in agile /nimble environments and can work autonomously

    • Passionate about understanding customers and their behaviour

    • Entrepreneurial mindset: adaptable, pragmatic, proactive, hands-on, strategic, analytical, and ambitious

    • Comfortable with complex data, analysis and insights. Must be very focused on measurement through data and fast iteration through learning

    • Strong understanding of digital technologies required to scale our data solution

    • Good at working within an ambiguous, fast paced environment \xe2\x80\x93 figuring it out and adapting as you go

    • A willingness to roll up sleeves to get it done

    • Good communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 verbal and written

    • Great at working within a team environment

"

title: NA
description:
b'

What is this client and role about?

My client is one of the most successful software fintech\xe2\x80\x99s in Australia. Their success comes from building the first and only sophisticated cloud solution to automate highly complicated financial services funds management functions. Their products have transformed an industry.

As part of their ongoing expansion, they are now looking to hire a technical leader for the build of a greenfield automated and AI driven Data Feeds product. In this role, leading a Scrum team you will oversee the transition from the existing data feeds solution to the new solution which will be designed and built by your team. This is a genuinely diverse role (designer, coder, leader and BA) which will include:

  • Team and technical leadership
  • Circa 50% coding (mostly complicated back-end C# and SQL)
  • Be heavily involved in the design of the new product
  • Leading the build and integration of the new product
  • Overseeing modification and enhanced features for the existing data feeds solution.

The right culture and fit?

The developers at our client are passionate, committed, logical, considered, calm, thoughtful, curious and analytical. They know they are good and this is reflected in quiet confidence, completely devoid of smugness or ego. They are not extroverted but are skilled communicators who can both explain and constructively debate complex ideas and logic, as well as engage effectively in product and domain conversations (their senior developers are pseudo BA\xe2\x80\x99s). Your design thinking and ability to look at complex problems from different perspectives is outstanding, as is your ability to then articulate the reasoning behind your solutions and views. You will be someone capable of applying independent critical thinking and helpings others around you solve problems and become better at what they do.

Why would you want this role?

You and your team will engage with product daily, and have direct influence over product direction. You will always know why you are building what you are building and have a voice in deciding how to deliver the highest user value through what you and your team build (they do not hire \xe2\x80\x98code monkeys\xe2\x80\x99).

You will be attempting to build a solution which has never been built before, and if successful would be transformational for the Australian financial services industry - build something which could have an industry wide user impact

You will have an interest in building products, making complex things run fast, working with high volume real time data, and having the chance to apply AI and automation to these areas.

You will be working with committed and skilled developers all pulling in the same direction

You will be working with proven developers who have built, and build, \xe2\x80\x98first of its kind\xe2\x80\x99 solutions which make incredibly complicated finance functions, simple and intuitive for users for the first time

You will be involved in \xe2\x80\x98ever evolving technical and domain challenges\xe2\x80\x99.

You will have a genuine interest in learning a lot about financial services, and how the \xe2\x80\x98guts\xe2\x80\x99 of the finance, funds management and wealth management industries work

We do not equate capability with years\xe2\x80\x99 experience, though it is likely you will have 10+ years development experience. You will definitely have worked in successful product environments and from your experience will be able to guide your team on what works and what doesn\xe2\x80\x99t.

A different recruitment experience?

Please apply or call if the above resonates with you, but please note you must have Australian work rights. We will look at all applications. If we do not contact you, it means we have not seen enough direct relevance to our client\xe2\x80\x99s particular requirements. If you do not hear from us, and feel we may have missed something regarding your suitability, then please call to discuss.

This role is being managed by Account Director Dan Gordon on 02 9409 4805. Dan is a certified Scrum Master and Product Owner, and from face-to-face interviews with the clients Head of Development, Lead Architect and Tech Leaders, will provide suitable candidates with a clear account of all aspects of this opportunity.

'

  • Assists clients and Ryan consultants in data analysis and manipulation.
  • Develops and delivers training programs to the consulting group.
  • Assists in developing, testing, and working with programmer(s) for improvements to proprietary software.
  • Provides back-up for the Sr. Data Acquisition Coordinator as required for vacations, etc.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

\xc2\xa0

Education and Experience:

High-school diploma or general equivalency diploma (GED) is required and a Post secondary degree or diploma in a finance or ERP systems related field would be a strong asset. Also, exposure to accounting and ERP systems such as SAP, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, AS400 systems, Great Plains and Accpac are definite asset. The candidate will be detail-oriented, possess strong communication skills, is enthusiastic, positive, and willing to learn. Accounting experience not required but is an asset.

\xc2\xa0

Computer Skills:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must have intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft\xc2\xae Word, Access, Excel, Outlook, SQL and internet navigation and research.

\xc2\xa0

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position supervises the Data and Systems Analyst along with more limited supervisory responsibilities for training employees on data manipulation techniques and applications.

\xc2\xa0

Working Environment:

  • Standard indoor working environment.
  • Occasional long periods of sitting while working at computer.
  • Position requires regular interaction with employees and clients via e-mail and telephone.
  • Independent travel requirement: none.
'

title: Analyst - Data Solutions
description:
b'

Whichever way our customers choose to engage with us, our people are accountable, motivated and passionate about delivering an exceptional level of service and enhancing financial wellbeing

We can\xe2\x80\x99t live without understanding the WHY factor

Do work that matters

You\xe2\x80\x99re driving the future of our business. Helping make sure CommBank make data driven decisions. You will play a key role in the development and enhancement of information solutions that underpin self-service analytics and visualisation.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll be in a sweet spot \xe2\x80\x93 working on highly visible projects that bring huge impact to the business. Knowing both data and the business needs so well means you\xe2\x80\x99ll grow quickly into a data Subject Matter Expert who can be called upon to speak in layman\xe2\x80\x99s terms.

See yourself in our team

In this role you\xe2\x80\x99ll have the opportunity to focus on requirements gathering, data acquisition and development. We want you to bring your knowledge and experience to contribute and influence solution design. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be working in close collaboration with Data visualization, Design and Operations teams. In this role you\xe2\x80\x99ll help contribute to project planning by providing effort estimation, and gathering and documenting business and technical requirements.

With your fresh eyes, you\xe2\x80\x99ll contribute and assist with agile processes, data asset solution design and outcomes, as well as continuous improvement for current practices and processes.

We want you to bring your fresh set of eyes and help us get better.

Your path looks like:

In such a visible role, the number of people, business units and teams you\xe2\x80\x99ll get to know will be huge. You\xe2\x80\x99ll have the ability to plot your course \xe2\x80\x93 tapping on shoulders who you\xe2\x80\x99ve previously helped out. But we\xe2\x80\x99ll empower you to get there, supporting you with on the job development and exposure.

We\xe2\x80\x99re interested in hearing from people who have:

  • SQL development, understanding of Extract Transform and Load (ETL) process, SDLC and script automation.
  • Proven experience writing and Reviewing Business / Technical Functional Specifications.
  • Proven experience in working with data warehouse.

Strong understanding of BI/Data visualisation tools and techniques

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we\xe2\x80\x99ll support you at every stage of your career.

'

  • Skills in\xc2\xa0NLP, text mining, or network analysis\xc2\xa0
'

title: Data Solution Architect
description:
b'

EXCITING DATA SOLUTION ARCHITECT POSITION FOR A MICROSOFT TRUSTED PARTNER WHO ARE BUILDING AN ELITE TECH TEAM!

\xc2\xa0

BCS Technology (BCS) is an award-winning Australian based Professional Services organisation focusing on the provision of quality consulting in the area of Business Intelligence, Data warehouse and Application Development. We are trusted partners of Cloudera and Microsoft and recently, BCS has been accepted as part of the Microsoft Practice Development Initiative to further develop our Analytics practice on Microsoft Azure. \xc2\xa0

We are transforming into a digital provider for the entire world. Founded in 2001, Sydney Australia, BCS has emerged as a leading Professional Services provider, delivering tailored solutions and services to clients throughout the world. With offices now in Sydney, Melbourne, Jakarta, Manila and Delhi, BCS is currently on track to reinvent itself to be one of the world's most reliable data analytics solutions provider. If you are looking to learn and grow, we also sponsor training programs. Come join our team and be a part of this exciting opportunity.

What will you be doing?

  • You will be responsible for the architecture of new Data Analytics platforms on Azure that will allow senior stakeholders to analyse and generate business critical insight for the purpose of business decision making.
  • We prefer those with hands on experience in Azure data but it is not necessary.
  • Experience in databases and analytics, including relational databases, AWS, Data Warehousing, Big Data , NoSQL, Machine Learning, Stream Analytics, Data Factory, Event Hubs , Notification Hubs and business analytics.
  • Understanding of big data use-cases.
  • Understanding of Hadoop-based design patterns knowledge of real time/stream analytics.

Essentials:

  • Bachelor Degree or higher in IT or relevant discipline
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Keen eye for detail.
  • Excellent time management.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Flexibility to travel - this position requires the person to travel to our international offices for short term assignments when required.

\xc2\xa0

If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career by being a part of an organisation committed to the growth of its customers and employees equally, please don't hesitate to APPLY NOW.

Please send your Resume in Word and we will get in touch with the shortlisted candidates ASAP.

\xc2\xa0

To be considered, you must be a Permanent Resident or an Australian Citizen.

'

title: Data Scientist
description:
b"

THE ROLE

We're looking for Data Scientist to join our newly created Forward Deployed Data Science team. The heart of this team is to ensure that our proprietary product 'Anna' and our clients have a long & successful relationship and to help us with this, you will be the go-to Data Scientist responsible for solving our clients data analytics' problems.\xc2\xa0

Working closely with the Customer, Data Science and Engineering teams, you will own client data on-boarding, reconciliation and analysis. Working with other data scientists in the team, you'll be able to have a key influence and provide input into the technical direction of Anna.

ABOUT YOU

You're passionate, up to date on new technologies, laid-back and adaptable. You know when to obsess over details and when it's time to delivery.\xc2\xa0
You're someone who wants to have an impact on the product you're working on and excited to join a creative and passionate team.\xc2\xa0
You want variety & exposure to different data-sets & industries. From financial services, technology, professional services and government clients, no project or data set is ever the same.
Aside from your expertise in SQL/R/Python, you are fluent in the application and commercialisation of data analytics.\xc2\xa0
Whether it's solving a new problem, reviewing code or sharing an approach with the team, you're an excellent communicator who takes pride in delivering the highest quality work.
You're hungry to learn and innovate working alongside world-class data scientists.

ABOUT US

We're a rapidly growing startup in the artificial intelligence space - we're poised for a huge year and we need to expand our team to help us reach our goals. We're casual and flexible and pride ourselves on our diverse, inclusive working culture.

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in quantitative field with 3 plus years of relevant experience
Advanced experience in SQL/R/Python
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work independently or as part of a group
Ability to work in a fast paced and collaborative environment
Ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely
Proven ability to lead and drive projects to completion

THE OFFER

Competitive salary on offer
Beautiful, centrally-located office
The opportunity to progress into a lead role
\xc2\xa0

"

title: Data Analyst
advertiser: Catholic Education Office, Diocese of Parramatta
description:
b"

The Catholic Education Diocese of Parramatta are on the lookout for a driven and skilled\xc2\xa0Data Analyst to\xc2\xa0ensure\xc2\xa0data management from CEDP systems is accurate, timely, secure, documented and reviewed for improvement. The ideal candidate will be\xc2\xa0able to analyse complex problems, understand customer needs and recommend solutions.

The Data Analyst is accountable for:

  • Ensuring the integrity and quality of the data in CEDP systems and project deliverables
  • Continuously reviewing data management and implementing improvements
  • Implementing data cleansing and standardisation across the system
  • Aligning data decisions with the strategic direction of CEDP
  • Developing and implementing data analytic processes and procedures
  • 2 full-time positions available, One\xc2\xa0Permanent position, one\xc2\xa0temporary maternity leave replacement( about 14 months)

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Demonstrated experience in SQL Data Base administration
  • Experience in use of Tableau for generating visualisations would be desirable
  • An education sector background, either Higher or Secondary Education would be desirable

Catholic Education within the Diocese of Parramatta provides quality learning and teaching in a faith-centred environment in its primary and secondary schools and for early learning and out of school hours care centres in western Sydney. One of the largest employers in western Sydney, Catholic Education's recruitment, selection and appointment processes reflect its purpose and intent, and that is to provide quality Catholic schooling by strengthening the professional lives of staff, and to improve the learning outcomes for each student within a Catholic faith community.

title: Data Center Technician
description:
b'

Data Center Technician, West Sydney Location, Permanent Role, $80-$90K base, Additional Benefits

Data Center Technician

This massive global technology company is seeking a talented Data Center Technician to assist with ambitious growth plans. Our client is looking for high achieving individuals with a passion for all things IT and a proven track record of success.

This is a unique opportunity to work in the world\xe2\x80\x99s most cutting edge data centers and a truly amazing organisation that prides itself on innovation and continuous improvement. As the Data Center Technician you must be able to demonstrate superior problem solving skills, commitment and strict adherence to processes.

This role requires deep Data Center hardware troubleshooting across rack installs / decommissioning / vendor escorting and coordination / Ingestion. Past experience with cabling troubleshooting and 24x7 shift management (reporting, access). You will maintain a high level of system reliability by prioritising and resolving trouble tickets efficiently as well as hands on skills with installing and configuring racks. You will triage the hardware and network issues as well as building / repairing desktop or servers. You will have broad networking awareness around Physical, Data Link, Networks.

You will have worked in a demanding environment as the primary point of contact for all Data Center faults or issues including but not limited to highly sensitive issues enforcing security best practices. You are also required to work on physical replacements and rotations of all server and network device parts as well as interacting with third party vendors. You will also respond to physical layer outages and recovery of physical power issues on racks. You will also participate in Data Center power & cooling events.

If you are a highly motivated IT enthusiast and you want to work in an exciting fast paced environment that values your ideas, then this is your dream job. Send your resume in a Word document and email any enquiries to stephen.mcgain@hays.com.au.

'

  • With a proven track record of successful assignment delivery and client relationship management
  • A team focussed style with strong organisational and project management skills. The ability to analyse business performance is essential and offer the right outcomes for the business
  • An ability to present solutions in a clear and articulate manner
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess ALL of the above attributes then please apply to this role or send me your resums and a supporting email highlighting your suitablity for the outstanding opportunity.

'

title: Data & Reporting Analyst
description:
b"

The Company

News Corp Australia is the nation's largest media company operating over 150 household name brands across print, digital and multimedia including The Daily Telegraph, The Australian and news.com.au. We are proud to be a central part of News Corp, a leading global network of powerful brands in news and information services, sports programming in Australia, digital real estate services, book publishing, digital education and pay-tv distribution in Australia including Fox Sports, Dow Jones, Harper Collins, Realestate.com.au and The Wall Street Journal.\xc2\xa0This is a flexible contract role is based in our Surry Hills based Head Office.

The Role

Your role as our Data & Reporting Analyst will see you working with National Reporting and Analytics team, supporting major projects and initiatives to deliver reporting and automated insights for the business to make timely and fact-based decisions, as well as feeding into more advanced analytics and models.\xc2\xa0

The ideal candidate will be technically minded with a high level of attention to detail and a passion for translating complex and raw datasets into actionable insights that add value and meet business requirements.

Your key responsibilities will include the following:

  • Design, develop and deliver regular reports to track and analyse customer behaviour and Key Performance Indicators
  • Creation and maintenance of accurate and insightful tools and dashboards to add value to operational & consumer centric business initiatives
  • Ad hoc data extraction, manipulation & analysis for the purpose of insights and recommendations.
  • Interpret and communicate results from data analysis as recommendations to internal customers of varying levels of data literacy
  • Drive the collection, cleansing, merging and management of customer data from various sourcesacross the business
  • Support data analytical thought leadership
  • Develop relationships both internally and externally

The Person

The successful applicant will have the following experience and attributes:

  • Bachelors degree in a numerical discipline such as Mathematics, Computer science etc.
  • Outstanding data extraction and manipulation skills, with a proven understanding of database interrogation using a range of software tools (eg, SQL, Vertica HP, Big Query etc \xe2\x80\x93 Intermeidate to Advanced)
  • Experience working with BI reporting tools (e.g. Tableau _- Intermediate to Advances, Excel \xe2\x80\x93 Advanced, etc)
  • Advanced Excel skills, including macros & ODBC connectivity for the purpose of data presentation & manipulation as well as building reporting tools for the business
  • Proven ability to transform large, complex and raw datasets into clear and actionable insights
  • Proactive approach to developing regular reporting, tools and dashboards to support and enable stakeholders to access data driven insights independently
  • Experience partnering with stakeholders across technical and on-technical disciplines
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work autonomously with strong time management skills
  • Exceptional problem solving abilities, critical thinking and demonstrated commercial awareness

Join Us:\xc2\xa0

News Corp Australia is evolving in response to the expectations and challenges of the digital world in which we now live. We have an amazing opportunity to reinvent our industry and redefine the future of media in Australia. We are passionate about what we do and proud of our heritage of world-class journalism and entrepreneurial spirit. Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.

For more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit:www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

"

  • Report and Dashboard design and development using Tableau
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills with a high degree of initiative and flexibility

This is a great opportunity to grow your experience in a company with an impressive trajectory; giving you access to senior stakeholders will help you to develop business acumen and communication skills. Analyst / Tableau / SQL / Trends / Dashboard / Insight / Analytics

title: Senior Data Analyst (ECM)
description:
b'\xe2\x80\xa2 Unique and exciting Permanent Full Time opportunity with Sydney Trains!
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent pay and benefits
\xe2\x80\xa2 Close to public transport and amenities

The opportunity
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst to be a part of our Enterprise Asset Systems team within Sydney Trains. This position plays a critical role in the daily operation, support and development of Engineering Content Management capability and services, including the Virtual Planroom system, ensuring its reliability and operational effectiveness.

We are looking for a computing, engineering or science professional who has experience as an Engineering Document Management power user /administrator (experience in the configuration of the Bentley ProjectWise and Enterprise Bridge systems are preferable), including the maintenance of Engineering Content.

You will be highly conceptual and analytical with excellent problem solving and communication skills and the ability to build rapport with stakeholders at all levels.

About us
At Sydney Trains, our vision is to keep Sydney moving by delivering safe, customer-focused, reliable and clean rail services.
We contribute to the success of transport in NSW by running efficient rail services which exceed our customers\xe2\x80\x99 expectations, support growth and contribute to the broader community and the economy.
Joining Sydney Trains will present an exciting opportunity to shape the future and make a genuine difference for the people of NSW by providing a world class rail system.

Benefits
Sydney Trains offers its employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and work-life balance. Other benefits include:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Free travel on Government trains, buses and ferries
\xe2\x80\xa2 Flexible work practices

Join Sydney Trains for the opportunity to shape the future and make a genuine difference for the people of NSW by providing a world class rail system.

Our commitment to Diversity
TfNSW are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

How to apply
Click on the APPLY button below. For more information on Sydney Trains or the position description, please click on links provided.

For any enquiries, please contact Jagadeesh Sethuraman on 02 8575 0450 and quote 000059FO.

Please note: successful candidate will need to undertake background checks and criminal record checks.

Applications close: 11:59pm Sunday 21st May 2017

For permanent positions in the NSW Public Sector, you need to be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident. For most Temporary jobs, you need a visa that gives you permission to work in Australia. To be considered for these roles you must be 18 years of age. Applicants will need to complete merit based selection activities and will be subject to satisfactory medical, drug & alcohol and criminal record checks as part of the selection process. Please note that an eligibility list may be created for this position, and position(s) of the same classification that subsequently become vacant may be filled using this eligibility list (where the vacancy is within 60 minutes travelling time). Transport for NSW is an equal opportunity employer. Women and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.

'

description:
b'

About the role:


An excellent opportunity has become available to join a large government nodal organisation in an unique position as a Data and Strategy Analyst in Sydney. In this role, you will have access to large datasets across the government. This opportunity will allow you to work on numerous greenfield projects and will provide you stimulating challenges.

  • Proven ability to act as a thought leader who can influence at the highest level and drive business engagement through delivery of appropriate business focused solutions
  • Proven ability to build meaningful relationships across the business and leverage those to drive tangible outcomes

  • Proven modelling experience, developing and maintaining data models and various statistical models for various business cases
  • Conduct analysis and create project scope based on decision science methodologies
  • Experience identifying meaningful insights from large data sources through various data analysis science techniques and interpret and communicate these insights and findings to business partners and decision makers


To apply:

If this sounds like the role for you, please apply today.
For any enquiries, please reach out to Brad on 02 9248 6213

title: Data Scientist
description:
b"

As a Data Scientist, you will work with different divisions to uncover their key business problems and implement data science solutions to create value for the organisation. You will work proactively on:

  • Identify where data science can create value or solve problems for the business and use your skills and experience to do so
  • Take responsibility for project delivery, communicate and develop relationships with all stakeholders
  • Be accountable for end-to-end predictive modelling from exploratory analysis to feature engineering to performance evaluation
  • Design and implement data science solutions that will deliver the expected business outcomes
  • Communicating data driven insights to stakeholders at all levels
  • Participate in regular training sessions to share best practices and develop knowledge of current and emerging technologies to constantly uplift the team's capabilities

Our Ideal Person

Postgraduate qualifications (PHD or Masters with a research component) in a relevant field with experience in data science working with large datasets. Extensive knowledge of varied machine learning models and analytical techniques.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Strong experience in analytical tools, processes and practices
  • Worked with R, Python or other open source tools
  • Strong SQL skills Data modelling skills
  • Machine Learning programming capability
  • Software engineering background
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem solving and presentation skills
  • Passionate about analytics

If you have the relevant prerequisites above please e-mail Andreas Mead your CV at andreas.mead@hudson.com or call on 0282 332 346

"

title: Data Scientist
salary: b'Enjoy working  in a flexible environment!'
description:
b'

Our Company

Tabcorp is one of the few integrated gambling and entertainment companies in the world. We deliver excitement and fun to our customers through our retail, digital and media platforms.

Our 3,000 strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive leading brands and industry-first sustainability efforts, here and internationally. They\xe2\x80\x99ve also made Tabcorp a top 100 ASX company.

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you\xe2\x80\x99re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we\xe2\x80\x99d love to hear from you.

Role Summary

As part of the Chief Marketing Office, the Data Science and Analytics team engage with business stakeholders from all key business areas, including marketing promotions and customer relationship management, wagering and pricing, risk and compliance, and digital channels. We leverage analytics to provide advanced data-enabled initiatives, creating the best experience for our customers and delivering the maximum value for our company.

One major strength of our team is diversity: we have people with advanced degrees in computer science, machine learning, statistics, natural language processing, sport science, etc. We come to work with the excitement of learning something new every day from other team members.

How you will contribute

As a Data Scientist, you will work with different divisions to uncover their key business problems and implement data science solutions to create value for the organisation. You will work proactively on:

  • Identify where data science can create value or solve problems for the business and use your skills and experience to do so
  • Take responsibility for project delivery, communicate and develop relationships with all stakeholders
  • Be accountable for end-to-end predictive modelling from exploratory analysis to feature engineering to performance evaluation
  • Design and implement data science solutions that will deliver the expected business outcomes
  • Communicating data driven insights to stakeholders at all levels
  • Participate in regular training sessions to share best practices and develop knowledge of current and emerging technologies to constantly uplift the team's capabilities

Our Ideal Person

Postgraduate qualifications (PHD or Masters with a research component) in a relevant field with sound experience in data science working with large datasets. Extensive knowledge of varied machine learning models and analytical techniques. You will have strong knowledge in any of the following; data visualisation, D3, geo-spatial, Tableau. Practical experience in Python/R with expertise in Scala and expertise in big data systems like kafka, Hadoop and traditional RDBMS.

When you join our team you\xe2\x80\x99ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

'

title: Sydney - Open Source Data Consultant - Cloud, Big Data and Analytics.
description:
b'
The Company:

We're proud to call this company a client and have supported them for a number of years in Australia. They continue to challenge the status quo around technology, drive both delivery and product build and have been involved in some of APAC's most complex and high profile Data programmes.

Unlike other Data companies these guys focus on technical quality, premium design concepts and the ability to develop highly complex and innovative technical solutions.

They don't mind calling them selves "geeks with flair" and love to work with the latest tech available. They build solutions from the ground up and have some of the smartest technical minds across APAC working for them.

The role:

2017 is shaping up to be one of the biggest yet with partnerships being created at a global level, customers empowering them to manage entire Data programmes and organic growth and progression internally.\xc2\xa0

They require a number of technical gifted problem solvers who have the following attributes:
  • At least 12 months experience developing technical solutions in a Data, Analytics and Business Intelligence capacity.
  • Outstanding - and I do mean outstanding - core SQL skills with a track record of coding with SQL when building solutions. Stored Proc, Scripting, Coding, Indexes, Triggers etc.
  • Solid command of Open Source and Applications orientated languages within a Data focused environment - Java, Scala, R, Python, Spark etc.
  • Experience in the design of Data solutions using various source systems within RDBMs and Cloud based technical environments.
  • Great communication skills with a passion for solving business problems through the use of technology.
  • Passionate about technology and the build of solutions through the use of it.
  • A real geek at heart who loves to learn and educate others.
  • Understanding of mainstream Data and Reporting Technologies with traditional RDBMS and Cloud / Open Source Environments - Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, AWS, Hadoop, Cassandra, Tableau, QlikView, Power BI.
What's in this for me?

Training, training and more training - seriously.....weekly training and education! Not to mention the chance to work on some of the best and most high profile programmes in Australia. Oh, and dont forget you will be working with a team that is unrivaled technically! Think the Google of Data or the Atlassian of Analytics!

What next?

Apply now via Seek and speak with Alloc8 to learn more. Alternatively send your resume to tom.sharp@alloc8.com.au today or contact Tom on (02) 9090 2761
Sponsorship available for candidates based in Australia.






'

title: Data Administrator / Customer Service
description:
b'

\xc2\xa0

So.... we change the world for the better - want to join us?

It's your lucky day.... Karrikins Group are hiring Data Administrators!

Do you dream details? Do you organise supermarket shelves when no one is looking? Do you know in your heart that without admin everything just falls apart? Well, you should read on, because you will find a home with us.

What are we looking for?

Our behaviour change programs change lives and our Admin Team provide our people with world class support. They (and you - if you're lucky) are responsible for:

  • Providing excellent customer service\xc2\xa0
  • Managing booking administration;
  • Internal reporting for the programs;
  • Support of overall program logistics; and
  • A variety of other ad-hoc tasks in support of the team.

We are looking for a highly motivated, self driven individual who is passionate about data and admin to join our team in North Sydney\xc2\xa0on a full time 12 month contract. Together with a team of 6, you will be responsible for assisting with program bookings and logistics as well as providing an outstanding of customer service (for internal and external stakeholders).\xc2\xa0

About you:

  • Values driven - you want to be part of something good
  • Communication (verbal and written) is your thing\xc2\xa0
  • A real eye for detail coupled with\xc2\xa0strong administration skills\xc2\xa0
  • Strong data entry and reporting skills\xc2\xa0
  • A focus on being of service in all that you do
  • An ability to deliver high quality outcomes within strict deadlines \xc2\xa0
  • Solutions oriented - 'together we got this' attitude
  • Solid experience using CRM systems and Microsoft suite (huge bonus!)

About Us - Karrikins Group:

Our impact is achieved through changing human behavior. Our unique behavior change model underpins all of our interventions aimed at creating a positive impact on the world.

We increase business value and social impact through branded positive behaviour change\xc2\xa0programs (mostly in-school programs), and evaluation and measurement.

We are a young group, founded in Australia in 2001, over time growing to over 120 staff delivering programs in 3\xc2\xa0countries (Australia, New Zealand, Canada), touching the lives of nearly 1 million people each year.\xc2\xa0

Why work with us?

At Karrikins Group, we are focused on creating a positive culture!\xc2\xa0People work with us because we change the world.\xc2\xa0If you are looking to work with a diverse group of smart and inspired people, committed to making a positive impact in the world, then Karrikins Group is the place for you!

You will also have access to a great employee benefit package and enjoy our positive and energetic culture - we\xc2\xa0have a lot of FUN and our team look forward to coming to work!

Sound like you?

If this sounds like the right role for you? Please provide your resume and a cover letter outlining why you are the best person for the job! Don't be shy... We can't wait to hear from you.

Please Note:\xc2\xa0Applications without cover letters will not be considered.

'

title: NA
description:
b'

What is this client and role about?

My client is one of the most successful software fintech\xe2\x80\x99s in Australia. Their success comes from building the first and only sophisticated cloud solution to automate highly complicated financial services funds management functions. Their products have transformed an industry.

As part of their ongoing expansion, they are now looking to hire a senior developer who and part of a cohesive Scrum team will help build a greenfield automated and AI driven Data Feeds product. In this role, as an experienced developer, you will assist in transition from the existing data feeds solution to the new solution which will be designed and built by this Scrum team. This is a genuinely diverse role (coder, designer and BA) which will include:

  • Circa 70% coding (mostly complicated back-end C# and SQL)
  • Be heavily involved in the design and development of the new product
  • Play a key role in the integration of the new product
  • Building modifications and enhanced features for the existing data feeds solution.

You & the right culture and fit?

The developers at our client are passionate, committed, logical, considered, calm, thoughtful, curious and analytical. They know they are good and this is reflected in quiet confidence, completely devoid of smugness or ego. They are not extroverted but are skilled communicators who can both explain and constructively debate complex ideas and logic, as well as engage effectively in product and domain conversations (their senior developers are pseudo BA\xe2\x80\x99s). Your design thinking and ability to look at complex problems from different perspectives is outstanding, as is your ability to then articulate the reasoning behind your solutions and views. You will be someone capable of applying independent critical thinking and helpings others around you solve problems and become better at what they do.

Why would you want this role?

This team will engage with product daily, and have direct influence over product direction. You will always know why you are building what you are building and have a voice in deciding how to deliver the highest user value through what you build (they do not hire \xe2\x80\x98code monkeys\xe2\x80\x99).

You will have an interest in building products, making complex things run fast, working with high volume real time data, and having the chance to apply AI and automation to these areas.

You will be involved in \xe2\x80\x98ever evolving technical and domain challenges\xe2\x80\x99

You will be working with committed and skilled developers all pulling in the same direction

You will be attempting to build a solution which has never been built before, and if successful would be transformational for the Australian financial services industry - build something which could have an industry wide user impact

You will be working with proven developers who have built, and build, \xe2\x80\x98first of its kind\xe2\x80\x99 solutions which make incredibly complicated finance functions, simple and intuitive for users for the first time

You will have a genuine interest in learning a lot about financial services, and how the \xe2\x80\x98guts\xe2\x80\x99 of the funds management and wealth management industries work

We do not equate capability with years\xe2\x80\x99 experience, though it is likely you will have 8+ years development experience. You will definitely have worked in successful product environments and from your experience know what works and what doesn\xe2\x80\x99t when building high quality software.

A different recruitment experience?

Please apply or call if the above resonates with you, but please note you must have Australian work rights. We will look at all applications. If we do not contact you, it means we have not seen enough direct relevance to our client\xe2\x80\x99s particular requirements. If you do not hear from us, and feel we may have missed something regarding your suitability, then please call to discuss.

This role is being managed by Account Director Dan Gordon on 02 9409 4805. Dan is a certified Scrum Master and Product Owner, and from face-to-face interviews with the clients Head of Development, Lead Architect and Tech Leaders, will provide suitable candidates with a clear account of all aspects of this opportunity.

'

title: Data Scientist - Python - R - Top Tier Client - Sydney CBD Location
description:
b'

My Client is a Global Oil and Gas\xc2\xa0company\xc2\xa0based in Sydney with presence in over 60 countries worldwide. They\xc2\xa0are looking for a Data Scientist\xc2\xa0to join their team. title: Lead Data Services Developer (SQL, SSIS, SSRS)

title: Data Entry - Tesrol
description:
b'

Tesrol was established over 35 years ago specialising in the manufacturing of cabinet doors & accessories for the supply at a wholesale level to the Cabinet making and Joinery trades.\xc2\xa0

Knowledge in the kitchen/cabinetry industry is preferred, but not essential if applicant is willing and eager to learn

Primary job role is computer entry of customer orders received. These are primarily for Kitchen Doors.\xc2\xa0 Also to ensure we respond to Customers enquiries promptly and efficiently.

You will need to be a good\xc2\xa0team player with good time management skills.

KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Keeping track of and accurately entering received data and source documents being job lot orders.
  • Taking calls from customer's in relation to queries and order's.
  • Contacting owners of source documents to resolve questions, inconsistencies, or missing data.
  • Keep record of work completed.
  • File source documents after entry.
  • Respond to inquiries regarding entered data.
  • Attending to\xc2\xa0customers in the\xc2\xa0showroom.
  • Administration

KEY ABILITIES
