  • Oral Communication - Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions.
  • Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
  • Organisational Support - Follows policies and procedures; Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports organization's goals and values.
  • Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently.
  • Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Monitors own work to ensure quality. Attention to detail is a must.
  • Quantity - Meets productivity standards; Completes work in timely manner; Strives to increase productivity; Works quickly.
  • Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
  • Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions.
  • Customer Service experience is required. All necessary in house training provided.
  • To perform this job successfully, an individual should have intermediate knowledge of computers.
  • Occasional overtime maybe required

Role is Based in Wetherill Park. This is a full-time position and an immediate start is available for the most suitable candidate.\xc2\xa0

title: Experience Optimisation Data Analyst
description:
b"

To meet the demands of substantial growth in our CRO offering, New Republique is looking to expand our team. We are looking for a talented 'Experience Optimisation Data Analyst'.\xc2\xa0


You would be working with new business across some of the biggest brands in the Banking, eTailer's, Finance, and Fashion. We are looking for someone with the following skills:

Must be located in Sydney and have a visa to work.

If this is you and you have a minimum of 2 - 5 years experience in conversion optimisation and data analysis we would love to talk to you. Please provide a CV and cover letter telling us why you believe you have what it takes.

title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist
description:
b'
Are you a creative Analytics professional looking for that opportunity where you can contribute to the strategic direction of the organisation?\xc2\xa0 This is a newly created group within their Strategic Intelligence team, where you will be applying your research and analytical skills to understand products and markets, identify trends and assess and evaluate risks. You will be able to provide solutions based on behavioural economics.
\xc2\xa0
As a Data Analyst / Data Scientist, you will contribute to the work of the Strategic Intelligence team by:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Working in a team of data analysts / scientists to identify and assess evolving trends, emerging risks and systemic misconduct in financial services and markets
\xe2\x80\xa2 Scoping, identifying and establishing data analysis methodologies to address research questions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Designing and advising on processes to collect, manipulate, clean and explore data
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analysing structured and unstructured data using statistical or machine learning approaches
\xe2\x80\xa2 Communicating analytical findings, including through reports, briefings, presentations and data visualisation

\xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting other teams and working across multi-disciplinary team projects.
\xc2\xa0
To be considered for this role:

You must have Australian Citizenship and able to get National Security Clearance
  • Experience using: R, SQL, SAS
  • Bachelor degree in Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics.
  • Advantageous Skills / Experience:\xc2\xa0Python, Java, Scala, Apache Spark, Hadoop, NoSQL databases, various ML libraries, experience extracting data from Teradata, etc.
  • Experience in applying statistical or machine learning approaches to data analysis.
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision and be accountable for outcomes.

title: Data Architect

b'

title: Commercial Data Business Analyst (Recent Graduate)
advertiser: Partners in Performance International Pty Ltd
description:
b'
  • Global Head Office Based Role\xc2\xa0
  • Opportunity to Contribute and Make a Real Impact\xc2\xa0
  • CBD Based\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Partners in Performance (PIP) is a fast-paced global management consulting firm\xc2\xa0with its Head Office located in Sydney CBD.\xc2\xa0 As a Firm we are about Unleashing Potential in our clients and our people. We assist organisations to deliver rapid and sustainable improvements in performance. We take a pragmatic 'at the coal face' approach to performance improvement. Our work spans strategy to procurement, revenues to costs, organisational culture to production debottlenecking and safety.

\xc2\xa0

ABOUT THE ROLE

Due to an internal promotion we are currently recruiting for the position of commercial Business Data & Reporting Analyst (not financial). \xc2\xa0You will assist with day-to-day analytical challenges across all of the business and with specific strategic initiatives.

The role has the key following activities: -

\xc2\xa0

THE CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

The role will appeal to a results-driven, commercially astute individual who possesses excellent analytical skills; sharp attention to detail and problem solving capabilities coupled with superior communication and interpersonal skills. Your other strengths include your strong relationship building with the ability to deal with ambiguity and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

JOIN US

PIP is committed to attracting, developing and retaining highly talented people and supports a rewarding and values-driven workplace culture. To attract talent we offer a competitive remuneration package.

INTERESTED?

to http://www.pipint.com/en/careers/join-pip/apply-now

Australian Citizen/Permanent Residents Only.

No calls or unsolicited applications from agencies please, including from existing suppliers. Thank you.

title: NA
description:
b"

SBS has developed a coveted reputation for being one of the most distinctive and diverse media organisations in the world. Some may call this an understatement. After all, where else is dancing in Mardi Gras parades, spotting Lee Lin Chin in the caf\xc3\xa9, or critiquing Eurovision performances all part of a days work?

We currently offer a rare opportunity within the newly created On Demand team for a User Experience Data Analyst. You will be taking a hypothesis-led approach to the analysis of user behavioural data from the On Demand platform to understand the user journey and how users are engaging with the player across all platforms. The output of your analysis will inform the prioritisation of both the backlog and the development and inclusion of new functionality and features. You will work as an integral part of the On Demand team bridging Qualitative UX research with existing behavioural data and A|B testing of new and existing features, driving a culture of experimentation and constant iteration.

What you will be doing

  • Master and analyse behavioural data flowing across all On Demand platforms to inform key decisions around digital product development, content curation and commercialisation
  • Support A|B testing with data analysis and insights
  • Innovate how we use behavioural data to engage more deeply with our audiences and drive loyalty and engagement with the platform.
  • Build user experience experiments and prototypes and validate these with data analysis
  • Independently perform data mining techniques and statistical analyses on large data sets to uncover critical patterns and predictive models.
  • Communicate effectively with small teams, formal presentations, and at business unit events with engaging storytelling.
  • Support the evolution of personalisation algorithms.
  • Build strong working relationships at all levels with internal clients and build problem-solving partnerships with clients and colleagues.

You'll be ready for your next big challenge and come equipped with:

  • Second to none analytical skills with an ability to transform data into plain English.
  • Hands-on experience working with a range of data sources and reporting formats.
  • Expertise in decomposing a problem and working through a technical approach and attacking a problem in a systematic way.
  • Experience working with digital product teams in an Agile environment.
  • Strong analysis and experimental design and prototyping skills with a keen sense for data gaps and inconsistencies.
  • Experience managing data-driven research from project inception to communication of insights and recommendations.
  • Experience in developing data visualisation independently or with tools.
  • Excellent oral, written and visual communication skills, particularly at explaining complex quantitative information to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong collaboration skills
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently in a constantly changing environment as well as collaboratively with a broader team
  • Boundless enthusiasm

What are we looking for?

Our ideal person will possess an ability to distil the available first-party behavioural data to identify key opportunities to improve the user experience and deepen engagement with and consumption of On Demand content. You will have experience at taking a hypothesis-led approach to the prioritisation of your analysis, using a variety of analytical techniques to generate insights and recommendations, which will be captured in succinct reports that cut through to the key issues for technical and non-technical users alike. You will be a lateral thinker with an ability to take ownership to achieve a required outcome. You will be known for your attention to detail and structured approach to problem solving. Our ideal person will have worked in a similar role with exposure to similar digital products and services.

The successful candidate will be offered a competitive salary

SBS aims to inspire all Australias to explore and appreciate our diverse world and by doing so contribute to an inclusive and cohesive society. Its a purpose which drives and motivates our team and the reason we love doing what we do. Click Apply to take the first step in becoming a part of it.

To apply online, please go to http://sbs.com.au/careers

"

title: Senior Data Scientist - Machine Learning
description:
b'

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with an engineering and Machine Learning programming background for one of our end user clients based in Sydney CBD.

This is a 12 months fixed term contract that is highly likely to move into a permanent role.

The hiring manager is looking for an exceptional candidate and the salary on offer for this role reflects this.

This collaborative team serve stakeholders from a variety of different internal business units, including marketing, risk and digital.

You must be able to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions through programming with tools like R, Python and SQL. This is a diverse team that build predictive analytical models for the business.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics. Attitude is a huge part of this role; a collaborative, creative person with technical and business facing skills is what we are looking for.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Strong experience in analytical tools, processes and practices

title: NA
description:
b"

Looking for a smart and creative Researcher and Data Analyst who will look after all technical data aspects of our agency's research projects

\xc2\xa0

Who

We are looking for:

\xe2\x80\xa2 at least four years experience in market research specialising in data

\xe2\x80\xa2 excellent survey scripting skills including complex routing and specific research techniques such as conjoint

\xe2\x80\xa2 advanced knowledge of Q and SPSS, along with high proficiency in Excel (including macros, pivot tables, VLOOKUP et) and will need to learn Qualtrics

\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Working knowledge of statistics and research techniques, along with good time management skills

\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0analytical thinking and the ability to work with a broader team, including clients

\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0curiosity and a passion to learn along with being proactive in responding to problems and finding creative solutions

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Role

You will be reporting to the Research Manager of the Sydney office. You will be required to:

\xe2\x80\xa2 script and test surveys in Qualtrics (tracking and ad hoc)

\xe2\x80\xa2 setting up quotas in Qaultrics, managing and monitoring fieldwork

\xe2\x80\xa2 liaising with external suppliers to oversee fieldwork

\xe2\x80\xa2 ensuring quality of data, weighting data sets and manipulating data in Altryx

\xe2\x80\xa2 setting up data in user-friendly formats

\xe2\x80\xa2 assisting in the development of new research products

\xe2\x80\xa2 manage timelines and delays on projects with the Research Manager

\xe2\x80\xa2 attend research supplier meetings and presentations

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

The Agency

We are a specialist boutique agency, focusing on research and analytics within the media and advertising industry.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 A wide range of research and analytical solutions are on offer, from face-to-face interviews up to large-scale quantitative studies, along with research panel development and management. Technology gives us our edge; we integrate passive data into our work, making our projects less imposing and more reliable.\xc2\xa0 Our smart, cross \xe2\x80\x93 channel solutions drive performance objectives through audience and media intelligence, enabling smart media buying for our clients.

Our culture is dynamic and nimble, we enable staff from every level through the agency to think independently and seek the best way of working for each project, rather than a 'set and forget' mentality.\xc2\xa0 We believe that diversity of talent, skill set and mindset generates the best environment for new thinking.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Curious minds and challenging work are always welcome here.

\xc2\xa0

Contact Us

If this sounds like you, please contact Amber on \xc2\xa0(+61) 2 9560 6695, or send your resume in Word Doc format to amber.crowe@cci-recruit.com, quoting reference number AC8646.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Sales Administration/Data Entry - 3 months
description:
b'

Who we are

Tyro delivers cloud-based, integrated and mobile EFTPOS banking solutions to Australian SMEs. In November 2015 we raised $100 million to grow and keep building for our 16,000+ customers.

We are actively looking for detail-oriented application specialists with excellent communication skills.

Purpose of the role

Manage the processing of merchant applications whilst ensuring that a high level of customer service is delivered to new and existing merchants.

What you will do

Processing Application Forms

\xe2\x80\xa2 Conducts preliminary review of all assigned applications within 24 hours of receipt. Reviews requirements for complete approval.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates the receipt and follow-up of all information and documents needed to process merchant applications.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Works closely with the Finance Credit Team and the Compliance Team to ensure that applications are compliant with the correct documentation required sourced from the merchant.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Upon receipt of documentation, reviews documents for completeness and "verifiable" information.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Follows up on requested documentation not received in time-frame necessary to meet and exceed merchant expectations.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Serves as the information source for internal and external merchant requests for status of application.

Data Entry

\xe2\x80\xa2 Accurate data entry and attention to detail

What we are looking for

Communication Skills

\xe2\x80\xa2 You communicate professionally, honestly and respectfully with merchants and internal team members at all times.

\xe2\x80\xa2 You are able to tailor their communication approach depending on their audience.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Your written communications are friendly, professional and to the point.

Business Acumen

\xe2\x80\xa2 You remain professional at all times and are a brand ambassador both internally and externally.

\xe2\x80\xa2 You think strategically and take initiative to improve the business when and where appropriate

\xe2\x80\xa2 You consider the impact of your actions and how you spend your time in terms of ROI for Tyro

Personal Brand

\xe2\x80\xa2 Must thrive working as an autonomous, individual contributor and concomitantly displays a high degree of personal responsibility

\xe2\x80\xa2 Empathetic listener and avid problem solver

\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct yourself with honesty and integrity both internally and externally

\xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to all requests in a timely manner & follows through on commitments

\xe2\x80\xa2 Be proactive: you take the opportunity to 'lean in' where possible and appropriate, contributing to team tasks and projects

\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist fellow team members to grow and learn

\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to a positive, vibrant culture

\xe2\x80\xa2 Filter decisions & actions through company values; innovation, fairness and transparency, flexibility and care

\xe2\x80\xa2 Embrace agility and ability to adapt to or create change

If this sounds like you, apply today, we would love to hear from you.

'

title: Data Engineer
description:
b"

NRL Digital is embarking on a period of major transformation and growth with many of the Game's key digital properties coming back in house from early 2018.

\xc2\xa0

As a result, we are currently recruiting a Data Engineer to work within our Data Warehouse team.

\xc2\xa0

The primary objective of this role is to support the execution of the digital marketing strategy. \xc2\xa0This involves working closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors.

\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities:

  • Design, Develop, Unit Test and maintain SQL stored procedures and functions that model, enhanced and interrogate the games data\xc2\xa0
  • Extend the current match and merge logic in the Data Warehouse
  • Design, Develop, Unit Test and maintain SSIS packages that automate data consumption and preparation
  • Monitor routines, logs and performance of the environments
  • Strong SQL knowledge and, ideally, some programming experience
  • Import adhoc and scheduled data sets into the Warehouse
  • Understand and simplify complex data environments
  • Ability to work with technical and non-technical colleagues and vendors
  • Support escalated production issues

Required:

  • \xc2\xa0Tertiary qualifications in Marketing or similar
  • Excellent SQL skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • High level of integrity
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Data Management and Manipulation skills
  • Ability to learn new software quickly
  • Detailed oriented
  • Process focused individual who is experienced in working to deadlines
  • Ability to work with various stakeholders in a professional manner
  • Delivery focused
  • Strong team player

If you believe you meet the above criteria and demonstrate the NRL's values of Excellence, Inclusiveness, Courage and Teamwork, then please apply.

\xc2\xa0

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply. The National Rugby League is an Equal Opportunity Employer

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Data & Strategy Analyst
description:
b'
Responsibilities

  • An opportunity to start your career with a global brand
  • Have real impact on strategy with major clients
  • Work on an exciting variety of projects

    \xc2\xa0

Aon is Australia's leading provider of broking and consulting services for risk management, insurance transactions, reinsurance, human capital consulting and financial planning. Aon is a global leader in the design and provision of risk services and products.

\xc2\xa0

Aon Inpoint is a leading global strategy consulting firm focused exclusively on the insurance industry. We partner with our clients to identify profitable growth opportunities and improve operational effectiveness for their business. As a trusted advisor with unmatched experience in strategy, we deliver credible and practical solutions to empower our client\xe2\x80\x99s financial performance. Aon Inpoint serves clients from offices in Chicago, New York, London, Singapore and Sydney and works with experts from Aon's global network of more than 600 offices in 120 countries.

Inpoint is seeking to hire an outstanding Strategy Analyst to come into the consultancy arm of the\xc2\xa0business. Working closely with the Consulting team in the Asia Pacific region, the candidate will be exposed to a variety of projects and clients, offering real opportunities to develop your skillset. You will think creatively to develop new and innovative strategies for our clients.

\xc2\xa0

You will be responsible for:

\xc2\xa0

  • Enhance and maintain Aon Inpoint\xe2\x80\x99s data environment
  • Collaborate with other teams to provide best possible analytical solutions & product solutions to clients and colleagues
  • Complete end to end peer review and testing of analytical outputs and analytical solutions
  • Provide input into the development of new analytics tools and solutions
  • Participate in various phases of the client engagement including:
  • Performing data analysis and modelling
  • Preparing and participating in client interviews
  • Developing client-ready materials (PowerPoint, Excel, and Access)
  • Supporting project leadership in synthesizing findings and identifying key insights from analysis of data

\xc2\xa0

To be successful in this role you will display:

\xc2\xa0

  • Experience creating and managing databases
  • Strong analytical abilities
  • Ability to perform well under pressure, on multiple work streams, and with tight deadlines
  • Strong attention to detail and a critical eye in overseeing work on peer reviews
  • Willingness to learn and to solve complex problems
  • Regularly identifies opportunities to take on additional responsibility and work efficiently
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with clients

\xc2\xa0

This is an excellent opportunity to join a leading international organisation within a very talented and growing team and to make a significant contribution to the overall regional APAC and global business.

\xc2\xa0

How to apply:

\xc2\xa0

Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.

\xc2\xa0

Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives. \xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Hands on Architect - C#/SQL - Big Data Flavour
description:
b"This global giant of big data needs to bring another application architect into the local team.

The role will focus on the ongoing development of their core big data platform, the layers that feed into it, and the backend logic that handles the analysis.

C# and SQL are the key languages involved. The platform is built around Hadoop, but much of the integration layer and backend is built within C# and SQL respectively.

Data integration and data integrity are two ongoing challenges for the business. Speed of integration and analysis are also going to be a focus moving forward.

The successful candidate will be a proven architect (this isn't a role for a dev looking to step up), with strong skills around C# and SQL. You would still be expected to cut some code.\xc2\xa0A background in data warehousing & analytics would be a bonus.\xc2\xa0

You'll also have strong communication skills and be a great influence and be able to win people over.

Your reward? A very interesting & challenging role working with some the big names of Australian business, a great salary package, a great workplace environment (plenty of opportunities for technical development, a staff gym onsite, and an active social club) and a location that cuts 15 minutes each way off the CBD commute (And what's that add up to a year? Actually I'll tell you: the equivalent of 15 days a year!!!) "

title: Data Warehouse Manager | NRL Digital
description:
b"NRL Digital is embarking on a period of major transformation and growth with many of the Game's key digital properties coming back in house from early 2018.\xc2\xa0

As a result, we are currently recruiting a Data Warehouse Manager.

The Data Warehouse Manager is responsible for maintaining and supporting the NRL Warehouse and all associated integrations.\xc2\xa0 Working alongside the Solution Architect this role will be responsible for building out a platform that will create a single customer view, match, merge and cleanse data.\xc2\xa0 This solution will support the Business Intelligence solutions across the NRL, States and Clubs.
\xc2\xa0
This role is responsible for supporting and building out the data warehouse.\xc2\xa0 This is an SQL environment built on Azure in combination with Master Data Management tools such as Maestro.\xc2\xa0 The key goal of the data warehouse is to combine a large number of disparate data sources using a golden record approach. The Data Warehouse Manager is responsible for this suite of technologies and the quality of the data produced.
\xc2\xa0
Required:

  • Tertiary qualifications in relevant fields
  • Minimum 5 years in Data Warehouse, ETL, MDM and Integrations
  • Experience architecting/implementing solutions.
  • Strong SQL experience
  • Knowledge of Azure and associated technologies
  • Experience background in installation, setup, configuration, implementation, integration and testing of Data warehouses and Governance programs
  • Strong implementation methodology
  • Experience and good understanding of the architecture of Cloud based services and systems\xc2\xa0
  • Experience and good understanding of integrations between multiple systems (on premise and cloud based systems).
  • Deep Understanding of SDLC (System Development Life Cycles) - Agile and Waterfall processes for future development.
  • Demonstrated background with following implementation, configuration and testing tasks within project schedules
  • Excellent time management skills
  • High level of integrity\xc2\xa0
  • Ability to manage time and deliver to tight deadlines

If you believe you meet the above criteria and demonstrate the NRL's values of Excellence, Inclusiveness, Courage and Teamwork, then please apply.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.\xc2\xa0
The National Rugby League is an Equal Opportunity Employer. "

title: NA
description:
b'

About us

Jemena owns and operates significant gas, electricity and water transportation assets across Australia\xe2\x80\x99s east coast, supplying millions of households and businesses with essential services every day.

With more than a century\xe2\x80\x99s experience and expertise in the utilities sector and\xc2\xa0our strong portfolio of important\xc2\xa0distribution and transmission assets, we are ready to make the most of opportunities for growth and innovation.

As a provider of gas, electricity and water, we have enduring relationships with our customers and the communities where we operate. They are at the heart of our commitment to deliver energy and water safely, reliably and affordably, and to the sustainable growth of our business in the long term.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0


The Interval Data Management Officer works with commercial data and billing processes designed to meet the regulatory and commercial obligations of Jemena. Your role ensures efficient processing and verification of interval meter reading and billing data and prompt resolution of meter reading and billing anomalies.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

The role includes the following responsibilities:

  • Efficient processing and verification of interval meter reading and billing data and prompt resolution of meter reading and billing anomalies to ensure timely delivery of accurate and complete daily consumption and billing data to external stakeholders including AEMO/STTM, retailers and network users.
  • Effective monitoring, maintenance and trouble-shooting of contract sites\xe2\x80\x99 metering equipment, Metretek and related devices, and telecommunication lines and equipment, including generation and scheduling of service and breakdown maintenance work and coordination with field technicians.
  • Efficient maintenance of accurate and complete interval meter reading and billing data to support retailer, network user and market stakeholder billing inquiries.
  • Design and implementation of business processes and systems changes to improve the efficiency of interval meter measurement and billing processes and compliance with regulatory and contractual obligations.

\xc2\xa0

NOTE:\xc2\xa0 This role requires starting work not later than 7:00am for Metretek data receipts and not later than 8:00am for meter data validations on weekdays on an as-required basis when providing back-up to other team members to meet market delivery timeframes.

\xc2\xa0

What we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for

\xc2\xa0

As the successful candidate you will bring the following skills and experience with you:

\xc2\xa0

Education

Tertiary qualifications in a technical or business discipline.

\xc2\xa0

Experience

\xc2\xa0

  • Experience in the Australian energy industry will be an advantage.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of, and experience with troubleshooting, interval meter measurement systems, hardware and software. Experience with Mercury Instruments Metretek systems and devices or interval data energy metering systems will be an advantage.
  • Demonstrated experience with using systems and technologies to manage data collection, processing, analysis and reporting will be an advantage.

\xc2\xa0

Technical competencies and skills

\xc2\xa0

  • Demonstrated ability to identify, track and resolve data anomalies.
  • Demonstrated ability to plan, prioritise tasks and meet stringent deadlines.
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to cooperate and work professionally with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Ability to design, implement, document, maintain and improve business processes.
  • Understanding of gas distribution network topology is an advantage.
  • Knowledge of NSW and ACT gas market regulatory procedures and rules including JGN and AAD Access Arrangements, NSW/ACT Retail Market Procedures, Gas Supply Act, Short-Term Trading Market Rules, Network Code, NGR/NGL, and the National Energy Customer Framework will be an advantage.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Intermediate Excel skills.

Jemena is a dynamic company that focuses on attracting and motivating talented industry professionals. We\xe2\x80\x99ve made it our priority to create an exceptional workplace with competitive salaries, educational assistance and salary packaging options, among other benefits.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Financial Services - Finance & Risk Data Scientist - Manager
description:
b'

About Accenture Financial Services practice

The Financial Services Operating Group serves all major industry segments in Banking, Insurance and Capital Markets - serving more than 700 unique clients in 24 countries. Among Accenture's clients are more than 86 percent of the Financial Services companies in the Fortune Global 500. The Financial Services operating group helps clients succeed in a dynamic and increasingly global market environment that includes cost and profitability pressures, industry consolidation, regulatory changes and the need to continually adapt to new technologies. The services offered are designed to help clients increase cost efficiency, grow their customer bases, manage risk and transform their operations.

About Accenture Finance & Risk

Banks, capital markets and insurance firms face extraordinary challenges related to profitability, complexity and new regulations in an uncertain economic environment, an environment we refer to as one of "permanent volatility."

Accenture Finance & Risk Services can help financial services firms focus upon the three key challenges of increasing profitability, reducing complexity and managing regulations. Accenture draws on its end-to-end transformation capabilities, as well as core strengths in management consulting, technology, analytics and outsourcing to help firms address complexity, volatility while creating sustainable competitive advantage.

Accenture Finance & Risk Services brings together Accenture's industry knowledge, consulting technology and outsourcing capabilities to develop solutions that can help clients strengthen their competitive position and enhance their profitability.

About the Role

The Finance & Risk Data Scientist Manager is accountable for assisting on execution of the strategy of data analysis, data quality, analytics and modelling offerings in the region. The successful individual will be an experienced data scientist, capable of supporting the go-to-market strategy, orchestrating and building data and analytics practice assets and capabilities, and creating thought leadership on data and analytics developments in the financial services market. The functional coverage of this consulting practice extends across financial services' risk and regulatory frameworks, finance processes, risk transformation, risk and regulatory remediation, optimising risk and regulation implementation and ongoing adherence and delivering the technology solutions required to enable insights through analytics.

This Manager will be able to define and deliver how Accenture will bring together all its data and analytics offerings (strategy, management consulting, technology solutions, systems integration, and operations) in an integrated way that provides a compelling value proposition to financial services institutions today.

Data Scientist that will help Acccenture's clients discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help our clients make smarter decisions to deliver better finance and risk capabilities for our clients. The primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems whilst working with our existing capability in the Digital and Analytics teams.\xc2\xa0

Another key role for this position is that of supporting Practice Development. In supporting this business area, the successful manager must not only be skilled at business planning but also in the operational activities that come with supporting a practice: managing consulting teams and supporting the culture in being leaders in compliance consulting. To achieve this, he/she must be able to work effectively in a global matrix of financial services sector heads and service line practice leaders who will contribute, follow and support the strategic roadmap for integrated business services.

Successful candidates for this position will be experienced in data and analytics services and/or consulting services for Financial Services or have moved on to relevant manager-level industry roles in Financial Services. The manager must demonstrate expertise in the following knowledge areas:

  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques

  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • Extending clients' data with third party sources of information when needed
  • Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
  • Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
  • Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
  • Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance

Skills and Qualifications

  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
  • Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable
  • Great communication skills
  • Experience with data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, Tableau, Qlikview etc.
  • Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive etc.
  • Experience with NoSQL databases
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
  • Good scripting and programming skills\xc2\xa0
  • Data-oriented personality
  • Develops strong and effective working relationships based on mutual respect and trust.
  • Authentic in his/her leadership style. Projects confidence, optimism and energy to encourage people on what they can achieve.
  • Strives to help others succeed. Shows an active interest in others and cares about them
  • Team oriented and collaborative working style, both with clients and those within the internal organization
  • Shows character under pressure. Professional and ethical in all business dealings.
  • Ability to conceive and articulate an inspiring vision/ future direction using analytics and data
  • Ability to examine issues from a broad perspective; considering impact beyond immediate scope.
  • Ability to leverage synergy opportunities across functions and businesses.
  • Identification of key business opportunities and challenges.
  • Takes charge and makes tough decisions. Demonstrates a "can do attitude".
  • Proactive and fearless. Moves beyond his or her comfort zone in pursuit of Accenture's vision.
  • Effective communicator, good listener with strong inter-personal skills.
  • Role model who engenders loyalty and longevity among staff.\xc2\xa0

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in STEM
  • 8+ years of professional experience
  • 7+ years Financial Services/Banking experience
  • 6+ years' experience in analytics and data

\xc2\xa0Preferred qualifications:

  • At least 6 years of experience in the sale and delivery of data analytics consulting services; with proven track record as an individual contributor and as a leader of a practice
  • Diverse background that includes working within different business models and markets.
  • Model development experience.

Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

'

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
b'

Your New Company & Team

Enterprise Services (ES) is responsible for the world leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank, from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business.

The Analytics & Information (A&I) team are accountable for the Group's key analytics capabilities including the GDW (Group Data Warehouse), Omnia (Hadoop Big Data Platform), Pega Decisioning, SAS, R, Tableau, Oracle BI, Ab Initio and Data Stage. We are focused on enhancing these to create world-leading capabilities for analytics, information management and decisioning.

Reporting into the Data Science Executive Manager, you'll be part of a broader Data Science team, working in consultation with:

  • Solution delivery managers
  • Project and Program teams
  • Data Science and Data Engineers teams
  • Resource Managers
  • Vendors and third party suppliers

The Challenge & Project Description
The Senior Data scientist will provide leadership and direction in implementing advance analytics and machine learning. This includes:

1- Thought leadership

  • Provide thought leadership to a broad team of architects in general areas of Data Mining and Machine Learning
  • Demonstrate leadership through concrete action and result-oriented approach
  • Apply state of the art statistical modelling/machine learning and data mining techniques to support business analytics teams across the Group

2- Project leadership

  • Take ownership (from inception to delivery) of two greenfield innovative projects in pricing / lending as well as, an early-stage project in Digital
  • Demonstrate business acumen in generating ROI (Return on Investment)
  • Engage with business stakeholders to clearly articulate findings as well as decompose business question into data science questions.

3- Drive innovation

  • Implement an experimentation data platform with associated tools and processes for quick prototyping and evaluation of novel approaches to modelling
  • Develop clear framework and guidelines for implementation of Data Mining solutions on large-scale production systems
  • An emphasis on coding or practice and on working closely with other teams to insure algorithms are delivered into production systems

Key Skills & Experience
Do you come from a large, complex, enterprise environment?

1- Soft skills:

  • Proven experience in business engagement on data science initiatives
  • Immaculate presentation, storytelling and business acumen

2- Hard skills:

  • Manipulate large datasets leveraging Spark, MapReduce and/or Hadoop
  • Data exploration (e.g. SQL, Pig, Hive, etc)
  • Data analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Python, etc)
  • Solve business problems by applying analysis, data mining and modelling (e.g. machine learning, Natural Language Processing, etc)
  • Data visualisation of complex relationships (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, MicroStrategy, etc)
  • NoSQL databases (e.g. HBASE, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc)
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment
  • Programming /coding in R, Python, Ruby or Scala.

3- Academic background
Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines

Highly regarded:

  • Agile (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Lean, etc)
  • Financial Services sector experience

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

  • Data driven culture from top-down for A&I are considered as a Centre of Excellence
  • Academic research (publishing of scientific papers and securing patterns) is at the core of innovation and half of the team holds a PhD
  • There is room for experimentation in the Innovation Labs for Deep Learning
  • You'll be invited to participate into the quarterly Hackathon and Datathon

You will have the opportunity to directly impact at large scale the Australian economy. If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
b'

Your New Company & Team

Enterprise Services (ES) is responsible for the world leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank, from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business.

The Analytics & Information (A&I) team are accountable for the Group's key analytics capabilities including the GDW (Group Data Warehouse), Omnia (Hadoop Big Data Platform), Pega Decisioning, SAS, R, Tableau, Oracle BI, Ab Initio and Data Stage. We are focused on enhancing these to create world-leading capabilities for analytics, information management and decisioning.

Reporting into the Data Science Executive Manager, you'll be part of a broader Data Science team, working in consultation with:

  • Solution delivery managers
  • Project and Program teams
  • Data Science and Data Engineers teams
  • Resource Managers
  • Vendors and third party suppliers

The Challenge & Project Description
The Senior Data scientist will provide leadership and direction in implementing advance analytics and machine learning. This includes:

1- Thought leadership

  • Provide thought leadership to a broad team of architects in general areas of Data Mining and Machine Learning
  • Demonstrate leadership through concrete action and result-oriented approach
  • Apply state of the art statistical modelling/machine learning and data mining techniques to support business analytics teams across the Group

2- Project leadership

  • Take ownership (from inception to delivery) of two greenfield innovative projects in pricing / lending as well as, an early-stage project in Digital
  • Demonstrate business acumen in generating ROI (Return on Investment)
  • Engage with business stakeholders to clearly articulate findings as well as decompose business question into data science questions.

3- Drive innovation

  • Implement an experimentation data platform with associated tools and processes for quick prototyping and evaluation of novel approaches to modelling
  • Develop clear framework and guidelines for implementation of Data Mining solutions on large-scale production systems
  • An emphasis on coding or practice and on working closely with other teams to insure algorithms are delivered into production systems

Key Skills & Experience
Do you come from a large, complex, enterprise environment?

1- Soft skills:

  • Proven experience in business engagement on data science initiatives
  • Immaculate presentation, storytelling and business acumen

2- Hard skills:

  • Manipulate large datasets leveraging Spark, MapReduce and/or Hadoop
  • Data exploration (e.g. SQL, Pig, Hive, etc)
  • Data analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Python, etc)
  • Solve business problems by applying analysis, data mining and modelling (e.g. machine learning, Natural Language Processing, etc)
  • Data visualisation of complex relationships (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, MicroStrategy, etc)
  • NoSQL databases (e.g. HBASE, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc)
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment
  • Programming /coding in R, Python, Ruby or Scala.

3- Academic background
Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines

Highly regarded:

  • Agile (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Lean, etc)
  • Financial Services sector experience

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

  • Data driven culture from top-down for A&I are considered as a Centre of Excellence
  • Academic research (publishing of scientific papers and securing patterns) is at the core of innovation and half of the team holds a PhD
  • There is room for experimentation in the Innovation Labs for Deep Learning
  • You'll be invited to participate into the quarterly Hackathon and Datathon

Impact

You will have the opportunity to directly impact at large scale the Australian economy. If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key.

'

title: Survey Data Analyst
description:
b"

About the business and the role

Austraffic has over 30 years' experience in the traffic and transport industry as data collection specialists. Austraffic's expertise is in survey design, execution, quality assurance, data processing and presentation of results.\xc2\xa0 Austraffic specialises in data collection and market research for local and state government, consultants and private clients

Job tasks and responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities

Data Management

  1. Review client survey requirements in order to assist with providing accurate quotes and timelines for analysis tasks.
  2. Provide timely, accurate and detailed professionally presented project reports.
  3. Complete quality checks for data processed by others as required.
  4. Send formatted results to Clients with outage and observation details and reports (as required).
  5. Identify problems and improvements and raise Notices, assign tasks and follow up appropriately on the Austraffic Business Management Interface.
  6. Review instructions to the processing team to ensure timely and accurate traffic counts.
  7. Update work status and manage task priorities using the online project management tools.

Business Development

  1. Continually review Austraffic data management systems to ensure ease of use, fit for purpose design with a focus on automation for standardising data processing.
  2. Influence system design to assist with timely and accurate completion of data processing and reporting tasks.
  3. Continually review Austraffic analytic software for easy use & report presentations.

Office Management

  1. Ensure that a safe work place is provided for all workers and visitors.
  2. Ensure that the office complies with the requirements of the Business Management System and Business Management Interface (Austraffic intranet) usage requirement.
  3. Ensure the office is secured at the close of business and sufficient access provided to workers and suppliers, including access to the warehouse and car park facility as needed.

Secondary Activities

Project Delivery

  1. Undertake survey activities as required including but not limited to:
    • Survey Set Up
    • Site Supervision
    • Data Collection
    • Field Audits
  2. Escalate unresolved or incomplete activities as necessary to ensure timely closure of projects.

Skills and experience

To be considered for a position you must have excellent English comprehension, written and verbal communication skills. You will be responsible for managing traffic data quality, interacting with the Survey Management Teams and working with client project briefs.\xc2\xa0 We are looking for individuals with a high level of attention to detail, an ability to work with numbers and in particular identify traffic patterns and apply logic to validate and test the outcomes. You will be expected to identify process improvements and enhance the business by proactively engaging with the team to develop system solutions to minimise repetition, ensure accuracy in results and deliver high quality client reports.

Core business tools include inhouse Traffic Survey software primarily producing excel based client reports, a Business Management System (Intranet) for project management and compliance and Microsoft suite for general administration and communications. \xc2\xa0

Job benefits and perks

The NSW office is located in Rydalmere, close to public transport. The hours of work will be between 8am-6pm, Monday-Friday or as otherwise required to meet project demand.\xc2\xa0 From time to time, there may be a requirement to travel to the Victorian office (located in Croydon South), for example to undertake training or provide project support.

Applications close: Monday, 8 May 2017.

Short listed applicants will be notified by email on Thursday, 11 May with first round interviews planned for Tuesday, 16 May 2017.

\xc2\xa0

"

This role is to provide digital marketing and analysis to improve the efficiency of acqusition activities across our categories; including channel mix, landing page optimisation, mobility.

Great communication skills

Basic skills in photoshop would be an advantage

title: Regional Manager - Professional Services (Big Data & Analytics)
description:
b"

We represent one of the world's talked about software vendors. Formed by execs from the highest profile tech companies and with colossal VC backing, our client works with the world's leading organisations in every market sector capture, store and process vast amounts of data using raging hot technology to drive business decisions.

Owing to significant global growth, a role has been created for an experienced and technically capable Professional Services Executive to manage the A/NZ operations of the services team, including project scheduling and financial management.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • attract and retain the top talent in the industry. Motivate, inspire and mentor project team members to excel
  • drive 100% customer satisfaction and project success
  • be working closely with the Regional Sales Managers to define, scope and sell project engagements


KEY SELECTION CRITERIA

  • 5+ years of successfully managing a P&L for a services region, preferably within an enterprise software company
  • experience managing the selling and scoping activities on large scale, complex technology infrastructure projects
  • direct line management experience of highly technical employees
  • customer relationship management including project escalations, and participating in executive steering meetings
  • strong foundational knowledge of database technologies, networks, distributed computing, programming languages and operating systems.
  • strong knowledge of software implementation methodologies
  • excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills
  • 30-50% travel anticipated
  • Degree in Computer Science and/or business administration
  • fluent written and spoken English

To be considered, send your updated resume of executive profile with covering letter addressing the abovementioned KEY SELECTION CRITERIA or call Senior Associate, Paul Dimond directly on +61 3 9235-1199 for a confidential discussion.

"

title: Head of Data Science & Analytics | Strategic role | Innovative Tech Product Co
description:
b'As the head of Data Science & Analytics you will report to the CTO and be strategically\xc2\xa0involved in building the Data Science & Analytics capability across this Innovative product Company
  • A unique Career opportunity along with an excellent Salary Package
  • A truly Innovative, Fresh and Dynamic Project Team
  • An Opportunity to contribute to further growth of this growing Technology Company
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
  • You will have a minimum of seven to ten years experience working within an Enterprise\xc2\xa0Data Science & Analytics environment.
  • You will have proven experience building out the Data Science & Analytics capability across Technology driven businesses.
  • A desire to become the strategic lead in a fast growing Technology Company.
  • Engage with key stakeholder to include CTO, C-level board, Head of Applications, Product & Marketing Manager to inform requirements documents, product roadmaps, and data architecture with detailed understanding of the data science needs and expectations of both generalist and sophisticated quantitative users.
  • Work closely with the product and development organisation and teams, lead the integration of predictive modeling, machine learning and artificial intelligence approaches, time series forecasting, text analytics, etc. into data architecture, intellectual property, and products
  • Experience working collaboratively with engineering teams onto integrate\xc2\xa0models, product and services, and applications that are based around the findings and correlations of the data.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Experience in an early stage entrepreneurial environment, willingness to play a versatile role in small team coupled with desire to help build a global team.
If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess the above attributes then please apply to this role, if you require further information on this then\xc2\xa0please\xc2\xa0contact\xc2\xa0DATA TALENT\xc2\xa0on 1300 763 895 for a confidential chat.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

title: Data Scientist
description:
b"

Join as a Data Scientist working on a large variety of projects and implementing the latest technologies

The Company

This leading consulting group located in Sydney CBD is currently expanding its Analytics division. Their work is focuused on AI implementation, machine learning and advanced analytics. They have a diverse team of data scientists, statisticians, developers and strategists who are focused on delivering unique customer solutions using the latest technologies

The Role

As a Data Scientist you will be designing, developing and implementing analytical solutions and focus on key areas of customers' business. You will closely work with the business stakeholders on factual problem formation, data identification and deriving answers that can solve business issues

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in a hands on Data Scientist position.
  • Advanced data modelling and statistical analysis skills.
  • 2+ years experience in analytical tools such as \xe2\x80\x98R\xe2\x80\x99 and ability to develop multilevel models

Career Opportunities

title: Data Entry
description:
b"

A new and exciting opportunity has become available for an experienced office administrator to advance their career by gaining experience in a well-known investment bank as data entry.

Client Details

Our client is a reputable international investment banker that is recognised both in Australia and internationally. Due to an expected expansion of their activities, an exciting and rare opportunity has arisen for an experienced data administrator to join their existing office support team.

Description

  • Acting as the first point of contact for clients including phone, email and face-to-face interactions;
  • Formatting all documents and reports to ensure professional presentation;
  • Maintaining internal records on excel in a timely and accurate manner;
  • Ensuring that all records match with the company's regulations and standards; and
  • Completing all administrative support duties as required by the team including filing, photocopying and proof reading.

Profile

The successful candidate will have previous experience within an office environment. You will hold exceptional verbal and written communication skills, as evident in proficiency in MS Office Suite including Excel. You will be an organised individual who takes pride in their work and is able to take initiative to prioritise the completion of tasks as required. Given the nature of our client, you will be professionally presented and will be confident interacting with stakeholders of all levels of seniority. Finally, the ideal candidate will fit in with a motivated and dynamic team of professionals.

  • Convenient CBD location with harbor views; and
  • A friendly and dynamic workplace culture with the opportunity for career progression.

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Carla Parish on +61 2 8292 2205.

"

title: SQL Data & Insights Analyst - CONTRACT
description:
b"Our client is an innovative and forward thinking Market Research agency who have successfully develop and delivered a number of cutting edge startegic data driven products to the FMCG/Retail industry. As a result of the success of the business they are entering into an exciting phase of growth and are looking to recruit an experienced SQL Data and Insights specialist to join the team and support the fulfilment of one of their most successful product streams. This immediate start contract will offer the successful applicant a fun and vibrant work environment and a long term opportunity to support the development of this innovative arm of the business.\xc2\xa0

As a SQL Data and Insights specialist the responsibilities of this contract role will involve but not be limited to:
  • Engaging with internal and external stakeholders to consult around incoming and outgoing dashboard requests. Defining project requirements, discuss methodologies, negotiating timelines/deliverables.
  • Leverage strong SQL programming (i.e. SQL Server, Oracle SQL, SQL Teradata) to extract, manage and manipulate large and complex datasets ready for analysis.
  • Perform a variety of statistical analysis techniques and develop compelling data visualizations (Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI etc) that will support client projects and highlight strategic recommendations.
  • Proactively identify and develop enhancements to existing processes and models that will improve data accuracy, integrity, reporting efficiency and facilitate business understanding.
The successful applicant will come from a strong background working in a data driven insights environment and will be able to demonstrate:
  • Strong SQL Programming skills for interrogating, managing and manipulating large and complex data sets (i.e. SQL Sever, Oracle SQL, SQL Teradata, MYSQL etc.)
  • Experience analysing large volumes of transactional data to identify key insights, patterns and trends that will support predefined strategic initiatives. (segmentation analysis, basket analysis, next best action analysis,\xc2\xa0store location & branch optimisation, customer profiling, customer lifetime value, hypothesis testing, campaign analytics etc)\xc2\xa0
  • Experience working with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlikview or PowerBI will prove highly advantageous.
  • Any exposure to working in a marketing, media or\xc2\xa0research\xc2\xa0agency with exposure to Retail/FMCG data will prove highly\xc2\xa0advantageous.\xc2\xa0
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

title: Big Data Hadoop Developer  Hadoop Consultant  Hadoop, Scala / Spark Consultant
salary: b'Great Location + Above average Rems + Bonus'
description:
b'

\xc2\xa0

Your Benefits:

  • End User Organisation;
  • Great Package + Bonus and Perks;
  • Senior Level Opportunities;
  • Work / Life Balance Options;
  • Fun & Positive Environment;
  • Top-tier Reputable Brand;
  • Brand-New and High-Profile Projects;
  • Friendly Management;

\xc2\xa0

Rewarding Opportunity for a Technical Hadoop Big Data Consultant / Architect

\xc2\xa0

In this role you will see yourself working at a reputable top-tier organization within the business intelligence / digital marketing function as senior player.

The focus of this role is having in-depth knowledge of Big Data ecosystems centrally focused on Hadoop Development while Scala / Spark form other parts of this role. This is a Business Intelligence related requirement and therefore having a background in that space, in particular with a NoSQL database is desirable.

\xc2\xa0

To be successful for this role, your CV will need to reflect on following skill-set:

  • Recent In-depth experience in development and configuration of Hadoop / Big Data components (e.g. Oozie, Cascading, Spark);
  • Demonstrated experience in analyzing text, streams with emerging Hadoop-based big data, NoSQL.;
  • Coding background in particular within Scala / Spark (Mandatory) and Python, Pig, Hive, R, \xc2\xa0Java (desirable) with emphasis on tuning / optimization;

Having local and recent experience is mandatory, other applicants will not be considered for this requirement.

You can either apply here or send your application directly to Navid at Navid@infinitypro.com.au quoting 008Hadoop. You can contact us on (02) 9687 1068 for a confidential discussion, please ensure you have sent your resume prior to making contact.

Please ensure all documents are sent in Microsoft word format.

title: Data Management - ETL Development Lead
description:
b'
  • Data Management Lead
  • Financial Services
  • Sydney CBD Based

Medium sized Wealth Management organisation based in the Sydney CBD is seeking a Data Management Lead to provide leadership and guidance to a small team of Data Analysts and Database Administrators.

The Data Management Lead is accountable and responsible for ongoing data governance and best practice for data extraction, transforming and loading (ETL) for system integration and reporting.

Strong hands on development experience with Microsoft BI tools (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS) are essential for this role, as are strong understanding of Master Data Management (MDM) principles, data governance and "source of truth", and industry best practice data modelling.

You will be responsible for leading the data integration and BI reporting team with designing and maintaining ETL and ESB frameworks, as well as understanding and designing the data model to industry best practice.

In order to succeed in this role you will be able to demonstrate:

  • Experience leading small teams
  • Experience as a Data Management lead on a high profile, time critical project
  • Experience developing and implementing data migration/integration strategies and plans.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of relational databases, ETL frameworks and tools - SQL Server, SSIS / SSRS
  • Proven experience with BI reporting packages
  • Technical understanding of data modelling, data mining and interrogation techniques
  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to collect and disseminate large amounts of data with strong attention to detail
  • Proven research and analytical skills
  • Good working knowledge of, and experience working with third party vendors and systems
  • Strong planning, prioritisation and organisational skills
  • Ability to articulate technical issues to non-technical audiences

Experience in medium sized organisations within Superannuation, Insurance or Funds Management highly desirable.

\xc2\xa0

To apply for this role, please provide your resume in our preferred Word or PDF format no larger than 1MB and quote Job Reference: 15153.

For any queries regarding this or other roles, please phone Derek Mock on 02 9248 6815.

Thank you for your interest and we will be in touch with those candidates
that meet the position requirements and are an Australian Resident.

People from a diverse background are welcome to apply.

For a full listing of positions please visit www.ecareer.com.au

\xc2\xa0

ecareer employment services
Level 10, 50 Margaret St, Sydney NSW 2000
Phone: 02 9248 6815

'

title: Data Centre Technician - Mechanical or Electrical
description:
b"

A global organisation have a requirement for a Data Centre Technician to join their team.

Your new company
A global organisation have an immediate requirement for an experienced Data Centre Technician from an electrical or Mechanical / HVAC background to join their team.

Your new role
In this role you will have the opportunity to work in one of the most technologically advanced data centres to date where you will be responsible for carrying out and overseeing maintenance on critical power systems, UPS & DC power distribution, BMS monitoring, backup generator testing, general ad-hoc duties as required and site inspections etc.

What you'll need to succeed
To succeed in this role you will be from an electrical or Mechanical / HVAC background and ideally have previous experience working on a critical site such as a hotel, hospital, telephone exchange or data centre.

What you'll get in return
This position will give you the opportunity of training and career progression along with a competitive salary package and the opportunity to working on some of the most cutting edge equipment in Australia.

What you need to do now
For more information please don\xe2\x80\x98t hesitate to contact Aaron Vandermeel (02) 9249 2222 or email aaron.vandermeel@hays.com.au quoting reference #. 1861086

"

title: Head of Data Science & Products
description:
b'

Our Company

Tabcorp is one of the few integrated gambling and entertainment companies in the world. We deliver excitement and fun to our customers through our retail, digital and media platforms.

Our 3,000 strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive leading brands and industry-first sustainability efforts, here and internationally. They\xe2\x80\x99ve also made Tabcorp a top 100 ASX company.

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you\xe2\x80\x99re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we\xe2\x80\x99d love to hear from you.

Role Summary

With the General manager, Data and Analytics as your leader, the Head of Data Science and products will be responsible for leading a team of Data Analysts that work across our diversified business units. You will see yourself partnering with senior stakeholders, developing insights on the customer and the business, applying science to optimize customer experience and support the creation of data products to support internal stakeholders and our customers.

Working with your team

You will have direct accountability for the following, however not limited to:

  • Provide leadership, mentoring and development to the team
  • Engage with various senior stakeholders within the business as the Data Science champion, applying science to optimize business outcomes
  • Drive creation of data products to support internal stakeholders and customers
  • Oversee the construction and maintenance of financial models to assess the impacts of business pricing strategies
  • Develop and design new business models to inform business of better future outcomes (prediction, algorithmic, machine learning)
  • Proactively understand and provide insights to improve products, channels, customer experience

Our Ideal Person

The successful candidate will have a quantitative, advanced degree in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields. You will be an expert in leveraging analysis tools such as SQL, Spark, R, and Python.It is essential that you have extensive experience in building and leading a team focused on quantitative analysis and automating decisions.

When you join our team you\xe2\x80\x99ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

'

title: Data Scientist - Perm - Sydney
description:
b'My client is seeking a Data Scientist with at least 2-3 years of commercial hands on advanced analytics experience to be part of a very high performing team of analysts, data scientists, and consultants.\xc2\xa0

In this role, you will apply machine learning, statistics and advanced analytics concepts and models to extract insights from large datasets. You will be part of a growing team and contribute towards some really exciting projects.

Your responsibilities:
  • Explore large datasets, discover trends and patterns and extract insights \xc2\xa0
  • Apply Statistical/Machine Learning techniques to build data product and features.
  • Develop scripts to extract and analyze large data sets and build statistical models
  • Test and verify scripts and models to ensure accuracy of the results
  • Work with domain experts to validate and interpret findings

Your skills and experience:
  • Australian citizenship - Required. Due to the nature of the job and clients. If you are an Australian citizen, please mention in your resume.
  • Post graduate qualification in either of the following: Statistics/ML/Mathematics
  • At least 2-3 years of experience in a commercial advanced analytics and insights environment
  • Solid skills in SQL and R for data extraction and manipulation and to create reports and dashboards.
  • Skills in NLP, text mining, or network analysis - Highly Preferred
  • Passionate about Data science and what it can do
  • Great team player
  • Loads of enthusiasm!
'

title: BIG Data ETL Engineer with Java API & Python ETL integration
description:

This High profile and much respected employer of choice is growing and needs to find a talented Java & Python Data Engineer with ETL skills to assist the development and support team with a range of duties.

Core skills:
  • Solid \xc2\xa0Big Data background with Hadoop\xc2\xa0
  • Solid understanding and experience of ETL tools such as: Informatica, Erwin Ideally Talend
  • Solid programming skills using Python and Java Script ( Java API)
  • Can Do proactive collaborative attitude
\xc2\xa0
Working closely with the development team to ensure successful deployment from development to production environment for all change requests and big releases are delivered accurately and on time. This is a role in which you will grow and be challenged, giving you the opportunity to shine and develop your skills in a demanding but supportive environment
\xc2\xa0
This is a career making role for an ambitious Big Data ETL developer who has Java Scripts and Python specialist who is eager to prove him/herself.
Do you have what it takes to seize this challenge?
\xc2\xa0
Don't delay send your word formatted cv to me Ann Mansard on ann.mansard@ibitsolutions.com.au today! "

title: Big Data Developer
description:
b'
  • Permanent Role
  • Urgent Requirement
  • Excellent pay+ Super

About the company:

This leading IT consulting company with global presence is looking for a\xc2\xa0Big Data Developer & Designer who has at least 6+ years of hands on experience.

Job Location-\xc2\xa0Sydney, NSW

About the role:

  • Designing and developing high quality solutions
  • Working with key stakeholders internal and external
  • Understand their high level requirements
  • High-quality solution architecture and data architecture to meet business needs and requirements
  • Documented solution architecture and data architecture
  • Coordinate deployment and release planning activities
  • Work closely with other teams to develop and document solutions to problems.
  • Maintain and improve overall quality of the code base
  • Design and develop good quality code.
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle.
  • Ensure code is in compliance with specifications.
  • Excellent communication skill

To get successful in this role, candidate must have :

  • Strong experience in HDFS, MapReduce, Yarn, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Oozie, HBase.
  • Experience in writing Hive script, Pig scripts, Sqoop jobs, Oozie jobs to schedule Hadoop jobs.

  • Experience in processing unstructured, semi structured and structured data.

  • Experience in working on real time data ingestion using Spark streaming.
  • Experience in writing Scala/Python codes on top on Spark.
  • Experience in cloudera distribution.

If you are available to start immediately and meet the above requirements, apply online now or send your application to career@tectrix.com.au

'

title: Data Solutions Designer - Big Data
description:
b"
Data Solution Designer
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Are you a Data solutions expert?
\xe2\x80\xa2 Do you want to work for a market leader?
\xe2\x80\xa2 Do you want more then just a Job?
\xc2\xa0
This iconic and respected household name is growing fast. To meet with the ever-expanding data needs the Head of the Data needs a talented data solutions designer to be her go and right hand man/woman.
In this key role, you will be part of a close knit dedicated small team of industry professionals. This role is both technical and business facing. So, it is essential that you are a confident communicator who can easily understand business needs and talk in techie in non-techie language.
Your role will include:
  • Assess business functional and non-functional requirements and seeing these through to becoming fully technical solutions.
  • Insure that Solution Architecture, design the detailed solution design are suitably documented (High Level Design, Interface specs, Detailed design, Data flow diagrams, mapping documentation)
  • You will be involved implementing Data Model, and \xc2\xa0developing impact assessment, integrating internal and external data sources and making the data available for analytics and Business Intelligence reporting.
  • Work with the Architects to define design standards and drive continuous improvement of the solutions by finding innovative ways to ensure data quality and increase efficiency
  • Define and maintain overall quality of the code base framework.
  • Work with data developers for successful delivery of projects.\xc2\xa0
  • Perform code review and test solution outputs to ensure the build is as per the solution defined
  • Coordinate deployment and release planning activities
\xc2\xa0
Core skills required:
  • 5+ years of data warehouse experience designing and building data solutions using Core RDBMS technology such as Teradata, Oracle, etc and Big Data technologies such as Hadoop.
  • Extensive experience in ETL development and design. Should be technology agnostic and able to pick up a new toolset relatively quickly but expert-level proficiency in at least one- ELT tool - preferably Talend or Informatica.
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering or other technical discipline is essential
  • Knowledge of data modeling and understanding of different data structures - their benefits and limitations under particular use cases
  • Strong requirement analysis and communication skills and\xc2\xa0ability to act as technical point of contact interacting with Data developers, vendors, internal and external stakeholders
  • Experience in working within a Solution Delivery Life Cycle framework.
  • Familiar with version control systems like Git
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Considered advantageous but not essential
\xc2\xa0
  • Experience with AWS S3 and EC2 computing environment is a plus
  • Experience in agile development and continuous delivery processes.
  • Media experience highly desirable
Offering a highly competitive salary and other industry advantages, this dynamic and fast paced role will challenge and delight you, as well as see you finely hone and expand your skills.
\xc2\xa0
So, if it's a time for you to showcase your skills and you want to work for a company that is constantly evolving and that values its staff, this has to be your next career move!
\xc2\xa0To apply in total confidence, send your cv in WORD format together with your cover letter, to me Ann Mansard on ann.mansard@ibitsolutions.com.au today!
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
