title: BI Consultant - Large Datawarehouse and Big Data Environments
description:
b"Our client is seeking a well-rounded, BI consultant (multiple Business Intelligence tools) to join their team in Sydney on a permanent basis. They carry out big and complex technical projects for some of Australia's largest companies in a diverse range of industries from banking to retail to telecommunications. If you are interested in adding more exposure to big data (Hadoop, Spark, AI) and analytics to your personal skillset - this could be the perfect opportunity for you!


For this hire, we are seeking someone with a hands-on skill set in various Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing stacks (e.g. SAS / Power BI / Cognos / Tableau / Alteryx / Microsoft SQL / Oracle / Teradata environments) who is capable of working on large complex enterprise data projects.


Since the nature of projects will vary - it is essential you are comfortable working on relational / SQL-based databases, but be ready to train and get involved in new big data deployments and some analytics work as required. If you have been learning skills with technology such as; Apache Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Linux, Scala, NoSQL, D3.js, React.js, Apache Zeppelin, etc. in your own time or in recent roles, we would love to hear about it! \xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0
Requirements / skills you will bring to the table:

  • Strong SQL / RDBMS skills - understanding database concepts, joins, ETL, data structures, etc.
  • Business Intelligence, Reporting or Analytics work with the likes of; SAS, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, \xc2\xa0PowerBI,\xc2\xa0Qlikview, Tableau, Alteryx, etc.
  • Quick learner with new technologies and concepts - ideally an interest in big data or data science
  • Strong team-player mentality\xc2\xa0
  • Outstanding communication & stakeholder management skills\xc2\xa0
  • Please note - prior\xc2\xa0consulting experience is not mandatory, but we would be looking for a high degree of fit - such as some BA experience or 'internal consultancy' where you have done requirement gathering and direct management of stakeholders, etc.

Please Apply with your CV and a Cover Letter through the links below. "

title: BI/DW/Big Data Consultants
description:
b'Since 2008, Servian has been known to be one of Australia's leading IT and Data focused consultancies. We provide a wide range of technical services including Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Analytics, Digital and User Experience. We are leading a number of projects across several tier one clients across many industries such as Banking and Finance, Retail and Telcos. Due to our continued success, we have great opportunities for BI/DW specialists at all different levels to join our team to support us in this growth.

The Role
This is a great opportunity for those who are eager to diversify their technical ability as well as gain exposure to a number of industries. You will be working alongside some of the most talented technologists in the industry, who's thinking and experience has driven Servian's growth and success.\xc2\xa0

To give you an idea of the variety of work you could be involved with at Servian here are some of the technologies we work with:
    • Reporting: PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, Datameer, Microstrategy
    • ETL: Talend, SSIS, Informatica, Alteryx, Datastage, SAS
    • Big data: Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR, Kafka, Elasticsearch, NiFi
    • Analytics: Spark, R, Cassandra, Databricks
    • Database: SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, PostgreSQL, Greenplum
    • Programming Languages: Python, Java, Scala, PHP, .NET, Javascript
    • Frameworks and Architectures: : Lambda, ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, NodeJS
What we offer:
  • Multiple leading projects with first tier clients
  • Exposure to various technologies
  • 2 hour weekly training
  • Fun, social culture with regular social events
  • The opportunity to work alongside some of the most talented consultants in the industry
We have a very strong culture. To us work is something you should be proud to do and so our attitude is "Find a way to succeed" - so we look to bring on individuals that would complement this. If you are committed to succeed, then Servian will provide you with all the tools and support necessary to help you reach the next stage of your career.

Note:\xc2\xa0all candidates go through a strict problem-solving activity (case Study) before joining the company.

Send your CV in ASAP to have a chat with us! '

title: ELECTRICAL FOREMAN - COMMS AND DATA
description:
b"

COMMS AND DATA FOREMAN

STAR GROUP - STAR ELECTRICAL CO \xe2\x80\x93 COMMS AND DATA FOREMAN

Established in 1956, the Star Group is a privately owned organisation that specialises in electrical, data and communications services in construction, rail and infrastructure environments. Star Group is an industry leader that is passionate and committed to completing projects and services on schedule.

Star Group and its divisions prides itself on having an exceptional knowledge of electrical standards, safety, environment, quality and statutory requirements.

This position is essential for Technologies and Communications Division of Star Group, which reports into a project manager. The position requires licenced electrician with string communications and data experience and be able to lead team of licenced tradesmen and apprentices. Requires an assertive person who possess experience in commercial construction with high level of workmanship, excellent work ethic, initiative and experience in supervising crews.

Key Responsibilities of the position:

  • Provide on-site direction and leadership to crew in order to complete projects within specific guidelines that include quality standards, time requirements and adhere to all WHS regulations and expectations.
  • Provide guidance on communication and data technologies for the project where required.
  • Supervise crew and evaluate employees' progress and performance
  • Train new team members
  • Ensure toolbox meetings and pre-start meetings occur on project site
  • Comply with all WHS responsibilities and supervise staff to ensure that they work in safe manner.
  • Identify conflicts and resolve problems on site where the arise.
  • Liaise directly with the Project Manager and Clients where required.

Required qualifications and experience:

  • Strong electrical, communications and data experience in commercial construction (essential)
  • Managed crews that focuses on communications and data on projects.
  • Licenced Electrician
  • Able to communicate effectively in writing to complete reports and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with safety requirement and supporting crews with health and safety processes.
  • Able to identify problems early and find solutions. Be assertive and proactive to resolve problems efficiently.
  • Strong attention to detail.

Star Group is committed to ensuring that their employees have an opportunity to further develop themselves and their careers.

This is a salary position.

If you believe you are suited to this position and meet the above criteria please proceed to apply by providing a resume.

If you would like to know more about this position or apply by providing a resume, please email recruitment@star-group.com.au.

"

title: Data Analyst
description:
b'

Springer Nature is one of the world's leading global research, educational and professional publishers. Nature Research is a flagship portfolio of journals, products and services including Nature and the Nature-branded journals, dedicated to serving the scientific community.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our Nature Index team in Sydney.

The Nature Index is a database of high-quality research which tracks research output and collaboration by measuring the contribution of institutions using author affiliation information collated from primary research articles published in a select group of science journals. Providing a close to real-time indicator of high-quality research output and collaboration at the institutional, national and regional level, Nature Index tracks over 9,000 parent institutions and close to 50,000 child institutions worldwide. Data from over 58,000 natural science articles is added to the index each year, with a 12-month rolling window of data updated monthly and made openly available at the Nature Index website.

Reporting to the Data Product Manager and working within the global Nature Index team, the Data Analyst will be responsible for providing analytical support for all data-related aspects of Nature Index, including data development and enhancement, analyses for supplements and business development.

Key tasks include:

  • Data development \xe2\x80\x93 processing and optimizing data efficiency and quality, 'cleaning' raw data and employing efficient research and data mining strategies. Proposing solutions and strategies by troubleshooting.
  • Data Analysis - reviewing, analysing, interpreting and developing appropriate analyses to support data driven editorial projects, sales and marketing, and other related Springer Nature products.
  • Data Reporting - using various tools, including data visualisation to report results to a large variety of stakeholders.

You will need:

  • A postgraduate qualification in a scientific discipline, or experience related to large scale data analysis, or a degree in Computer Science or an equivalent discipline.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Technical expertise and knowledge in using analytical, data management and data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Excel, Access, Gephi, R, etc.) to analyse large data sets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of SQL or NoSQL data extraction and manipulation, and experience using JSON or XML data formats. Skills in one or more scripting languages would be beneficial (e.g. .net, Python, Visual Basic, R, etc.).
  • Ability to communicate and engage with a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams and to break down and explain complex results.
  • Strong critical thinking skills, with the ability to see the "big picture" while also diving into the details where necessary.
  • Prior experience in manipulating and analysing large and complex data sets and/or working in research or the scientific community would be advantageous.

Applicants should include a CV, a covering letter explaining their interest in the position.\xc2\xa0

Please note all applications must be submitted via the company website.

Closing date: midnight\xc2\xa0Wednesday\xc2\xa031 May.

'

The Masterfile team play an important role within our business and works closely with Category Managers, Suppliers and Marketing to maintain product details.

Required

  • Intermediate to advance Excel Skills.
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Well organised and able to develop your own processes on the job.
  • A problem solver who enjoys tracking an issue to its cause.

If this is the career opportunity you have been looking for please apply by clicking Apply below.

title: Head of Reporting - Global Technology and Data Agency
description:
b"

Do you want to join one of the most forward thinking Global Data and Technology Companies out there?\xc2\xa0 We are looking for a Head of Reporting to join the team.\xc2\xa0 This is a great opportunity to join us, work on leading clients and develop data driven marketing strategies, powered by a connected system of technology, tools, consultants and digital activation.\xc2\xa0

Annalect is the digital, data, technology and analytics division of Omnicom Media Group. We have provided data driven marketing solutions for marketing problems across the globe for over 5 years. In Australia, the company took on 4 of the OMG specialist agencies under its umbrella from January 1, 2016. These are:

  • Data, Analytics and Technology agency: Annalect
  • Mobile specialist agency: Airwave
  • Digital agency: Resolution Media
  • Programmatic trading agency: OMG Programmatic

Why you\xe2\x80\x99ll love us:

Our people are our priority. We believe well balanced employees are happy employees, and happy employees bring their A game to work. Join like-minded high achieving individuals and help us change the way Data, analytics and technology works.\xc2\xa0 We are talking\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Voted as the \xe2\x80\x9cSmart Data Agency Of The Year\xe2\x80\x9d by I-Comm in 2015.
  • We work in diverse, open office atmosphere where sharing ideas is encouraged.
  • It\xe2\x80\x99s a chance to work in a forward-thinking company that conceptualizes and builds awesome stuff out of technology.

Why we'll love you:

As The Head of Reporting, you will be responsible for driving and managing the highly data reliant and \xe2\x80\x98in demand\xe2\x80\x99 reporting team at Annalect. This role revolves around continuous improvement in data collection, governance, processing, and reporting. This person is someone who would take pride in their work around building a high-quality team where accuracy is paramount in what we do.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Champion Annalect\xe2\x80\x99s Reporting Offering to generate awareness, interest, and engagement across Omnicom Media Group agencies
  • Deliver on building a trusted partnership and maintain collaborative relationships with agency leadership and ensure delivery of high-value services.\xc2\xa0
  • Be responsible for client satisfaction and growth - measured by retention, upsell, and cross-sell opportunities.
  • Drive pricing strategies and roll out new reporting products with market feedback
  • Deliver data and reporting consulting services to Omnicom clients.
  • Engage and manage an off shore team, enhancing capabilities and capacity

Your background will include:

  • Strong background in delivering Sales, Sales Operations and Account Management services related to data and reporting in a marketing (preferably media) environment.
  • At least 2 years of Tableau Desktop experience required
  • Sound understanding of Power BI, Power Pivot, & data warehouse interrogation
  • Intermediate SQL and/or VBA knowledge
  • Advanced Excel skills with the ability to write, edit, and run macros, connect to data sources, and build pivot tables/reports
  • Experience querying, cleaning, joining, and working with large disparate databases to develop a single source of truth
  • Data warehousing and data management experience
  • An analytical/investigative mind with a customer centric outlook
  • Management experience at a senior level, overseeing a diverse group of project management and technical experts.
  • Basic knowledge of Python, R, or other programming languages highly regarded

If you are a passionate and driven individual who genuinely feels you could thrive in this role; and you have the experience and qualifications outlined above please apply\xe2\x80\xa6. we would love to meet you.

"

title: Computational Statistician | Data Science and Research Software Business
description:
b'

About Us

Displayr is a rapidly growing data science and research software business, headquartered in Sydney, with offices in the US and the UK. We develop and sell data science software, with our leading in-market product being the highly successful market research analysis software Q (www.qresearchsoftware.com) which continues to have a very strong revenue growth profile.\xc2\xa0 We are expecting considerable further growth from a new product Displayr, currently in beta release (www.displayr.com).\xc2\xa0

With our head office in Glebe, and working from a converted post-industrial warehouse, we have a relaxed, casual workplace culture with a start-up vibe.

About the Job

Reporting to the Team Leader of our Data Science team, you will be responsible for building high quality features for statistical analysis and communicating to users the benefits of using these features. Most of your work will be open-source.

Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

  • Creating analysis and visualization features for Displayr. Log in to www.displayr.com and see Insert > Analysis for the features currently developed, and https://github.com/Displayr for code. Most of this work is done in R, but C++, JavaScript/d3, and C# are also sometimes used.
  • Write blog posts describing how the analysis and visualization features work. See https://www.displayr.com/blog/.
  • Regression testing of code.
  • Documentation.

About You

  • A University Degree in a quantitative discipline eg. Statistics, Econometrics, Biometrics, Psychometrics, Marketing Science, ideally with First Class Honours or a Ph.D.
  • Strong understanding of statistical theory: statistical testing and computation.
  • Extensive experience writing code to implement statistical techniques in an industry or academic setting. The ideal candidate would have developed a highly used statistical package in R available in CRAN or GitHub.
  • Very strong written and strong verbal communication skills.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident.

This role is based in Sydney and relocation will not be offered at this point in time.\xc2\xa0

Benefits

We value and reward performance. This is a chance to work on a product that could revolutionise data analysis. Salary will be negotiable depending on experience, and will include base, super and share options.

To apply, please include a cover letter along with your resume.\xc2\xa0

'

title: Junior Data Scientist (Modelling, Insights & Data Science)
description:
b"Our client is an Australian market leader in suppling Data Analytics and Insights based solutions to the countries leading consumer based based businesses. They boast the industry's largest and most comprehensive consumer 'Big Data' sets which are leveraged to deliver a range of Customer, Marketing and Credit Risk driven statistical models. Employing the industry's brightest analytical minds they offer a hot bed for innovation and guarantee unparalleled opportunities for career development and growth.

Following the internal promotion of a valued team member a brand new position has been created for a Junior Analyst (Modelling, Insights & Data Science) to join the Sydney based team. With the key focus on leveraging strong SQL / SAS programming skills to manipulate data, uncover insights, and build statistical models the responsibilities of the role will include but not be limited to:\xc2\xa0
  • Engaging with internal stakeholders to consult around analytical project requirements, discuss methodologies, and negotiate deliverables.
  • Providing support to variety exciting stakeholder driven projects that could include; marketing campaign execution & optimization, customer insights analysis, statistical modelling, credit analysis, credit risk / scorecard modelling, product & portfolio analysis, digital / web analytics, data visualization / dash boarding, sales reporting & insights.
  • Leveraging your strong SQL, SAS or R data management skills you will extract, manipulate and merge large volumes data from a variety of complex data sources. Delivering against ongoing requests from the business for timely and accurate SQL, SAS or R data sets to support their strategic initiatives. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
The successful applicant will come with exposure to working in a data driven analytics environment, where analyzing and delivering insights from large data sets has been the key focus. You will be able to demonstrate:\xc2\xa0
  • Strong technical skills and experience (1-2yrs) using SQL, SAS or R to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R)\xc2\xa0
  • At least one year of experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data relating to; customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, risk reporting, risk analysis, statistical modelling, marketing mix modelling, credit analysis etc \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Strong attention to detail, work prioritization, and process improvement skills.
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as - Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Studies, Data Science, Computer Science\xc2\xa0etc.\xc2\xa0
  • A genuine interest in pursuing a career in Data Analytics / Data Scientist, implementing analytical techniques and concepts such as; marketing campaign analytics, customer insights analysis, customer propensity modeling (churn / acquisition / cross sell / up sell), segmentation analysis (cluster / basket), credit risk analysis, credit scorecard development, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, significance testing, decision trees, neural networks etc
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

As a junior SQL Customer Data Analyst the core responsibilities of your role will cover, but will not be limited to:\xc2\xa0
  • Engaging with stakeholders to consult around data fulfilment requirements, discuss approaches and negotiate timelines.
  • Leveraging your strong SQL, SAS or R data management skills you will extract, manipulate and merge large volumes data from a variety of complex data sources. Delivering against ongoing requests from the business for timely and accurate SQL, SAS or R data sets to support their strategic initiatives.
  • Provide support to variety of ongoing stakeholder driven initiatives that could include; marketing campaign execution & optimisation, customer insights analysis, statistical modelling, credit analysis, credit risk / scorecard modelling, product & portfolio analysis, digital / web analytics, data visualization / dashboards, sales reporting & insights.
The successful applicant will come with exposure to working in a data driven analytics environment, where analyzing and delivering insights from large data sets has been the key focus. You will be able to demonstrate:\xc2\xa0
  • Strong technical skills and experience (1-2yrs) using SQL, SAS or R to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R)\xc2\xa0
  • At least one year of experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data relating to; customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, risk reporting, risk analysis, statistical modelling, marketing mix modelling, credit analysis etc \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Strong attention to detail, prioritization, & process improvement skills.
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as - Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Studies, Data Science, Computer Science\xc2\xa0etc.\xc2\xa0
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

title: Senior Data Scientist / Machine Learning (Customer Marketing)
description:
b"Our client is an global market leader from within the Consumer and Commercial Insurance sector. They boast a well established and rapidly expanding analytics division, employing the industry's brightest analytical minds they offer a hot bed for innovation and offer unparalleled opportunities for career development and growth.\xc2\xa0Due to the ongoing success of the business a brand new position has been created for a Senior Data Scientist with exposure to Machine Learning to join the Sydney based team. With the key focus on delivering customer loyalty predictive modelling projects the responsibilities of this role will include:\xc2\xa0

  • Engaging with internal and external stakeholders to consult around analytical project requirements, discuss methodologies and negotiate deliverables.\xc2\xa0
  • Deliver a range of bespoke analytics projects leveraging techniques that may include; Customer propensity/regression modelling (churn, acquisition, cross sell), segmentation analysis (cluster),\xc2\xa0marketing campaign analytics, hypothesis testing, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, decision trees, neural networks, gradient boosting, etc.\xc2\xa0(requires SQL, SAS R or Python analyst skills).
  • Lead and support the development and implementation of continually improving machine learning models in Python to optimise the digital customer marketing strategy.\xc2\xa0
The successful applicant will come from a strong background working in a data driven insights and modelling environment and will be able to demonstrate:
  • Commercial Data Science experience\xc2\xa0building a range of\xc2\xa0statistical\xc2\xa0models relating to customer marketing strategy (Acquisition, retention, growth, cross sell, churn), customer segmentation, next best action, campaign analytics.
  • Experience building Machine Learning Models in Python.\xc2\xa0
  • Strong technical skills and experience using SQL, SAS, R or Python to extract, manipulate and merge large customer behavioural or transactional data set from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base, Python or R)\xc2\xa0
  • Exposure to Scala, Spark, Hadoop etc will prove highly advantageous.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Digital Analytics experience in Adobe Marketing Cloud or Google Analytics will prove highly advantageous.\xc2\xa0
  • A genuine passion to build a career in Data Science and Machine Learning, implementing analytical techniques and concepts such as; Customer propensity modeling (churn, acquisition, cross sell), segmentation analysis (cluster),\xc2\xa0marketing campaign analytics, hypothesis testing, credit risk analysis, credit scorecard development, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, decision trees, neural networks, etc.\xc2\xa0(requires SAS, R, Python, Scala, Spark etc)
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

title: Data Scientist (Marketing Mix & Econometrics)
description:
b'My client is a leading global media agency with one of the Australian markets most sophisticated and forward thinking data analytics divisions. Leveraging a cutting edge technology platform consisting of Spark, Hive, R, Python, SQL and Tableau they apply a broad range of Statistical (Data Science) techniques to optimise and visualise their clients strategic decision making processes around Media and Marketing spend. Due to the pending departure of a senior member of the team unique opportunity for an experienced Media Data Scientist has become available.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
As a Media Data Scientist (Marketing Mix & Econometric Modelling) the responsibilities of your role include but not be limited to;
  • Leading client engagements through a series of sophisticated Media/Marketing optimisation projects. Scoping out and defining project requirements relating to media strategy and marketing ROI optimisation.
  • Provide thought leadership and coaching around advanced statistical modelling techniques to develop sophisticated solutions that will optimise the clients Media/Marketing strategy (i.e. econometric models, marketing mix models, predictive models, response rate models, attribution models etc).
  • Ensure time and quality assurance is achieved against all competencies in R, Python, SQL or SAS where used to create and manipulate large and complex datasets ready for analysis.
  • Lead the client engagements when presenting the key insights and strategic recommendations that will ensure future business opportunities are identified and secured.\xc2\xa0
As the successful applicant you will come with at least 3 years of relevant experience delivering complex statistical analysis and models in a commercial environment. With a passion for advanced analytics you will be able to demonstrate;
  • Experience a range of building complex statistical models that may include Econometric Modelling, Marketing Mix Models (MMM), response rate models, attribution models, customer behaviour models, propensity models (acquisition & retention), customer scorecards, etc.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, R, SQL or SAS for creating and manipulating large and complex datasets.
  • Clear and confident communication skills with the ability to negotiate project deliverables and present data driven insights to a variety of stakeholder groups.
  • A strong academic qualification in a highly numerical discipline (i.e. Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering).
To apply please click on the link below or send your resume direct to ben@correlateresources.com '

title: Data Scientist / Statistical Modeller
description:
b"Our client is an Australian market leader in suppling Data Analytics and Insights based solutions to the countries leading consumer based based businesses. They boast the industry's largest and most comprehensive consumer 'Big Data' sets which are leveraged to deliver a range of Customer, Marketing and Credit Risk optimisation solutions. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

The successful applicant will come from a strong background working in a data driven insights environment and will be able to demonstrate:
  • Commercial experience\xc2\xa0building a range of\xc2\xa0statistical\xc2\xa0models relating to customer marketing strategy (Acquisition, retention, growth) or credit risk analytics (scorecard development and\xc2\xa0validation)\xc2\xa0
  • Strong technical skills and experience using SQL, SAS, R or Python to extract, manipulate and merge large customer behavioural or transactional data set from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base, Python or R)\xc2\xa0

title: Senior Data Governance and Reporting Analyst
description:
b"The role of Senior Data Governance and Reporting Analyst\xc2\xa0is accountable for the maintenance and strategic development of the data governance and system architecture.

YOU\xc2\xa0

To be appointed, you will have demonstrated:\xc2\xa0
  • Experience in development of operating models within investment management.
  • A high level of experience in front-office order management systems and the broader systems architecture interacting with them.
  • Understanding of best-practice in data governance frameworks and procedures.
  • Experience in strategic management of data and systems vendor relationships.
  • Experience in contemporary DevOps practices relating to architectural change and code release.
  • Broad familiarity with differentiated asset classes and associated financial instruments.
  • Appropriate tertiary qualifications

THE ROLE

\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure internal architecture is industry best practice and remains compliant with ongoing regulatory changes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continue to develop a robust governance framework to ensure future changes to data sets or systems are implemented with minimal operating risk and are well communicated\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure a clear set of design principles for ongoing internal systems development
\xe2\x80\xa2 Adherence and contribution to internal control framework to meet compliance policies and mitigate key risks within the team
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage internal queries to ensure data accuracy
Participate in development and maintenance of core processes and procedures covering the team functions
\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa2 Build and maintain effective relationships with external providers (including custodian / middle office provider, system & data vendors, auditors and member administration) with aim of achieving FSS business outcomes.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the management of vendors & service providers by monitoring agreed deliverables & timing, updating issue & open query logs and providing general feedback for regular review meetings.
Trouble shoot with various data providers ensuring high integrity/quality and accuracy of the data

Don't miss out on the best working environment in super industry! "

title: NA
description:
b'
Huawei Technologies is a leader in providing next generation telecommunications networks, and now serves 45 of the world's top 50 operators, along with over one billion users worldwide. The company is committed to providing innovative and customised products, services and solutions to create long-term value and growth potential for its customers. Globally Huawei has 150,000 employees, of whom 44% are dedicated to R & D. In line with our rapid growth within the South Pacific Region, we are seeking high calibre individuals to join us for mutual development.

For more information, visit us at: www.huawei.com/au/

\xc2\xa0
IT Data Centre Solutions Manager
\xc2\xa0

What we are looking for?

We are seeking an IT Data Center Solutions Manager\xc2\xa0to join our team in Sydney.

Position Summary:
This opportunity would suit a well-rounded IT Data Centre Solutions Manager with a solid understanding of Data Centre, Cloud and Server / Storage Solutions transformation. The role will bring technical depth and versatility and to be able to confidently discuss with and lead the customer's management and technical staff on all topics relating to Enterprise solutions.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities
  • The responsibility for yearly sales quota and delivering strong Data Center / Server / Storage Solutions Architecture to improve customer satisfaction and needs
  • Responsible for marketing insight ,developing and executing the strategy and sales growth initiatives for the IT DC / Server - Storage solutions.
  • Customer business strategy, understanding of customer requirements, and design Data Center solutions. Track the status of customer requirements for existing and future demands.
  • Participate in bidding, responsible for BOQ and SOC on the technical and commercial side.
Who are we looking for?

Key Skills required:
  • Minimum 5+ years commercial experience as an IT / Cloud - Data Center / Server - Storage Architect / Engineer and 2-3 years Pre-Sales activities
  • Strong communication skills and being able to develop strong customer relationship
  • Ability to work under pressure and the ability to solve problems while being a quick thinker & learner.
  • A good understanding of these industry sectors as you will receive the requirements from ISP, Education, Energy and some public industries such as Government and so on.\xc2\xa0
  • You will work as a senior product manager and you will be responsible for IT / Cloud - Data Center Solutions development in NSW \xc2\xa0
  • Your will be involved in Marketing and Branding
  • Strong communication skills in English and in Chinese (Mandarin)
Why work for us?
\xc2\xa0
You will be part of a global leading organisation which offers a range of career paths due to the diverse products and solutions offering. You will be contributing to a growing business which needs your energy and motivation.
\xc2\xa0
We have been operating in Australia since 2004 and now 50% of the population use Huawei for their telecommunications needs, where we are now the third biggest seller of smart phones and in the Enterprise space our leading solutions and services cover IP Network Infrastructure, Unified Communications and Collaboration, Cloud Computing and Data Centre.

Huawei Technologies (pronounced "WAH-way") is a $60 Billion global market leader in Telecommunication, with over 170,000 employees, 45% of whom work in R&D on which we spent USD$9.2 Billion in 2015. Ranked 129th in the Fortune 500 and one of Fortune's most admired companies in 2015, our revenue grew by over 35% last year.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.
'

title: NA
description:
b'

  • Macquarie Headquarters, 50 Martin Place
  • Newly created opportunity
  • Dynamic, innovative environment

Joining our Enterprise Data Management (EDM) team, you will work with a wide range of stakeholders across Macquarie's support groups and businesses to help our Risk Management Group continue to meet its Enterprise Data Management (EDM) obligations. This role focuses on our EDM data strategy and governance model, so your natural affinity to manage change and work within a project based environment will prove critical to success.

Key responsibilities of this role include ensuring compliance with Macquarie group wide policy, continuing to enhance the EDM framework and roadmap for our Risk Management Group, stakeholder management across various global locations, attending stakeholder meetings, ensuring EDM remains to have a consistent approach across Risk Management, and facilitating education and training across our core risk related business units.

You will be a self-starter with the ability to self-manage work load and deadlines whilst maintaining a high degree of accuracy and quality. This role will give you the opportunity to utilise your strong relationship management skills and natural flair in engaging with a broad cross-section of individuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential. An understanding of Enterprise Data Management and involvement in relatively large scale programs will be an advantage.

These opportunities do not present often. Macquarie is a merit based work place; accelerate your career with us.

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for assessing and monitoring risks across Macquarie. This includes market and liquidity risk, credit risk, compliance risk and operational risk. RMG personnel liaise closely with all operating areas to ensure risks are understood and properly managed.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

'

title: Data Centre Facilities Electrician / Shift Electrician
description:
b'

Fujitsu Australia and New Zealand is focussed on helping its customers with their digital transformation. Our people have access to significant resources to enhance their careers working with interesting technology, an energetic and agile working environment as well as opportunities to learn and grow locally and globally. We partner with our customers to consult, design, build, operate and support business solutions and are recognised as a supplier of choice for leading corporate and government organisations.

What's On Offer?

Fujitsu's Data Centre group operates 10 high-quality continuous-availability data centres nationally, with five primary sites located in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth.

The data centre group has a proud history of data centre design and continues to be at the forefront of innovation in data centre technologies. The services provided include:

  • 24x7 operational support
  • Specialised systems monitoring for mission critical systems
  • Batch Processing monitoring and management
  • Provision of off-site secure tape vaulting service

An opportunity exists for a Data Centre Facilities Electrician within our Greystanes Data Centre.

This is a 12 hour shift based role, as part of a rotating 24x7 roster.

Your primary function will be the ongoing management (monitoring and performance) of sub-contractors and large scale electrical and mechanical services infrastructure. Infrastructure will include all switch-gear, electrical distribution systems, diesel generators, fuel systems, chilled water systems, data hall cooling systems, fire detection and suppression systems and environmental monitoring systems.

You will coordinate all preventive and remedial maintenance, prepare documentation according to standard protocols, arrange approvals prior to any works commencing, and supervise all activities carried out by contractors ensuring at all times appropriate PPE and WHS standard are maintained and adhered to.

You will also monitor all building services, identify and resolve any issues within your scope or escalate to team leaders and services providers and follow up to resolution.

You will be part of a supportive and experienced team, in a challenging role that offers excellent career development opportunities.

What Do We Want From You?

Technical Competencies

  • Minimum 3 years' facilities management / shift electrician experience
  • Demonstrated technical skills and experience in supporting electrical and/or mechanical services infrastructure.
  • Electrical trade certification - nice to have
  • Ability to take initiative
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Current First Aid Certification or open to training in First Aid
  • Ability to work well in a team environment
  • Experience in managing maintenance contractors
  • Good knowledge of occupational health & safety and environmental work practices
  • Good understanding of building services and maintenance requirements.
  • Ability to identify risks and issues, and implement appropriate interim or permanent resolutions in a critical environment.
  • Skills in the use of Microsoft Visio would be an advantage

Non-Technical Competencies

  • The ability to develop and work well within a team.
  • Commitment to continuous improvement.
  • Polite, professional and well presented.
  • Effective communicator
  • Process and Procedural based work methods.
  • Ability to work unsupervised.

Location

Greystanes, NSW

"Fujitsu does not accept any unsolicited resumes from head-hunters, executive recruiters, or other staffing or recruitment agencies. Please do not submit or forward any resumes, CVs or profiles to the Fujitsu careers portal, nor to any Fujitsu personnel. Fujitsu will not pay any fees relating to unsolicited resumes."

NB: Applications will be reviewed prior to the closing date; which is dependent on the status of the recruitment process and is subject to change without notice.

'

title: Data Engineer, Data Modelling / Analytics, Exciting New Role, CBD, Flexible Hrs
description:
b"
Are you an experienced Data Engineer, looking for a role you can utilise your expertise and influence the methods of data modelling within an exciting organisation?\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Looking for a role you can really drive decisions on data tools, with the opportunity to work towards growing your own team?

\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
If this sounds like you, hit APPLY NOW

\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Who they are
An exciting CBD based firm with a focus on rich, 3D visual analytics. Working on an innovative product using cutting-edge technology, this team is rapidly growing both in Sydney and internationally.

The Data Analytics team enables their business to turn data into action. Using big data platforms, data warehousing and business intelligence technology, 3D data, advanced analytics, data science and visualisation, this team supports company efforts to transform how their customers conduct their business, driving efficiency at the forefront of their projects.


\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Who you are
You are an experienced Data Engineer with a strong passion for data and extensive experience of data tools. You'll be able to recognise business requirements and define and implement the correct tool to remodel data from the Data Warehouse.\xc2\xa0

You have previous experience connecting data sources to Amazon Redshift (Fivetran preferred). You will join the team at transformer stage and will work closely with the Data Scientist dissect\xc2\xa0the middle layer of data and provide data to the BI team.

Once the model is set up, your role will transition to engage with the machine learning team and you will have the opportunity to grow your team.\xc2\xa0

This role requires strong technical and communication skills, creativity and attention to detail, and experience managing data science projects from end-to-end (from use case definition to final product delivery).

The Data Engineer will be an innovative forward-thinker who will help lead end-to-end execution of data initiatives, mentor and direct junior data engineers, and contribute toward the end goal of the project. Communication and ability to work in a collaborative team environment are essential.

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
How to get this role
  • 3+ Years' Experience in Database heavy roles
  • Experience connecting data sources to Amazon Redshift (Fivetran preferred)
  • Experience cleansing and preparing large, complex datasets for analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management -\xc2\xa0ability to present complex information in a concise and compelling manner
  • Expertise applying statistics or machine learning in a professional or other intensive problem-solving environment with large, complex datasets
  • Familiarity with data visualisation tools, like Tableau
  • Self-starter with analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work autonomously, using own initiative
  • Experience across a range of data tools
  • Degree in related field beneficial
  • Ability to shift priorities effectively as business requirements change
\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
To apply, please submit your CV via the portal by clicking\xc2\xa0the\xc2\xa0APPLY NOW\xc2\xa0button below.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Kat Thow
kat@nbridgeit.com
0427 975 476

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
(Only applicants who are shortlisted will be contacted)\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
"

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
b'

Nasdaq is recognized around the globe as a diversified worldwide financial technology, trading and information services provider to the capital markets, with more than 3,500 colleagues serving businesses and investors from over 50 offices in 26 countries across six continents \xe2\x80\x93 and in every capital market.\xc2\xa0

Nasdaq has recently made a strategic decision to create an in-house Innovation lab as part of its business model to develop existing and new solutions based on deep data exploration, machine learning models, enhanced algorithm development, and innovative visualisation techniques.

Simply put, the Nasdaq Innovation Lab will be a Collaborative Practice Environment for engaging our staff, partners, clients and communities to create, test and prototype new product ideas using Data Science methods to reach our goals.

As part of this exciting Vision we are seeking a Data Scientist to join the team. This is a crucial role within the Innovation Lab as you will conceptualise the project problems and solution design, and work closely with the data handlers and visualisers in creating innovative data science solutions.

The use of machine learning and deep learning techniques will be key to creating innovation that is scalable, ethical and productive.

This role will be part of a larger picture responsible for helping transform Nasdaq into a business that truly innovates and competes on data and analytics.

To be considered for this key role your skills will include but not be limited to;

  • Extensive programming skills, preferably in different programming languages such as Python, R, Java, Ruby, Matlab, Pig or SQL.
  • Experience of Natural Language Processing; the interactions between computers and humans.
  • Machine learning: using computers to improve as well as develop algorithms.
  • Conceptual modelling: to be able to share and articulate modelling.
  • Statistical analysis: to understand and work around possible limitations in models.
  • Predictive modelling: most of the big data problems are towards being able to predict future outcomes.
  • Hypothesis testing: being able to develop hypothesis and test them with careful experiments.

Located in wonderful offices overlooking the Harbour Bridge and Opera House, Nasdaq offers an environment where you can truly make a difference. Yes, it is a challenging, dynamic international work environment which provides excellent career opportunities, a competitive salary, bonuses and a comprehensive benefits package.

Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, colour, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Data Insights Project Manager | Microsoft Australia
description:
b'Are you ready to seize an opportunity to drive leading edge technology solutions with the customer? Do you value deploying \xc2\xa0and working on the latest solutions with real world impact? Do you thrive by mentoring and leading by example? Would you love to help us accelerate the transformation towards data-driven organizations? Do you want to join an elite and distinguished team?
\xc2\xa0
The Project Manager is responsible for leading delivery of profitable and sustained high-quality Advanced Data Analytics and Data Platform related projects to Microsoft's enterprise customers in Australia. This position reports into the Data Insights practice lead - Asia Pacific and Japan.

Microsoft's Enterprise Services Delivery - Data Insights Domain is a global delivery practice of 1000 professionals who are exceptional services delivery professionals including engineers, consultants, project managers, architects and data scientists and it is the fastest growing practice within Enterprise Services. The Data Insights Domain helps customers realize their full potential through accelerated adoption and productive use of Microsoft Advanced Analytics technologies.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for leading delivery of data insights related projects in Australia and accountable for project profitability, revenue recognition and other delivery related financial metrics, customer satisfaction
  • Support pursuit lead(s), and at times lead, statement of work (SOW) writing during bidding.
  • Play key role in reviewing of effort estimation, delivery resource assignment, vetting of delivery resource capabilities according to SOW and commitment, reviewing key reusable IP if deemed fit, set up project governance structure and rhythm according to services delivery methodology.\xc2\xa0
  • Vet and review subcontractors and India offshore delivery capabilities. Manage subcontractors and offshore delivery resource during project delivery.
  • Responsible for customers satisfaction of projects delivery.
  • As this is a senior position, the candidate is expected to play a leading role of Australia delivery resource and bench management, deal structure and profitable delivery supervision, customer satisfaction
  • Engages with customers presales / business development situations where needed by sales and bidding team, representing Data Insights domain and capabilities and sponsoring our key Enterprise Services activities
  • For high profile data insights engagements, he/she will work closely with field sales, Australia local management and lead the shaping, packaging and delivery of innovative value propositions\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Education & Experience:
  • Preferably Master's degree (e. g. MBA, engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems management or Computer Science) or equivalent education
  • PMI certification is required.
  • Proven related experience (> 15 years) as IT Project Manager/Director or Consulting Practice Manager with very international large software or technology firms
  • Sound experience with different type of services contracts (especially fixed price contracts)
  • Proven track record of managing and delivery of very large consulting related projects and thorough knowledge and experience in managing Project Profit & Loss
  • Proven experience in managing very large consulting delivery projects in Australia
  • Sound Knowledge of IT related project management methodology (e.g. Agile, CRISP)\xc2\xa0
  • Solid background (> 5 years) of leading technology/solution/consulting presales from enterprise strategy, technology consulting, and large project implementations (> US$5M+ projects)
  • Proven experience in managing very large complex projects/client solutions delivery. Deep understanding of the latest technology offerings in the market (for example: mission critical applications development, ERP/CRM/HRM, database platform, business intelligence, enterprise data warehouse, technology stack migration, public cloud, machine learning, chatbots, artificial intelligence, predictive analytics)

Management Skills and Competencies:
  • Confidence, Impact and Influence, Interpersonal Awareness, Developing People, Optimizing Resources & Budgets, Setting Goals & Expectations
  • C-level interactions with customers\xc2\xa0
  • Capable of articulating Microsoft Consulting Services value proposition and business cases around IT trends and Microsoft solutions and technology stack.
  • Building and maintaining relationships with key customers and delivery partners
  • Analytical and thorough problem solving
  • High energy with a strong desire to aspire a team of delivery professionals. Strong in motivating and developing talents.
  • Risk management, ability to develop the insights foreseeing the risks of bids, project deliveries, and leading mitigation plans and landing them.
  • Strategic insight of the consulting business, what drives the growth initiatives, creates a compelling and actionable growth plan in business/people, landing the plan and delivers measurable progress and quantifiable business results that are aligned with the overall subsidiary growth plan and annual P&L budget.
  • Very strong in cross-team and virtual team collaboration: with other subsidiary departments, across Australia, Hong Kong and Taiwan, India and also with Asia Pacific and Japan teams.
  • Demonstrated ability to make timely, sound decisions based upon a mixture of analysis, acumen, experience and judgment. Ability to make decisions with potentially incomplete data and conflicting views under tight deadlines.\xc2\xa0
  • A dynamic "get-it-done," results-oriented perspective with large initiative/project-based leadership experience\xc2\xa0
  • Key agent of driving change\xc2\xa0
  • Value selling
  • Very strong English (oral and written) and confident to handle C-level communications: presentations, proposals, and project steering committee meetings

This role is hired as a 12 month contract. We can offer a flexible working day based in our award winning offices, using state of the art activity based working facilities. '

title: Data Analytics Consultant
description:
b'

Join an exciting Data transformation from traditional BI reporting to Advanced Analytics. Looking for open minded and forward thinking individuals.

Role:

Working for a leading Australian Insurer you will be working as part of a newly structured Analytics and Data team. Responsible for data management and insights across all business units you will accountable for assisting the firms transition from traditional BI reporting to Advanced Analytics across the next 2-3 years. As an experienced Analyst or Engineer you\xe2\x80\x99re intensely curious and continually exploring new ideas to understand business trends.

Look for candidates with a strong understanding of Business Intelligence and some exposure to new technologies such as Big Data or Machine Learning. Passion for data science is key!

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the entire data pipeline from warehousing to visualisation, our team is trusted to provide insight into all aspects of business performance as well as analysing strategic opportunities.
  • Build relationships with internal customers to understand requirements, identify patterns/behaviours using complex data models and communicate their findings through interactive reports and presentations.
  • Design complex and enriched data models
  • Explore hypotheses/trends by applying statistical analysis methods
  • Share knowledge and coach other team members
  • Develop new dashboards and self-service reporting
  • Maintain periodic performance reports
  • Maintain data warehouse integrity and performance
  • SQL development to design stored procedures, functions, tables, views and triggers

Requirements:

  • Minimum 3-5 Years experience as Data Analyst, BI Analyst or Analytics Analyst/Consultant
  • Strong proficiency with SQL, R, Python and Tableau
  • Experience building statistical analysis and predictive models
  • Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as economics, statistics or maths.
  • Innovative and open mindset
  • Want and lust to work in Data science is key!

To apply please click apply or call Stefan Kovacevic on 02 8289 3100 for a confidential discussion.

'

title: Data Engineer - Sydney - Python/Java - AWS

title: Solution Architect | Big Data Engineering | Strategic role |
description:
b"Seeking a dynamic Solution Architect to join a leading Australian Enterprise client and become an integral player in the Data Engineering team. The Solution Architect / Designer will play a critical role in defining the future state data management capability being built on Big Data capabilities like Hadoop & NoSQL databases as well as by leveraging traditional DW technologies where applicable.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

The candidate filling this role is expected to take the lead in gaining a technical understanding of Big Data technologies and in particular, gain working technical knowledge of managing massive volumes of data leveraging Hadoop, Spark and Talend.

This role is a strategic role and will be working closely with senior management and business stakeholders. This role offers an excellent salary package along with an excellent investment into the chosen candidates long term career.


Key Career experience:\xc2\xa0
  • Minimum 5 years of experience creating Data Marts / DW architectures,
  • Hands-on experience working in across Big Data Engineering platforms.
  • Experience delivering against long-term, strategic technology roadmaps
  • Success leading multiple projects using the Agile methodology
  • High accountability with a demonstrated ability to deliver
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and concisely ideas (both verbally and in writing) to executives and technologists

  • Work closely with the project teams as outlined in the Agile methodology \xc2\xa0providing guidance in implementing solutions at various stages of projects
  • Roll up your sleeves and work with project teams to support project objectives through the application of sound architectural principles

If this role is of interest then please contact\xc2\xa0Gino Lancaster on 0401 735 235 for a confidential chat.\xc2\xa0

Data Talent Australia is one of the leading Data Engineering recruitment partners working with a range of Innovative Organisations across Australia

If you are currently looking for a new opportunity across Data Engineering and Insights & Analytics in Australia then visit www.datatalent.com.au\xc2\xa0

title: Big Data Developer
description:
b'Opportunity for a Big Data Developer to work on a greenfield project (Kafka, Google Cloud, Java) to take this leading global high frequency trading company\xc2\xa0that operates within the sporting industry as they move to a new level of technology.

The Role

This role will be instrumental in the building and ongoing growth of a new cloud based data solution focused on the extraction of structured data from both commercial and publicly available sources and making it available for analysis by the R&D team and to the modelling systems.

This role will join a newly formed small team and become an expert in the data extraction platforms, being able to write code for such platforms as well as the data itself and the data sources used.

You will manage a pipeline of new data projects and report regularly on progress, and reduce lead-time in the creation of Production data system.

Primary Skills\xc2\xa0
  • Extensive experience with developing applications in Java\xc2\xa0

  • Experience with cloud data services (Google, AWS, Azure) highly desirable

This role offers the opportunity to build from scratch a high performing leading edge platform to take this highly successful business to the next level.\xc2\xa0

title: Clerical - Data Entry - Administration
description:
b'

Shutters Australia and Inwood Blinds, an industry leader in the manufacture and installation of Shutters, Blinds and Awnings, seek a confident energetic person to join our team at our Castle Hill head office.

As part of a small team in\xc2\xa0our successful home improvements retailing and manufacture business, our administration department is dedicated to Customer Service and Excellence.

The primary role\xc2\xa0is Order Processing/Purchasing, Data Entry and Banking.\xc2\xa0General office duties, telephone support,\xc2\xa0stock ordering, accounts checking and payment preparations are also part of the duties.

The role will require you to have a pro-active approach to tasks, providing excellent service as well as having a fantastic "can do" attitude that will enable you to be inventive and work on your own initiative.

\xc2\xa0The main duties and responsibilities of this role will include:

  • Process customer orders ensuring pricing and codes are correct
  • Process invoices and payments correctly
  • Manage order changes and pricing
  • Provide fast and accurate response to the inquiries made by customers or sales team
  • Handle enquiries calls

  • Liaising with internal and external customers
  • Update and record customer inquiries, appointments, or any other relevant customer information in the databases

\xc2\xa0Skills & Experience

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Previous experience working within a small / medium environment
  • Experience using CRM / Databases
  • Exceptional customer service skills
  • High attention to detail
  • A proactive approach in dealing with tasks
  • Ability to handle pressure
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Outstanding organisational skills and ability to prioritise tasks efficiently
  • MYOB
    • Proficient use of Microsoft Office & Excel spread sheets.
  • Ability to learn quickly

\xc2\xa0Full time position,\xc2\xa0 Monday \xe2\x80\x93 Friday 9am-5pm.

\xc2\xa0$30k-$39k

'

title: Account Executive - IT Maintenance Solutions
description:
b"

Are you a talented and successful sales professional looking for your next challenge? Join Data#3 and take your career to the next level by selling our innovative solutions and being involved in our clients' strategic projects.

Data#3 Limited (DTL) is an ASX listed company that provides market-leading business technology solutions in a Hybrid IT environment from on-premise to outsourced to cloud across a wide range of industries throughout Australia and Asia Pacific. We are a tier-1 partner of global hardware and software vendors and one of Australia's leading systems integrators.\xc2\xa0We are one of Australia's best employers and most admired companies.\xc2\xa0We won Australia's Best Company in the 2016 Employer of Choice Awards\xc2\xa0for the Human Resources Director (HRD) Magazine.

We are currently seeking a seasoned, energetic and driven Account Executive\xc2\xa0to work with our IT Maintenance Solutions team.\xc2\xa0

At Data#3, we offer more than just straightforward IT maintenance and support services. Our dedicated team works as our client's technology partner, delivering proactive and predictive maintenance services to help optimise productivity and mitigate risk across their IT infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

  • Direct and drive sales growth
  • Attain sales revenue and profitability objectives by developing new business
  • Manage existing accounts and drive key account sales
  • Develop and ensure implementation of business plan and sales strategy
  • Prepare and present accurate forecasts, tracking and sales plans
  • Cultivate close working relationships with organisational stakeholders to help identify and address all product issues, including quality, delivery and design
  • Maintain sufficient activity levels to build pipelines and achieve the annual sales target

The experience and qualifications required for this role are:

  • Over 5 years in successful technology sales with a proven track record of attaining targets
  • Strong sales and relationship building skills with a proven track record in negotiating and closing sales in assigned territory
  • Experience in selling at the senior stakeholder level
  • Excellent written, presentation, and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to present technical concepts and business solutions clearly through demonstrations and proposals
  • Self-motivated, able to problem solve and work with limited supervision
  • Strong experience in the government and education sectors are desirable
  • Experience in maintenance services sales would be looked upon favourably

Don't miss this great opportunity to join one of Australia's leading companies and be part of an organisation that truly supports its sales teams.

Send in your application if you are a strong match to the requirements. Please note that only candidates with valid work rights and who match the selection criteria will be shortlisted and contacted.

"

title: Product Data Assistant
description:
b'

Product Data Assistant

CSR Lightweight Systemsis the Australian market leader in the manufacture and distribution of Gyprock\xe2\x84\xa2 plasterboard, Cemintel\xe2\x84\xa2 Fibre Cement and Ceilector\xe2\x84\xa2 ceiling systems, for use in a wide range of residential and commercial construction applications.

Our Gyprock business is one of Australia's most trusted brands, manufacturing the highest quality gypsum based products such as Plasterboard, Cornice, Compounds, Adhesives and associated finishing materials and accessories.

The opportunity!

We currently have an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic Product Data Assistant to join our team based in Wetherill Park, though there is the opportunity to base yourself closer to home.

This will be a highly rewarding role for someone who is passionate and eager to develop their skills and take the next step in building a career. You will work with us to keep data purity in our SAP system, ensuring it is up to date and the data is where it needs to be.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Assist with the maintenance of our Gyprock products and accessories to ensure that SAP data is current and accurate;
  • Assist the Category Manager with product related projects and enquiries;
  • Work with the Inventory and distribution teams to resolve product or price related issues;
  • Assist and collaborate with stakeholders to streamline and improve methods of managing, categorising and reporting on products and inventory;
  • Support the range review process including the preparation of documents and comparison and analysis of vendor submissions.

What will make you an excellent fit for this role?

  • A combination of excellent communication skills, strong organisational and analytical abilities;
  • Self-motivation and enthusiasm to get involved in all aspects of the role;
  • The ability to work autonomously as well as part of a wider team;
  • Solid PC skills and proficiency in MS Office;
  • SAP experience is essential;
  • Most importantly, a vibrant and enthusiastic personality!

What\xe2\x80\x99s in it for you?

This is a great opportunity to increase your skills with SAP and eventually move into analytics; you will also be rewarded with a fantastic salary package inclusive of 12% Super + leave loading.

We also have a strong commitment to our people at CSR and you will be exposed to a number of training programs to assist with your personal growth and development.

Apply online today! Or for more information please visit www.csr.com.au ; www.gyprock.com.au or contact Scott Wastell \xe2\x80\x93 CSR Recruitment Business Partner via email swastell@csr.com.au.

Please do not send applications via email.

CSR has a strong commitment to workplace health and safety. Successful applicants will be required to complete a pre-employment medical which includes a full drug and alcohol screen.

'

title: Data Analyst
description:
b"

My client is a US giant with a growing presence in APAC. Headquartered in Canberra with 11 other sites nationally, they are integrating 2 key applications into the business.

The organisation has an excellent opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the infrastructure team in Mascot on the integration of two aviation solutions into the infrastructure. The primary role of this position operating under general direction from the solution vendors and the Head of IT is to provide key support in the migration, testing and maintenance of large sets of restricted and controlled data.

You'll be working closely and effectively across the infrastructure and applications team to deliver consistent integrated services and solutions which can be replicated in growing regions and which contribute to improving processes and systems. There will also be some production and management of customised database solutions. This role could move into a more client facing and training on how to use the data and associated software.

Skills and Capability Requirements:

  • At least 3 years experience as a Data Analyst collating, cleaning, testing and manipulating data \xc2\xa0
  • Very strong Analytical and customer facing skills
  • Strong SQL and development of importing SQL scripts are essential
  • The ability to self-manage and take ownership of the project from end-to-end
  • Experience in deploying web applications with SQL and IIS
  • Provide a key role in supporting and partnering the business in all data driven initiatives
  • Design and support data analyses to derive meaningful insights
  • Importing, cleaning, transforming, validating or modelling data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making purposes
  • Technical expertise in data models, database design development and data mining
  • A relevant tertiary degree
  • Highly effective written and oral communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Experience in data analysis and data mining techniques.
  • Exposure to data governance, data management and development processes

This opportunity is only available to Australian Citizens. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

"

title: Senior Segment Manager (SME)
description:
b'
  • ASX Top 20 Organisation
  • Sydney or Melbourne CBD location
  • Permanent Full Time opportunity

\xc2\xa0

About IAG

At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:

  • #Proud to be me \xe2\x80\x93 we value difference, not sameness
  • #Together \xe2\x80\x93 harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to bring our best for our customers & each other
  • #No boxes \xe2\x80\x93 it's not about labels, boxes or categories, rather it's about building a diversity, inclusion & belonging mindset into everything we do

In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.

The Role

This role leads a team of two Segment Managers to effectively work across the broader Australian Brand Divison Marketing and Brand team and Customer Labs. The key goal for the role is to develop and implement innovative marketing campaigns, leveraging data, customer analytics and digital capabilities to drive profitable growth. In addition, you will:

  • Establish and drive relationships within IAG marketing communities, in line with overall company strategic direction
  • Inform and update National Marketing and Brand Manager on the development and execution of SME Segment Strategies, reporting success metrics and escalating potential risks
  • Drive innovation for SME Segment around new industry partnerships, new product solutions and new go-to-market approaches
  • Collaborate and develop media mix strategies to reach target customers
  • Build an increased capability of marketing analytics to enable SME knowledge, insight efficient campaign measurement and target profitable customer segments

These are the essential skills and experience we're looking for

  • 7+ years in a B2B or B2C marketing or communication role and strong knowledge of digital marketing in a B2B environment
  • Demonstrated and comprehensive working knowledge of, above and below the line marcomms, channel communications and brand management
  • Experience in designing /implementation of marketing strategies
  • Strong key stakeholder management capabilities and excellent influencing skills
  • Experience in both above the line and below the line marketing
  • Financial services and commercial insurance industry experience (desired)

How to Apply

To submit your interest in this role, please click the \xe2\x80\x98Apply' button below or contact Kai Wong on (03) 8630 1833 for a confidential discussion. For more exciting careers at IAG, visit our website

title: Pre-sales Architect
description:

Client

Our client delivers platform solutions data visualization and data analytics applications with thousands of clients globally.

developing and growing the technical, demo, commercial and messaging skills with pre-sales and business analysts within the key focus solution provider, consulting & services partners

Training will be provided on the products. The role will be based in Sydney covering Australia and New Zealand to support the partners and occasionally client meetings expected.

Interested? Please hit APPLY. Alternatively, you may send your CV across to Ellen - Ellenor.terrado@ajilon.com.au
