title: Advanced Analytics Manager, 12 month Contract/Secondment, Sydney NSW
advertiser: Commonwealth Bank  Institutional Bankin g & Markets
description:
b'

Advanced Analytics Manager

At CommBank, we never lose sight of the role we play in other people\xe2\x80\x99s financial wellbeing. Our focus is to help people and businesses move forward, to progress.

Your Business:

Institutional Banking and Markets is responsible for managing the Group\xe2\x80\x99s relationships with major corporate and government clients and institutional investors, and provides a full range of capital raising, transactional and risk management products and services. Our purpose is to enhance our clients\xe2\x80\x99 success through market-leading capabilities and unique insights. It\xe2\x80\x99s part of our DNA.

Your Team:


The Strategy & Operation team supports IB&M strategic priorities and encompasses four distinct functions: Strategy, Business Support, Portfolio and Client Analytics, and the Innovation Lab.

Your impact & contribution:
Provide targeted and timely analytics to help frontline teams understand their customers, anticipate their needs, and tailor solutions/offers to match those needs. Development and embedding analytical sales tools to empower frontline teams with unique actionable insights and innovative solutions for customer retention, needs identification and acquisition opportunities. Provide both tactical and strategic analytical and segmentation support to help IB&M and B&PB businesses identify opportunities, risks and productivity improvements.

Your responsibilities:

Seeking a highly proficient Predictive Modeller/ Data Scientist to join the Advanced Analytics & Modelling team that focus on implementing advanced modelling and segmentation technique to exploit CBA\xe2\x80\x99s data asset and to create industrialised analytics solutions. With the focus on moving towards a big data platform, we are seeking an experienced predictive modeller to help build a library of analytics models and improve the overall capture and streamlining of data. Specific responsibilities include:

  • Employ advanced statistical analysis to answer high-impact business questions and extract relevant and actionable insights capturing strategic and advantageous value.
  • Deliver innovative analytics-driven products and services that help our clients run their business better.
  • Develop concepts/prototypes to test/validate the insights value from client perspective.
  • Transform data/information into actionable insights.
  • Implement advanced modelling and segmentation technique to exploit CBA\xe2\x80\x99s data asset and to create industrialised analytics solutions.
  • Leverage the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s big data platform and open data to identify new business opportunities and unique insights for internal and external clients. This also includes analytics and data discovery to support \xe2\x80\x9ctest and learn\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cR&D\xe2\x80\x9d initiatives.
  • Design, develop and maintain analytical models (predictive, segmentation, profiling etc.) to optimise insights \xe2\x80\x93 This also includes complex behaviour and descriptive analysis/segmentation to help formulate/support business strategies.
  • Ongoing generation of leads to support retention, cross-sell and acquisition activities.

Your experience and qualifications:

  • 2+ year experience in relevant industries (e.g. Financial Services, Insurance, Marketing, Tech etc.)
  • Advanced statistical modelling skills \xe2\x80\x93 Regression, GLM, Data Mining, Time- Series, etc.
  • Familiar with statistical software and programming \xe2\x80\x93 R, Python, Java, SAS, Pig and SQL.
  • Good understanding of Hadoop, Hive and/or MapReduce.
  • Ability to communicate and present data findings to all audiences.
  • Familiar with machine learning, feature extraction, signal processing classification, regression algorithm and statistics.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills

Please apply online to be considered for this role. Have a question about your application, our process or what happens next? Click here for some of the most commonly asked questions about applying for a role at CommBank.

'

title: Business Analyst - FMCG & Retail Experience
description:
b"

GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) is a science-led healthcare company, with a proud history in Australia dating back to 1886. Our mission is to improve the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer. Preventing and treating disease is challenging and inspiring work. We support, develop and reward the people that make-up our talented workforce.\xc2\xa0 Our diverse business is made up of three distinct areas: Pharmaceuticals (including vaccines), Consumer Healthcare (household names such as Panadol, Voltaren and Sensodyne)\xc2\xa0and poppies for medicinal alkaloids.

GSK Consumer Healthcare is at the beginning of an exciting journey.\xc2\xa0 We're bringing together the legacy businesses and product portfolios of two great companies \xe2\x80\x93 GSK Consumer Healthcare and Novartis Consumer Healthcare \xe2\x80\x93 to form the world's largest manufacturer of OTC products, with our products reaching over a 1 billion consumers.\xc2\xa0 We're passionate about building the world best Fast Moving Consumer Healthcare company with a focus on quality, backed by science.

We are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to assist Grocery and Pharmacy team in hitting KPI's through the provision of analysis, insights and recommendation, using Nielsen, Aztec and IMS data. Candidates with FMCG and Retail\xc2\xa0experience in a similar role\xc2\xa0are encouraged to apply.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Partner with Pharmacy & Grocery Sales teams to provide accurate, timely and robust IMS & Nielsen standardised reporting & analysis to track performance internally and externally (sales, market share, distribution, promotions)
  • Act as a super user for IMS, scan, and loyalty data, and ensure it is fully utilised within the business
  • Lead partnership with global analytics team, local IT & potential external providers such as Mercurial to explore best in class data consolidation tools/reporting availability to improve data capability in the business
  • Provide data analysis during planning and post launch of NPI projects across both channels
  • Develop best in class promotional analysis & recommendations for priority customers across grocery & pharmacy
  • Lead the presentation and discussion of performance at Grocery/Pharmacy team meetings
  • Direct involvement in internal planning meetings, and unique brand projects
  • Train & embed Pharmacy interns with the delivery of monthly maintenance of IMS, customer meetings & day-to-day data provision for the pharmacy team
  • Coach and mentor Pharmacy & Grocery interns to develop analytics capability annually
  • Partner with Head of Sales, Head of Channels & Head of Operations when analytical support is required
  • Provide analytical support to the Account, Brand, Category, Demand & Finance teams for the core commercial cycle and price increase process as required
  • Support Market Analytics Lead with establishment of annual IMS data contracts and day-to-day management of IMS through fortnightly WIPs that cover data integrity queries, data sources/services available and company-wide training

You will have proven understanding of account management, negotiation and the Australian retail market. You will have strong analytical skills and the ability to turn data into insights and finally into action. You will demonstrate business maturity in the ability to protect the interests of GSK while ensuring a win across the business. If you are a proven winner with fantastic commination styles and great interpersonal skills, we want to hear from you.

Please apply online. GSK does not accept applications from third party channels.

*LI-GSK

"

title: Business Development Manager
description:
b"

Backed by over 70 years of experience, STULZ is a global provider of innovative data centre cooling solutions and services for mission critical facilities such as computer rooms, data centres, telecommunications, medical, industrial and many other applications. Our equipment is developed and manufactured in Germany, to the very highest standards of quality and includes room cooling, chillers, air handling units, adiabatic cooling, micro and modular data centres. We also offer to the local market customised containment/racks and environmental monitoring solutions.

As we continue to grow and invest in people, a new role has been created for a Business Development Manager to join our company.

Reporting\xc2\xa0to our National Business Development Director, this role will improve the company's market position and achieve financial growth through; existing and new\xc2\xa0customer relationships, identifying\xc2\xa0business opportunities and\xc2\xa0negotiating\xc2\xa0and closing business deals.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Qualify leads, pitching and presenting to customers
  • Develop strong, multi-level relationships within customers within your nominated portfolio.
  • Foster professional relationships with key decision makers
  • Achieve\xc2\xa0growth through agreed growth strategies
  • Tender management - Prepare and present technical and pricing proposals to key stakeholders and Negotiate\xc2\xa0tenders
  • Identify\xc2\xa0market opportunities to generate new business

To be successful in this role, you will have;

  • Knowledge of various infrastructure used in the ICT industry
  • The ability to provide multi-product technical solutions and prepare winning sales proposals that meet customer expectations
  • Professional presentation skills with solid business acumen
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and relationship management skills to complement a strong understanding of sales concepts and techniques
  • Extensive knowledge of current market environment
  • Strong administrative and organisational ability
  • A Driven, proactive attitude and approach

This position is ideal for someone looking for a long-term career with a reputable, growing, privately-owned company with an amazing\xc2\xa0culture that; supports, excites and inspires you!\xc2\xa0

In addition, we offer a\xc2\xa0competitive salary package that includes\xc2\xa0attractive incentives and\xc2\xa0car allowance as well as\xc2\xa0ongoing training and development.

"

title: Strategic Workforce Planning Analyst
description:
b'

Client:

This leading industry financial services organisation has a demonstrated history of success, with a strong focus on hiring high performance individuals. The team prides itself on having a collaborative, sociable culture and offers excellent career development opportunities as well as offering flexible working arrangements.

Role:

This role was newly created to provide workforce planning and deliver strategic insights based on the data across Australia and leading edge analysis techniques. The team aims to maximise business success by improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the workforce while identifying both customer trends and market opportunities. The role will include advanced analytics and data modelling across a number of areas.

Essential Skills & Criteria:

  • Great communication and negotiation skills
  • Experience in financial services and/or workforce analytics
  • Sound stakeholder management experience
  • Extensive knowledge of data extraction and analysis - SQL is essential

The team are looking for someone ideally with retail banking experience. This role presents an exciting opportunity for a strategic thinker who is keen to take their next step in a progressive financial services organisation. title: Principal Business Analyst, Balance Sheet Management, Treasury & Finance...
description:
b"

The Balance Sheet Control team is the gateway for Treasury business providing data that enables the company to report on its financials, largely for regulatory reporting requirements. This role is to work in a team to provide a range of analytical support to project initiatives. This will involve analysis of new requirements, identification of potential solutions, UAT testing, new report development, and adhoc analytical requests relating to the project deliverables and benefits.



\xc2\xa0
Major Accountabilities of Position
  • As a Principal Business Analyst in the Balance Sheet Control team your role will focus on data analytics and production of requirements and recommendations using, SQL, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
  • Through your analysis, you\xe2\x80\x99ll identify issues and opportunities relating to the performance of the Balance Sheet Control project initiatives. Your analytical input will contribute to the success and realisation of project benefits.
  • Develop a detailed understanding of the Treasury Data Management Framework encompassing business areas and the underlying systems and data. Make recommendations to improve analytical techniques and resolve data integrity issues.
  • Work with the team to enhance quality and value of the data and increase analytic skills of the team. Provide support, direction, strategic and operational planning, team building, service and performance analysis including problem resolution
  • Your projects and tasks will fall into the following areas:
  1. Data and systems analysis \xe2\x80\x93 Extraction and cleansing of data from group data warehouses including a good understanding of the underlying source systems. The role will involve solving data integrity issues, maintaining metadata and contributing towards data simplification and consolidation initiatives.
  • New / Enhanced Source Feeds - Replacement of existing feeds that don't meet Treasury SLA's.
  • CDM (common data model) Consolidation - Consolidating LR/ LRS tables & redesigning CDM layers.
  • QRM (quantitative risk management) application & interface upgrades
  • QRM liquidity scenario analysis
  • New Reporting and workflow
  • Testing \xe2\x80\x93Preparation and execution of UAT tests, plans and scripts, identification of issues, reporting, running of testing tools and liaison with the business. Raising any defects found during testing and escalating in accordance with set procedures. This role will also involve liaising with IT and the project team to ensure that planned testing meets their requirements.
    Required Knowledge, Skills and Capabilities:

    • Strong understanding of banking and financial systems
    • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
    • Advanced technical knowledge of SQL, Excel with VBA and experience in other Microsoft Office applications.
    • Treasury experience would be preferred
    • Banking experience (esp. Treasury) is ideal
    • Min 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in a similar role
    • Good written and verbal communication skills
    • Experience working according to Agile / Scrum principles preferred
    • Information Technology / Computer Science
    • (Maths/Statistics/Quantitative/Business/Finance) or equivalent business experience
    • interpersonal skills that enable you to work with people at all levels, motivate others and change people's attitudes when necessary;
    • written and spoken communication skills that allow you to inform and advise others clearly;
    • problem-solving and negotiation skills;
    • initiative and the ability to offer new ideas;
    • organisational and planning skills to manage your time and to meet deadlines and objectives;
    • good time-keeping skills to enable you to effectively manage training schedules\xc2\xa0

    Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility.

    \xc2\xa0


    \xc2\xa0

    • "

title: NA
description:
b'

What is this client and role about?

My client is one of the most successful software fintech\xe2\x80\x99s in Australia. Their success comes from building the first and only sophisticated cloud solution to automate highly complicated financial services funds management functions. Their products have transformed an industry.

As part of their ongoing expansion, they are now looking to hire a technical leader for the build of a greenfield automated and AI driven Data Feeds product. In this role, leading a Scrum team you will oversee the transition from the existing data feeds solution to the new solution which will be designed and built by your team. This is a genuinely diverse role (designer, coder, leader and BA) which will include:

  • Team and technical leadership
  • Circa 50% coding (mostly complicated back-end C# and SQL)
  • Be heavily involved in the design of the new product
  • Leading the build and integration of the new product
  • Overseeing modification and enhanced features for the existing data feeds solution.

The right culture and fit?

The developers at our client are passionate, committed, logical, considered, calm, thoughtful, curious and analytical. They know they are good and this is reflected in quiet confidence, completely devoid of smugness or ego. They are not extroverted but are skilled communicators who can both explain and constructively debate complex ideas and logic, as well as engage effectively in product and domain conversations (their senior developers are pseudo BA\xe2\x80\x99s). Your design thinking and ability to look at complex problems from different perspectives is outstanding, as is your ability to then articulate the reasoning behind your solutions and views. You will be someone capable of applying independent critical thinking and helpings others around you solve problems and become better at what they do.

Why would you want this role?

You and your team will engage with product daily, and have direct influence over product direction. You will always know why you are building what you are building and have a voice in deciding how to deliver the highest user value through what you and your team build (they do not hire \xe2\x80\x98code monkeys\xe2\x80\x99).

You will be attempting to build a solution which has never been built before, and if successful would be transformational for the Australian financial services industry - build something which could have an industry wide user impact

You will have an interest in building products, making complex things run fast, working with high volume real time data, and having the chance to apply AI and automation to these areas.

You will be working with committed and skilled developers all pulling in the same direction

You will be working with proven developers who have built, and build, \xe2\x80\x98first of its kind\xe2\x80\x99 solutions which make incredibly complicated finance functions, simple and intuitive for users for the first time

You will be involved in \xe2\x80\x98ever evolving technical and domain challenges\xe2\x80\x99.

You will have a genuine interest in learning a lot about financial services, and how the \xe2\x80\x98guts\xe2\x80\x99 of the finance, funds management and wealth management industries work

We do not equate capability with years\xe2\x80\x99 experience, though it is likely you will have 10+ years development experience. You will definitely have worked in successful product environments and from your experience will be able to guide your team on what works and what doesn\xe2\x80\x99t.

A different recruitment experience?

Please apply or call if the above resonates with you, but please note you must have Australian work rights. We will look at all applications. If we do not contact you, it means we have not seen enough direct relevance to our client\xe2\x80\x99s particular requirements. If you do not hear from us, and feel we may have missed something regarding your suitability, then please call to discuss.

This role is being managed by Account Director Dan Gordon on 02 9409 4805. Dan is a certified Scrum Master and Product Owner, and from face-to-face interviews with the clients Head of Development, Lead Architect and Tech Leaders, will provide suitable candidates with a clear account of all aspects of this opportunity.

'

title: NA
description:
b"
Operating nine mission critical Data Centres nationally, Interactive is an Australian owned IT company.\xc2\xa0 We provide secure enterprise Data Centres with efficient and highly resilient environments for customers to locate their critical IT equipment.\xc2\xa0

One of the main contributors to our incredible success has been our unquestionable focus on creating an outstanding customer experience. Our engineers are some of the best in the industry, and always deliver an exceptional service.

The demand for our Data Centre services is growing at a rapid rate and as a result, we are seeking exceptional and experienced Data Centre Engineers to support our Sydney and Melbourne Data Centre facilities within the white space and the Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure. Once on-boarded the role will expand and allow you to work at our external partners' facilities in which Interactive also manage.
\xc2\xa0
Your typical week will involve:
  • Directly managing and working alongside our 3rd party providers on servicing both mechanical and electrical plant;
  • Being responsible for regular maintenance & testing, service faults & call outs, ensuring remediation works are performed to a high level;\xc2\xa0
  • Managing 3rd Party Repairs & Maintenance quotes, reporting and scheduling;
  • Understanding and maintaining the Interactive Data Centre facilities, Infrastructure plans and documentation, including electrical, mechanical, hydraulics, fire and BMS/EMS systems;
  • Co-coordinating the implementation of internal and external customer requests within the Data Centre, including smart hands, logistics, etc;
  • Performing Data Centre Engineering and facilities tasks across multiple Data Centre sites (Internal and external).
\xc2\xa0
We are looking for someone who has
  • Experience working in an operational Data Centre environment;
  • Electrical Trade qualification (mandatory);
  • Ability to understand and work with complex and critical infrastructure systems;
  • Proven capability using a work management system for logging and managing\xc2\xa0requests, changes and incidents;
  • Excellent communication skills - oral and written (report writing skills);
  • Flexibility to work a 24x7 rotating roster;
  • Valid driver's licence and own vehicle to travel between customer sites.
\xc2\xa0
What's in it for you?
Opportunity to work with Largest privately owned Australian IT business - BRW Top 500 with premium Data Centre space built on world class technologies. At Interactive we understand the importance of investing in our people; providing our staff\xc2\xa0with the tools to continuously improve the way we operate and ensure we have training and initiatives running to support the growth needs of our business and employees.
\xc2\xa0
The successful candidate will be a technically capable professional with a strong customer philosophy wanting to make a real difference in our Data Centres along with being a goal-oriented, self-motivated professional who is not afraid of working autonomously.

This role is located out of western Suburbs in Sydney and Melbourne, with time also spent at other Interactive locations including customer sites. \xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
If you are looking for a great career opportunity in an industry where you can make your mark, then please apply online or contact our Talent Acquisition Specialists Hima Mohanavelu or Dan McFarlane on (03) 9921 8444 for further information. "

title: Research and Data Analysis - Superannuation
description:
b'

We are currently recruiting for a superannuation professional to join a well-respected and trusted superannuation advisory firm.

The role is newly created and will be a combination of research and consulting. Responsibilities will include:

  • Working with data - extracting and manipulating data to ascertain trends. Drafting reports on key trends to come out of the data;
  • Drafting material on findings of research;
  • Presenting to senior staff from within clients the organisation works with;
  • Supporting your findings with data.

You will be performing research on/ for a variety of superannuation funds and the industry at large. The day-to-day will have you performing research, analysing industry related data, interpreting information and providing the data to back those findings up.

This is a great opportunity for individuals who enjoy performing research, working with data, and engaging with a variety of stakeholders (internal and external). For those with an interest in superannuation, the exposure to a variety of industry wide data/ information, and the people you will get to engage with is second to none.

Individuals who have previously worked in research or as a consultant in superannuation will be very well received. Individuals coming from a role working with data in superannuation will also be held in high regard.

The role is best suited to individuals who enjoy research, working with data, are interested in superannuation and who are comfortable working with a range of different people.

If you are interested in this role please Apply Now. Alternatively, if you have further questions please contact Adrian on 9888 7888.



'

title: Hadoop Big Data Platform Consultant / Engineer
salary: b'Above market rates are assured huge bonus & shares'
description:
b"Datasource Services has extensive, international experience placing skilled candidates within Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Data Science. Our network spans across Australia and New Zealand with a wide range of clients ranging from tier ones to start-ups. People and Data are at the heart of everything we do! Join the Datasource community today at\xc2\xa0www.datasourceservices.com.au\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
We have a brand new requirement on the books to join a global Big Data and Data Science Consultancy who are working on some of the most cutting edge projects in Australia and across the globe. This role is for a high level Technical Engineer who has notable experience working on enterprise Hadoop / Big Data Platforms as an Engineer.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The role:\xc2\xa0
  • Deliver a wide range of complex data engineering requirements as per customer requirements. Enterprise client list.
  • Engage with customers across a range of different industries to understand requirements and deliver technical solutions.
  • Development of POC and mock up data solutions for customers, assisting pre-sales teams with presentations.
  • Analysis of customer data, building effective data pipelines using Spark, HIVE, Kafka etc.
  • Build and support Hadoop data sets for a team of highly skilled Data Scientists.
  • Set up and implement Hadoop HDFS platforms for a range of customers, reviewing areas such as security, operating systems, integration with existing architecture etc.
  • Complex data streaming and data processing in Apache Spark & Kaftka.
  • Process improvement across the current software engineering methodologies.
  • Set up, run, install, implement and support enterprise side Hadoop clusters (200-300 nodes).
  • Maintain effective communication and documentation.
  • Work in an Agile development environment.

Required skills and experience:
\xc2\xa0
  • Outstanding programming skills across a range of languages such as Java (essential) and Scala, R, Pig, Python. Go etc.
  • Commercial experience of unstructured data sets and HDFS platforms, Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra etc.
  • Strong implementation skills, with the ability to understand complex installation issues such as Security, Cloud Install, CPU usage, Operating systems etc.
  • Any experience with Apache Spark or Kafka is highly regarded.
  • Excellent problem solving skills, structured and analytical approach.
  • Experience with visualizing large data sets is highly desirable.
  • Customer facing role, so experience in Consulting is highly beneficial but not essential.
  • Ability to guide and mentor customers through enterprise Hadoop implementations.
  • Outstanding communication skills are required.
This role requires a unique blend of high level communication and deep, broad technical knowledge. A true understanding for Data Warehouse, MPP and HDFS Architecture is required, alongside an appreciation for Infrastructure, Security and Cloud solutions. You will be rewarded with an award winning, culture, global thought leadership and exposure to Australia's largest Big Data programs. APPLY NOW!

Please note:\xc2\xa0Due to the nature if this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Permanent Residents or Citizens, currently residing in Australia. "

title: Data Analytics Lead Consultant, take over an existing desk
description:
b"Our client\xc2\xa0
Runs a high touch, vertically focused IT recruiter with solid, profitable relationships in place which result in exclusive, non PSA work. \xc2\xa0Working from stylish offices in the CBD, they and the team deliver to an SME, mid tier client base through specialist entities. \xc2\xa0Due to a recent change, there is the opportunity for an experienced Data specialist to step up, form part of the management team, and lead Data further building on their capacity.

What the role involves
This role requires a strong recruiter who also wants to become a leader from client identification to management of delivery. \xc2\xa0A lot of work has already been done in this area, so there is a lot to leverage, however there is enough scope that a team could be hired under your management, in time. \xc2\xa0

Who you will be
You will have considerable data analytics recruitment experience, preferably locally and be familiar with the client base and talent sourcing methods. \xc2\xa0You will want to grow something, at the moment the desk has been one of the highest billing in this agency but there is scope in this area for a team. \xc2\xa0A knowledge of starting desks, next to yours, in boutique environments would be preferred as you will have an appreciation of the varying advantages smaller businesses provide.\xc2\xa0

The rewards
This role will pay an attractive base and OTE, easily achievable due to the solid foundation in place. \xc2\xa0It's a business built on its' relationships formed with a long tenure team. \xc2\xa0Move to an environment where you will be valued and key to this business' success. \xc2\xa0We are keen to speak to you asap so call Lisa on 02 9410 4590 or send your CV to jobs@mccallnorris.com. \xc2\xa0

McCall Norris offers the largest referral fee in rec2rec locally, $2,017 so if this sounds like someone you know please call us or visit our website for details.
"

title: Solution Architect (Voice/DATA/Network) - based in Adelaide
description:
b"
One of our reputable clients urgently seeks a Solution Architect for their existing and upcoming ICT projects based in Adelaide.
\xc2\xa0

The responsibilities for this role includes, but not limited to technical consultation and advice, planning, developing and implementing software solutions, continuous improvement, business, management and legislative report writing, business case analysis, and best fit solution architecture.
\xc2\xa0

The successful candidate will need significant experience in network systems, analysis, networking principles, proprietary software/hardware (data and/or voice)
\xc2\xa0

Essential Job Functions
\xc2\xa0
  • Coordinates initiatives and supports requirement validation through inspections, simulations, and other data collection techniques to reduce the risk of failure and enhance system validation.
  • Leads design reviews to verify designs meet requirements and integrate systems throughout all phases of the design process, enabling the study of performance characteristics.
  • Coordinates systems and subsystems testing by defining test cases and plans; develops procedures, operates and monitors tests, and tracks results to enhance performance.
  • Collects and analyses the measures of system performance; recommends appropriate course of action to maintain or enhance performance. Stays current with advances in technology.
  • Creates processes to provide information regarding performance standards; researches levels which exceed standards and communicates results.
  • Participates in key initiatives to evaluate systems to capture measures that define performance.
  • Consults with customers and other stakeholders to validate that performance aligns with requirements, in order to improve and optimize their overall experience.
  • Applies advanced methods and researches various technical and management areas related to performance to drive efficiencies.
  • Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.


To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Saumya Sharma on 08 7422 0617. Please quote our job reference number: 200167088. "

title: Digital Performance Analyst - Full Time, Drummoyne NSW
description:
b'

About Longtail UX

Join an exciting Aussie tech start-up with patented technology, a fast-growing client base and agency partners in Australia and internationally.

Founded in 2013 by an ex-Googler, a successful entrepreneur and a Buddhist monk, Longtail UX is transforming Search: Our technology increases Search channel ROI by 50% across SEM and SEO. We have made the integration into client websites effortless \xe2\x80\x93 so businesses can concentrate on their core mission: creating exceptional products, services and brands.

Join our experienced, fun and fast-growing team.

The Role:

We are looking for a highly motivated\xc2\xa0Digital Performance Analyst with a passion for data and experience with SEM Keyword Research and Campaign management\xc2\xa0to join our growing team.

Reporting directly to the Managing Director, you will be highly analytical with excellent Excel skills. You demonstrate a high level of attention to detail and have a minimum 2 years' experience with SEM. You are proficient at processing and manipulating large volumes of data for the purpose of campaign optimisation.

What does the role involve?

  • KW Research with SEM tools (e.g. AdWords KW Planner) and other third party tools
  • Analysis of Web Analytics and KW reports
  • Processing and presentation of data in order to guide account optimisation
  • Search results analysis and optimisation on our patented platform
  • Accurately monitor all campaign aspects and ensure accurate delivery of results.
  • Collation of data and Reporting
  • Client Account Management

Essential Criteria

  • Minimum 2 years' experience with Google AdWords, KW research and campaign management
  • Experience with Web Analytics (particularly Google Analytics)
  • Passion for Data with proven working experience
  • Competent in Microsoft Office Systems, highly confident in Excel and data management

In addition to the above experience, the ideal candidate will have the following attributes:

  • Strong team player with a positive can-do attitude
  • Trouble-shooting and problem solving skills and experience
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Good spoken and written English language skills and a full-time Australian working visa.

A plus\xe2\x80\xa6 but not essential:

  • Knowledge of SEO principles and best practices

\xc2\xa0

Due to the high volume of applicants, we will only contact you if you are successful at the initial stage.

No recruitment agencies please (we have this one covered)

If this sounds like the ideal next step in your career and you are looking to work in a fun, supportive and innovative team, please click on "Apply for this job" to send us your cover letter and CV.
\xc2\xa0

'

title: Purchasing Officer
description:
b'

Our client is the Australian distribution division of an international group. They are highly successful, market leaders in electrical and data products distribution with a network of over 200 branches nationally.

About the role:\xc2\xa0

Looking to work for a national market leader with the opportunity to positively influence business results? Then consider this opportunity with an established, highly successful company with turnover in excess of $1bn.

Due to ongoing growth they are ready to hire a talented Purchasing Officer, ideally with electrical products experience, to be based at one of their inner city branches.

You will be responsible for maintaining relationships with suppliers, managing the purchasing process and ensuring timely order fulfillment to maintain optimal inventory levels and customer service.

The characteristics of the successful candidate are:

  • Purchasing experience ideally in electrical and data products
  • Formal training or accreditation in purchasing, highly regarded
  • Motivated by challenge and proving yourself in a competitive business environment
  • Persuades and motivates others
  • Enjoys working in a hands-on, team-based environment
  • Fluent communication skills

What's on offer:

  • Great opportunity to work with an established, highly successful company

  • Be surrounded by a team of experienced industry leaders

Apply now via SEEK for this unique\xc2\xa0opportunity, including a Cover Letter and CV!\xc2\xa0

For inquiries please contact Peter Pychtin, Northeast Quadrant Consulting. Phone: 02 9419 6811

'

title: IT Reporting & Analytics Graduate - North Ryde
description:
b'

IT Reporting & Analytics Graduate \xe2\x80\x93 North Ryde

CSR Limited is a top ASX listed Australian manufacturing company that specialises in creating innovative and sustainable building products and systems for the Australian and New Zealand markets. Our Business Information Services (BIS) team provides all IT services to internal and a select number of Joint ventures across Australia and New Zealand, supporting around 200 network sites and over 3000 end users.

We believe our people are the key to our success and we strive to employ talented individuals who are knowledgeable in their field and committed to excellence.

The opportunity!

At CSR, we recognise the need to invest in analytics capabilities that will allow our businesses to look for opportunities within data. As a result, we have created an exciting new role for an enthusiastic IT Reporting & Analytics Graduate.

Duties & Responsibilities include:

  • Assisting the SAP Reporting team in supporting end user issues channeled in via our incident management system.
  • Resolving incidents or completing service requests related to data flows, reports or dashboards.
  • Ensuring end users have a positive experience by providing timely and helpful assistance.
  • With training, become highly knowledgeable in the solutions we provide, as well as work with the team to understand how other solutions might enhance our current capability.

Skills & Experience

The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate:

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT/Engineering/Business or equivalent (Either complete or to be completed in the next 12 months)
  • An understanding of database structures and data flows in the context of reporting and analytics platforms
  • Experience in analytics platforms and data visualisation tools
  • Previous IT support experience will be advantageous
  • SAP BW and Microsoft PowerBI experience highly desirable
  • A strong desire to learn and develop within the team and organisation
  • Solid interpersonal skills \xe2\x80\x93 the ability to connect with varying people
  • A creative yet analytical thinker combined with a positive and collaborative approach

We are ideally looking for someone who can join us on a full-time basis, however there is some flexibility to offer the role as Part-Time (3-4 days p/wk.) for the right candidate.

How to apply

Are you excited about being a part of a great team and building your career with a diverse, innovative and forward thinking business? If yes, then apply online today!

Applications close Tuesday, 23 May. Please include a cover letter addressing your experience or suitability against the criteria.

To learn more about us visit www.csr.com.au or contact Emilia Besha \xe2\x80\x93 CSR Recruitment Business Partner - 02 9964 1361 for any additional queries.

Please note: CSR has a process of pre-employment medicals (including a drug and alcohol screen) requiring successful completion before a formal offer is made.

'

title: Data Entry Officer
description:
b"

TPG Telecom Limited is a highly successful telecommunications business listed on the ASX. We have one of the largest Internet, data and voice networks in the country, and we offer some of the most competitive products in the market to a range of customers including residential, SMEs, large corporates and many government institutions. Our business now has over two million customers and approximately 6,000 employees. We are continuing to invest in our people and our network infrastructure to cater for further expansion of our business.

TPG Telecom are seeking a hard working individual to join our Geographic Information System (GIS) Team as a Data Entry Officer on a full-time basis.

Reporting to the GIS Manager, your key responsibilities will include:

  • Design and document fibre circuits;
  • Check and collate asbuilt information;
  • Preparation of both hard and soft copy maps;
  • Application support and training;
  • Capture spatial data in various formats;
  • Perform spatial data quality control; and
  • Other ad hoc duties as assigned by management.

The following skills, experience and attributes will be required:

  • 1-2 years' experience in data entry;
  • Excellent administrative skills;
  • Good knowledge of spatial systems ad their application;
  • Basic knowledge of telecommunication fibre networks;
  • Good problem solving and diagnostic ability;
  • Ability to meet deadlines;
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • High level of communication \xe2\x80\x93 both written and verbal; and
  • Ability to work well within a team environment.

If you have an interest in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and have eligibility to work in Australia and would like to express your interest please apply now.

"

title: Data Analytics Associate
description:
b'

Afiniti invites applications for Data Analytics Associate.

About us

Afiniti is the world's leading applied artificial intelligence and advanced analytics provider, which transforms the way humans interacts by pairing individuals on the basis of behavior. Afiniti operates at the cutting edge of telephony sales optimization; serving key FTSE 100 and Fortune 100 multinational clients. To date, Afiniti has delivered over $4 billion in revenue for its clients. At the heart of Afiniti's proposition is its unique ability to measurably increase contact center revenue by 4-6%. Afiniti delivers this lift using its patented "Artificial Intelligence" technology to identify psychographic and demographic pairings between customers and agents which are more optimal than the random "longest waiting agent / longest waiting caller" strategy, traditionally deployed in contact centers. Founded in 2009, Afiniti has to date delivered over 150 programs across North and South America, Europe, Asia and Africa. Afiniti headquarters are in Washington D.C., with a further eight offices around the world.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

  • Establish and grow client relationships that allow for discovery of and access to client data
  • Help build and maintain artificial intelligence and machine learning models that help optimize client enterprise performance
  • Help in the research and development of new Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning modelling technologies and techniques
  • Customer-facing experience
  • Knowledge of SQL, R, C++, .Net

Education

  • Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or Mathematics and/or Statistics

Experience

  • Mid- Level professionals
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in software development
'

title: Retail Business Intelligence Analyst - Esprit

b'

Esprit is an international lifestyle brand operating in more than 40 countries with over 1000 points of sale. Our continued success depends on the abilities, commitment, enthusiasm and energy of our teams around the world.

To join a lifestyle brand that creates the future, apply now!

'

title: Senior Data Scientist / Machine Learning (Customer Marketing)
description:
b"Our client is an global market leader from within the Consumer and Commercial Insurance sector. They boast a well established and rapidly expanding analytics division, employing the industry's brightest analytical minds they offer a hot bed for innovation and offer unparalleled opportunities for career development and growth.\xc2\xa0Due to the ongoing success of the business a brand new position has been created for a Senior Data Scientist with exposure to Machine Learning to join the Sydney based team. With the key focus on delivering customer loyalty predictive modelling projects the responsibilities of this role will include:\xc2\xa0

  • Engaging with internal and external stakeholders to consult around analytical project requirements, discuss methodologies and negotiate deliverables.\xc2\xa0
  • Deliver a range of bespoke analytics projects leveraging techniques that may include; Customer propensity/regression modelling (churn, acquisition, cross sell), segmentation analysis (cluster),\xc2\xa0marketing campaign analytics, hypothesis testing, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, decision trees, neural networks, gradient boosting, etc.\xc2\xa0(requires SQL, SAS R or Python analyst skills).
  • Lead and support the development and implementation of continually improving machine learning models in Python to optimise the digital customer marketing strategy.\xc2\xa0
The successful applicant will come from a strong background working in a data driven insights and modelling environment and will be able to demonstrate:
  • Commercial Data Science experience\xc2\xa0building a range of\xc2\xa0statistical\xc2\xa0models relating to customer marketing strategy (Acquisition, retention, growth, cross sell, churn), customer segmentation, next best action, campaign analytics.
  • Experience building Machine Learning Models in Python.\xc2\xa0
  • Strong technical skills and experience using SQL, SAS, R or Python to extract, manipulate and merge large customer behavioural or transactional data set from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base, Python or R)\xc2\xa0
  • Exposure to Scala, Spark, Hadoop etc will prove highly advantageous.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Digital Analytics experience in Adobe Marketing Cloud or Google Analytics will prove highly advantageous.\xc2\xa0
  • A genuine passion to build a career in Data Science and Machine Learning, implementing analytical techniques and concepts such as; Customer propensity modeling (churn, acquisition, cross sell), segmentation analysis (cluster),\xc2\xa0marketing campaign analytics, hypothesis testing, credit risk analysis, credit scorecard development, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, decision trees, neural networks, etc.\xc2\xa0(requires SAS, R, Python, Scala, Spark etc)
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

title: Senior Digital Account Manager
description:
b"
Yahoo7 makes the world's daily habits inspiring and entertaining. By creating highly personalised experiences for our users, we keep people connected to what matters most to them, across devices and around the world.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

A little about us

We're a dynamic and passionate sales team who connect advertisers to our audiences through great ideas, delivering powerful results. We combine market-leading technology and human expertise delivering the best solution for advertisers - whether it's a brand story or reach, managed or programmatic, guaranteed or non-guaranteed. Leveraging market research and our suite of products, our\xc2\xa0sales team are driven in finding the optimal solution to meet our client's needs.

\xc2\xa0
A lot about you

You are a dynamic, strategic, savvy digital media professional who can dive in and immediately add value by driving revenue and increasing client investment. With your proven track record across digital advertising sales, you will be prepared to hit the ground running and\xc2\xa0manage multiple complex projects with key agency clients. You're organised, proactive and love nurturing long term business relationships, regularly pitching new ideas to deliver the bet results for your clients.
\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0

Your day ....\xc2\xa0
  • Responding to briefs on time and on brief and proactively following these responses through to achieve a positive outcome
  • Proactively pitching new concepts and campaign solutions to clients based on your deep knowledge of their objectives and business plans
  • Developing a strong external stakeholder network spanning implementers and key decision makers in all of your agencies, as well as within clients where appropriate\xc2\xa0
  • Continuing to not only build upon existing relationships, but always identifying where new relationships need to be formed and establishing those connections
  • Making yourself an intrinsic part of your agency's decision making through continually delivering value to your agencies, maintaining top of mind presence through appropriate levels of contact and delivering upon the needs and requirements of your agencies\xc2\xa0

What you'll need ...\xc2\xa0
  • 4 plus years proven digital experience in advertising sales and relevant contacts within the industry\xc2\xa0
  • Have a clear understanding of online advertising and how it correlates to traditional media
  • A strong understanding of the sales cycle and proven ability to hit revenue targets
  • Ability to acquire new business within targeted agencies
  • Be a self starter with the ability to work proactively and autonomously\xc2\xa0
  • Proven ability to develop and maintain relationships at multiple levels
  • A passion for the digital advertising industry as demonstrated by understanding of current trends and knowledge

Why Yahoo7 ...\xc2\xa0

By combining world-class technologies and premium content, we create kickass experiences that shape the digital world. Creativity is at our core and our people are empowered to push boundaries and challenge the norm. They look at what's possible, and then take it further. Together we deliver - for each other, our clients and our users and as individuals and as one, we enrich people's daily lives.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

title: Health Information Coordinator
description:
b'

Home based healthcare is the future - Regal Home Health has been operating for over 50 years with a focus on supporting people to achieve independence & quality of care at home!\xc2\xa0

The Health Information Team is responsible for maintaining the data integrity of our systems and analysing\xc2\xa0 and interpreting data to drive continuous improvement in clinical outcomes. This is achieved through:

  • Recording, Updating and Maintaining of Confidential Client Health Records
  • Updating the company database with new information
  • Participating in team meetings
  • Verification of reports
  • Mail merging\xc2\xa0and Mail Outs
  • Providing administration support and other ad-hoc admin duties as requested, including filing
  • Collating, proof reading and releasing specialised medical reports
  • Producing invoices relating to those reports
  • Monitoring and managing report workflows
  • Liaising with medical professionals and clients
  • Problem solving and troubleshooting\xc2\xa0

Ideal Candidate

Skills & Qualifications

  • Experience in Quality Management and accreditation processes within the health environment\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0would be a significant advantage
  • A tertiary qualification in a Health related degree.
  • Minimum 2 years experience in administration in the health sector
  • Previous experience working with The "Department of Veteran Affairs" preferred.
  • Demonstrate attention to detail
  • Be able to work well with systems, processes & procedures
  • Show a willingness to learn, initiative and motivation
  • Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Professional, customer focused telephone manner
  • A high level of confidentiality
  • Confident in the use of Advanced MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Outlook)
  • Typing skills above 65+wpm \xe2\x80\x93 your ability to multi-task and take calls, access computer files and services greatly impacts on your success in this role.
  • Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills

Attributes:

  • At Regal we pride ourselves on being 'Regal' \xe2\x80\x93 what that means to us is that you are professional, compassionate, passionate and dedicated to meeting all stakeholder needs proactively.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
  • An organised, structured and detail focused approach to work that enables you to meet and manage all deadlines and expectations.
  • A positive attitude and ethics setting an example to others.
  • Team player, autonomous and enjoys the results of being prepared and working together to produce great results benefiting our clients.
  • The ability to work in a fast paced environment whilst maintaining 100% accuracy, discretion, diligence, professionalism and superior service.
  • The highest levels of confidentiality and integrity are key attributes in this role.

What's in it for you?

  • You will enjoy working in a\xc2\xa0productive and happy office culture.
  • With regular team meetings providing support and direction, a unique team happiness measure, a health & wellbeing culture as well as fresh fruit to keep you going throughout the day!
  • Modern office with city views & cafe kitchen
  • Competitive salary based on health industry experience!
  • We reward success, if you are successful we are successful.
  • You have a voice and can express yourself freely in making a difference within the team and management and the clients you advocate for.

Regal Home Health Corporate Social Responsibility

"I think the desire to help other people is a really strong desire in all of us"\xc2\xa0

- Alain De Botton\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Senior Data Analyst - Governance and IM
description:
b'An outstanding and exclusive opportunity presented by the team at Alloc8 for an experienced Data and Governance professional. Supporting the design, implementation and on-going support of a business critical, greenfield Governance programme in Sydney with both the financial and business backing to really succeed.

The Company:

An Australian icon with a high profile reputation and aspirations to change the way Australians interact, communicate and educate themselves. An enterprise technology environment awaits with complex systems, real business backing and the financial clout to embrace new and emerging technology.

The Role:

As the Senior Data Analyst the role requires a blend of strong technical acumen when delivering Data Governance, Data Quality and Master Data Management solutions as well as outstanding communication, customer engagement and business facing capabilities

In order to be considered you will bring the following attributes to the role:
  • At least 10 years experience working in a Data Warehouse, Data Governance, Data Quality and MDM capacity with strong technical and design capabilities across core IM.
  • Experience driving Data Governance implementation alongside broader Data Strategies within enterprise technology environments.
  • Proven experience in driving the business through Data Governance initiatives with the ability to influence.
  • Outstanding communication and business engagement skills with strong documentation and the ability to act as the business liaison when running workshops and requirement elicitation.
  • Innovative approach to the use of Data related technology with strong core technical acumen across SQL, MDM, Data Quality and Governance tools.
  • Comfortable when working with and driving vendors and technical delivery teams.
  • The ability to manage multiple data initiates at any given time with a pragmatic and open approach to delivery.
Why should I apply?

Simply put this is the most high profile governance and data programme in Australia right now!

You will join a team of high performers and your Data Governance skills will be challenged daily. You will get exposed to Senior Execs and will drive decisions and outcomes across the programme.\xc2\xa0

You will also be rewarded with an extremely competitive package and the benefits of joining a large, dynamic and well respected organisation.

If you are keen to learn more - have 8 + years Data experience and think you can handle the challenge then apply today. Or why not call Tom Sharp for an informal chat on (02) 9090 2761.

Please not that due to the nature of this role only Australian Citizens and / or Residents can be considered. '

title: Product Data Scientist - Growing Digital Team
description:
b"We are seeking a product focused data scientist with strong modelling and data mining experience using R, SQL and ideally some SAS. This position is in a new team that works with some huge customer / online sales data sets with objectives to drive customer growth and experience across the Digital landscape within our client.

Role:\xc2\xa0
  • Analyse the performance of products across their websites
  • Create product affinity framework and impact on churn model
  • Dynamic visitor profiling based on product affinities
  • Develop dashboards, ad-hoc reports and presentations to communicate the value of our product offering
  • Develop a KPI framework to measure the performance of pages, products and website
  • Work closely with merchandising experts to develop ideas and tests to improve product performance
  • Design and propose solutions that will move merchandising analysis from ad-hoc to always on
If successful, you will get to explore and work with some of Australia's deepest customer and sales data sets, \xc2\xa0analyse the performance of products across the their website and work on developing new or improving existing machine learning algorithms.
\xc2\xa0
Required skills & Experience:\xc2\xa0
  • Minimum of 2-4 years' commercial experience\xc2\xa0implementing advanced modelling techniques (linear regression, machine learning, etc) in a professional environment is a must
  • Ideally at least 2 year's experience within retail product Analysis
  • Academic background at the bachelor / Masters / PhD level in a STEM field such as statistics, machine learning, actuarial studies, bioinformatics, etc.
  • Experience using: R, SQL, SAS to build models on large to 'big data'
  • Dashboarding experience, ideally with Power BI but can be within Excel or Tableau
  • Exceptional communication skills: verbal, written and in presentation of technical concepts to business stakeholders such as marketing managers, teams and directors
Advantageous Skills / Experience:\xc2\xa0Python, Java, Scala, Apache Spark, Hadoop, NoSQL databases, various ML libraries, experience extracting data from Teradata, etc.
\xc2\xa0
This role will see you join a fairly elite team with opportunities to apply best practice and complex data modelling approaches to drive customer growth, profit and personalised customer marketing. "

title: Data and Quality Coordinator
description:
b"

The Stroke Foundation is a national not-for-profit organisation that works with stroke survivors, carers, health professionals, government and the public to reduce the impact of stroke on the Australian community.\xc2\xa0 Our mission is to Stop stroke, Save lives and End suffering

About the Program

The Stroke Foundation collects and evaluates data on the delivery of stroke care using standard indicators based on the best-practice recommendations of the Clinical Guidelines. The National Stroke Audit is conducted annually but alternates between acute and rehabilitation services on a two-year cycle.

About the role

Reporting to the National Manager Clinical Services, the Data and Quality Coordinator leads the National Stroke Audit and provides specialised data support to the Stroke Services Team and other relevant areas of the Stroke Foundation as required. The role also supports activities related to facilitating improved quality of stroke care, particularly related to the 'InformMe' online portal.

Your background

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in project management or significant equivalent experience
  • Previous experience undertaking or coordinating an audit program, including data collection and analysis
  • Demonstrable ability to develop, implement and evaluate projects that require high level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Experience with data collection and management
  • Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Robust data analysis and report writing skills
  • Strong skills across the Microsoft Office Suite of products
  • Excellent time management, administration and organisation skills
  • Understanding of stroke, stroke care and stroke recovery is advantageous

What's on offer?

A flexible, innovative and dynamic organisation with engaged, knowledgeable staff with the added benefits of competitive remuneration and salary packaging advantages.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with one of Australia's leading not-for profit organisations that has a positive influence on the lives of thousands of Australians each year. If you are passionate about making an impact, and want to be part of an organisation that is making a real difference in people's lives, please forward your resume with a covering letter to recruitment@strokefoundation.com.au

The Stroke Foundation embraces cultural diversity and strongly encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply.

"

title: Solutions Architect

b'

BCS Technology International (BCS) is an award-winning Australian based Professional Services organisation focusing on the provision of quality consulting in the area of Business Intelligence, Data warehouse and Application Development. title: Digital marketer - media & events
description:
b"

About the business and the role

RFi Group is a global intelligence, media and events provider focusing exclusively on financial services. \xc2\xa0We offer a dynamic, fast-paced environment with opportunities for fast career growth and development. RFi Group has had an annualised growth rate of 50% year on year since 2007 and was listed on the BRW Fast 100 6 years in a row from 2011 to 2016.

We have offices in Sydney, Singapore, London, Hong Kong, Toronto and Washington DC and are rapidly expanding around the world providing new opportunities for employees who excel.

RFi Group produces news, magazines and events, in Australia, Asia, the Americas and the UK. Our events are aimed at senior level industry leaders and include many major conferences, awards evenings and Thought Leader Dinners.

Due to continued growth we are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated digital marketer to look after our media and events digital marketing operations.

Job tasks and responsibilities

Main responsibilities will be:

  • Manage the upkeep, update and maintenance of the marketing automation, CRM and event systems on a daily basis (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud, Eventbrite) including tagging event attendance, magazine subscriptions, updating contact information and pulling marketing lists
  • Segmentation of the database according to industry, event attendance, subscription opt-in and industry association groups
  • Purchase URLs and transfer them to the back-end systems
  • Create web pages for various events
  • Monitor and update website content
  • Coordinating eDMs \xe2\x80\x93 daily and weekly
  • Monitor social media channels
  • Managing the output of daily, weekly and monthly email communications to various parts of the database
  • Working with the editorial and business development team to manage the media distribution processes

Skills and experience

As the successful candidate, you will:

  • Have experience of SEO, google analytics and google tag manager
  • Have experience of HTML coding (Basic) and link building
  • Speak fluent English and have good writing skills\xc2\xa0
  • Be highly organised and able to work under pressure to deadlines
  • Be tech savvy and love working with data
  • Have a working knowledge of SalesForce and Marketing Cloud (essential)
  • Have excellent customer service skills and be comfortable conversing with internal and external stakeholders
  • Have an acute attention to detail

Job benefits and perks

The RFi way:

Full 'on the job' training, specific to this role will be provided, underpinned by RFi's comprehensive formal training program which includes:

  • Employee onboarding process \xe2\x80\x93 mapping out the first 100 days so you know exactly what to expect
  • 30 noteworthy skills sessions to create a strong understanding of the various components that make up the business.

RFi is committed to fostering a positive culture and workplace environment, and provides:

  • Employee success team \xe2\x80\x93 Regional project teams driving new initiatives in employee engagement
  • Monthly drinks \xe2\x80\x93 Facilitates networking with employees from other departments
  • Bi-annual companywide strategic offsite events - where all employees are encouraged to contribute ideas to the company's strategy for the next financial year
  • Volunteer initiatives and charitable community partnerships
  • Annual employee awards \xe2\x80\x93 recognizing high achievers across the board
  • Social events for special events throughout the calendar year
  • Casual dress and 4pm finish Fridays
  • Birthdays off work and monthly cakes

Our recruitment process focusses heavily on individual attitude and drive to succeed - ensuring that we hire passionate and hardworking individuals who to learn and thrive within the company.\xc2\xa0This is a fantastic opportunity to accelerate your career in digital marketing media and events. Apply now to join the RFi team!

"

title: Reporting and Insight Analyst
description:
b'Based in our new North Sydney Offices, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be reporting into the Demand Analytics and Reporting Manager working alongside a team of talented analysts who are based in Hobart. As an Insight Analyst your role is to create critical data sets and insights to support the Customer Care division\xe2\x80\x99s delivery of business objectives. You will be responsible for producing regular operational reporting and developing key insights.

As an Insight Analyst, you\xe2\x80\x99ll work cross-functionally with other teams to understand issues, trends and opportunities to improve the experience of our customers. To succeed you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to be an exceptional relationship manager and have the technical ability to source, analyse and present data driven insight in a meaningful and engaging way while working to aggressive timeframes. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for someone who can not only create reports but can communicate the insights in a way that prompts stakeholders at all levels of the business to take action.

This is a perfect opportunity for someone early into their career as a data analyst to grow and develop. The successful candidate will possess:

  • a solid understanding of business reporting preferably with experience using Teradata in a position supporting a sales or service function
  • a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT or a related discipline (highly desirable but not mandatory)
  • Excel mastery with the ability query complex databases to create reports\xc2\xa0
  • a problem solving and analytical nature
  • a demonstrated ability to prioritise and achieve strict deadlines
  • the ability to work autonomously and remotely whilst still retaining strong team engagement and collaborative approach
  • excellent communication and presentation skills\xc2\xa0
We offer an amazing workplace with a dynamic and cooperative culture empowering you to be the best you can be and to have fun while doing it. Enjoy working in a professional yet very relaxed environment with people who are at the top of their game.

If you\xe2\x80\x99re passionate about data and the impact your insights can have on the success of the business, then we want to hear from you!

SK94630A


'

title: Senior Analyst - Big Data
description:
b'

Your New Company & Team
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers.

The Customer Decisioning (CD) team uses data-based quantitative techniques, in partnership with our colleagues in Marketing and Product, to identify and deliver relevant propositions to CBA customers and prospects.

Data, Enablement & Visualization (DEV) is one of the key areas within the CD function. In partnership with Enterprise Services (ES) and vendors, the DEV team is responsible for the Data and Infrastructure strategy and roadmap, developing, maintaining and optimising the data and system infrastructure and processes.

The Challenge & Project Description
The role will report into the Senior Manager Marketing Data Assets and work in consultation with Product Owners, Executive Mangers at ES.

What will success look like?
The breakdown of your role is to participate in the enhancement and implementation of all data and infrastructure development related to CD data, tools, technology and infrastructure. You'll contribute to by:

1- Driving enhancements on the Big Data platform

  • End to end project ownership
  • Remediate any data asset and infrastructure: run and refresh its data sources
  • Develop data assets in Hadoop
  • Perform hands on enhancement and changes to data assets
  • Implement changes
  • Productionise with Enterprise Services (ES) and document innovative changes
  • Perform Impact Analysis of data changes and developments, and reporting back to the team and customer of any impacts that may be significant to them

2- Team leadership

  • Role model the CBA vision and values that drives employee engagement
  • Train team members
  • Participate in building a strong team culture

3- Executing on the strategy

  • Drive the future capability
  • Develop a partnering relationship with customers and stakeholders and adopt a long-term perspective
  • Develop and deliver on your own business plan for you and your team
  • Ensure your business plan is reflective of the business priorities
  • Manage your own pipeline

Key Skills & Experience
1- Experience in:

  • Scala and one of the following (object oriented or functional) programming language (e.g. Java, C++, C#)
  • Big Data infrastructure (e.g. Hadoop, Spark)
  • SQL development and script automation, database design
  • Extract Transform and Load (ETL) process, data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and/or distributed systems
  • SDLC process and project lifecycle
  • Agile practices
  • Impact analysis
  • Enterprise Data Warehousing (EDW) and reporting platforms experience

2- Highly regarded:

  • Bachelors in Computer Science / Engineering
  • Industry certifications (e.g. Teradata, Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, etc)

FYI, the tech stack comprises of:

  • Hadoop and Spark for distributed data storage and processing
  • Teradata, Hbase and Cassandra to support OLAP and OLTP requirements
  • Scala and Java for our back-end applications and data integration tools
  • Tableau, d3 and Shiny for presentation of data insights
  • Python and R for data science, machine learning and rapid data profiling
  • Cloudera Search / Solr to support fast, flexible and familiar data exploration

People & Culture

  • The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career
  • Flexible working hours / work from home allowance
  • Energetic, delivery orientated team

Compensation & Benefits

  • Lucrative salary and bonus component
  • Have a meaningful impact one of the one of the top priorities in the bank
  • Opportunity to be a part of world class data analytics and infrastructure projects
  • On the job training provided with lots of room to grow
  • Opportunity to move across the business units of the bank or up into a management role

Don't Delay & Apply Now!

title: Senior Analyst - Big Data
description:
b'

Your New Company & Team
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers.

The Customer Decisioning (CD) team uses data-based quantitative techniques, in partnership with our colleagues in Marketing and Product, to identify and deliver relevant propositions to CBA customers and prospects.

Data, Enablement & Visualization (DEV) is one of the key areas within the CD function. In partnership with Enterprise Services (ES) and vendors, the DEV team is responsible for the Data and Infrastructure strategy and roadmap, developing, maintaining and optimising the data and system infrastructure and processes.

The Challenge & Project Description
The role will report into the Senior Manager Marketing Data Assets and work in consultation with Product Owners, Executive Mangers at ES.

What will success look like?
The breakdown of your role is to participate in the enhancement and implementation of all data and infrastructure development related to CD data, tools, technology and infrastructure. You'll contribute to by:

1- Driving enhancements on the Big Data platform

  • End to end project ownership
  • Remediate any data asset and infrastructure: run and refresh its data sources
  • Develop data assets in Hadoop
  • Perform hands on enhancement and changes to data assets
  • Implement changes
  • Productionise with Enterprise Services (ES) and document innovative changes
  • Perform Impact Analysis of data changes and developments, and reporting back to the team and customer of any impacts that may be significant to them

2- Team leadership

  • Role model the CBA vision and values that drives employee engagement
  • Train team members
  • Participate in building a strong team culture

3- Executing on the strategy

  • Drive the future capability
  • Develop a partnering relationship with customers and stakeholders and adopt a long-term perspective
  • Develop and deliver on your own business plan for you and your team
  • Ensure your business plan is reflective of the business priorities
  • Manage your own pipeline

Key Skills & Experience
1- Experience in:

  • Scala and one of the following (object oriented or functional) programming language (e.g. Java, C++, C#)
  • Big Data infrastructure (e.g. Hadoop, Spark)
  • SQL development and script automation, database design
  • Extract Transform and Load (ETL) process, data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and/or distributed systems
  • SDLC process and project lifecycle
  • Agile practices
  • Impact analysis
  • Enterprise Data Warehousing (EDW) and reporting platforms experience

2- Highly regarded:

  • Bachelors in Computer Science / Engineering
  • Industry certifications (e.g. Teradata, Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, etc)

FYI, the tech stack comprises of:

  • Hadoop and Spark for distributed data storage and processing
  • Teradata, Hbase and Cassandra to support OLAP and OLTP requirements
  • Scala and Java for our back-end applications and data integration tools
  • Tableau, d3 and Shiny for presentation of data insights
  • Python and R for data science, machine learning and rapid data profiling
  • Cloudera Search / Solr to support fast, flexible and familiar data exploration

People & Culture

  • The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career
  • Flexible working hours / work from home allowance
  • Energetic, delivery orientated team

Compensation & Benefits

  • Lucrative salary and bonus component
  • Have a meaningful impact one of the one of the top priorities in the bank
  • Opportunity to be a part of world class data analytics and infrastructure projects
  • On the job training provided with lots of room to grow
  • Opportunity to move across the business units of the bank or up into a management role

Don't Delay & Apply Now!

Tags
Hadoop, MapReduce, Lucene, HDFS, Hadoop Distributed File System, Pig, HIVE, HBase, Flume, Sqoop, ZooKeeper, HCatalog, Ambari, Oozie, Mahout, Drill, Avro, Whirr, Mrunit, Bigtop, YARN, Cloudera, Hortonworks, Yahoo!, Facebook, Stumbleupon, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift, Microsoft Azure, Spark SQL, Impala
