title: NA
description:
b'

Our client is a well known Australian ompany who is looking for an experienced Senior Business Intelligence Developer with exposure across a variety of BI and Data Visualisation tools to manage the ongoing design, development and support for the company\xe2\x80\x99s data warehouse and business intelligence platform.

This role will suit candidates with a strong technical competency in the design, development, implementation and ongoing support of ETL processes, data warehouses and business intelligence platforms. Experience within the retail industry is highly desirable along with strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills. The candidate must have strong data analysis and reporting skills and enjoy solving business challenges through working with stakeholders at all levels.

Responsibilities and Requirements

  • Own the design and development of BI solutions in accordance with the requirements of the business
  • Work directly with Business Analyst/Deliveries Manager to define requirements and estimate time to delivery for complex reports and BI requirements and with business stakeholders for noncomplex reporting requirements
  • Design, build, test and enhance existing and new data warehouse applications based on SQL database and OLAP technologies
  • Competent ETL developer responsible for the hands-on coding of all stages of the ETL processes using appropriate tools
  • Responsible for the scheduling and monitoring of the operational ETL processes and for resolving any issues with those processes
  • Awareness of data warehouse design and dimensional modeling techniques such that you can implement processes to deliver these designs and articulate any issue or ideas in the context of the overall design
  • A self-start driven by both quality and timescales
  • Provide BI Technical/Development Support

Essential Skills/Behaviour:

  • Degree educated or equivalent industry experience
  • Extensive experience in the development of Business Intelligence & Reports using the Microsoft BI stack (MSSQL, SSRS, SSIS, SSAS)
  • Very strong analytical skills and experience of writing highly complex SQL queries
  • Functional & technical understanding of ERP systems
  • Extensive experience using MDX to query and manipulate multidimensional data stores in OLAP cubes
  • Solid knowledge of data warehousing and ETL development process
  • Extensive experience in development of reports using Microsoft SQL Server Reporting and associated services

Desirable:

  • Experience with ZAP BI

For more information and to apply, please send your CV in WORD format to lisa@progressivepeople.com.au quoting 8886 or apply to this ad.

 '

title: Metadata & Analytics Analyst
description:
b'

At Foxtel, our purpose is to effortlessly connect Australians to all the stories they love. We offer a better entertainment experience every day through exclusive and diverse television across all genres, the world\xe2\x80\x99s most popular channel brands, and investment in high quality local content.

Our Playbook is what we call the way that we like to do things around here, and we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for people who can bring this to life. We\xe2\x80\x99re customer heroes, we challenge the norm, we make it easy and we make it fun.

Your purpose

  • Owning and solving viewing and behavioural data issues raised by Foxtel\xe2\x80\x99s internal data customers (Business Intelligence, Broadcast Operations, Advertising and Product Owners)
  • Owning data quality and manipulation of this data for its delivery to other internal and external systems.
  • Lead Technical focused vendor management meetings and direction.
  • Highlight, escalate and address data quality concerns to appropriate stakeholders
  • Generating and providing regular status reports on data quality
  • Maintaining a close relationship with application delivery groups maintaining a view on schedule delivery vehicles for Foxtel applications and device updates that impact on data availability and/or quality.
  • Audit acceptance test cases and the teams that write them
  • Audit and create and/or modify analytic tracking plans

Your capability

  • A capacity to recognise trends in data
  • Education of a minimum Degree level required, ideally in an analytical discipline such as mathematics, statistics, econometrics, actuarial studies, computer science etc.
  • Minimum of 1 year experience actively working with JSON, HTTP, AWS S3, AWS Redshift, SQL, XML based technologies Viso, MS Project (and other Office apps) expertise mandatory
  • Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence preferred
  • Exposure and understanding of Audience Measurement (ie Nielsen/OzTam), and ratings preferred
  • Understanding of VAST, IAB standards, DASH video technologies is desirable
  • Familiarity with tools such as SQL, R and SAS to provide ad hoc support.
  • Previous exposure to Data Warehouse processes will be advantageous

What\xe2\x80\x99s in it for you?

As well as a meaningful role working with a company that effortlessly connects Australians to all the stories they love, the Foxtel team has access to a great range of benefits including a free Foxtel subscription, discounts and cash-back offers from a long list of retailers, competitions and giveaways, and our health and wellbeing program.

We are customer heroes, we challenge the norm, we make it easy, and we make it fun!

'

title: NA
description:
b"

This is a large iconic Australian organisation with an enviable reputation and work environment. The position's objectives will be to become expert in the structure, coding and toolsets used to implement CA and then to help develop and extend its application to key areas of the business. The position requires data analysis skill in extraction, merging and transformation of large data sets across systems and database environment, with experience in designing analytical approach, identifying key findings, and producing output for non-technical audiences.

Job Responsibilities

  • Be the initial point of contact for users of Risk & Assurance applications - Protecht (WORMS), PAWS and ACL
  • Development and maintenance of continuous monitoring applications / scripts
  • Assist with data analysis and planning in preparation for assurance reviews and special projects
  • Undertake IT related risk and assurance reviews
  • Assist in the preparation of Management Reports and Board / Committee Papers

Key skills and experiences

  • 2+ years of experience in ETL and data analysis
  • Exposure to the use of ACL, Oracle, TSQL, PHP or VBA coding exposure
  • Knowledge of SAP, including relationship of key tables, how data is stored, security features & key TCodes
  • SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Service), SSIS (SQL Server Integration Service) advantageous
  • Familiarity with risk management systems (e.g. Protecht, Cura, Active Risk, or similar) highly regarded
  • Management of Internet services (IIS) at departmental level
  • Operating systems, i.e. Windows and Unix
  • HTML, CSS
  • ODBC connections

To indicate your interest please apply via the link or call Eugene on 94094710 for a detailed and confidential discussion

title: Data Engineer - New project work
description:
b'
  • Dynamic & non-corporate environment
  • Work with industry leaders
  • Key role on new projects

Our client is a leading provider of data and machine learning applications. They are currently enjoying a period of growth and are looking for an enthusiastic Engineer to manage the data environments.

You will work alongside a small and talented team of Software Engineers and Mathematicians on a wide variety of interesting and challenging projects.

This is a pro-active role that will see you liaising with the business, modelling and programming teams, set up databases, finding the data from multiple sources around the world, loading the data, testing the data and filling the holes.

To be considered for this role, you will have the following:

  • 5 years+ commercial experience working in IT or similar
  • Experience working as a DBA or Software Engineer in Database heavy roles
  • Experience with large databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres etc
  • Programming experience with c++ or C# an advantage
  • The ability to think outside the box and solve data related issues by constantly searching for and delivering the best data available
  • Top-level communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Ability to shift priorities effectively as business requirements change
  • The ability to work autonomously and take effective ownership data related projects by delivering on time

This is the perfect opportunity for someone who is passionate about data and is currently feeling frustrated working as purely a DBA or Software Engineer in the corporate world. The successful candidate will need to show drive and enthusiasm to help the business by delivering the best data available.

Interviewing now. APPLY NOW or call Simon Haynes on 0405 186 257 for more information.

\xc2\xa0

'

We have an exciting opportunity available for a dynamic individual to join our vibrant and energetic team. title: Senior Commercial Analyst
description:
b"

Role Title

Senior Commercial Analyst

Location

North Ryde, Macquarie Park

Rewards

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits on offer

About Us

Smith & Nephew is a diversified advanced medical technology business that supports healthcare professionals in more than 100 countries to improve the quality of life for their patients.

We have leadership positions in Orthopaedic Reconstruction, Advanced Wound Management, Sports Medicine and Trauma:

  • Orthopedics Reconstruction - joint replacement systems for knees, hips and shoulders
  • Advanced Wound Management - wound care treatment and prevention products used to treat hard to heal wounds
  • Sports Medicine - minimally invasive surgery of the joint
  • Trauma & Extremities - products that help repair broken bones

We have over 15,000 employees around the world. Annual sales in 2016 were more than $4.6 billion.
We are a constituent of the UK's FTSE100 and our shares are traded on the London Stock Exchange and through American Depository Receipts on the New York Stock Exchange (LSE: SN, NYSE: SNN) .

Summary

Commercially astute, analytically focused and able to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders, the Senior Commercial Analyst plays a key role in data analysis, management and dissemination to support strategic decision-making, particularly related to assessment of our market and potential commercial opportunities.

Essential Job Functions

  • Strategic and Business planning: Work with Commercial Finance to prepare ANZ submissions for Regional/Global Strategic Plans and Budgets
  • Commercial Analysis: Provide accurate and timely analyses to support commercial decision making and evaluation of business opportunities related to tenders and contracts, business development, new product introductions and other strategic decisions
  • Build and maintain Strategic Intelligence capability:
    • Identify, collect and analyse data related to our business and our market to generate insights and support commercial, decision-making. This includes working with third party data vendors and analysts
    • Create and maintain market models for all business units
    • Create and maintain relevant platforms, forums and materials to disseminate information on the business and the market to relevant Internal stakeholders
    • Develop decision-support tools e.g. return on investment calculators etc. as required

Requirements

Education:

  • Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline e.g. Accounting, Finance, Business or Commerce is preferred

Experience:

  • A minimum of 3 years experience in an Analyst role in the healthcare sector, preferably in the Medical Technology or Pharmaceutical Industries
  • Demonstrated market and financial modelling skills
  • Proven ability to work with complex and large datasets

Competencies:

  • Well-developed stakeholder management skills
  • Strong commercial/business acumen and ability to comprehend and critically evaluate data to identify and communicate key insights to relevant stakeholders
  • Highly numerate with strong analytical skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Driven and self-motivated with a high level of initiative
  • Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills

Technical knowledge:

  • Advanced level Microsoft Excel
  • Experience generating analyses using Business Intelligence tools (COGNOS or similar)

Scope

This role reports to the Market Access & Competitive Intelligence Manager. Key internal stakeholders include the Managing Director and Leadership team, Sales and Marketing, Commercial Finance, Corporate Accounts and Regional/Global Business Intelligence and Strategic Planning functions. Key external stakeholders include 3rd party data vendors and Analysts.

Applications

Smith & Nephew is committed to helping people regain their lives by repairing and healing the human body. We believe that this can only be achieved by establishing mutually beneficial relationships with all of our stakeholders including patients, healthcare professionals, investors ad employees. If you share our passion for innovation and can demonstrate how you meet the criteria outlined, we would love to hear from you.

We continue to actively build an environment where every individual can fulfill their potential and be proud ambassadors for Smith & Nephew, our customers and their patients. We value the diversity of our people and welcome applications from everyone.

"

title: Administrator Recruitment
description:
b"

Have you got what it takes to join a team that's full of activity, drive and enthusiasm?

Here is your opportunity to join a national company that\xc2\xa0recognises\xc2\xa0achievements and success!

Putting the effort into your career at HOBAN will see you rewarded with a competitive salary, a professional highly motivated team to work with and not to mention the opportunity to progress your career within the recruitment industry.

title: Product Support & Data Administrator
description:
b"

Who we are?

Innovation Group delivers customer solutions and support through Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) for the global insurance, fleet and automotive industries. Innovation Group employs over 3,000 people world-wide, operating from offices in UK, France, Spain, Germany, Poland, Belgium, USA, India, South Africa and Australia. The Group serves over 1,200 clients comprising 15 of the top 20 global general insurers and 3 of the top 5 fleet and lease management companies globally.

The Opportunity

The Product Support & Data Administrator will be responsible for providing advice, guidance, problem solving, and query management, in support of our B2B e-commerce platform 1link Service Network, using various methods including inbound telephone calls.

The role includes recording details of customers, maintaining an accurate database of call statistics, supplying ongoing over the phone user training, and as a secondary element of the role collating and updating our automotive databases in support of our B2B solutions.

The Applicant

The successful candidate will have the following duties:

  • Ability to receive inbound calls and emails from customers and assist them with their requirements,
  • To manage platform issues and liaise with customers in a timely and agreed manner, from initial report to resolution,
  • To provide advice, knowledge and support in relation to product issues for internal and external customers,
  • Managing new dealer set-up's,
  • Maintaining our customer and automotive parts and service databases.

The successful candidate will have the following attributes:

  • Excellent communication both written and verbal,
  • A passion for the auto industry,
  • Good operational understanding of Microsoft products including Windows, and Office (Word, Excel, Access), products.
  • Strong understanding of automotive parts and manufacturers.

Due to the high volume of applications received, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

"

title: Data Delivery Manager
description:
b'

  • New role in developing a leading strategic data capability
  • Location: Melbourne, VIC and Sydney, NSW
  • Application close date: 4th May 2017

ORIGIN - AUSTRALIA\xe2\x80\x99S LEADING INTEGRATED ENERGY COMPANY

An integral part of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

Origin offers exciting and rewarding career opportunities - from project management and leadership, to technical and engineering. Working for Origin can take you all over Australia - in the field, as well as in the office - or around the world. With global energy demand growing, Origin is looking for new ways to meet that need and create tomorrow\xe2\x80\x99s energy solutions. It\xe2\x80\x99s an exciting time to be a part of Origin.

The Role

Acumen Metering is a leading Metering Provider providing metering services to retailers and their electricity and hot water consumers. Acumen has over 100,000 meters under management and is implementing a program of large-scale deployment of digital meters throughout the National Electricity Market.

Developing and delivering a leading data capability is a strategic priority for Acumen and this exciting, newly created position plays a pivotal role in achievement of current and future business objectives. Specifically, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have overall accountability for delivering significant value from the use of meter data and revolutionising the way this is used by the number of programs and stakeholders relaying on this data, including Power of Choice.

This position operates within a dynamic and commercially focused environment that requires a clear understanding of the meter data market, regulations and the customer's needs. With the introduction of Power of Choice, it\xe2\x80\x99s expected that the Data Delivery Manager will provide strategic and visionary input into the Acumen Metering leadership team, ensuring that the transformation of this business meets the new and exciting emerging requirements.

Reporting to the National Manager of Operations and Delivery, this role is suited to an experienced technology leader who can demonstrate thought leadership, an ability to drive innovation as well as partnering with business customers to deliver a best in market meter data service. This position operates within a commercially focused environment that requires a clear understanding of the meter data market, regulations (governed by the National Electricity Rules) and the customer\xe2\x80\x99s needs.

Your core accountabilities will include:

  • Delivery of meter data that complies with the National Electricity Rules and to meet customer and stakeholder requirements
  • Provide leadership and support to stakeholders and team members of a diverse team located across Australia and overseas
  • Manage an operations focused team (offshore and onshore) that deals with high volumes of data, focus on exception management and complex, time critical priorities
  • Ensuring that our meter data delivery capability continues to grows rapidly to meet business and customer requirements
  • Delivery of meter data services for other metering services such as water and solar to meet customer expectations
  • Operational management of any customer portals to make data available to customers

Is This You?

Potentially coming from either a Technology Data or Billing Data leadership background, this role requires a blend of strong technical skills, commercial acumen and an ability to partner with a variety of business stakeholders. Success in this role will also be your proven ability to manage teams in highly operational and transactional environments, as well as your implementation and project management skills.There are on call components to this role that apply on Saturdays.

At Origin we promote a flexible workplace culture and we\xe2\x80\x99re confident that together we can work out when, where and how you work - so that you can enjoy work and have life balance too.

We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

MAKE AN IMPACT ON AUSTRALIA'S ENERGY FUTURE
If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.

For more information, please contact Nezar Asyo on 03 8665 7551.

Job Requisition: 45863\xe2\x80\x8b

'

title: Major Account Manager - Software Defined Networking (SDN)
description:
b'

Listed on the NYSE, with operating revenue of about USD$1b. They were founded to pioneer and deliver cloud networking solutions for large data centre storage and computing environments. Recognized by Gartner as a "leader" for Data Center Networking" they offer high growth, technology solutions and flexible software, delivered worldwide through distribution partners, systems integrators and resellers and a strong partner community.

Job Description:

Exciting opportunity for a Major Account Manager. The purpose of this position is to generate qualified leads and develop new customers in conjunction with the strategic channel partnerships. The candidate should have experience in both developing end user client relationships with enterprise organisations and the partner community.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage and grow new customer relationships and revenue associated with data center networking products.
  • Prospect and develop new potential customers (Resellers) via telephone by qualifying and tracking leads, researching and identifying key contacts, placing calls to establish business relationships, qualifying new accounts and making sales.
  • Participate in marketing program planning, development, execution and measurement to ensure that programs succeed according to plan.
  • Interfaces with headquarters to coordinate sales and marketing activity.
  • Take initiative in getting necessary training and certification on all products
  • Monitor client satisfaction and elevates issues of dissatisfaction for quick resolution.
  • Sets own priorities and schedules to meet established goals; meets commitments consistently.

Key Requirements:

  • Sales experience in data networking equipment, software, and/or services, particularly with Value Added Resellers/Distributors and Systems Integrators in datacentre markets.
  • Very strong communication and listening skills, ability to establish rapport over the phone, ability to build credibility quickly, and clearly articulate a value proposition
  • Strong customer service orientation and ability to develop and maintain relationships
  • Knowledge of competitive products, solutions, and services
  • Professional in appearance with solid business acumen and the ability to present and negotiate
  • Strong time management and ability to multi-task; takes initiative and follows through
  • Desire and ability to move into a leadership position as the business grows
  • Strong work ethic and commitment to integrity
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent required

Whats on offer? The OTE is 300K + super, on a 50/50 split + RSU,s - phone, notebook, WiFi, car mileage reimbursement, etc. The targets will be circa USD $4m per annum, but that equates to about 10 deals of average size a year; they have big chunky customers that you will be allocated.

If this sounds like you, please apply below by attaching your resume and a cover letter. Alternatively email your resume and cover letter to Bevan Stephenson -bevans@halcyonknights.com.au ONLY shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

For other exciting job opportunities and to keep up-to-date with the IT world, please 'Follow' Halcyon Knights on LinkedIn @www.linkedin.com/company/halcyon-knights

'

title: NA
description:
b'

A great opportunity for a Market Data Analyst / Data Scientist to join Australia's leading developer of retail planning products and database segmentation solutions. RDA's unique web-services are used by some of Australia's largest and most successful corporations.

\xc2\xa0

What we do\xe2\x80\xa6

RDA Research's web-based retail planning and segmentation solutions are supplied through our geoTribes branded segmentation products and geoTribes Explorer web service. We have partnerships with leading research companies and market our products in Australia, New Zealand and North America.

RDA is at the leading edge of applying market research data in retail planning, database enhancement and digital media targeting through our proprietary synthetic population and data fusion models.

\xc2\xa0

About the role\xe2\x80\xa6

You will be responsible for delivering data analysis projects using client data and building statistical databases for our web portals.

You will develop your understanding of business problems and have a key role in the development & application of our products, working closely with our clients and data partners.

You will develop your technical skills in statistical analysis, modeling, geodemographics, retail network analysis, big data, SAS programming and other analytical\xc2\xa0disciplines.

\xc2\xa0

Ideal qualifications\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Tertiary graduate in a relevant quantitative discipline, eg. statistics, science, economics or psychology.
  • Strong academic record.
  • An avid and continuous learner with strategic problem-solving skills.
  • Experience using statistical analysis tools, SAS preferred.

\xc2\xa0

Key requirements\xe2\x80\xa6

  • An understanding of how statistical analysis works to solve business problems.
  • A proven track record in data analysis & experience in statistical database production.
  • Ability to take responsibility for running & prioritizing projects, with on-time delivery.
  • Experience in programming eg. R, SAS, Python, Visual Basic or SQL.
  • Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
  • Enjoy working as part of a small, professional team.
  • Strong graduate applicants will be considered.

For more details about RDA visit our website at www.rdaresearch.com


To apply for the above position, please use the Seek link and include your academic record. Please note that only short listed candidates will be contacted.

No recruitment agencies please.


'

Do you want to join one of the most forward thinking Global Data and Technology Companies out there?\xc2\xa0 We are looking for an Digital Ad Operations Assistant to join the team.\xc2\xa0 This is a great opportunity to join us, work on leading clients and develop data driven marketing strategies, powered by a connected system of technology, tools, consultants and digital activation.\xc2\xa0

Annalect is the digital, data, technology and analytics division of Omnicom Media Group. We have provided data driven marketing solutions for marketing problems across the globe for over 5 years.


Why you\xe2\x80\x99ll love us:

title: Business Development Manager | IT Hardware | SYD
description:
b'

What's in it for you?

This is an exciting opportunity to work with a leading data cabling and server cabinet distributor and manufacturer delivering high quality products and services. They are offering an above market base salary, dependent on experience, between $80,000 - $120,000 + Super + uncapped Commission. You will be joining a company who is developing their presence in the Australian market in terms of distribution, but who\xe2\x80\x99s factory is well established. A company who has quickly built their reputation with clients by providing exceptional services and delivering on results. Whilst you are expected to be self-motivated and driven to learn and contribute to the growth of the company, the company is also eager to help expand your own personal skills and ultimately your career. You will have full access to provide the full suite to your customers, along with the support of senior management and technical support. They are looking to expand rapidly over the course of the next 12 months and here is a strong chance to progress within the company.


What will you be doing?

Reporting to the General Manager and working with 2 other colleagues, you will be responsible for increasing market share and profitability. Hunting new business through your network within the industry and through creative sales strategy, you will be part of a team that will help coordinate the sale to make sure you can close with the best result. Meeting with the management team towards the start of the week, this role will see most of your days out on the road working autonomously, managing effective relationships as well as your own professional development. Your interest in technology will see you keeping abreast and up to date with current and emerging technologies and proactively share your knowledge, skills and experience. As a whole, you will address customers\xe2\x80\x99 needs, research the market as well as competitors and deliver solutions that not only generate great relationships but also create and follow Go To Market service and product offerings. Being a manufacturer and a distributor, means you can seamlessly put together solutions and proposals with quick, direct answers in regards to solving customer needs.


Who will you be doing it for?

They offer a wide array of AV and Network materials such as cabinets, cables, connectors, wall plates, rails, wall mount brackets, projector screens and more. Their product line is growing by the day and so is their global presence. A key principle is that business is built on relationships and on-going commitment to provide the very best and latest products/services. They want the right individual to grow, learn from senior professionals and make their mark in a fun, growing and exciting company.

You must have to apply to this role:

  • Over 7 years\xe2\x80\x99 sales experience in IT/Electrical distribution & wholesale industry.
  • Must understand networking, cabling, data products and above Hardware.
  • A strong network of connections within the data centre supplies or related industries.
  • Proven IT industry awareness
  • Ability to build professional relationships
  • Independently drive the potential expansion on product range Strong business acumen
  • Drive for results

All you have to do to apply for this exciting sales role is submit your resume to Matthew Rowles via the "Apply Now" button below. Send your CV ASAP as I will be screening applicants from the moment this ad goes live. If however, you want to know more about this unique opportunity or similar sales roles, you can call me for a confidential chat on my direct line 03 9283 9077.

Only successful applicants will be contacted.

'

title: Data Analyst
description:
b"

Assetlink Group is an Australian owned integrated facilities services provider and global asset management technology company We provide both individual services and tailored integrated solutions through our two divisions, Assetlink Services and AssetFuture.

Our AssetFuture division is a global leader in asset optimization, using our leading edge asset condition and cost based technology, with a \xe2\x80\x9cWhole of Life Planning\xe2\x80\x9d approach that includes operation, maintenance, renewal and disposal. Our vision is to improve communities by enabling a range of organisations to make significant cost savings, enabling evidence based decision making and improvements to be made to the services they provide.

We are looking for building data analysts to join our team on a full-time basis, for a 3 month contract with possibility for extension, to be data stewards as a pivotal, frontline role in the data governance framework. The data analyst will be responsible for cleansing, transforming, validating or analysing data with the purpose of understanding or drawing conclusions from the data in order to drive clinical and operational decision-making for clients and management.

With a firm grasp of the technology, the intention would be for the role to evolve into presenting data in charts, graphs and tables as well as designing and developing algorithms for relational databases to operate autonomously.

Analytical Skills: Data analysts work with large amounts of data: facts, figures and number crunching.

Communication Skills: Must communicate methodology and findings well with team members and ancillary resources.

Attention to Detail: The conclusions drawn from this data analysis will drive critical business decisions and recommendations. Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.

Math Skills: Understanding of basic statistical methods.

Programming Skills: This role requires an understanding of programming logic, although no experience with a specific programming language is required. Familiarity with SQL, Tableau will be an important part of the data analyst role.

Overall Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Must be comfortable working with clients, team members, and other stakeholders in the organization
  • Have the ability to interpret their intent and application
  • Demonstrates the ability to handle a variety of responsibilities under pressure
  • Must be able to function independently
  • Demonstrates good communication skills
  • Background knowledge in building fabric and services preferable

If you're able to adapt on the run, execution driven individual with a commitment to improving society, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the 'Apply' button below.

"

title: SQL Data Analyst
description:
b"

Equifax powers the financial future of individuals and organisations around the world, using its strength of unique trusted data, technology and innovative analytics. Equifax offer their customers world leading insights and knowledge to help them make informed decisions.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Are you looking for the next step in your career? In an entrepreneurial and collaborative environment? Then our position as a SQL Database Analyst should be your next move.

\xc2\xa0

We are looking for someone with strong SQL experience who will be responsible for designing, developing, maintaining, managing and administering Equifax's database management systems. Through manipulating large sets of data, the Database Analyst will determine data quality and recommend data improvements.

\xc2\xa0

This is however a diverse role and will also include .Net duties as well as working on both project and BAU activities. We are therefore looking for a candidate who is flexible and able to cope with changing workloads.

\xc2\xa0

Duties of this role will include:

  • Analysis of data using SQL, Excel and SSIS
  • Provide technical assistance and advice
  • Use data sets and database design knowledge to recommend, build and implement data solution
  • Develop, enhance and maintain.Net applications

\xc2\xa0

Simply put, the required skills are:

  • Degree qualification in a relatable subject
  • Strong SQL Server skills
  • .Net experience
  • High level of database knowledge \xe2\x80\x93 database design and modelling
  • Strong data analysis skills and experience
  • Problem solving ability
  • Drive to get to the bottom of issues
  • Experience with large data sets
  • Experience with reporting tools
  • Strong communication skills

\xc2\xa0

Why apply for this role and join Equifax?

  • Opportunity to work with the latest technology and all the kit you want
  • Chance to work with Cambrian data set- both supporting and building
  • Opportunity to work with high volumes of data and develop a career within big data
  • Our culture; entrepreneurial, creative, collaborative and energetic

\xc2\xa0

This really is a great opportunity to join an industry leader not only in the local market but the global market.

\xc2\xa0

If you feel you have the required competencies to fulfil our needs we invite you to apply.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: NA
description:
b"The Company
\xc2\xa0
Our client is an Australian-owned ICT services and solutions company which has been catering to Australia's enterprise companies for the past 15+ years. Their personalised service is focused on delivered high-powered results and excellent client services and technical support for any circumstance. Recently the company has acquired a large government contract and is also branching out to focus more on SMB level clients to drive market growth.\xc2\xa0

Where experience in some form of Technical Support is essential,\xc2\xa0full product training and support will be provided.


The Role

The Technical Support Engineer will be responsible for actively providing support to Enterprise-level clients for the company's solutions and services. You will also work as a technical advisor and product advocate to clients and customers. The TSE must be able to develop and maintain existing client relationships throughout the sales cycle as well as maintain partner satisfaction to the company's standards.

The Culture

There is a fantastic laid back culture to the business. Most of the individuals are self-motivated, driven sales professionals and are treated accordingly. As a reward for your efforts, the company is willing to offer a generous bonus structure to ensure that (coupled with a generous salary) you can achieve your financial goals.

The company is heavily focused on internal promotion and will always look inwards before going outside the company. We seek the very best sales professionals to fit in with the enthusiastic, vibrant sales team that the company has managed to build and develop.

The Candidate

You will have:
  • Technical background;
  • 3+ years relevant experience in technical support (preferably Enterprise level);
  • Experience and familiarity of data cloud management software;
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Domain Environment, Active Directory, Email Servers (Exchange and others) SharePoint Server, Group Policies deployments, Windows Services;
  • Working knowledge of MAC OSX, Tomcat/Apache Server, Proxy Server;
  • Understanding of Android Apps installation and configuration;
  • Understanding of virtualisation and cloud infrastructure.
If you fill the above criteria and are interested in the role. Please apply now and send me through your resume. "

title: NA
description:
b'

Our Place

Stockland was founded in 1952 with a vision to "not merely achieve growth and profits but to make a worthwhile contribution to the development of our cities and great country". Today we reflect this vision by helping to create thriving communities where people live, shop and work as one of the largest diversified property companies in Australia. Our approach is underpinned by our purpose "we believe there is a better way to live". This is brought to life by over 1,400 employees who are guided by our values of community, accountability, respect, and excellence (CARE).

Your Role

In this role you will be responsible for delivering business outcomes and providing support for Stockland's IT infrastructure.

Key responsibilities include:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing third level support consisting of troubleshooting, diagnostics and resolution of escalated technical issues

\xe2\x80\xa2 Participating in project work relating to system upgrades and new services as directed

\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in monitoring of all servers and infrastructure and resolve any problems identified

\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the infrastructure is installed and maintained

\xe2\x80\xa2 Build long term value for all stakeholders

About You

To be successful in this role you will ideally at least 5 years' experience in 3rd level infrastructure support or systems administration. You are skilled at managing vendor and key business relationships and you have an emphasis on service delivery. You will be solutions focused with strong analytical skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical problems.

Experience with Cloud infrastructure, SCCM, Citrix XenApp, Citrix XenDesktop with SAN based administration and operations, will see you succeed in this role.

Importantly you understand the value of working as part of a team, you strive for excellence and have a willingness to assist others.

Why Stockland?

At Stockland, we value diversity and aim to create a vibrant and inclusive workforce which is reflective of the communities in which we operate. We also value flexibility and are committed to ensuring it is not just supported, it is encouraged. We want employees to work in ways that suit their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments and support their wellbeing. Stockland could be 'your place' too.

Apply today - Stockland - It's your place

'

title: Compliance and Reporting Analyst
description:
b'
Procurement Services \xe2\x80\x93 Strategic Procurement
Reference no. 782/0417\xc2\xa0

  • Utilise your high level analysis skills
  • Get involved in using data to drive real change
  • Remuneration Package: $97K which includes leave loading and 17% superannuation

\xc2\xa0
About the opportunity\xc2\xa0

A critical part of the Finance department, Procurement Services supports the University to meet future challenges in the Higher Education Sector, it aims to satisfy the University\xe2\x80\x99s requirements for external goods, services and capital works in order to deliver excellent educational and research outcomes and demonstrates additional value to the University through the continual development of Procurement capability.

We are currently seeking to appoint a Reporting Analyst to be responsible for providing analytical support to the Procurement Services team in the areas of spend and process analytics, compliance monitoring and benefits tracking, as well as supporting in the provision of timely and accurate management reports to support relevant stakeholders across the University. This role will also support the maintenance and effective communication of procurement processes and procedures, specifically in relation to monitoring the accuracy and currency of the Procurement Services intranet site to ensure that our stakeholders can find the correct information easily.
\xc2\xa0

About you

The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance in recruiting talent aligned to these values in the pursuit of research excellence. We are looking for a Compliance and Reporting Analyst who possesses:
  • tertiary qualifications in Business or Commerce or relevant discipline
  • the ability to analyse and grasp key concepts and issues quickly and translate strategy into practical applications and solutions
  • excellent communication skills (written, verbal and listening)
  • the ability to analyse, report on and present complex quantitative and qualitative data
  • superior customer service skills coupled with a can do attitude and able to demonstrate concern for meeting and exceeding the needs of the customer
  • highly developed problem solving skills, including thinking outside the box and the ability to exercise good judgement
  • experience in an analytical role in a large, complex organisation
  • significant experience in liaising with and providing data to stakeholders whilst working within the confines of process and compliance requirements
  • experience in managing risk and compliance frameworks

About us

Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We\xe2\x80\x99re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across 9 campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 47,000 students.
\xc2\xa0
We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job\xe2\x80\x99s listing on the University of Sydney careers website.\xc2\xa0

All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.\xc2\xa0 Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number to apply.
\xc2\xa0
Closing date:\xc2\xa05pm 17 May 2017\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.
\xc2\xa0
If we think your skills are needed in other areas of the University, we will be sure to contact you about other opportunities.

\xc2\xa9 The University of Sydney\xc2\xa0

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.
\xc2\xa0
'

title: Market Risk Analyst
description:
b'
  • Leading Financial Institution
  • Great opportunity to step into financial markets/market risk
  • Up to $85,000K Inc Super
  • 12 Month Fixed Term Contract

My client is a renowned financial institution and seeking a market risk analyst to work in their market risk team. The position will involve oversight and monitoring of traded market risks and risk management processes associated with the Interest Rates, Equities and Commodities (Electricity). This is a unique opportunity for someone with less than 3 years of experience in financial risk analytics and looking to move into traded market risk. This is also a great opportunity for someone with a data analytics background and strong programming skills (R, SQL or VBA) and looking to get into financial markets.

Key Duties

  • Support the production and delivery of market risk reports to senior stakeholders and regulators.
  • Assist in the development of internal models and limit frameworks for market risk
  • Analyse data and report market risk exposures

The successful candidate will need to have at least 2 years of experience within a data analytics domain, preferably in market risk or financial markets. Ideally we are seeking candidates with strong data modelling and analytics skills especially in R, SQL or VBA.

For more information please contact Maria Shevelev at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2612

( SK912965A )

IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.

http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

'

title: Modeller - 3D CAD
description:
b'

The City of Sydney is the local government authority responsible for the city centre and more than 30 suburbs within the council boundaries. The council provide services for more than 200,000 residents and 20,000 businesses, as well as the daily influx of workers and visitors into the City. On any given day, the local population swells to more than 1 million with people commuting, doing business, shopping, playing, studying, or here to see the sights of Sydney.

We have a current requirement for a Modeller - 3D CAD to manage the currency of the City of Sydney 3D Model Data. You will also be responsible for the analysis of policies and procedures, for providing support services for Council and the Central Sydney Planning Committee (CSPC), assisting with systems improvements, customer queries and possible assistance at Neighbourhood Services Centres.

Key Responsibilities;

  • Efficiently manage a caseload of various Initial Data Extractions in a timely and effective manner to assist in achieving Council\xe2\x80\x99s vision for quality development in the City and ensuring legal requirements are met;
  • Assist the Manager Urban Design and Heritage and Senior Modeller/Team Leader in day to day operations and on special projects;
  • Contribute to the development of effective procedures and practices for the operation of the Unit;
  • Assist in the implementation of new systems, as required.
  • The position holder will prepare, using the City\xe2\x80\x99s 3D CAD software, Initial Data Extractions, which will consist of sections of the City\xe2\x80\x99s 3D data overlayed with a survey accurate site plan spatially referenced to NSW Dept of Lands grid coordinates
  • Prepare supporting technical evidence for planning professionals to submit on behalf of Council in the Land and Environment Court Providing comment on development proposals referred to Council from Planning NSW.
  • Check and assess all new physical models submitted with development applications to ensure they meet standards of fit and quality.
  • Transport and present physical models to CSPC and Council Meeting
  • Provide technical assistance in the development of planning instruments and policies, as required;

Key Selection Criteria

  • Successfully completed an accredited 3D CAD modelling course.
  • Demonstrated extensive experience in 3D modelling.
  • Highly developed 3D modelling skills.
  • Well-developed image editing skills.
  • Familiar with Microstation by Bentley Systems (2D Minimum)
  • Some experience with cross 3D CAD platform file import / exporting.
  • Customer service experience
  • Ability to balance the competing interests of applicants, authorities, residents, ratepayers and other stakeholders in the City;
  • Physical ability to meet the manual handling requirements for assisting in the transporting of architectural scale models for presenting at council meetings.
  • Demonstrated commitment to Equal Employment Opportunity, Occupational Health and Safety and Cultural Diversity principles.

Please contact Olivia Faydherbe for further information on 02 9277 7000.

'

title: Helpdesk Support | Motor Damage Assessment
advertiser: Ensure Recruitment  Seek Award Winner   Best Small Specialist
description:
b'

Join a highly regarded organisation who provide an outsourced solution for clients\xe2\x80\x99 automotive fleets.\xc2\xa0 Customer service is at the core of everything they do.

\xc2\xa0

THE ROLE:

\xc2\xa0

  • Providing IT Support to new customers, taking them through the online portal where all automotive repairs are input
  • Dealing with fleet management companies with queries on the process and where the vehicle is during the repair process
  • Creating new client profiles on the system
  • Patiently answering questions on how to perform task on the system
  • Researching and compiling data regarding service and repair timelines

\xc2\xa0

ABOUT YOU:

\xc2\xa0

  • With experience in IT Helpdesk Support with a strong interest in cars/mechanics
  • Outstanding communication with the ability to convey answers concisely to clients
  • Strong research and data compilation (Excel) skills to provide statistics to the business

\xc2\xa0

THE BENEFITS:

\xc2\xa0

  • Salary to $60,000, depending on experience
  • Join a small team, where you will be supported and also allowed to handle your workflow independently
  • Opportunity to take on additional work in the future
  • Easy going working environment, where you will be trusted to work efficiently.
  • Free parking

\xc2\xa0

TO APPLY:

\xc2\xa0

This is an immediate permanent opportunity, suitable candidates will be contacted within 24 business hoursHelp

'

advertiser: Talent \xe2\x80\x93 Winner \xe2\x80\x98Seek Large Recruitment Agency of the Year\xe2\x80\x99 3 consecutive years!
description:
b'A hugely successful global data insights SaaS company are looking for a Senior Project Manager to join their impressive and talented team. This innovative company are breaking records while having fun, and are experiencing unprecedented growth - join as a part of their leadership team while working on complex, exciting and ground-breaking projects. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
This is an integral role, you will act as the fundamental link between clients, sales, and project execution. You will be responsible for end-end management of market research projects, managing client relationships, balancing multiple projects concurrently, and ensuring customer satisfaction remains high. If you are passionate about using data to its full potential, and have a passion for helping clients make incredible data-driven decisions, and are also an impressive and detail-oriented project manager with a proven track record of delivering successful projects, then this may be the role for you.
\xc2\xa0
You:
  • Relevant degree or tertiary qualification
  • 5+ years' experience leading complex projects
  • 5+ years of market research/data analytics experience Familiarity with CRM based Solutions
  • Familiarity with SaaS and web technologies
  • Confident in stakeholder management
  • Excellent communication skills, relationship building skills, and able to work as a part of a team.
  • Positive, energetic, motivated and tenacious with high standards of customer service.\xc2\xa0

Being a team player is a MUST! You will have experience managing and mentoring a team. As a part of a global team, you will be expected to be able to collaborate globally and across a number of disciplines - supporting different teams and customers. As this is a client facing role, experience with managing customer expectations is essential, as well as being driven to deliver the best outcome of the project to the customer's satisfaction. You will be required to build strong, open and honest relationship with the customers and communication will include project reviews, and user and technical level communication.
\xc2\xa0
On top of an awesome opportunity to join a booming company that continues to go from strength to strength, you will also be offered a very generous salary package - and their "work hard, play hard' ethos ensures there are many perks!

For more information or to grab a coffee, please contact Lauren on (02) 8240 9547. Or to apply, please send your CV directly to: lauren.johnson@talentinternational.com
\xc2\xa0 '

title: Service Electrician
description:
b"
  • Generous Hourly Rate Negotiable Dependent on Experience + Superannuation
  • Electrical Contracting Group Specialising in Installations of Data, Fibre, Security & Lighting Solutions
  • Take Advantage of an Amazing Role that Offers On-Going Training and Development
  • Great Package on Offer Including Hourly Rate, Vehicle, Mobile, Uniform & Overtime Penalty Rates
  • Medium Sized Multi Skilled Business with a Friendly Culture | Huge Variety of Clients and Workload


Our Client

Our client is an electrical installation and maintenance company working on many projects of varying scales, from small additions to complete installations. With many regular clients from high-end residential, specialist schools, transport facilities, strata and commercial offices, our client prides itself on establishing and maintaining a close working relationship with their customers.

The Opportunity

Our client is seeking a Service Electrician to join their company working in the Sydney Basin Area, NSW, with the potential to earn a generous hourly rate | negotiable salary + superannuation + vehicle + phone + travel allowance + uniform.

The primary purpose of this position is to complete ad hoc electrical and communication installations and fault finding.

Reporting directly to the Service Manager some of your responsibilities include:

  • Power and lighting installations
  • Data cabling and fibre optic cabling installs
  • Electrical service work and fault finding

To be successful in this role you will have 3+ years experience post trade licence, an electrical trade licence along with a current driver's licence. Additionally, an industry white card and own hand tools are essential.

Candidates who possess a cabling registration and/or an elevated work platform license will be highly regarded for the position.

The ideal candidate will have the ability to work alone, strong levels of communication, time management skills, and a confident attitude.

Apply today and don't miss out starting this amazing opportunity and advance your career as soon as possible.

"

title: Principal Analyst - Project Portfolio
description:
b'
  • Want a rewarding career with Government? Join Transport for NSW!
  • Finance and
    Investment / Group Finance / Budget Reporting and Performance
  • Transport
    Service Grade 9 ($123,116-$137,889), plus employers contribution to
    superannuation and annual leave loading
  • Permanent Full
    Time Opportunity
  • Chippendale Location (close to Central station)
\xc2\xa0
The opportunity
\xc2\xa0

We have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Analyst Project
Portfolio to be a part of Finance and Investment team within Transport for NSW.
This position plays a key role in collecting, researching and analysing complex
data regarding performance and reports to the Manager Project Portfolio.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

  • Undertake research and analysis to
    provide robust input to the assessment of whole-of-life project portfolio
    performance of all live projects and to the provision of advice on budget
    implications, allowing for mitigating actions to be implemented, if required.
  • Develop and implement models to
    support the forecasting of anticipated risks to planned whole-of-life project
    portfolio performance and provide input to reviews and interventions to
    projects of concern.
  • Analyse and track the effect of
    anticipated and actual changes (i.e. additional allocations through FIC, ERC)
    to identify funds being utilised/progressed, mitigate risk and enable effective
    management of funds.
  • Undertake project portfolio project
    reviews, assessments and evaluations to track key performance indicators and
    provide insights and recommendations regarding corrective action as necessary.
  • Research, develop and provide a range
    of reports, briefings and specialised papers, particularly for large and
    complex projects, to regularly track and evaluate information and provide
    commentary on progress for the information of management across the cluster.
  • Analyse trends and developments to
    provide commentary, advice and insights on future directions, potential risks
    and issues and best practice on whole-of-life project portfolio management.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

We are looking for a Principal Analyst Project Portfolio who can
implement appropriate controls to ensure compliance and who has experience in maintaining
a currency regarding emerging technologies and how they might be applied to
support business outcomes.

\xc2\xa0

For more information on
this position, view the role description
here.

\xc2\xa0
About us
\xc2\xa0

At
Transport, our vision is for a truly integrated transport system that will meet
the needs of our customers now and into the future. The Transport portfolio
includes Transport for NSW as principal agency with Sydney Trains, NSW Trains,
State Transit Authority and Roads and Maritime Services as our key operating
agencies.

\xc2\xa0

We are a values based
organisation and\xc2\xa0 employ the most
talented people to work together to deliver services for our customers and make
NSW a better place to live, do business and visit.

\xc2\xa0
Benefits
\xc2\xa0

At
Transport we offer employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities
for career progression, learning and development and flexibility.

\xc2\xa0

We provide
comprehensive staff training through structured programs and provide study
assistance to staff pursuing work related courses.

\xc2\xa0

Our commitment to
Diversity \xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

TfNSW are committed to building a
diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and
promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse
community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander,
LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW
recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and
customers in delivering the future of NSW.

\xc2\xa0
Essential requirements
\xc2\xa0

Tertiary
qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience.

\xc2\xa0

Extensive experience in analysing and reporting on large portfolios
of projects in a large infrastructure environment, preferably in government



Please note: The successful candidate will need to undertake
background checks and criminal record checks.

\xc2\xa0
How to apply
\xc2\xa0

To apply for this position, please submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than
two pages) which addresses:

  1. the reason for your interest, and
  2. how your skills and experience suit the role.
\xc2\xa0

For more
information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click\xc2\xa0here or for more information on
Transport for NSW please click on link provided.

\xc2\xa0

Should you have enquiries about the role, please contact Alex Kraska on
02 8202 2376.

\xc2\xa0

For assistance on how to apply online, please contact Hansleen Nandra
on 02 8574 3775 and quote 0000598W.

\xc2\xa0

If you encounter technical issues please contact I Work for NSW Support
Team on 1800 562 679 (Mon-Fri) or support@jobs.nsw.gov.au

\xc2\xa0

Applications close: 11:59pm,
Sunday 21 May 2017.

'

title: Principal Analyst - Project Portfolio
description:
b'
  • Want a rewarding career with Government? Join Transport for NSW!
  • Finance and
    Investment / Group Finance / Budget Reporting and Performance
  • Transport
    Service Grade 9 ($123,116-$137,889), plus employers contribution to
    superannuation and annual leave loading
  • Permanent Full
    Time Opportunity
  • Chippendale Location (close to Central station)
\xc2\xa0
The opportunity
\xc2\xa0

We have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Analyst Project
Portfolio to be a part of Finance and Investment team within Transport for NSW.
This position plays a key role in collecting, researching and analysing complex
data regarding performance and reports to the Manager Project Portfolio.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

  • Undertake research and analysis to
    provide robust input to the assessment of whole-of-life project portfolio
    performance of all live projects and to the provision of advice on budget
    implications, allowing for mitigating actions to be implemented, if required.
  • Develop and implement models to
    support the forecasting of anticipated risks to planned whole-of-life project
    portfolio performance and provide input to reviews and interventions to
    projects of concern.
  • Analyse and track the effect of
    anticipated and actual changes (i.e. additional allocations through FIC, ERC)
    to identify funds being utilised/progressed, mitigate risk and enable effective
    management of funds.
  • Undertake project portfolio project
    reviews, assessments and evaluations to track key performance indicators and
    provide insights and recommendations regarding corrective action as necessary.
  • Research, develop and provide a range
    of reports, briefings and specialised papers, particularly for large and
    complex projects, to regularly track and evaluate information and provide
    commentary on progress for the information of management across the cluster.
  • Analyse trends and developments to
    provide commentary, advice and insights on future directions, potential risks
    and issues and best practice on whole-of-life project portfolio management.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

We are looking for a Principal Analyst Project Portfolio who can
implement appropriate controls to ensure compliance and who has experience in maintaining
a currency regarding emerging technologies and how they might be applied to
support business outcomes.

title: BI Development Engineer Lead
description:
b"

The Company\xc2\xa0

Coca-Cola Amatil (CCA) is one of the largest bottlers of non-alcoholic ready-to-drink beverages in the Asia-Pacific region and one of the world's top five Coca-Cola bottlers. CCA operates in six countries - Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, Fiji and Samoa. CCA employs 14,900 people across the Group and has access to 270 million consumers through more than 700,000 active customers.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

The Role

Do you enjoy working in a genuine \xe2\x80\x9cBig Data\xe2\x80\x9d environment?

We currently have an exciting opportunity available for an experienced BI Development\xc2\xa0Engineer Lead\xc2\xa0to join Coca-Cola Amatil\xe2\x80\x99s innovative and technologically advanced team.\xc2\xa0 You will enjoy providing expert guidance and output on development practices including solution design, solution architecture, coding standards and engineering practices.\xc2\xa0

In this role, you will have technical ownership of projects across a domain specialty, be a conduit between third party vendors and the business to define, manage and monitor engineering practices across a specialty area and coach and mentor other team members on code quality.

This role will require someone who has the flexibility to work on a rotating roster because from a business continuity perspective for our Production areas, you will be required to work as User Tech Support one in every six weeks.

Requirements:

  • Experience designing and leading complex Microsoft BI implementations
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft, including SSIS, SSRS, SSAS and Power BI
  • Agile Methodology
  • Experience in large data warehouse environments

\xc2\xa0

About You

The ideal candidate will can explore customer needs appropriately and has a high degree of customer focus and creativity in generating customer solutions.\xc2\xa0 In addition, you will be able to define technical solutions that meet the business objectives in consultation with all project stakeholders and display a solid understanding of broader business goals.\xc2\xa0 Relevant degree qualifications (i.e. Computer Science) and experience in managing enterprise level solutions both bespoke and off-the-shelf will be highly regarded.

\xc2\xa0

The Benefits

At CCA we value being straightforward and open and encourage our people to take initiative and we focus on today and tomorrow. These values are the basis of how we do business and are the foundation of our culture.

CCA fosters an environment where people are encouraged to innovate and contribute to the continuing success of our organization. We can offer highly unique career opportunities to skilled and dedicated individuals who enhance and add value to our business, providing uncompromising commitment to customer satisfaction.\xc2\xa0We will offer the successful person a highly competitive salary and our benefits include staff sampling of products across the CCA range of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Full Stack .NET Developer
description:
b'

Lucsan is an innovative risk and data analytics products company with a passion for providing data driven products to our customers.

Our high-performance product team is expanding\xc2\xa0and has a position open for\xc2\xa0a strong and passionate Full Stack .NET Developer. The ideal candidate would be someone with solid front-end experience, software development/technical background in an enterprise environment and a very strong command and understanding of latest Cloud Analytical and Data Platforms.

You need to have:

  • C# .NET / .NET core
  • JavaScript / Typescript
  • Test Driven Development
  • SQL Server Skills

We want:

  • Front-end : Experience with JS Frameworks e.g. Angular 1, 2, 4,\xc2\xa0 React, VueJS & viz libraries
  • C# .NET / .NET core : Microsoft identity, OAuth and OAuth2, OData, AutoMapper
  • Databases : Cassandra, PostgreSQL, MongoDb

About the Role

You will be a part of our high-performance team engaged as a Full Stack Developer supporting the development of an innovative risk and predictive modelling system with a rich user interface. The role requires extensive practical hands-on experience and an ability and passion to learn new technologies.

This is an exciting opportunity to develop a cutting edge, global data analytics product with exposure to some of the latest tech and approaches in this field. Strong Analytics and Data driven initiatives skills as well as Cloud based experience is an absolute must for this role. More information will be provided if your skills and experience match our requirements. \xc2\xa0

About You

You are highly motivated, sharp, and ambitious and enjoy collaborating in an integrated and multidisciplinary team within a changing, dynamic and agile environment where opportunities for training and development are provided. You are experienced in delivering cutting edge technology with a focus on user experience, product design and cloud based analytics solution.\xc2\xa0You are a team player who likes to collaborate with exceptional inter-personal skills and ability to perform at high level to meet deadlines.

Required experience:

  • Full stack .Net experience
  • .Net architectural knowledge
  • Develops elegant and maintainable code
  • Experience in working in an agile and test driven environment

Required Technical skills:

C# .NET / .NET core

  • WebApi 2
  • Entity Framework
  • Dependency Injection / Inversion of Control
  • Unit Testing with NUnit / XUnit and other tools
  • Razor Views and ASP.NET MVC 6
  • Linq

Front End

  • jQuery
  • Bootstrap
  • Native JavaScript
  • HTML 5
  • CSS / Less / SCSS

Database

  • MS SQL 2008+

Our Work Environment

We are a diverse company with an open team atmosphere. Our people are positive and collaborative with strong ethics. If you are looking for challenging, significant projects and a good work-life balance, please contact us on iryna.hrushevska@lucsancapital.com

To apply for this role, please provide your resume.

'

title: NA
description:
b'

SBS is expanding its programmatic division, part of the Digital Commercialisation team. We work closely with Sales and the Digital Campaign Managers to set up, optimise, report and deliver on all types of programmatic campaigns across video and display on all SBS platforms.

Seeking a quick learner, an analytical mind and a keenness to roll your sleeves up and get into our data management platforms, audience segmentation, programmatic trading and ad serving systems.

Prior experience in a trading desk, agency, ad tech or publishers digital environment is a must, as well as a demonstration of experience with reporting, data analysis and digital programs such as excel and API\xe2\x80\x99s.

  • Set up, manage and report on all programmatic deals
  • Train Digital Campaign Managers and Sales team on programmatic tools and strategies
  • Use reporting and analysis skills to maximise yield for all programmatic deals
  • Responsible for management of all video volume deal commitments in ad server and any third party platforms
  • Management of all audience segmentation in data management platform
  • Work towards automation in reporting and collaborate with BI teams Skills/experience
  • Some experience from agency , publisher, ad tech or trading desk
  • Understanding of programmatic deals
  • Video experience and/or display media
  • Analytical skills in data and site analytics, intermediate experience using Excel spreadsheets
  • Experience in using a DMP, ad server, supply or demand side platforms and reporting API\xe2\x80\x99s

To apply online, please go to http://sbs.com.au/careers

'

title: Modeller - 3D CAD
description:
b'

The City of Sydney is the local government authority responsible for the city centre and more than 30 suburbs within the council boundaries. The council provide services for more than 200,000 residents and 20,000 businesses, as well as the daily influx of workers and visitors into the City. On any given day, the local population swells to more than 1 million with people commuting, doing business, shopping, playing, studying, or here to see the sights of Sydney.

We have a current requirement for a Modeller - 3D CAD to manage the currency of the City of Sydney 3D Model Data. You will also be responsible for the analysis of policies and procedures, for providing support services for Council and the Central Sydney Planning Committee (CSPC), assisting with systems improvements, customer queries and possible assistance at Neighbourhood Services Centres.

Key Responsibilities;

  • Efficiently manage a caseload of various Initial Data Extractions in a timely and effective manner to assist in achieving Council\xe2\x80\x99s vision for quality development in the City and ensuring legal requirements are met;
  • Assist the Manager Urban Design and Heritage and Senior Modeller/Team Leader in day to day operations and on special projects;
  • Contribute to the development of effective procedures and practices for the operation of the Unit;
  • Assist in the implementation of new systems, as required.
  • The position holder will prepare, using the City\xe2\x80\x99s 3D CAD software, Initial Data Extractions, which will consist of sections of the City\xe2\x80\x99s 3D data overlayed with a survey accurate site plan spatially referenced to NSW Dept of Lands grid coordinates
  • Prepare supporting technical evidence for planning professionals to submit on behalf of Council in the Land and Environment Court Providing comment on development proposals referred to Council from Planning NSW.
  • Check and assess all new physical models submitted with development applications to ensure they meet standards of fit and quality.
  • Transport and present physical models to CSPC and Council Meeting
  • Provide technical assistance in the development of planning instruments and policies, as required;

Key Selection Criteria

  • Successfully completed an accredited 3D CAD modelling course.
  • Demonstrated extensive experience in 3D modelling.
  • Highly developed 3D modelling skills.
  • Well-developed image editing skills.
  • Familiar with Microstation by Bentley Systems (2D Minimum)
  • Some experience with cross 3D CAD platform file import / exporting.
  • Customer service experience
  • Ability to balance the competing interests of applicants, authorities, residents, ratepayers and other stakeholders in the City;
  • Physical ability to meet the manual handling requirements for assisting in the transporting of architectural scale models for presenting at council meetings.
  • Demonstrated commitment to Equal Employment Opportunity, Occupational Health and Safety and Cultural Diversity principles.

Please contact Olivia Faydherbe for further information on 02 9277 7000.

'
