title: 5x SaaS Product Support Engineers - (Linux, Java, RoR, Python, Golang) $75-100K
description:
b"This top tier data analytics company is rapidly scaling its first office in Sydney. They have a phenomenally powerful, fully integrated, cloud-stack Saas monitoring tool that is revolutionising the way companies operate. Founded in New York with over 300 staff globally and an ever growing, seriously impressive A-List of big name clients joining up! This is now the time to be a part of their journey in their beautiful new offices located in Pyrmont, Sydney.

The role:

The Support Engineers are some of the most important people in the company, the front-line to making the customers happy and helping them be successful. This position provides the opportunity to dive headfirst into the complexities of technical systems monitoring and you must be able to learn quickly while thinking on your feet.
\xc2\xa0
You will have exposure to some or all of these technologies - Linux, Java, Ruby on Rails, Python or Golang BUT you only need to have an entry level understanding of one of these languages and lots of passion to learn to be considered.
\xc2\xa0
In a typical day you will be checking Slack, looking at what has been happening in other regions, being assigned or assigning tasks to help solve customer queries, pairing up and troubleshooting technical issues together where necessary. Contributing to innovative side projects, adding to internal documentation and learning over 150+ tools, API's and plugins. You will be speaking to customers on the phone or working with them face to face on-site and these positions will offer constant learning with lots of variety in your day to day...
\xc2\xa0
The ideal person will be eager to join a start-up culture where they will be challenged constantly but also get to immediately witness their contribution to the company.
\xc2\xa0
What you will do:
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Join a tightly knit team of generalists solving hard problems the right way by being intelligent, prompt and resourceful.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to customer requests, quickly, accurately and with a smile.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Reproduce issues and file bugs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build out documentation, including writing API examples.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Driving product conversations based on needs and problems learned during client
\xc2\xa0
What tech skills we want to see:
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong technical trouble shooting with customers, comfortable with at least one of these languages - Java, Ruby on Rails, Python or Golang.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of Linux, Sys Admin, DevOps would help.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Plenty of gusto to learn quickly and share with the team.
\xc2\xa0
Who you will be:
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 You're a tinkerer with some programming experience and a basic knowledge of Linux
\xe2\x80\xa2 You're a critical thinker who defaults to a customer-oriented demeanour
\xe2\x80\xa2 You're self-motivated, detail-oriented, and willing to learn
\xe2\x80\xa2 You're a master at one thing: tell us all about it
\xe2\x80\xa2 You want to work in a fast, high growth start-up environment\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Bonus Points:
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Comp Sci or Engineering degree
\xe2\x80\xa2 Active contribution to open-source projects (code, bug reports, etc.)
\xc2\xa0
If this role sounds like your next challenge please contact me - jay@hyre.com.au
"

title: Business Support Manager
description:
b"
  • Provide high- level support to UNSW Science Executive Team
  • One of the largest and most complex UNSW Sydney faculties
  • Project management projects aligned with Strategy 2025 implementation

Data driven business operations and process improvements \xe2\x80\x93 excellent research, analysis and communication skills essential.

\xc2\xa0

About the role:

  • Fixed term (12 months)
  • Maternity leave replacement

As the Business Support Manager you will support and drive UNSW's ambition to establish itself as Australia's global university, a global leader in discovery, innovation, impact, education and thought leadership.

Reporting to the General Manager, Science, you will provide support to the Dean, General Manager and Associate Dean's, to analyse and report on Faculty performance and project manage initiatives aligned with the implementation of Strategy 2025.\xc2\xa0

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Provision of background materials for the Dean's engagement activities
  • Content preparation including research, analysis and translation of data
  • Market research and analysis
  • Leading projects to support business improvement and new initiatives
  • Meeting facilitation
  • Data analysis and management of Faculty research and performance data
  • Management of Faculty grants schemes

\xc2\xa0

Skills and Requirements

To be considered for this role, you will possess:

  • Excellent organisational skills
  • An ability to convey technical results to senior management
  • A high level of interpersonal, leadership and negotiation skills
  • Experience in putting together briefing papers and policy related documents
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Previous experience in analysing and reporting on large data sets
  • Demonstrated ability to undertake advanced analysis and present statistical data in an informative way
  • Tertiary qualifications ideally from Mathematics/Statistical/Commerce background \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

This is an exciting time to join UNSW and work where your data analytic and relationship building skills will support and compliment a busy and diverse Faculty.

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

\xc2\xa0

To Apply

Please submit your resume and cover letter (addressing the selection criteria) as soon as practicable. Please note all documentation must be in pdf format.

\xc2\xa0

Contact

Clare Connelly,\xc2\xa0Talent Acquisition Consultant,\xc2\xa0Clare.Connelly@UNSW.edu.au



"

title: Systems Manager  Business Continuity Advisory
description:
b'

About the team

Group Security are accountable for group-wide frameworks and assurance relating to protective security, fraud & corruption control, reporting of fraud and unethical behaviour, and business continuity and crisis management.

The role of Systems Manager \xe2\x80\x93 Business Continuity Advisory, sits within the Group Business Continuity Management (GBCM) team, a division of Group Security. GBCM is responsible for ensuring the Group is prepared for disruptive events and meets its regulatory obligations in relation to Business Continuity.

About the role

The focus of this role is to support and enhance the Business Continuity (BC) application that leverages real-time data sources from within the Group and provides analytical capabilities in relation to business disruption risk.

You will need to be able to analyse, communicate and validate business requirements for continual improvement; understand the business problems/opportunities; recommend solutions that enable the organisation to achieve its goals; and ensure these requirements are brought to life through development and implementation in the system.

You will do this through:

  • Effectively interpreting business needs and translating them into project objectives, scope, features, process and detailed specifications.
  • Critically assessing, analysing and evaluating proposed solutions in order to reach the most appropriate outcome, with a strong focus on customer experience, functional analysis and design.
  • Developing and maintaining effective business relationships with key customers across the Group.

What does success look like?

You will possess practical and demonstrable experience working in software development, business analysis, IT consulting or related area. Advanced MS Office suite and SQL knowledge would be an advantage.

This is a high performing team that possess strong internal and external customer service ethic and focus. Your ability to prioritise work, keep business objectives at the forefront of decision making, and strong stakeholder management skills will see you excel in this role.

Tertiary qualifications in a related field are essential, with ideally exposure to Banking systems/tools.

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we\xe2\x80\x99ll support you at every stage of your career.

'

title: Delivery Manager
description:
b'

Suncorp Group includes leading general insurance, banking, life insurance and superannuation brands in Australia and New Zealand. The Group has 13,500 employees and relationships with nine million customers. Suncorp Group is a top 20 ASX-listed company with $96 billion in assets and aims to create engaging and simple propositions that focus on meeting customer needs and enabling them to manage their financial journey seamlessly.

About the role

We currently have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Delivery Manager to join our Technology, Data & Labs (TDL) group. The Delivery Manager sits within the customer platform Digital function within TDL and is responsible for leading a high performing team to deliver digitally enabled products, initiatives and services. Based in our Sydney office, the Delivery Manager employs a coaching and mentoring approach to engage and empower their team to take accountability for delivery, risks and issues whilst utilising lean and Agile methods. Projects will be varied in size within a fast paced work environment due to the nature of Digital. The position will require a strong people leader managing a team of up to 40 employees and have the ability to influence leaders when change is required.

As a Delivery Manager, you will

  • Ensure that delivery team purpose and objectives are clear and linked to the broader Group vision, strategy and customer roadmap.
  • Translate business objectives into streams of work, aligning technology and business strategy.
  • Work closely with Iteration Managers, Project Managers and other leaders to deliver initiatives and products utilising lean and agile project management methods.
  • Coach and empower delivery teams to take accountability for delivery, risk and issue management and assisting by removing blockers.
  • Application and/or Platform ownership including facilitation of critical incident management and technical roadmaps.
  • Empower and support product owners and delivery teams to invest in application health, balancing application and platform ownership responsibilities with project delivery.
  • Provide coaching, mentoring and professional development opportunities (i.e cross-skilling and role exposure) for team members in line with career development plans.
  • Enable and support Strategic Delivery Partners to optimise and deliver valued outcomes from partnered resources.
  • Develop a team environment that supports team engagement and high performance in a diverse, distributed and partnered team.
  • Proactively manages and addresses performance issues in delivery team members.
  • Builds strong relationships with internal customers, stakeholders and integration teams to ensure delivery is smooth and customer centric.
  • Provide technical advice and direction to teams and customers with a view to inform business strategy, and deliver technical solutions, that drives innovation and business outcomes in an Agile way of working.
  • Provide advice and thought leadership to ensure successful design and implementation of technology strategies that align with divisional corporate goals and strategies.
  • Manage team operations, including portfolio planning, resource, financial and risk management.

The ideal candidate will have the following

  • At least three (3) years in either a Delivery Management, IT Manager or comparable role
  • A passion for digital with previous experience of high-availability application ownership and IT operations in a large organisation
  • Previous experience leading mid sized high-impact delivery teams in a distributed model to deliver on projects
  • Demonstrated ability to be flexible, adaptive and resilient in a fast changing environment
  • Excellent knowledge of and experience in the application of agile and lean practices

  • Experience in program management or project management, with the ability to manage several projects concurrently

So what's in it for you

  • Ability to advance your career in a top 20 ASX-listed company that has a strong focus on personal development
  • Competitive salary and bonus with awesome Suncorp employee benefits
  • Flexible working arranging arrangements

If you are a strong leader, who is motivated by the idea of a new challenge and empowering teams, then please apply now. For more information, please contact Phil Jarratt in the Recruitment Team on Phillip.Jarratt@suncorp.com.au.

'

'

title: IT Operations Manager - Data Analytics
description:
b'

Role: IT Operations Manager - Data Analytics

Location: Sydney, CBD

Term: Full Time

\xc2\xa0

QBE Insurance Group is one of the world's top 20 general insurance and reinsurance companies, with operations in all the key insurance markets. QBE is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange and is headquartered in Sydney.

\xc2\xa0

The Opportunity:

QBE is embarking on a journey to setup a leading data and analytics capability globally across all 37 countries that QBE operates in. The capability is being setup on the cloud and will consist of a wide variety of tools, technologies and Services. The capability is being built by working hand in hand with multiple product and technology services vendors and is one of the key strategic programs at QBE. QBE also has a variety of other Analytics applications and operations in progress, globally.

\xc2\xa0

About the Role:

We are looking to hire an experienced "Analytics Operations Manager" to lead the support and management of the Analytics platform and applications at QBE. The role will have global coverage and visibility within QBE and is expected to work closely with QBE analytics teams (group and divisions), vendor partners and the QBE internal IT teams.

Your responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:

  • Act as the single point of contact (SPOC) for the Analytics teams and business units globally
  • Provide solutions for Analytics model development and operationalisation by recommending the optimum utilisation of Analytics application / platform capabilities to deliver the project outcomes\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Support the Global Data and Analytics Platform and ensure that all capabilities are utilised optimally and are functional
  • Ownership of the support triaging process to identify root cause and issues as well as to recommend next steps
  • Scope and appropriately plan for any strategic requirements, improvements or configuration changes, including conducting user and business impact assessments
  • Drive enhancements by reviewing architecture work products to ensure quality, traceability, effectiveness and timeliness of the solution and capabilities

\xc2\xa0

You will need to be able to display you have the following qualifications and experience:

We are looking for someone with experience in IT - Data and Analytics and other related large transformation program & support functions. To be successful in the role you will ideally have an understanding of technologies to support analytics, solution design involving data and analytics tools and IT support. We are also looking for someone with a solid understanding of cloud technologies, especially Microsoft Azure.

\xc2\xa0

As this is a newly created role this gives you the opportunity to make the role your own. You will have the opportunity to work with senior stakeholders including Heads of Data and Analytics globally.

\xc2\xa0

You will be provided with a competitive salary package and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning.

\xc2\xa0

QBE recognises and supports a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance.

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

\xc2\xa0

If you are a QBE employee, please inform your Manager before applying.

\xc2\xa0

For more information, click the APPLY button to submit your details.

\xc2\xa0

Applications close Sunday April 23rd 2017

'

title: NA
description:
b"
  • Seeking a Marketing Graduate looking to launch their Sales career within the data space
  • Full Sales Training provided within the growing B2B marketing database industry
  • North-Sydney Permanent role

IncNet is the marketing data specialist unit of Database Consultants Australia (DCA), Australia's leading database management and software development Company. IncNet researches the top Australia/New Zealand companies and in the past 25 years has created a globally respected B2B database. Marketers use IncNet to source data for marketing campaigns, to generate and qualify sales leads, verify and enrich internal databases, segment markets, identify market opportunities and maximise marketing ROI.

Due to extreme growth and market demand within our sector, we have created a Sales & Business Development Traineeship program. This is an exceptional opportunity for a highly motivated Marketing Graduate to become an integral part of our closely-knit sales team.

To secure this opportunity you will be a Marketing Graduate who is self-motivated, able to build rapport with varying personalities and someone who understands the importance of superior customer service. Your exceptional relationship building and communication skills have already enabled you to 'stand out from the crowd' and you know that those same skills will assist you carve out a successful career within the corporate world. Most importantly, you will possess a competitive spirit and be passionately committed to achieving the very best at everything you undertake. Some previous corporate experience within the Data/Advertising/Marketing B2B space would be highly regarded but not essential.

For the right person IncNet will provide the essential training, support, diversity of activity and professional environment to ensure that you flourish. There is no doubt that over time you will reap exceptional rewards from your efforts.

Applicants are encouraged to visit www.incnet.com.au and www.data.com.au and explore the total range of possibilities that this opportunity presents.

To find out more about this role, contact Brad Hill on 02 8875 7499 .To apply, please send a current version of your resume to\xc2\xa0careers@data.com.au\xc2\xa0no later than\xc2\xa0Thursday 18 May 2017, quoting reference number\xc2\xa0INC-DST-MAY-17.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Administration support
description:
b'

Management of Court Winding Up applications for sales calls.\xc2\xa0 Maintain spreadsheet of results. Handle email enquiries. Maintain filing systems, databases, tasking schedules.

Key to this role is, accuracy, speed, efficiency, presentation of work and ability to conduct on line searching for relevant information.

'

title: Consultant (BI, Data Warehousing, Analytics, Digital, Big Data) - Sydney
description:
b'

Big Data Consultant

About the company and role:

  • Work for a rapidly expanding niche consultancy specialising in delivering Big Data & Analytics, Business Intelligence, Digital and Cloud solutions for a varied client base across Australia \xc2\xa0and New Zealand.
  • My client has a fun and collaborative team environment where you are encouraged to learn and certification and studies are funded by the company.
  • As a Consultant the role will involve you in a diverse range of customer engagements covering Big Data, Digital, customer Customer Engagement and cloud projects and therefore we are seeking strong IT generalists across all these domains.\xc2\xa0
  • You will enjoy solving problems, have strong business acumen and excellent presentation and communication skills.

\xc2\xa0

Skills and experience sought:

  • Strong background in developing proof of concepts, solution design through to development and testing
  • Background in Programming and Development with strengths in SQL
  • Some infrastructure and cloud based platforms knowledge is required

Ideally looking for strengths in 3 or more of the following Data and Analytics areas:

  • ETL: Talend, SSIS, Alteryx, Informatica
  • Database: SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, PostgreSQL, Greenplum
  • Reporting: PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, Datameer
  • Big data: Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR, Kafka, NiFi, Elasticsearch
  • Analytics: Spark, R, Teradata Aster
  • Programming Languages: Python, SQL, Java, Scala, PHP, .NET, Javascript
  • Frameworks and Architectures: Lambda, ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, NodeJS

If you are passionate about IT and looking for a customer focused consulting role, please "apply now" or for a confidential discussion please call Luke Radford on 02 8089 1406.

'

title: Translational Data Scientist
description:
b'Brain and Mind Centre
DVC Research Portfolio
Reference no. 680/0417

  • Be valued for your exceptional knowledge and experience in Data Science
  • Full time fixed term for 12 months with possibility of 12 month extension
  • Remuneration package: $106K p.a. which includes leave loading and up to 17% super
\xc2\xa0

About the opportunity\xc2\xa0

Reporting to the Brain and Mind Centre Academic Lead for Data Science, the Translational Data Scientist in brain and mind sciences (neuroscience and mental health) will help support research opportunities across all areas of basic, clinical and translational medicine and health.\xc2\xa0 The role will enhance and develop data science projects across Brain and Mind Centre; grow data science capacity to promote discovery; provide support with open-source and proprietary software for generating data visualisations and data understanding; and assist with data access and management.


About you

The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance in recruiting talent aligned to these values in the pursuit of research excellence. We are looking for a Translational Data Scientist who possesses demonstrated expertise in:

  • using complex data sets
  • modern data-centric programming languages including one of Python, R and developmental languages including one of C++ or Java
  • understanding of modern data software and tools, from cloud computing to the many existing commercial products used for data analytics

Further, this role relies on an aptitude for understanding and interpreting researchers\xe2\x80\x99 needs, advising on and providing appropriate data science skills for the research objectives, and communicating and translating this back to the researchers, in an ongoing discussion, to progress and achieve successful outcomes.

The successful candidate will work closely with basic science, clinical research and academic staff working in brain and mind sciences both physically at Brain and Mind Centre and across The University and its affiliated teaching hospitals and research partners.\xc2\xa0


About us

Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We\xe2\x80\x99re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across 9 campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 47,000 students.

We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.


For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job\xe2\x80\x99s listing on the University of Sydney careers website.

All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.\xc2\xa0 Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number to apply.

Closing date: 11.30pm 17 May 2017

The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.

If we think your skills are needed in other areas of the University, we will be sure to contact you about other opportunities.

\xc2\xa9 The University of Sydney

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment. '

title: Lead Data Architect & Analyst
description:
b'

You will work with a small 12 man team of young motivated professional web developers, back end and app developers and marketers to achieve our goals of improving computer learning in schools. You will be responsible for data stored in AWS cloud data warehouses. You will be innovative and will ensure the right data is collected, is of high quality, is stored and maintained well, the right questions are asked of it, and data is visualised optimally. You will work with leaders in this new field, including academics at universities.

Reporting directly to the Software Team Leader, your duties will include:

  • Database design - maintain and build on existing DB design (RDS postgreSQL on AWS) as needed to support the large data set for classroom Learning Analytics product
  • Database programming: designing and modifying stored procedures for storing, verifying and reporting data
  • Implementing data warehouse (RedShift) and other up to date strategies to optimize reporting
  • Maintain database integrity, performance, reliability and security, implementing protocols to achieve these goals.
  • Specifically using latest Amazon tools for database optimization
  • Perform data analytical tasks in relation to educational big data including telemetry, recorded activity data, recorded educational websites.
  • Supervise and mentor one or two junior database programming staff

To be successful in this role, your skills will include:

Essential:

  • Extensive experience in design and development of database structures
  • Experienced in PostgreSQL, stored procedures, PL/pgSQL - SQL Procedural Language and Redshift
  • Alternatively extensive experience with other DB such as MySQL, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server
  • Must have knowledge in least one programming language, e.g. C++, Python for building complex and efficient algorithms.
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science or Mathematics.

We are looking for a person who:

  • Exhibits strong attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of data theory, both of empirical [test] design theory (scientific method) and Measurement theory (Link), categorical nature, missing data, outliers.
  • Critical thinking - to detect dependencies, inconsistencies, improbable data, corruption, outliers.
  • Is an excellent communicator with well-developed relationship management skills.
  • Has a clear focus on internal customer requirements, delivery and results with accurate and efficient working methods.
'

title: Big Data Engineer (Scala and Spark)
description:
b"

Quantium Big Data Engineer

Since 2008, our data teams have wrung every bit of information they can from our clients' data in order to give them the insight they need to make a real difference to their business.

Times and technology have changed, but this remains our goal. Instead of wrangling single, SQL-based databases, our MapR Hadoop platform runs across 200 nodes with multiple clusters using the latest big data technology.

Our industry-leading partners' real-world data sets are growing along with their complexity so we need to bring more developers and engineers into our team. We're hoping that's you.

Working with Scala, Spark and the rest of the Hadoop ecosystem, you'll be building applications to work with unique data sets (some of the largest and most complex in Australia) to make a real difference to our clients.

FAQ:

Is your Scala fully FP?

Not always. We focus on building highly maintainable code so there's often a decision to make on what the best way to go is. We're not purists, but we love to use FP where it's the best solution

How do your teams work?

We work in multi-discipline teams so you'll be working alongside Data Scientists, Analysts, Testers and Devops

What are you looking for in the ideal candidate?

We're looking for Big Data technologists:

You've been working with Scala and love to play with it, you know your way around the Hadoop eco-system with Spark at the top of your go to frameworks

You're a pragmatist, a true engineer and love to solve complex issues

You can also have a conversation about Scalaz without alienating anyone!

Do you have a bullet point checklist for me to check off my suitability?

We know people are not bullet points but sure thing!

You have:

  • Experience developing applications using Apache Spark or similar Hadoop-based big data technologies
  • Experience building\xc2\xa0Scala\xc2\xa0applications, preferably in distributed contexts (if you have a real love of Scala and are itching to move from Java, we'll also consider it)
  • A solid foundation in functional and object-oriented programming with data structures
  • A passion for solving problems and writing efficient algorithms
  • An awareness of considerations around structuring data on distributed systems to support analytic use cases
  • A passion for delivering high-quality, peer-reviewed, well-tested code
  • A love for knowledge sharing, you know what works, but you're also happy to learn new methods and technology

Ok, that's great, but what's in it for me?

Quantium takes care of its biggest asset \xe2\x80\x93 our people. We believe there is more to a successful career than just hard work. To this end we provide a range of personal and professional benefits across\xc2\xa0six broad categories:

Career\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Our exceptional growth means new and exciting career opportunities at Quantium. New clients, new projects or new roles \xe2\x80\x93 our growth plans power bigger and better career possibilities for our people.

Workplace
We work hard but we don't take ourselves too seriously \xe2\x80\x93 ask anyone who has been on one of our annual trips away! Our people have cited 'Fun place to work' as one of the top 5 attributes of working at Quantium. Our world-class offices are fitted out with office games and stocked with food and drink all year round.

Financial
We want our people to feel and act like owners of our business. Quantium's Employee Share Scheme applies to all permanent team members who want a greater share of our growth. We also offer a market leading range of financial and insurance benefits and entitlements.

Health and wellbeing
Healthy body, healthy mind. Quantium believes in promoting ways for you to maintain and improve your health and personal wellbeing. Our team enjoys a range of activities, including group fitness sessions, health advice and various team sports.

Lifestyle
We recognise the need to balance personal and family commitments with your work. At Quantium you have more control over how, when and where you work. We also recognise the importance of holidays and time to recharge so we always do our best to accommodate leave requests.

Family
Quantium understands that family is important. We support the needs and career aspirations of our colleagues with families. From the arrival of a newborn to your child's Christmas concert, we ensure you have the support to spend the time you need with your family.

"

title: Data Analyst & Support Officer
description:
b'

My client is looking for a Data Analyst & Support Officer for an initial 12 month contract working within a Government organisation.

\xc2\xa0

  • Advanced Excel skills are a must for this position, you will need to be switched on in terms of data e.g. what is happening with the data and what it is applying to.
  • It is a very hectic and exciting fast paced work environment so you will need to be flexible and adapt well to change on both a daily basis and within the role.

\xc2\xa0

Key\xc2\xa0Responsibilities:

  • Extract and manipulate routine to complex data, ensuring the accuracy, integrity and relevance of information pertaining to comparative and impact analysis activities to support efficient processes.
  • Comparative assessments, impact analysis, and verify data.
  • Schedule and prepare for meetings, briefings, pool assessments and interviews, preparing correspondence for impacted staff.
  • Contribute to and support the creation, and ongoing maintenance and analysis of complex data sources, and communicate identified risks promptly to the BP Implementation to support efficient processes across the program.
  • Draft templates and other documentation related to the consultation and implementation processes, including at the various stages of the placement process to support consistency and effectiveness across the program.
  • Manage communication channels efficiently and effectively, directing inquiries as appropriate to facilitate the effective operation of the change process across the relevant business area.
  • Gather, collate and provide background information to support informed decision making and planning.
  • Maintain appropriate and accurate HR and records management systems, to ensure the integrity of data and to support the efficient retrieval of information at all stages of the program.
  • Provide panels support during the pooled assessment processes to facilitate a consistent and effective process.
  • Work in collaboration and provide support in recruitment, assessment, placement, onboarding and related processes to enable the delivery of outcomes for the business.

\xc2\xa0

Key Challenges:

  • Experience in facilitating and providing administration support for Human Resources and/or Recruitment within a high volume environment.
  • Excellent MS Office skills, particularly in word, Excel and PowerPoint. Advanced Excel skills are essential including skills in presenting, manipulating and analysing accurate data.
  • Working through a significant period of transformation where changes to structures, processes and cultures will be ongoing and it is critical to maintain confidentiality and deliver to strict deadlines and stakeholder expectations.
  • Keeping both outcome driven and strong customer focus in a complex environment with multiple work streams and high volume and often competing workloads that will challenge the delivery of timely outcomes.
  • Maintaining systems and processes to effectively coordinate the activities of BP Implementation and while providing high quality customer service to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical and written communication skills
  • Experience working in a confidential environment with excellent organisation and coordination skills.
  • Preferably have Visio skills (Microsoft office for org. charts) would be advantageous.
  • Must have SAP experience.
'

title: Hadoop Data Modeller
description:
b'

This Top ASX listed client are looking for an outstanding BI Consultant with strong data modelling as the organisation embark upon a best in class data management practice and push the boundaries of data. My client is looking for individuals with strong experience in Data Modelling and this is non negotiable.

This is a key role for the business and your innovative work will be be rolled out to global subsidiaries and you will have huge impact on the business. In exchange you will have a market leading salary and work in a top team.

The successful candidate will have:

  • Strong modelling skills
  • Agile experience
  • Hadoop experience in a commercial environment will be highly favourable
  • Strong experience of implementing large scale BI platforms
  • Experience with Kimball Data warehousing methodologies and Semantic layer design experience
  • Exceptional SQL query writing
  • Ability to work closely with senior stakeholders and working closely with the Data Architect
  • Excellent communication skills


If this sounds like the opportunity for you get in touch with Leon Young on 0289863147 or better still send your CV to lyoung@morganmckinley.com.au

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

'

title: Master Data Analyst
description:
b'

As the Master Data Analyst, you will ensure the maintenance and accuracy of the companies internal data. You will be reporting into the Financial Controller and will be working alongside the CFO team. You will maintain control over the groups financial information and further enhance financial reporting through effective use of available tools.

You will be:

  • Preparing monthly reports on Key performance metrics.
  • Pro-actively manage finance master data quality processes
  • Perform data cleansing and data quality checks.
  • Run GL Consolidation.
  • Set of exchange (hyperion)

To be successful for this role you will have:

  • Relevant degree
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a similar role
  • Experience in Oracle, SQL, MS Office, Hyperion
  • Strong communication skills - oral and written

To apply online, please click on the link below. Alternatively, to discuss this opportunity further please contact Leonard Coronel on 02 9689 8905.

Follow West Recruitment on LinkedIn to receive the latest industry news and job updates at http://www.linkedin.com/company/west-recruitment-consulting

Please submit your resume in Word format only.

'

title: Analyst
description:
b'

This is a great opportunity to work with a professional, dynamic and innovative business with strong presence both locally and globally. As an Analyst your role will be to support the business on high profile initiatives that help to define and shape strategy through data and analytics.

Key accountabilities will include;

  • Working with complex data assets to identify analytical solutions and opportunities to drive strategic business decisions
  • Partnering with a wide variety of business stakeholders to identify these challenges
  • This role is very much a hands on analytical role; as such your role with involve extracting, manipulating and analysing data in tools including SQL, R and SAS to deliver these insights and recommendations
  • Deep dive analysis, data mining and behavioural analysis

Experience required

  • Proven experience in working within data analytics; a minimum of 12 months experience
  • Strong business acumen and commercial awareness
  • Technical skills in either SQL or SAS essential
  • An appetite for learning and innovation
  • Tertiary qualified

This role would suit someone currently keen to secure an analytical position where you can really see the outcomes and impact of your work.

My client offers excellent benefits that include;

  • Career development opportunities supported by formal and informal training and development and mentoring programme
  • Wellness and lifestyle benefits
  • Company bonus scheme
  • Discounted products and services

Please apply on line, or for more information, please contact Marie Thow at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2640

( SK920044A )

IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.

http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

'

title: Data Scientist
description:
b'

Are you a thinker who can ask the right questions? Are you curious and enjoy diving deep beneath the surface to find an answer to a yet unknown question?

Boral currently have an opportunity for a Data Scientist with the key focus of delivering mathematically rigorous analysis of sales and marketing data to provide insight and the basis for developing models to improve EBIT across all product lines, communication of findings to stakeholders and to educate the organisation in the benefits and practice of data science techniques.

The scope of the role will include support across a sales and marketing team of approximately 250 people and require collaboration in virtual and distributed teams driving outcomes across different geographies and time zones.

While keeping up-to-date with latest technology trends, objectives of the role include;

  • Research and develop statistical learning models for data analysis
  • Collaborate with product management and engineering departments to understand company needs and devise possible solutions
  • Implement new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis
  • Optimize joint development efforts through appropriate database use and project design
  • Create meaningful data visualizations that communicate your findings and relate them back to how your insights create business impact

To be considered, you will possess the below qualifications and attributes:

  • Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in operations research, applied statistics, data mining, machine learning, physics or a related quantitative discipline (preferable)
  • Solid understanding and application of statistical and predictive modelling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms
  • Demonstrated analytical skills and commercial acumen
  • Knowledge of ETL, data processing, database programming and data analytics
  • Extensive background in data mining and statistical analysis
  • Experience with programming languages such as R and Python
  • Advanced skills with SQL and Tableau
  • Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
  • Excellent pattern recognition and predictive modelling skills
  • Collaborative and customer focused approach with advanced written and verbal communication
  • Demonstrated ability to train/coach

This position will be conveniently located next to North Ryde train station and based within a dynamic business campus. Boral is a great place to work, we value your abilities and reward results that drive business success, we share goals and celebrate individual and team success.

If you are interested in applying for this position, please click on the apply now button or visit http://careers.boral.com.au

'

title: NA
description:
b'This is a newly created position to join an existing Testing Practice where you will be a Test Analyst focused on providing manual & automated testing solutions for an on-going business transformation involving the Web Applications and ETL / Data Warehouse testing aligned to the Microsoft BI technology stack.
\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities:
  • Acting as a technical Test Analyst in being able to guide stakeholders on testing solutions and outline the benefits for each of the options.
  • Create and develop test cases, execute test cases and produce test recommendation reports.
  • Development & Testing of web applications.
  • Development & Testing of Business Intelligence (BI) solutions focused on ETL / Data Warehouse - e.g. Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS etc..)
  • Analyse business requirements and specifications to create detailed manual or automated test scenarios and scripts
  • Liaise with the business users, developers and business analysts to gather testing requirements.
  • Communicate and collaborate with other technical resources and stakeholders regarding status, technical issues and delivery of solutions.\xc2\xa0
  • Develop sound knowledge of data management for on-going projects.
\xc2\xa0Skills & experience required:
  • Proven hands-on testing experience involving Business Intelligence (BI) domains - ETL and Data Warehouse.\xc2\xa0
  • Extensive experience in QA around end to end testing, system testing, manual testing, automation testing, & UAT.
  • Proven experience testing web based applications.\xc2\xa0
  • Extensive Testing experience working across the full SDLC with proven and hands-on experience with a variety of testing tools.
  • Automated testing experience with automated testing tools such as Selenium, HP QTP etc..
  • Ability to design and develop test conditions, cases & execution.
  • Experience working within an Agile testing environment.
  • Ability to translate technical specifications into customer/business requirements.
Please feel free to contact Matt Moran on (02) 9199 5602 for more information or for a confidential discussion regarding this rewarding career opportunity. '

title: Senior Manager Monitoring and Supervision
description:
b'

  • Understands and applies data science
  • Creates frameworks, models, and policies to drive audit focus
  • Driver of change & holds self to a high standard

About the role

The main purpose of this role is the design, and build of models to identify risks within AMP's financial planner practices and to guide the audit process.

You will be collecting data from various points including the current audit process, complaints, practice financials and performance, commissions paid and current policies.

Once identified you will need to engage with the audit teams and assist them in their processes.

The team runs in a lean and fast paced environment and is highly visible.

We are ideally looking for someone with an exceptionally strong data science background.

This is a position looking for innovation, broad thinking, and ways of setting up monitoring and supervision that are highly relevant and adaptable to change.

You will be operating at a very senior level within the business and should be comfortable in doing so as well as communicating strategy across the broader team.

There is a focus on self-learning and development as well as identifying training and development opportunities within your team.

Duties
  • Identifies & analyses trends
  • Creates models to negate risk
  • Lead and manage the Monitoring and Supervision team incorporating the Audit, Data Analytics and Insights and Trends functions
  • Provide high quality strategic audit advice, insight, and support to the Head of Strategic Advice Solutions and Compliance
  • Actively learn from industry best practice to build the capability of the team in risk based audits and continuous improvement processes

Skills & experience

  • Proven capability in leading, managing, motivating, and developing a high performing team
  • Well-developed knowledge of the Financial Services industry legislative and regulatory issues, compliance, and standards
  • Leadership and decision making skills to create, and sustain, a culture of accountability, ownership, and delivery
  • Ideally strong understanding and application of data science practices
  • Ability to constructively challenge, consult and advise, whilst maintaining excellent relationships and the respect of senior executives

Why AMP?

Working for AMP means working for a company that empowers its people to make a difference, while providing the support of a highly talented, experienced team. We understand that it is our customers that make us great. And because people achieve their best in different ways, our culture is flexible and supportive, to give you the freedom to focus on outcomes rather than just processes.

Our Culture

AMP is an organisation like few others. We enjoy a culture that recognises individuality yet encourages collaboration, giving real meaning to our work and making a difference to our people and our customers.

Benefits

Access a great range of benefits such as flexible working options, retail discounts, social club, onsite gym, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.

Inclusion & diversity

AMP welcomes people with all kinds of life and work experiences. Our individual differences - and collective strength - make for great employee, customer and business outcomes. What unique insights could you bring to the AMP team?

Ref: EB597419

'

title: BI BA Consultant l Microstrategy, Business Objects
description:
b"A global financial services company is currently seeking a solid BI BA Consultant to join their dynamic team based in North Sydney.

Key responsibilities:
  • Work closely with the BI consultant, Architecture team, Developers, Business Analysts and Testers to deliver end to end, data centric, BI solutions.
  • Design and develop solutions across BI technologies \xe2\x80\x93 ETL, reporting, visualisation and dashboarding technologies and the supporting underlying data structures and data integration, as required, to provide an overall BI solution.
  • Contribute significantly to the design and ongoing maintenance of the data warehouse and govern adherence to design principles.
  • Provide governance of standards and validation of code quality using walkthroughs, design and code reviews and unit tests. Ensure secure application design and development practises are followed.
Selection criteria:
  • 8+ years experience in Business Intelligence analysis and development
  • Skilled and experienced across multiple BI technologies spanning ETL and Reporting/Visualisation/Dashboarding tools. Able to develop well designed, clean, high performing and attractive BI solutions, particularly using visualisation technologies.
  • Experience with Microstrategy, Business Objects, OBIEE, Cognos, SSRS\xc2\xa0
  • Strong SQL/RDMS skills, specifically DB2 and optionally also MS SQL Server
  • Exposure to Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, other BI tools, Salesforce experience and Data Integration tools also an advantage.

SK921110A

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0294645583. Please quote our job reference number: 200164571. "

title: ANZ Sales Manager
description:
b"ANZ Sales Manager
Location: Sydney or Melbourne
Salary: $160k - $190k package + bonuses

Overview
Austcorp are seeking a first class Sales Manager with a strong background within the data centre industry.

Joining part of a global sales team, you will be the first employee on the ground here in Australia. This role will see you building a strategic business and sales plan for the region, with the core functions being to manage existing re-seller relationships; create new relationships; and secure new revenue streams. Product offerings revolve around power solutions, but also encompass cooling, DCIM and environmental monitoring.

Key Requirements
  • Strong network within the data centre industry in ANZ
  • Good technical understanding of power and cooling
  • Proven relationship builder with consultative selling approach
  • Able to work alone with minimal guidance
  • Willing and able to travel both interstate and overseas
If you would like the opportunity to work for a company who are looking to increase their market share in ANZ by 3-4 fold in the next 3 years, and you feel that you meet the above criteria, then please apply for immediate consideration.

To apply please send your CV to Gareth Johnston by clicking the 'Apply Now' button below. (Reference Number )
AustCorp provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment in accordance with federal and state laws.
\xc2\xa0

"

title: Resource Analyst - Organisational Development
description:
b'
  • Flexible working environment
  • State of the art offices
  • Supportive management team
  • Excellent hourly rate\xc2\xa0
  • Varied and complex role
  • Multi $B Infrastructure Project\xc2\xa0
We are looking for an experienced resource analyst who is able to assist with the successful management of organisational resource plans. You will be required to analyse information and data to ensure optimisation of available resources to support the delivery of a major infrastructure project.\xc2\xa0

Key responsibilities will include:\xc2\xa0
  • Coordinate and audit the collation of Resource information and create spreadsheets and personnel databases etc to update and maintain employee data
  • Manage, maintain and process Organisational Change requests, including approvals, and maintain this in Objective to ensure capture of all approved changes to organisational structure and resource management and escalate where relevant
  • Prepare relevant resourcing reports as requested and reporting metrics to highlight trends and share insights to help inform workplace planning decisions
  • Monitor functional mailboxes and respond to internal staff on all queries in a timely and professional manner
  • Assist the Organisation Strategy team as needed with metrics and other adhoc requests to support team objectives
  • Work closely with procurement and recruitment teams to ensure efficient on boarding and off boarding process and procedures
In this pivotal role you will make recommendations that will ensure the required resources are in place to enable delivery teams to meet objectives.

Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field, or experience in a similar role will be key to the success of your application. We are also looking for strong systems, database and computing skills (including use of spreadsheets, graphing, word processing and data manipulation).\xc2\xa0

For a confidential discussion, please call Lucy Brophy on 02 9350 8305. Alternatively you can send your resume in Word format.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Please click on "Apply for this job" below to send your resume for consideration.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Your details will not be forwarded to any companies without prior consent. For a full explanation of our specialist areas and available positions please visit our website at www.constructive.net.au.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
All applications are treated in the strictest of confidence.
\xc2\xa0
SK91598A '

title: Business Support Manager
description:
b"
  • Provide high- level support to UNSW Science Executive Team
  • One of the largest and most complex UNSW Sydney faculties
  • Project management projects aligned with Strategy 2025 implementation

Data driven business operations and process improvements \xe2\x80\x93 excellent research, analysis and communication skills essential.

\xc2\xa0

About the role:

  • Fixed term (12 months)
  • Maternity leave replacement

As the Business Support Manager you will support and drive UNSW's ambition to establish itself as Australia's global university, a global leader in discovery, innovation, impact, education and thought leadership.

Reporting to the General Manager, Science, you will provide support to the Dean, General Manager and Associate Dean's, to analyse and report on Faculty performance and project manage initiatives aligned with the implementation of Strategy 2025.\xc2\xa0

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Provision of background materials for the Dean's engagement activities
  • Content preparation including research, analysis and translation of data
  • Market research and analysis
  • Leading projects to support business improvement and new initiatives
  • Meeting facilitation
  • Data analysis and management of Faculty research and performance data
  • Management of Faculty grants schemes

\xc2\xa0

Skills and Requirements

To be considered for this role, you will possess:

  • Excellent organisational skills
  • An ability to convey technical results to senior management
  • A high level of interpersonal, leadership and negotiation skills
  • Experience in putting together briefing papers and policy related documents
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Previous experience in analysing and reporting on large data sets
  • Demonstrated ability to undertake advanced analysis and present statistical data in an informative way
  • Tertiary qualifications ideally from Mathematics/Statistical/Commerce background \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

This is an exciting time to join UNSW and work where your data analytic and relationship building skills will support and compliment a busy and diverse Faculty.

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

\xc2\xa0

To Apply

Please submit your resume and cover letter (addressing the selection criteria) as soon as practicable. Please note all documentation must be in pdf format.

\xc2\xa0

Contact

Clare Connelly,\xc2\xa0Talent Acquisition Consultant,\xc2\xa0Clare.Connelly@UNSW.edu.au



"

title: NA
description:
b'I am looking for a Data Analyst to join an organisation in Sydney, offering the chance to work on a landmark data health program across Australia.


Why work for this company?

The client is a Large Sydney based company that are offering the chance for a Data Analyst to work on a landmark health program working with health data from across Australia to help improve the lives of everyday Australians. You will be working on one of the largest ever health data sets in Australia and the work you do will directly impact the health of Australians cross the country.

Benefits of working at the company:


  • Excellent Salary packaging options
  • Valued staff\xc2\xa0 with excellent training on offer and a clear path to promotions from within
  • Collaborative culture and supportive team environment
  • Flexible working conditions (Soft Start time etc)
  • Employee assistance program
  • Fixed term contract until July 2018 in line with funding, this could be extended.
  • Based in Surry Hills
What are your operational responsibilities?

In this role you will be responsible for developing appropriate methods to clean, validate and analyse the data and provide meaningful reports to participating practices, including the Department of Health and relevant stakeholders.

You will also work collaboratively within a diverse team across different areas and will be required to engage with stakeholders and team members to identify and present results and information.

Do you have what it takes?
  • Relevant graduate or postgraduate qualifications (e.g. epidemiology, pharmacology, public health, biostatistics)
  • Experience in the analysis and interpretation of complex data - strong preference for Health Background.
  • Strong analytical and programming skills including familiarity with SAS, \xc2\xa0SQL server and MS Analysis Services and Reporting Services
  • Experience implementing quality assurance processes to ensure product quality
  • An understanding of the technical and usability requirements of reports for various stakeholders including GPs
  • Ability to independently solve problems and manage personal work priorities
  • Demonstrated excellent written and oral communication skills as well as organizational and project management skills.
  • Strong negotiation skills and ability to build and manage professional working relationships within research settings
  • A high level computer literacy.

What is the best way to secure this role?

To apply for this role please send your most recent resume. Most importantly, please make sure your resume clearly highlights relevancy to the above requirements.\xc2\xa0

Apply for this job online via the link or send your resume directly to\xc2\xa0Dean Coleman\xc2\xa0by emailing\xc2\xa0dean.coleman @ nesglobaltalent.com\xc2\xa0. Confidential enquiries can be made by calling Dean on\xc2\xa0 02 9696 8016\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


Established in 1978, NES Global Talent provides a complete range of contract and permanent talent solutions to the Oil and Gas, Power, Construction and Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Manufacturing and IT sectors worldwide. With more than 40 offices in 28 countries, we are able to provide our clients with the engineering and technical expertise they need, wherever and whenever it is needed. Offering far more than a traditional recruitment service, we fully support our contractors while they are on assignment with everything from securing visas and work permits, to providing market leading benefits packages and accommodation, ensuring they are safely and compliantly able to support our clients. '

title: Cryptologist Operator
description:
b'

Opportunity

As a Navy Cryptologist Operator (also known as Cryptologic Systems), intercept and analyse radio data transmissions while enjoying:

  • a good salary plus generous superannuation
  • ongoing investment in your personal and career development
  • free medical and dental
  • job security and a good work/life balance
  • rewarding work and world-class training
  • subsidised accommodation
  • a supportive team environment
  • travel and leave entitlements
  • free access to sports and fitness facilities
  • friendships that last a lifetime

All that plus meaningful experiences such as joining humanitarian missions and supporting communities in need.

Your role

If you have good attention to detail, advanced problem-solving skills and the discretion to be entrusted with sensitive information, you could make an excellent Cryptologist Operator (Cryptologic Systems).

In this rewarding intelligence role you will be responsible for the detection, acquisition, identification and exploitation of machine-generated communications. You'll use sophisticated search receivers and other state-of-the-art equipment to intercept electromagnetic emissions that deliver tactical advantage to the Australian Defence Force.

Dependent on your exact role, some of the duties you may perform include:

  • manually tuning or programming radio receivers and manipulating automated systems
  • searching, identifying, analysing and reporting on transmissions of interest
  • utilising state of the art high-tech equipment to record selected or unknown transmissions to enable in-depth analysis of these signals
  • At sea, conducting initial real-time and post intercept in-depth analysis of communications
  • providing tactical indication of possible threats
  • producing technical reports and summaries on transmissions of interest

All Cryptologist Operators (Cryptologic Systems) receive training on:

  • communications theory, including radio wave propagation
  • operation of acquisition, recording, and processing equipment
  • analytical techniques including problem solving
  • communications networks; formats, terminology, and theory of pattern analysis
  • the fighting structure or the 'order of battle' of military forces
  • procedures for processing and distributing intelligence data
  • methods for handling, distributing, and safeguarding intelligence information

In this critical role you'll enjoy the personal satisfaction of having a direct impact on the success of Navy operations. Better still, you will be working for a dynamic organisation that offers a great lifestyle plus opportunities you simply won't find anywhere else.

Sounds good? Then apply now (below).

Salary

  • Fully-paid training
  • Once trained, starting package approx. $66,100 p.a. plus superannuation
  • Numerous other benefits

Location

  • Any fleet unit or shore establishment in Australia
  • Some of your time will be spent at sea

Entry Requirements

  • At least 17 years of age
  • Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Year 10 completion with passes in English, Mathematics and Science (preferably with a Physics component)

If you do not have the required passes you may be eligible to sit an Alternative Education Equivalency assessment. Medical and fitness guidelines also apply.

To be considered for this highly classified role you will need to undergo a detailed security evaluation.

How to Apply

Click on the APPLY FOR THIS JOB button to submit your application. For more information view the full position description here:

Cryptologist Operator (Cryptologic Systems) position description

'

title: Experienced Dental Receptionist
description:
b'

Experienced Dental Receptionist

\xc2\xa0

Job Description

Due to our increasing patient base we need to expand our support team. We are looking for a team player who is dedicated to providing superior customer service and care. Our patients' experience is our top priority. We endeavor to develop strong relationships with all of our patients' to ensure their visits are fun, comfortable, relaxing and positive. We are a progressive and forward thinking practice, so a desire to learn and excel is essential.

This is a permanent position working in our CBD and Maroubra rooms, 4 days / 38 hours per week. Working hours are 7:15am \xe2\x80\x93 5:45pm.

\xc2\xa0

Experienced Receptionist

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Welcoming patients into the surgery
  • Answering telephone calls & enquiries
  • Scheduling patient appointments
  • Entering patient data into practice database
  • Processing accounts and payments
  • General administration duties
  • Ensuring excellent diary management

\xc2\xa0

The ideal candidate should be able to display:

  • Excellent customer service skills and a friendly personality
  • Exceptional diary management
  • Ability to multi-task in a busy environment and work within a team
  • Initiative, time management & flexibility
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Impeccable attention to detail

Dental Experience will be highly regarded.

\xc2\xa0

If you wish to be part of a fun, rewarding environment and have the attributes to fulfill the role\xc2\xa0above please email your resume and covering letter to Laura at ldavies@theorthopractice.com.au

'

title: SAS Analytics Lead - $200K (inc super)
description:
b"Our client is market leading financial services solutions provider with a highly skilled and experienced Analytics division. As the result of the ongoing success of the business and new industry legislations they have a considerable and growing pipeline of Analytics initiatives that need to be addressed. They are currently looking for a seasoned SAS Analytics Lead to join the team and take ownership of high profile projects to be delivered in a complete end to end fashion. As an experienced SAS Analytic Lead the responsibilities of this role will cover but not be limited to;
  • Lead a team of four experienced analytics professional taking responsibility for all traditional line management duties (recruitment, inductions, technical training, professional development, work flow management, quality assurance, etc.)
  • Engaging and managing relationships with key internal stakeholders; developing an understanding of their business units (i.e. challenges and opportunities), identifying key projects and prioritizing initiatives, agreeing timelines and deliverables, etc. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Leveraging strong SAS Programming (SAS Base & SAS Macro) to perform the hands on analysis of data relating to strategic initiatives that may include but not be limited to Customer Marketing, Credit Risk, Portfolio Performance, Collections Strategy, Operational Performance etc \xc2\xa0
  • Proactively analyzing data (in SAS) from specific product portfolios, business units and operational areas to identify opportunities for improvements or areas of risk, giving strategic recommendations on how these can be addressed.
  • Deliver the results of your analysis back to key stakeholders with recommendations on actions to be taken, and future analysis that can be delivered.
As the successful applicant you will come from a proven background working in a highly visible, business facing Analytics role where you have been required to leverage your technical skills in SAS (SAS Base and SAS Macro) to analyze strategic business initiatives that will optimize corporate performance. You will be able to demonstrate;
  • Strong stakeholder engagement skills with ability to develop robust working relationships, build trust, gather and develop project requirements, negotiate timelines and deliverables, deliver and present solutions, cultivating a pipeline of projects taking the business on an evolutionary journey. \xc2\xa0
  • High levels of business acumen and commercial awareness; with ability to quickly grasp strategic concepts, clarify desired outcomes, address ambiguities, and set expectations with limited support and guidance. \xc2\xa0
  • Strong SAS programming skills (SAS Base and SAS Macro) for managing and manipulating large volumes of SAS data, automating SAS data feeds, creating and enhancing SAS data assets.
  • Analytical project experience in environments that may include but not be limited to; Product and Portfolio Analysis, Operational Analytics, Customer Contact Strategy (Campaigns, A/B testing, ROI analysis etc), Risk and Fraud Analytics, Credit Scorecard Development etc \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Experience leading a team of SAS analytics professionals will prove highly advantageous.
  • A strong self-starter with the ability to manage your own work flow and deliver solutions on time in a fast passed environment.\xc2\xa0
This an exceptional opportunity for you to join a hugely successful and rapidly growing financial services organization with a major focus on data and analytics. You will get the opportunity to grow with the business and gain exposure to a variety of initiatives as the business scales and new teams are formed.
\xc2\xa0
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "
