title: Internet Marketing Statistician/Analyst - Permanent Full-time Role
description:
b"

About Us.

ITSM Digital is a well-established online marketing and data management company located in the heart of Bondi Junction, full of people helping to solve interesting problems using a wide variety of technologies. You'll be working with a great team of professionals, participating in monthly and quarterly events, taking in sweeping views of Sydney harbour, and enjoying great perks such as drinks, fitness sessions & gym facilities provided for free! At close to 300 people, we have the security of a big company but the fun and the culture of a small one. There's always room to learn and grow your career path, plus we are literally drowning in data.

Who we're looking for.

We're looking for a smart, personable, friendly and talented Digital Business Analyst to either lead or join our ever growing BA team. You should be passionate about learning, problem solving, and digging into the data to help guide the company.\xc2\xa0 Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must. You will be responsible for taking projects from problem definition, right through to model design and final implementation. This will require using large data sets from a MS SQL database and other sources.\xc2\xa0

What you'll be working on.

Our company is heavily data-driven, with most business areas relying on efficient and effective delivery of stats, models, or answers based on the customer data. This insight is used to guide the decision making and direction of the company. Here data is King. You'll be regularly interfacing with teams from all business areas, from marketing, through to customer support, fielding their requests for analysis of a particular experiment, problem, or model, all based on the available data.

Responsibilities.

  • Responsible for taking projects from problem definition, right through to model design and final implementation
  • Building digital attribution models, statistical models and segmenting customers
  • Number based cost benefit analysis
  • Mentoring other team members and growing their skill set
  • Reviewing customer data to identify trends and opportunities for the marketing teams and wider business to support business initiatives
  • Presenting the analysis and outcomes of the projects or models
  • Simplifying the stats so that anyone can understand them
  • Growing your skill set and analysis capabilities

Must haves.

  • 1+ years experience as an analyst or similar role for a digital business (working for a digital publisher or marketing\xc2\xa0 or ecommerce organization\xc2\xa0a plus)
  • Advanced skill\xc2\xa0with Excel
  • Knowledge of SQL, databases, and manipulating data
  • Experience building models and deriving insights
  • Proven ability to work with data and analytics to drive actionable insights to improve digital products
  • Knowledge of data and statistical modelling techniques and tools
  • Ability to present analysis in some kind of user friendly summary and visualization
  • Ability to simplify the complex into something understandable and insightful
  • Interest or experience in designing and managing A/B and multi-variant testing projects
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work with various levels of stakeholders across technical and non-technical roles
  • Project management skills & ability to manage multiple projects at once
  • Knowledge of digital marketing (SEO, SEM, Display, Social), web design and development, ecommerce, and user flows
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to thrive in an autonomous, fast-paced and changing environment
  • A desire to learn new things
  • Excellent verbal and written English
  • A University degree in a quantitative discipline e.g. Math/Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Econometrics, Actuarial, Economics, or to at least enjoy working with numbers
  • A good sense of humor, as all good analysts know 73% of all stats are made up on the spot

Nice to have but not required.

  • Experience in google analytics or web log based data collection and analysis
  • Other programing languages
  • Microsoft T-SQL experience
  • Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services or other reporting platforms
  • Familiarity with big data platforms (Google BigTable, MS Data Lake, etc.)
  • Mathematical language query skills (R or similar)
  • Advanced statistical modelling and regression modelling

Please note, to apply for this role you MUST be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or already possess a suitable Work Visa.
\xc2\xa0

Join a great\xc2\xa0company for a great salary package!

"

title: Account Manager/Case Manager - Home Care Packages
description:
b'
  • Mobile Position \xe2\x80\x93 South West & M5 Corridor Sydney, Parramatta & Western Suburbs, Hawkesbury/Windsor and Nepean/Blue Mountains

Catholic Community Services (CCS) is a division of Catholic Healthcare Ltd, one of the largest providers of aged and community services in Australia. CCS assists over 4,500 people throughout NSW to enhance their independence and well being within a person centered framework.

We are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic Account Manager who is able to work autonomously, responsible for managing their workload on a day-to-day basis and delivering on agreed KPIs. Your strong clinical and case management skills will be used to deliver high quality care to consumers ensuring that their physical, mental and social needs are being met through excellent care planning, assessment and service coordination. Your strong sales and networking skills will be used to build strong relationships with relevant community stakeholders and CCS consumers both current and prospective.

To be considered for this position you must possess the following criteria:

  • Minimum 3 years experience in Case Management, Health, Behavioural or Social Science, Social Work, Aged or Community Services
  • Experience working in a results driven environment
  • Experience delivering discipline specific interventions
  • Stakeholder engagement and relationship management experience

Highly desirable

  • Degree qualified\xc2\xa0 in Nursing, Social Work, Allied Health or related field and current registration with APHRA or relevant body
  • Knowledge of data mangement system Procura
  • Demonstrated ability to facilitate and drive change

\xc2\xa0Additional job specific requirements:

  • Must have own vehicle and NSW drivers licence

\xc2\xa0For Further Information please visit our website at www.catholichealthcare.com.au\xc2\xa0 or contact our Recruitment Team on 1800 024 540.

\xc2\xa0Applications addressing the above selection criteria can be submitted on line.

Applications Close:\xc2\xa020 June, 2017

'

title: Business & Product Development Manager (Traffic Engineer or Transport Planner)
description:
b"

About the business and the role

Established in 1983, we continue to grow our product offering and develop our existing pool of intellectual and business excellence. We want the best people to present our offering and to drive innovation to deliver quality data solutions. We have a role in the development of technologies for the next generation of solutions.

As one of our team, you will work alongside our established operations, and assist in the discovery and creation of new innovations as part of our journey and mission.\xc2\xa0

Austraffic is an energetic vibrant organisation providing exciting opportunities for people to do fulfilling things, to personally develop and grow in a practical work place and dynamic commercial market place.

The NSW office is located in Rydalmere.

Job tasks and responsibilities

We are seeking a passionate and creative Engineer to join our team. This is a pivotal role, which will be involved in the delivery of significant traffic and transport projects and contributing to winning work for the survey teams.

Applicants are required to have experience in Road Safety, Traffic Management, Transport Planning or Road construction. The role will see the successful applicants work across several road engineering projects such as transport planning, road safety, traffic engineering and data analysis. Austraffic will provide the successful applicant with the opportunity to gain experience and knowledge working with the highly experienced and respected operations team.

In this position you will:

  • Contribute to the presentation and provision of data solution services to clients.
  • Develop effective working relationships with key local government, state government and other related clients, ideally you will have an established network of contacts in the marketplace
  • Contribute technical knowledge to projects managed by others
  • Identify and follow up contract opportunities through contacts and technical knowledge
  • Prepare tenders and proposals including method, cost budget and timetable.

As a senior member of the team, you will be required to travel interstate to participate in management events, client meetings on a needs basis and conferences.

Skills and experience

This is a new role!\xc2\xa0 It's based in Sydney. A Traffic & Transport Data Specialist industry leader we seek to expand the team with the inclusion of a talented, self-motivated, experienced Traffic Engineer or Transport planner with Road Safety Audit accreditation, a penchant for ITS and of course a keen interest in data analytics.

We seek an individual who has:

  • Civil Engineering or relevant Science degree.
  • 15 years of relevant project experience in one or more of the following road engineering disciplines - road safety, traffic engineering, transport planning and/or road crash analysis and investigation
  • Well-developed research, analytical and technical skills
  • Project management skills appropriate for research, consulting and service-based projects
  • Be an innovative thinker - more than just perpetuating current practices
  • Highly developed report writing and presentation skills
  • Advanced computer skills (MS Office).
  • Good personal presence with great presentation delivery skills.

Job benefits

An exciting, dynamic and collaborative workplace with challenging roles, where your skills, knowledge and experience will be recognised and respected, including:

  • Opportunities to contribute to high-profile and interesting projects
  • Salary package including a bonus incentive program.
  • Strong support for career development and industry participation.

"

title: Excel Operator
description:
b'

A successful Direct Marketing / Mailing business in the Western suburbs requires a talented Excel Operator for their busy operation.

About the role:

As an Excel Operator you will be responsible for the accurate data processing of our clients data.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Process client supplied data in accordance with job brief details.
  • Ensure that all quality procedures are followed and final output is checked as per the quality system requirements.
  • Work closely with key business stakeholders to ensure project deadlines are met.
  • Attend client meetings to provide technical support for the Account Manager.
  • You will be required to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Provide technical support for internal staff as required.
  • \xc2\xa0Install new software and hardware.

The Required Skills:

Essential:-

  • Microsoft Office suite (2003/2007/2010) with a high level of proficiency in Excel.
  • Demonstrated ability to problem solving and work under pressure.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Ability to manage time effectively and work on multiple projects simultaneously.

\xc2\xa0

Desirable:-

  • Ability to write programs in at least one of VB.net, C# or VBA for MS Access.
  • Groovy programming skills.
  • Mail House experience is highly desirable.
  • Adobe Creative Suite.
  • GMC Software.
  • PrintShop Mail Software.
  • Datatools Software (Twins and FPC).
  • Windows Server and Networking.
'

title: Customer Service Officer, Maintenance
description:
b'
  • Permanent full time 35 hours
  • Fairfield location
  • Salary packaging available

Hume Community Housing is a nationally accredited Tier 1 Community Housing Provider with over 1700 properties under management. We are growing and ready for a bright and exciting future!

We are committed to creating vibrant, sustainable and cohesive communities through the delivery of outstanding homes and equitable customer focused services.

We are Champions of change, Creators of connectivity, Builders of resilience, Determined to succeed.

The Customer Service Officer is responsible for providing excellent customer service through the responsive maintenance hotline, supporting our relationships with property owners and real estate agents and our contractors by administering the work orders and invoices accurately.

In this integral role you need to demonstrate sound and solid experience in\xc2\xa0

  • Responding to all customer enquiries over the phone and email within agreed service levels and response times;
  • Managing customer feedback and satisfaction survey processes and data;
  • Preparing job orders and allocating work to appropriate contractors;
  • Monitoring contractor performance and maintaining up to date contractor compliance and safety details;
  • Reporting on monthly maintenance spend;
  • Raising work orders, checking invoices and liaising\xc2\xa0 with our finance team for payment;
  • Maintaining records in the assets management system;
  • Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel & Project at Intermediate to Advanced level; and
  • Knowledge and understanding of Community Housing Sector, preferred.

\xc2\xa0

We need you if you

  • Love our values;
  • Enjoy working within a diverse community;
  • Have good communication skills both verbally and written;
  • Have strong analytical skills and data management; and
  • Have a passion for customer service and finding solutions.

\xc2\xa0

Hume Housing is a great place to work and offer above Award salaries, 35 hour working week, long service leave after 5 years, flexible working arrangements, salary packaging and professional development and career opportunities - the list goes on!

Want to know more, see our website for more information and the position description www.humecha.com.au

What are you waiting for? Apply now and submit your resume with a covering letter clearly demonstrating how you are the best person for this exciting opportunity to recruitment@humecha.com.au \xc2\xa0as described above and in the position description.\xc2\xa0

Hume Housing is an equal opportunity employer.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Applications close 5pm Wednesday 24th May 2017.

'

title: NA
description:
b"

  • Build a long term career across the broad areas of our business

  • Immerse yourself in an inclusive, diverse and supportive culture

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG's Tax Delivery and Data Excellence (DDX) team brings value to our clients through the provision of technical tax compliance services and data analytics. Our clients are some of the largest domestic and international corporations and financial institutions operating in Australia.

About the role

Working as a Manager/Senior Manager within the DDX team you will have lead the professional development and training program for the DDX team. Responsibilities will include:

  • Identify and arrange suitable professional training programs for the DDX team including development of internal training materials and delivery of training sessions

  • Provide tax technical and on-the-job training to all members of the DDX team

  • Actively mentor and coach junior members of the DDX team to create an environment that engages and motivates the team

  • Identify and support the development of new innovations that enhance our service offerings and improve the quality and efficiency of the core services we provide to clients

You will bring to the role

In order to be successful in this position it is likely you will have a combination of the following skills and experience:

  • Practical and relevant tax compliance skills across either large corporate organisations or mid-sized organisations

  • Good organisational skills

  • Exceptional communication skills and a keen nurturing attitude

  • Ability to create an engaging and dynamic learning environment for DDX

  • Excellent attention to detail

  • Consistent commitment to delivering high quality outputs that support DDX and KPMG

What we offer you

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.

"

title: Technical Support Success Analyst
description:
b'

Who we are:
As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Australia, we are passionate about what we do. Our software solution sees thousands of businesses scheduling their employees on a daily basis underpinned by smart, rich data and the aim of making lives easier. Employee's clock in and out for work through beautiful intuitive apps for smart phone and iPad.

Deputy is a cloud-based work scheduling and people management platform with social mobile technologies at its core. We're continuously improving functionality and broadening our user base. Since we launched 2008, it's been quite a journey as we strive for world domination. That's where you come into the picture.

The role:
Deputy is a fast-paced, award-winning SaaS vendor specialising in time and attendance software. Due to continued growth, we are looking for someone who is passionate about technical support and willing to improve our customer's experience with our front-line support team.

Being part of Technical Support Team Success will require you to work closely with the Support Manager to provide Technical Assistance with all things regarding product related knowledge.

You will be the Second highest level of Technical support within the Support Team that can answer all Level 1, 2, 3 & 70% of all Enterprise level questions. This role will be a go to resource for any technical question that can not be answered by Level 1, 2 and 3 agents. If stuck, you will consult with the Support Manager for assistance.

You will be responsible for:

  • Monitoring team performance and quality. Including but not limited to the following;
  • Monitoring responses sent by agents via chat (intercom) and phone (aircall)
  • Ensuring the quality and call punctuality of monitored responses
  • Response time audits for chat and phone conversations
  • Reviewing chats to check resource knowledge and correctness
  • Ensuring agents meet their expected KPIs and deliverables
  • Increase Customer Success through support team responsiveness and punctuality
  • Help contact and reach out to paying customers that are slipping away.
  • Empower our customers through using the Deputy team as a resource
  • Contact and Management of newly churned customers
  • Working with Support Manager in improving the customer's experience
  • Escalating issues/outages with Support Manager
  • Provide product training for the Support Team guiding them in career progression. Will inform the Support Manager of progression suggestions

Key Skills

  • Tertiary Education in IT, Business, Sales and Marketing or relevant discipline
  • Great listener and communicator
  • Ability to build rapport and trust
  • Attention to detail and passionate about your clients
  • Collaborative team player
  • Ability to prioritise, manage time effectively and multitask
  • Great personality and "can do attitude"
  • Previous work experience in a support team for a online SaaS platform favoured, but not required

What's on Offer?

  • A collaborative, supportive environment that gives you autonomy to explore new ideas, grow your skill set and create outstanding work
  • The chance to make a genuine impact on the company's growth
  • Plenty of challenging work and the opportunity to stretch yourself

Everyday you'll get to work with amazing talent in a fast growth company that really values their people

Interested? Apply here:
https://deputy.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=17

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Customer Implementation Specialist
description:
b'

Who we are:

As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Australia, we are passionate about what we do. Our software solution sees thousands of businesses scheduling their employees on a daily basis underpinned by smart, rich data and the aim of making lives easier. Employees clock in and out for work through beautiful intuitive apps for smart phone and iPad.

Deputy is a cloud-based work scheduling and people management platform with social mobile technologies at its core. We're continuously improving functionality and broadening our user base. Since we launched 2008, it's been quite a journey as we strive for world domination. That's where you come into the picture.\xc2\xa0

The role:

Deputy is a fast-paced, award-winning SaaS vendor specialising in time and attendance software. Due to continued growth, we are looking for a Implementation Engineer to join our Customer Implementation team.

Being part of the Implementation team will require you to work closely with Deputy's Implementation Specialists to provide developer assistance when on-boarding new enterprise clients.

You will be responsible for:

  • Front-line on-boarding specialist that will implement Deputy from start to end for large enterprise companies
  • Required to run each implementation project in a structured managed way that informs the customer of expected timelines of completion for each stage of the implementation
  • Confirm to implementation timeframes set by implementation guidelines
  • Inputting and manipulating data via excel and similar tools to a high standard
  • Interpreting and implementing business' and their hierarchy
  • Interpreting and implementing complete award configurations based on their existing payroll award configurations
  • Consult the Customer Implementation Engineers when the requirements returned by the customer will need some custom scripting built to cater for their requirements
  • Manage delays and expectations throughout the whole implementation process
  • Able to travel and consult the customer out on the field
  • Consult and train (using the provided training guidelines) the customer and employees at the end of the project implementation
  • Provide process improvement suggestions that can enable quicker, more efficient implementations
  • Provide weekly updates of projects that show any delays

Key Skills

  • Exceptional communication skills and the ability to create a strong rapport with partners and clients
  • A minimum of 1 year experience providing CX support for a HRIS or Cloud based Time Management & Scheduling platform
  • You must have solid skills and experience in PHP, Javascript, CSS, working with 3rd party APIs and working on the LAMP stack.
  • Loads of passion and innovation!

What's on Offer?

  • A collaborative, supportive environment that gives you autonomy to explore new ideas, grow your skill set and create outstanding work
  • The chance to make a genuine impact on the company's growth
  • Plenty of challenging work and the opportunity to stretch yourself

\xc2\xa0

Everyday you'll get to work with amazing talent in a fast growth company that really values their people.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Interested? Apply here:
https://deputy.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=43

'

title: Senior Customer Service Representative / Relationship Manager
description:
b"

Dicker Data is an Australian owned and operated ASX listed hardware and software distributor.\xc2\xa0

Based in Kurnell,\xc2\xa0an exciting opportunity exists for\xc2\xa0a sophisticated and intuitive Senior Customer Service Representative to join the innovative Account Management team, reporting to the National Inside Sales Manager. Immersed in our vibrant and dynamic culture, your role will be essential as the central point of management for reseller requirements within Dicker Data. You will also demonstrate your unparalleled initiative by proactively contacting resellers on a regular basis. You will hit the ground running as a brand ambassador with a passion for service excellence, where challenging daily tasks await and endless opportunities abound. This is a fast paced role and would suit a candidate with a sales background in the ICT industry.

Our culture encourages team growth and success, we understand the importance of hiring the right people to make a great team, and to optimize their drive to get the job done. Don't miss this opportunity to become a vital member of our innovative and passionate team!

\xc2\xa0

Requirements

  • Professional communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Excellent relationship building skills
  • Proactive orientation
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to provide sales advice for a range of products and services
  • Ability to manage and resolve customer issues and complaints
  • Ability to work well in a team as well as autonomously
  • Intermediate MS Office proficiency
  • IT industry experience is preferred

Responsibilities

  • Provide customer service and sales support to all Dicker Data resellers
  • Liaise with resellers on a regular basis to build strong working relationships with your customer portfolio
  • Proactively work with resellers to generate sales
  • Be the central point of management for reseller requirements within Dicker Data
  • Provide support to colleagues in a team environment
  • Develop and maintain strong product and process knowledge of all Dicker Data vendors
  • Acquire and maintain vendor Sales Certifications as required
  • Attend reseller and vendor social and training events

Rewards

  • A competitive salary package depending upon experience
  • On-site parking
  • A selection of freshly prepared lunch options provided on a daily basis
  • On-site gym
  • Discounted health insurance
  • Access to comprehensive discounted superannuation product and insurance
  • Banking and finance benefits
  • Travel and lifestyle benefits

\xc2\xa0

Only those with the legal right to work in Australia may apply for this position

"

title: Growth Marketing Director
description:
b'

About us

Art Money is increasing access to art. We make owning art easier and more affordable by allowing buyers to take their art home and pay for it later. 10 payments, interest free. A win/win for buyers, galleries and artists. Launched in Australia 2 years ago and recently in the US, we are a lean startup changing the way people buy art \xe2\x80\x93 growing the industry and bringing positive culture change to the art world on an international scale.

About the Role

As head marketer, you will complement our deep domain knowledge, strategic focus and strong organic growth by bringing a data driven growth marketing approach, taking responsibility for accelerating sales and partnerships, in particular customer pull-through demand.
Working directly with the founder/CEO in a critical hands-on role you will be a key part of the management team and have the opportunity to grow with the business. This is an international role.

About You

We are looking for someone who is passionate about making a difference and wants to play a key role in helping us make art more accessible. You will probably have:

  • Growth marketing experience (5 years minimum)

  • Passion for creating positive culture change

  • Proven yourself and hungry to move on to a bigger

    challenge/opportunity

  • A love of contemporary art

    You will almost certainly be:

  • digitally & technically adept

  • strong personal & written communicator

  • passionate about marketing, love growth hacking

  • great with data - but also have good instincts & gut feel

  • hands on, and a self-starter

  • a team player , working well in small teams

  • a creative thinker

  • able to understand cultural differences globally and how we will adapt our offer accordingly

  • strong in execution and follow through, impeccable attention to detail

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide a data driven growth marketing approach to complement existing deep industry knowledge

  • Customer acquisition & retention - lead generation, funnel conversion

  • Digital marketing campaigns & analytics across search,

    email, retargeting, social, earned media

  • Partner acquisition, retention and communications - including galleries

    and art fairs

  • User experience

  • Content strategy & creation

  • Branding & positioning

  • Manage marketing budget

  • Product & business development

    What you can expect

  • Opportunity to influence and grow an entire industry on a global scale

  • Potential to grow into CMO role & equity participation

  • Key part of management team working directly with founder/CEO

  • A hands on role in a small but passionate and driven

    international team

  • A culture of honesty and openness where everyone is able to

    contribute and make a difference

  • Travel in the US and increasingly, globally

  • To help us change the (art) world in a positive way

  • A competitive salary

    Location

    Art Money is an international business. This role could be based in the U.S. (Soho, New York) or Australia (Newtown, Sydney).
    The role will involve travel, particularly for art fairs, and for much of 2017 will be based in New York, although flexibility is offered.

'

title: Customer Service Officer, Maintenance
description:
b'
  • Permanent full time 35 hours
  • Fairfield location
  • Salary packaging available

Hume Community Housing is a nationally accredited Tier 1 Community Housing Provider with over 1700 properties under management. We are growing and ready for a bright and exciting future!

We are committed to creating vibrant, sustainable and cohesive communities through the delivery of outstanding homes and equitable customer focused services.

We are Champions of change, Creators of connectivity, Builders of resilience, Determined to succeed.

The Customer Service Officer is responsible for providing excellent customer service through the responsive maintenance hotline, supporting our relationships with property owners and real estate agents and our contractors by administering the work orders and invoices accurately.

In this integral role you need to demonstrate sound and solid experience in\xc2\xa0

  • Responding to all customer enquiries over the phone and email within agreed service levels and response times;
  • Managing customer feedback and satisfaction survey processes and data;
  • Preparing job orders and allocating work to appropriate contractors;
  • Monitoring contractor performance and maintaining up to date contractor compliance and safety details;
  • Reporting on monthly maintenance spend;
  • Raising work orders, checking invoices and liaising\xc2\xa0 with our finance team for payment;
  • Maintaining records in the assets management system;
  • Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel & Project at Intermediate to Advanced level; and
  • Knowledge and understanding of Community Housing Sector, preferred.

\xc2\xa0

We need you if you

  • Love our values;
  • Enjoy working within a diverse community;
  • Have good communication skills both verbally and written;
  • Have strong analytical skills and data management; and
  • Have a passion for customer service and finding solutions.

\xc2\xa0

Hume Housing is a great place to work and offer above Award salaries, 35 hour working week, long service leave after 5 years, flexible working arrangements, salary packaging and professional development and career opportunities - the list goes on!

Want to know more, see our website for more information and the position description www.humecha.com.au

What are you waiting for? Apply now and submit your resume with a covering letter clearly demonstrating how you are the best person for this exciting opportunity to recruitment@humecha.com.au \xc2\xa0as described above and in the position description.\xc2\xa0

Hume Housing is an equal opportunity employer.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Applications close 5pm Wednesday 24th May 2017.

'

title: Allocation Analyst
description:
b"

Bendon is Australia and New Zealand's leading Intimate Apparel Company. We have a global footprint with a strong presence in Australia and New Zealand, and our iconic brands Stella McCartney Lingerie, Pleasure State, Lovable, Bendon, Fayreform and Heidi Klum Intimates cater to diverse customer segments.\xc2\xa0

In the Allocation Analyst role, you will be responsible for having the right stock in the right store at the right time to enable us to meet the business commercial objectives! You will also be exposed to training directly from our Allocations Manager and develop with on the job development.

As a successful allocations analyst, you will have strong analytical skills, be a pro at Excel with a solutions driven approach.\xc2\xa0

As an Allocator you will also be responsible for:

  • The management of allocation and ordering of stock to all stores across Australia and New Zealand
  • Maintenance and set up of replenishment templates to ensure all stores have the right stock mix
  • Management of promotional set up and pricing
  • Accurately maintaining stock adjustments\xc2\xa0
  • Troubleshooting between retail merchandise and planning to ensure accurate execution at store level

As the ideal candidate you will have:

  • Previous experience in reporting and analysing data
  • Experience with JDE / RMS or a similar ERP system would be an advantage.
  • An above intermediate user in Excel
  • Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
  • An ability to build rapport quickly and establish effective working relationships
  • The confidence to use data to support your conclusions
  • A good understanding of business financials and operating in a professional environment
  • Attention to detail, can-do attitude and ability to learn quickly

In return, you will step into a new role within a fast paced environment and dynamic team based in our funky offices in Alexandria. To top it up, you will receive exclusive staff discounts on all Bendon brands and products. We are interviewing immediately so if this sounds like an opportunity you're looking for, then we'd love to hear from you. Apply on-line now.

"

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assitant
description:
b'

Role

As a receptionist you will be the first point of contact for the company and you will provide administrative support across the organisation. You will handle the flow of people through the business and ensure that all receptionist responsibilities\xc2\xa0are completed accurately and delivered with high quality and in a timely manner.

Responsibilities

  • Serve visitors by greeting, welcoming, directing and announcing them appropriately
  • Answer, screen and forward any incoming phone calls while providing basic information when needed
  • Maintain security by following procedures and controlling access via the reception desk
  • Update appointment calendars and schedule meetings/appointments
  • Perform other clerical receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, collating, faxing etc
  • Maintaining function of the office eg. Ordering of office stationary and toners for printers, receive and sort daily mail/deliveries/couriers
  • Entry of data into MYOB and Build Tools

Requirements

  • Fluent in English language
  • Proven working experience in a front office handling\xc2\xa0receptionist responsibilities
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
  • Professional appearance
  • Solid communication skills both written and verbal
  • Ability to be resourceful and proactive in dealing with issues that may arise
  • Ability to organize, multitask, prioritize and work under pressure
  • High school degree
'

title: NA
description:
b'This company are on a\xc2\xa0huge growth path within the underwriting space. Due to the growth they are now seeking a junior to join the property underwriting team.

They will invest many resources in to this position, putting you through the necessary training and giving you hands on experience in the role. You will work with senior managers who will impart their wealth of knowledge to enable you to develop in your career.

They are seeking someone with 1-2 years insurance exposure and understanding, who are now ready ready to make a long term career commitment to underwriting.

This role will encompass tasks such as data and administration for the senior underwriters, as well as assisting with the processing, endorsements and renewals. No experience in this area is necessary, however you do need to understand the general insurance market, and have had direct exposure to it.

In order to be considered you should:

\xc2\xa0This role will fast track your career, they will put you through any training and development courses within insurance, and enable you to have very hands on experience. A great role for career progression. '

title: Merchandise Allocator - Sydney Head Office
description:
b"

Allocator \xe2\x80\x93 Permanent Opportunity \xe2\x80\x93 Immediate Start!

If you see your career in the Planning area in the future, this is an excellent opportunity for you to build a solid grounding!

Bendon is Australia and New Zealand's leading Intimate Apparel Company. We have a global footprint with a strong presence in Australia and New Zealand, and our iconic brands Stella McCartney Lingerie, Pleasure State, Lovable, Bendon, Fayreform and Heidi Klum Intimates cater to diverse customer segments. We couldn't do what we do without passion. It's a part of everything we do and it is felt by everyone who contributes to our success.

In the Merchandise Allocator\xc2\xa0role, you will be responsible for having the right stock in the right store at the right time to enable us to meet the business commercial objectives! As a successful allocator, you will have strong analytical skills, be a pro at Excel with a solutions driven approach.\xc2\xa0 As a highly proactive and nimble individual, you will thrive in the ever changing trading environment that is Retail at Bendon.

  • Maintenance and set up of replenishment templates to ensure all stores have the right stock mix

  • Liaising with retail merchandise and marketing to ensure featured product and stock levels are aligned to marketing initiatives

As the ideal candidate you will have:

  • Previous experience in reporting and analysing data

In return, you will step into a new role within a fast paced environment and dynamic team based in our funky offices in Alexandria. We are interviewing immediately so if this sounds like an opportunity you're looking for, then we'd love to hear from you. Apply on-line now.

"

title: BI Media Analyst
description:
b' This globally recognised media company is currently at the forefront of their market and have continued to grow from strength to strength.\xc2\xa0 With several recent client wins combined with new implementations and projects, the need for a Data BI / BA has emerged to join their highly experienced and professional team.\xc2\xa0 In this role you will play a pivotal part in liaising between both marketing / sales team and with the media audience where you will analyst large sets of data.\xc2\xa0 You will work in a supportive and nurturing environment that promotes personal development and progression.
\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities will include:
\xc2\xa0
The strategic analyst plays a key role in the development of company revenues, applying a passion for movies combined with a broad knowledge of advertising media and the media agency ecosystem to the business.
\xc2\xa0
Working within the analytics division, the role involves close collaboration with sales, marketing, commercial and finance departments, to drive outcomes that positively impact the business.
  • Development of analytics tools to address challenges and improve knowledge across the business.
  • Interpretation of data based on business requirements.
  • Maintain awareness and perspective of new developments in business intelligence and the application of data in the advertising media and entertainment sectors.
  • To become an expert on CineTAM and assist it\xe2\x80\x99s evolution and development
  • Creation of reporting to assist company sales activities using CineTAM data
  • Integration and analysis of other data sets to support and enhance targeting opportunities
  • Analysis of business information tools using other data sets available across the business
  • Develop a strong understanding of the technical environment.
  • Overseeing the ongoing development and operations of business intelligence architecture that enables fact-based decision making analysis and insight generation.
  • Analysis of large quantities of data, developing reporting templates and models alongside ad-hoc queries.
  • Advising and educating management and users of the data.
  • Collaborating with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery.
To be successful for this position you will need to display:
\xc2\xa0
Advanced skills in the following technologies:
  • MS SQL Server query writing (including Analysis Services and SSRS)
  • Executive Dash-boarding
  • Data-warehousing
  • Data-integration
  • Experience in business requirements analysis.
  • Demonstrated discipline for code and architectural documentation.
  • Strong time management and attention to detail
  • Passion for media, movies and advertising
  • Proactive, resourceful with a \xe2\x80\x98can-do\xe2\x80\x99 attitude
  • Team player
  • Strong communication skills
\xc2\xa0
If you have the above experience and want to join a fun, fast paced passionate team please forward your resume to julians@charterhouse.com.au or call me on 9641 2453.
\xc2\xa0 '

title: Category Strategy Manager
description:
b"
  • Premium brand portfolio
  • Opportunity to grow and develop Australia-wide business
  • Great work life balance & flexibility for the right candidate!

Founded in 1884 and one of Australia's largest privately-owned companies, Stuart Alexander & Co imports, markets and distributes premium brands such as Chupa Chups, Fisherman's Friends, Mentos, Tabasco, Ocean Spray and Duracell throughout Australasia.

Stuart Alexander employs over 180 people nationally, and is committed to attracting, developing and retaining great people who can contribute to our vibrant, collaborative and high-energy culture.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Category Strategy Manager, to join our Category and Shopper Activation Team.

Broadly, the key responsibilities of the role are:

  • Determine the key drivers / occasions that will unlock category growth over the next 3+ years
  • Partner our retailers to understand and develop the category vision
  • Work with our account teams to develop category review presentations
  • Develop shelf merchandising strategies/standards based on shopper insights
  • Ensure category strategy is linked & leveraged across Stuart Alexander's internal planning horizon
  • Work with our principals and marketing teams to identify our role in delivering category growth potential
  • Analyse and translate strategies and insights into specific activities.

We are looking for an individual who possesses the following:

  • Demonstrated experience as a category manager or similar role in FMCG
  • Tertiary Qualification in Business, Marketing or other relevant area
  • Experience in developing Category and Channel strategy
  • An ability to interpret data and gain the insight to provide the basis of strategy development
  • Involvement in integrated commercial planning process
  • Experience in partnering and influencing the retail trade
  • Demonstrated collaboration on cross functional projects
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.\xc2\xa0

Flexible approach to work requirements will be considered for the right candidate. \xc2\xa0

If you fit the above criteria and want to join an energetic team in a fast growing area of new business, please send your resume to: hr@stalex.com.au or call Caroline De Kimpe on 02/9282 7793 for a confidential chat.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Business Intelligence Report Developer
description:
b'

The Performance and Pricing Team is responsible to:

  • develop and deliver performance reporting and analysis for claims and liability outcomes
  • identify trends in and drivers of claims and liability performance
  • calculate and communicate annual workers' compensation premiums for employers

This position contributes to the development of an effective and sustainable workers' compensation scheme. The role manages the development and implementation of reports and data extracts that support performance reporting, analytics and premium setting functions within Comcare.

The role is required to advise on data warehouse content and structures and the maintenance of the reporting system (including access and quality controls) in order to support timely, high quality, robust and flexible reporting in a controlled and efficient manner.

The role will provide input to the ongoing improvement of Comcare's data capabilities.

Closing date: 21 May 2017 at 11:00pm (Australian Eastern Standard Time)

The job information pack including how to apply can be obtained from our website http://www.comcare.gov.au/careers/current_vacancies

'

title: SQL Database Developer + Administrator
description:
b"

SQL Database Developer/Manager\xc2\xa0- People Analytics, Business Intelligence

Perception engineers solutions to address opportunities in\xc2\xa0enterprise recruiting and talent management utilising\xc2\xa0predictive analytics. Our cloud platform delivers actionable insights to medium and large enterprise clients in Asia-Pacific, enabling\xc2\xa0smarter and better business decisions about their investments in people.

The Database Developer/Manager will join a small entrepreneurial team to manage a critical component of our data infrastructure, and develop/manage SQL applications technology.

You have\xc2\xa0advanced SQL skills and experience dealing with large and complex data sets, including:

  • capabilities\xc2\xa0to navigate and manage complex systems whilst thinking critically and retaining a high attention to detail
  • an understanding of fundamental design principles behind scalable applications
  • ability to manage\xc2\xa0administrative processes associated with business applications (such as user creation, resolution of\xc2\xa0application issues)
  • skills to write, test, maintain and debug SQL code; and manipulate and extract data from SQL databases
  • an understanding of database-driven design and development techniques, system integration and testing/deployment principles

You must have experience with....

  • SQL and the\xc2\xa0Microsoft tech stack
  • ASP.NET MVC, C#, JavaScript/JQuery, web services (SOAP/RESTful)
  • web servers (IIS or Apache) and\xc2\xa0DNS
  • agile project development and\xc2\xa0management
  • complex web applications and systems that store, manage and process data
  • managing\xc2\xa0complex relational database environments
  • multiple database integrations and/or migrations
  • back-end administration platform

What you'll be doing....

  • developing and managing SQL applications that capture, store and process workforce and performance data to help client understand the drivers of high performance
  • developing, implementing and managing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise data efficiency and quality
  • acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases/data analysis systems
  • designing and developing applications in a .net/SQL environment for recruiting, HR and business leaders to make better informed people decisions

Please send us details of your background, then we'll ask you to send us samples of your work!

"

title: Donations and Sponsorship/Accounts Receivable Manager
description:
b"

Wanted: \xc2\xa0Donations and Sponsorship/Accounts Receivable Manager

Are you looking for a role where you have autonomy, breadth and depth in your work, and skills development opportunities?

Would you like to work in a cross between a start-up and a not-for-profit, working for a highly regarded Founder/CEO with a young strongly motivated team?

If you have 3-5 years accounts receivable experience, if you consider yourself to be pro-active, personable and tech-savvy, open to change, if you like to problem solve and are driven to replace manual processes with scalable automation, as well as use your skills to have a real impact on the organisation, we would like to talk to you.

This role reports to the Finance Manager. We are based in the Sydney CBD.

Snapshot of School for Life:

School for Life Foundation (SFL) is a not-for-profit organisation working in rural Uganda. We raise all our funds in Australia to carry out the work in Uganda.

We empower communities to help themselves and create their own opportunities. We do this by providing a quality education and associated services, including employment and healthcare.\xc2\xa0

Our two schools can be found an hour and a half away from Uganda's capital Kampala. We operate across two campuses, and are constructing a third in 2017. To date we have raised more than A$4 million and mobilised the support of thousands of people around the world who have helped us:

  • Educate 560 students annually
  • Employ more than 120 adults in related roles
  • Train and employ 15 women as tailors
  • Construct an effective animal husbandry program with a fully functional piggery
  • Provide 3 nutritious meals a day for all our staff and students
  • Provide clean drinking water to our communities
  • Access to health care through 2 clinics and community outreach programs.

The Role:\xc2\xa0 Key Objectives

  • To manage the School for Life Foundation's sponsorship, regular giving and donations systems and payments. This includes administration of sponsorship accounts in Salesforce, email and phone follow up daily.
  • Salesforce CRM management, data cleaning and reconciliation.
  • Managing collections data in a structured, methodical way.
  • All other responsibilities as defined and agreed with the CEO.

Detailed responsibilities:

  • Donations
    • Ensure efficient processing and record keeping of funds received, in particular receipt of agreed donations, including strong financial oversight of the regular giving program, contacting those donors whose credit cards have expired and ensuring all donor payments are kept up to date.
      \xc2\xa0
  • Finance
    • Generate tax receipts from Salesforce.
    • Manage invoices.
    • Categorise transactions and manage reconciliations.
    • Remain up to date on non-profit accounting best practices, policies and procedures and all relevant legislations in Australia and Uganda.
      \xc2\xa0
  • CRM/Systems
    • Work to ensure smooth connection between all current systems \xe2\x80\x93 MYOB, Salesforce, Autopilot etc.
    • Clean data to ensure duplications and invalid contacts are merged and removed.
    • Enhancing systems continually to move with School for Life's growing and changing structure and needs.

Required Qualifications and Experience

  • Minimum 3 years' of experience in an accounts receivable role, in corporate or not for profit organisations.
  • Accounting diploma or degree, not necessary but preferred.
  • Experience in the use of MYOB.
  • Experience with Salesforce or other CRM database management.
  • High level proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Word and Excel.
  • High level of interest and competence in technology.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills.
"

title: NA
description:
b'
  • Global & local market leader in endocrine & haemostasis products
  • R&D based Biopharm with an extraordinary development pipeline

An exciting opportunity now exists for a Medical Affairs Manager to join our successful and high-performing Medical Affairs team located at Norwest Business Park.

Reporting to the Clinical, Medical & Regulatory Director, you will be responsible for leading and managing the Medical Affairs team across our entire portfolio of endocrine and haemostasis products and will manage a team of Medical Advisors. This is an exciting time to join Novo Nordisk as we have a number of potential new product registrations scheduled over the coming years.

The successful candidate will work cross functionally with sales, marketing, clinical research, regulatory affairs and market access to provide medical and scientific services management for our current and future businesses. This is a highly impactful and influential position; with key collaboration across internal and external stakeholders, including medical education programs and KOL engagement. In addition you will work closely with the Director to provide input to global medical affairs projects, data and metrics.

Other key responsibilities include medical affairs support for portfolio strategy; product campaign development, excellence in scientific meetings, publication planning and medical writing; ensuring compliance with Novo Nordisk policies/procedures and industry Codes; pharmacovigilance; and support for clinical trials and approval/reimbursement for new products.

A PhD in life sciences or a Medical Degree (MD) is essential. Previous people management experience in a medical affairs department is also essential. Industry experience relevant to the company's areas of therapeutic interest, diabetes in particular, is required as well as familiarity with the TGA and other regulatory guidelines.

On offer is the opportunity to work with a leading global research-based pharmaceutical company committed to providing innovative treatments and devices that make a difference in the quality of care every day to our patients. If you are ready to strengthen our position as an innovative pioneer and respected industry leader, we encourage you to join us to make the most of your talent.

To apply for this job go to: www.novonordisk.recruitmenthub.com.au.

Applications close 24 May 2017.

No agencies please.

'

title: DevOps / Build Engineer
description:
b'

DevOps\xc2\xa0/ Build Engineer
A leading Financial Services institution is seeking a DevOps I Build Engineer, to join them in their highly complex enterprise environment.\xc2\xa0 This role will be look after the group data warehouse, big data and advanced analytics systems, defining what DevOps means.
The purpose of DevOps | Build and Release Engineer is to champion the deployment process for promoting code to various environments using latest DevOps Tools being in a centralized Operations Team as well as with Project Teams as a DevOps/Build and Release Engineer.


Key Responsibilities:
The challenge of the role is to identify the code to be delivered, compile and package the code, deliver new client installers, communicate about the build to the appropriate project teams, and troubleshooting any environmental or release issues. This role also involves providing support to Build and deploy tools using Agile methodology.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0To document procedures and policies that relate to the IT systems you support in particular the application configuration.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0To support the development lifecycle including all types of testing to ensure system performance meets the required standard
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0To manage deployments and all changes to the infrastructure and code base in production.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0To manage 3rd party vendors and hosting services and any licenses specifically for the infrastructure you support
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Create monitoring and regular reports on availability and performance
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0To be involved in defining the physical architecture and maintaining this as part of an IT roadmap


The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following skills:
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Commercial experience with infrastructure support and development, utilising technologies such as: Ansible, Python, Team City, Atifactory, Service Now, Jira
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Governance and review of change requests
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Install and configure new environments using automated scripts that you create.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Remove repetitive manual steps and any steps prone to defect.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Perform an evaluation on P1 and P2 Incidents
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Produce Delivery Assurance packs for Product Managers
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Identify Operational Risk
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Works across a multidisciplinary team to help build solutions, improving operational resilience.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Excellent communication skills, ability to work within cross-functional teams, delivery
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Proven ability in writing procedures and policies which can be used by other staff and are maintained within a review lifecycle
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0The candidate should be capable of writing code to deliver a highly automated infrastructure / environments that support the DEV team who will be working via an agile methodology
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0System level knowledge of Linux, Apache, Tomcat.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Software release management
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Patch management

Please apply if you fit the above criteria and are interested in developing your career in an outstanding environment.


Our Client are keen to interview suitable candidates this week so please apply online today to be considered.
S42
SK920136A











\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0

'

title: SQL Developer / Applications Support
description:
b'

The SQL Developer / Report Writer / Application Support will be responsible for the creation, implementation and maintenance of SSRS, Crystal, and SSAS reports.
\xc2\xa0
The SQL Developer / Report Writer / Application Support is responsible for the delivery of end to end business intelligence and report writing solutions that support and enhance the financial, clinical, and quality outcomes of the organisation.
The role requires a passion for data and technology, thorough understanding of ETL in a data warehouse environment, excellent communication skills, understanding of business processes, knowledge of best practices, and the ability to provide quality actionable business intelligence using industry standard tools in a rapidly growing organisation.
\xc2\xa0
This job requires access to confidential and sensitive information, requiring ongoing discretion and secure information management.
\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using SSRS, Microsoft Power BI and other reporting tools Develop and maintain integration jobs using SSIS to manage interfaces between 3rd party/external applications Understand complex stored procedure, SQL queries and table structures in order to provide information to business Maintain company Data Warehouse and improve visibility of data where necessary (i.e. through cubes) to provide required information to business Provide support on Retail, Warehouse and other business applications when necessary.
  • As part of the support role, ensure adequate back-up skills exist within the department. Maintain contact with users to quickly solve any daily Application issues and raise requests to the 3rd party application support desk and follow up to ensure appropriate fixes are implemented. Ensure adequate documentation is completed.
  • Creation of conceptual designs and technical designs where appropriate as part of improving productivity and enhancement of documentation. Establish rapport and communicate with all levels of users, writing conceptual designs and documentation the user can fully understand and conceptualise. Provide advice and training to users on best practice in the use of a business systems/BI tools Increase IT knowledge level of users by assisting educating new users into the business on the relevant IT system applications Support the Infrastructure Support Team

Contact Adrian Spurrier for further information\xc2\xa002 9641 2408

'

title: NA
description:
b'

My client is one of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s largest Financial Digital Technology organisations and they are seeking a Business Intelligence Designer/Developer to join them in their highly complex environment. You will have the ability to influence and collaborate, be interactive, a strong communicator, provide high end technical design and enjoy rolling your sleeves up and seeking solutions.


They are looking for someone with extensive, real-world experience in Business Intelligence. Applicants should get a real kick out of helping projects go live in a successful and stress-free manner.


To be considered for this role, you will have:


Strong background with a wide range of BI tools
Development using queries, integration and reports using SQL 2016
Hands-on experience with SQL - Essential
Excellent skills in Data Integration and Data transformation
An analytical and sharp approach to challenges
Experience using Microstrategy

The primary purpose of this role will be to co-ordinate the business engagement, business requirements, solutions architecture,
data migration and vendor management activities associated with the implementation of the SAP Connect system, data migration and
integration with retained legacy systems.

title: NA
description:
b'

A large NSW Government agency is currently seeking a Telecommunications Infrastructure Design Engineer for an initial 6 months based in Sydney CBD.


As a Technical Specialist and holder of Engineering Design Authority, this position has accountability for the architecture, design, development and assurance of DC Power Supply system and Telecommunication Facilities (i.e. equipment room and housing, HVAC, cable routing).


To be successful in this role:



  • Qualifications in IT / Electrical / Telecoms Engineering, qualifying for graduate membership of the Institution
    of Engineers Australia. OR Tertiary qualifications in IT / Electrical / Telecommunications Engineering and
    extensive experience in rail telecommunications engineering design.
  • Extensive experience with the design of DC Power Supply system and Telecommunication facilities, in
    particular as applied to meet operational requirements.
  • Working knowledge of Australian telecommunications regulations, practices and standards applicable to DC
    power supply and Telecommunication facilities (e.g. Building Code)
  • Knowledge of current and emerging technologies relevant to the business in the area of DC Power Supply
    and Telecommunication Facilities/infrastructure
  • Knowledge of Configuration Management & Control processes.
  • Strong interpersonal and oral/written communication skills, including the ability to prepare detailed technical
    specifications/documents.
  • Relevant experience in Project Engineering, particularly Telecommunications Engineering projects.
  • Experience in all aspects of optical fibre cable design, inclusive of cable selection, fibre interconnection
    drawings, fibre splicing design and cable route designs.
  • CDCP (Certified Data Centre Professional) qualification - desirable

Is this you? Apply now!


Thanks
Michael T
REF S22

title: Insight Analyst
description:
b'

What you'll do!

  • Extraction and preparation of data from a variety of sources for use in modelling, analysis, monitoring and/or reporting;
  • Application and development of predictive statistical models;
  • Interpretation of modelling outcomes and analysis of data;
  • Identify, analyse and communicate emerging trends in the market;
  • Identify, build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders;
  • Perform data manipulation and checking;
  • Analysing structured and unstructured data using statistical or machine learning approaches;
  • Deliver consistently sound decisions and recommendations that give consideration to both profit and level of risk; and
  • Keep abreast of market trends and competitor analysis.

What will you bring?

  • Tertiary qualifications in either Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial
  • Experience in Machine Learning (desirable)\xc2\xa0
  • Strong system skills, including; SAS, SQL, VBA, Office
  • Strong attention to detail, prioritization, & process improvement skills
  • Self-reliant team player with the ability to work and collaborate with others
  • Previous General Insurance experience is desirable

Please note:

PetSure is a pet friendly environment and welcomes dogs and cats in the workplace and it is the policy of PetSure that all new employees consent to a background check.

If all this sounds like you, apply 26th May 2017

'

title: NA
description:
b'

A leading Financial Services institution is seeking a Business Intelligence\xc2\xa0Solutions Designer, to join them in their highly complex enterprise environment.\xc2\xa0 This role will be pivotal for the success of a reporting solution on a two year program of work.


A legacy reporting system was used by the organisation for many years and recently they have implemented a custom built reporting solution.\xc2\xa0 The custom solution that has been built is very complex and challenging.


This role involves a review and extension of the in-house built reporting solution. The sucessful applicant will be responsible for the entire system design.


This\xc2\xa0designer role will influence technology direction and lead the technical delivery capabilities.\xc2\xa0 It is necessary to look at the whole solution end to end and assess what\xe2\x80\x99s possible and what\xe2\x80\x99s not.


The project team is in place to provide a road map and transition across to the new end to end solution.\xc2\xa0 You will also be asked to provide guidance on architecture and infrastructure.


Successful applicants will have similar experience in large, highly complex enterprise environments.\xc2\xa0 It is also important to have a passion for solving business problems and exceeding expectations.


Requirements:



  • Proven experience designing and leading complex Microsoft BI Reporting implementations
  • Extensive\xc2\xa0knowledge across the full MS BI Stack including SSIS, SSRS, SSAS & Power BI
  • Solid experience of designing databases for optimal performance
  • Agile Methodology
  • Experience integrating SSRS with Custom applications
  • Experience using the MS BI Portal framework
  • Experience in large Data Warehouse environments
  • Excellent Report Design and Visualisation expertise
  • Strong work ethic, positive attitude and articulate with great communication

If this sounds like your ideal next role please submit your resume for immediate consideration.

'

title: HR Manager
description:
b"

About the Company

Getinge\xc2\xa0Group is a leading global provider of innovative solutions for operating rooms, intensive-care units, hospital wards, sterilization departments, elderly care and for life science companies and institutions.

With nearly 16 000 employees in over 40 countries the Getinge Group has a passion for life, building quality and safety into every system. Our unique value proposition mirrors the continuum of care, enhancing efficiency throughout the clinical pathway. Based on our first-hand experience and close partnerships, we are able to exceed expectations from customers - improving the every-day life for people, today and tomorrow.

What is the opportunity?

We have a great senior HR leadership role with a seat at the ANZ leadership table supporting a very capable and passionate President in ANZ in executing the people strategy supported well by a strong and capable HR and recruitment team. The role is set up to play a significant leadership and transformational role across the ANZ region with 200 plus employees. Be part of a growing organisation at a critical stage of its transformational journey.

Key Responsibilities:

This role covers the full HR generalist remit. Your role will be to create, implement and lead the people strategy for the organization across ANZ. You will need to have proven capability in the following areas:

  1. Strategic Planning
  2. Leadership
  3. Talent Management
  4. Culture of Performance
  5. Change Management
  6. Compensation & Benefits

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor Degree Business Management \xe2\x80\x93 Human Resources Management OR Psychology
  • 5-10 year's experience in a National HR Management role overseeing a similar sized organization and team
  • Strong team leadership, interpersonal and relationship-building skills
  • Strong employment relation law background - skills in managing poor performance and misconduct issues; Ownership of responsibility to achieve outcomes
  • Client service orientation and commitment to excellence in work practices and work product
  • Ability to handle multiple competing priorities and meet deadlines under time pressure
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to exercise judgement to balance business needs against the interests of the people
  • Analysis and interpretation of data to make recommendations for action
  • Trusted Business Advisor - Professional and confidential approach that inspires confidence in Supervisors, Managers and Staff
  • Project management skills

As an organization, we strive to gain high performance from all of our employees. We focus on their development and growth so that our employees can achieve the expectations of the company as well as their own personal aspirations. At Getinge Group we use the foundation and structure of employee's through our behavioural cornerstones of development: Passion, Collaboration, Openness, Ownership & Excellence.

Successful applicants will be required to undergo relevant referee,\xc2\xa0police, and medical checks\xc2\xa0prior to appointment.

"

title: Experienced Software Engineer
description:
b"

Intersect is a pivotal part of Australian research infrastructure. We provide robust, innovative, and collaborative technology to support world-class research at member and customer organisations. Intersect delivers storage and compute platforms, data services, software products, custom engineering, expert consultation and training programs to hundreds of researchers every year.

Our\xc2\xa0Software Engineer roles are\xc2\xa0exciting and challenging. We are a\xc2\xa0small team who\xc2\xa0design, construction and support software solutions that enable our customers and researchers to undertake and deliver research outputs more efficiently by using technology to enhance productivity. \xc2\xa0

The team's work\xc2\xa0varies greatly\xc2\xa0from project to project, one day you could be using Python\xc2\xa0with a genome sequencer, the next, building a secure, scalable data catalog used by researchers all over the world in Rails or PHP.

Having said this, the core responsibilities are to:-

  • Design and develop code according to\xc2\xa0project specifications;

  • Use test driven development (TDD) to develop integration and/or unit level tests;

  • Identify, review and assess technology, services and systems relevant to each project;

  • Build prototypes to test concepts and/or prove design and technology requirements;

  • Analyse and profile systems to determine problem areas and deliver solutions

You will be ideally suited to our role if you have the majority of the following skills and experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science or equivalent;

  • Strong experience as a software engineer contributing to substantial software projects;

  • An understanding of the software development life cycle and experience with Agile development methods;

  • Ability to contribute to project design, analysis, specification and implementation;

  • 2+ years experience with Python, Ruby and data visualisation;\xc2\xa0

  • Some web services knowledge & experience \xe2\x80\x93 definition, configuration, deployment and security;

  • Knowledge of web-related technologies and standards such as SOAP/REST/XML/JSON;

  • Knowledge of software testing procedures and experience with unit testing;

  • Excellent verbal and written presentation skills.

Intersect is the place for you if you are trying to find meaning in\xc2\xa0your work. If\xc2\xa0you've\xc2\xa0learned multiple languages and actually want to use them, Intersect will meet your needs. \xc2\xa0If you are the type of developer who gets a buzz out of knowing what you do is helping others, you'll find like minded people here! \xc2\xa0Intersect is a small team and this helps you\xc2\xa0really make an individual difference here with your work.

We are looking for engineers that are defined by what they do not who they work for. In return we offer:-

  • A small, close knit team
  • A flexible working environment
  • A casual office\xc2\xa0in the heart of the CBD near Wynyard\xc2\xa0
  • Not for Profit Salary Sacrificing
  • A great culture and work-life balance
  • And of course, the free office drinks and snacks
"

title: NA
description: NA

title: Learning and Teaching Administration Officer
description:
b'Learning and Teaching Administration Officer
Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences
Reference no. 683/0417
  • Opportunity to be part of a team conducting research and teaching that make a difference to the Australian and global communities
  • Provide administrative support to key FASS Education Initiatives
  • Fixed term for 12 months, remuneration package: $84,435 which includes base salary, leave loading and 17% superannuation
\xc2\xa0

About the opportunity\xc2\xa0

The Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences is consistently ranked among the leading faculties of its kind, nationally and internationally. In the recent Times Higher Education 2015-16 global rankings, for example, the Faculty is ranked 1st in Humanities in Australia and 3rd in Social Sciences while in the most recent QS World Faculty Rankings it is ranked 1st in New South Wales and 14th in the world for Arts and Humanities.

Working closely with the University\xe2\x80\x99s professional services units, the Teaching and Technology Innovation team (T&TI) assists the faculty of Arts and Social Sciences to get the best from the challenges and opportunities presented by emerging technologies and ensuing levels of digital disruption.

The role of the Learning and Teaching Administration Officer is to help deliver on University and Faculty strategies by providing data and administrative support to key FASS Education initiatives, through: analytics and reporting, learning and student analytics, Learning Management System (LMS) administration and other administrative tasks.

\xc2\xa0

About you

The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance in recruiting talent aligned to these values in the pursuit of research excellence. We are looking for a Learning and Teaching Administration Officer who possesses:
  • Experience in using online survey design tools and data analysis software packages
  • Experience in updating and maintaining web pages (using a content management system and HTML
  • Excellent numeracy skills and experience in preparing spreadsheets and report using Microsoft Excel
  • Experience in updating and maintaining sites using learning management systems
  • Ability to meet deadlines in a high-volume environment
  • Proven ability to build successful relationships in a client services and team environment.
\xc2\xa0

About us

Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We\xe2\x80\x99re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across 9 campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 47,000 students.

We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.

The University of Sydney encourages part-time and flexible working arrangements, which will be considered for this role.

For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job\xe2\x80\x99s listing on the University of Sydney careers website.

All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.\xc2\xa0 Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number to apply.


Closing date: 11:30pm 16 May 2017


The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.

If we think your skills are needed in other areas of the University, we will be sure to contact you about other opportunities.

\xc2\xa9 The University of Sydney

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment. '
