title: NA
description:
b'

The Company



Our client is a fully customised marketing agency (largest in Australia) and has a long track record when it comes to providing promotional merchandise and marketing solutions to their customers in the exhibition and events space Australia wide.

The exciting Sales Support / Office Admin opportunity exists as a result of continuous growth in the Australian market.

Their organisation is all about providing a happy, supportive working culture and environment. If you're career focused and looking to be part of a stimulating and collaborative workplace with a motivated and committed team you can learn from, this is an opportunity you won't want to miss out on.



Sales Support / Office Admin Role

The primary responsibility of the Sales Support / Office Admin is to assist the Sales Team and the Managing Director with administration and other business support duties including the following but not limited to:

  • Sales support of 15 sales staff
  • Ensuring efficient operation of office
  • Executive assistance to Directors
  • Assistance in collating presentations eg. putting together proposals for clients
  • Organising the courier, packing and sending deliveries
  • Data Entry / CRM
  • Reception and ad-hoc duties



What do you need to apply?

To be successful in this role, you will need to have the following:

  • Minimum 1-2 years of Corporate experience (sales support, reception, administration, coordinator, personal assistant etc.).
  • Excellent communication/presentation skills
  • Be well presented and polished
  • Be highly organised and have good time management skills
  • A strong work ethic
  • Great attention to detail
  • Looking for long term career progression



Salary

Salary dependent on experience, Base is $45k to $50k + Super.

Please Apply Now to be considered for this amazing role to kick start your career or contact Albert on 0481 365 385 for a confidential chat.

www.streamrecruitment.com.au

title: Snr DW Developer - Informatica
description:
b"
The Environment: The local data warehouse and business intelligence solutions service over 600 users across ANZ for Management, Regulatory, Risk and Operational reporting
\xc2\xa0
The Job:
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide robust Data Warehouse architectural and development solutions for all areas of the company, including a facilitation of data product synergies, ensuring consistent and efficient technical delivery of information.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide significant input into how the company's data solutions will be designed through the on going transformation
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all aspects of the system lifecycle (i.e. analysis, testing, documentation, support) are properly managed in accordance with standards / policies, and that all approved tasks are completed on time.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the business needs are met, and hence be involved in analysis, user requirements, fixes / enhancements to existing ETL processes and reporting, as well as any new changes and reporting requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Development of technical design/configuration solutions against approved Business Requirements.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
If you have a very strong background in Informatica DW Development (5-10 years plus), preferably in a banking or fin services background and you'd like to exercise your architectural skills, then Apply now!
\xc2\xa0
For more information contact Martin Fletcher on martin.fletcher@perigongroup.com.au "

title: Analyst, Planning & Performance
description:
b"

About IAG

Insurance Australia Group Limited (IAG) is the parent company of a general insurance group with controlled operations in Australia, New Zealand and Asia, employing over 15,000 people. IAG is the name behind some of the most trusted and respected general insurance brands providing a wide range of products to protect the homes, lifestyles and businesses of our millions of customers.

About the role

We are on the lookout for a Planning and Performance Analyst with demonstrated experience to join the Operations division at IAG in a recently formed team. Working autonomously, you will support senior management across the Operations division to develop and execute business plans and projects utilising a blend of technical and influencing skills.

Supported by robust data and performance insights reporting, you will help enable and empower IAG to build a simpler, more scalable and agile business for our current and future customers. Your success in this role will be dependent on your ability to present complex insights in a simple and meaningful way to a variety of Senior stakeholders across the business.


Reporting to the Executive Manager, Planning & Performance, you will be responsible for:

  • Contributing to the formulation and evolution of the COO business plan, including preparing and facilitating planning across the COO to ensure alignment with IAG's various operating divisions and group strategy.\xc2\xa0
  • Contributing to & facilitate ongoing projects within the COO of a strategic and operational nature, as required. These projects will be separate from the work undertaken and governed by the Optimisation Office (OO).\xc2\xa0
  • Assisting in the management of the COO's internal reporting commitments to the IAG Board, Group Leadership Team and other governance forums as required (including business reviews and planning sessions).\xc2\xa0
  • Contributing to key external reporting activities including results reporting, investor updates and analyst presentations, as required.\xc2\xa0
  • Applying a broad set of planning tools and help deliver data driven insights to support planning, decision making and prioritization.

As an experienced leader, you will ideally have:

  • Tertiary level qualifications in a related discipline
  • Demonstrated experience working in a planning, strategy and/or project capacity within a large corporation, preferably ASX-listed.
  • Good understanding of planning frameworks.
  • Good understanding of the Australian general insurance industry.
  • Strong modelling and presentation skills (e.g. PowerPoint).
  • Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills (written & oral).
  • Strong analytical, project and program management skills.\xc2\xa0
  • Ability to cope with pressure and prioritise workload to meet timeframes.
  • Ability to work autonomously within a small team framework.

On offer is a rewarding career within Australia's largest general Insurer. In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options.

If you're looking for a role where you can make your mark, we'd love to hear from you. Apply online today!

"

title: Receptionist
description:
b"

Currans Accident Repair Centre has over 55 years' experience in the Automotive Industry. We are leaders in the industry with decades of experience and providing a wide range of services to suit our customer's every need. We provide luxury, classic and supercar repair services.\xc2\xa0 Currans utilises industry best practices and equipment in order to ensure vehicles are repaired back to factory specification after suffering from accident trauma.\xc2\xa0 We have a passion for the overall presentation and performance of luxury vehicles and the Concours standard vehicle presentation is the benchmark for the quality of Currans Accident Repair Centre work.


We are currently looking for a friendly and switched on Receptionist to join our friendly and growing team.

\xc2\xa0

Position details:

  • Answering telephone \xe2\x80\x93 including screening calls before forwarding
  • Daily administrative duties including photocopying, morning tea and lunch orders and sending faxes
  • Customer Services including assistance with insurance claim form completion
  • Data entry
  • Ensure that management have received messages and returned phone calls promptly
  • Complete each day's filing as directed by office manager
  • Keep files and job sheets updated every day
  • Download photos to relevant files
  • Report all customers complaints (internal and external) and conditions that are adverse to the operational efficiency of the department or achievement of quality

\xc2\xa0

Skills, Knowledge and Experience:

  • Previously worked as a receptionist
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Experience using Microsoft office products, especially excel
  • Experienced in data entry
  • Knowledge of the auto mobile industry (desirable)
  • Strong and proven organisational skills
  • Clear and polite phone manner
  • Strong and accurate administration skills
  • Excellent communication skills

\xc2\xa0

How to apply:\xc2\xa0 Please email your up to date resume to hr@currans.com.au stating where you saw this role advertised.

\xc2\xa0

Seek:\xc2\xa0 Please click the 'Apply Now' button ensuring that you attach your up to date resume.

\xc2\xa0

To be eligible for this position you must have an appropriate visa to work in Australia/New Zealand

\xc2\xa0

Please note:\xc2\xa0 Only successful applicants will be contacted due to the high volume of applications

"

title: Java Developer - Spring/Microservices - BRISBANE
salary: b'$market leading salary, flexibility and more'
description:
b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
The organisation does great things for Queensland community and relies heavily on information and efficient, accurate work-flow to keep doing so.\xc2\xa0 Huge, new commercial opportunities they could capitalise on are significant but sometimes slowed by technology.

These roles and specifically, YOU have an opportunity to make a real impact with your smart coding skills across Java using Spring Boot,\xc2\xa0Spring Data and REST and utilising cloud services such as AWS and Docker to support and drive forward a number of major projects.

To\xc2\xa0re-iterate, the key areas of focus are around maintenance and development using:
  • Java 7/8
  • Spring Boot
  • Micro-services exposure and/or experience (highly regarded)
  • REST
  • Hibernate
  • Docker (highly regarded but not essential)
  • AWS (ditto above)
The main message to get out here is about the environment and working culture. This is a chance to join a large, diverse team who are all very friendly, warm and collaborative and have a clear mission to deliver together.

There will be true work-life balance and flexibility on offer in this role - leadership is all about outcome-based approaches. There is also one RDO per month, further flexible working arrangements and additional financial benefits for your pocket.

With property prices and rents going orbital in the southern states, maybe now is the time to head north to the sunshine and the chance to own more than a shoebox!

To hear more about this exciting and rare opportunity in the Australian market, please contact Adam Broadbent on 0487 868 787 or email adam@harveybroadbent.com.au

*** THIS ROLE IS BASED PERMANENTLY IN BRISBANE *** '

title: Cryptologist Operator
description:
b'

Opportunity

As a Navy Cryptologist Operator (also known as Cryptologic Systems), intercept and analyse radio data transmissions while enjoying:

  • a good salary plus generous superannuation
  • ongoing investment in your personal and career development
  • free medical and dental
  • job security and a good work/life balance
  • rewarding work and world-class training
  • subsidised accommodation
  • a supportive team environment
  • travel and leave entitlements
  • free access to sports and fitness facilities
  • friendships that last a lifetime

All that plus meaningful experiences such as joining humanitarian missions and supporting communities in need.

Your role

If you have good attention to detail, advanced problem-solving skills and the discretion to be entrusted with sensitive information, you could make an excellent Cryptologist Operator (Cryptologic Systems).

In this rewarding intelligence role you will be responsible for the detection, acquisition, identification and exploitation of machine-generated communications. You'll use sophisticated search receivers and other state-of-the-art equipment to intercept electromagnetic emissions that deliver tactical advantage to the Australian Defence Force.

Dependent on your exact role, some of the duties you may perform include:

  • manually tuning or programming radio receivers and manipulating automated systems
  • searching, identifying, analysing and reporting on transmissions of interest
  • utilising state of the art high-tech equipment to record selected or unknown transmissions to enable in-depth analysis of these signals
  • At sea, conducting initial real-time and post intercept in-depth analysis of communications
  • providing tactical indication of possible threats
  • producing technical reports and summaries on transmissions of interest

All Cryptologist Operators (Cryptologic Systems) receive training on:

  • communications theory, including radio wave propagation
  • operation of acquisition, recording, and processing equipment
  • analytical techniques including problem solving
  • communications networks; formats, terminology, and theory of pattern analysis
  • the fighting structure or the 'order of battle' of military forces
  • procedures for processing and distributing intelligence data
  • methods for handling, distributing, and safeguarding intelligence information

In this critical role you'll enjoy the personal satisfaction of having a direct impact on the success of Navy operations. Better still, you will be working for a dynamic organisation that offers a great lifestyle plus opportunities you simply won't find anywhere else.

Sounds good? Then apply now (below).

Salary

  • Fully-paid training
  • Once trained, starting package approx. $66,100 p.a. plus superannuation
  • Numerous other benefits

Location

  • Any fleet unit or shore establishment in Australia
  • Some of your time will be spent at sea

Entry Requirements

  • At least 17 years of age
  • Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Year 10 completion with passes in English, Mathematics and Science (preferably with a Physics component)

If you do not have the required passes you may be eligible to sit an Alternative Education Equivalency assessment. Medical and fitness guidelines also apply.

To be considered for this highly classified role you will need to undergo a detailed security evaluation.

How to Apply

Click on the APPLY FOR THIS JOB button to submit your application. For more information view the full position description here:

Cryptologist Operator (Cryptologic Systems) position description

'

title: Senior Analyst
description:
b'
Senior Data Analyst
Clerk Grade 9/10
Department of Family & Community Services
\xc2\xa0
Location: Ashfield
Salary range: 102,838 - $113,324 pa plus employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
About the Opportunity
\xc2\xa0
Note a Data Analyst role (Clerk Grade 7/8) is also being advertised concurrently. To view the advertisement and apply for this role see Job Reference Number 57UB.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
There is an exciting opportunity to join the Statistical Analysis and Modelling team at NSW Family and Community Services (FACS) to shape future policy direction that impacts FACS? most vulnerable clients.
\xc2\xa0
The Statistical Analysis and Modelling team undertakes quantitative analysis and modelling, research and provides valuable insights and advice to policy makers and operational arms of the business to inform current reforms, planning and policy development.
\xc2\xa0
As part of a small team, you will be responsible for

  • Undertaking statistical analysis for research and evaluation of programs


  • Developing \xc2\xa0quantitative models such as demand forecasting models


  • Leading data linkage projects


  • Providing governance support to FACS stakeholders around data sharing and usage\xc2\xa0
To be successful in this role appropriate tertiary qualifications and relevant professional experience in quantitative analysis and analytical software packages such as SAS or SPSS is required.
\xc2\xa0
Job Notes
\xc2\xa0
This is a temporary role in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013 for a period of up to 12 months.
\xc2\xa0
A Recruitment Pool may be created to fill similar roles for both ongoing and temporary opportunities if and as they arise.
\xc2\xa0
How to apply
\xc2\xa0
Candidates must apply online and submit a covering letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume which clearly details their skills and experience as relevant to this role.
\xc2\xa0
Part of the assessment process may include additional online capability testing, skills testing or work samples in accordance with the new Government Sector Employment Act 2013, therefore you may be contacted to participate. You will also be asked to complete a Health Declaration Form in later stages of the assessment process.
\xc2\xa0
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
\xc2\xa0
FACS is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and other diversity groups.
\xc2\xa0
FACS encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace.
If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.
If you?re looking for general information about our reasonable adjustment process, you can email WorkforceAcquisition@facs.nsw.gov.au or phone (02) 8879 9115.
\xc2\xa0
More Information
\xc2\xa0
Click here to view the role description.
\xc2\xa0
For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here
\xc2\xa0
Please submit your application online including the information outlined above.
\xc2\xa0
If you experience difficulties submitting your application, please contact FACS recruitment on 9765 3999.
\xc2\xa0
Closing date: Monday 15^th May 2017 at 11:59pm
\xc2\xa0
For enquiries: Please contact Shuling Chen on 02 9716 2566 or Shuling.Chen @facs.nsw.gov.au
\xc2\xa0
Thank you for your interest in our role.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: BI Developer / Consultant - Permanent - Sydney
description:
b'
The Company
Have been around for some time now and are well known for having some of the best BI & Analytics specialists in the country. They have a number of developments on at anyone time and will be working on traditional BI reporting projects, unstructured data pieces and large DW builds.\xc2\xa0

The Role
Is for someone who loves making sense of data. if you are a BA, Developer, Data Analyst, consultant or all of the above then this could be your role. You will be talking to business units, gathering data and putting together reports and insights to deliver to the relevant people. You will help design databases, deep dive into some unstructured data as well as developing amazing reports.\xc2\xa0

Requirements
3-5+ Years BI Development, Data Analyst or Analytics experience\xc2\xa0
Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Board or other BI tool knowledge
Understanding of R, Python, SAS, Excel\xc2\xa0
Expert in all things database related
Strong SQL knowledge\xc2\xa0
Excellent communication skills\xc2\xa0
Time management ninja\xc2\xa0

On offer is the chance to work with an award winning organisation that has a huge pipeline of work and are working on some of the best BI & Analytics projects in Australia. They invest in their staff and offer a lot of training, support and some great incentives.\xc2\xa0

Please click the apply now button and send in your most up to date CV.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

'

title: Clinical Territory Manager( Retail pharmacy)
description:
b"\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Why work with EvansPetersen? We specialise in recruitment within the Pharmaceutical and Medical Device Industry. We have\xc2\xa0developed an outstanding network of clients, as well as a very thorough knowledge of the Healthcare industry. How? Because we've all worked in it ourselves as reps, managers, marketers - not just recruiters! We support our candidates by offering a personalised and experienced approach, every step of the interviewing process.
Our client
Are committed to understanding and meeting the needs of local customers and patients. They develop, manufacture and market high-quality affordable medicines the world over and it is their mission to ensure affordable, quality medicines are available to people in both Australia and New Zealand.
\xc2\xa0
About the Role
  • Position is calling on Retail Pharmacists & front of shop staff
  • You will be a highly motivated and extremely business focused salesperson\xc2\xa0
  • Territory covers South West, Southern Highlands and ACT
  • Must have ability to take on & impart clinical data
  • Permanent full time role
  • Reporting to NSW Manager (team of 7 in NSW)
  • 1 week per month in country territory
  • Large number of new launches planned throughout the next 2 years
  • Company focus in Biosimilars\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0The Successful Applicant\xc2\xa0
  • Experience within the pharmacy arena as a Pharmacist or Pharmacy rep
  • Successful completion of relevant tertiary qualifications- pharmacy preferred
  • Previous sales experience advantageous
  • Strong results focus with a proven track record of achieving targets/ KPIs etc
  • Resilience & tenacity
  • Agile with lots of energy!
  • Full Australian licence

Competitive salary package including car or car allowance, super and bonuses is on offer for the successful candidate - Interested? \xc2\xa0

Click the APPLY button to send your CV.

If you would like further information before sending your CV, please call Karina Stafford on 0401 991454 for a confidential chat.

WWW.EPHealthcare.com.au
au.linkedin.com/in/karinastafford

Please follow us on our LINKEDIN page; EvansPetersen Healthcare

\xc2\xa0
This opportunity is only open to candidates who are eligible to work in Australia and hold the appropriate visa to work permanently "

title: NA
description:
b'
Originally a fashion house,\xc2\xa0Merivale, owned by the Hemmes family, has been established in Australia for 60 years. The Hemmes family are developing and operating pioneers within the hospitality industry - owning a growing portfolio of more than 60 vibrant restaurants, bars, pubs, hotels and event spaces across Sydney. Merivale is built on our people and proudly employs over 3000 of the industry's most exceptional talent.
\xc2\xa0
We're searching for someone who is crazy about data, analytics and insights. An exceptional talent that is passionate about identifying trends and using them to identify opportunities, inform briefs, CRM strategy and using them to address business challenges. The primary responsibility for the Research and Insights Manager will be to review data from multiple sources and identify insights and trends while also being responsible for:
  • championing the voice of our guests in a way that will shape business strategies, deliver real return on investment and add long term guest value to multiple disciplines within the business; events, guest relations, operations and the technology team
  • build insight around the guests journey and multiple connection points, to inform creative briefs and serve as foundations for the marketing and CRM strategy
  • focus on getting underneath the key business issues and using technical expertise in the fields of insight and CRM to engage key stakeholders, teams and Merivale partners to achieve real value to the business.
To be successful, you will need to demonstrate the following
  • You will be extremely strategic but also have a creative flair

  • exceptionally strong written skills and computer literacy, with the ability to create simple presentations that tell an impelling story
  • clear verbal presentation skills and style with a natural ability to present in a manner that influences and leads others
  • organised and efficient with time management, can keep up with the fast pace of the industry and our organisation.
  • passionate about consumer behaviour but also food, wine, lifestyle, design, music and entertainment
Sound like the next challenge you are looking for? Please submit your CV for our review.\xc2\xa0 In return, you will be provided with fantastic career development opportunities, strong support and incredibly generous discounts and benefits as well as a competitive salary package. '

title: Technical Program Manager (SEATTLE Opportunities)
description:
b'

Rowben Consulting have a number of opportunities available for Technical Project Manager who want to work with Amazon in Seattle.

These roles will be across a number of highly visible projects within the Group. These will include projects around Security and Data Analytics.

At Amazon being a Technical Program Manager is a high-level, high visibility position that is extremely important to the success of our product teams. They are visionary; they drive technology and have led teams and projects.

As a Technical Program Manager you are expected to have ownership over the full lifecycle, from inception to delivery. This means that they will be responsible for gathering requirements, defining features, planning projects, reviewing architecture, removing road blocks, owning products, and more.

Essentially, responsibilities of a Technical Program Manager can be broken into three core areas:

  • Technical - Has a solid engineering background and will be facilitating and contributing to design and architecture discussions with the engineering team. Need the ability to read code and design a system at a high level and be comfortable going deep in specific areas to assess tradeoffs, scalability, etc.
  • Project - Will own projects from inception to delivery
  • Design/Product - Decides what product to build, its features, and the delivery schedule

Do you have what it takes?

  • Background as a Software Development Engineer (5+ years is ideal)
  • 3+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in platform technology groups to define, scope, prioritize and deliver software products
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills
  • A proven track record in being responsible for systems design/architecture
  • Leading a SCRUM
  • Outstanding communication skills
  • Experience working with large -scale online services

All candidates who apply MUST be an Australian Citizen.

Amazon hires the world\xe2\x80\x99s brightest minds and offers them an environment in which they can invest and innovate to improve the experience for their customers.

This is not a direct advertisement from Amazon. Rowben Consulting will only submit applications to Amazon who meet all the required criteria requested by this amazing organisation.

'

title: NA
description:
b'

Why Gallagher Australia?

Arthur J Gallagher is one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s leading insurance brokers and risk solutions providers. You will be joining one of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s growth stories and playing a role in shaping the future world for more than 100,000 clients ranging from SMEs through to large multi-national corporations, affinity partners and trade & industry associations. Headquartered in Itasca, Illinois, we have grown from humble origins to become one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest insurance and risk management business.\xc2\xa0

Insurance may not be a first choice of career for many people but what we find is that once you invest, you will find a wealth of opportunities await you. Whether you are in a front-line sales role, part of our back-office support team or somewhere in between, choosing Gallagher could be one of your smartest career moves and a unique opportunity to watch the future unfold.\xc2\xa0

We look forward to meeting you.

\xc2\xa0

What is the role?

We have an excellent opportunity to join our National HR team as an HR Coordinator based in North Sydney.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

As our HR Coordinator, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be responsible for the professional, efficient, effective and seamless delivery of support and assistance to the overall business including supporting HR BAU activities and initiatives. The role will focus on all HR life-cycle processes, including:

  • Co-ordinating and processing employee related activities
  • Ensuring the integrity of data and information in the system.
  • Administering HR processes, policies and projects.

In return, we create opportunities for your continued learning and growth on the job and within the organisation. You will be part of a team that collaborates, is focused on providing great service but also celebrates its successes.

\xc2\xa0

What are we looking for?

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Minimum 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in a similar Human Resources role, to give you a good grasp of HR processes including understanding how to apply policies, administer\xc2\xa0compliance and employment related regulatory requirements.
  • Tertiary qualifications in HR or a related discipline
  • A\xc2\xa0passion for learning, continuous improvement and for\xc2\xa0delivering excellent service.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • High attention to detail and organisational skills
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills, especially in Excel to be comfortable working with large and complex data sets
  • Good knowledge of HR processes
  • High degree of motivation and self-discipline\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

What team does this role sit within?

Our national HR team is located across Sydney, Melbourne and Perth enabling our businesses, partnering with our leaders and supporting our people across on facets of HR including recruitment, learning and development, operations and service delivery, payroll and growth initiatives (i.e. integrations and acquisitions). We work closely with our global teams to leverage and optimise resources and create more value to our people.

\xc2\xa0

How to apply?

For more information please contact Karine McAuliffe, Head of Recruitment at careers@ajg.com.au or apply online today. Deadline for applications is Sunday,\xc2\xa09 April, 2017 however selection may commence prior.

'

title: NA
description:
b"Use your deep knowledge of digital and customer to provide thought leadership and create an experience difference for customers and the business.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

Who?
\xc2\xa0
Like a lot of large organisations, our Client is going through positive change and transformation to provide a better service and experience to their customers.\xc2\xa0 On their quest to become customer lead, data driven and digital first, they need a digital thought leader who can work comfortably with an ELT, and collaboratively alongside their peers to embed a truly integrated digital approach that makes things easier for both customers and the business - it's the beautiful balance between customer centricity and measurable business outcomes with digital as the enabler.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
I know we are skirting around the industry in which they operate, this is not a mistake.\xc2\xa0 We are keen to speak with people who have deep digital marketing knowledge, have worked to a general management level within a large organisation, are commercial and business savvy and we are open to the sector you may have gained this experience in.
\xc2\xa0
What?
\xc2\xa0
Here is an opportunity to make a difference in the digital future for this business.\xc2\xa0 Acting as the digital thought leader, you will bring vision, clarity and innovation to the organisation.\xc2\xa0 This role is focused on defining and bringing to life several areas including future digital, design, product innovation and ecosystem strategies.\xc2\xa0 You will use Lean Design and Agile methodologies to bring new products and services to life tying in customer centricity with business outcomes.\xc2\xa0 It's all about identifying digital trends, threats and opportunities that you can leverage.
\xc2\xa0
As well as providing thought leadership to the board, senior leadership, and peers, you will lead a large and varied team of digital specialists particularly within the program space.\xc2\xa0 You will create a culture of excellence, where people are engaged and share a vision of building a world class digital experience.\xc2\xa0 Wider to this you will build your reputation across the business and be a welcomed influencer enabling you to embed the vision of a customer lead, data driven digital first business.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Who?
\xc2\xa0
We are looking for someone with experience in everything from digital strategy through to execution, you will have worked in large and complex organisations and know how and when to scale your ideas.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Broader then your advanced digital experience and knowledge, we are looking for someone with proven business leadership and management skills at a senior Head of or General Management level.\xc2\xa0 We need someone who is experienced in commercialising products from a digital perspective, is adept at influencing and leading their peer group through to Board level, is experienced at managing budgets, resources and the commercial finance piece as well as an expert in Design Thinking and Agile methodologies.
\xc2\xa0
From a personal perspective, you will be comfortable working in a transforming environment and have the skills, capabilities and appetite to be a leader through what can be a painful process!\xc2\xa0 You will have masses of integrity, be a straight shooter and a clear and concise communicator. But over-riding all, you will be a people person at heart, engaging, and willing to empower.
\xc2\xa0
Apply.
\xc2\xa0
For a confidential chat about the opportunity including the role itself and the level (as mentioned at this stage we can't disclose the business or sector) please get in touch with Estelle at Tribe on 021 247 1062.\xc2\xa0 If this sounds like your ideal next role feel free to apply in confidence. "

title: Inside Sales Representative - Data Center Group (TSR)

Lenovo is a US $46 billion global Fortune 500 company and a leader in providing innovative consumer, commercial and enterprise technologies. At Lenovo we employ more than 60,000 people worldwide and our people share a common aspiration to be the very best. Whether serving our customers, working as a team or contributing to the community, we are working to build a unique company.\xc2\xa0 A company that delivers unparalleled products created and supported by people with a wealth of different cultures and experiences. Our strength lies in this diversity. We are dedicated to fostering an environment that encourages entrepreneurism and ownership. A workplace where people's talents can be challenged and their efforts recognised and rewarded.\xc2\xa0 We employ fantastic people\xe2\x80\xa6come join the fun!

Lenovo is an Affirmative Action - Equal Opportunity Employer.\xc2\xa0 We offer a market-competitive salary and benefits package including:\xc2\xa0 An external benefits package, an Employee Assistance Program, life insurance, a reward and recognition program that provides the opportunity to win cash and non-cash incentives, flexible work arrangements and professional and interpersonal development programs tailored to your needs.

title: FMCG Category Analyst / Client Manager - THE ROLE THAT HAS IT ALL!
description:
b"

This role has it ALL!

  • BIG BRAND clients both local and international
  • High visibility with clients from day 1 including working onsite with client brand, marketing and product teams
  • Access to the best in market practices, shopper and loyalty data and IP
  • Exciting fast paced projects across shopper, brand, price, promotion and product strategy
  • Solid career progression including an established fast track / future leaders program and industry gold standard training
  • Real opportunities for international secondments and travel
  • Flexible working including options to work from home
  • Fun, social and supportive work culture

Are you a switched on, intelligent and enthusiastic Research Account Manager / Category Manager / Category Analyst interested in the world of FMCG marketing insight and strategy? Do you enjoy delivering insights from marketing and sales data and using those insights to advise clients? Do you get a buzz from working on high profile projects? Then look no further; this is the role for you!

Our client is a leading edge data driven research consultancy, and they are looking for a talented and numerate Account Manager to join their growing team. Providing strategic direction supported by sophisticated, relevant analytics they really are at the forefront of the industry. They provide resource (people, software and data) to deliver their clients the answers they need to stay one step ahead of the competition.

As an Account Manager you will be on site with your clients to offer research and consultancy services on all aspects of product and category management e.g. new product launch, promotional performance and competitor analysis. The ideal candidate will have previous experience of analysing scan data or FMCG sales data. This could have been gained in house within an FMCG producer or retailer or through working for a research / data supplier. You will also need to have strong account and client management skills, alongside an ability to communicate (verbal and written).

This company is going from strength to strength and so it is the perfect environment in which to see your career really fly! So don't delay, apply today! Send your CV to Rowan Haylett on rhaylett@resourcesgroup.com

"

title: Research Executive | Join a business with a difference
description:
b'

So what makes this business different?

They dare to be great and are not afraid to imagine new possibilities and aim high.

They thrive in teams and collaborate with clients, consumers and each other to inspire and achieve goals

They keep it real and appreciate that is short \xe2\x80\x93 they try not to be so busy building careers that they don't make a life.

As a Research Executive within this top team you will learn to truly understand client businesses, grasping their issues whilst spotting opportunities. As a business they help clients navigate the ever changing complexities of the consumer world. They advise on product development, pricing, brand and marketing strategy, communications, customer experience and much much more. They work for top name clients across teleco's, banking and retail and this is the ideal role for a researcher who wants to work closely with top brands.

title: Campaign Insights Analyst (SQL Teradata)
description:
b"Our client is a high profile loyalty analytics and insights business with global footprint and outstanding reputation for delivering best in class solutions. Boasting unique and extensive loyalty data assets that focus on Australian consumer behaviour, they stand in exceptional position where they fuse this information with online customer behaviour data to provide increadibly effective customer campaign targeting solutions. As a result of the success of the business a brand new position has been released for an experienced SQL Digital Campaign Analyst to join the team with the key responsibilities including but bit limited to;\xc2\xa0
  • Engaging with key stakeholders across the business to understand and consult around analytical project requirements, negotiating timelines against deliverables to ensure workable outcomes can be achieved.
  • Leveraging strong SQL (Teradata) data manipulation skills to extract, manage and merge large volumes customer data from a variety of complex data sources. Delivering against ongoing requests from the business for timely and accurate SQL data sets to support strategic initiatives. \xc2\xa0
  • Providing analysis and insights throughout the project pipeline leveraging techniques that may include; pre campaign analysis, experimental design, control group creation, test and learn, next best action analysis, control group testing, ROI analysis, post campaign reviews, dashboards and reports etc\xc2\xa0
The successful applicant will come with strong experience working in a complex consumer data driven environment, where delivering insights from complex SQL data sets has been a key focus. You will be able to demonstrate:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Strong technical skills and experience (3yrs+) using SQL, SAS or R to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R)\xc2\xa0
  • At least two years' experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data focusing on marketing campaigns, customer insights, risk reporting/analysis, statistical modelling etc\xc2\xa0
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as - Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Studies, Data Science, Computer Science\xc2\xa0etc.\xc2\xa0
  • An understanding or appreciation of the Data Analytics / Data Science landscape and analytical concepts such as; Marketing Campaign Analytics, Customer Insights Analysis, Customer Propensity Modeling (Churn / Acquisition / Cross Sell / Up Sell), Segmentation Analysis (Cluster / Basket), Customer Lifetime Value Analysis, Next Best Offer Analysis, Hypothesis/Significance Testing, Decision Trees, Neural Networks etc.
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply Now' button below or send you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

title: Senior Customer Insights Analyst
description:
b"Our client is a high profile and instantly recognisable travel and tourism brand, who are relishing a sustained period of innovation in their approach to customer marketing through data driven insight and analytics. As the result of the departure of a valued member of the team they are looking for an experienced Customer Marketing Insights Analyst\xc2\xa0to join the business with the key focus on innovation and execution. \xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Working as a Senior Customer Marketing Insights Analyst the core responsibilities of this role will cover but not be limited to:\xc2\xa0
  • Managing key relationships with with marketing stakeholders, consulting around customer marketing strategy, analytical project requirements, and the associated timelines and deliverables.
  • Deliver a range of bespoke analytical projects, leveraging techniques that may include but not be limited to; marketing campaign analytics, customer insights analysis, customer propensity modeling (churn / acquisition / cross sell / up sell), segmentation analysis (cluster / basket), customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, data visualisation, project story boarding. \xc2\xa0
  • Ensure the ongoing support. delivery and operational fulfilment of all data initiatives.
The successful applicant will come from a strong background working in a data analytics environment, where analysing and delivering key insights from large data sets has been the focus. You will be able to demonstrate
  • Strong stakeholder engagement and relationship management skills with the ability to present compelling data driven stories (story boards) and gain buy-in on new concepts and roadmaps.
  • At least four years of\xc2\xa0commercial\xc2\xa0experience\xc2\xa0experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data relating to; customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, statistical modelling, marketing mix modelling etc. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Strong technical skills and experience using SQL, SAS, R or Python to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R)\xc2\xa0
  • Strong attention to detail, prioritization, & process improvement skills.
  • A genuine passion for building on\xc2\xa0your career in Data Analytics / Data Scientist, implementing analytical techniques and concepts such as; marketing campaign analytics, customer insights analysis, customer propensity modeling (churn / acquisition / cross sell / up sell), segmentation analysis (cluster / basket), credit risk analysis, credit scorecard development, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, significance testing, decision trees, neural networks etc
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

title: Senior Test Automation Engineer
description:
b"Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?

If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.

We\xe2\x80\x99re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades \xe2\x80\x94 and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be working with teams across the world. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.

We are currently looking for\xc2\xa0Test Automation Engineers to join our R&D team based in North Ryde. This role will require you to create QA strategies, test plans, procedures, test cases and test scripts according to business and functional requirements.
\xc2\xa0
As a Test Automation Engineer you will be involved with:
  • Perform QA engineering reviews and ensure compliance with stated requirements
  • Identify the goal of the serve and develop a QA strategy and plan
  • Evaluate and test new software applications
  • Design test cases
  • Implement test cases using automated test tools
  • Transform detailed requirements into a complete, detailed systems QA document which focuses on how to verify the required functionality
  • Convert the design into a complete test system
  • Install the systems environment
  • Create and test databases
  • Prepare test case procedures, test files and perform a test readiness review
  • Perform API level testing, System testing, black box, functional, UI and white box testing
  • Perform load, performance, security, capacity, availability and scalability tests
  • Prepare and document reports to communicate internally
  • Work with technical teams and assist with the installation and deployment of the new service / application.
  • Resolve any issues identified in the integration and test phases
Key Selection Criteria
  • Demonstrated experience in Software Quality Assurance
  • Deep knowledge of the SDLC and a QA\xe2\x80\x99s role within it
  • Experienced with implementing and auditing test methodologies and QA standards
  • Extensive experience designing and implementing test suites for cloud (SaaS) services
  • Experience testing micro-services, containerised applications and ideally application analytics utilities
  • Selenium Webdriver with C#
  • Performance testing with JMeter
  • Microsoft Test Manager
  • Solid understanding of SQL Server and relational databases
  • Jira
  • Scrum / Agile

We would like to take this opportunity to thank you in advance for your application and advise that only candidates that meet the position requirements and who have valid Australian work rights will be contacted.

Job Ref: BP224403
birsen.polat@dimensiondata.com

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Birsen Polat on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 224403. "

title: Electrical Site Foreman - Commercial Projects

title: Business Intelligence Report Developer
description:
b'

The Performance and Pricing Team is responsible to:

This position contributes to the development of an effective and sustainable workers' compensation scheme. The role manages the development and implementation of reports and data extracts that support performance reporting, analytics and premium setting functions within Comcare.

title: Full Stack Developer - Node.JS / Scala / Apache Spark - 6 Month Contract
description:

This is a great opportunity, looking for a talented Full stack developer with strong skills in front end technologies, Node.JS, Scala, AWS infrastructure and DevOps.

  • 3+ years Full stack web developement experience
  • Proven technical background in Node.js & Scala
  • Have worked with AWS, Apache Spark and Redshift
  • Well versed in front end technologies - HTML, CSS, Javascript
  • Any experience working on big data application builds is highly valued
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Enjoys working in an agile / collaborative digital technology environment
  • Any knowledge of MongoDB and Apache Kafka is well regarded
This role is keen to start someone ASAP and is offing a very attractive day rate and supportive work environment.

To find out more please e-mail your CV to ds@limelightpeople.com.au\xc2\xa0
Or call 02 8458 2626 '

description:
b'

BACS has a full time 9-5 vacancy for a customer support person in our East Chatswood office.\xc2\xa0 Parking available and close to bus services.

We're looking for someone to join our team of 14 who has a desire to see customers happy, enjoys a challenge, and gets satisfaction from a job well done.\xc2\xa0 In addition to supporting our customers, you'll be working closely with our sales, service and accounts departments.\xc2\xa0 Microsoft Office skills essential.\xc2\xa0 Closing soon.,\xc2\xa0 This is a good job and will go fast so act now.

title: Commercial HVAC - Site Supervisor
salary: b'$85k - $100k p.a. + plus super and vehicle allowan'
description:
b'

About the company;

Our client is progressive tier two contractor who currently operates with-in commercial new development and refurbishments - mechanical HVAC, trading over 30 years with and a strong client base they have managed to keep a family orientated environment perfect for the work life balance as well as sustaining substantial growth with-in their key sectors - As a result they are now seeking an experienced Site Foreman/ Manager to join their construction team.

Your new role;

Reporting directly to the project manager you will be responsible for everyday management on site.

You will be in charge of running labour, ordering materials, tool box meetings, making sure all onsite safety is up to scratch and will be working closely with the PM ensuring the project is delivered on time and with-in budget - projects range from $2 million up to $7 million.

Our client can offer career progression and believes in promoting internally, this position is ideal for someone wanting to progress into a junior PM\xe2\x80\x99s position.


This a reputable contractor with low staff turn over and can offer a range of benefits for working with their organisation.

About the Culture;

The company is family owned and have kept their family orientated environment.
They offer a great work/ life balance, the director still works in the office allowing management and senior staff to have input into company direction.

Package;

  • $80 to $100k plus super, vehicle allowance and laptop.
  • Career development and training.
  • Work/ life balance
  • Progress into project management

Selection Criteria;

  • Trade qualified - HVAC
  • Understanding of OH&S
  • Two recent references
  • Excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong time management

For further information regarding this position or any other opportunities that we currently have available please contact James Iversen in confidence on 0403 578 999 or at james.iversen@designandconstruct.com.au

'

title: Digital Analyst
description:
b"
  • Ref 680/17
  • Penrith Campus
  • Full-Time, Ongoing

The Office of Marketing and Communication at Western Sydney are seeking applications for the position of Digital Analyst. The Office of Marketing and Communication leads activity to develop the image, branding, positioning and marketing of the University. The Office also plays a leading role in ensuring continuous improvement across a range University systems that are designed to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.\xc2\xa0

The Analytics and Insights team are responsible for undertaking the analysis of student and market data, and interpreting insights in a compelling way to all stakeholders, as well as engaging stakeholders in financial planning activities, system analysis and process improvement.\xc2\xa0

The Digital Analyst will work within the Office of Marketing and Communication and be responsible for providing digital analytics to internal marketing clients, assisting with defining and implementing measurement strategies that align with internal client marketing and business objectives. This position will be responsible for producing meaningful marketing KPI dashboards, delivering regular performance reports and fostering a test and learn culture within the marketing team. It will carry responsibility for web analytics (Adobe Analytics) insights capabilities including the reporting, dashboard development, data integrity, insights and actionability of the data.\xc2\xa0

Some of the key responsibilities of the role include:\xc2\xa0

  • Advising on campaign strategy: advising on suitable measurement strategies; analysing campaign performance; benchmarking performance across KPIs.\xc2\xa0
  • Reporting and analysis: analysing, interpreting and reporting on available data on trends and marketing campaigns; analysing online user behaviour; performing ROI analysis on campaign effectiveness.\xc2\xa0
  • Analytical and technical: providing feedback on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking; providing tag and data governance and KPI governance.\xc2\xa0
  • Communication: collaborating with the wider marketing team to enhance campaign effectiveness.\xc2\xa0


Please review the position description and address the selection criteria to be considered for the role.\xc2\xa0

This is a full-time, ongoing position based at our Penrith Campus (Werrington North).\xc2\xa0

Remuneration Package:\xc2\xa0HEW Level 8 $111,562 - $123,846 p.a.\xc2\xa0(comprising salary $94,271 - $104,651 p.a., 17% superannuation and leave loading).

Position Enquiries:\xc2\xa0Frances Holland on (02) 9678 7326 or email\xc2\xa0f.holland@westernsydney.edu.au\xc2\xa0

Closing Date:\xc2\xa014 May 2017

To view the Position Description and to apply for this position, please go to the University's current vacancies website athttp://www.westernsydney.edu.au/employment/home/current_vacancies\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Lead Analyst - Marketing & Campaign Analytics
description:
b"Our client is a high profile financial service organization with a large, established and growing analytics division. As the result of the changing structure of the team and a number of strategic initiatives being rolled out, a brand new position for a Senior/Lead Customer Marketing Campaign Analytics Specialist has been released. This unique opportunity will give the successful candidate a highly visible role supporting these key initiatives which will ensure their ongoing professional development and a clearly mapped path towards senior management promotion.
\xc2\xa0
The immediate responsibilities of this role will include but not be limited to.
  • Taking\xc2\xa0the role of Lead Analyst within the team,\xc2\xa0managing and\xc2\xa0mentoring peers, supporting\xc2\xa0recruitment\xc2\xa0activity and ensuring best practice\xc2\xa0techniques are leveraged.
  • Engaging with key marketing stakeholders across the business to understand and consult around analytical project requirements, negotiating timelines and deliverables to ensure workable\xc2\xa0project briefs
  • Providing analysis and insights throughout the project pipeline leveraging techniques that may include; pre/post campaign analysis, experimental design, control group creation, test and learn, next best action analysis, control group testing, ROI analysis, post campaign reviews, dashboards, reports etc.\xc2\xa0
  • Leveraging strong SQL (Teradata) or SAS Base data manipulation skills to extract, manage and merge large volumes customer data from a variety of complex data sources. Delivering against ongoing requests from the business for timely and accurate data sets to support strategic initiatives.\xc2\xa0
  • Supporting and\xc2\xa0proactively adding value to key\xc2\xa0strategic\xc2\xa0initiatives that may include; Agile workflow\xc2\xa0integration, Digital\xc2\xa0strategy adoption, New technology implementations (i.e. Adobe Marketing Cloud), analyst upskilling and team capability development. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
The successful applicant will come with strong experience working in a complex consumer data driven environment, where delivering insights and strategic optimization from complex SQL/SAS data sets has been a key focus. You will be able to demonstrate;
  • A natural flair and passion for leadership and a genuine passion to pusue a career in senior management, with previous experience managing or mentoring analysts within the team environment.\xc2\xa0
  • A strong appreciation of the Customer Marketing Campaign Analytics landscape and analytical concepts such as; Campaign Optimization, Pre/Post Campaign Analysis, Inflight Tracking, A/B Testing, Control/Hypothesis Testing, ROI Analysis, Digital Chanel Optimization, Customer Insights Analysis, Propensity Modeling (Churn/Acquisition/Cross Sell), Segmentation Analysis, Customer Lifetime Value, Next Best Action/Offer Analysis, etc.
  • Strong technical skills and experience (3yrs+) using SQL or SAS to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems\xc2\xa0(e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R)\xc2\xa0
  • Experience working in an 'Agile' environment will prove highly advantageous.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply Now' button below or send you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com "

title: Account Executive - Marketing Technology
description:
b'

Client

This company is in a significant period of growth. With pent up demand in market, their core proposition is around helping clients solve complex marketing problems using technology and analytics. With disruptive technology and services in market, they are supporting clients in bringing their marketing practice in house, and become true life cycle marketers.

Opportunity

  • Daily management of offline/online marketing campaigns
  • Make recommendations to clients on leveraging data insights in campaigns
  • Own program execution for clients, working in conjunction with cross functional delivery teams\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Manage multiple data driven marketing projects

You

  • Experience helping clients to solve marketing and business\xc2\xa0problems\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

    \xc2\xa0

On offer

    \xc2\xa0

Be part of the next growth phase of this international company drive change through the business, develop professionally and you will accelerate you career.

'

title: Senior Consultant Engineer - Splunk
description:
b'

This fast growing consultancy is looking for at least 2 hands-on\xc2\xa0Engineers with good consultative soft skills. Reporting in to a Principal Consultant and working alongside some very skilled Engineers, Architects and Consultants, we are looking for Engineers with the following experience:

  • Previous consulting experience internal or external but ideally gained within an agnostic Systems Integrator;
  • A solid technical engineer with at least 3 years Splunk Integration, configuration and deployment experience;
  • Experience of dealing with vendors and working on site at large enterprise.

\xc2\xa0The types of engagements you will be tasked with include but are not limited to:\xc2\xa0

  • SIEM integration using Splunk;
  • Design and deliver scalable splunk architectures in a range of environments including physical, virtual and cloud (AWS) based solutions;
  • Define Splunk strategy; this involves requirements gathering, delivery estimation, scoping and capacity management of the Splunk infrastructure;\xc2\xa0
  • Architecting & designing a Splunk implementation, and the development of dashboards, alerts and applications. Such solutions could potentially ingest data from various systems such as Oracle Exadata, Teradata and SQL Server databases, Cloudera Hadoop systems and other enterprise applications.

You may be someone who enjoys delivering technical security services in to large enterprise environments or developing security designs and architectures, including SIEM and Log management solutions, malware detection & analysis, visibility technologies, traffic capture and/or deep packet inspection inspection capabilities. Or you may enjoy designing & implementing Big Data (and analytics) tools, such as Splunk, as part of an Operational or Security monitoring solution\xe2\x80\xa6 Either way, we would like to talk with you.

\xc2\xa0

This is a terrific opportunity to join an industry leader. \xc2\xa0If you are a hands-on Engineer who would like to further develop your consulting skills, please email mdunham@decipherbureau.com ASAP.

\xc2\xa0

We are looking to engage at least 2 Engineers ASAP!

'

title: Senior Reporting and Information Analyst
description:
b"
  • Ref 644/17 \xc2\xa0
  • Penrith (Werrington North) Campus
  • Full Time, Ongoing Position

Western Sydney University is a major urban university spread over six campuses in Greater Western Sydney, a region of great opportunity, diversity, challenge and growth. The University has a strong connection to Greater Western Sydney, working with its communities and businesses to contribute to the region's growth. The University is culturally diverse, over 2,500 staff and 40,000 students drawn from Australia and around the world.

The Senior Reporting and Information Analyst is part of the Information and Analysis Unit, which is responsible for:

  • Institutional research, analysis and review
  • Management information and reporting
  • Provision of Institutional Surveys; and
  • Student load data management

The Senior Reporting and Information Analyst reports to the Senior Manager, Information and Analysis Unit and is responsible for the provision of high level data analysis and developing and disseminating reports to support the University in its planning, policy, review and reporting functions. This role provides multiple source data analysis and report design and development for the business intelligence/data analysis teams within the Office of Quality and Performance. The position works with staff across the University to understand their data requirements, source the data and present it in an easily accessible format. The role is required to solve high-level analytical and complex reporting problems independently and in direct consultation with University staff at all levels. The role is expected to manage multiple priorities and to provide high level technical expertise as well as client liaison. This is an exciting opportunity for a position of responsibility and variety. A creative and flexible approach and the ability to focus on and work to deadlines will be required, as well as a strong commitment to customer service. The University offers flexible work arrangements including flex leave and flexible working hours, and provides a supportive team work environment and promotes a healthy work/life balance. The position is full-time continuing and will be based at the University's Werrington North campus near Penrith. Applicants will be shortlisted based on their responses to the selection criteria.

Remuneration Package: Higher Education Worker Level 9 $129,108 to $137,876 p.a. (Salary $109,098 to $116,507 p.a. plus 17% Superannuation and Leave Loading).

Position Enquiries: Stephen Butcher on (02) 9678 7450 or by email at s.butcher@westernsydney.edu.au

Closing Date: 14 May 2017

"

title: Senior Analyst, Customer Insights
description:
b'

My client is an ASX listed organisation with market leading analytics capability. This is a newly created opportunity in response to continued growth and investment in the analytics team.

Specifically you will be accountable for the analysis of data to support campaign activity and customer insights, driving recommendations back to the business to optimise customer engagement and retention.

Key Responsibilities

  • Partnering with the business to design analytical solutions that support customer led business initiatives
  • Working with large datasets, predominately in SQL to extract, manipulate and manage large data sets to produce actionable insights and recommendations
  • End to end campaign analysis from business requirements gathering through to post campaign analysis and reporting
  • Creation of automated campaign reports and development of dashboards using SQL and Tableau
  • Customer profiling and segmentation including A/B testing to identify cross sell opportunities and next best actions to support customer engagement

Background and Experience

  • Tertiary qualified in a relevant discipline
  • Advanced SQL skills; comfortable in working with and interrogating large datasets
  • Proven ability in acting as an analytics SME, working with commercial business stakeholders to identify and design innovative solutions
  • Commercial analytics experience, ideally within a customer led environment

.

Please apply on line or for more information, please contact Marie Siddle at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2640

( SK920044A )

'

title: NA
description:
b"DMP Specialist - Reputed e-Commerce brand

Brand new opportunity for 2017 - A fantastic opportunity for a DMP Specialist to manage the Data Management Platform (DMP) for one of Australia's leading e-commerce brands. You will join a highly collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.\xc2\xa0

It is a great opportunity to join a global organization with a fantastic vision - they have a start-up mentality and have some of the best systems and tools to work with. You will be challenged in this environment as it is a space that is constantly changing so they look for people who are adaptable to change.\xc2\xa0

About the role -
Reporting into the Head of Analytics you'll manage the Data Management Platform (DMP) across the Data team. You will work with multiple stakeholders across the business to educate and influence on the product platform ability.\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities -\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Use DMP technology to support a range of business functions with cutting-edge analytics.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Drive DMP functionality and its value, use and importance across the business.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continuously improve the DMP platform, coordinating data across a range of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party datasets.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Help identify and create custom segments to be used by a range of teams.

Skills Required -\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Highly desirable is experience with a DMP (e.g. Adobe Audience Manager, Krux, BlueKai) - or at least understanding of how a DMP operates in a programmatic landscape
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced knowledge of digital media technologies, targeting and data collection\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication and analytical skills and experience working across technical and strategic teams
\xe2\x80\xa2 High level of attention to detail and someone who's good at breaking down complex results into simple clear recommendations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent internal and external stakeholder management skills

Must haves -\xc2\xa0

\xe2\x80\xa2 Database software - SQL\xc2\xa0

\xe2\x80\xa2 A/B testing a plus\xc2\xa0

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who's passionate about data and is willing to learn since the Head of Analytics is a great mentor and is more then happy to train and develop people in his team.

If this sounds like an interesting role to you and you would like more info please get in touch with Kausty at 02 8047 4037 for a confidential chat. "
