title: Key Account Manager
description:
b'Our highly respected client is a leading source of data visualisation and business intelligence. Their leading service helps companies/organisations of all sizes address complex and often strategic issues through providing customer insights and analytics, information management, intelligence and data quality solutions. Due to continued growth, they now have an exciting opening for a Key Account Manager to join their successful Sydney based team.

As a Key Account Manager, you will:
  • Join a growing team based in CBD, where the focus is on developing revenue streams from new public and private sector accounts
  • Generate and follow up on leads, qualify new business opportunities and present solutions to match the requirements of the client
  • Work closely with colleagues to deliver the value proposition through proposals and presentations
  • Take a lead role in breaking into new geographical markets that complete the existing AUS and NZ operations
  • Manage a portfolio or accounts

The ideal sales candidate will:
  • Be educated to degree level and possess 3+ years sales experience gained in SaaS, Information, Data or Media
  • Be intelligent, inquisitive and possess business acumen, motivation and a dynamic, yet professional approach
  • Have first class communication and presentation skills and the ability to liaise with customers at all levels
  • Have a hunter mentality with a demonstrable record of sales success
'

title: Contract SQL developer - $550/day
description:
b"\xc2\xa0This global heavyweight of the big data space needs a SQL developer to join the team.

They run Hadoop as their big data platform, but the bulk of the back end logic (and there's a hell of a lot of it) is written within SQL. We're talking core T-SQL, not SSIS or SSRS.\xc2\xa0They don't need Hadoop skills rather strong SQL skills and the ability to write complex stored procedures from scratch.\xc2\xa0We'd also like for someone to come out an environment with some complexity and scale.

They are an agile shop, so ideally you'll be familiar with agile.

The role is contract, and includes some neat perks around training, staff gyms, etc. It's a nice place to work, that for a lot of people is closer to home. Good people doing interesting stuff. Paying $550/day. 3 months initially. Might well extend beyond that.

So apply now. Don't bother with a cover letter - your CV will speak for itself "

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
b'

Equifax powers the financial future of individuals and organisations around the world, using its strength of unique trusted data, technology and innovative analytics. Equifax offer their customers world leading insights and knowledge to help them make informed decisions.\xc2\xa0

The Senior Network Engineer is responsible for administering, maintaining and developing Equifax's high availability Data / Security/Voice Network & Telecommunications infrastructure in order to maximise its benefit to our internal and external customers.

What you will be doing:

  • Provide technical expertise to Global Platform Services internal and external customers.
  • Participate in the development of architectural and design standards with network architecture team(s).
  • Demonstrate innovative approaches to solving unique challenges, and be able to maintain the security and integrity of the network.
  • Provide third level support for on-call Network Operations Engineers.
  • Maintenance, administration, and troubleshooting of networking infrastructure.
  • Responsible for communicating all system issues to the relevant parties.
  • Participation in an agreed after hours support capability, to facilitate the delivery of 24 by 7 production services as agreed with business units.
  • Work with Local & Global Project managers, Architects and Technical leads to deliver projects.
  • Ability to work independently on multiple projects, priorities task and time manage effectively.

Technologies you will have your hands on:

  • Switching - Arista Networks and Cisco Systems
  • Firewall \xe2\x80\x93 Palo Alto & Juniper Networks
  • Routing \xe2\x80\x93 Juniper Networks & Cisco Systems
  • Load Balancing - F5 Networks

Skills you will need for the role:

  • Possess a strong understanding of LAN and WAN networking concepts, including modern and current designs and technologies.
    • Strong BGP and OSPF commercial experience
  • Experience in datacentre networking technologies and techniques.
    • Variable length subnet.
    • VxLAN (desirable).
  • Possess a strong interest in continued education in advanced technologies.
    • Controller and Controller-free Software Defined Networking.
  • Experience with large enterprise designs and implementations.
    • Multiple locations and Data Centres
    • Spine Leaf.
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with knowledgeable and non-knowledgeable technology peers on proposed network designs, and reasoning for design approach and components.
  • Understanding of Security principles, domains, zones, DMZs and customer connections.
  • Worked BAU in Enterprise environments with experience in Perimeter Security.
  • Sound understanding in SSL Certificates, Ciphers, Cryptography and Standards.
  • Strong team player and work with local and global team.
  • Focus on quality; look for continual improvements and a passion for "getting things done well".
  • Project experience in web based applications delivery.

Why apply for this role and join Equifax?

  • Work Life balance\xe2\x80\xa6. YES it can happen
  • New projects with new technologies
  • Outstanding career growth potential on a global scale

This really is a great opportunity to join an industry leader not only in the local market but the global market.

If you feel you have the required competencies to fulfil our needs we invite you to apply.

'

title: Hadoop ETL Support Engineer
description:
b"Development & Operations Specialist ETL Developer & Support Engineer
In this iconic market, leading company, you will be putting your ETL experience to the test.
In this small but elite team of industry professionals you will be working to improve the quality and support the maintenance of one of Australia most beloved companies.
Their reputation as both an company and employer of choice is second to none
\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
Key duties will be to:
  • Developing, maintaining and support data processing jobs within the data environment using ETL solution and Hadoop loading components.
  • Conduct job optimization, automation, troubleshooting and debugging of issues.
  • Provide detailed analysis of problems and recommend solutions
  • ETL administration and ownership of release activities - work with the development team to ensure successful deployment from development to production environment for all change requests and big releases
  • Administer project roles, users, privileges in different ETL environments
  • Develop custom data integration using programming languages such as Java and Python
  • Work with IT and vendor teams and monitor the system and the processing managed by them
\xc2\xa0Core technical skills:

  • Strong ETL development skills
  • Strong programing skills such as SQL, Java and Python
  • Strong administration skills
  • Solid Exposure to Big Data tools such as Hadoop
  • Proven understanding of DW methodologies\xc2\xa0
  • A strong background working on ETL and Data warehouse projects
  • Exposure to big Data integration tools ideally Talend\xc2\xa0
  • Ability to build relationships with both technical teams and the business
  • Ability to communicate effectively and work collaboratively whist being able to take initiative
  • A University Degree in technical, business or I.T disciplines or equivalent.
\xc2\xa0
If you're looking for a role, in a fast paced and dynamic environment, where every second counts and you want a career not just a job, this has to be your next job.\xc2\xa0 This is a highly supportive environment where no two days are alike. To find out more about this role send your Word formatted cv to me Ann Mansard on ann.mansard@ibitsolutions.com.au today! "

title: Java Software Developer | Cyber Security Focused Tech Company | Global Reach
description:
b"

Experienced Java Software Engineer with experience in front-end development and JavaScript technologies to work on high throughput and real-time authentication systems used to prevent cybercriminal activities.

The company

Technology company with a global reach that has deployed their technologies worldwide. Their online authentication and security systems are used by major tech companies such as eBay, AliBaba and Yandex. Your colleagues are highly talented engineers who push each other to make this highly reliable and robust, mission-critical product.

The role

Working with the latest Big Data technologies. You will be involved in developing sophisticated front-end solutions and highly responsive User Interfaces. The beauty about this role is the need for their systems to handle over 100+ million transactions on a daily basis. They have multiple Big Data clusters deployed worldwide with a high performance threshold and low fault tolerance. You will mainly be using Java (GWT) and JavaScript frameworks such as ReactJS, Backbone, and Angular.

Required Skills

  • Strong Java programming skills (Version 7 or 8) with a focus on front-end development
  • Exposure to JavaScript and modern frameworks is a plus.
  • Experience in HTML, CSS, XML and Ajax (experience in developing code that has cross browser compatibility)
  • Deep knowledge of computer science fundamentals such as multi-threading, real-time systems and high performance computing concepts (these systems will handle over a billion transactions per month)
  • Exposure and interest in big data technologies is highly beneficial (e.g. Hadoop, Cassandra)
  • Dynamic individual with a great work ethic and attitude to learn new skills and new technologies.
  • Experience with GWT (company has plans to discontinue using GWT in the medium term and move to other technologies in the future)

In return for your hard work you'll join one of the best cultures in the industry and have a genuine impact on a globally expanding business.

MCS Consulting has been at the forefront in advanced technology, R&D and IT&T Recruitment for 18 years, and has an effective personal approach that really does make a difference.

Edward Man B.E. ; (02) 9481 8888 job EM-JavaDevFrontEnd-Slider. SK94839A
Please send your resume ASAP

A WORD VERSION CV IS ESSENTIAL
An Address helps us and should be included.

www.mcs-consulting.com.au

We are more than happy to discuss career aspirations.
At MCS we are here to help, not just recruit


Follow our Company Page on Linkedin

"

title: Business Analyst
description:
b"

Our client is a leading name in the NSW Health Care Industry and we are supporting them with the search for two Business Analyst with a strong data analytics background. As the Business Analyst your primary responsibility is to support the business process design, system development and implementation. Manage the data integrity of the case management system. Develop reporting capability for the review and analysis of the organisation's current business needs and contribute to overall business improvement.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research, analyse and prepare accurate information about business processes.
  • Analyse and consolidate information for the development of business requirements
  • Develop data analysis and reporting solutions
  • Oversight of data integrity and business system improvement projects.
  • Prepare technical documentation
  • Provide plain language advice and documentation on technical issues to non-technical audiences
  • Further activities arising from the Scheme Agent Transition Project include:
  • Mapping data migration requirements between Scheme Agents
  • Working closely with data migration teams to develop appropriate plans including identification of data, data testing and error rectification requirements

Key Requirements:

  • 3-5 years experience working in a Data Analyst/Business Analyst/Technical Analyst role within a complex enterprise environment
  • Exposure to the healthcare or insurance industries would be beneficial but not mandatory
  • Bachelors Degree in related field

For more information you can call Kristen Mason in our Sydney office on 02 90876208 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest.

"

title: Business Development Manager
description:
b'

We are working with one of the most exciting Loyalty, Marketing and Data platforms in the world, with an enormous global reach working with the who's who of consumer businesses. Australia, a fast-growing and new(ish) market for them is of vital importance to the company's growth. They are now looking to hire a Business Development Manager to really show Australia what they have to offer. Fantastic track-record in SaaS platform sales. Ultimately, an unreal B2B SaaS sales person.

A true hunter who focuses almost exclusively on winning new business

A strong technology knowledge. You don't have to be a "techy" but must have a good understanding of marketing technologies and how they work.

Run their own programs and help other brands to run theirs.

Self starter, have built a sales strategy for a new business from scratch.

Large deal sizes above $200,000.

'

title: Installation Fitters
description:
b"

Computer Room Solutions (CRS), a wholly Australian owned and based company is recognized as a leading innovator and manufacturer of computer room racks, cabinets and caging solutions for the data and communication sectors. Committed to service excellence, the company specialises in the delivery of custom design and manufactured solutions for major organisations and data centres.\xc2\xa0

Due to continued growth the company is now seeking to expand the capacity of field operations through the appointment of two installation fitters. The role will involve site installation of CRS products in data centres and corporate computer rooms. The positions will suit experienced people looking for a role in a dynamic environment, and will be based from the company's head office facility in Alexandria NSW.

Applicants should have a trade or trade assistant background in shop fitting, mechanical fitting or sheet metal work. Although not essential trade qualification will be well regarded.\xc2\xa0 Candidates should possess a current drivers license and be suitably fit to handle the physical aspects of installation work and be confident using power tools.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Operations Manager - Participation and Game Development
description:
b"The NRL has a vision to be the most entertaining, most engaging and most respected sport. We currently have an opportunity for an Operations Manager - Participation and Game Development to join the Rugby League family and be part of the game's exciting future.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
As part of the Participation and Game Development Unit, the primary objective of the role is to oversee and manage the day-to-day running of Participation & Game Development's operations, data collection & communication administration, reporting and the implementation of special projects to achieve agreed Strategic Plan outcomes.
.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
RESPONSIBILITIES\xc2\xa0/ TASKS:
  • Lead and manage the performance of the operations team to provide operational and administrative services to support the Participation & Game Development team nationally.
  • Work across different NRL business units/stakeholders to further develop whole of business intergration and maximise commercial opportunities where possible
  • Interface with Commercial Manager - Football to assist with the review of relevant Participation & Game Development policies and ensure communication of updates and any associated training requirements are completed
  • Manage the ongoing collation of Participation & Game Development performance statistics within the Salesforce system to provide regular national, state and regional reports
  • Act as primary contact in regard to execution of ASC\xc2\xa0 Sport Investment Agreement requirements\xc2\xa0
  • Provide recommendations and input to the National Participation & Game Development Manager to improve existing processes and performance where possible
  • Develop and lead the implementation of operational special projects which enhance the targeted outcomes of the operations team, the Participation & Game Development team and/or the broader participation base of the Game.
  • Represent the Rugby League at all times internally and externally to promote a positive profile, brand awareness and perception of Rugby League within the community

\xc2\xa0REQUIRED:
  • Experience in operations, events, people and budgetary management.
  • Experience in the management of data collections and communication systems
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications
  • Interest in and understanding of Rugby League
  • Sporting industry and management experience
  • Communication skills to network and build effective relationships with key stakeholders

If you meet the above selection criteria, believe you demonstrate the NRL's values of Excellence, Inclusiveness, Courage and Teamwork and are interested in this opportunity, then please apply.

The NRL is an equal opportunity employer. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to apply. "

title: Business Intelligence Analytics Manager
description:
b"

As the BI Analytics Manager role you will provide BI and Analytics leadership for Alinta Energy. You will establish and execute a vision for the delivery of information and analytics processes, platforms and solutions that will support Alinta Energy achieving its business strategy.

Reporting to the CIO, you will be managing a team of 6, provide strong leadership and engage with key stakeholders across the business to make data available and transform the company into a business that truly utilises information and analytics to drive business value. Operationally you will provide the structure and management to efficiently and cost effectively plan, prioritise and deliver the businesses reporting and analytics needs.

What you'll be doing;

  • Facilitate the development of Alinta's BI Analytics vision and the strategy to deliver
  • Leadership of Alinta's BI Analytics functions in IT and across business units
  • Prioritise and deliver the businesses reporting and analytics needs
  • Provide IT leadership across Alinta as a member of the IT leadership team
  • Develop Alinta's data, reporting and analytics architecture

What we're looking for:

  • Extensive expertise with BI and analytics
  • Knowledge of key BI trends and the BI vendor landscape
  • Strong interpersonal skill and the ability to develop and engage cross functional teams
  • A constructive and collaborative leadership style
  • IT leadership and senior executive engagement experience
  • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills.
  • Proven ability to manage vendor, supplier, sub-contractor relationships
  • Experience in building and supporting BI/analytics/big data business cases

Join a more rewarding culture at Alinta Energy.

Applications close Friday 13th, May 2017.

A bit about us:

Alinta Energy is a leading Australian utility with an owned and contracted generation portfolio of ~2,000 MW, approximately 800,000 electricity and gas retail customers and over 370 employees across Australia and New Zealand.

Operating Australia's largest contracted gas generation portfolio, Alinta is the only truly national electricity and gas company spanning the South West Interconnected System (SWIS), North West Interconnected System (NWIS) and South East Pilbara region of Western Australia (WA) as well as the National Electricity Market (NEM). Alinta operates in five of Australia's six states as well as New Zealand.




"

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
b"

About Us

Displayr is a rapidly growing data science and research software business, headquartered in Sydney, with offices in the US and the UK. We develop and sell data science software, with our leading in-market product being the highly successful market research analysis software Q (www.qresearchsoftware.com) which continues to have a very strong revenue growth profile.\xc2\xa0 We are expecting considerable further growth from a new product Displayr, currently in beta release (www.displayr.com).\xc2\xa0

With our head office in Glebe, and working from a converted post-industrial warehouse, we have a relaxed, casual workplace culture with a start-up vibe.

About the Job

This is a full-time role based in our Glebe office. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Design and implement features from specs, identifying opportunities to improve the specs along the way.
  • Front-end development in TypeScript, HTML and CSS.
  • Server-side development in C#.
  • Write unit tests and automated end-to-end tests.

About You

This is a junior level role, so we would consider graduates, or candidates with less than 3 years' experience in Software Engineering. The successful candidate will have the following:

  • Bachelor degree in Software Engineering, Computer science or equivalent with First Class Honours or Ph.D., or other evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Demonstration of a lifeline interest in programming.
  • Passionate about UX.
  • Australian citizenship or permanent residency.

If you have a site where your code is public, please share this in your resume as it will highlight your application. \xc2\xa0

Our Environment

  • Client: TypeScript, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS3, HTML5
  • Server: C#, ASP.NET MVC, MS SQL Server
  • Desktop app: C#, WinForms, .NET, Embedded Chrome
  • Daily automated deployments to Microsoft Azure
  • Continuous integration builds with unit tests
  • Automated web browser tests
  • One-on-one code reviews
  • Source control (Subversion)
  • SCRUM
  • Flexible work hours (before/after core hours of 10.30am - 5pm)

The successful applicant will be instrumental in the growth of an app that is unlike anything else on the market.

Note: Please include a cover letter along with your application, outlining why this role appeals to you and what you think you bring to our awesome team.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Technical Lead / Solution Architect
description:
b'

Tigerspike Sydney is looking for a\xc2\xa0Technical Lead\xc2\xa0who is excited to work alongside a talented group of innovators to create digital products.\xc2\xa0 Being a part of the conversation from the start, you will be expected to lead full lifecycle web-based projects including guiding technical scoping, design and implementation. Collaborating with UX & UI designers, researchers and other engineers (web & mobile), you will have the ability to flex your full stack chops from AngularJS to Web APIs to .NET backend to help shape, design and build digital products that help solve key business needs.

We want people who love being involved in challenging and innovative work.\xc2\xa0 If you are excited to learn new things and thrive in a team-based culture where you have a lot of fun along the way, then Tigerspike could be the place for you!

Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, IT or related technical field
  • 5+ years of web/software development experience with a proficiency in .NET (v4.0 and above) including C#, MVC4+,\xc2\xa0Enterprise Library, Web Services and WCF
  • Solid front-end coding skills with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, Bootstrap and AngularJS
  • Ability to write clean, reusable, maintainable and readable code
  • 2+ years in a tech lead capacity with direct reports and/or mentorship with junior developers
  • Ability to take the lead on projects with strong communication and ability to be client facing is key\xc2\xa0(previous experience leading workshops is highly desired)
  • Drive standards, process and development best practices within the development team
  • Bonus Points: exposure to AWS, Swift and/or Android SDKs
  • Have the following\xc2\xa0personal attributes: integrity, trust and personal credibility; be a clear communicator; an ambitious self-starter; hungry for results and show perseverance; a good listener; customer oriented; comfortable amongst higher\xc2\xa0management levels; strong interpersonal skills; someone who can influence and guide others easily; and well organized with clear attention to detail

Benefits

  • Great team culture \xe2\x80\x93 we all regularly go out for drinks, have Friday team lunches together, optional group exercise training and have even done a Tough Mudder together!
  • Paid professional training & events
  • Opportunity to work in other global office locations such as New York, London, Singapore, San Francisco, Tokyo, Dubai and Melbourne

Right to work in Australia\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

All staff employed by Tigerspike must have the "right to work"\xc2\xa0in Australia.\xc2\xa0Australian and New Zealand citizens automatically have the right to work in Australia, as well as Australian Permanent Residents.\xc2\xa0Everyone else is required to hold a current visa with work rights in order to gain employment in Australia. No excuses or exceptions.\xc2\xa0

About Us

Tigerspike\xc2\xa0is a global digital product company\xc2\xa0specialising\xc2\xa0in strategy,\xc2\xa0experience design, development and systems integration.\xc2\xa0We take a product approach to solving complex problems and believe our differentiator is a focus on the\xc2\xa0experience, the technology, and the data derived from both.

With over 60 awards in 13 years, Tigerspike has a reputation for innovation and creates long-term partnerships with clients such as AMEX, Emirates, Service NSW, 7-Eleven, Family and Community Services, Telstra,\xc2\xa0Medibank and many others.\xc2\xa0

Note to Recruiters

Please note that we do not accept introductions from recruiters.

'

title: National Account Manager - Cosmetics
description:
b'

About The Company:

Our client is a highly successful, Australian-owned Cosmetics Brand operating in global markets. With market leadership in Australia in their core category, they are experiencing accelerated growth both domestically & internationally. title: NA

title: Consulting - Analytics - Senior Con/Manager
description:
b'

About the Role
You\xe2\x80\x99ve all heard the facts\xe2\x80\xa6more data has been created in the past few years than has existed throughout history. In five years there will be over 50 billion smart connected devices in the world, all developed to collect, analyse and share data. Research suggests that less than 1% of the data created is analysed and used.

Imagine the world of possibilities.

Across industries and both large and small clients, the appetite for analytical insight is growing. Our clients are increasingly looking to make sense of their data and for analytics to underpin their business decision making and deliver a tangible impact.

To meet this demand Deloitte\xe2\x80\x99s Analytics practice is seeking talented people with demonstrable experience from strategy to execution in the Analytics domains.

We are looking for people who love data and want to solve problems with insight. Whether you call yourself a data scientist, analytics whiz or builder of predictive models. We want to hear from you if you are genuinely passionate about this area and have some applied experience.

This is an opportunity to harness emerging technologies and analytical methodologies to help our clients on their objectives. You will be part of a collaborative team that provides our clients with solutions that are practical as well as visionary and have an impact from the back office to the boardroom.

About You
You\xe2\x80\x99ll bring experience in one or more of the following competencies and enabling technologies:

  • Strong programming background - scripting is essential as is prior experience developing an application using various software with dedicated modules/libraries/distinct sections in order to represent complex systems programmatically
  • Expert in a range of scripting languages - (e.g. Python, R etc.) and SQL is mandatory
  • Solid grounding in the fundamentals of APIs, data management and storage (e.g. DBA skills), basics of cloud computing, batch scripting and mathematical programming
  • A strong background in applying mathematical and analytics approaches and methodologies to identifying complex relationships in data
  • Ability to communicate technical requirements and outputs in a clear and concise manner
  • A structured, logical and solution-oriented design mindset
  • Ability to work autonomously and with minimal oversight
  • Ability to demonstrate initiative and ownership in the completion of tasks
  • Experience working in teams over extended project delivery periods (e.g. 2 - 6 months)
  • A demonstrable interest and passion for exploring new data/analytics concepts, applications and innovations (e.g. Cognitive, AI, RPA, IoT etc.)

About Us
We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing professionals who are driven yet highly inclusive and social - our people are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

Next Steps
If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential discussion. Please contact Emily McBain via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

'

title: NA
description:
b"The Company
\xc2\xa0
Our client is an Australian-owned ICT services and solutions company which has been catering to Australia's enterprise companies for the past 15+ years. Their personalised service is focused on delivered high-powered results and excellent client services and technical support for any circumstance. Recently the company has acquired a large government contract and is also branching out to focus more on SMB level clients to drive market growth.\xc2\xa0

Where experience in some form of Technical Support is essential,\xc2\xa0full product training and support will be provided.


The Role

The Technical Support Engineer will be responsible for actively providing support to Enterprise-level clients for the company's solutions and services. You will also work as a technical advisor and product advocate to clients and customers. The TSE must be able to develop and maintain existing client relationships throughout the sales cycle as well as maintain partner satisfaction to the company's standards.

The Culture

There is a fantastic laid back culture to the business. Most of the individuals are self-motivated, driven sales professionals and are treated accordingly. As a reward for your efforts, the company is willing to offer a generous bonus structure to ensure that (coupled with a generous salary) you can achieve your financial goals.

The company is heavily focused on internal promotion and will always look inwards before going outside the company. We seek the very best sales professionals to fit in with the enthusiastic, vibrant sales team that the company has managed to build and develop.

The Candidate

You will have:
  • Technical background;
  • 3+ years relevant experience in technical support (preferably Enterprise level);
  • Experience and familiarity of data cloud management software;
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Domain Environment, Active Directory, Email Servers (Exchange and others) SharePoint Server, Group Policies deployments, Windows Services;
  • Working knowledge of MAC OSX, Tomcat/Apache Server, Proxy Server;
  • Understanding of Android Apps installation and configuration;
  • Understanding of virtualisation and cloud infrastructure.
If you fill the above criteria and are interested in the role. Please apply now and send me through your resume. "

title: Operations Process Specialist - Managed Services
description:
b"Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?
\xc2\xa0
If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.
\xc2\xa0
We\xe2\x80\x99re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades \xe2\x80\x94 and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be working with teams across the world. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.
\xc2\xa0
We are currently looking for an\xc2\xa0Operation Process Specialist -\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0to support the business in achieving its strategic objectives.

This role is responsible for the set up, coordination and day-to-day running of tasks generated from our Managed Service Division.\xc2\xa0 This includes both planned and ad-hoc work requests, as well as collation of reporting.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
The role is based from a combination of The Rocks, North Ryde and occasionally on client site.


What we expect you to do:
This Operation Process Specialist role is accountable for the effective coordination of all tasks, reporting and out of scope requests generated from Managed Service.
  • Enter and track requests using the appropriate tool
  • Ensure work is delivered as per SLA\xe2\x80\x99s
  • Ensure processes are followed, including relevant documentation and approvals
  • Liaise with\xc2\xa0 internal engineering and delivery teams to ensure work is done in a timely and efficient manner
  • Collate input and report monthly on all MS tasks, as well as other reports as requested by manager
  • Liaise with client in regards to timing of work carried out and updates on status of requests, as and when required.
  • Assist with any other aspects of Managed Services as and when required
\xc2\xa0
Here's what we are looking for in candidates for this job
  • Experience in contract interpretation
  • Understanding contract deliverables
  • Experience in coordinating multiple vendors, administrative and engineering resources
  • General knowledge of project management practices is desirable
  • Strong interpersonal skills\xc2\xa0
  • Good skills in the use of Microsoft Excel, Word and Siebel (MS Access is optional)
  • Substantial experience in the IT industry is desirable
\xc2\xa0
Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data.\xc2\xa0Apply today!\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Diversity in Dimension Data
We have a global culture that embraces diversity. Dimension Data respects the diverse experiences and individual beliefs of its employees. As such, Dimension Data is committed to an inclusive workplace for all and we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to provide equal employment opportunities for all qualified applicants.

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Kirsty Page on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 223814. "

title: Business Development Manager
description:
b'

At Experian we take pride in our people. We employ over 17,000 people in 40 countries.\xc2\xa0 In a faster, more complex world, our data and analytics help people and organisations protect, manage and make the most of their data.

Experian Data Quality works with organisations to create competitive advantage through data. We ensure that our client's data is fit for purpose and that its quality is maintained over time across their full business lifecycle \xe2\x80\x94 analysing, improving and controlling their strategic data assets.

About the Role

You will strategically manage client relationships and work closely with them to understand their requirements and identify ways in which we can help them achieve their commercial objectives.

With your drive to succeed and focus on achieving results you will be responsible for:

  • Achieving revenue targets \xc2\xa0and performance KPI's by closing opportunities from a specified territory
  • Acquiring new business opportunities within existing customer accounts and prospects
  • End-to-end sales lifecycle, including successfully closing business

The ideal candidate will have experience and skills in the following areas:

  • Innate desire to succeed with a resilient attitude
  • Extensive experience in business development
  • Experience in solution sales, particularly IT and/or software
  • SPIN Sales Methodology training (desirable)
  • Understanding of how to manage a solution sales process from creation to close
  • Proven ability to deliver results under pressure
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Relevant Bachelor's Degree

Why Experian?

Bringing data to life requires creativity, passion, flexibility and expertise. We want you to share in our success. That's why we offer rewards that recognise great performance. Working in a culture of collaboration, achievement and respect we will give you the support and encouragement you need to develop your skills and talents and progress your career.\xc2\xa0

Every day our people bring enthusiasm, innovation and inspiration to work and if this sounds like you then connect with us at Experian.\xc2\xa0

Read more about Experian's Data Quality Business through the website at https://www.edq.com/au/

Read more about Experian at https://www.experianplc.com/careers/ \xc2\xa0

Please kindly note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Our diverse workforce is part of the reason for our success. We want everyone to succeed, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, sexuality, physical ability or age. We welcome applications from Torres Strait and Aboriginal people and our progressive policies, such as flexible working hours, ensure that our employees can flourish no matter what their individual circumstance.

'

title: Manager, Financial Accounting
description:
b"

About the business and the role

The Manager, Financial Accounting sits within the Finance and Administration Team and reports directly to the Financial Controller who reports to the CFO. This role requires the incumbent to plan, review and administer the accounting systems and procedures. In particular this role is responsible for the financial and fiscal management of the firm as well as ensuring that the firm meets all its fiduciary responsibilities. The incumbent is charged with ensuring the accuracy of the financial data input into the accounting systems, the production of financial management information reports to assist management in their decision making and to assist management in the application of cost performance and financial improvement initiatives. This role is pivotal in the ensuring compliance with the Australian Accounting standards and compliance with Trust account and Payroll reporting requirements.

Job tasks and responsibilities

  • Oversee, manage and co-ordinate all fiscal reporting activities for the firm including, P&L statement, revenue/expense, cash flow and balance sheet reports in a timely manner.
  • Oversee the production of monthly reports required by the Partnership
  • Develop, implement and monitor revenue and expense budgets on a firm wide basis
  • Income tax
  • Support in internal audit
  • Assist the FC and CFO to model the financial implications of strategic management decisions and establish
  • The financial soundness of any proposed capital acquisitions, proposed joint ventures or Partnerships.
  • Mentoring and skill development of direct reports.

Skills and experience

  • Qualified CA with 5+ years' experience in the similar capacity (in Australia)
  • Previous experience working in any of the Big 4 preferred
  • Management experience and leadership skills
  • Good understanding of transactional banking documents and treasury settlements would be a plus
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Flexible and someone who can be hands on if needed to be \xe2\x80\x93 very important
  • Good accounting systems knowledge \xe2\x80\x93 system implementation or integration experience would be plus
  • M3 accounting system knowledge would be a plus
  • Mentoring and skill development of direct reports.
  • MUST be an Australian citizen or a permanent resident or Australia

ONLY SELECTED CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED

"

title: Logistics Coordinator
description:
b'

Our client is an Australian brand that has grown to be a global player and a household name.

Celebrated for their ongoing success, they are known to be an employer of choice and foster a positive and nurturing culture, boasting many additional employee benefits.

The Role

We are currently seeking an experienced Logistics Coordinator to join the team. Reporting to the Distribution Team Leader, you will be responsible for effectively and efficiently planning the distribution of goods to customers domestically.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyse data and provide reporting to allow the business to make optimal decisions and ensure customer expectations are met to the highest standards
  • Liaise with logistics partners, manage the daily transport requirements to ensure delivery timelines are met
  • Allocate transport and manage inwards/outwards truck management
  • Load planning and vehicle size coordination
  • Understand and adhere to Chain of Responsibility requirements
  • Order and data entry, both manual and through our automated systems (EDI)
  • Manage and build excellent relationships with all internal and external stakeholders to meet KPIs
  • Create and maintain benchmark data reports & reporting tools for internal/external stakeholders to inform business decisions
  • Assist the team with daily orders through our WMS system, and management of stock between orders to meet our customers' expectations
  • Liaising with external customers updating order status, ETAs, and dealing with any other ad-hoc customer enquiries
  • POA, ASN's and E-Invoicing
  • General administrative assistance as required

To be successful in this role, it is vital that you are a self-motivated person who will possess an abundance of positivity, initiative and passion. In addition to that, you will have the following skills / attributes:

Skills & Experience

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in a similar role
  • Understanding of transport lead time
  • Strong knowledge of Australian geography
  • Knowledge of consigning requirements and systems (WMS)
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Advanced time management skills with the ability to prioritise to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment
  • Positive, flexible, proactive and agile attitude
  • Excellent problem solving skills and experience working in a solutions orientated manner
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong customer service and relationship building skills
  • Team player

On offer for the right candidate is a vibrant and positive office culture with a strong focus on health and happiness. As a valued\xc2\xa0employee of this iconic brand, you are provided with lunch supplied daily, generous product allowances, additional days off (performance based), and more!

If you have the relevant experience and would love to be considered for this opportunity, please forward your WORD formatted CV and cover letter via the Apply Now button or for a confidential discussion, phone Cindy on (03) 9566 7295

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Filing and Administration Assistant
description:
b"

At Baker McKenzie we are different in the way we think, work and behave. Like no other law firm, we were born global.

Our Australian practice was established in Sydney in 1964, in Melbourne in 1982 and in Brisbane in 2014. Our lawyers work seamlessly with our global colleagues, collectively providing a capacity of more than 5,600 locally qualified lawyers and 6,000 professional staff in 77 locations across 47 countries.

An exciting opportunity now exists in our Sydney office for you to continue your strong administration career in the legal industry. We are looking for a full time Filing and Administration Assistant to join our Secretarial Float team on a 12 month contract. You will support secretarial teams across the Firm with general administration tasks including hard copy and electronic filing of client-matter related records, printing, photocopying, scanning and other ad-hoc duties.

Key accountabilities

  • Identifying, opening, generating, maintaining, labelling, updating, closing and archiving files, according to task, author and the Firm's requirements
  • Ensuring electronic and hard copy files are kept up to date, and appropriate documentation is filed correctly
  • Modifying or improving filing systems or implementing new filing systems to drive efficiency
  • Performing periodic inspections of materials or files to ensure correct placement, legibility and suitable condition
  • Designing forms related to filing systems
  • Keeping records of materials filed or removed and tracking all materials to ensure borrowed files are returned
  • Inputting data, such as matter numbers, new or updated information, or document information codes into computer systems to support information retrieval
  • Maintaining an in-depth knowledge of commonly used procedures and methods in the maintenance of files and systems, including indexed records of location of files
  • Promoting best practice methodology and training others on filing efficiencies and e-filing
  • Printing e-mails and documents
  • Collating, photocopying, scanning, faxing and binding documents as requested
  • Court filing
  • Providing ad hoc support to filing projects such as e-filing
  • Providing other ad hoc administrative support as required

Qualifications, experience and abilities

The ideal candidate will be proficient in Microsoft Outlook and Word, document management systems and databases. They would have strong organisational skills and the ability to prioritise competing deadlines in a high pressure environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must as is previous experience in a similar role either in a legal firm or professional services environment. A Diploma of Business Services (Legal Practice) will be viewed favourably, although not essential.

This role is focussed on delivering high level operational support, and you will be required to roll up your sleeves and get involved, therefore a flexible approach will be required. We are seeking enthusiastic people with a 'can do' attitude, who are willing to seize opportunities and are excited by the connectivity that a global law firm can offer.

For a confidential discussion please contact Kathleen Blackburn, Talent Management Administrator on 02 8922 5255.

Direct applicants only. We are not accepting applications from third party recruiters at this time.

"

title: Full-Stack Java Developer - Senior
description:
b'

The Company

My client are an industry-leading SaaS provider to the financial services sector, with operations in the UK and Australia.

Role Purpose

The company are embarking on a long-term transformation programme, the aim of which is to ensure their core product offering is at the cutting edge of technology, whilst migrating away from and shutting down some of their legacy applications. A senior full-stack Java developer is required to join the team permanently to assist in this process. Initially, your development responsibilities will be a rough 75/25 ratio split between back-end and front-end. The target salary package for this role is $130k - $140k.

Essential Skills, Knowledge and Experience

- Expert full-stack Java development experience using related tools, technologies and frameworks.

- Spring Boot, AWS, RESTful services, Web Services, HTML, SQL, Transact SQL (Stored Procedures), XML/XBRL

- Front End Development with modern JavaScript libraries and frameworks, Angular, React, and CoffeScript a significant advantage

- Software patters (GoF and enterprise, SOA)

- Atlassian product suite (eg. Bamboo, Confluence, Crucible, Fisheye, JIRA)

- Integrated Development Environments (eg. Eclipse, IntelliJ)

- jQuery

- JPA/Hibernate

- Mockito

- Oracle Database environments (11.1 RAC SE, 11.2 SE)

- Subversion, Mavern

- Testing tools such as JUnit, Selenium

- Tomcat

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities

- As a senior developer, you will be expected to take the initiative and work with little supervision

- Developing effective and responsive full-stack web applications that work on all browsers and devices.

- Work with code quality and client / customer satisfaction in the forefront of your mind at all times.

- Get involved with both application development and solution design planning and decision processes, contributing ideas.

- Help drive the technical vision of the firm, strive and push others around you to achieve outstanding results.

- Work closely with other internal stakeholders (architects, project managers, testers, etc.), to deliver software that meets the bespoke needs of clients.

- Take enjoyment in mentoring junior developers and helping them to upskill, while ensuring that you yourself stay up to date with the latest technologies and industry trends.

- Help build the future technical roadmap, lay the groundwork for other developers and future hires in this growing team.

- Developing effective and responsive web user interfaces that work on all browsers and devices.

- Adhering to security and data protection protocols

- Assisting with code reviews and documentation

This opportunity would suit an ambitious and multi-faceted developer that is motivated by the technical challenges that periods of change and transformation entail. To apply, please follow the instructions below.

Good luck.

( SK913229A )

IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.

http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

'

title: Sales Associate (Sales Support - Understudy)
description:
b"

Considering Real Estate sales as a career? Join the most successful network in Australia!

Do you have 3-5 years of work experience under your belt? Do you see yourself as a good 'understudy'? Can you think and act quickly? Does a sales support role appeal?

If you're a mature yet energetic individual who is keen to get into Real Estate sales and happy to support and learn from one of the best this could be for you!

The Role

As a\xc2\xa0Sales Associate\xc2\xa0you will support and in-turn be taught the art of Real Estate sales by the office Principals, Darren Dowd and Scott Dunger, both of whom are also Elite Agents in their own right!

Ranked within the\xc2\xa0top 3%\xc2\xa0of the Ray White Group in the country, Principal of Ray White Baulkham Hills Darren Dowd is a highly respected agent. Part of the Ray White Group for over 15 years, Darren has been awarded the prestigious Alan White Elite Performer status every year since 2008 for his consistently outstanding results.\xc2\xa0Darren's success lies in his ability to communicate effectively with people and a strong desire to provide clients with the\xc2\xa0very best service\xc2\xa0founded on professional business practice.\xc2\xa0Darren is admired for his intricate Hills district knowledge, superior negotiation skills and impressive sales results.

After more than 10 years of high performance real estate sales Scott Dunger made the transition into business ownership, buying into\xc2\xa0one of Ray White's first and best performing franchises in NSW - Ray White Baulkham Hills. Owning and operating the office alongside Darren,\xc2\xa0together they are taking this already highly successful office to new heights.\xc2\xa0

You will be assigned to support either Darren or Scott\xc2\xa0and work along side them. This is an exceptional 'apprenticeship'!

Your initial day-to-day activities will initially include:

  • Gathering market intelligence
  • Database management
  • Prospecting
  • Opportunities to assist with\xc2\xa0home appraisals
  • Opportunities to assist with listing properties for sale
  • General administration

As you develop and display increasing competence in these areas your responsibilities will evolve, potentially resulting in you becoming a fully-fledged Agent. In the years ahead you may well become the Agent who mentors a new-starter!

Is this you?\xc2\xa0

  • Capable of utilising an advanced vocabulary to describe, explain and market a product when communicating with a prospect;
  • Can efficiently base your\xc2\xa0decisions on numerical data and can communicate these data easily to clients and prospects;
  • Active and can focus on several sales objectives at a time;
  • Will use a direct approach to selling but will also appreciate the more subtle aspects of sales negotiation;
  • Motivated by the opportunity for personal contact with clients and prospects. You\xc2\xa0often enjoy selling in a team environment;
  • Prefer accomplishing your\xc2\xa0work without the red-tape of specific sales procedures. You're creative;
  • Tend to question the agenda of those with whom you\xc2\xa0negotiate a sale but can express confidence in making the sale once your\xc2\xa0doubts have been alleviated;
  • Consistently respond to client's needs in a timely fashion and make quick decisions under pressure;
  • Willing to stand up for your\xc2\xa0agenda in a sales situation;
  • Perform best when provided minimal structure and given the room to make decisions independently without their sales manager micro-managing their activities;
  • Most successful when provided ample information to make objective decisions yet are capable of relying on intuition when necessary.

Because that's how our most successful sales people are 'hard-wired'.

Don't be fooled\xe2\x80\xa6 a career in real estate sales is not 'easy-street'. The hours are long, the effort high and the market is fiercely competitive. But for those with the drive, persistence and self-discipline the rewards are ample.

How to Apply

Please include a\xc2\xa0cover letter\xc2\xa0giving us a brief overview of your previous relevant experience and what interests you in this role.\xc2\xa0

If you're motivated by the competitive, fast-paced world of sales, and can follow through on the administrative detail, while helping people achieve their dreams then apply now!

"

title: Research Assistant
description:
b'

About the business and the role

Community and Patient Preference Research (CaPPRe) is a young and dynamic company with a big impact. We specialise in choice-based research in a range of industries including healthcare, government infrastructure, the arts, transport and environmental economics. We are looking for a Research Assistant to work across these areas. The Research Assistant will assist in various aspects of the research, including ethics submissions, research design and implementation, data analysis and dissemination.

About you

  • Have a passion for research and statistics, modelling or economics
  • Completed a degree or post-graduate qualifications a research-related field (e.g., in economics, psychology, medical science, biostatistics, commerce, mathematics or other relevant discipline)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated organisational skills and ability to work individually and as part of a team
  • Adaptable and able to respond and adjust easily to changing work demands and circumstances

'

title: Business Development Manager | ICT Infrastructure
description:

With over 40 years experience in delivering the highest quality solutions across Data Centres, this business has grown from strength to strength, continuing to build on its industry-leading reputation of service excellence and product innovation. Traditionally recognised for its strong position delivering HVAC solutions to Data Centres, the organisation is currently looking to diversify their service offerings and expand on their history of success.

About the role\xc2\xa0

Due to strategic growth, this business is now looking for a consultative Business Development Manager to develop strategic relationships with both new and existing end-users across the Data Centre sector. Being a newly created role, this is a unique opportunity to play a key position in a reputable business as they continue to grow across Australia.\xc2\xa0

Click on the APPLY button or contact Alexandra Wilson on (02) 8024 7104 for a confidential discussion. '

title: Digital Marketing Specialist (PPC/SEM/Adwords)
description:
b'A leading global agency are expanding and are looking for their next enthusiastic Digital Specialist to join the team. After launching 2 new international offices in the last 12 months and growing the Sydney organisation to a record number in the company short history.
\xc2\xa0
The role requires the successful candidate to:
  • Setup, manage and optimise campaigns on Google Adwords, Bing and any other paid advertising platforms that can generate a positive ROI
  • Review analytics to identify areas of opportunity and utilise conversion rate optimisation tactics (eg split-testing) to maximise performance.
  • Manage email marketing campaigns and their creation (including autoresponder sequences)
  • Manage landing page, website and checkout process copywriting & wireframing process and then work with the design/development teams to implement.
  • Build relationships with clients
  • Prepare performance analysis reports and make recommendations for corrective modifications with a view to ongoing optimisation.
  • Educate clients on strategies and tactics.
  • Contribute to the growth of the CRO/PPC team through innovation.
While full training will be provided and everyone will be considered, its always nice to have some of the necessities:\xc2\xa0
  • Demonstrable experience or interest in Online Marketing and/or eCommerce
  • 2 years experience across SEM, PPC, CRO
  • Experience with advanced Google Adwords strategies & techniques.
  • Experience with data/product feeds & comparison shopping networks.
  • Experience with Website Design/Development, Landing Pages & Email Marketing
  • Experience with Google Analytics and/or Adobe Ominiture
  • Knowledge of HTML/CSS & CMS Systems like Wordpress
Furthermore a vested interest or experience with your own online ventures (online business, social media organisation/brand etc).

This is an extremely exciting role and a great opportunity for someone to get a big break in the booming digital market place. For further information "APPLY" below or contact Guy on (02) 8234 3522 '

title: CTO - Product Agency
description:
b"Innovative Product Company

This global product design agency is actively engaging some of Sydney's greatest creative and technology minds and currently boast some of the countries leading authorities on mobile development, data and web analytics and product build and development. To continue their growth and success, they seek their first ever CTO/Head of Engineering.

The role
  • Be the technical adviser for all internal and external client needs.
  • Build, grow and coach the technology team
  • Set the strategic technology roadmap for the business and where necessary, our growing client base.
  • Work with the senior leadership team to set and define future strategy.
Ideally
  • You have been or are currently a CTO/Technical Director/Creative Technologist at a leading software consultancy or digital agency
  • You possess a strong technical background across mobile and web development - Android/IOS/React
  • You have an excellent track record delivering complex end2end products and projects for enterprise clients.
  • You have excellent communication and presentation skills and are able to lead conversations with all levels of business functions
  • You are deeply passionate about web technologies and follow digital trends.\xc2\xa0
  • You have built, coached, developed and lead a global technology work force\xc2\xa0
To learn more about the role, company and opportunity please contact Andrew on\xc2\xa00450 445 169\xc2\xa0for a confidential brief or apply below with a word version of your resume. "

description:

title: Graduate Metal Trader
description:
b'

Our client is a leading marketer and producer of natural resources seeking an enthusiastic junior level commodities trainee trader.\xc2\xa0

The role is based in Sydney and will involve assisting the senior metal\xc2\xa0traders in a range of facets with emphasis on logistics and trade support. The position will provide training and experience with the intention of leading to a full-time metal trading role.\xc2\xa0

APPLICANTS MUST BE BASED IN AUSTRALIA AND BE AUSTRALIAN CITIZENS OR PERMANENT RESIDENTS.

Responsibilities

  • Close interaction with the respective Trader and traffic persons, as well as cooperation with other teams such as Chartering, Insurance, Finance, Legal and Compliance;
  • Verification of all documents with Compliance and Company internal guidelines;
  • Identification of issues and contractual risk and respective advice to Traders;
  • Documentary monitoring of the contract from the beginning to the end, including co\xe2\x80\x93managing of contract changes and corrections;
  • Drafting/ issuing/ reviewing of purchase and sales contracts including all related legal documents, such as Holding Certificates, storage agreements, pre-finance agreements, guarantees;
  • Administration of Purchase and Sales contracts: Purchase/ Sales Order Entry into CTTS, Customer data handling / processing and maintenance, including updating and amending the current data in the internal data system. Filing of documents and archiving;
  • Depending on the respective task area, the Contract Writer/ Administrator may have direct contact to customers and/ or colleagues in field offices

Additional responsibilities include

  • Calculation of metal quantity and foreign currency amounts to be priced Contact to clients / field offices
  • Vessel chartering or container shipments in co-operation with the chartering department; organizing rail, truck and air transport or releasing of material in warehouse
  • Insuring risks of each transport as well as material in storage
  • Correspondence on availability of materials in production, transit and in stock; documentation, invoicing, outgoing
    and incoming payments, client exposure control and claim handling

Requirements

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Only 1-2 years post-university experience \xe2\x80\x93 the nature of the role will require someone with less than 2 years experience
  • Ideally some exposure to logistics or commodities
  • University education in Commerce or Engineering, or other interesting related majors such as Metallurgy.\xc2\xa0
'

title: Inventory Controller
description:
b"

An exciting online wine business is looking for a proactive and dedicated professional to join their vibrant team.

The Cracka Wine Group is an exciting and fast growing online wine business. We are currently looking for a well organised, proactive inventory controller to join our growing team based in Surry Hills. Reporting to the Operations Director your primary responsibility will be to manage the ERP system content, along with 3PL warehouse processes & stock management. Duties will range from updating item master data, collating sales analysis to be used for supply planning and vendor negotiation and overseeing the successful fulfilment of thousands of orders per month.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to;

  • Monitor, maintain and report all product movement inclusive of receipt, despatch and storage
  • Liaising with internal departments & vendor to follow up on open orders
  • Monthly stock reconciliations to ensure inventory system accuracy and any discrepancies are resolved.
  • Review of 3PL daily reports, following up on open customer orders.
  • Monitor and manage inbound receipts process
  • Monitor deliver and report on inventory KPI's.

Skills & Experience;

  • Forecasting with strong exposure to lead time concepts and safety stocks
  • Have a thorough understanding of inventory control and purchasing processes
  • Well-developed interpersonal communication and time management skills
  • High level of attention to detail and excellent organisational skills
  • Versatility to build rapport, communicate & influence stakeholders at all levels.
  • Previous experience in the FMCG industry.
  • Exceptional written & verbal communication skills.Advanced Microsoft Office skills & previous experience with data analysis.

The Ideal Candidate will have;

  • A pro-active and driven attitude.
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a positive attitude
  • Previous experience with ERP systems in the FMCG industry
  • Exceptional\xc2\xa0organisation\xc2\xa0and time management skills with the ability to prioritise workloads.
  • Capability of working in a small team and to tight deadlines

\xc2\xa0

This is an opportunity to get involved with an exciting, entrepreneurial team of professionals in a fast paced and competitive industry.

If you're looking for a new challenge and this sounds like the role for you, then we'd love to hear from you. Please send a copy of your resume together with a cover letter detailing what you can bring to the role.

\xc2\xa0

All applicants must be currently based in & legally entitled to work in Australia. No recruiters please.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Ad Ops - Programmatic Digital Media
description:
b'

Client

One of the funkiest programmatic digital media agencies! Having enjoyed exceptionally fast growth over the past 4 years consecutively, the are looking to expand their social and dynamic team. This fast growth business offers awesome hands on training in programmatic media which is huge! . With a fun and sociable, yet still highly professional environment and a strong "work hard, play hard" ethic, you will love being part of this talented group.

Opportunity

They are seeking a bright and energetic Ad Ops Specialist\xc2\xa0to join their team. Eventually this role will become an APAC Team Lead role within the Ad Ops Team.\xc2\xa0

As an Ad ops, you are expected to:\xc2\xa0

  • Support the campaign and product managers with data and technical requirement needs across the division.\xc2\xa0
  • Optimze campaigns through the continual improvement of technology and thid party integrations across their tech platforms\xc2\xa0
  • Troubleshooting technical issues on the technical back end of the campaigns (more so than managing the campaign itself)\xc2\xa0

You will need to be:\xc2\xa0

  • Require bachelors in Information Systems or Information Science (or something technical related)\xc2\xa0
  • Quite analytical to work with the data and insights\xc2\xa0
  • Experience working with data using Excel and SQL\xc2\xa0
  • 2 - 4 years experience in Ad Operations from a Publisher or an Agency / Tech Business\xc2\xa0
  • Knowledge on JavaScript, HTML, XML, CSS\xc2\xa0
  • Process driven to manage different tasks and projects simultaneously\xc2\xa0
  • Cool with a flair and passion for digital media/advertising\xc2\xa0
  • Work well with pressure and deadlines\xc2\xa0
  • Fit into a funky, work hard play hard type of culture! These guys are massive on culture! :)

Reward

Competitive base salary, plus super and generous bonus component\xc2\xa0

Ability to lead into an APAC Team Lead role to lead a team of 5\xc2\xa0

Learn of programmatic guru's and smart individuals who have successfully\xc2\xa0taken off a business\xc2\xa0

If this sounds like you, APPLY NOW. Interviewing next week!\xc2\xa0

'

title: NA
description:
b"

Company Description

DT (a WPP AU/NZ company) is a full-service team of 180 digital experts across Australia, NZ, India and South East Asia who can execute every idea we conceive. We've worked with some of the largest and best-known organisations in Australia and the world, and we have the awards to match. More than 20 years after our beginning, we're still as wide-eyed and excited about the new frontiers we can explore for our clients.

\xc2\xa0

Job Description

We're looking for Campaign Analysts in our Delhi team to develop cross-channel campaigns for our clients. There will be occasional travel to Australia and NZ required in this role.

DT's Campaign Analysts are responsible for the execution of campaigns, as well as post-campaign analysis and feedback for our clients. Working together with the Campaign Manager, the client, and other DT specialists in strategy, content, creative, development, social media, design and more, you will understand the business and marketing objectives to then deliver integrated innovative campaigns across a range of market leading technologies.

To succeed in this role, you need to be a collaborative team member, with a strong understanding of digital campaigns and deliverables in terms of data, scheduling, targeting and other campaign-based criteria.

As a DT Campaign Analyst, you'll be involved in campaign delivery:

  • Work with clients and DT teams to understand and deliver campaigns
  • Translate marketing briefs into technical delivery requirements
  • Create DT campaign briefs based on understanding the client solutions
  • Translate a client business requirement into solution deliverables
  • Work with DT partner technologies including Adobe Campaign to plan, build and deploy campaign workflows
  • Work with DT partner technologies including Adobe Campaign and Tableau reporting to evaluate and analyse campaign performance
  • Monitor ongoing campaign activity delivered by DT against agreed metrics
  • Manage change requests for existing and future planned campaigns


Required Skills & Experience

  • Experience working within campaign management on agency or client side
  • Experience of campaign development processes from brief to execution
  • Strong interpersonal and proactive problem-solving skills
  • Detail-oriented and proactive attitude
  • Strong time management skills to deliver multiple projects / campaigns
  • Technical experience of working with Adobe Campaign, Marketo, IBM Unica, Responsys, Exact Target or other similar cross channel marketing technologies
  • Highly numerate
  • Familiarity in data manipulation using tools such as SQL, Teradata, Oracle and other database technologies would be highly beneficial

We offer a supportive, flexible and enjoyable work environment as well as heaps of team benefits for our kick-arse staff. Most of all, we invest in you, with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional development.

If you're an analytical thinker who thrives as part of a team, join one of Australia's best digital teams, submit your application today!

\xc2\xa0

Additional Information

We're looking for Campaign Analysts in our Delhi team to develop cross-channel campaigns for our clients. There will be occasional travel to Australia and NZ required in this role.

"

title: Office Coordinator
description:
b"

A new opportunity to work for a financial services business in North Sydney.

Client Details

A financial services firm that has professionals in all specialisms of finance including tax. Looking for an Office Coordinator to provide support to the Finance Manager and the wider office.

The office in North Sydney holds around 30 employees, all of whom are social, and engaging and keen to find someone to come on board that enjoys bringing the company together and can keep with the culture.

Description

The role of Office Coordinator will include, but not be limited to the following duties:

  • PA support for the Finance Manager
  • First point of contact for clients
  • Meeting room arrangement
  • Ordering of supplies and stationary
  • Preparation of letters, spreadsheets, reports and other documents as required - using MS Word, Excel & Outlook
  • General administration, office filing, printing, binding etc
  • Liaise with Clients, Contractors & Facility Managers on all levels
  • Schedule Appointments & Travel
  • Data Base input & amendments
  • General errands and ad-hoc duties as required in busy office

Profile

The ideal candidate for such a position will ideally have an interest in either finance, or progressing their career in Office Support, with strong Microsoft office skills including excel.

It will suit someone who enjoys people interaction, whilst still being incredibly organised.

Job Offer

The opportunity to work in a business that values each employee, has a wide responsibility level, and the chance to progress. Based in North Sydney, the office is ideally located for any public transport route.

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Sophie Watson on +61 2 8221 8112.

"

title: Commercial Analyst - FP&A
description:
b"

Due to an internal progression my client is recruiting for a highly analytical Commercial Analyst. The successful candidate will have strong experience across budgeting and forecasting, sales analysis and working with a high volume of excel data. The Commercial Analyst will be responsible for providing accurate and timely financial analysis and reporting to support commercial decisions across the business.

Client Details

My client is a global leader with a well established and fast growing subsidiary located in the Norwest Business Park. They are industry leaders and promote a strong employee first culture.

Description

  • Developing and maintaining daily sales reports
  • Preparation of the management reporting pack, which includes budgeting and forecasting
  • Supporting sales and marketing teams with pricing analysis and tenders
  • Supporting the MD and other senior stakeholders with financial modelling, commercial analysis and scenario analysis
  • SAP experience is ideal

Profile

  • Studying towards their CPA/CA qualifications
  • Excellent excel skills: Pivot tables, V-lookup and Macros
  • Excellent communication skills - role involves business partnering with senior stakeholders
  • High UAI/ATAR
  • Must be able to commute to the Norwest Business Park
  • SAP experience is preferred
  • Has worked as a Commercial Analyst for 3-5 years

Job Offer

  • $80,000 - $90,000 plus superannuation plus bonus (dependent on experience)
  • Modern offices located in a corporate business park
  • Opportunities to work closely with senior stakeholders
  • Progression and development opportunities are provided

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact David Choe on +61 2 8292 2029.

"

title: Marketing Manager
description:
b"

Marketing Manager

Financial Services

High profile professional member based Association

Supportive, friendly and flexible work environment

Make a difference at a time of change

The Financial Planning Association (FPA) is Australia's leading professional community of financial planners.\xc2\xa0 Our 12,000 members are at the forefront of a profession currently on a journey to building consumer confidence and trust. The FPA vision is that, through our members, we stand with Australians for a better financial future. They do this by raising education and professional standards in financial planning, and connecting consumers to the right financial advice.
\xc2\xa0

A unique opportunity exists for an experienced Marketing Manager to join the team. Located in the CBD and reporting to the Head of Marketing, the Marketing Manager will play a pivotal role in supporting the business plan to deliver marketing and communication initiatives that nurture and grow the FPA membership base.

\xc2\xa0

Why work for the FPA

The FPA offers a work environment where your input is valued and respected. The FPA values your contribution and encourages teamwork.\xc2\xa0 The aim is for people to work together and balance work with home time. Flexibility can be offered to attract talented staff. The team at the FPA are passionate about what they do.\xc2\xa0 They want to improve the profession and deliver better outcomes for the community and the profession. Staff at the FPA enjoy coming to work and making a difference. They are not just doing a job. If you share this passion, then we are keen to hear from you.

What we would like you to do

  • In the role, the Marketing Manager will have responsibility for developing and driving a range of marketing campaigns to engage, grow and nurture current and potential members. The campaigns will run across both traditional and digital channels, with an emphasis on email marketing, as well as advertising, PR, social and website.
  • Multi-channel marketing campaign for flagship annual member conference (FPA Professionals Congress), including email marketing, advertising, event app, PR, social media strategy and onsite branding and experience.
  • Member database analysis \xe2\x80\x93 interpreting data into meaningful campaign insights.
  • Manage the marketing and communications for the annual membership renewals process.
  • Support the business with segmented marketing and communications initiatives to grow and nurture members.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Oversee trade advertising and marketing campaigns around education, events and awards, working in conjunction with the Marketing Executive.
  • Budget accountability for campaigns and initiatives under management
  • Liaise with suppliers, members, FPA departments, Committees and Management as required.

Skills we would like to see

  • Marketing related Bachelor's degree
  • Minimum of 5 years' experience in B2B marketing
  • Association, finance or professional services experience highly desirable
  • Extensive digital marketing experience (particularly email marketing)
  • Advanced data analysis capabilities
  • Proven ability to manage multiple agencies
  • Strong writing skills
  • Extremely high attention-to-detail
  • Superior project management abilities
  • Ability to build and nurture stakeholder relationships.
  • You will be an analytics-driven marketer: taking a data-insights led approach to campaigns and ensuring decisions are based on a factual understanding of member needs.
  • Exceptional project management, strategic thinking and the ability to interpret data are a must. The Marketing Manager will own their work, confidently lead our member activity and will have a desire to foster a happy and growing membership base.

\xc2\xa0

If you are sick of just 'doing a job' and not being appreciated and you are ready to work with an organisation that will value your input and appreciate your work, then please send your CV along with a cover letter explaining your suitability and addressing the criteria in this advertisement to paul@pauldickinsonconsulting.com.au. Phone enquiries to Paul Dickinson on 0413 274 467.
