title: NA
description:
b"

Company Description

DT (a WPP AU/NZ company) is a full-service team of 180 digital experts across Australia, NZ, India and South East Asia who can execute every idea we conceive. We've worked with some of the largest and best-known organisations in Australia and the world, and we have the awards to match. More than 20 years after our beginning, we're still as wide-eyed and excited about the new frontiers we can explore for our clients.

\xc2\xa0

Job Description

We're looking for Campaign Solution Architects in our Delhi team to develop cross-channel campaigns for our clients. There will be occasional travel to Australia and NZ required in this role.

DT has the in-house capability to deliver unique customer experiences across every digital touchpoint. We provide a full-service offering to our clients that encompasses strategy, data, creative, user experience, technical implementation, systems integration, quality assurance and other disciplines. If a fast-paced environment and big budget web projects using market leading enterprise platforms is your thing, then read on.

As a senior developer and architect with proven experience using the Adobe Campaign platform, you will be able to articulate technical concepts to a mixed audience (technical and business) and have experience in network architecture including load balancing, database servers, cloud solutions. You should be comfortable with Javascript, SQL, XML and HTML and capable of developing Campaigns implementations.

Experience with Adobe Audience Manager or other data management platforms highly regarded.

As a Campaign Solution Architect, you'll be involved in campaign delivery:

  • Work with clients and DT teams to understand and deliver campaigns
  • Translate marketing briefs into technical delivery requirements
  • Translate a client business requirement into solution deliverables
  • Architect end-to-end marketing solutions with DT partner technologies including Adobe Campaign to plan, build and deploy campaign workflows

Required Skills & Experience

  • Written and verbal communication
  • Strong problem solving and diagnostic skills
  • Experience working with clients to define marketing requirements and translation into technical solutions
  • Experience of consulting with clients for continued platform use and evolution over time
  • Experience working and delivering marketing technology campaign environments across Adobe or similar platforms
  • Business analysis and systems architecture
  • Adobe Campaign, IBM Campaign/ Unica, Oracle Responsys, Oracle Eloqua, Marketo or ExactTarget experience highly desired

You will be joining our talented team of 180+ digital experts with:

  • The opportunity to learn and grow with a creative, innovative and technically advanced team
  • Ongoing personal and professional development.
  • A commitment to your work/life balance.
  • A great team culture, pub lunches, fully stocked bar fridge, team outings, paid certifications, yearly ski trip and plenty of opportunities to progress.

We offer a supportive, flexible and enjoyable work environment as well as heaps of team benefits for our kick-arse staff. Most of all, we invest in you, with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional development.

If you're ready to join one of Australia's best digital teams, submit your application today!

\xc2\xa0

Additional Information

Do you have a passion for leading-edge marketing and campaign platforms?

"

title: Community Regional Manager  Western Sydney
description:
b"

Our client is a Community Aged Care Provider focused on enabling, empowering and promoting independence for older people so they can remain active members of their community for as long as possible.\xc2\xa0

Due to Increased demand from our clients, Your World Healthcare are currently recruiting for a Community Regional Manager\xc2\xa0who will undertake responsibility for growth of community service programs autonomously in addition to the management of programs and supervision of staff within the Western Sydney region.

The Community Regional Manager will focus on building strong relationships with CCS clients and prospecting for new customers. Additionally, will ensure a standard of client care that aligns with principles of client choice, and that reflects the requirements of the program contract with specific requirements such as activity targets, reporting and quality standards.
\xc2\xa0
Objectives:

  • Providing cost effective, evidence based and goal oriented support for clients that deliver demonstrated positive outcomes to a client's quality of life.
  • Developing and maintaining effective working relationships with clients, their families, and support networks, local community and service networks, spiritual care support, sector professionals, relevant Government Departments and agencies, and key members and elders of the community.
  • Balancing self-management and client directed care with duty of care, positive health outcomes and organisational capacity to deliver services.

Must have:

  • Degree qualifications in Allied Health, Nursing or other relevant field or working towards
  • Well-developed understanding of care delivery in community care and a commitment to best practice and continuous improvement
  • Excellent written documentation and assessment skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and problem solving skills
  • Minimum of 5 years' experience in a similar role within the Aged Care, Community Services or Allied Health Industry
  • Experience using client/data management systems
  • Current drivers licence

In return:

  • Great rate of pay
  • Training provided
  • Excellent team
  • opportunities for career progression\xc2\xa0

To discuss this opportunity in more detail and obtain a full position description, apply now or contact\xc2\xa0Mark McAlpine\xc2\xa0at Your World Healthcare on 02\xc2\xa08320 3254\xc2\xa0or mark.mcalpine@ywrec.com

title: Sales Administrator

b"

Sales Administrator

\xc2\xa0

Cult Design is Australia, Singapore and New Zealand's leading destination for Authentic Designer Furniture, Lighting and Accessories. Cult Design has showrooms in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Auckland and a distributor network across the other capital cities.

\xc2\xa0

We are looking for a qualified 2 x Sales administrator to join our expanding sales teams in both Sydney and Melbourne locations and help achieve our vision and goals.   • Maintain and update sales and customer records

\xc2\xa0

title: Sales Engineer  Gantry cranes
description:
b"

International global OEM is seeking a proven professional sales engineer to represent and grow major key products throughout Sydney NSW. This organisation stands alone in the market and is at the forefront and design in the industry, it doesn't get any better than this company. As you can tell I'm extremely excited about this opportunity and so will you after I have spoken with you. You will work with the Sales Manager that will provide mentoring and opportunity for advancement. You will be given full training plus a career that will keep you motivated to work for this global giant.

In this challenging role you're to focus on building new business within Engineering, mining, marine, aviation, rail, industrial engineering, chemical, petrochemical and this list goes on. You're to sell the complete engineering turnkey solutions and build key relationships throughout Sydney NSW. You be required to cover cold calling but also work through a strategic direction in sales. Below I have given a strong technical understanding of the role.\xc2\xa0

  • Obtain critical market and customer intelligence to drive and convert customer enquiries into orders.
  • Take ownership of the tender process by undertaking sizing and selection of equipment, preparing engineering data sheets, seeking estimates and drawings, delivering customer communications and technical clarification where required
  • Ensure data is provided to purchasing/engineering to enable equipment cost to be properly estimated that enable margins to be realised.
  • Create and maintain product documentation, assist with the preparation of risk analysis documentation as required.
  • Project management \xe2\x80\x93 Tender proposal through to execution\xc2\xa0
  • Ensure the revenue/profit targets of the region are achieved or exceeded.
  • Site inspection with reporting on warehousing applications
  • Work with National Sales Manager to make Bid/No Bid decisions on major projects.
  • Manage the distribution communication process, ensuring\xc2\xa0 processes are followed and timelines met
  • Development/identification of solutions to client requirements that provide innovation, cost advantage and competitive differentiation
  • Attend client meetings at initial tender stages as well as project progress meetings
  • Develop new sales opportunities with new machine builds in major manufacturing or engineering workshops.
  • Provided technical application support to key customers by working with engineering team and R&D
  • Cost & Budget new systems for mining equipment.
  • Report to the National head office on default systems & apply solution reports.

\xc2\xa0

Your outstanding track record in\xc2\xa0new business sales distinguishes you from your peers.\xc2\xa0 Your exceptional interpersonal, negotiation and relationship building skills are underpinned by your keen business sense and commercial acumen.\xc2\xa0 You are driven to succeed and are renowned for your strategic business thinking, technical expertise and solution-focussed approach, encompassed by your ability to deliver exceptional customer service and marketing strategies.\xc2\xa0 The focus to the role is to develop and deliver high quality customer service and make mark in the industry.

Candidate requirements \xe2\x80\x93

  • 5+ years selling a technical mechanical solution
  • Mechanical engineer or trade in engineering
  • Proven sales experience
  • Excellent listing and communication skills
  • Willingness to learn and develop your skills
  • Driven and motivated to work for a global OEM
  • Methodical and structured in the direction of technical selling
  • Positive an upbeat attitude

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

ON offer is an excellent salary package with a base component of $80,000 - $90,000 with your standard superannuation of 9.5% and full training development. All your travel will be paid for and you will also get a travel allowance if you have to fly to customer sites or country regions. You will also be given full training plus be mentored by the regional manager in how to conduct yourself in day to day business with key customers and major OEM's.

If this opportunity sounds like something that you can get your teeth into and you're looking a new and exciting opportunity than you will need to apply to me today to\xc2\xa0 Ryan@salexo.com.au or if you would like to call me direct on 02 9922 9611. My client is looking to fill this position ASAP as they have large number of projects on board and awaiting this individual start right away.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

title: Student Administration Advisor
description:
b'

Macquarie University is a workplace like no other. From our inception we have crossed traditional boundaries. We developed the first electronic calculator for the blind, wireless internet technology and the Macquarie Dictionary. We were the first university in Australia to introduce childcare on campus and the first to appoint a female Vice-Chancellor. We were founded to be different, and we have always been at the forefront of changes to the way we work, live and learn.

The Deputy Vice-Chancellor (Academic) & Registrar is part of a dynamic portfolio, which has been built to meet current and future student's needs at the University. We have an exciting new opportunity to be part of this energetic team.

The vision is to be the number one University in Australia for Student Experience. This position offers the opportunity for you to use your skills to help the University to achieve its vision.

The Role

Reporting to the Admissions Team Leaders, you will be responsible in providing advice and administration support to students and staff on admissions policies, procedures and processes. You will collaborate within your team to support the coordination of service delivery and process improvement across all aspects of sub degree, Undergraduate and Postgraduate coursework admissions.

You will have a strong sense of customer service, sound assessment knowledge and experience, strong problem solving and relationship management skills, which will enable you to make a positive contribution to an exceptional student experience.

Selection Criteria

To be considered for this position, applicants must respond to the selection criteria below and attach their response as a separate document in the application process.

  • Demonstrated skills and experience in coaching staff and managing team workflow
  • Demonstrated skills and experience in providing advice, guidance and support to students and university staff
  • Demonstrated skills and experience in implementing process innovation and improvement
  • Strong skills and experience in delivering services in a high-volume processing environment
  • Demonstrated experience in working with complex data management and student administration systems
  • Demonstrated experience in interpreting and applying complex policies, assessment criteria and rules with respect to admissions, whether direct or via the Universities Admissions Centre

For further information regarding this role please view the position description below.

Salary Package: from $87,699 \xe2\x80\x93 $95,084 p.a. (Level 7), plus employer's superannuation and annual leave loading

Appointment Type: 6-month full time fixed term contract from late June 2017 to mid-January 2018

Position Description:Student Administration Advisor

Specific Role Enquiries: Anita Huang on anita.huang@mq.edu.au

General Recruitment Enquiries: Melissa Mesiti, HR Consultant on melissa.mesiti@mq.edu.au

Applications Close: Sunday, 21 May 2017 at 11:55pm

Macquarie University is an EO Employer committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications are encouraged from people with a disability; women (particularly for senior and non-traditional roles); Indigenous Australians, people who identify as GLBTI; and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

Applications need to be submitted through the Macquarie University online recruitment system. Where circumstances such as disability or remote location prohibit your access to our online system please contact the enquiries person listed in this advertisement for assistance

'

title: Wholesale Assistant
description:
b"

Giorgio Armani Group

The Armani Group is one of the leading fashion and luxury goods groups in the world today with 8,000 direct employees and 13 factories. It designs, manufactures, distributes and retails fashion and lifestyle products including apparel, accessories, eyewear, watches, jewellery, home interiors, fragrances and cosmetics under a range of brand names: Giorgio Armani Prive, Giorgio Armani, Armani Collezioni, Emporio Armani, AJ | Armani Jeans, A/X Armani Exchange, Armani Junior and Armani Casa.

With approximately 500 stores worldwide, the Group's exclusive Australian retail network currently comprises: 2\xc2\xa0Giorgio Armani boutiques, 5\xc2\xa0Emporio Armani stores, 14\xc2\xa0Armani Collezioni stores,\xc2\xa01\xc2\xa0AJ | Armani Jeans stores, 2\xc2\xa0Armani Junior stores and 4 Armani Outlet stores.

As a result of expansion, Giorgio Armani Australia,\xc2\xa0is looking for a passionate and motivated individual\xc2\xa0to join the Head Office team as full time Wholesale Assistant. This role will report to the Wholesale Manager.

Responsibilities:

Client Relationship Management

Customer service liaison and management of relations

  1. Customer service liaison and management of relations.
  2. Acquisition of new clients.
  3. Store visits and maintenance of points of sale.
  4. Training of respective staff both internal and external.

Management of Seasonal Sales Campaign

  1. Administer appointments and sell to respective wholesale clients and seasonal selling dates.
  2. Administer and coordinate internal functions (VM, logistics, IT, Projects) in maintaining showroom standards.
  3. Management of associated price lists.
  4. Coordination with Milan headquarters.
  5. Administration and coordination of budgets, forecasts and reporting.
  6. Documentation and presentation of feedback.
  7. Presentation to internal buyers of direct managed stores.

Management of Inventory

  1. Management and analysis of pricing and margins.
  2. Coordination of logistics according to scheduled intakes.
  3. Planning of seasonal drops with respective customers.
  4. Sales analysis and tracking sell thru reports.
  5. Competitive analysis reports of adjacent brands.
  6. Administer associated replenishment programs.
  7. Coordination of visual merchandisers and maintenance of in-store assortments.
  8. Return orders and refunds for respective business units.

Logistics

  1. Maintain service levels of fulfilment, delivery timing and invoicing accuracy in accordance with company and customer requirements.
  2. Mange IT systems with order entry, processing and deliveries.
  3. Manage EDI processing in coordination with internal and external stakeholders.
  4. Management of merchandise data integrity and EDI orders.
  5. Stock returns and associated reverse logistics.

Marketing

  1. Coordination of promotional events with wholesale clients.
  2. Coordination and ordering of promotional material.
  3. Administration of new location openings.

Skills required for this role:

  1. Retail sales experience.

  2. Customer relationship management.

  3. ERP systems experience, SAP preferable.

  4. Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint advanced.

  5. Prior understanding of Wholesale Merchandising.

Please note that applicants who are eligible to work in Australia with the relevant experience and skill set required will be contacted for an interview. Recruitment agencies need not apply.

"

title: Sales Coordinator
description:
b'
  • 12 month fixed term contract
  • Great career stepping stone into Account Management
  • Work within a truly collaborative team
  • Genuine ability to embrace continual change

We are an Australian-based digital media company with a passion for real estate.

Our leading brand is Australia\xe2\x80\x99s biggest property resource, realestate.com.au. We also operate the number one commercial property site, realcommercial.com.au, and have businesses that help property developers and other brands advertise with us. Whilst we live in Australia, we\xe2\x80\x99ve also got ventures in Asia, Europe and North America, and have the vision of expanding our footprint further.

What it\xe2\x80\x99s like to work for us\xe2\x80\xa6

Our people are our greatest asset. Without them, we would not be the successful business that we are today. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we offer a range of benefits to ensure we hire and retain great staff.

We offer\xe2\x80\xa6

  • An annual reward and recognition program for staff who are kicking goals throughout the year.
  • A day off for volunteer leave, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community.
  • An Employee Community Grants program to show you that we care about your community just as much as you do.

You can\xe2\x80\xa6

Be a part of Realestate.com.au\xe2\x80\x99s success story. Our leading brand, realestate.com.au, is looking for a Sales Coordinator to be a part of the team. You\xe2\x80\x99ll work alongside two other Sales Coordinators to provide a seamless sales support function to the Account Managers while they\xe2\x80\x99re out on the road meeting with their residential real estate agency customers. They\xe2\x80\x99re a busy, hardworking yet engaged sales team who enjoy celebrating their success and supporting each other, so you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to be someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high performing team environment.

What do we look for in a Sales Coordinator?
Someone who can:

  • Assist with contract preparation, sales collateral and reporting requirements for customer meetings
  • Analyse data and be able to identify and communicate key insights
  • Create easy-to-understand reports and PowerPoint presentations
  • Create and maintain daily sales dashboards from the CRM
  • Receive inbound new business enquiries, provide relevant information, follow up and close when required
  • Assist with event management as required
  • Attend occasional client visits with Account Managers in order to learn the sales process

You are\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Proactive with a go-getter attitude and customer-focused approach
  • Someone who has seamless time management skills, natural ability to multi-task and confidence to build relationships with both customers and internal stakeholders
  • Able to communicate effectively with a team who are often out on the road
  • Previous experience analysing and translating data and reports
  • Excellent Excel skills and experience creating PowerPoint presentations
  • Reliable, with an eye for detail and impeccable follow up

If you like who we are and have what we want, we\xe2\x80\x99d like you to throw your hat in the ring. While we take a look at your application, why not check out our blog, tech blog, LinkedIn, Instagram and Twitter.

'

title: Sales Administration / Internal Sales
description:
b"

We are a major global manufacturer of high quality industrial products with a great career role for an energetic, motivated office-based person to do both administrative and internal sales duties.

You -

Will have experience and accurate skills in:

  • Entering data into ERP and CRM systems

Us -

title: Payroll Officer
description:
b"

Martin Brower is a global logistics solutions provider, delivering more than 500 million cases to 20,000 quick service restaurants around the world each year. Renowned for finding innovative and timely means of delivering products to customers, Martin Brower is well known for setting new standards for on-time delivery, dependability, efficiency and safety at the international. Martin Brower also has a network of distribution centers across major capital cities in Australia and New Zealand with approximately 500 employees and we are hiring!

We are currently seeking a passionate and dedicated Payroll Officer to join the HR team based at the Head Office in Wetherill Park.

Reporting into the Payroll Manager your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Preparation of weekly payrolls, including Kronos manipulations and downloading of Kronos into the payroll system and processing of payrolls. Ensure that all employees receive their pay slip notices within the legislative timeframe.
  • Interpreting awards and Enterprise Agreements to ensure that employees are paid correctly.
  • Preparation of manual payroll adjustments and payments (E-pays), including termination payments. Provision of appropriate payroll data for reporting to internal and external stakeholders as required, including delivery of KPI's.
  • Timely payment of all payroll related deductions to the appropriate authorities and organizations including Commonwealth and State Tax Offices, superannuation funds etc.
  • Assist with the weekly payroll reconciliation process.
  • Act as a point of contact and respond to payroll enquiries in a timely and accurate manner, escalating matters as required.
  • Coordinate Training, including liaising with internal and external parties, as directed
  • Assist with the preparation of the annual Workplace Gender Equality Agency reports
    \xc2\xa0

The successful candidates must demonstrate:

  • Previous experience in a similar role
  • Intermediate Level proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Strong literacy and numeracy skills
  • Sound communication skills (verbal and written)
  • High attention to detail
  • Previous experience with Australian and New Zealand Payroll Systems
  • Sound knowledge of ANZ payroll taxation laws and legislative obligations etc.
  • Knowledge of current payroll systems
  • Tertiary qualifications in HR (Diploma or higher)
"

title: Assistant Financial Accountant
description:
b"

About us



Link Group is one of Australia's leading fund administration and share registry specialists.\xc2\xa0 We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics.



About the role



To prepare trial balance for a portfolios of share plans on a monthly basis, to prepare annual financial statements for a portfolio of share plans as required and to assist the Accountants and Senior Accountants in the superannuation team with daily authorisation tasks including authorisation of ABLE.



Key responsibilities


  • Preparation of month Dividend Reconciliation
  • Reconciliation of Shares held to Oscar
  • Reconciliation of Sundry Creditors and Sundry Debtor balances in the trial balances
  • Adherence to EPS processes and procedures including completion of relevant checklists.
  • Preparation of the tax calculation as part of the monthly TB preparation process including calculation of the under/over tax provision on an annual basis.
  • Liaison with Trustee office staff to resolve issues
  • Completion of the monthly trial balances for sending to the Trustee office in accordance with the agreed SLA\xe2\x80\x99s.

  • To build effective relationships across own team and to be considered \xe2\x80\x98first port of call\xe2\x80\x99 for general accounts queries
  • Withholding Tax for LMS Treasury Clients and assisting in processing as required.

About you


  • Working towards CPA/CA qualification
  • 1-3 years experience in accounting
  • Ability to demonstrate a practical knowledge of all accounting concept and reporting issues
  • Intermediate\xc2\xa0 skills using Word,\xc2\xa0Excel and other Accounting Products
  • Ability to meet deadlines and demonstrate strong planning and organisation skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work with limited supervision as well as part of a team
  • Attention to detail and accuracy

Experience in or knowledge of one or more of the following areas is desired but not essential:


  • Knowledge of Oscar or similar administration system highly regarded.
  • Exposure to the employee share plan administration industry would be valuable

Joining our team



At Link we believe our people are our MOST important asset. We offer excellent career progression opportunities, ongoing training and development, competitive salary, staff recognition programs, salary continuance insurance and discounted healthcare

title: Case Manager (Community Care)  Western Sydney
description:
b"

Our client is a Community Aged Care provider, focused on enabling, empowering and promoting independence for older people so they can remain active members of their community for as long as possible.

Our client is currently recruiting for a Case Manager in Western Sydney to provide community management support for clients of the provider and deliver positive outcomes to their quality of life.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide cost-effective, evidence-based and goal oriented case management support for clients of the provider that deliver positive outcomes to their quality of life.
  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with clients, their families, support networks, local community and service networks, spiritual care support, sector professionals, relevant Government departments and agencies, and key members of the community.

Are you right for this job?

To be successful for this role, you must have degree qualifications in Allied Health, Nursing or another relevant field. You must also have CACP, EACH, EACHD, Level 1-4 or CDC experience.

You will have a high level of understanding of care recipients' complex needs as well as a well-developed understanding of care delivery in community care.

A commitment to best practice and continuous improvement is key for this position along with excellent written documentation and assessment skills. You also need excellent interpersonal, communication and problem solving skills.

Proficiency using computer applications, including MS Word/Excel/Outlook is vital with a willingness to learn new programs.

Requirements

  • Degree qualifications in Allied Health, Nursing or other relevant field.
  • CACP, EACH, EACHD Level 1-4 OR CDC experience
  • Minimum 2-3 years' experience in a similar role within the Aged Care, Community Services or Allied Health industry
  • Experience using client/data management systems
  • Current driver's licence

Benefits

  • Great rate of pay
  • Training provided
  • Excellent team
  • Opportunities for career progression

To discuss this opportunity in more detail, apply now or contact\xc2\xa0Mark for more information.\xc2\xa0

"

title: NA
description:
b'

The Head of Customer Happiness for Oneflare directs and oversees all aspects of the customer service experience, including managing the Customer Happiness team and developing and driving new strategic initiatives.

You will be motivating and inspiring the team daily to deliver exceptional customer service, as well as developing guidelines, training, and initiatives to improve measurable efficiency, productivity, and quality of service.   • Enhance the efficiency and quality of the team's work and the customer experience through continual evaluation and optimisation of internal processes

  • Manage the staffing and performance of the Customer Happiness team members, including motivating, coaching, and developing their skills continually

  • Identify and implement innovative technology and reporting opportunities using highly effective change management skills

  • Establish and implement metrics and reporting, and use a data-driven approach for root cause analysis. Develop contact deflection strategies accordingly, and drive related cross-functional improvements

  • Liaise with other leaders to deliver large scale improvements to the customer experience

  • Manage and resolve escalated inquiries or complaints

Skills and Experience

Essential:

  • Proven success in change management, implementing new processes and technology, and team development and training

  • Experience working in a\xc2\xa0highly dynamic and fast-paced environment on multiple demanding projects in parallel, while balancing day-to-day team management.

  • Minimum 5-6 years experience, with 3 years management experience leading customer support teams

  • Excellent communication both written and verbal, along with cross-functional stakeholder management skills

Desired:

  • Experience implementing, developing, and working with remote teams

Personal characteristics:

  • Motivational, inspirational, positive, collaborative leadership style

  • Data driven and results oriented

  • Passion to deliver a positive experience to customers and value to the business

  • Strong attention to detail and able to approach problems in a logical and methodical manner

  • Proactive work ethic and always looking for ways to add value

  • Adaptability to be successful in a highly dynamic environment and work beyond the scope of responsibilities when required

What is Important to Us

At Oneflare, our values are important as they guide how we engage with our customers, stakeholders and employees. Our team live these values every day, in everything that we do. They are a reflection of what's important to us and have shaped our distinctive Oneflare culture.

We are accountable

We take responsibility for our decisions and ownership over our work.

We strive for excellence

We encourage each other to do better and hold ourselves to a high standard.

We have integrity

We trust each other's judgement and expertise. We earn trust by working with transparency when dealing with our businesses and customers.

We are positive

We see opportunities, not problems! We rise to the challenge and we persevere!

All employees are expected to adhere to Oneflare's Code of Conduct and policies and procedures.

Apply now!

You must have full working rights in Australia to be considered for this position.

Please note only successful candidates will be contacted.

title: Order Entry Clerk
description:

Are you looking for a first job or to progress your career in administration and customer service? Do you like routine and talking to people?\xc2\xa0Then read on for an exciting opportunity open in administration while working with the sales team!

Livingstone International is more than just a diversified importer, marketer and distributor\xc2\xa0in the medical, beauty, healthcare and consumables market. The company looks for people who can grow, think and deliver in an environment with constant change. Our culture thrives on rewarding hard work and creativity. title: Logistics Manager, Castrol - Guildford
description:
b'

As part of BP, Castrol is widely acknowledged as the world\xe2\x80\x99s leading specialist provider of Lubricant solutions. Although best known for our expertise in developing lubricants for the auto, Industrial and resource sectors, we also produce lubricants that directly affect our daily lives in other ways such as in gas and electricity production, transport industries, construction, and the marine sector.

We are now recruiting for a Fulfilment Manager - Mining to join our team with specific responsibility for our mining and resource customers. The role is primarily concerned with building sustainable processes, procedures and solutions to underpin the offer platform for all channels. Additionally the role contributes to our logistics network design which includes warehousing and distribution.

Key Responsibilities:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Representing our mining customer strategy in the Global Supply Chain (GSC) process documentation, communication to business, continuous improvement from order to supply
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and maintaining the logistics network design including warehousing and transportation and seek continuous improvement opportunities in service and cost performance
\xe2\x80\xa2 Effectively manage mining related projects, KPIs, safety, quality and asset performance providing leadership and direction to ensure delivery in line with business expectations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for being the key point of contact in GSC for mining as subject matter expert
\xe2\x80\xa2 Acting as the single point of accountability for any offer related discussions with the customer
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting in the development of solutions and offers to customers including the identification of appropriate assets to properly serve our customer base
\xe2\x80\xa2 Key contributor to tenders, agreements and contracts for customers, including some non-mining customers
\xe2\x80\xa2 Embedding new systems, processes and reporting requirements across a diverse group of stakeholders and ensuring that they have bought into and support your initiatives
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continually monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, systems and processes across multiple operational and project spheres
\xe2\x80\xa2 Intervening when necessary with regard to inventory issues, in particular when there is a direct risk to customer delivery

Essential Skills & Experience:

In order to be considered for this role, applicants must; have extensive supply chain experience, particularly with regard to warehousing and logistics; be an accomplished analyst - able to use data to drive the design of the future state of our supply chain; be a capable people and functional leader and; be an expert stakeholder manager.

At all times your priority will be to ensure that all tasks undertaken are done so in accordance with BP and regulatory health, safety and environmental policy.

'

title: Payroll Officer - Permanent Position
description:
b'
  • Payroll Officer - Permanent Position
  • 60-65k Package
  • Sydney CBD location, great team with support and training.

\xc2\xa0

My client, a\xc2\xa0large contractor based recruitment firm in Sydney CBD is looking to hire a payroll officer to join their finance team. The role reports into the National Payroll and HR Manager. The\xc2\xa0position will suit someone with great attention to detail and\xc2\xa0looking to expand on their payroll knowledge. Ideally the successful candidate will have 1-2 years payroll experience as either a Payroll assistant or payroll officer, further desirability but not essential if you have worked in a contractor/ recruitment payroll environment.

\xc2\xa0

Job details:

  • Processing of new starters and job setups

  • Uploading T+A data and processing timesheets

  • Timely and accurate end to end processing of allocated payroll/s including, but not limited to, the checking of critical payroll data is completed before payroll is sent to bank

  • Reconciling and preparing Superannuation payments

  • Running weekly and monthly reports

  • Processing invoices

  • Provide professional, accurate and timely payroll customer service to both internal and external customers

\xc2\xa0

To be successful you need:

  • Previous experience working in a Payroll Officer role and have fantastic communication skills

  • Strong numerical and data entry skills

  • Excellent time management skills

  • Attention to detail -- this\xc2\xa0is paramount

  • To know how to following up and process\xc2\xa0timesheets

  • Excellent communication skills.

  • Experience managing phone and email enquiries for the any disputes

  • Excellent Microsoft Excel skills

  • Experience with FastTrack would be highly advantageous.

  • To be proactive and have a positive attitude

\xc2\xa0

Please send your CV\xc2\xa0to johndeligiannis@charterhouse.com.au\xc2\xa0or call for a confidential discussion on +612 9241 6419

'

title: IT Support and Reporting Analyst
description:
b'

About the business and the role

IT Support and Reporting Analyst

An excellent opportunity to join a growing company based in the Sydney CBD that specialises in outsourced legal and mortgage services for Australia's largest lenders.

The primary function of this role is to provide high level client reporting and professional and efficient IT support to internal users who make use of the company's IT systems, reporting to the IT & Operations Manager.

Job tasks and responsibilities

  • Supporting the IT & Operations Manager
  • Generate weekly, monthly and ad-hoc reports for our clients using MS Excel, ensuring accuracy and delivering on time
  • Create and modify system reports, Word macros and email templates
  • Provide IT administration and support to over 60 staff members \xe2\x80\x93 business operates in a hosted Citrix environment
  • Install and maintain local PC's, printers and phones
  • Liaise with external system developers and cloud providers
  • Provide web portal support, administration and maintenance

\xc2\xa0

Skills and experience

The ideal candidate must possess the following:

  • Good technical skills and experience across Windows 7/8/10 and Server 2012, active directory, exchange and TCP/IP networking
  • Strong MS Excel skills (combine formulas and manipulate data)
  • Good knowledge and experience in relational databases and reporting tools ie. SQL, MS Access, Report Builder, Power BI etc
  • Excellent problem solving and communication skills
  • Must be able to communicate clearly in both written and verbal forms
  • Good time management, strong work ethics and high attention to detail
  • Must have at least 2 years experience in a similar role
  • Must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Payroll Officer - Multiple Opportunities
description:
b"
  • Multiple Locations - CBD, Chatswood & Macquarie Park
  • Junior & Senior Positions Available - Permanent & Temporary
  • Systems - Chris21, Micropay Meridian, Neller Preceda & SAP

Client Details

Working with a number of large listed organisations operating in various industries such as Retail, FMCG, Construction & Non For Profit.

Description

Within the available roles you will be responsible for the end to end processing of Payroll in high volume environments. You will need exceptional written and verbal communication skills along with a customer service focus. Your role will include but not limited to the following:

  • End to end accurate processing of weekly/monthly payroll
  • Maintain employee Master Data records
  • Processing of new starters and terminations
  • Processing of superannuation, payroll tax, worker\xe2\x80\x99s compensation, etc.
  • Compile end to end testing of system upgrades and report issues
  • Ensure all payroll information and documentation received is accurate and complete
  • Ensure processes and procedures are followed
  • Processing of termination pays including redundancies ensuring legislative and regulatory rules are followed
  • Maintain strict confidentiality of employee information

Profile

Ideally you will have 3+ years experience in a full function, high volume environment utilising systems such as Chris21, Micropay Meridian, Neller Preceda or SAP. You will have an outgoing personality coupled with a customer service focused attitude in this fast paced role.

Job Offer

In return you will have the opportunity to join some of Australia's most reputable businesses working alongside teams of like-minded individuals. An attractive remuneration package or hourly rate will be put in place for the successful candidate alongside an emphasis on work/life balance.

To apply for this position, please click the 'Apply Now' button below. For a confidential discussion, please contact Mossy Tariq on 02 9195 2903.

"

title: Service Desk Support Officer
description:
b'

Reporting to the Team Leader - Service Management this role works within the Information Management & Technology Group. This position is responsible for the provision of a range of customer services, as outlined in the IM&T Service Catalogue, to support the efficient and effective operation of core and other relevant business data and applications, device management (physical and virtual) and related ICT infrastructure.

Mandatory qualifications and licences:

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT or a related discipline; A current Drivers Licence. ITIL Foundation knowledge
  • Please refer to job description for full list of essential experience and skills.

Essential experience and skills:

  • Significant experience in the field of Information Management and Technology;
  • Extensive experience in developing a strong customer focus within an organisation;
  • Experience and knowledge in increasing value-add to customers and maximising accessibility and minimising risk to an organisation's information resources; and
  • Extensive experience utilising Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) processes in the Service Operations area.

This is a permanent full-time position working 35 hours per week with 19 day month flexi-time available.\xc2\xa0

The successful candidate's values will align with Council's Values:

  • Collaborative - be open and welcoming, genuinely connect to others, include others, work together as one
  • Active - be enthusiastic and optimistic, make a positive contribution, set goals to be the best you can be, deliver every day
  • Respectful \xe2\x80\x93 be honest and trustworthy, do what you say you will put yourself in the other person's shoes, listen to what's important to others
  • Evolving \xe2\x80\x93 stay up to date, take on new opportunities, think creatively about solutions, be a big picture thinker

Salary range:\xc2\xa0 $65,294 - $69,209\xc2\xa0pa + 9.5% superannuation.

Applications close:\xc2\xa025 May 2017.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

All applications must address the selection criteria contained in the job description which can be found on Council's website www.sutherlandshire.nsw.gov.au.

Applications to be submitted online through the website.

Quote Ref No 51-17 when applying.\xc2\xa0 This position is being re-advertised.\xc2\xa0 Previous applicants need not re-apply.

'

title: Talent & Organisational Development Manager
description:
b'

BOC, a member of The Linde Group is known as one of the world leaders in gases, engineering and healthcare. We are a progressive organisation and have a rare opportunity for an experienced business orientated professional to be responsible for the overall management of the Talent, Training and Organisation Development function.
Reporting to the South Pacific HR Director, and crucial in accomplishing business goals, you will provide strategic direction to HR, executive leaders and the greater business to drive talent management strategies that support and enhance performance to meet current and future business needs.

Key Accountabilities:
\xc2\xb7 Partner with HR and business leaders in formulating and implementing strategies and initiatives for the region\xe2\x80\x99s talent, succession and performance management for the short, medium and long term.
\xc2\xb7 Provide coaching, engagement and guidance to key stakeholders in building our organisation capability, transforming culture and promoting the value of training.
\xc2\xb7 Develop programs to successfully identify and develop the right people to grow the business through leveraging a broad network in Asia Pacific and globally.
\xc2\xb7 Refine and run talent management processes, including succession planning, talent movement and leadership capability building.
\xc2\xb7 Facilitate and implement Asia Pacific and global initiatives to closely connect and align the Linde Group people competencies with regional development initiatives.
\xc2\xb7 Adopt industry-wide best practice standards to measure and benchmark people performance and run the performance management program.
\xc2\xb7 Responsible to maintain and enhance the permanent and casual labour hire recruitment model across the business and manage the recruitment provider/s.

Experience & Qualifications:
\xc2\xb7 Tertiary qualifications in HR or Professional Education & Training with a minimum of 10 years in contemporary HR, talent and organisation development practices.
\xc2\xb7 Demonstrated success in the design and delivery of talent and leadership development solutions that provide tangible value to the business.
\xc2\xb7 Ability to prioritise multiple tasks and achieve deadlines.
\xc2\xb7 Well-developed relationship and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence, manage and communicate effectively with a range of stakeholders.
\xc2\xb7 Proven business acumen, perspective, depth and credibility to appreciate different operating environments.
\xc2\xb7 Strong analytics and data-oriented approach.

The Company
BOC is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from women and men of all ages, including Indigenous Australians and people with a disability.
We\xe2\x80\x99re known as experts in our field, who hold the safety of people and sustainability of our communities as our top priorities. We respond to change with integrity and innovation, to ensure our customers get performance and reliability from our products and services. And we achieve this through great people who take the lead.
Our people have the opportunity to thrive and excel. We provide a wide range of training programmes to enhance career development. There is potential for overseas opportunities. We also have a variety of employee appreciation programs to recognise individual and team efforts.
At BOC we respect a work/life balance, and that\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99ve introduced initiatives such as generous parental leave, flexible working arrangements and attractive superannuation benefits. We\xe2\x80\x99re also firmly in the driver\xe2\x80\x99s seat when it comes to our involvement in the community as well as our charity involvement with organisations such as Road Safety Education and Redkite.
So what are you waiting for? The opportunity is yours. Are you ready to take the lead?

'

title: Receptionist
description:
b"\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Dentsu Aegis Network is a global Digital, Media & Communications Network. As an organisation we pride ourselves on being values led. Our vision globally is to innovate the way brands are built and we base this vision on our five key values of being Agile, Pioneering, Ambitious, Responsible, and Collaborative. Our values are core to the way we operate and think.

Responsibilities
  • Manage the front of house reception area in our Sydney Office
  • Answer the phones and direct calls appropriately
  • Meet and Greet clients/media in a professional manner
  • Manage all mail
  • Help with office catering requirements
  • Maintain meeting rooms
  • Liaise with Sydney maintenance team and assist the office manager with all requests for the floor
  • Occasional data entry or typing
Skills Required
  • Ability to work full time, with flexibility around working hours
  • The ability to juggle conflicting demands and a good eye for detail
  • A high level of discretion and confidentiality
  • Very strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with staff and others
  • Excellent personal presentation\xc2\xa0
  • Ability to prioritise tasks and work autonomously
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
We're open minded about our ideal candidate - we don't mind if you're an enthusiastic young person looking for a foot in the door in a rapidly growing industry, or an experienced Receptionist looking for a long-term role you can sink your teeth into in an exciting new environment.\xc2\xa0 So long as you can demonstrate that you're dedicated and up for the task at hand!

If this role sounds like you then please APPLY! We look forward to hearing from you! "

title: Software QA Analyst  Leading Australian Organisation
description:
b"

About Your New Company

Your new role will see you working within DocsCorp, a privately owned Australian software company. DocsCorp offer a range of products, enabling enterprises to perform value adding document production and manipulation tasks, and improving business workflows for the professional business users we serve, namely Legal and Accounting firms, Government departments and Corporate businesses.

With more than 3,500 customers worldwide, primarily located in the Americas, Europe and Asia Pacific, DocsCorp is a fast growing and fast paced organisation of approximately 90 employees with offices in three continents.

About Your New Role

You will be working within a team that has produced products that have enhanced business productivity throughout the world. You will be engaged and working alongside multinational development teams and Product Management to ensure the QA Function at a corporate level is one of continuous improvement.

Due to company growth, we are currently seeking an enthusiastic QA Analyst to join the organisation within the Sydney based team.

Being adept within your role, you'll be expected to have experience in supporting multiple projects simultaneously, whilst being able to both develop and implement test methodologies across the organisation.

Technical Criteria

  • 5 years+ commercial\xc2\xa0experience in software testing
  • Experience in development of software test cases, test plans and test reports
  • Experience in product testing including functional, regression, performance, usability testing.
  • Ability to perform effective ad-hoc testing
  • Ability to analyse and contribute to automated tests (Ranorex, SpecFlow, MSTest)
  • Ability to analyse and contribute to test data and environments
  • Ability to comprehend technical and user specifications to assess and mitigate risks
  • Ability to perform detailed quality reviews with engineers
  • Excellent requirements analysis skills through collaboration with product and engineering management
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Windows operating system
  • Working knowledge of virtual machines for testing purposes
  • Experience with Document Management Systems such as SharePoint is desirable

Awaiting the successful candidate is a very progressive and fast growing global provider that enhances its own company culture, as much as its own product suite. Employee benefits include ongoing company training and development, technology allowance and profit sharing, all of which are part of the benefits of working for this leading software house.

Applicants must be motivated, team focused and enjoy not only the QA function itself, but also have a talent for complex tasks and solutions. To apply for this role, please use the dedicated link now.

"

title: Network and Security Engineer
description:
b"

Xenith IP Group Limited is the holding company for a group of entities providing a broad range of intellectual property (IP) services and advice along the innovation pipeline, providing clients with a holistic service offering around their IP and the opportunity for a better commercial outcome. The company includes Griffith Hack, Shelston IP, Watermark and Glasshouse Advisory.

Xenith IP Services' National Information Technology Group is a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary team working with the latest professional services technology and practices. This position reports directly to the IT Manager and is responsible for the ownership, support and development of the networking, communications and security infrastructure across the group.

Key responsibilities of the role will include:

  • Management of the LAN/WAN networking infrastructure, Cloud, video conferencing and VoIP telecommunications
  • Ensuring data integrity and security whilst providing empowering functionality and systems access across traditional and emerging mediums.
  • Support the delivery of agreed service levels incorporating system availability, capacity, performance and incident management to the Desktop and Server environments.
  • Providing analysis, insight and recommendations which foster a continual improvement philosophy, thereby increasing value to the customers and the organisation.

The successful candidate for this role will have the following skills and abilities:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology or the completion of specialist systems courses in related discipline. Current Cisco Certification CCNA or CCNP highly regarded.
  • IT professional industry experience 5+ years in similar operational environments (WAN spanning multiple locations, 250+ desktops, 100+ Servers).
  • Knowledge and design experience using multi-disciplinary networking infrastructure. Including routing protocols (HSRP, BGP, EIGRP); server technologies (Active Directory services, DNS, DHCP); communication systems (VoIP telephony, video conferencing, mobility); and networking infrastructure (switching, routing, gateways, WAN acceleration).
  • Strong background in security with Palo Alto firewall experience essential; Checkpoint and WatchGuard experience beneficial; DMZ infrastructure design and analytics experience highly regarded (monitoring, internal, perimeter and cloud defences, remote access systems, service and mobility solutions).
  • Technical operational understanding of core software and hardware systems from Microsoft, VMware and Citrix operating and management systems; Communication platforms such as Office 365, Exchange, Skype for Business, Polycom and Mobile (Android/iOS); networking platforms from Cisco, Juniper, Dell, Riverbed, Acano, and Citrix.
  • Demonstrated experience in Networking and Security infrastructure, analysis, maintenance and management.
  • Exposure to business finance including budgeting, planning, procurement and maintenance agreements.
  • Project management including resource planning, allocation, provisioning and ITIL foundations and practices.
  • Strong stakeholder engagement and management skills across both business and technology; demonstrated ability to deliver on both operational and project based responsibilities.

How to apply

To apply for this position, please provide the following to Monica Kwan, People & Capability Advisor:

  1. Cover letter
  2. Academic transcripts
  3. CV
"

title: Asbestos Consultant
description:
b"

PRM provides risk management consulting services to clients in the field of hazardous materials, occupational hygiene, environmental and health and safety. An opportunity exists in PRM's Sydney Metro office in the field of asbestos/hazardous materials.\xc2\xa0

PRM offers a flexible workplace, strong team environment and the ability to gain experience and understanding of all service offerings throughout the company.

About the Role
PRM are looking for a self-motivated, experienced, professional asbestos/hazardous materials consultant to join our growing team. Reporting to the Principal Consultant \xe2\x80\x93 Workplace Safety Risk, your role will include the following:

  • Providing specialist knowledge and solutions in the area of asbestos and hazardous materials.
  • Project management and client liaison.
  • Producing high quality technical reports.
  • Assist in writing proposals and cost estimates.
  • Air monitoring and clearance inspections.
  • Hazardous building material inspections and audits.

Requirements for the Role\xc2\xa0

  • Tertiary qualification in health and safety, occupational hygiene or environment.
  • NSW Licensed asbestos assessor (preferred).
  • Preferable to have 2 years' experience as a minimum.
  • Experience in asbestos fibre air monitoring, lead dust air monitoring and other types of air monitoring.
  • Professional experience in asbestos / hazardous materials.
  • Strong report writing skills, fieldwork and data management experience.
  • Proven ability to develop and maintain client relationships.
  • The ability to work effectively within a team environment, but also have the ability to work independently.
  • A commercial awareness and willingness to assist in driving business growth.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Mobility and able to travel as and when required, including working weekend and night shifts depending on the project.

Why work for PRM?

The successful candidate will be working with an experienced team and have the ability to grow their own career whilst working in a professional, fun and united company. PRM will be able to offer the successful candidate with a competitive salary package commensurate with experience, access to structured training and development opportunities from all team members and flexible working arrangements, including working from home.
If this career is of interest please send all CV and correspondence to info@progressiverm.com.au\xc2\xa0

"

title: NA
description:
b"

\xc2\xa0

It's an exciting time to join P&O Cruises. Our newest ship, Pacific Explorer, is joining the fleet (or should we say family) in June, plus we are sailing to more destinations across more itineraries than ever before.

\xc2\xa0

The Sales and Marketing Analyst is responsible for analysing Sales and Marketing performance and assisting in the planning of Sales and Marketing activity for P&O Cruises. This analysis includes reviewing weekly booking trends, campaign effectiveness and trade performance.

\xc2\xa0

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Assisting the Pricing Manager with finding insights from booking data, including shifts in demand trends for itineraries, homeport, distribution, cabin types and shifts in demographics
  • Sharing key insights with the broader commercial team, including Marketing, Sales, and Customer Services to align strategic goals
  • Monitor competitor pricing and promotional activity, cruise market and holiday market trends which may impact demand
  • Work closely with Yield Analysts and Marketing team in the production of promotional activities to support the programs featured
  • Ensure weekly Sales and Marketing reports are accurate and delivered in a timely manner

\xc2\xa0

Our ideal candidate will be Degree Qualified in Finance/Economics/Commerce or similar and bring:

  • Some experience within an office/corporate environment (not necessarily in an analytical role)
  • Database knowledge is highly desirable
  • A passion towards systems and process, and an unwavering level of patience to delve into data
  • A love of numbers, analysis and finding solutions based on logic
  • Intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills
  • Communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 verbal and written, with high attention to detail
  • Great interpersonal skills with a strong team orientation
  • A high level of self-organisation skills, with the ability to prioritise, use initiative and work to deadlines
"

title: Planning Admin Assistant
description:
b'

About the company

For Bras N Things it's about her, Always. We are Australia's leading fashion lingerie retail with more than 170 stores across Australia, New Zealand and South Africa, with plans for further growth.

Bras N Things offers an innovative range that of lingerie, sleepwear, playwear, active and swimwear taking the best elements of style and comfort. Our designers are continuously creating a wide range of styles to ensure that we have you covered no matter what you are looking for, sexy, playful, comfy, flirty and fun.

About the role:

As a Planning Admin Assistant you will be responsible managing the lifecycle of products within RMS from item registration to mark down.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 This role seeks to provide Bras N Things with the highest level of data integrity. This role also supports the planning team with basic reporting and analysis.

Planning Admin Assistant Responsibilities

  • Setting up Item Registration in RMS system
  • Entering Purchase Order Management into RMS system
  • Manage Price changes
  • RMS Allocations
  • RMS Stock receiving and dispatching
  • Updating and Maintenance of\xc2\xa0 Buy Plans for all product
  • Maintain weekly amendment report
  • Run and manage number of different reports

Contribution to the group

  • Commit to self improvement and expansion of industry knowledge
  • Diligently follow Bras N Things standards, methodologies, processes and procedures
  • Contribute actively to the business strategic direction.
  • Contribute positively & energetically in group meetings & company events.
  • Ability to analyse and solve problems.
  • Demonstrated ability to work as part of the Team.
  • Participates in projects to improve the operation of the department/company.
  • Has a positive can do attitude at all times, whilst listening, challenging & directing.
  • Coachable in all aspects, flexible & proactive in style

The successful candidate will have written and verbal communication skills, \xc2\xa0skills as well as have proven ability to multi-task and manage work priorities across multiple projects. If you thrive in a fast paced environment, have proven ability to work within deadlines and the commitment to deliver exceptional results we would love to hear from you - apply now!

'

title: Administration Supervisor (Operational Support role)
description:
b"
  • Ref No: A17/0122
  • Permanent Full Time \xe2\x80\x93 35 hours per week
  • Salary package up to $85,000 p.a. (including Superannuation)
  • 9-day fortnight, family friendly policies and other great employee benefits
  • Located in Alexandria (modern open plan office)
  • 10 mins walk to shops and public transport (trains and Bus)

Waverley is a diverse and innovative Council located in the heart of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs taking in some of Sydney's most beautiful and iconic beaches and historic locations.

As Administration Supervisor you will lead and support a team of three (3) office bound staff who provide administrative support to the operational departments within Council. These departments include Open Spaces, Parks and Tree management, Maintenance and Construction, and our Waste services team.

This position will also provide administrative support to the Executive Manager of this sub program.

The Key focus areas for this position include; Team leadership, information and data management, customer service excellence, and continued business improvement.

If you have tertiary qualifications in Office Administration or frontline management, have a solid background in administrative services, are a great communicator and team motivator, then this could be the job for you!

If you are new to the government sector or would like more information on how to apply for this position, please contact Paul Sparks on 0466 541 650 between 8am and 4pm Monday to Friday.

Waverley Council is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all candidates. We encourage applications from women and men from diverse groups, including, but not limited to, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island people; people from culturally diverse backgrounds; young people; older workers; people with disabilities; LGBTI; and other minority groups.

CLOSING DATE: Tuesday 23 May 201

"

title: Valuation Actuary
advertiser: Ensure Recruitment  Seek Award Winner   Best Small Specialist
description:
b'A Life Insurance company is looking to bring in another Qualified Retail Valuation Actuary to join their team of 9 in Sydney. This person needs possess a good amount of local Retail Valuation experience as well as good communication and leadership skills to work alongside some external consultants on the 4 new system building.\xc2\xa0

They offer a generous salary package for people that are qualified for this role.\xc2\xa0
  • Responsible for the Local and USGAAP monthly and quarterly reporting requirements; including calculating, policy reserves, unearned premium, IBNRs, DAC, pending claims and CICP\xc2\xa0
  • Collection and analysis of data for product profitability analysis and determination of valuation assumptions\xc2\xa0
  • Perform actuarial investigations, analysis and costings
  • Draft reports on investigations and communicate the results
  • Proactive identification of risks to profit or capital position with recommendations to address
  • Drafting and review of relevant sections of the annual FCR
  • Manage the Actuarial Analysts to ensure the provision of timely, quality actuarial valuations including meaningful analysis and feedback to the business\xc2\xa0
  • Oversight of the preparation of statistical and other data for submission to APRA\xc2\xa0
  • Working with the Valuation Actuary, Group to support the overall Actuarial Valuation and to manage the day to day responsibilities of the Actuarial Analysts
  • Working with the Capital and EV Actuary to provide input and advice for capital and EV calculations, analysis and advice to the business\xc2\xa0
  • Participates in project work as required
  • Maintain full working knowledge of the relevant product and regulatory environment in Australia
  • Proactively contribute to and lead the identification and implementation of ways to do things better within the LEAN framework
For more details or to express your interest, please contact Hallie Chin on h.chin@ensurerecruitment.com.au. '

title: NA
description:
b'Company
This large ASX listed company is well established in it's field and offers a fabulous working culture. They have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst with SAP FICO experience to join their growing team. This opportunity is within the Systems and Processes team, but will work very closely with the Finance function.\xc2\xa0

Role and responsibilities\xc2\xa0
Your role with ensure control is maintained over the company's assets and ensuring effectiveness and efficiency of Finance and Costing business processes, namely:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Policy development and accounting guidelines around stock and inventory
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and regularly maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) relating to \xc2\xa0stock control
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assurance of a complete and thorough statutory stocktake; to ensure assets are properly reflected on the balance sheet at each statutory close
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of reporting on plant stock variance batches to business units
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop leader board reporting to establish areas of concerns regarding controls
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement the reporting of KPI's on inventory consumption and inventory levels\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 \xc2\xa0Be integral in the design & constant re-developing of procedures, policy and controls in the SAP environment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 \xc2\xa0Co-ordination, quality control,\xc2\xa0 design delivery,\xc2\xa0 impact assessment, system testing and user acceptance testing\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continuously improving processes, operating procedures, business controls and reporting for the finance function
\xe2\x80\xa2 Act as the subject matter expert for all finance related systems and processes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the research and use of data analysis tools and implement as required to improve business efficiency and data integrity
\xe2\x80\xa2 Act as an internal advisor to review proposed changes to operating systems that affect internal controls and underlying processes


Profile
To be successful you need to have a degree in Finance/Commerce, be CA/CPA or have substantial finance experience. You will need to be highly experienced with SAP FICO (2-3 years) and having exposure or knowledge of inventory is advantageous.\xc2\xa0Advanced Excel skills and strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills will also be necessary.\xc2\xa0

Apply
To find out more please call Melanie McCroarey on +612 9262 4836 or apply at\xc2\xa0www.moirgroup.com.au.

To be alerted when we advertise a new job please set up a "job alert" by visiting us at our website\xc2\xa0www.moirgroup.com.au '

title: Employment Lawyer

The team is small, collegiate and tight knit.\xc2\xa0You will receive instructions directly from the Partner and will enjoy plenty of direct client contact. The role offers high end transactional and advisory work and you will become a pivotal member of this high performing team. IR experience is advantageous.

title: Social Policy and Planning Officer
description:
b"

UTS has a bold vision to be a world-leading university of technology. We are a dynamic and innovative university in central Sydney, consistently ranked the top young university in Australia. With a culturally diverse campus life and extensive international exchange and research programs, UTS prepares graduates for the workplaces of today and tomorrow.

The UTS Institute of Public Policy and Governance (IPPG) is an independent research institute focused on public policy, governance, social research, strategic planning, monitoring and evaluation and leadership. The UTS:IPPG incorporates the UTS Centre for Local Government, which supports the advancement of local government policy and practice.

The institute is currently recruiting a Social Policy and Planning Officer with experience working for local government or in local communities to focus particularly on all areas of social policy and planning such as social impact and infrastructure assessments, CPTED assessment, stakeholder and community engagement, and community planning, development and services.

The Social Policy and Planning Officer is responsible for contributing to the Institute's applied policy consultancy projects by conducting thorough and detailed research and analysis, and preparing proposals for external funding opportunities. This work contributes to the Institute's research consultancy objectives by assisting with the effective and efficient delivery of high quality research consultancy projects in accordance with set milestones and budgets.

Main duties/responsibilities:


  • Undertake projects with a focus on policy, planning and impact assessment for a wide range of social issues across different local communities and places
  • Undertake community engagement activities - such as interviews, focus group and workshop design and facilitation, and survey design and analysis
  • Prepare and contribute to projects so they are completed on time and budget
  • Prepare applications and proposals for external funding of research and consultancy projects, in particular social planning and policy work at the local level
  • Liaise and collaborate with organisations, such as local councils, industry partners, UTS faculties, and departments and agencies at State and Commonwealth level
  • Write project reports relating to commissioned research consultancies
  • Develop, present and explain research and consultancy findings and recommendations to a wide range of audiences including local communities and stakeholders, policy and decision-makers
  • Design and carry out high quality, innovative and evidence-based change processes and projects with local governments, communities and stakeholders using appropriate quantitative and qualitative research and engagement methods
  • Conduct analysis of demographic, socio-economic, crime, health and other relevant data sources so that projects are strongly evidence-based.

Main skills/experience required:


  • An understanding of the context and approaches to social and community planning, service design and/or delivery at the local level
  • Demonstrated experience in undertaking projects with a focus on social planning and/or social impact assessment either within or for local government
  • Knowledge of current trends across a wide range of social policy areas, and ability to quickly grasp new social policy and service delivery issues
  • Demonstrated experience engaging local communities and stakeholders on complex policy issues including ability to build rapport, understand and empathise with them
  • An understanding of the industrial and risk context within which local government operates
  • Financial and project management literacy
  • A solid understanding of project management
  • Demonstrated knowledge of social research and policy development, implementation and evaluation processes and methods.

Remuneration

Base Salary Range: $85,681 to $94,795 pa (HEW 7)

This role attracts 17% superannuation in addition to the base salary. Employee benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities.

This appointment will be on a continuing full-time basis.

How To Apply

Prior to commencing your application for IRC94585, please review the Position Description and the relevant selection criteria - click on the apply link to be taken to the relevant page. You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document.

Please note that only those applications submitted via the UTS online recruitment system will be accepted. Current UTS employees should apply through their UTS Employee Self Service function.

As you will be unable to save your application once started, please have all required documents and information available prior to commencing.

Please ensure that the file name for each document submitted includes IRC94585.

Specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to the UTS Recruitment Team at recruitment@uts.edu.au or on +61 (0) 2 9514 1080.

Closing Date: Tuesday 23rd May 2017 at 11.59pm (AEST)

We are committed to diversity and social inclusion, evidenced by our WGEA Employer of Choice citation, Wingara Indigenous Employment Strategy and the UTS Access and Inclusion Plan. We welcome applications from women (particularly for senior and non-traditional roles), Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those who identify as LGBTIQ and applicants from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.


"

title: BOOKKEEPER

Listed company seeking full time bookkeeper/junior accountant to assist the financial controller in the day to day financial management of this exciting company.\xc2\xa0
