title: Sales Solutions Executive
description:
b"

Step into our world and discover a nationwide family united by passion and imagination. At oOh!, we're proud collaborators, which means we have the confidence to explore new territories because we will always explore together. We experiment with cutting edge technology, test the bounds of our creativity, and lead our industry down exciting new paths. And when we do that well, we celebrate it.

Here is why we need you\xe2\x80\xa6

Due to continual business growth we have an exciting opportunity for a talented Sales Solutions Executive to join our close knit and driven Client Solutions Team. \xc2\xa0As a Sales Solution Executive you are responsible for the creation of market leading reactive and proactive proposals for the agency & direct sales team.

Here's what you'll do\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Work collaboratively to identify audience & product data
  • Maintain strong internal relationships with our Data & Insights, Creative, Sales & Product teams\xc2\xa0
  • Be involved in the strategy and ideation phase in order to fully conceptualize client briefs and objectives\xc2\xa0
  • Be responsible for the creation of proposals across agency and direct sales\xc2\xa0
  • Create objective led; audience filtered reasons for clients to purchase our products
  • Assist in the creation of tactical 'go to market' sales collateral such as presentation packs & reports\xc2\xa0
  • Internally coordinate brainstorming workshops in conjunction with the key business divisions\xc2\xa0

This is what you'll look like\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Prior industry experience in a sales or integrated role\xc2\xa0
  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills as this is a highly collaborative role\xc2\xa0
  • Be able to conceptualize clients' needs easily and interpret this into tangible sales solutions\xc2\xa0
  • Awesome storytelling abilities with a knack for producing knock out presentations\xc2\xa0
  • An understanding of the media space and planning/ buying principles & how this is utilized via agencies\xc2\xa0
  • Solid organisational skills and good time management essential\xc2\xa0
  • Be a strong team player with a CAN DO attitude\xc2\xa0


If you're curious, brave, and ready to leap into a career like no other, we're ready to open our doors to you.

If this isn't the right role for you, we'd love for you to be part of our Talent Community so you can be the first in line to be considered when a new opportunity comes up.

"

title: Automotive Industry: Area Sales Manager - NSW/ACT
description:
b'

About the Role

Based in Sydney, you will join a highly experienced regional team. Your key task will be to assist our dealer network to achieve strong sales performance through the development of effective dealer sales and inventory plans. You will be a brand advocate within our dealer network and support them to achieve outstanding sales and customer satisfaction results. This role will also include some intrastate and interstate travel.

\xc2\xa0

Company Info

Mitsubishi Motors Australia is part of the global Mitsubishi Motors organisation and is a key member of the Mitsubishi Group companies. We take great pride from knowing that over 11 million people around the world have chosen to drive our vehicles. It's what inspires us to go the extra mile and develop new technology and ground-breaking safety systems that challenge convention. We also take pride in the drive of our employees - if you're looking to take your career to the next level then we want to hear from you.

\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities Include:

  • In conjunction with key dealership personnel establish and execute effective sales strategies that drive the achievement of regional vehicle sales targets
  • Support dealers in managing their stock including effective stock ordering processes and analysis
  • Partner with dealers to maintain a focused and motivated dealer network
  • Monitor and enhance the capabilities and results of your assigned dealerships
  • Monitor market conditions, competitor actions and implement effective marketing strategies to generate appropriate levels of customer enquiry
  • Provide assistance with sales management, sales process and product training

\xc2\xa0

What You'll Need to Join Our Team

  • Account Management / Business Development experience in automotive, or, a related industry
  • Tertiary qualification in Business / Commerce would be well regarded
  • Excellent knowledge of dealer operations and associated industry KPI's
  • Proven track record of career achievement in a sales related environment
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills including ability to build strong business relationships
  • Ability to analyse and use data to make decisions and recommendations
  • Be goal orientated and have strong personal drive
  • Ability to work in a dynamic environment managing multiple requirements
  • High level PC based skills (particularly MS Office Suite)

\xc2\xa0

What we Offer

Mitsubishi Motors Australia Limited offers a competitive remuneration and benefits package and the opportunity to work within a very dynamic environment. You'll also receive all the tools to do the role successfully including a company car and opportunity for lease vehicles once applicable.

To apply please click the "apply for this job" button below.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Tests Administrative Officer
description:
b'
  • Dynamic, friendly and professional environment with great conditions

\xc2\xa0

UNSW Global is a not-for-profit and wholly owned enterprise of The University of New South Wales (UNSW) and provides English language preparation programs and pre-university Foundation programs for students wishing to study at UNSW. These programs are designed specifically for students with an international education background.

The Tests Administrative Officer is responsible for providing administrative and logistical support for the high stakes English language tests offered by the UNSW Global testing service. This role requires an organized, proactive administration professional with exceptional communication skills.

The successful candidate will possess:

  • Highly developed administrative and organisational skills in a high volume work environment, including ability to multi-task
  • Effective oral and written communication skills and cross-cultural awareness

'

title: B2B advertising sales manager
description:
b'

About the business and the role

Are you a B2B advertising sales professional looking for that next step in your career?

Our client Inside HR is a niche publishing business with a well-known and respected brand in the business media sector. The brand and platform are well established and we are looking to find the right person to help capitalise on this through commercialising revenue opportunities, and building a sustainable foundation for the continued growth of the brand. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in a similar role or be able to clearly demonstrate why this role is a match for them.

Job tasks and responsibilities

You will:

  • Require a self-starter attitude and be willing to take the initiative in generating sales with a potentially large client base
  • Take a relationship-based selling approach to developing and realising sales targets and opportunities.
  • Deliver revenue to achieve agreed monthly, quarterly and annual budgets
  • Ensure best practice standards are upheld on site reporting and campaign delivery/optimisation and analysis.

Skills and experience

Essential requirements for this role

  • Minimum 2-5+ years of B2B print, digital media and events sales experience, preferably publisher side, operating at a junior-mid level
  • Experience in developing/managing senior level stakeholder relationships and negotiations
  • Solid understanding of web, mobile, native, data, ad tech and analytics/reporting platforms in the digital media industry
  • Understanding of best practice around ad sales, delivering and reporting to clients/agencies
  • Understanding of premium media, video, social and data opportunities
  • Experience with diversifying products into other revenue related opportunities such as events

Preferred requirements for this role

  • Degree in Business, Marketing, Media or Communications
  • Experience in media ad sales, programmatic sales and/or social media ad unit sales, eg sponsored posts, Twitter amplify etc.
  • Experience in product management and/or sales management in the print and digital advertising space
  • Strong agency and client awareness of product and network opportunities, differentiators, and market positioning

Job benefits and perks

The remuneration package is negotiable for the right person and will include a competitive salary, superannuation and commission. An immediate start is available for the right candidate.

If you feel this is the role for you please send a brief cover letter and CV to editor@insidehr.com.au.

'

title: Map Info or GIS Mapping Whiz
description:
b"

About GDR

GDR Group is a\xc2\xa0a full-service marketing firm that specialises in seamless, end-to-end marketing solutions.\xc2\xa0

title: Administration Officer, Community Palliative Care Services
description:
b'

About HammondCare

HammondCare is an independent Christian charity that exists to improve quality of life for people in need.

We specialise in aged and dementia care, palliative care, rehabilitation, cancer rehabilitation and mental health services for older people, and other related health and aged care services.\xc2\xa0 HammondCare seeks to embed evidence based best practice in its services and we provide these services through home care, sub-acute hospitals and residential aged care.\xc2\xa0

Bringing these health, hospital and aged care services together, HammondCare has been able to develop innovative, flexible care models designed to serve people with complex health or aged care needs, regardless of their circumstances.\xc2\xa0

HammondCare works to provide its staff with support, career development opportunities, education, responsibility and recognition, work/life balance, and satisfying roles.

More about the role

The role of the Administration Officer \xe2\x80\x93 Community works within the Mission and Mission in Action of HammondCare to ensure the provision of high level secretarial and administrative support services for the units Clinical Services under direction of the Service Director.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

The essence of this role:

  • Complete administrative activities associated with admissions and discharges of patients.
  • Timely with bookings for clinics and appointments
  • Key person for enquiries for the service and face to face contact for patients, visitors and staff
  • Triage client telephone enquiries
  • Maintain accurate medical records and process data on patients

About you

  • Commitment to engage and align with HammondCare's Christian Mission, Motivation and Mission in Action.
  • Demonstrated ability to provide high level administrative and organisational support in a health environment.
  • Demonstrated administrative capabilities.
  • Demonstrated problem solving, prioritisation and communication skills.
  • Comprehensive experience in working in a flexible, multi-skilled team environment, where high level interpersonal, communication and customer service skills are key factors to effective operation.
  • Capable of working autonomously and effectively following directions.
  • Application skills in Health Information Systems plus Microsoft Office Suite of products.
  • Empathy and patience.
  • Multicultural sensitivity and/or experience working in a multicultural setting (desirable).
  • Understanding Medical Terminology (desirable).

HammondCare offers its staff competitive salaries, excellent training & development opportunities, a supportive environment and a fabulous benefits program. For more info check out our website: www.hammond.com.au/careers

Ready to make a change? Apply Now!

For an information pack, including the selection criteria, and details on how to apply, please click on link below or see our website: www.hammond.com.au/careers

For any specific queries not answered by the information pack, please contact Gerry Dixon on 0412 825 901.

Closing Date: 26 May 2017

All short listed applicants for these positions will be asked to consent to a criminal r

'

title: eCommerce Manager
description:
b"

As a CRM expert, you are looking for an eCommerce role that focuses on increasing a brands membership base through data, loyalty & customer insights. This is a fantastic opportunity in Australia's largest womenswear retailer and an ASX listed business.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Your New Career

As a forward thinking eCommerce professional you have the mindset of a \xe2\x80\x98shopper' and want to innovatively drive growth of the Millers brand by developing and managing a site that delivers on the vision of customer experience.


With ownership of the online channel, this is an exciting opportunity to develop and drive e-commerce and digital marketing where the customer is at the centre of everything we do. There is already a huge date base of 2.4 million members of which 80% have actively \xe2\x80\x98shopped' this season. However, there is a huge opportunity for growth in terms of site optimisation through strategic SEO, SEM & data analytics.


You would describe yourself, as a \xe2\x80\x98trader' who is motivated and engaged to drive targets and build a team to achieve sales and provide creative solutions to areas of the digital function that need improving.

\xc2\xa0

This is a hands on role ensuring that the website content is managed, maintained and available 24/7.

You will have a can do attitude, be willing to take risks and have sound business acumen with P&L responsibility.

\xc2\xa0

We are looking for:

  • 6-8+ years' experience within an eCommerce environment preferably in the Fashion industry;
    • Highly competent in digital strategy, including website management, content development; social media, eCRM, mobile, online advertising, blogger engagement/outreach, SEM/SEO, online customer acquisition and user experience.
    • Experience managing a customer database, segmentation modelling and driving consumer insights
    • Proven ability to manage, trade and grow an online retail business
    • Highly collaborative with excellent strategic problem solving skills
    • Personal engagement in Digital Marketing + Social Media best practices
    • Experience and a strong acquisition track record focused on affiliates, resellers, SEM, SEO, Abandon Cart etc.
    • Ability to lead and motivate a team

\xc2\xa0

In turn you will be reporting directly into a brand GM and have the opportunity to work in and for a classic Australian brand that celebrates the unsung heroes; your mum, aunt, sister & grandmother. This is a unique, high profile and rare chance to affect real change, drive results.

\xc2\xa0

Your New Destination

A reliable brand that appreciates value fashion for an ageless customer, Millers continues to transform and expand with new-look stores and other initiatives on the horizon. At the heart of Millers is making real women feel special through affordable and thoughtful fashion.

\xc2\xa0

Millers are part of Specialty Fashion Group - an ASX leading, specialty apparel retailer with over 1,000 stores and 7,000 Team Members across Australia, New Zealand, South Africa & the USA. Through our fantastic brands \xe2\x80\x93 Autograph, City Chic, Crossroads, Katies, Millers, OneWoman and Rivers \xe2\x80\x93 our purpose is to be a global market leader that changes the perception of fashion.

\xc2\xa0

SFG are all about game changers who are customer centric. If this is you get in contact with our talent team who are waiting to connect with you!

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Logistics Specialist
description:
b'

Stockade Brew Co is one of the fastest growing and most creative craft breweries in Australia and there's a reason for this;

  • We LOVE what we do
  • We have the best time doing it
  • We thrive on organised chaos

If you're a thinker, like to challenge the status quo but still\xc2\xa0a team player\xc2\xa0and\xc2\xa0looking for a career with a business which will truly values your input then\xc2\xa0you'll fit in just fine with us. To be honest, when you land this job, you'll\xc2\xa0wake up every day and look forward to the day ahead, including all the challenges it throws at you!

\xc2\xa0

ABOUT THE ROLE

This\xc2\xa0role will be based at SBC HQ in Marrickville but may start out at our brewery in Narellan as we transition to new digs in the inner west.\xc2\xa0This role is really just about 2 things;\xc2\xa0precise numbers and great communication.\xc2\xa0We offer plenty of opportunity to grow and\xc2\xa0progress within the business and you will be a key player in the super growth of Stockade. Your day-to-day tasks will include;

- Being an awesome human being
- Processing daily orders
- Maintaining CRM data
- Daily communication\xc2\xa0with the field sales team
- Ensuring all stock is delivered without incident
- Communicating with storage and transport partners
- Maintaining appropriate stock data
- Working closely with the Operations Manager to maintain production levels\xc2\xa0in-line with growth
- Running regular inventory checks and reporting on\xc2\xa0a regular basis
- General office admin - answering the phone, stationary orders, post office runs, etc
- From time to time you may be asked to help out in the arts and craft\xc2\xa0department, cutting, glueing, making, sticking, painting, etc but this is a non-essential and only if you like doing something different every now and then to break up your day

\xc2\xa0

ABOUT YOU (ESSENTIAL)

You must be adept with technology. We run everything in the cloud, on mac laptops using a suite of different apps to make our lives easier. A thorough knowledge of spreadsheets is a must.\xc2\xa0If you don't pick stuff\xc2\xa0up quickly, this place will kill your life.\xc2\xa0You\xc2\xa0have a "can-do", problem-solver\xc2\xa0attitude and the ability to manage your time effectively so deadlines are adhered to. It is extremely\xc2\xa0important you are the kind of person who is obsessive about accurate numbers and attention to detail - almost to the point of being compulsively driven to ensure reports are on point.

\xc2\xa0

PERKS OF THE JOB

Culture - This is not a politically correct office and if you don't think that's a perk, you're not the right person for the job.\xc2\xa0We work in a\xc2\xa0loud open plan office where you can work from the couch, a desk, a bar-top or the floor. Everything is based in the cloud and information and ideas are shared with extreme encouragement. We value your\xc2\xa0input. We listen. We reward.

Free\xc2\xa0Apple Music Account - yep, free streaming and downloads

Free Beer - Is this stating the obvious?

Travel & Events - We meet up with the whole team from around the country a few times a year. We spend our days talking about beery\xc2\xa0stuff and our nights partying. In addition, we're always doing all kinds of festivals (music, art, food, wine/beer, etc) and, more often than not, you'll have free access to these.

'

title: Territory Manager - Endoscopy (NSW) - 12 month contract
description:
b'

Cook Medical is a global industry leader committed to improving medical care worldwide. \xc2\xa0

We are seeking the services of a dedicated Sales professional for a 12 month maternity leave contract, to be\xc2\xa0based in Sydney.

The successful applicant will join our highly successful Endoscopy Team and look after a Sydney Metropolitan and Central Coast territory.\xc2\xa0

About this role:

Reporting to the National Sales Manager, this role focuses on sales and technical support for Endoscopy products. Working as part of a talented and dedicated team, your responsibilities will be to initiate and develop relationships with Clinical Specialists while achieving solid growth in sales.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Initiate interpersonal communication and establish rapport with clinical medical specialists, nurses and other healthcare professionals.
  • Provide excellent sales and technical support for endoscopy products in assigned hospital accounts.
  • Analyse sales reports to identify business opportunities and risks to ensure effective management of customer base.

Key Requirements:

  • Previous experience in sales in a related field; such as medical devices, pharmaceuticals or related healthcare roles.
  • Ability to absorb and process technical data in a business setting.
  • Time management, analytical, planning and prioritisation skills are essential.
  • Compliance with COOK Code of Conduct and maintenance of high ethical standards.
  • A paramedical or nursing background will be well regarded.
  • Occasional interstate travel is required.

Cook can offer:

  • An opportunity for you to join a company who is committed to improving medical care.
  • An attractive package including monthly car allowance.
  • A culture that supports personal growth and continuous learning.

Cook as an employer:

Cook Medical is the largest privately owned Medical Manufacturing Company in the world, with the Head Quarters located in Bloomington, Indiana. COOK employs over 10,000 staff worldwide - together we create, manufacture and sell minimally invasive medical devices.

Endoscopy

The Endoscopy team is one of the larger Business Units at Cook Australia. This team sells Interventional Technologies that enhance efficient diagnoses and provide effective treatment for patients with biliary pancreatic and esophageal/colonic/gastric diseases.

With Cook Medical celebrating over 50 years of success, there is no better time to join the team. The future of medical care has never been more exciting.

If you would like to know more about Cook Medical please visit http://www.cookmedical.com.

If you are an experienced sales person wishing to gain experience in Medical Devices with a highly regarded company and possess all the requirements above, please apply now!

'

title: BMS/DDC Engineering Consultant | Integration | Design | Project Manage | Partner
description:
b"

BMS/DDC Engineering Consultant | Integration | Design | Project Manage | Partners
Sydney, CBD, New South Wales

My client is an expanding private, employee owned, independent BMS, Integration and specialist technology solutions business offering both technical consulting services for Audit, Design, Technical Project Management and Performance Optimisation as well as highly innovative Integrated Platform turnkey solutions in Australia and New Zealand.

Their goal is to apply \xe2\x80\x9cbest of breed\xe2\x80\x9d technology to improve the built environment for all stakeholders, constantly pushing the boundaries to deploy commercially viable, innovative solutions within both existing and new building facilities.\xc2\xa0 The convergence of the IT world with BMS/DDC/Energy management/ELV systems is the focal point of the client\xe2\x80\x99s expertise, being technically advanced across this converged environment and at the leading edge of smart technology solutions development.

This opportunity fits someone who is already well down this \xe2\x80\x9cknowledge pathway\xe2\x80\x9d and can clearly see the rapid advancement of open data and communications designs to deploy \xe2\x80\x98Smart\xe2\x80\x99 building technical and innovative business solutions to building owners, operators and occupants.

The person is likely to be frustrated with limitations of traditionally designed and engineered solutions and now ready to exploit their well-developed technical BMS/DDC/HVAC/ (and possibly ICT) knowledge to play a key role as part of a highly innovative and technically advanced team.

The client has developed in depth knowledge in each of the key areas needed for leading edge technical and business solution development and implementation and possesses over 500 years of combined industry experience.

Due to sheer demand for their services and innovative solutions and coupled with sustained growth plans, my Client is now actively looking for a technically proficient BMS/DDC Engineering Consultant to join its successful team in Sydney.

Key Role/Responsibilities:

  • Complete in depth, comprehensive BMS/DDC/HVAC building audits & performance reviews.
  • Undertake BMS systems upgrade designs and provide strong technical oversight during implementation and commissioning of BMS contractors, representing building owners.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Produce high quality engineering documents and reports.
  • Quickly develop capability to undertake Integration Platform design requirements.
  • Manage contractors and current BMS Partners respectively. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0

Professional Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Ideally degree qualified, but direct industry experience can supersede providing a strong desire to add to professional qualification over time;
  • Must have permanent residency.

Skills and Experience

  • 6-10 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in the BMS industry with proven client technical engineering and project management performance for both small and large projects with multiple stakeholders.
  • Significant experience in design and delivery of large commercial, health or campus type BMS/DDC systems
  • Sound knowledge of all requirements for auditing, designing, implementing, commissioning and monitoring new BMS/ELV HVAC service improvements
  • Well-developed writing ability \xe2\x80\x93 for Client Proposals, Client Reports, Technical Design Documents, Client Presentation material and internal technical documentation
  • A sound working knowledge of related IT systems, communication protocols, and software applied in BMS/Systems Integration solutions.

Attitude is Everything:

My client is highly VALUES driven and its 7 core values are required to be \xe2\x80\x98lived\xe2\x80\x99 by all members of its close knitted team: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

  • Be honest and trustworthy
  • Understand, promote and deliver real value
  • Enjoy yourself and make it a good working environment for others
  • Learn, improve and innovate
  • Run to the problem
  • Listen with intent and build great relationships
  • Be flexible and adaptable

Benefits and Opportunity

Excellence and high performance is always rewarded by my Client.\xc2\xa0 With a staff profit share plan and longer term opportunities to share in company ownership interested applicants should be highly confident of the upside potential from this initial role. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0

To apply please send your CV to Grant Townsend by clicking the 'Apply Now' button below. (Reference Number )
AustCorp provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment in accordance with federal and state laws.
\xc2\xa0

"

title: SQL Report Writer/Application Support
description:
b"

As IT SQL Report Writer/Application Support your primary responsibility is to develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to streamline day to day and strategic business decisions and also provide support on business application where necessary to improve business operations.

Client Details

My client is a number one leading retailer that actively promotes a customer first culture!

Description

  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using SSRS, Microsoft Power BI and other reporting tools
  • Develop and maintain integration jobs using SSIS to manage interfaces between 3rd party/external applications
  • Understand complex stored procedure, SQL queries and table structures in order to provide information to business
  • Maintain company Data Warehouse and improve visibility of data where necessary (i.e. through cubes) to provide required information to business
  • Provide support on business applications when necessary. As part of the support role, ensure adequate back-up skills exist within the department

  • Increase IT knowledge level of users by assisting educating new users into the business on the relevant IT system applications

Profile

  • 3+ year experience in SSRS report development must
  • Strong experience with Transact SQL query and Stored Procedure skill
  • Experience in SSIS, Data cubes and SQL server 2008 and upper
  • Knowledge on Microsoft Power BI an added advantage.
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills with good documentation practice
  • Individual that demonstrates initiative and has the ability to adapt to changing priorities
  • Technical aptitude - ability to grasp technical concepts and details.

Job Offer

  • Location: Mascot

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact [Sarah] [Johnson] on [+612 8292 2063].

title: Administration Officer, Rehabilitation Services
description:
b'

About HammondCare

HammondCare is an independent Christian charity that exists to improve quality of life for people in need.

We specialise in aged and dementia care, palliative care, rehabilitation, cancer rehabilitation and mental health services for older people, and other related health and aged care services.\xc2\xa0 HammondCare seeks to embed evidence based best practice in its services and we provide these services through home care, sub-acute hospitals and residential aged care.\xc2\xa0

Bringing these health, hospital and aged care services together, HammondCare has been able to develop innovative, flexible care models designed to serve people with complex health or aged care needs, regardless of their circumstances.\xc2\xa0

HammondCare works to provide its staff with support, career development opportunities, education, responsibility and recognition, work/life balance, and satisfying roles.

More about the role

The role of the Administration Officer \xe2\x80\x93 Rehabilitation Services (Level 3) works within the Mission and Mission in Action of HammondCare to ensure the provision of high level administrative support services to the unit and the community team ensuring the smooth operation of administrative systems and communication processes within the service.

The essence of this role:

  • Face to face contact for patients/families/carers and staff
  • Admitting, transferring and discharging patients, following completion of documentation by Multidisciplinary Team
  • Timely with bookings for clinics and appointments
  • Maintaining accurate medical records and processing data on patients

About you

  • Commitment to engage and align with HammondCare's Christian Mission, Motivation and Mission in Action.
  • Demonstrated ability to provide high level administrative and organisational support in a health environment.
  • Demonstrated administrative capabilities.
  • Demonstrated problem solving, prioritisation and communication skills.
  • Comprehensive experience in working in a flexible, multi-skilled team environment, where high level interpersonal, communication and customer service skills are key factors to effective operation.
  • Capable of working autonomously and effectively following directions.
  • Application skills in Health Information Systems plus Microsoft Office Suite of products.
  • Empathy and patience.
  • Multicultural sensitivity and/or experience working in a multicultural setting (desirable).
  • Understanding Medical Terminology (desirable).

HammondCare offers its staff competitive salaries, excellent training & development opportunities, a supportive environment and a fabulous benefits program. For more info check out our website: www.hammond.com.au/careers

Ready to make a change? Apply Now!

For an information pack, including the selection criteria, and details on how to apply, please click on link below or see our website: www.hammond.com.au/careers

For any specific queries not answered by the information pack, please contact Tina Long on 0417 450 941.

Closing Date: 26 May 2017

All short listed applicants for these positions will be asked to consent to a criminal record check.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

title: Account Executive
description:
b'

At Optus our vision is to continue to lead Australia through outstanding customer experience and we believe our people are at the heart of this. We are passionate about creating a climate that encourages our people to achieve their best - personally and professionally!

We have an opportunity for an Account Executive to join our Consumer Team based in either Melbourne or Adelaide. The primary function of the Account Executive role is to manage and develop Channel Partners and their Sales Teams and support staff, to achieve individual Partner and overall sales, NPS, compliance and quality targets. Maximizing opportunities to grow sales capability across all sale categories drive efficiencies and channel optimization while delivering high standards of customer service

Reporting to the Channel Manager, the Account Executive will specifically focus on the development (in conjunction with the Channel Manager), implementation and improvement of tactical and strategic plans to acquire and retain Channel Partners market share across all products including mobile voice and data, fixed wire - voice, broadband, data, entertainment and digital business, within the consumer and Small to Medium business sector. This covers both acquisition, migration and retention of customers across the above product suites.

The development of a strong, compliant and effective relationship with each Channel Partner is vital in achieving the required goals. It is expected that a strong commercial and operational focus will be brought to the role to ensure channel viability and growth. The challenge with Channel Partners will be the size complexity and multi locations, requiring a strong commercial understanding and the ability to influence at all levels of an organization.

Frequent engagement, coaching support and daily/weekly performance discussions with the external leadership team will be key to the success and evolution of the partners.

Experience:

  • Leadership background in Contact Centre Sales and Customer Experience (min 2 yrs)
  • Experience managing Vendors and Business Partner contracts/relationships (BPO)
  • Strong analytical skills; ability to turn insights in to actions and SMART goals
  • Strong interpersonal, motivational & development skills, especially with regard to influencing people not directly reporting to you

At Optus we have a variety of benefits including discounts on Optus products and services, salary packaging, sustainable transport options, career development tools and lifestyle benefits. For more information on what Optus can offer you, please visit optus.com.au/careers and click on "Working at Optus". #LI-NV1

Heads Up!!
Due to the fast paced nature of the Optus business, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change. Don\xe2\x80\x99t delay, make sure you apply as soon as possible. We will assess applications as they are received.
One last thing, Optus operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions, sorry folks.

'

title: Client & Marketing Coordinator
description:
b'

Client & Marketing Coordinator

Companion Systems is looking for an energetic person to join our team, interacting with all aspects of our business.

Responsibilities

Customer health checks.

You will call our customers on a quarterly basis doing our software system health checks. The health check is a friendly call to make sure our customers are not experiencing difficulties with the system that we can help them resolve, if they may need extra training services, how their business is going, changes in staff, etc. It also includes updating our database with changed or missing information about their company and contacts.

Information researching.

Finding out details about individual businesses and their management teams or industries as a whole. This will include calling companies to gather information for directed personalised communications, creating databases from association membership information, working through purchased lists, etc.

Web maintenance.

Drafting of content for inclusion in our web sites across the international markets and industries we are working with or targeting.

Publication media editing.

Drafting our brochures, user work books, print media ads, advertorials, etc. to look great and consistent.

Information updating.

This involves the updating of data and information in our demonstration databases for customer demonstrations.

Events

Coordinating the events we hold for our customers to attend including sending invitations, producing handouts, registering attendees, liaising with facility providers, etc.

Social media.

Managing our social media feeds, followings and announcements. Updating our profiles across social media platforms and doing a bit of the fun stuff like running competitions, writing blogs, etc.

Culture & position

People join our business who have an attention to detail and respect the value of customer support. We look for excellent verbal and written communications as we deal with industries that are not technology focused but are technology dependant, so we need to speak their language.

This is an entry level, full-time position within our growing company. With success in this role, future opportunity to move into our sales, marketing, customer services or development teams would be available.

You

You will need to be able to demonstrate fantastic communication skills and an understanding of social media usage to progress through the interviewing process. These two attributes we can't teach you, you have to have yourself. Training on all other aspects of the role will be provided.

We are based in Parramatta CBD and work normal business hours Monday to Friday.

If you are interested in this career opportunity, please submit a cover letter highlighting your suitability for the role and a resume in strict confidence.

Applications should be sent via Seek only.

Due to limited resources, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

No recruitment agencies to respond please.

'

title: SENIOR BI LEAD - Technical/Stakeholder Management/Projects!!
description:
b'\xc2\xa0

  • Location: Alexandria
  • $120-130k + Super Neg.
  • PLEASE NOTE: QuikView experience a must!
An Aussie retail corporate giant with operating subsidiaries in Australia and New Zealand -\xc2\xa0over 350 stores across different retail chains and exclusive distribution rights for 13 international brands across Australia and New Zealand.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Reporting to the Head of IT, your role will be to drive and lead the Business Intelligence solutions and reporting within the organisation, and manage all aspects around growth, development and support of this platform for the multiple business divisions.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Key Responsibilities:
  • Consulting with management, sales , buying, operations and Inventory Analysts to determine information needs, data flows and system definitions and requirements
  • Taking ownership of BI projects assigned and supporting other developers in completing tasks.\xc2\xa0
  • Ensuring reporting runs within timeframes and is aligned to company required deadlines.
  • Working with all levels of development from analysis through to implementation and support.
  • Interpreting business needs of stakeholders and develop analytical solutions
  • Carrying out quality assessment of data, data reports and the accompanying decisions.
  • Working in partnership with the Data Warehouse team and other stakeholders concerning the accuracy of data and efficiency of processes.
  • Resolving end user reporting problems through collaboration with IT and Operations.
  • Create technical and maintenance documentation for reports and end user training as needed.
  • Using reporting expertise to identify varying ways to analyze data to help drive to root cause of issues.\xc2\xa0 Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistical tools, ability to identify trends and create reports as required by business needs.
  • Maintaining a solid understanding of what is new and innovative in the market with Business Intelligence, and utilize to drive improvements and positive change.
  • Ensuring backups are conducted on a regular and cyclical pattern so that records can be restored should the system fail or data become corrupted by operator error.

Key Requirements:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Formal qualifications in IT
  • 5+ years BI Database Analyst experience
  • Strong Data Warehousing experience utilizing SSAS and SSIS

  • Experience in ERP systems - Erply, Pronto, AP21 (preferable)

  • Proven ability to interpret business requirements into technical and analytical solutions
The company culture is one of collaboration to drive commercial outcomes. The team are enthusiastic with a great interest in achieving personal and professional goals.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
This is a true opportunity to shine and be rewarded!! '

title: Marketing Associate
description:
b"

The Opportunity

Due to significant growth we are seeking a junior candidate to join our well established marketing and distribution team. The right candidate will possess drive and ambition with a passion for marketing and investment management.

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone keen to start their sales & marketing career in funds management and work from the ground up. A focus on client engagement will ensure you are constantly learning in this varied and rewarding role.

This role has the opportunity to progress into other positions within the firm.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist marketing team set up and execute digital campaigns for our affiliated investment managers. This includes, but is not limited to email, webinar and social media marketing
  • Organise recurring monthly boardroom luncheons for our investment managers
  • Assist marketing team with maintenance and data mining of Salesforce
  • Assist marketing team assess effectiveness of campaigns using various analytical tools
  • Maintain and update websites as needed for our affiliated investment managers
  • Various ad hoc responsibilities
  • Prepare fund facts sheets and manager collateral

The Successful Candidate:

To be considered for this opportunity, we require:

  • A Graduate degree in either Marketing, Communication, Commerce or Business with excellent academic results
  • Proficiency in Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Drive and ambition, with a passion for marketing and investing
  • A positive, mature, and 'can do' approach to your work
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • You must be an Australian citizen or hold PR to be considered for this role

About The Company

Pinnacle Investment Management Group Limited (ASX:PNI) is a leading Australian-based multi-affiliate investment management firm. Our mission is to establish, grow and support a diverse stable of world-class investment management firms.

Pinnacle currently consists of seven investment management firms that collectively manage over A$25 billion in assets across a diverse range of asset classes. Our affiliated managers operate autonomously, in line with our philosophy that 'supported independence' is an essential ingredient in sustaining investment excellence and business resilience over the long term. Pinnacle investment managers: - Antipodes Partners Limited (global and Asian equities, both hedged and long-only) - Hyperion Asset Management Limited (growth-style Australian equities) - Palisade Investment Partners Limited (Australian unlisted infrastructure) - Plato Investment Management Limited (quantitative equities) - Resolution Capital Limited (global real estate securities) - Solaris Investment Management Limited ('style neutral' Australian equities) - Spheria Asset Management ( small / microcap Australian equities)

Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

title: Social Media Manager
description:
b'

This role exists to build, nurture and activate our Collective Hub community across different social platforms. Collective Hub has quickly built a thriving and active social media community, and you'll be here to understand, engage, and connect with more like minded people, companies, and brands.

Collective Hub is a multimedia brand that encompasses engaging print and digital content, bespoke events, strategic collaborations and unique product extensions. Founded by the vibrant, game-changing entrepreneur Lisa Messenger with a vision to uplift and empower people to live their lives to the fullest.\xc2\xa0

You'll see that at Collective Hub, we're curious, purposeful and deliberately conscious about everything we do/say/share as a voice in the media landscape. This would be just some of the reasons you'd love to work with us.\xc2\xa0

More on the role:\xc2\xa0

  • Create bespoke, shareable content and adapt this content specifically for each social platform
  • Create a consistent and continuous posting schedule for advanced and real time posting and ensure all content is of a high standard and is high quality always!
  • Work with the digital team to develop a solid content and engagement strategy keeping the community active, sharing and delighted
  • Create systemised, efficient process for collecting, curating, scheduling content and responding to communications from the community. Ensuring the team has visibility over the content plan
  • Be creative with an eye for design
  • Be a news and trends junkie, ensuring systems are in place to monitor, find amazing content inspiration, people and brands to follow, and the latest trends to report
  • Proactively work with the Marketing team to ensure you are across upcoming events, interviews, and any opportunity that will be great to share with the community
  • Ensure there is content created for social purposes at all Collective Hub events
  • Continuously engage with the Collective Hub community and ensure all posts and communications have a consistent Collective Hub voice
  • Use social media monitoring tools to identify influential accounts to follow and engage with
  • Monitor a defined group of #hashtags and accounts and engage where relevant
  • Monitor and engage with Collective Hub ambassadors and potential ambassadors
  • Facilitate and start discussions and encourage the community to talk to each other
  • Use good judgement and have a sound understanding of comment etiquette \xc2\xa0
  • Work directly with the partnerships team to ensure all paid social media advertising fits within the organic strategy
  • Plan, execute, monitor and report on promotions and campaigns
  • Project manage internal requirements for social posting
  • Manage and foster relationships directly with the main social networks
  • Use different analytics tools to monitor community growth, content performance, engagement and community profiles and report back to the team in a visually pleasing manner
  • ENJOY data, analyse data, draw real actionable insights and provide recommendations
  • To ensure the overall performance is continually improving you will be consistently testing! Testing new content, new copy, new campaigns, new images
  • Stay abreast of industry developments by seeking out and monitoring industry news, commentary, trends, and strategies surrounding "social media" on a regular basis
  • Keep up to date with emerging trends, technology providers and social media tools available in the market
  • Share knowledge with the team

Skills and experience required:

  • Experience across the major social networks and a solid grasp of best practices in social media
  • Excellent copywriting / writing ability
  • Design skills, a good eye, and a passion for creativity
  • A solid understanding and best practise use of tagging, hashtags, and search tools
  • Ability to learn and master new technology platforms
  • Be passionate about connecting people, and passionate about the Collective Hub
  • Ability to use data and analytics tools (Google Analytics, Facebook Insights etc)
  • Excellent use of Microsoft Excel
  • Experience in content asset management and a strong grasp of the different formats/specifications for content across different platforms
  • Ability and initiative to self-learn, research and apply
  • Strong organisational and project management skills
  • High emotional intelligence and awareness to be able to manage a large community
  • Experience in running paid social media advertising on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
  • Experience in developing and improving internal processes to increase efficiencies
  • Effectively take ownership and responsibility, ensuring visibility of data and reporting

The beauty and exciting part of social media is that it always changes and evolves.

Want to join the team?\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

Send your cover letter and CV, along with any supporting information you think we'd enjoy, to careers@collectivehub.com with 'Social Media Manager' in the subject.\xc2\xa0

We hire with our overall culture in mind and always appreciate extra effort and creativity in applications.\xc2\xa0

Good luck!

**Only successful applicants will be contacted for interviews**

'

title: NA
description:
b"\xc2\xa0Our client is one of the country's largest facility services providers who work across commercial, government, healthcare, and transportation sectors. Our client is a global company and has a strong presence in Australia with offices in every State and their teams are built up of high performing individuals who have local knowledge and a high level of technical expertise. You will be responsible for:
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Customer Service and Relationship Management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Critical environment and data centre management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facility Management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Financial Management\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Compliance

To be successful in this position, you will be an experienced and action-oriented facilities manager with experience in managing critical environments.\xc2\xa0Additionally you will also bring;

\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in all aspects of operational services within critical environments in a corporate environment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proven track record of contract and contractor management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Leadership experience with managing and motivating teams and staff performance
\xe2\x80\xa2 Engineering or trade qualifications in mechanical/an or Electrical industries
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Microsoft office suite and CMMS
\xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional planning, organising, and analytical skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to delivery under pressure and maintain client and stakeholder relationships

Please call\xc2\xa0Grant Rogers or Emma Lines\xc2\xa0on\xc2\xa093628500\xc2\xa0 for more information or email your CV to\xc2\xa0elines@goughrecruitment.com.au\xc2\xa0All applications will be held in the strictest of confidence. Only those with the right to work in Australia need apply. "

title: Inside Sales Support
description:
b"

This leading distributor of fibre optic infrastructure products and data centre solutions is looking for an experienced Inside Sales\xc2\xa0Support person\xc2\xa0to support their growing team located in West Ryde.


You will also have some runs on the sales board gained\xc2\xa0from your experience in the Distribution or Telco worlds, be able to demonstrate your success in generating business through outbound calls and will be comfortable and excited by the ability to achieve monthly targets.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

On a day to day basis you will:
  • Support the Interstate and local Sales representatives in their day to day activities.
  • Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails
  • Identify sales leads and escalate them to external sales staff
  • Receive inbound customer sales inquiries and provide quotations, product / service information, support and pricing details in response to inbound enquiries, promoting the features and benefits of the company's products / services
  • Process sales orders and arrange the dispatch and administration of products / services sold
  • Receive, manage or escalate customer complaints related to the sale of the company's products / services

To be successful in this role, you will need the following skills and behaviours:

  • Strong sales orientation and committed to excellent Customer service
  • Past experience supporting a Sales team.
  • Ability to develop strong working relationships with key contacts within client/vendor\xc2\xa0 organisations
  • A very high attention to detail and use to working to tight deadlines
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Knowledge of Fibre Optic technology with a willingness to continually upskill in this area
  • Calm under pressure
  • Ability to prioritise and use initiative
If this sounds like the perfect role for you, then please apply today with a copy of your updated CV in word format.
"

title: Expenses Administrator
description:
b"This large, ASX listed business based in the heart of the city are renowned for their excellent culture and flexible work environment.\xc2\xa0

This role sits in head office and is the key point of contact for the new Concur expense management system.

You won't be processing expenses yourself, the role centres around answering queries, assisting with system updates and maintenance, making sure policy is understood and employees are compliant.\xc2\xa0

More specifically:
    • Manage the Concur administration and maintenance processes to safeguard integrity of data and interfaces, and system stability and performance
    • Manage Corporate Card administration processes to support appropriate travel and business spend whilst protecting the company's transactional security
    • Act as Verifying & Authorising Officer for credit card approvals and limit applications as well as administration of suspensions and cancellations in a timely manner
    • Act as a Subject Matter Expert to provide credible support to users including maintaining training and support materials on the intranet as well as support the periodic service review with the Concur Account Manager
    • Ensure the Business Expense Policy (BEP) is understood across the business and monitor compliance with such - develop and review Concur reports and act as an escalation point for audit queries with the Accounts Payable Offshore team.
    • Ensure all SAP postings are fully supported by Concur / CBA reports and any reconciling items are managed on a timely basis
    • Support Accounts Payable Business Partner with expense management continuous improvement initiatives and support Accounts Payable activities as required
To be considered you will need excellent communication skills, a large company background and experience with expense management systems (ideally Concur).

Great salary on offer - $80,000 including super + bonus

Please apply ASAP as the role is shortlisting now, any questions please call Lauren Johnson on 02 9775 5913. "

title: Risk Analytics & Reporting Analyst
description:
b'

The Organisation

Our client is a renowned financial services provider of asset financing and fleet leasing solutions. As a group they are committed to continuously diversify the product range, advance the technology and deliver exceptional customer experience.

The Role

  • Working in a close-knit and high performing team, design, develop and implement risk scorecard and analytics models for the group\xe2\x80\x99s portfolio
  • Risk data consolidation and modelling
  • Produce analytical outcomes for management reporting
  • Provide insights for business decisioning
  • Validate and upgrade other statistical models and scorecards as required
  • Assist the risk management team in continuous framework review and refinement

The Requirements:

  • 3-5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in risk analytics, quant modelling or data engineering; preferably gained from a major Australian bank or financial institution
  • Tertiary qualification with a strong quantitate background in mathematics, statistics, actuarial, engineering or related
  • Proactive and results focused
  • Flexible and adaptive to change and innovation
  • Independent and critical problem solving abilities
  • Strong programming language skills - SAS, SQL, Tableau, R
  • Ability to incorporate applicable improvements on the established credit framework

If this position interests you, please submit a WORD version of your resume via the 'Apply Now' button or email. Or for further information please contact Eugena Gong at egong@ikasinternational.com, quoting reference ARC_RA1

If this job is not right for you but our specialisation in Finance Technology or Advisory, Risk & Compliance is, then please do contact us.

iKas International (Australia) Pty. Ltd. is providing recruitment services for this role.

"Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only."

'

title: Junior Compliance Engineer
description:
b"

Junior Compliance Engineer

A civil/remedial construction contractor in Sydney is looking for a full time junior engineer to assist with HSEQ compliance across all wastewater projects.

Ideally you will have a good understanding of the basic HSEQ legislation and compliance requirements for NSW.

You will be reporting to the HSE Coordinator and will be assisting, supporting and providing advice in relation to compliance requirements.

Your duties / responsibilities will include:

  • Weekly inspections of all project sites
  • Internal company audits
  • Assisting in the preparation and review of Quality and Safety Management Plans
  • Preparing SWMS in consultation with our work crews
  • Assisting with environmental monitoring
  • Assist with subcontractor and consultant management
  • Preparing Safety Alerts, when requested
  • Quality Management support for Senior Engineers and Project Managers
  • Client interaction during inspections and audits
  • Support the Systems Manager with ISO 9001 and AS 4801 management
  • Track and analyse data and audit results for the company
  • Archiving project records in accordance with the company procedure
  • Undertake inductions, tool box talks and training, when required
  • Managing SDS
  • Assist the WHS Manager with equipment management

About you:

  • Have qualifications in civil engineering
  • You must be a driven and proactive person who will drive initiatives within the company and support the HSE Coordinator in introducing improvements
  • Be confident speaking to a crew of workers and comfortable in communicating with all project delivery team members
  • You must have a driver's licence
  • Self-motivated

The following attributes would be desirable:

  • Have good basic knowledge of the WHS Regulation and Act within a civil engineering and construction environment
  • Demonstrated experience in a civil engineering construction project
  • Experience in auditing and inspecting workplaces
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
  • Organised with exceptional attention to detail

If you meet the criteria and would like to become part of the Metrocorp Team please email your resume to contact@metrocorp.com.au . For any further information or if you have any questions please call 9540 3455 during business hours.

"

title: Customer Service Representative
National Marketing Manager
description:
b"

ABOUT THE COMPANY:\xc2\xa0

Our client is one of Australia's most respected, leading wholesale and now retail\xc2\xa0fashion brands. They're recognised for signature elements and inventive classicism\xc2\xa0that captures\xc2\xa0the imagination of style leaders around the country since it has launched. With there head office based in Sydney our client is after an experienced Marketing Manager to join there well cultured team.\xc2\xa0

ABOUT THE ROLE: \xc2\xa0

As the National Marketing Manager\xc2\xa0you will be responsible for creating highly innovative marketing concepts and outcomes of the highest standard from concept through to execution. You will ensure marketing content is presented with an elevated, on brand look and feel, while developing out of the box ideas and concepts that lead to growth of the online and retail business.\xc2\xa0

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Develop a marketing strategy and manage execution from end to end
  • Budget planning, management and reporting
  • Complete marketing calendar, in line with promotions and marketing strategy
  • Overall responsibility for brand management and identity
  • Work closely and manage agencies
  • Coordinate new store launches
  • Manage all digital advertising
  • Deliver the Digital Marketing and sales plan and set KPI's
  • Manage traffic to the website/retail stores
  • Strong analytical research
  • Ensure all print marketing is delivered on time and to standard
  • Create and manage the loyalty program
  • Lead and manage the CRM activity and build customer retention
  • Manage the EDM platform
  • Develop relationships both internally and externally
  • Manage photoshoots and source the appropriate models
  • Overall management of the website and social media platforms
  • General admin, ore and post reporting through to stakeholders
  • Demonstrate leadership to inspire, coach and manage your team

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

  • 5+ years' experience working I a similar role for a fashion retailer
  • Proven Digital and General Marketing experience
  • Advanced Microsoft Office knowledge
  • Effective planning, organisation and time management skills
  • Previous experience in team leadership, management and motivating towards a vision \xc2\xa0
  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS and Javascript development constraints
  • Up to date on the latest trends and best online marketing practices
  • Data and analysis driven thinking
  • Experience in managing and negotiating with agencies

In return you will joining a growing, on trend brand and the opportunity to join a fun, fashionable and collaborative\xc2\xa0culture with great discounts.\xc2\xa0

"

title: National Retention Manager
description:
b"

\xc2\xa0

With a comprehensive range of finance, insurance and warranty solutions you will be working with one of Australia's leading vehicle finance corporations. We have a unique culture, business practices and work approaches that make Toyota Financial Services (TFA) such a successful company.

\xc2\xa0

Our Marketing Distributor Liaison & Loyalty Department located in our Head Office in St Leonards is currently seeking to appoint a National Retention Manager on a permanent fulltime basis. This is a pivotal role in driving change and performance across our Franchise of the Future initiative.

\xc2\xa0

Reporting to the General Manager - Marketing, Distributor Liaison & Loyalty, your responsibilities will include:

\xc2\xa0

  • Planning, implementation and management of the National Retention program, driving knowledge, understanding and performance among key stakeholders within TFA and Toyota Motor Corporation Australia (TMCA), and the Dealer network
  • Achieve monthly sales targets derived from Loyalty and Retention activity
  • Partner with the Regional Sales teams to deliver the National strategy at a state level
  • Coordinate and deliver face to face training programs to Regional Sales Teams to ensure they can effectively and efficiently perform their regional training obligations
  • Manage relationships with TMCA across new and used vehicles to ensure alignment to Franchise strategy
  • Develop a communications strategy to build retention based on customer insight and propensity modelling
  • Provide and communicate reporting to stakeholders on KPI and activity tracking
  • Facilitate National and Regional meetings as required to address ongoing support, sharing best practice and standards

\xc2\xa0

To ensure your success in this role, ideally you will have:

  • Demonstrated history of achievement within a National Sales environment (Essential)
  • Superior internal and external influencing and engagement skills, with experience in change management or project management (Essential)
  • Ability to analyse and rationalise performance data and develop strategic plans to reinforce objectives (Essential)
  • Comprehensive understanding of the end to end Retention or Loyalty process (Essential)
  • Comprehensive understanding of a Dealership operation and environment (Preferred)
  • Comprehensive understanding of Finance & Insurance products used within Automotive Dealerships (Preferred)
  • Excellent written and verbal presentation skills (Essential)

\xc2\xa0

In return, you will receive great benefits such as MY-CAR suite of benefits, financial support for relevant study and/or joining professional associations and networks to ensure you have a clear perspective of best practices in the market. Work life balance initiatives including paid parental leave.

\xc2\xa0

Successful candidates will be required to undergo background verification checks prior to commencement of employment.

\xc2\xa0

If you are keen to join an organisation that recognises people who add value to the business and this is the role you've been looking for, then please apply now!

"

title: Legal Receptionist/Administrator (VIETNAMESE FLUENT)
description:
b"

YOUR ROLE

As the 'front face' and 'first voice' of this high profile personal injury law firm, you will enjoy the variety of taking all incoming phone calls, assisting with client enquiries, English-Vietnamese interpretation, typing documents, data entry, filing, helping lawyers and general administration work.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Highly reputable firm;
  • Great opportunity to grow your legal administration/secretarial experience +use your Vietnamese language skills;
  • Job satisfaction +Rewarding opportunity to help injured clients;
  • Top quality mentorship;
  • Great team environment and inspiring leadership.

WHO YOU ARE

We are interested in hearing from you if you:

  • have had minimum 6 months+ reception/secretarial/administration experience [preferably\xc2\xa0in the legal industry];
  • are fluent in Vietnamese+ English [essential];
  • have excellent customer-service+ people skills;
  • are highly organized and can meet deadlines;
  • love to work in a vibrant, fast-paced environment;
  • have\xc2\xa0strong Microsoft Office (Word) skills+computer literate;
  • are able to commit full time for minimum 2-3 months (up to June/July 2017).

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Programmatic Account Manager
description:
b"

The Company

\xc2\xa0

A market leader with a global presence, these guys are \xc2\xa0the leading DMP in the travel space. Working with some of the world's largest travel brands, they provide actionable data insights which combine to form a powerful performance marketing platform!

\xc2\xa0

The Role

\xc2\xa0

This global player are looking to expand their operations across ANZ. As a cornerstone hire you would be tasked with managing lucrative client relationships across both agencies and brands.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

You'd be a product evangelist and would be comfortable discussing the technical elements of the platform with clients, as well as ensuring a great experience across the board.

\xc2\xa0

About You

\xc2\xa0

* Strong understanding of the digital media landscape- ideally programmatic

* Excellent client service skills and stakeholder management experience

\xc2\xa0

Ideally you'll be excited by the prospect of being an earlier hire in a rapidly growing company and will be keen to make a real impact in a key stage of this companies growth.

\xc2\xa0

If this sounds like you, please apply with an updated CV or shoot me a note directly at nbradish@round8.com

"

title: Sales Executive NSW
description:
b'

Fantastic opportunity for a super-star Sales Executive, who loves "hunting" and the thrill of closing deals, all whilst making a difference in someone\xe2\x80\x99s life!
\xc2\xa0
Carrera is excited to recruit exclusively for a highly reputable and forward thinking organisation that works within the Education & Training Sector, helping recent graduates to bridge the gap between University and Employment.
\xc2\xa0
As part of a small high performing sales team, the Sales Executive is responsible for managing and developing a direct report to build a pipeline of business, including management of the NSW territory.
\xc2\xa0
Critical to the success of the role will be a relentless focus on driving sales results to achieve and exceed targets each month.\xc2\xa0 This will be delivered initially through the efficient following up of leads as well as a drive to develop new sales channels and partners.
\xc2\xa0
Utilising your exceptional sales and business development ability, you will\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Deliver and exceed sales and margin targets
  • Create efficiencies and improvements to lead generation activity and follow up
  • Identify new growth opportunities with new partners
  • Work closely with Marketing to expand lead generation reach and activity to increase capability, and to position the business and its value proposition for prospective partners and customers
  • Develop new channels to market while maintaining margins and exceeding targets
  • Foster solid working relationships with all partners to achieve sustainable growth at appropriate margin levels
  • Use data to analyse trends and implement strategies to improve results
  • Lead, develop and motivate direct report to contribute substantively to territory and team targets

Is this role made for you?
\xc2\xa0
You are an energetic with a work hard, play hard attitude and enjoy a workplace where you can get involved in a bit of fun office banter with your colleagues! You are a high achieving team player, who is goal and action-orientated, with ability and desire to work towards activity and revenue targets, always conducting yourself in a professional manner.
\xc2\xa0
Prior experience working in a Business Development or Sales Management role is essential, with proven capabilities in achieving sales results, particularly in a high volume sales environment. Experience in the Education/Training sector is not essential. Both B2C or B2B sales background\xe2\x80\x99s will be considered.
\xc2\xa0
Want to hear more?
\xc2\xa0
To register your interest in this position, please send your resume in word format to Carrera by clicking apply. For a confidential discussion please call Belinda Sartori on 02 9410 4540 during business hours.

Only applications from Australian & New Zealand citizens, permanent residents and those holding valid visas allowing them to work in Australia will be considered.

'
