title: NA
description:
b'

MySale is a leading international online retailer with established online flash sales and retail websites in Australia, New Zealand, South-East Asia and the United Kingdom.\xc2\xa0Due to continued growth and success we now have an opportunity for a university graduate interested in email to join our team in Brookvale.\xc2\xa0

As Email Manager you are responsible for setting up and testing day-to-day email marketing campaign activities in a fast-paced environment. You\xc2\xa0will also assist with implementation of customer journey, segmenting and data driven marketing in line with\xc2\xa0business unit objectives across all markets and all websites.\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities Include:

Email Development

  • Set up and administer comprehensive email campaigns
  • Edit and maintain email templates utilising HTML +\xc2\xa0CSS
  • Conduct QA for all email campaigns to ensure that the creative, copy\xc2\xa0and links are correct
  • Test campaigns for rendering across email clients and gain approval from stakeholders
  • Deploy email campaigns to targeted subscriber lists through Responses +\xc2\xa0Alterian/SDL Email Manager platforms
  • Track progress of campaigns and update stakeholders
  • Track analytics to determine campaign success
  • Monitor email deliverability and make recommendations based on findings

Business Support

  • Support business units throughout the company with their email campaigns
  • Work with internal clients to clarify requirements and resolve issues with their email campaigns
  • Recommend best practices and processes
  • Reinforce industry and company standards for email marketing

About you:

  • You are a detailed and organised individual passionate about data and processes
  • Have the desire to provide email subscribers with a world-class experience
  • Are able\xc2\xa0to learn quickly and work efficiently with great attention to detail
  • Flexible\xc2\xa0and able\xc2\xa0to adapt to evolving business objectives
  • Basic ability to read and understand HTML

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Executive Level 2  Director / Technical Expert- Located in Canberra
description:
b'

Department of Human Services is home to one of the largest in-house IT operations in the southern hemisphere. The Chief Information Officer (CIO) Group needs to be flexible and agile to respond to the needs of Government and the department's customers. We are looking for people to join the ICT Infrastructure Division to drive change and transformation through pushing the boundaries in emerging and leading edge technologies.

We are looking for leaders and technical experts who can:

  • Drive the department's strategic direction to implement Automation and Orchestration or the adoption of bimodal application development and support.
  • Stretch boundaries further through proactive research and analysis of ways to introduce Artificial and Cognitive Intelligence into the current DHS Operating Model.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of Big Data and the potential it can offer the organisation.
  • Ensure that work programs are compliant with approved architectural directions and conform to the Technology and Strategic Plans. The Technical Expert will engage in directing and co-ordinating all technical aspects of the section. They will be acknowledged as the experts in the particular field of expertise.
  • Present on their area of expertise both internally and externally to their peers or at technical forums.

For details of the specific positions available please visit our careers page.\xc2\xa0

'

title: Personal Executive Assistant
description:
b"

Demonstrate your\xc2\xa0high level of integrity whilst you enhance the function and effectiveness of several senior Executives. A key focus of the role is helping to prioritise their day through the coordination and collation of data and information for the regularly scheduled board reports and meetings within the organisation. \xc2\xa0

Key Duties & Responsibilities

For the board:

  • An essential requirement of this position is your experience in preparation of board documentation,\xc2\xa0 requiring a high level of accuracy in typing and document preparation
  • Manage agendas, collating information and reports for meetings and follow-up actions.
  • Arrange and co-ordinate meetings and telephone conferences/video conferences and events on and off-site, end to end support from logistics and sites to catering for teams.
  • Take minutes, note actions and circulate to wider team, follow up on action items

For the senior executives

  • Action / address appropriate emails \xc2\xa0and manage diaries
  • Schedule meetings, organise catering, equipment, necessary documents and materials
  • Answer and screen phone calls
  • Organise all travel arrangements such as hotels, flights, visas, itineraries
  • Reconcile credit card transactions and invoices, coding to the correct area and cost centre
  • Demonstrate Safety Leadership to Coates Hire's Safety First - Zero Harm safety culture

Your Skills & Expertise will include:

  • Previous board support and executive assistance experience at a senior level a must
  • Strong time management, attention to detail and organisational skills
  • The ability to work with a high degree of confidentiality
  • Advanced skills across the Microsoft Office suite
  • The ability to engage and communicate across all levels of the organisation
  • Working autonomously and unsupervised, being proactive and planing ahead

This \xc2\xa0is a diverse, hands-on role which requires interpersonal skills, energy, attention to detail and above all, professionalism. Work with a motivated and collaborative team for a long standing, stable and trusted employer. Parking is provided in our Mascot head office. If you think you have what we need, we would love to hear from you. Please apply via the link with your CV and covering letter.

"

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
b'

Opteon is one of the largest independent property valuation and advisory organisations in Australia.\xc2\xa0 We are embarking on an exciting period of growth and change following the recently announced 'integrated business model', positioning Opteon as one of the most prominent property service providers in Australia and NZ.

The Role

Reporting to the GM Marketing & Client Relations you will be responsible for the development and implementation of the digital marketing strategy across all Opeton group businesses and will deliver strategic digital marketing campaigns, drive innovation and revenue through the digital marketing platforms and channels.\xc2\xa0 Other key responsibilites will include:

  • Maximise lead generation, conversions, acquisition and customer loyalty across multi channels including company websites
  • Implement SEO/SEM initiatives to drive online traffic to the company websites and other digital platforms
  • Implement a global company CRM platform
  • Responsible for all company websites including website design and layout to enhance SEO and user behaviour
  • Manage the end-to-end production of website assets to support the digital marketing strategy
  • Develop and implement a test and learn strategy across all digital marketing initiatives to deliver the best possible outcomes

The Candidate

The successful candidate will be a solutions focussed, entrepreneurial and innovative digital marketing professional with proven commerical expereince managing teams and working across multiple social media platform for B2B and B2C outcomes together with:

  • 5 to 10 years' expereince in a digital marketing or an agency environment
  • High level of experience in managing digital performance marketing channels and understanding of SEM & SEO and also CRM Platforms
  • Well-developed leadership skills with the proven ability to develop a high functioning team
  • Strong commercial acumen and an understanding of \xc2\xa0economic and industry activity and influences on data to improve business results
  • Experience using digital analytics systems
  • Experience in driving digital campaign activity
  • High level of competency in using backend of websites
  • Strong understanding of Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Dreamweaver, Microsoft Office, CSS, Fireworks, Adobe Premier and Mail Chimp

What We Offer

We offer a culture of recognition, professional development and a stimulating and inclusive work environment.\xc2\xa0 To apply for this role please follow the link below.\xc2\xa0 All shortlisted applicants will be asked to demonstrate a portfolio of work and brand experience and results.

For further details or for a confidential discussion regarding the role, please contact Mileva Strachov on mileva.strachov@opteonsolutions.com.

'

title: NA
description:
b'

About the role:

You will be reporting to the lead BI Analyst in the CAF Data Team and will be closely involved with the management of the existing Business Objects platform, the creation of new universes as and when required, as well as:

  • liaising with front end BI to understand requirements for semantic layer
  • working closely with Data Modeller / Architect to implement end-to-end data solution for business
  • administration of Business Objects
  • advance report writing / complex queries in Business Objects
  • advise (and implement) best practice reporting standards
  • conducting and coordinating testing ETL, queries, view, reports deployment to production
  • provide Business Objects training for front end users

About you:

To be successful in this role you wil have experience of relational database concepts, an appreciation of strong governance frameworks, and ideally have experience working in a central data team. We'd like you to bring strong analytical skills, the ability to write use cases, and the ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements. Any experience working in an Agile team will be advantageous, as will specific experience with Business Objects (how to use from front end and connect to different data sources)

We'd also like you to have skills in:

  • SAP Business Objects (BOE) v4.x
  • SAP Web Intelligence (Webi)
  • SAP Universe Design Tool (design, build and amend universe / expose fields in universe)
  • SAP Central Management Console (CMC)
  • SAP Dashboard Design (Xcelsius)
  • SQL querying
  • semantic layer design / modelling

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

'

title: Product Manager, Life Insurance (Bancassurance)
description:
b"

We are currently recruiting for a Product Manager for one of Australia's large life insurers. Reporting to the Head of Product you will have responsibility for the Bancassurance channel. You will be involved in strategic decisions and manage the P&L.

The following are some of the key requirements in this role:

  • Developing customer insights that can be used to make good decisions;
  • Developing and driving growth strategies. Developing and executing retention strategies;
  • Overseeing the implementation of regulatory change (EG Code of Practice).

You will build relationships and work very closely with a number of key people across a variety of departments internally (sales, pricing, legal, underwriting, compliance) in developing market leading product solutions.

The role is extremely high profile and we are looking for individuals who think commercially, are wanting control and responsibility, and who have the confidence to make decisions. It is also important that you enjoy working with a variety of different people.

This is a channel that has historically been underutilised by the organisation. Due to this the role offers quite a bit of flexibility in the way to approach (from a strategic perspective). There is potential to be creative (although the data obtained and analysed will influence decisions).

Previous experience working in life insurance product roles and a desire to continue working in product will be best suited to this role. We will also consider individuals who have come from a marketing background. Previous experience having worked with/ via the bank channel would be a huge advantage but is not essential. A desire to work collaboratively with people is also a must.

This role is an opportunity to work on a new strategy within a large organisation. It is a combination of technical, people engagement and strategy. You will have ownership of the product in a business that is listening to customers and looking to develop the products that they want/ need.

If you are interested in this role please Apply Now. Alternatively, you are more than welcome to call Adrian on 9888 7888.

"

title: Database Administrator
description:
b'

We are currently seeking applications for the following positions located in our North Sydney office.

Database Administrator

A database administrator (DBA) is responsible for the performance, integrity and security of a database. They will also be involved in the planning and development of the database, as well as troubleshooting any issues on behalf of the users.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • establishing the needs of users and monitoring user access and security;
  • monitoring performance and managing parameters to provide fast responses to front-end users;
  • mapping out the conceptual design for a planned database;
  • considering both back-end organisation of data and front-end accessibility for end-users;
  • refining the logical design so that it can be translated into a specific data model;
  • further refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements;
  • installing and testing new versions of the DBMS;
  • maintaining data standards, including adherence to the Data Protection Act;
  • writing database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata);
  • controlling access permissions and privileges;
  • developing, managing and testing back-up and recovery plans;
  • ensuring that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly;
  • capacity planning;
  • working closely with IT project managers, database programmers and multimedia programmers;
  • communicating regularly with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security;
  • Commissioning and installing new applications and customising existing applications in order to make them fit for purpose.

\xc2\xa0The following skills and experience is required:

  • Strong technical knowledge and experience supporting Desktop, and Virtualisation systems
  • Previous experience administering Windows Server, Microsoft Active Directory and Microsoft Exchange technologies
  • Good technical knowledge of local and wide area computer networking systems and equipment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the demonstrated ability to liaise with all levels of people both on a technical and non-technical level (essential)
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail
  • Tertiary qualifications in IT or Microsoft certification would be highly regarded

The successful applicant will be subject to an interview, reference checks, pre-employment medical and drug and alcohol screen.

If you would like to join the My Biz Connect team please email a copy of your resume and application to mybizconnectaus@yahoo.com.

MBC is an equal opportunity employer.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Digital Business Analyst
description:
b'
  • One of Australia's leading general insurers

About IAG

IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, with a growing presence in Asia. IAG owns some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC, WFI and Swann Insurance.

At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:

How to Apply

title: DevOps Applications Engineer
description:
b'
We are searching for an experienced Applications/DevOps Engineer to join a Global Trading\xc2\xa0
Organisation working in a small team to support the front office trading activities.
This is a fast paced environment so you must be quick thinker and have the ability to perform under pressure.
\xc2\xa0
Your key stakeholders will be the Traders and Quants but you will also work closely with the Development and Infrastructure teams so you will literally be touching every piece of technology in the business!
\xc2\xa0
The role will be a mix of project work and support so every day will bring variety and new challenges.   • Analysing and optimising system setup

  • Collaborating with other teams and individuals to fix, test and deploy system improvements and bug fixes as quickly as possible
  • Help solve business needs with technology by evaluating different technology options
\xc2\xa0
Key Requirements:
  • Strong skills in at least one of the following Python/C++/C#
  • Solid experience with Linux systems management
  • Good scripting skills \xe2\x80\x93 Bash, PowerShell
  • Extensive experience with infrastructure \xe2\x80\x93 networks, servers, hardware
  • A Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree or higher, preferably in Computer Science (or similar)
\xc2\xa0
Desirable Skills/Experience
  • Docker
  • Chef / Puppet
  • Monitoring and logging tools (ELK Stack / Influx / Grafana / Zabbix)

  • SQL Data management
  • Basic understanding of financial markets
\xc2\xa0
For more information you can call Daniel in our Sydney office on (02) 9087 6893 quoting Job Reference 497000 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest.
'

title: Agile Business Analyst
description:
b'What's it about?
Amaysim is transforming.. and we need your help! We're no longer the start-up we once were. We've become an award-winning, listed telco, servicing well over 1,000,000 customers. To allow us to continue growing and delivering an amazingly simple experience for our customers, we're changing the way we build and deliver software. We're making the transition from projects to products, legacy to new, balls of mud to greenfield(s), manual to automation, datacenter to cloud. We're well underway on this journey and we've made huge strides, but we need your help to maintain the momentum we've already achieved.

If working in empowered product teams, delivering high quality solutions to interesting problems, surrounded by like-minded people within an amazing workplace culture is what you're seeking then look no further. As a company we value our core principles of reliability, simplicity, agility and empathy above all else, and unlike some, we genuinely live and breath these values. Everything we do, we do with these at the forefront of our minds, and we truly believe that these help set us apart from other employers and help inspire us to make amazing products for our customers.

Who are we looking for?
You! No seriously, if you think you have some or all of the below skills or experience we'd really love to hear from you:
  • Naturally, you're an experienced Business Analyst who is as comfortable in workshops as dissecting bugs with end-users, or going under the hood with the dev team.
  • You're a fast learner, passionate about technology and would thrive in a stimulating role working with a complex, constantly evolving product
  • You have experience working with a digital development team.
  • Agile/SCRUM experience. You've worked with SCRUM/Agile methodologies supporting development projects.
  • Exceptional written skills. You know how to document technical software requirements and write concise, easy-to-understand user-stories.
  • Exceptional verbal communication skills. You can comfortably work with both business and IT people all the way up to the executive level.
  • You need the discipline and flexibility to operate in multiple modes (the "now" of the current iteration and the "later" of upcoming iterations).
The Role:
  • Your key responsibility will be to work with our stakeholders and analyse functional and non-functional requirements, translating them into agile user stories for our product delivery teams.
  • You will regularly work with project stakeholders to translate their requirements into something that developers can understand, as well as to translate the resulting questions that the developers have into something the stakeholders can understand.
  • You'll lead workshops with key stakeholders to document user stories and develop acceptance tests. You'll collect data, perform process mapping and modelling, and assemble detailed documentation for our business and scrum teams
  • While you understand the value of documentation in an Agile environment, your main focus is on collaboration, knowledge transfer, and skills transfer
  • You will be part of a team of highly collaborative colleagues with a furious focus on delivering value, negotiating value delivery in short cycles, and helping your business partners understand what they really need-not only up front but also as the product unfolds in small, usable chunks.
\xc2\xa0In a typical day, you'll:
  • Break down large pieces of work into smaller, more manageable stories
  • Work with our engineers to clarify tasks and ensure feature development matches user needs.
  • Work with the Product Manager and Delivery Practices Manager to clarify any unclear acceptance criteria
  • Negotiate requirements dependencies with other teams, reprioritizing as appropriate, together with the Delivery Practices Manager
  • Facilitate requirements modeling sessions
  • Educate stakeholders in the development process
  • Check on feature burn down and see how the team is tracking towards completion
  • Attend the daily standup with the scrum team - Check in on confidence, just to get a feel of where we are and if were going to make it by the end of the sprint
  • Check that things meet our team Definition of Done
What's in it for you?
You'll get the chance to work in an environment that has an enormous appetite for change; a place that truly values and fosters the innovation you can bring to the teams you work with. We try to be as lean as we can, avoiding red-tape, bureaucracy and waterfall wherever possible. We do our best to maintain the 'startup' look and feel, but without the constraints and overheads normally associated with less well established organisations. We're small enough that your voice will be heard loud and clear and your (awesome) ideas and innovations will be championed and rapidly adopted. And we're large enough that we can execute on these ideas at scale and your work will be used by hundreds of thousands of (happy) customers.
But wait, there's more. As well as being an awesome place to innovate, drive change and make a difference, amaysim also tries to be a place that keeps you excited to come in on a Monday morning through all kinds of fun extras, including:
  • an amaysim phone plan (what else??) and a generous subsidy towards a new phone/tablet to use it on
  • an extra day of annual leave on your birthday
  • covering the costs of your attendance to any and all meetup groups (taxis and time-in-lieu)
  • 'amaysim ideas' sessions several times a month with many external speakers (Facebook, Dropbox and many more)
  • swish offices, with\xc2\xa0even\xc2\xa0swisher ones\xc2\xa0beginning construction soon and rolling out in August
  • join the entire company on 'Culture days' at least twice a year (normally at a harbour-side location - Taronga Zoo most recently), to discuss and shape how the company is run (and to see the Penguins ??)
  • a thriving social life, with events happening most months \xc2\xa0
  • subsidised gym membership & free F45 training at lunchtimes
and many, many others...

Salary
Competitive & Negotiable '

title: Senior Brand Manager - Personal Care

title: NA
description:

Our Client

Our client is a Collections company within Insurance, Banking and Finance sectors. They are seeking an Account manager to join their Insurance collections division.

With this role comes a generous bonus structure. With realistic and achievable KPI's set, as the successful candidate you will have the opportunity to earn up to $12k on top of your annual salary.

The Role

This role is responsible for maximising revenue by the efficient management of a client portfolio to ensure the effective and timely collection of debts, maintaining excellent service levels, building client relationships, and working effectively with other team members. This involves:

  • Evaluating the debtor's intent and/or ability to pay. Negotiate debt payment/settlement in line with client needs.
  • Ensure that all files are actioned in an efficient and timely manner.

title: Engineering Surveyor

title: Sales Executive | Business Development Manager
description:
b"

About the business and the role

Revel's iPad POS (Point-of-Sale) system is a one-of-a-kind solution developed for all businesses. The iPad POS is optimized, but not limited to QSR, Full Service Restaurants, Retail and Groceries. Revel's iPad POS can work offline and in real-time with data access, securely from one centralized cloud location. Revel is a quick, intuitive and a secure product that far surpasses the capabilities of our competitors. Revel is fully customizable and can work independently, or in companionship with other software. The rich API enables custom development of features and allows integrations with other tools. Revel's iPad POS also comes with support for payroll, inventory tracking, web ordering, email receipts, loyalty programs, rewards, social media and so much more!\xc2\xa0

This position will be responsible for customer- company relationship and satisfaction and being the first point of contact and representation of Revel Systems. The role focuses heavily on providing prospect clients a deep understanding of the company's product and service and close qualified lead accounts. In addition, this individual will also communicate benefits and feature as appropriate and relevant to the client. The role requires strong sales, customer satisfaction, and technical skills to successfully communicate with clients and other departments.

Job tasks and responsibilities

  • Field incoming sales leads from Lead Generation team
  • Be a true sales 'hunter' and self generate leads
  • Maintaining contact with leads to ensure a positive view of our company
  • Drive excitement and product awareness of our solution
  • Prospect potential clients through personal networking
  • Cultivate relationships with clients, gain deep understanding into their business, and ultimately provide solutions for their POS goals
  • Generate a high volume of sales related activities including demo presentations and proposals
  • Educate potential clients about the strengths of the Revel product
  • Perform all aspects of selling professionally including: prospecting, approaching, presenting, handling objections, closing and follow-up
  • Handle all administrative aspects of the sale including: completing customer contracts and accepting customer payments and filing the -completed orders
  • Maintain strong knowledge of all products, accessories, pricing plans, promotions and service features
  • Maintain knowledge of competitive offers and provide critical market feedback to the client regarding local competition and product/service needs
  • Participate in training designed to complement the needs of the role
  • Consistently meet or exceed revenue quota assignment
  • Other duties as needed

Skills and experience

  • Business/Commerce degree is highly desirable
  • Minimum of 1-3 years experience selling technical products
  • Experience in hospitality or retail is hirely desirable
  • Experience selling IT hardware and software is highly desired
  • Proven track record in prospecting, qualifying, and closing accounts via phone is highly preferred
  • Experience in selling to small and mid sized businesses strongly desired
  • Must be proficient in MS Office
  • Experience with SalesForce or other CRM is strongly desired

Job benefits and perks

  • Ongoing training & development
  • Free weekly fitness class
  • Central dog friendly office in Lilyfield (5 minutes from Town Hall)
  • Free all day parking
  • Annual flu vaccinations
  • Free weekly fruit delivery
  • Revel Rec room featuring our arcade games,\xc2\xa0ping pong table, book nook and foosball table.\xc2\xa0
  • Annual trip to San Francisco as part of our Global Sales kick-off

"

title: Customer Service/Sales Representative
salary: b'50-54k Dependant on Exp. and Industry Background'
description:
b'

The Company

Premier Workplace Solutions is a dynamic, professional company operating in the workplace safety field. Our clients are predominantly building/facility managers or OH&S personnel who appreciate the wide variety of creative and resourceful solutions we can offer. We provide an array of products and services to our Industrial & Commercial client base.

As a result of continued expansion, we are looking for a full time customer service/Internal Sales professional to join our growing team.

The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate very strong communication skills, have a professional phone manner and have a strong customer focus.


The Person

The person we are seeking will demonstrate

\xe2\x80\xa2Minimum 2 years customer service/internal sales experience
\xe2\x80\xa2Sales experience in the Commercial or Industrial safety markets is highly regarded.
\xe2\x80\xa2Proven experience using MS Office to produce correspondence, quotes,
\xe2\x80\xa2Strong communication skills and a confident phone manner

You will

\xe2\x80\xa2Be an effective time manager
\xe2\x80\xa2Display integrity and enthusiasm
\xe2\x80\xa2Work effectively with other members of the sales team

The Job

\xe2\x80\xa2You will essentially be conversing with external customers, updating details, verifying orders and following-up on quotes.
\xe2\x80\xa2You will also be required to provide administrative support including entering data and processing orders.
\xe2\x80\xa2As a full time internal sales representative you will work closely with our external sales team, providing them support and responding to their customer's inquiries.
\xe2\x80\xa2You will also assist with targeted marketing, product promotions and help explore new business opportunities.

\xe2\x80\xa2Your performance will be judged on\xc2\xa0identifying sales opportunities through to a close relationship with your clients
\xe2\x80\xa2In return for your strong work ethic, team spirit and motivation you will be rewarded with a competitive salary package and work within a great team environment.

The package:

A salary dependent on experience and industry background will be offered to the successful candidate + 9.25% super

Applications

If you would like further information on the type of products and services we offer, please visit our website at www.thinkworkplacesafety.com.au

If you find yourself interested in the opportunity, the package and products we have to offer, please email your resume to hr@pwsonline.com.au.

We look forward to hearing from you.

**Only successful candidates will be contacted**

'

title: Maintenance Co-ordinator
description:
b'

I am looking for an experience Building Construction and Maintenance Officer for an ASAP start for a contract assignment. For this position we would preferably be looking for candidates with experience in local Government and knowledge of building design, maintenance and construction.

Candidates must have a valid driver\xe2\x80\x99s licence.

KEY ACOUNTABILITIES:

  • Working with local Government
  • Entering data into the system
  • Traveling to various Council Facilities within the boundaries of Cumberland Council
  • Prepare briefs, select materials to be used, and additional works required etc.
  • Supervision of contractors and site works
  • Call in quotes for raising purchase orders
  • Carry out maintenance requirements, inspection of Council own and operated facilities

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

  • Good and effective communication skills and customer service
  • Proven ability to work as part of a team
  • Knowledge of the construction and maintenance industry
  • Relevant Trade Certification
  • Knowledge of Building Code of Australia is desirable
  • Knowledge of TRIM is desirable

Please APPLY NOW to send in your application for this Building Construction and Maintenance Officer position as I am currently shortlisting.

You can also call Fiona on 02 8252 3122 for further information.

'

title: Mechanical (HVAC) Services - Services Manager
description:
b'

WHO WE ARE:

BGIS Technical Services (BGIS) is a leading provider of facilities management services, project delivery services, and workplace solutions.

With a combined team of over 1,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's estate portfolios by developing and implementing innovative facilities management strategies.

BGIS Technical Services deliver planned and reactive maintenance solutions across mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, building and fire disciplines to a range of existing accounts within the BGIS contract portfolio.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

As the role of the NSW Mechanical (HVAC) Services - Services Manager, you will be responsible for the efficient performance of FM services and delivery for all aspects of the Mechanical (HVAC) Services for all NSW contracts.

This is a Full Time Permanent position based in NSW, and will work from our Northmead Office (Sydney NSW).

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage expenditure and costs to meet agreed budget targets
  • Manage the contract delivery in all aspects of the Services Agreement ensuring that all KPI's are met
  • Monitor and measure Contract Performance and promote continuous improvement using KPI assessments and analysis, customer surveys and sub-contractor interviews
  • Develop appropriate scopes of works and contract documentation to all Service Contracts to be entered into in accordance with the Company's procurement procedure
  • Facilitate planning and programming for prescribed maintenance, service and activities, in line with tendered obligations
  • Manage and co-ordinate maintenance planning and programming for prescribed maintenance, service and activities, in line with tendered obligations and CMMS operations including maintenance and updating of all necessary input data and output reports
  • Ensure the contract's sub-contractors and suppliers are effectively managed so that they deliver the services in accordance with the contract requirements and the Company's system requirements in a time and cost effective manner
  • Manage or oversee the management of subcontractor(s) administration including the following:
    • Prepare all contracts and documentation
    • Review of subcontractor OHS documentation
    • Assessment of works complete
  • Liaison with client, or representative, to assess delivery
  • Day to day administration of contract terms and conditions
  • Manage staff time in accordance with the budget and the Company's procedures
  • Payment to subcontractors and suppliers
  • Review of maintenance activities for best possible value for money and Whole of Life (WOL) outcomes
  • Prepare and obtain approvals for Client works including variations and additional works as provided under the contract and in accordance with the Company's and the client's procurement procedures
  • Provide technical & management service and support to staff and clients as required
  • Ability to co-ordinate activities, resources, equipment and information as required
  • Report and escalate to senior management as required
  • Experience in working with various job-tracking systems and familiarity with mobile tools and applications

An attractive remuneration package will be provided. If you are committed, enthusiastic and professional, this is a great opportunity for you to join a highly motivated and dynamic organisation.

Please send your resume and a cover letter detailing your qualifications and experience to: hr@bgists.com

COMPETENCIES & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Trade and Post Trade (Engineering Certificate/ Associate Diploma) desirable
  • Strong demonstrated experience in management of large scale maintenance activities
  • Experience in collaborative, relationship or alliance contracting
  • Extensive subcontractor procurement and management experience
  • Estimating and whole of life cost optimisation experience
  • Environmental / ESD/ Energy and OH&S management experience
  • Strong business acumen with demonstrated business planning and high-level financial knowledge and skills
  • Proven capability of working within an environment using QA, OH&S and environmental systems
  • Able to respond quickly to change and adopt a flexible / innovative approach to problems and opportunities
  • High level written and verbal communication skills
  • White Card (General Construction Induction Card)
  • Australian Citizenship

WHY JOIN BGIS TECHNICAL SERVICES?

BGIS Technical Services (BGIS) is rapidly expanding and we are looking for high performers to join and grow our business.\xc2\xa0 Our people are our greatest asset and we believe in attracting, developing and retaining the highest calibre.\xc2\xa0 Stepping Up' is our innovative and interactive talent development programme designed to help our team manage their careers, so if you think you can step up to the challenge and be a part of a dynamic team, then get in touch.\xc2\xa0

BGIS is committed to building a culturally diverse workforce and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and minority groups are encouraged to apply.

'

title: IT Support Analyst
description:
b"

Dicker Data is an Australian owned and operated ASX listed hardware and software distributor.

Based\xc2\xa0in Kurnell,\xc2\xa0an exciting\xc2\xa0opportunity exists\xc2\xa0for\xc2\xa0a\xc2\xa0passionate\xc2\xa0and\xc2\xa0intuitive\xc2\xa0IT Support Analyst\xc2\xa0to join the\xc2\xa0innovative\xc2\xa0IT\xc2\xa0team, reporting to the\xc2\xa0Chief Information Officer.\xc2\xa0

Our culture encourages team growth and success, we understand the importance of hiring the right people to make a great team, and to optimize their drive to get the job done. Don't miss this opportunity to become a vital member of our innovative and passionate team!

\xc2\xa0

What you will need to succeed in this role:

  • Advanced knowledge and experience administrating desktop applications. Including but not limited to Microsoft Outlook, Skype for Business, Google Chrome
  • Familiarity with and management experience within Unix/ Linix environments
  • Shell scripting experience advantageous
  • Professional communication skill, both written and verbal
  • Ability to work well in a team as well as autonomously
  • General enthusiasm to learn new things, and engage on new projects
  • Strong work ethic and ability to demonstrate initiative as required

    \xc2\xa0

What you will do in this role:

Primary

  • Triage and manage the completion and escalation of support cases, making sure users and the business are kept up to date with regular progress updates
  • Provide technical support to employees and contractors as required
  • Assist in the creation and management of user accounts, including system permissions and security
  • Proactively monitor and audit the health and availability of core business systems
  • Assist in the installation, configuration and maintenance of IT infrastructure

General

  • Engage with the Dicker Data teams in a clear and professional manner
  • Participate in training as required
  • Promote open and mutually beneficial sharing of knowledge between the team and the wider business
  • Regularly audit the IT environment

\xc2\xa0

Your rewards in this role:

  • A highly competitive salary package depending upon experience
  • Convenient on-site parking
  • Staff only on-site gym
  • A selection of freshly prepared lunch options provided daily
  • A relaxed, modern office setting with smart casual dress
  • Discounted health insurance options
  • Access to comprehensive discounted superannuation products and insurance
  • Various banking and finance benefits
  • Travel and lifestyle benefits
  • A professional environment comprised of driven yet supportive teams

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0Only those with the legal right to work in Australia may apply for this position

"

title: Purchasing Officer
description:
b"

All Pumps is a well-established importer and distributor of Industrial Pumps and Equipment, we service clients in the Mining, Industrial and Building sectors. With operations Australia wide, our head office and warehouse is located in Silverwater, Sydney.

As the\xc2\xa0Purchasing\xc2\xa0Officer, you'll be responsible for ensuring production has the necessary stock on hand to meet defined production timelines, load dates and costing requirements. To achieve these objectives, you'll use your proven experience within a factory assembly environment, preferably where all products produced are custom made.

This is a true\xc2\xa0purchasing role. Due to the nature of the environment, you won't be able to solely rely on forecasted production pipelines or sales targets, as the customers' needs will vary with every order.

\xc2\xa0

In this busy and hands on role your\xc2\xa0responsibilities will include:

  • Creating purchase orders combined with Inventory control and analysis
  • Track and communicate the status of purchases as required
  • Managing supplier delivery issues/requirements/processes
  • Working closely with the production, sales and project teams to develop effective purchasing strategies\xc2\xa0
  • Manage local and international suppliers, building optimal relationships whilst monitoring performance and price competitiveness\xc2\xa0of suppliers and negotiating pricing
  • Ensuring data is processed with the highest degree of accuracy
  • Commitment to best practice and continuous improvement within the team
  • Review processes and procedures to improve and streamline
  • Sourcing of special items for specific projects or applications
  • Maintaining a high level of customer service between Purchasing and the Production team.

To be considered for this role it is essential that the successful candidate has the following skills and experience:

  • Minimum of 5 years experience within a dedicated purchasing role\xc2\xa0
  • Exposure to inventory control, demand planning and production planning would be great
  • Advanced Microsoft skills - Word and Excel
  • Exceptional communication skills - written and verbal
  • Strong attention to detail combined with advanced analytical skills

If you're looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity that'll allow you to grow and prove your capabilities, then we'd love the opportunity to discuss the role in more detail.

This position requires an enthusiastic, team orientated individual with a strong customer focus who can work independently, as well as collaboratively to maximise workflow and achieve company goals.

"

title: Technical Business Development Manager - Symantec
description:
b"

Dicker Data is an Australian owned and operated ASX listed hardware and software distributor.

This outbound role offers\xc2\xa0an exciting opportunity for\xc2\xa0a sophisticated and intuitive Technical Business Development Manager - Symantec\xc2\xa0to join the innovative Software team, reporting to the Business Manager \xe2\x80\x93 Software.

You will be required to demonstrate your unparalleled initiative by providing pre-sales training for our channel partners that need to understand a deeper knowledge of Symantec and their solutions. You will hit the ground running as a brand ambassador with a passion for service excellence, where challenging daily tasks await and endless opportunities abound.

\xc2\xa0

Immersed in our vibrant and dynamic culture, your role will be essential in supporting our channel partners on end user meetings and building solutions using Symantec products.

\xc2\xa0

This role is designed for a self-starter that can work remotely and travel inter-state. The success of this role is based on the commitment, energy and enthusiasm you bring to the role.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Our culture encourages team growth and success, we understand the importance of hiring the right people to make a great team, and to optimize their drive to get the job done. Don't miss this opportunity to become a vital member of our innovative and passionate team!

\xc2\xa0

What you will need to succeed in this role:

  • Technical experience or expertise in some or all the following areas:
    • Pre-sales for Network, Security and Cloud
    • Understanding of key technologies from Symantec
      • Endpoint Protection
      • Data Loss Prevention
      • Secure Web Gateway
      • VIP \xe2\x80\x93 2 Factor Authentication
      • CASB
      • WSS
      • SSL
  • Excellent understanding of the Australian security market.
  • Ability to translate technical requirements into business-level requirements
  • High level interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and effectively prioritise work, to meet with company and customer expectations
  • Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills. This includes an ability to communicate and liaise with all levels of customer and supplier contacts
  • Intermediate MS Office literacy and ERP applications
  • Good numeracy skills - (multiplication, division, addition & subtraction)
  • High level of initiative and enthusiasm
  • Well-developed negotiation skills
  • Professional, helpful and efficient manner
  • Ability to recognise potential in customers
  • Ability to forecast numbers against budget on a monthly/ quarterly basis

\xc2\xa0

What you will do in this role:

  • Build POC and demonstrate solutions to channel partners and end users
  • Support our channel partners on end user meetings and support them on building solutions using Symantec products
  • Provide pre-sales training for our channel partners that need to understand a deeper knowledge of Symantec and their solutions
  • Provide technical support for our unmanaged partners
  • Complete all required technical certificates for Symantec
  • Develop strong product and process knowledge of all Dicker Data's vendors
  • Acquire and maintain vendor Sales Certifications as directed
  • Attend Reseller and Vendor social and training events, which may be out of normal hours
  • Forecast accurately throughout the month and quarter
  • Ensure that, where possible, the customer's financial arrangements are in line with their business needs (credit limits, payment terms etc.). Initiate reviews as appropriate
  • Liaise with appropriate Dicker Data Specialist, Presales and/or Licensing personnel for assistance with quotations involving large and/or complex configurations
  • Update and detail the DD quoting tool, providing win probability and close months for quotes
  • Liaise closely with customers and suppliers to develop, maintain and enhance relationships which ensure the growth of Dicker Data's business and proactively promote and sell Dicker Data's product and services
  • Proactively distribute product information and pricing to customers, such as product releases, special promotions, product updates and marketing activities
  • Proactively seek and develop new business opportunities in existing and potential accounts
  • Ensure CRM is maintained and up to date for territory
  • Conduct Customer and Vendor Meetings per week as per goals set by your Sales Manager
  • Manage and develop Reseller base, understand key personnel and specific reseller needs
  • Follow vendor special pricing process ensuring that all claims can be processed in a timely manner
  • Regularly meet and form strong relationships with all Supplier contacts
  • Co-ordinate and conduct presentations to customers to provide product or technology information along with information about the Dicker Data value proposition
  • Conduct reseller training as requested
  • Conduct Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR) with selected Partners

\xc2\xa0

Your rewards in this role:

  • A highly competitive salary package depending upon experience
  • Convenient on-site parking
  • Staff only on-site gym
  • A selection of freshly prepared lunch options provided daily
  • A relaxed, modern office setting with smart casual dress
  • Discounted health insurance options
  • Access to comprehensive discounted superannuation products and insurance
  • Various banking and finance benefits
  • Travel and lifestyle benefits
  • A professional environment comprised of driven yet supportive teams

    \xc2\xa0

Only those with the legal right to work in Australia may apply for this position.

"

title: Quality Assurance and Training Manager
description:
b"

Working closely with the Clinical Operations Director you will have sole responsibility for establishing and ensuring all clinical processes are conducted in accordance with industry standard guidelines, local regulations and with organisational policies and procedures for the conduct of clinical trials. You will also be responsible for developing the training curriculum and managing and delivering the respective training to clinical staff.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Quality Assurance and Training Manager looking to take the next step in their career as the CRO expands into new markets. As a key member of this entrepreneurial and fast-paced team you will focus on:

  • developing and maintaining ICH/GCP compliant and training processes
  • monitoring all QA processes contributing to the performance of a clinical trial
  • leading auditing activities to ensure that studies are conducted in accordance with sponsor protocols, GCP, industry guidelines, agency regulations
  • managing activities in the areas of Internal Quality Audits, CAPA (Corrective and Preventive Actions), Quality Management Reviews, and Quality Audits
  • troubleshooting and identifying non-conformances clinical trial activities, provide suitable recommendations and facilitate ongoing quality improvements using risk-based methodology while maintaining compliance with applicable study protocols, Quality System Regulations and/or ISO standards where applicable
  • vendor audits and review vendor supplied data and quality records for conformance and good documentation practices (GDP)
  • developing and implementing clinical research\xc2\xa0 training curriculum (both online and in-house trainings) for Clinical Staff, External Stakeholders and Site Staff
  • conducting various trainings (CRA, CRC, GCP, etc)
  • conducting investigator and system audits
  • assisting in ISO9001 Certification and maintaining databases for the Quality system
  • preparing annual reports and quality trending reports
  • continuing to improve training programs
  • ensuring the organisation is up to date with all related quality legislation and compliance issues.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • at least 3 years' experience in the pharmaceutical industry and/or medical device industry with an in-depth knowledge of Australian, New Zealand and International regulatory standards, and GxP guidelines for the conduct of clinical trials.
  • at least 3 years working in a quality assurance area
  • experience and knowledge of Quality System Regulations and ISO Standards, is desired
  • ASQ and/or Auditor accreditation is desirable
  • 3 years' experience in training program development (both online and in-house programs) is a must
  • experience including external/CRO, clinical/regulatory and document auditing highly desirable
  • Ability to travel both nationally and internationally

If you are an energetic and driven quality assurance and training professional ready to take ownership of the quality assurance and training function for this fast paced global organisation then this career opportunity is for you. To apply please submit your cv together with a covering letter to linda@heathrconsulting.com.au

"

title: NDIS Administration Assistant, Aspect Choose & Connect NSW
salary: b"Approx $51,375 FTE incl super + salary pack'ing"
description:
b'
  • Full time, 6 month max term contract to\xc2\xa0November 2017
  • Approx. $51,375\xc2\xa0p.a. FTE salary package\xc2\xa0range\xc2\xa0inclusive of\xc2\xa0superannuation\xc2\xa0(pro rata\xc2\xa0for contract term)
  • Excellent tax-effective salary packaging benefits
  • Flexible location base locations - Ryde, Hurstville, Marrickville or Canterbury, NSW

What we do: Autism Spectrum Australia (Aspect) is Australia's largest specialist autism provider, delivering services to people within NSW, ACT, Victoria & SA.\xc2\xa0Aspect provides a range of centre and community based services, focussing on education, early intervention, skills development, community engagement, and self-directed options for people on the autism spectrum.

Choose & Connect - Aspect's community based & individualised services for people on the autism spectrum autism &\xc2\xa0their families.\xc2\xa0The focus is on the development of individual programs based on the specific interests, wants & needs of each participant.\xc2\xa0

About this role:\xc2\xa0In this varied role, using your client management experience, you will coordinate\xc2\xa0and manage referrals, bookings, reviews\xc2\xa0and enquires for all new & existing services provided to\xc2\xa0NDIS participants.\xc2\xa0You will have the\xc2\xa0ability to provide outstanding customer service and liaise with\xc2\xa0a range of people including Aspect staff, external organisations & families/carers of\xc2\xa0people on the autism spectrum. Possibility for extension at end of max term contract.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Working with the Regional Coordinators, develop & manage Service Agreements & Schedule of Supports
  • Create service bookings through the NDIA portal for all participants
  • Set up participants shifts on Carelink in line with NDIS funding agreements
  • Accurate maintenance of database records & information systems
  • Responding to service enquiries\xc2\xa0& requests
  • Communicate & liaise with team members, key stakeholders, services users, families, staff\xc2\xa0& advocates
  • Assist with collation of data for reporting purposes\xc2\xa0

Skills, experience & qualifications:

  • Understanding of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) & participants NDIS\xc2\xa0plans
  • Relevant tertiary qualification in administration or business administration or relevant industry experience
  • Minimum 12 month\xc2\xa0experience in an administration or office management role
  • Experience providing administrative support to multiple clients\xc2\xa0-\xc2\xa0outstanding customer service skills
  • Proven ability to work autonomously &\xc2\xa0collaboratively as part of a team
  • Strong organisation & time management skills - ability to multi-task
  • Strong communication & interpersonal skills
  • Highly organised with good attention to detail
  • Strong\xc2\xa0MS Office skills, particularly in Word, Excel & Outlook
  • Experience using client management systems such as Salesforce, Carelink or Time Target - highly regarded
  • Ability to design\xc2\xa0& enter information in a variety of formats such as narrative, business correspondence & statistical tables
  • Ability to establish effective relationships with internal & external stakeholders
  • Current\xc2\xa0NSW\xc2\xa0Working With Children Check for paid employment

A police check is a requirement. Aspect will arrange this.

What we offer: A competitive package will be based on relevant qualifications & experience. As a Public Benevolent Institution (PBI), Aspect employees receive tax-effective salary packaging opportunities including $15,899 each year tax free. This means you can increase the value of your take-home pay.

This role is covered by the Federal Social, Community, Home Care and Disability Services Industry Award &\xc2\xa0is classified at Level\xc2\xa02, depending on qualifications & experience. We focus on providing a positive work & learning environment for staff.

The\xc2\xa0Position Profile is available one you apply.

To apply: Please include your resume & complete the candidate questionnaire as part of Aspect's online recruitment process. Cover letter is optional.

Enquiries should be directed to: Linzi Coy\xc2\xa0Community Engagement and Operations Manager on 0425 291 465.

For more information about Aspect: www.autismspectrum.org.au.

Please submit applications as soon as possible.

\xc2\xa0Aspect is a Public Benevolent Institution and EEO employer.\xc2\xa0 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply

NOTE: If you have a profile with Seek, you may prefer to click the "Apply with Seek" button below. This will automatically pre-fill your personal details and attach your resume from Seek. To complete your application you must also answer the questions below.

'

title: Graduate Network Engineer
description:
b'

There's something special about working for a company like Macquarie Telecom. We're not the biggest in the industry, where you're just a number.

We're not tiny enough that you've never heard of us. We're in that sweet spot where we're strong enough to punch above our weight.

And we definitely do! Success. We love that word. We love it as it means our customers are happy. It means our technology works. It means our employees can grow.

One of the ways we make a difference is by providing the world's best customer care to our customers, this is where you come in:

What will you be doing

As a Tier 1 Engineer in our Network Operating Centre (NOC) you will manage inbound customer queries via phone, email and web chat.

You will be responsible for monitoring incidents for our customer managed services and proactively communicate and resolve them.

Your role will entail technical diagnostics and restoration of data services, either resolving on first call or escalating where necessary, but always keeping customers informed and up to date.

About you

  • Networking is your first love, family and friends call upon you to setup a home network or fix anything technology related at home

  • You have a good knowledge of:

    • the OSI model

    • configuring firewall and routers

    • Network monitoring tools and protocols (MRTG, RRD, NAGIOS, SNMOP)

  • Troubleshoot issues in CISCO or Juniper environments
  • Accreditation in CISCO or Juniper
  • Recent graduate/ final year of IT/Technical Services (Engineer/Science) degree

  • You have a keen interest and are passionate about talking to customers

  • You love problem solving and are always up for a challenge
  • You are resilient and adaptable
  • You are a current Australian Citizen

What's in it for you?

  • Advanced\xc2\xa0Training in Networking, Juniper and many more technologies

  • Rostered shifts based on a 24x7 'always on' schedule

  • Great CBD Location

  • Competitive remuneration package

  • Pay for your certification examinations

If you tick these boxes, and are happy to consider shift work (7am - 4pm/ 3pm - 12am/ 11pm \xe2\x80\x93 8am shifts available) please apply today.

'

About this role:\xc2\xa0In this varied role, using your client management experience, you will coordinate\xc2\xa0and manage referrals, bookings, reviews\xc2\xa0and enquires for all new & existing services provided to\xc2\xa0NDIS participants.\xc2\xa0You will have the\xc2\xa0ability to provide outstanding customer service and liaise with\xc2\xa0a range of people including Aspect staff, external organisations & families/carers of\xc2\xa0people on the autism spectrum. Possibility for extension at end of max term contract.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Working with the Regional Coordinators, develop & manage Service Agreements & Schedule of Supports
  • Create service bookings through the NDIA portal for all participants
  • Set up participants shifts on Carelink in line with NDIS funding agreements
  • Accurate maintenance of database records & information systems
  • Responding to service enquiries\xc2\xa0& requests
  • Communicate & liaise with team members, key stakeholders, services users, families, staff\xc2\xa0& advocates
  • Assist with collation of data for reporting purposes\xc2\xa0

Skills, experience & qualifications:

  • Understanding of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) & participants NDIS\xc2\xa0plans
  • Relevant tertiary qualification in administration or business administration or relevant industry experience
  • Minimum 12 month\xc2\xa0experience in an administration or office management role
  • Experience providing administrative support to multiple clients\xc2\xa0-\xc2\xa0outstanding customer service skills
  • Proven ability to work autonomously &\xc2\xa0collaboratively as part of a team
  • Strong organisation & time management skills - ability to multi-task
  • Strong communication & interpersonal skills
  • Highly organised with good attention to detail
  • Strong\xc2\xa0MS Office skills, particularly in Word, Excel & Outlook
  • Experience using client management systems such as Salesforce, Carelink or Time Target - highly regarded
  • Ability to design\xc2\xa0& enter information in a variety of formats such as narrative, business correspondence & statistical tables
  • Ability to establish effective relationships with internal & external stakeholders
  • Current\xc2\xa0NSW\xc2\xa0Working With Children Check for paid employment

A police check is a requirement. Aspect will arrange this.

What we offer: A competitive package will be based on relevant qualifications & experience. As a Public Benevolent Institution (PBI), Aspect employees receive tax-effective salary packaging opportunities including $15,899 each year tax free. This means you can increase the value of your take-home pay.

This role is covered by the Federal Social, Community, Home Care and Disability Services Industry Award &\xc2\xa0is classified at Level\xc2\xa02, depending on qualifications & experience. We focus on providing a positive work & learning environment for staff.

The\xc2\xa0Position Profile is available one you apply.

To apply: Please include your resume & complete the candidate questionnaire as part of Aspect's online recruitment process. Cover letter is optional.

For more information about Aspect: www.autismspectrum.org.au.

Please submit applications as soon as possible.

title: Collections & Accounts Receivable Officer
description:
b"

MW Lomax are currently looking for a debt collector to join our Chatswood team.\xc2\xa0

To be considered for this role you must have the following:

  • A friendly and 'can do' attitude
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Attention to detail
  • Basic Microsoft Office skills\xc2\xa0
  • Willingness to learn

Responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

  • Debt Collection
  • Accounts Receivable processing
  • General office duties - photocopying, scanning, filing
  • Correspondence
  • Data entry
  • Completing general administration tasks and supporting the administration and accounting team as required

Applicants with some previous experience in collections or an accounting environment are encouraged to apply, however it is not a requirement.

Excellent working conditions provide opportunities for career progression.

Salary is Award based and is dependent on age and experience.

If you believe you would be a good fit for this position please submit your resume and cover letter through Seek.

Please note that unfortunately due to the high volume of applications we receive, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Maintenance Electrician
description:
b"

With an ever-growing portfolio of commercial properties serviced across greater Sydney, Micron Group are seeking experienced service and maintenance electricians to carry out routine, preventative maintenance and upgrade works for numerous clients across the Sydney CBD and metro areas.\xc2\xa0 We service some of Sydney's premier commercial sites with over 50 regularly serviced buildings in the Sydney CBD alone.

To be successful for this role, you will need to be a qualified Electrician with an electrical license and at least 2 years' experience in the field.\xc2\xa0 You are required to be able to work unsupervised, be self-motivated and demonstrate a structured approach to your daily tasks.

In this role, you will be responsible for general electrical repairs, the maintenance of lighting installations and their control gears, periodic RCD and emergency lighting testing, Test & Tag, thermal imaging of electrical switchboards, fault finding and breakdown repair, install and fault finding of data cabling networks,\xc2\xa0liaising with clients and reporting.\xc2\xa0

Experience with intelligent emergency lighting systems, lighting automation solutions such as Cbus,\xc2\xa0Dynalite & KNX, variable speed/frequency drives, motors, analogue and digital CCTV systems, phone lines, computer networks\xc2\xa0relay and contractor control are desirable but not essential.\xc2\xa0

You will be required to demonstrate the ability to quickly develop a structured approach to your maintenance tasks and to show proficiency in using computer-based programs to track and report on maintenance progress. \xc2\xa0The key to your success will be an ability to effectively identify and solve system issues in a timely and proficient manner while managing client expectations and delivery of service.

"

title: Leasing Manager - Fixed Term Contract 12 Months
description:
b'

\xc2\xa0

What's your ambition? Is it a big goal or small steps? Professional or personal? We'd like to know, because we make your ambitions our business.

\xc2\xa0

If you're looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you'll have a chance to innovate with the world's leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You'll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you'll be inspired by the best. We're focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours.

\xc2\xa0

What this opportunity involves:

The Leasing Manager is responsible for managing and delivering lease administration, data and property management services while developing strong relationships with our client and JLL stakeholders. You will prepare and manage all critical data reporting and ensure landlords comply with lease obligations.

\xc2\xa0

Sound like the job you are looking for? Before you apply it's also worth knowing what we are looking for:

As the successful applicant, you will have held a Leasing Manager role previously with lease administration, property management and property legal expertise. An undergraduate degree or advanced diploma in property is desirable with solid experience using property management systems. Analytical, strategic skills and attention to detail is essential with the ability to negotiate and influence a variety of stakeholders and external parties. Computer literacy is crucial as is the ability to work under pressure. If you love a good challenge and thrive in a dynamic work environment then this role is for you.

\xc2\xa0

What you can expect from us:

You'll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together \xe2\x80\x93 across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

\xc2\xa0

Apply today, quoting job reference number 57170BR.

\xc2\xa0

Please note, although developing relationships with agencies forms a component of the JLL talent acquisition strategy, on this occasion agency submissions will not be accepted.

'

title: Junior Buyer
description:
b'

About HelloFresh

We are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market. This is a unique opportunity to gain valuable and challenging experience at a rapidly growing startup. Responsibility is given from day one to use your initiative and creativity to help us grow our business. We are fast-paced and love the food world. Learn more about us at HelloFresh.com.au

If you would like to join an energetic and highly motivated team and work in a dynamic, high-energy, high-growth field where you can really have an impact and make a difference every single day then join us and become part of developing a global fresh food champion!

Job description

You will\xe2\x80\xa6

  • Create and maintain purchasing files and price lists, as well as determine if their companies have enough inventory on hand
  • Be responsible for providing procurement advice, price updates, reporting, replenishments, compliance, tenders and managing stakeholder relationships
  • Work with suppliers to ensure on-time, on-spec deliveries or discuss shortages/missed deliveries
  • Check in person shipments to ensure the exact quantity and quality of items are delivered
  • Assemble data relating to supplier performance
  • Assist with cost reporting and invoice validation

Mandatory requirements

You have\xe2\x80\xa6

  • 1-2+ years experience in procurement or contract management working in a similar role. Management consulting experience is a plus
  • An organised approach to work and have the ability to think on your feet
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent analytical skills, strong command of Excel is a must
  • A "whatever it takes" mentality that drives you to find solutions quickly and whenever needed

You are ...

  • Obsessed with food!
  • Proactive, confident in manner and are able to deal with a large and complex network of suppliers delivering a large quantity and variety of perishable ingredients.
  • Passionate about our business: a foodie or an operations and problem-solving zealot

What you'll get in return

This position will allow you to work within a supportive team environment while developing your technical skills to be able to take the next step in your procurement career. Since we know you love food, you'll also get access to our staff discounts to our amazing meal delivery boxes!

Start date: Immediate

Compensation: Competitive salary with benefits

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

'

title: CTP Claims Consultant
description:
b"

\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Take ownership of your own CTP Claims portfolio
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Excellent opportunities for performance based promotion\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Become part of a dynamic, high performing, supportive claims team environment\xc2\xa0

As a\xc2\xa0Allianz CTP Claims consultant\xc2\xa0(CTP standing for Compulsory Third Party), you will manage personal injury claims arising from motor vehicle accidents. As a valued member of our team, you'll take charge of your own CTP Claims portfolio, working alongside our Team Manager and Case Reviewer to manage your portfolio of personal injury claims. As well as managing the needs of the injured claimant, you\xc2\xa0 will gather medical information, review treatment requests, liaise with doctors, lawyers and employers to proactively progress claims to resolution. \xc2\xa0

You'll be responsible for:\xc2\xa0

\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Managing your own claims portfolio while supporting claimants through their injury and rehabilitation, driving effective return to work/health outcomes
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Providing fair and reasonable outcomes for insured claimants, while being mindful of processes and targets
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Implementing claims management strategies and best practice methods
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Making settlement offers and attending settlement conferences and attend CARS (Claims Assessment & Resolution Service) and Court hearings with our panel lawyers and barristers\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Working and liaising with stakeholders including injured claimants, lawyers, rehabilitation advisors and medical professionals
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Accurately adding data to our systems and maintaining a high degree of confidentiality on individual cases
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Professionally dealing with customer interactions and building effective relationships\xc2\xa0

We're looking for talent who have:

\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0An empathetic, professional and courteous manner
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0CTP, liability or equivalent experience (preferred)
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0An understanding of insurance legislation (desired)
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Sound problem solving skills
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0The ability to negotiate and resolve conflict should it occur
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0A positive attitude for proactivity, taking ownership and managing targets
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0An ability to energetically handle a high volume of work with autonomy
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Excellent time management skills and able to work in a fast paced environment
\xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Tertiary qualifications with recent legal graduates (with 1-2 yrs experience) being highly desired\xc2\xa0

The Allianz career difference

At Allianz you'll enjoy a role with a defined career path and the opportunity to progress from a level 1 Claims Consultant all the way to a Senior Claims consultant based on your performance. You'll also benefit from generous discounts across our products and services and enjoy excellent opportunities for career advancement. With 4,300 people, Allianz Australia is an outstanding place to learn, develop, grow and lead. Not only will a career with Allianz link you to a brand that's financially strong, but you'll be connected to a culture built on supportive management, internal promotion, and making the most of your potential.

"

title: Customer Improvement Lead
description:
b'

About the business

As the leader in property software, Rockend is constantly looking for new ways to innovate and help our customers to grow and run smarter businesses. Our goal is to transform the way businesses operate on a day-to-day basis.

We have an exceptional name in the market place with over 5,000 valued customers, Rockend is a dynamic and vibrant company who can offer you a genuine career move.

Due to ongoing growth we are on the hunt for a Customer Improvement Lead to lead a stream of work that is continually defining new ways of working and serving our customers based on real customer and employee insights in an economically viable way.\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities

  • Use all insights and data to run design and improvement 'sprints' using Human Centred design methods to drive improvement for our customers and employees
  • Map customer episodes and support the develop of the NPS system
  • Ensure a customer centric experience and advocacy strategy is embedded in all new and change activity
  • Define method and measures for voice of customer channels
  • Build capability in teams to support the design and redesign of customer episodes
  • Support companywide capability building in Customer Experience methodologies and thinking
  • Work with front line leaders and teams as well as the Manager CE Operations to ensure accurate and timely customer insights are gathered to drive a system of continual improvement

Skills and experience:

  • 3+ years' proven experience in customer redesign and/or systems thinking \xc2\xa0
  • Cross functional leadership experience
  • Proven experience interpreting data to drive action
  • Experience working in Real Estate, Telecommunications or Finance is desirable but not essential

Rockend prides itself on truly valuing all employees and in return for your hard work and dedication you will receive a competitive salary package and will be able to take advantage of Rockend's many benefits including a free gym membership, modern and comfortable office space that includes snooze rooms and a working environment that encourages cooperation, teamwork and development.

'

title: Administrator
description:
b"

Join Australia's leading recruitment agency as Office Administrator. Salary of 40k + super. Immediate start.

Your new company
Hays is the leading global specialist recruiting group. We are the expert at recruiting qualified, professional and skilled people worldwide, being the market leader in Asia Pacific and the UK and one of the market leaders in Continental Europe and Latin America. We operate across the private and public sectors, dealing in permanent positions, contract roles and temporary assignments.

Your new role
Administrative support for 7 recruitment consultants including:

  • Reception duties
  • Compliance management
  • Data entry
  • General administration
  • Office maintenance


What you'll need to succeed
A positive, can do attitude with a strong customer service focus. Proficiency on Microsoft office with a high attention to detail. Ability to to think on your feet.

What you'll get in return
Global industry experience and working for a market leader. Being part of a close knit and supportive team culture with plenty of opportunity for career progression. You will receive a salary of up to 40k + super.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

"

In this diverse role, your key responsibilities will include:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Drafting and reviewing a broad range of commercial agreements
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advising senior management & the wider business on a variety of legal & regulatory issues

A demonstrated capability in advising on commercial contracts (including procurement contracts), product liability, privacy and data security and competition and consumer law will be highly regarded.
