title: Account Manager - TV Research
advertiser: Nielsen Television Audience Measurement Pty Ltd
description:
b"
  • Looking for a dynamic career with a company that encourages and rewards creativity and fresh thinking?
  • Do you love turning the complex into something simple and easy to understand?
  • Do you want to take on a new challenge in a global organisation?

If you answered yes to these, then we have the role for you...

We currently have a vacancy for a Manager in our Client Service team at Nielsen Television Audience Measurement (TAM), the TV ratings company. We are the official source of television audience measurement for the free to air networks and subscription television channels in Australia.

You will be part of a team based in Sydney dedicated to providing our TV and advertising clients with the highest level of service by delivering an exceptional standard of information, assistance and support.

You will need 2-3 years relevant media experience in order to develop strong relationships with Regional TAM, your assigned Television network, and other clients to assist them with all their TAM and Arianna software needs.

In this role you will need to build excellent product/company knowledge to assist your clients with:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Viewing behaviour analysis and data insights

\xe2\x80\xa2 Resolution of data queries
\xe2\x80\xa2 Client and industry education
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analysis software support and training

To join our team you would need to be:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Curious, with the ability to problem solve and have a strong attention to detail
\xe2\x80\xa2 Numerate and interested in data analysis
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enthusiastic, pro-active, goal-oriented with the ability to work autonomously
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint

\xe2\x80\xa2 Previous experience using a media analysis software tool is beneficial
\xe2\x80\xa2 Well-developed in your written and verbal communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 A team player who actively participates in achieving group goals

\xc2\xa0

This role also involves interstate travel to various client sites as required and a current driver's license is a must.

Interested?

If you wish to apply, please forward\xc2\xa0CV and accompanying cover letter outlining your relevant experience by clicking 'Apply Now'.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Senior Account Executive
description:
b'

Your new opportunity

At Cheil Australia, we are more than just a Brand and Retail ideas company. Ranked 15th globally and a true deliverer of integrate solutions, we are a company that others aspire to be a part of. With offices in 35 countries and ranked 15th in the world, this truly global agency delivers integrated solutions that move people, brand and product.

We are seeking a Senior\xc2\xa0Account Executive who is looking to work hard and prove themselves.\xc2\xa0 The ideal candidate is an energetic confident and passionate individual, keen to develop a career within an agency focused culture. \xc2\xa0Your positive personality, can do attitude and love for a challenge will be key to your success.

Your new role

Among your responsibilities will be to:

  • Procure and develop concise and accurate studio briefs in conjunction with Account Management team
  • Develop timelines and project plans, manage deadlines and monitor milestones through to completion of projects
  • Assist with the development and management of project budgets including third party costs, commissions, head hours and revenue forecasts
  • Work on monthly invoicing, create estimates, purchase orders, project budget management and billing forecasting\xc2\xa0
  • Coordinate and manage projects with local and offshore vendors and internal resources to guarantee on time, cost effective, delivery of assets\xc2\xa0
  • Respond, regularly, via quotes and presentations to client's quoting and bidding system
  • Assist with the analysis of project resource data to measure key performance indicators - actual figures versus forecast.

What you'll need to succeed

  • Tertiary education (Bachelor Degree preferred) in business, marketing or communications, highly desirable
  • Good understanding of communication and advertising \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0principles
  • Agility, flexibility and ability to manage multiple projects at once\xc2\xa0
  • Commitment to developing and maintaining client relationships
  • Excellent verbal and presentation communication skills
  • Be open to a multi-cultural work environment

What you'll get from us

You will be rewarded with a comprehensive remuneration package. We will provide you best in class training and development with career progressing opportunities and a great working environment.

How you can join our team

All you need to do to pursue your career goal is to click "Apply for this job" button below and start your adventure with us. For more details about the job, you can contact our Recruitment team on 02 9735 3400 and we are more than happy to discuss this exciting opportunity with you.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Lecturer (Assessment) and Associate Lecturer (Assessment and Evaluation)
description:
b'

Sydney Medical School
Reference no. 853/0517

  • We are looking for highly motivated individuals with strong statistical and qualitative and quantitative research skills
  • You will contribute to the effectiveness of the assessment of students in the SMP and be essential members of the assessment and evaluation team
  • Both roles are full-time, fixed term for two years, with the possibility of extension

About the opportunity
The Assessment and Evaluation Unit is an integral part of the SMP Education office. We are responsible for the design and implementation of formative and summative assessment across the SMP and for the evaluation of the program. The SMP is currently undergoing a curriculum renewal, which is expected to be implemented for Year 1 in 2020. You will be involved in the design of new assessment and evaluation components for the 2020 curriculum.

Lecturer:
You will work with clinicians who deliver the medical program to ensure that written and clinical assessments are valid representations of the curriculum. The position is supported by professional staff with whom you will work closely in implementing assessments. You will conduct statistical analyses (eg Rasch) to evaluate examinations as well as student performance, and provide feedback to students and written reports for teaching staff. \xc2\xa0Opportunities exist to develop expertise and conduct research in a particular area such as clinical assessment.

Associate Lecturer:
You will provide academic support for the SMP in Assessment and Evaluation under the supervision of the Academic Lead Assessment and the Academic Lead Evaluation. The position will encompass the three key areas of assessment, evaluation and admissions but includes opportunities for research specialisation. Your work will include consulting with clinicians who deliver the program, preparing assessment and evaluation materials with the assistance of professional staff, conducting statistical analyses and preparing written reports for staff and feedback to students as directed

About you
The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. We see the importance in recruiting talent aligned to these values in the pursuit of research excellence. We are looking for dedicated academics who have:

Lecturer:

  • postgraduate qualifications in psychometrics, health sciences, public health or medical education and a completed research based PhD using statistical methods or currently enrolled in a PhD
  • previous experience in developing and evaluating assessment tools in a tertiary education setting
  • demonstrated capacity to design and implement systems based improvements to an item bank
  • excellent quantitative statistical analysis skills and experience
  • a demonstrated academic track record with research publications/ consultancies/ grants and/or fellowships in a relevant field \xc2\xa0
  • broad knowledge of the Australian health system and of health professional education.

Associate Lecturer:

  • qualifications in psychometrics, health sciences, public health or medical education
  • experience with data processing and merging files from different databases
  • excellent quantitative statistical analysis skills and experience
  • skills and experience with qualitative data collection and analysis methods
  • broad knowledge of the Australian health system.

About us
Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We're Australia's first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across 9 campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 47,000 students.

We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.

For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job's listing on the University of Sydney careers website.

All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.\xc2\xa0 Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number to apply.

Closing date: 11pm 31 May 2017

The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.

\xc2\xa9 The University of Sydney

'

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
b'

Background

Operating within a young but rapidly growing niche area, your new employer has had a phenomenal rise to success in relatively short period of time. Built on incredible market expertise they aspire to being the most trusted and respected provider of risk services to the insurance market.

Current state

With such incredible pace and growth comes the opportunity to improve efficiencies and to build a robust technology platform that can help the business achieve its desired outcomes. Currently the business is in the process of developing an IT roadmap, critical to their success is the identification and appointment of an Enterprise Architect who will contribute to this plan and give scope to drive the future direction.

Future state

The Enterprise Architect will focus on digital architecture, incorporating both infrastructure and applications for their expanding business. The business has already developed a list of IT priorities, the operating model, and the roles required. Upcoming projects are centered around future cloud-based solutions, such as building a CRM, expanding current product offerings and additional services to clients, such as risk management tools, a client portal, and apps to leverage data and 3rd party integration. Data analytics have been identified as a key factor for the ongoing success in the future for the business and it is expected that this role will help to facilitate a move in that direction.

Environment

Operating in a largely cloud-based environment, they have recently implemented Active Directory via Azure for document storage, and the Office 365 environment. Effectively they have outsourced the management of their IT infrastructure but need to expand their current infrastructure to support their cloud-based solutions. A background in insurance systems is a bonus it is not essential.

What we need

This is a great opportunity for an innovative, self-starting professional who can think laterally and design and deliver solutions which are scale-able and which will change the way insurance is transacted.

We are seeking someone who:

  • Is able to drive technological advancements and outcomes for the business.
  • Can drive a more sophisticated, digital focus.
  • Will work with Senior Stakeholders to understand requirements and set a strategy for delivery.
  • Has project management skills and work with the existing Project Manager to support deliverables.
  • Can analyze and investigate their current insurance platform and make recommendations for improvements or for moving to a new platform in the medium term.
  • Can automate, automate, automate!
  • Will investigate and make recommendations for a new CRM.
  • Will make recommendations for a new portal.
  • Will set the direction for Data analytics and a Data warehouse.
  • Can communicate the Senior and C-level and can sell a concept or an idea without getting lost in the technical detail.
  • Will enjoy shaping the future growth of this expanding business.

This is a once in a career role in a true, greenfield site, if you would like to learn more then please contact Jason Ajai by sending your resume

'

title: Project Administrator / Dynamic and Innovative Team
description:
b"Imagine being given the opportunity to work for a global HR business that specialises in cultural and organisational change and also support\xc2\xa0an innovative and dynamic team.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
This company pride themselves on providing a team orientated and innovative environment - they offer a supportive team, progression opportunities and will open you up to a wide industry - get to know the leaders in the biz!! Add to that a fun young team and you have the whole package!!\xc2\xa0

This administration based role is part of a partnership supporting a team of 6 Account Managers. Sitting together as a close knit team you will be the go to person for anything admin based - essentially you are the glue keeping the team together!\xc2\xa0

This varied role will include duties such as:

  • Data entry and survey processing
  • Management of stock room - picture yourself as a sort of gate keeper
  • Setting up accounts in the system and assist with some reporting\xc2\xa0
  • Prepare training materials and courier to clients\xc2\xa0
  • Formatting presentations and reporting - think copy and paste rather than complete creation\xc2\xa0
  • Ensure CRM database is kept up to date\xc2\xa0
  • General team assistance and administration\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
This is an entry level role into the business and as such if you have recently graduated and are looking for a foot in the door then this could be the opportunity for you. Alternatively if you have some office/admin experience and are looking to progress your career and build on your skills then this could also be for you!\xc2\xa0

The pace of the role can vary depending on workflow so someone adaptable will be really effective in this role. If you are process driven and extremely detail orientated then you will love the duties you need to complete. Someone proactive, dynamic and flexible will also be successful, and a complete whizz with MS Office will be a superstar!!\xc2\xa0

If this sounds like the right career progression job for you, then don't think thrice or even twice, just hit that apply button now!

Alternatively if you have any questions then please don't hesitate to contact Jessica Baker on 9271 0033.
\xc2\xa0
We look forward to working with you! "

title: Premier Relationship Officer (Castle Hill)
description:
b'\xc2\xa0
Some careers have more impact than others.

Retail Banking and Wealth Management serves more than 50 million customers worldwide with a complete range of banking and wealth management services to enable them to manage their finances and protect and build their financial futures. title: Accounts Receivable Officer
description:
b"
  • Do you want to work in an environment where you will sharpen your communication skills?
  • Are you energised by a busy, dynamic environment where you will be an integral member of a high performing Finance team?
  • Are you meticulous in your attention to detail and not afraid to ask questions to find the right answers?

Thomas Holt provides a boutique style of aged care services and we are proud that our staff commitment and care enables our residents to 'Love Where They Live'.

About the Role:

We are seeking a dynamic, client-focused Full Time Accounts Receivable Officer to join our team at Thomas Holt.

What you can offer us:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Accounting/Finance or relevant, related discipline or equivalent experience in a similar role
  • Experience in the Aged Care Not for Profit Sector is highly regarded
  • Sound knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, advanced MS Excel skills required
  • Experience with the EPICOR system will be highly regarded
  • Highly analytical & strong attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Passion for aged care
  • Empathy towards and ability to communicate with internal and external stakeholders
  • Work with limited supervision at times and be collaborative, where required
  • Highly developed computer literacy skills and sound understanding of electronic financial data base

Be part of a progressive organisation that values our people.

What we can offer you:

  • Competitive remuneration package and access to salary packaging;
  • Learning and Development program;
  • Access to information technology systems for operations and development; and
  • Career development plan.

What you would be involved with:

  • Maintain a high level of customer service when responding with empathy and efficiency to client queries
  • Contribute to the operation and integrity of the departmental accounts receivable system and ensure accounts receivable functions are delivered effectively and efficiently for clients
  • Day to day processing of payments and deposits
  • Collation and distribution of invoices and statements

  • Conduct regular reviews of policies and procedures to identify issues or provide improvement to current procedures and systems and continually review and update the process of accounts payment to ensure that it meets Auditor requirement and is achieved with maximum efficiency.

Successful applicants will need to complete a National Police Record Check

title: Automation Test Engineer
description:
b'

Immediate requirement for a Strong Automation Test Engineer to join one of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s largest brands. Initially for a 6 month engagement with extensions to follow, you will be embedded within a cross functional, test infected, Agile Development Team.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


The ideal candidate will have come from a product background that understands the nuances of developing product solutions with the intention of releasing it to an external market on a regular basis.\xc2\xa0


Previous experience from a Telco environment working in a similar nature will be highly regarded for the role.


Day-To-Day



  • Write, maintain and enhance Test automation scripts and framework including its infrastructure, data and execution practice
  • Write automation test scripts using existing or new test frameworks for projects and regression.
  • Create automation tools or scripts that support testing infrastructure
  • Manage test infrastructure and execution of automated tests
  • Continuously maintain automated test cases
  • Improve the automated testing framework, as required, for reusability and scalability
  • Act as a key liaison between testing and development & release teams

Skills Required



  • Strong Java Core knowledge
  • Strong Experience in automation testing using Java Selenium, Java Script frameworks for Enterprise RESTful APIs.
  • Performance testing experience (using JMeter or any equivalent tools)
  • Experience in writing automated test frameworks (GUI and Non-GUI)
  • Experience in version control tools
  • Extensive knowledge and experience in testing and supporting cloud-based applications
  • Hands on experience with Search systems, e.g. Elastic Search
  • Enterprise solution testing experience\xc2\xa0 (Highly desirable)
  • Highly motivated to achieve results
  • Familiar with Agile framework and tools

Please apply now or contact Danny @ danny@finxl.com.au for more info.

'

title: Lean Six Sigma Consultants (S7)
description:
b"

FinXL have exclusive opportunities for a range of Green Lean Six Sigma Consultants for a long term engagement with one of our key customers.
Working on-site, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be involved in leading the Business Re-engineering initiatives across a key program of work. As a Green Belt, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be required to gather data gathering, conduct analysis across key areas of the program and contribute your functional knowledge to the project teams.


To be successful for the role, you must be able to demonstrate the following:



  • Engage with Supply Chain & Operations leadership on business problems and collaborate to bring effective solutions
  • Translate client problems into business requirements that can be transitioned into delivery functions for execution
  • Facilitate application and tools assessment for Operational Excellence / LSS processes
  • Ability to plan, design and implement LSS related strategies to drive business adoption
  • Develop articulate presentations that communicate proposals, strategies, plans and outcomes
  • Involved in / lead / manage high performing teams to deliver quality outcomes aligned to Time, Quality and Cost metrics

Professional experience & qualifications:



  • 5 years' experience in using Green Belt Lean Six Sigma techniques within an enterprise wide environment
  • Knowledge and experience in business transformation using Lean methodologies and best practices
  • Proven track record to quickly understand the key value drivers of a business, how they impact the scope and approach of client assignment
  • Possess commercial acumen with ability to tailor solutions to enhance effectiveness and to identify valuable client development opportunities

Apply now or for\xc2\xa0more info please contact Danny on dannyv@finxl.com.au

title: Billing and Contracts Administrator
description:
b'

The Company

Our people have made Fuji Xerox what it is today - a leading edge document technology and services company. We provide essential back office support that clears the way for customers to focus on their core business.

The Role

We have an exciting new opportunity for a well organised, customer focused problem solver to join our team as a Billing and Contracts Administrator based at Macquarie Park.

The key objective of the role will be to administer and invoice existing Fuji Xerox contracts and implement new contracts in accordance with the terms and conditions of each Master Services Agreement.

The key responsibilities of the role will be:

  • Generating and releasing invoices by the due date
  • Resolving invoice disputes and queries promptly and efficiently
  • Reviewing and validating equipment orders relating to contracts and ensuring accuracy of data
  • Validating new contracts and amendments and ensuring the billing system is updated to ensure customers are invoiced on time and accurately
  • Ensuring revenue is accurately reflected in the monthly profit and loss reporting

The Person

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Strong numeracy & literacy skills
  • The ability to work autonomously as well as working as part of the team
  • Initiative and be a self-starter
  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse range of stakeholders
  • Experience in reading and interpreting contractual clauses is desirable
  • The ability to achieve outcomes through problem solving and thinking outside the square
  • Intermediate Excel, Outlook& Access skills

If you enjoy working in with a friendly and supportive team, love solving problems for customers and like a diverse and challenging role, then don\xe2\x80\x99t hesitate and apply now.

Fuji Xerox has an open and diverse culture and you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of tasks and collaborate with talented people.

'

title: Quality Officer
salary: b'Up to 80k + Super, + Vehicle., phn, laptop'
description:
b"

About the business and the role

We are Australia's largest privately owned housing maintenance company. Our clients include Public Housing and\xc2\xa0Community Housing across NSW, WA and\xc2\xa0Tasmania.\xc2\xa0

Reporting directly to the National Compliance Manager, this essential position will be responsible for ensuring Contract based compliance and auditing for the entire NSW state.\xc2\xa0

Job tasks and responsibilities

Management of all Customer Improvement Notices (CIRs)

  • Respond to all CIRs in a timely manner.
  • Monitor trends in CIR data, and report on these.
  • Liaise with the appropriate bodies in finalising CIRs
  • Negotiate agreed outcomes on disputed CIRs
  • Provide a weekly report to the State Manager on CIR information

\xc2\xa0

Audits

  • Conduct audits for on-site issues.
  • Ensure follow-up actions from on-site audits are completed in a timely manner.
  • In conjunction with Manager, ensure Work in Progress Inspections are completed in a timely manner.

\xc2\xa0

Quality Inspections

  • Complete site quality inspections as required.
  • Undertake trends analysis
  • Provide a weekly report to the State Manager
  • Review QI completions by FS & defects raised to ensure adequate results are recorded and defects closed correctly

\xc2\xa0

Reporting

  • Attend weekly operational meetings with internal and external stakeholders

Skills and experience

To be considered for this position, you must come with the following skills and experience;\xc2\xa0

  • More that 2 years experience in the same or similar position.\xc2\xa0
  • A sound and working knowledge of SHE legislations for NSW
  • A solid and demonstrated work ethic.
  • Able to work autonomously.\xc2\xa0
  • Able to communicate politely and efficiently\xc2\xa0with all areas of the business. \xc2\xa0I.e. Exec Manager to Trade on site.\xc2\xa0
  • Experience managing reporting and audit admin.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Job benefits and perks

We offer full training, and all tools of trade to get this role off the ground. \xc2\xa0We are growing fast, and there is room for the right candidate to grow with the business and learn from some of the best SMEs in this industry.\xc2\xa0

title: NA
description:
b"

Freedom is Australia's leading furniture and homewares retailer, located throughout Australia in 50 locations, and in New Zealand. We are owned by Steinhoff Asia Pacific, which employs over 10,000 people, across 8 retail brands and 616 stores.

As one of the\xc2\xa0nation's leading lifestyle\xc2\xa0retailers, our teams are\xc2\xa0innovative, passionate\xc2\xa0and\xc2\xa0energetic, all working closely together in a\xc2\xa0high performance culture.


Role:

An exciting opportunity exists for an experienced\xc2\xa0Email Channel Manager, with a track-record of driving email growth to join our passionate and talented digital team. As Email & Content Manager you will lead and facilitate the\xc2\xa0performance of the email channel, as well as manage the delivery of\xc2\xa0freedom's\xc2\xa0content marketing\xc2\xa0plan across all digital channels including\xc2\xa0social media.

Working with internal stakeholders, including an in-house creative team, you will manage the end to end campaign planning, execution and optimisation of the email and content channels to\xc2\xa0meet and exceed email database growth, open rate, click through, conversion and revenue targets.

The right candidate will be a\xc2\xa0data driven marketer\xc2\xa0with a\xc2\xa0passion for digital\xc2\xa0and\xc2\xa0strong drive for results. With impeccable communication and relationship building ability this role will present every opportunity for you to succeed in a growing digital team.

The successful candidate will have:

  • Minimum 3 years\xc2\xa0digital marketing / ecommerce experience
  • Track record in driving\xc2\xa0email channel growth\xc2\xa0(omni-channel preferred)
  • Content marketing and Social Media experience (highly desirable)
  • Experience utilising\xc2\xa0website analytics\xc2\xa0packages
  • Strong\xc2\xa0analytical\xc2\xa0and reporting skills
  • Exceptional time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Team player, flexible and\xc2\xa0proactive\xc2\xa0attitude

We offer:

  • Free onsite gym
  • The opportunity to work with a\xc2\xa0talented\xc2\xa0and\xc2\xa0passionate\xc2\xa0digital team
  • A vibrant and\xc2\xa0fun team\xc2\xa0environment
  • Generous staff discounts\xc2\xa0across company brands, including freedom, Bay Leather Republic, Snooze and more

If you are an\xc2\xa0experienced\xc2\xa0direct & data driven marketer,\xc2\xa0with\xc2\xa0omni-channel\xc2\xa0experience, this is the role for you! Please submit your resume and brief cover letter by clicking on the link below.

"

title: Account Coordinator
description:
b" STARCOM is a world-renowned media agency that simplifies human understanding to deliver meaningful brand experiences. STARCOM does this by creating the Space for Ideas, in peoples' minds and in the world, via a unique approach that gives the agency an unparalleled advantage. With over 1,200 employees, STARCOM helps get the right consumers' attention and delivers brand-building results for many of the world's leading companies.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
This is a diverse and varied role across one of the most high profile accounts in the agency. This role will sit in the newly created Publicis One model.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
The role is fast-paced and challenging, with room for growth and progression.You will be required to work closely with the Account Executive and Manager assisting with the day-to-day management of client requests.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • To provide support to the team on planning campaigns
  • Regularly update plans
  • Delivery of competitive reports, including analysis
  • Ad-hoc competitive requests

  • Establish strong working relationships with Investment and Rapport team members
  • Administrative support
  • Develop a sound understanding of clients' specific industries
  • Prepare and help with client presentations

We're looking for a confident and outgoing Account Coordinator. Enthusiasm and a willingness to learn are absolutely key. We have a sociable agency culture and someone who's willing to get involved with this will fit in perfectly!

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
b'
The Company

Infomedia Ltd is a publicly-listed company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX symbol "IFM"). We are a leading supplier of information solutions to the parts and service sector of the global automotive industry whose business solutions are currently used each business day by over 150,000 dealership personnel. They are produced in almost 30 languages and at work in 186 countries. Their powerful search functions and intuitive, user-friendly interface helps boost efficiency, profitability and customer retention for OE Parts and Service Departments.

What is it Infomedia need?

We\xe2\x80\x99re on the hunt for a serious Business Systems Analyst to join our fast paced and ever expanding global SaaS business. \xc2\xa0Business Systems encompasses all IT systems (email, collaboration tools, authentication, VPN, laptops, etc), Information Systems that underpin the core workflows of Infomedia (ERP, CRM, Subscription Billing, Project Management, HRIS, etc), business intelligence (data warehouse, business reporting), and systems integration. The success of this person will hinge on them being someone who combines a passion for software development, a meticulous eye for detail and a documentation expert. Think passion, creativity, skill, intelligence, EQ and personality in equal high levels.\xc2\xa0 We want energy, we want drive, we want innovation and forever looking for continual improvement.

\xc2\xa0

Key Responsibilities:

  • Support the integrity of, and enhancing the efficiency of critical Business Systems and infrastructure.
  • 60% technical role focusing, on support and project work encompassing C#ASP.NET Stack development, WebAPI, MS BI Suite development (SSRS, SSAS, SSIS) and Legacy Dynamics CRM support.
  • 40% Functional role, focusing on stakeholder partnering, liaising with various department from Sales to Finance in elicitation and documentation of requirements
  • In collaboration with wider Business Systems and Global IT team, execute on the the Business Systems roadmap.
  • Through utilizing your expertise, provide commentary and recommendations into Business Systems programs and projects.

Essential Experience:

  • 5+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in IT and Business Systems Analysis roles
  • Polyglot/Tech agnostic full stack development experience (Ideally .NET Specialization)
  • Well-honed stakeholder management experience
  • Seasoned Business Analysis skills and requirement elicitation and documentation expertise
  • Ideally experience in a Sys Admin or similar role
  • Testing experience will be well regarded
  • Ideally you will have worked in a software product environment previously
  • Seasoned professional communication skills, both written and verbal

Why would you choose us?

Alongside the interesting work, complex problems to solve and the ability to work on a suite of globally recognized products, we offer:

  • Onsite Gym
  • Quarterly meetups
  • Games area
  • Brand new campus minutes from the Northern Beaches
  • Family social events.
  • Casual Fridays and afternoon drinks.

Interested in chatting?

If you think this sounds like you and you would like to be part of a culture that rewards performance and encourages ideas, then please press the "apply now" button below and submit your resume.

'

title: NA
description:
b"You only get out what you put in. This is something that I\xe2\x80\x99ve heard many times over the years and as a sales professional there is no simpler a description of what success in sales is about.

If you are driven to earn a serious income, looking to work in an emerging and evolving marketplace and learn skills for life then read on.

Viiew is a unique type of services firm focused on addressing the Talent and IT services needs of Australia's Top 100 organisations. Viiew provides services solutions differentiated by increasing value, offering clients the flexibility to manage their desired risk profile, priorities and desired project or operational outcomes.

We work with medium to enterprise-sized organisations with large IT departments who need to engage IT Consultants regularly and quickly to supplement or expand their teams. \xc2\xa0Owned by Dimension Data, a global IT services and solutions provider. Viiew benefits from a greater depth, insight and knowledge into the IT labour marketplace.

We are currently seeking a goal oriented, driven individual looking to grow their sales career \xe2\x80\x93 do you want to join our team?

\xc2\xa0This is an exciting and rewarding role as an integral member of the NSW branch, driving sales achievements and fulfilling our growth strategy. You will take ownership of all new clients that you bring onboard whilst further developing some existing accounts. We will invest in your future, train you on our service offerings, develop and grow your capability and in turn we are looking for your commitment to succeed.

You will be supported by a dedicated team, expert knowledge and a leading market positioning.

\xc2\xa0This opportunity is not to be missed.


In this position you will be responsible for:
  • Direct sales growth of the NSW branch accounts, new business pipeline and account development.
  • Picking up the phone and developing new business pipeline
  • Identifying IT staff Augmentation services sales prospects and developing relationships with new clients
  • Contributing and driving sales strategies in collaboration with the National Sales Manager.
  • Client engagement, relationship management and growth.
  • Build client acquisition plans
  • Ensure client satisfaction
  • Achieve GP targets
  • Plan and manage client accounts
  • Interact and co-operate with\xc2\xa0delivery teams
  • Perform sales administration
\xc2\xa0
Your previous experience may\xc2\xa0include:
  • A desire to make money and\xc2\xa0have a passion for hunting new business
  • IT recruitment background
  • Eager to learn and develop your career in a fast changing industry
  • Flexible / adaptable approach
  • Collaborative team player
  • Degree, or similar is\xc2\xa0desirable
  • Self-motivated is a must
  • Structured and methodical approach helps
  • Act as corporate citizen
  • Display the right behaviours
\xc2\xa0
You will be rewarded with a responsive and balanced workplace, unparalleled IT industry positioning, excellent benefits and salary structure along with a talented and focused team.




To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Chris Tellett 02 8249 5048\xc2\xa0. Please quote our job reference number: 221994.

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Chris Tellett on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 221994. "

title: Account Manager - TV Research
advertiser: Nielsen Television Audience Measurement Pty Ltd
description:
b"
  • Looking for a dynamic career with a company that encourages and rewards creativity and fresh thinking?
  • Do you love turning the complex into something simple and easy to understand?
  • Do you want to take on a new challenge in a global organisation?

If you answered yes to these, then we have the role for you...

We currently have a vacancy for a Manager in our Client Service team at Nielsen Television Audience Measurement (TAM), the TV ratings company. We are the official source of television audience measurement for the free to air networks and subscription television channels in Australia.

You will be part of a team based in Sydney dedicated to providing our TV and advertising clients with the highest level of service by delivering an exceptional standard of information, assistance and support.

You will need 2-3 years relevant media experience in order to develop strong relationships with Regional TAM, your assigned Television network, and other clients to assist them with all their TAM and Arianna software needs.

In this role you will need to build excellent product/company knowledge to assist your clients with:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Viewing behaviour analysis and data insights

\xe2\x80\xa2 Resolution of data queries
\xe2\x80\xa2 Client and industry education
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analysis software support and training

To join our team you would need to be:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Curious, with the ability to problem solve and have a strong attention to detail
\xe2\x80\xa2 Numerate and interested in data analysis
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enthusiastic, pro-active, goal-oriented with the ability to work autonomously
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint

\xe2\x80\xa2 Previous experience using a media analysis software tool is beneficial
\xe2\x80\xa2 Well-developed in your written and verbal communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 A team player who actively participates in achieving group goals

This role also involves interstate travel to various client sites as required and a current driver's license is a must.

Interested?

If you wish to apply, please forward\xc2\xa0CV and accompanying cover letter outlining your relevant experience by clicking 'Apply Now'.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Supply Planner
description:
b'

Ranked #2 on the GPTW's Best Places to Work in Australia, Stryker is one of the world's leading Medical Technology companies offering a diverse array of innovative reconstructive, medical, surgical, neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and satisfying lives.

Stryker continues to grow at a fast pace due to the highly-talented, hardworking team of people who fuel the company and the state-of-art products.\xc2\xa0 To keep up with this growth and continue to provide the high-quality service, we are currently recruiting a Supply Planner to join our team in St Leonards!

Role:

As a Supply Planner, you will be part of the Planning & Coordinating team and responsible for the replenishment of stock and delivering on customer commitments for a portfolio of capital goods and consumables within Stryker South Pacific. You will be the primary internal point of contact for the portfolio, working closely with Sales, Marketing, Finance, Technical Services, Customer Service, Quality, and corresponding suppliers.\xc2\xa0

You will be responsible for:

  • Purchasing, tracking purchase orders, and maintaining relationships with suppliers
  • Coordinating the dispatch, delivery, and billing of capital products
  • Reducing inbound freight costs while keeping high service levels
  • Adhering to operational budgets to support the fulfillment of sales orders
  • Managing optimal inventory levels
  • Planning strategic purchases
  • Driving lasting changes

To be successful, you'll have:

  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Proactive and clear communication skills
  • Customer first focus
  • Ability to work in a team setting and collaborate with other cross-functional teams
  • Ability to handle large amounts of inputs/data with strong attention to detail
  • Supply Chain understanding
  • Ability to prioritise and stay organised to ensure deadlines are met
  • Competency to learn new technology and systems
  • Willingness and drive to continuously lead long-term improvements

If you have these skills, and you want to work somewhere that makes a positive impact on peoples' lives, please apply now to begin your Stryker Career!

'

title: NSW State Sales Manager - Commercial Lighting Industry
description:
b'

Our client is a well-established and highly reputable supplier of world class LED lighting solutions for commercial, industrial and architectural applications. The company\xe2\x80\x99s enviable reputation is built on more than two decades of experience providing class leading products and design services to electrical engineers, contractors and end users accounts. Currently there is an exciting opportunity to progress your career with this leading company in the role of NSW State Sales Manager.

The role

Working out of the company\xe2\x80\x99s Sydney office, the NSW State Sales Manager reports to the National Sales Manager and is responsible for leading and developing a team of Technical Sales Representatives while also playing an active role in securing and delivering lighting projects throughout NSW. The position will seek to develop and implement state based sales initiatives, implement and monitor KPI\xe2\x80\x99s and sales budgets and play an active role coaching the sales teams. As the NSW Sales Manager, you will also take a lead role in developing close working relationships and supporting a range of clients including consulting engineers, lighting designers, councils, architects and end users. The successful incumbent will also work closely with the company\xe2\x80\x99s in house design team to provide appropriate lighting designs, maintaining project tracking and customer data and forecasting to ensure budgeted sales figures are achieved for the region.

Required Experience

  • Demonstrated sales leadership experience within the lighting or electrical industry;
  • Strong knowledge of commercial, industrial or architectural lighting;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of the specification process with lighting consultants;
  • A track record of experience in securing and delivering large lighting projects;
  • Reliable, tenacious and energetic personality with a desire to progress your career;
  • Strong relationship building, communication and presentation skills;
  • Proven ability to develop new business and achieve sales targets;
  • Relevant electrical trade or engineering qualifications would be an advantage; and
  • Able to work autonomously or in a team environment.

This is an exciting opportunity to progress your career with a leading supplier of high end, energy efficient LED lighting solutions. The position offers the successful incumbent a supportive, friendly environment and culture and the opportunity to lead a team while playing an active role in business development. On offer is an attractive negotiable $100K + salary + vehicle allowance + bonuses and expenses.

To submit an application, please click below. For a confidential discussion, please call Chris O\xe2\x80\x99Flynn at u&u on 07 3232 9111, quoting reference number 8190.

Please submit your resume in Word format only.

'

title: Communications, Media & Technology  Cloud Advisory  Consultant to Manager
description:
b'

About the business and the role

Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world.\xc2\xa0 The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.\xc2\xa0Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

Accenture Communications, Media & Technology (CMT) helps companies connect with digital consumers, launch innovative products and services, increase revenues and streamline operations to reduce costs.

Due to an exciting growth and capability build phase, CMT is currently seeking market leading consulting talent to join our high performing team.

Working closely with our clients, consulting professionals design, build and implement strategies that can help enhance business performance. They develop specialized expertise-strategic, industry, functional, technical-in a diverse project environment that offers multiple opportunities for career growth. While the specific type of consulting work they do can vary, it generally aligns to management consulting, systems integration consulting or technology consulting. Typically, Consultants work at client sites, which often requires travel.

Accenture applies industry know-how to help our clients swiftly and safely migrate to the cloud to unlock the business value of as-a-Service now, and the CMT Technology Advisory practice area plays a key role in enabling this 'Journey to Cloud'. Accenture consulting professionals in this practice area define the 'Journey to Cloud' by providing the strategy, assessment and roadmap required for thus journey. Our consultants detail the value case, target state design and delivery model according to unique preferences and needs of clients to achieve their business strategy.

Job tasks and responsibilities

Key responsibilities:

  • Assist clients with the development of business cases and value realization plans for the deployment of cloud based services.
  • Identify business requirements and corresponding cloud based solutions.
  • Eagerness to participate on a team designing cloud based application hosting and data services.
  • Assist in cloud security advisory and cloud journey management
  • Assist clients with identifying opportunities to utilize cloud based services.
  • Apply Accenture methodology, Accenture reusable assets, and previous work experience to delivery consistently high quality work.
  • Deliver written or oral status reports regularly.
  • Stay educated on new and emerging market offerings that may be of interest to our clients.
  • Adapt to existing methods and procedures to create possible alternative solutions to moderately complex problems.
  • Use considerable judgment to define solution and seeks guidance on complex problems.

Professional experience & qualifications

  • At least three years' experience in a consulting environment, with specific exposure to some of the following areas: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

  • Cloud Advisory

  • Knowledge of/exposure to the following domains:

  • Virtualization Platforms (e.g. VMWare, Hyper-V, etc.).
  • Cloud Computing and Storage (AWS, Azure)
  • Cloud Management Platforms (vrealize, Gravitant, etc.)
  • Infrastructure provisioning and management (Puppet, Chef, Ansible)\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
    • Public and private cloud discovery, design, build, and migration experience

    \xc2\xa0

    Skills and experience

    • Proven track record to quickly understand the key value drivers of a business, how they impact the scope and approach of the engagemen
    • Have an awareness of the latest cloud offerings and related technologies.
    • Strong project management and organisational skills including the ability to prioritise tasks and meet deadlines
    • Ability to develop and maintain strong internal and client relationships
    • Proven track record in working creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
    • Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment with effective consulting skills
    • Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skill
    • Bachelor's Degree is essential.

    Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

title: Senior Manager, Precinct Retail Activation & Customer Experience
advertiser: The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation
description:
b'

\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


Unique opportunity focused on the iconic Darling Harbour & The Rocks precincts


Grade 11/12, salary package up to $152,482


Full time ongoing opportunity based in Sydney


\xc2\xa0


Our Organisation


\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


Place Management NSW is responsible for some of Sydney\xe2\x80\x99s most historically and culturally significant waterfront locations and most importantly The Rocks and Darling Harbour.\xc2\xa0 Attracting over 40 million visitors per year, Place Management aims to create extraordinary experiences for locals and visitors.\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


This is a senior role in the Partnerships, Activation and Customer Experience Team within Place Management NSW. We are seeking a collaborative and innovative executive to lead the retail activation, marketing and customer experience strategy for The Rocks and Darling Harbour precincts to effectively position them in the hearts and minds of Sydneysiders and visitors and drive traffic and turnover.


\xc2\xa0


Key responsibilities include:


Development of the strategic retail marketing plan and delivery of the activity calendar across both precincts demonstrating excellence in execution for all programs across owned, earned and paid channels.


Leading development of the Customer Experience strategy (informed by data/research), engagement with key stakeholders and delivery of key initiatives across physical and digital experiences.


Collaborating with retail operations, commercial partnerships, events delivery, marketing and agency teams to deliver an enhanced customer experience every day.


\xc2\xa0


To succeed in this role you will have previous experience in:


\xc2\xa0


Developing and driving the delivery of multidimensional strategic retail marketing and customer experience plans.


Effectively managing a range of high level internal and external stakeholders and competing interests in order to achieve precinct visitation, activation and commercial outcomes.


Achieving multiple project objectives given limited resources, tight deadlines and competing demands and priorities.


Leading a team to effectively deliver and optimise a retail marketing plan and partnering with the team to develop their capabilities.


\xc2\xa0


Place Management NSW is part of Property NSW, the NSW\xe2\x80\x99s Government agency responsible for:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


Leading property reform


Active portfolio and asset management


Delivering transactions and major projects


Place making and heritage conservation, and


Valuation services


\xc2\xa0


Learn more:\xc2\xa0Please review the Role Description. \xc2\xa0For enquiries regarding this position, please contact Justine Earl-Smith on 02 9240 8774. Understand more about the Department of Finance, Services and Innovation.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


TARGET QUESTIONS


\xc2\xa0


  1. Describe a time where you considered creative options to address a business issue. Walk us through your thinking process and the steps you took.
  2. Describe a time when you had to manage relationships internal or external stakeholders. Why was it important for you to engage their support? What techniques did you use? What happened?

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


Closing date: 24 May 2017[11:59PM] your application should include a two page cover letter, which includes your response to the two target questions, and an up-to-date resume of no more than five pages which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to this role. Applicants invited for interview will be required to complete additional assessments. There are no selection criteria to be addressed.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


Salary: Grade 11/12 maximum salary package up to $152,482 Package includes salary [$118,943 - $137,557] and employer\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to superannuation, commensurate with skills and experience.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


Job Status: Ongoing under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


Apply now: at IworkforNSW Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact their helpdesk 1800 562 679.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


Job reference: 000058OJ


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation is an EEO employer and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultures and people with a disability. At DFSI, we endeavour to make roles flexible. While these roles are advertised as full time, we will consider requests to undertake flexible work arrangements including on a part-time or job share basis.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0



\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0

description:
b"

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. b'

Who are we?

What do we stand for?

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Provide highest standard of technical support, develop personal technical expertise

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Increase customer satisfaction, refine customer management skills

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Advance reputation of the company\xc2\xa0

Why you?

You are someone who gets excited by innovation. You are a highly driven and confident Sales Professional who wants to work for a values based organisation whose solutions are leading edge. You are focused, collaborative and passionate about the work that you do. In addition, you possess the following relevant skills:

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Diploma/Degree in Electrical, Electronic, Power, Process Automation, Mechatronic, Chemical, Software or Computer Engineering, or Trade Qualification with relevant experience

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Product specific training and Training qualifications desirable

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Computer literate, Excellent written and spoken abilities, Technical fault finding skills, Data analysis, Awareness of electrical standards\xc2\xa0

Why us?

At Schneider Electric, we\xc2\xa0are open, we value differences, we listen, we learn, connect, and collaborate with others.\xc2\xa0 We\xc2\xa0are passionate\xc2\xa0about our customers, our people, our business and our technology. We are positive in our approach to finding solutions that better our lives.

\xc2\xa0

#LI-DG1

title: National Fasttrack 360 Analyst
description:
b"

National Fasttrack 360 Analyst

Who are we? The Toll Group is the Asian region's leading provider of integrated logistics services, employing over 40,000 staff, generating annual revenue of AU$8.8 billion. Toll operates an extensive network of 1200 sites throughout more than 50 countries across the world

The Role: This role maintains and monitors Fasttrack360 data integrity and accessibility, and assists the National IT Manager in identifying and implementing new functional capabilities to Fasttrack360 system. This role will collaborate with the training and quality department and other key stakeholders within Toll People to administer national reports, meet compliance standards, troubleshoot system issues and implement IT infrastructure, process and system improvements in accordance with the National IT strategy. As a Fasttrack360 subject matter expert, this role is accountable for maintaining and improving system functionality and delivering national solutions to support operational efficiency and overall business objectives.

More specifically:

  • Ownership of all queries related to Fasttrack360 and time and attendance vendors and referring user based errors to National Fasttrack360 Trainer.
  • Liaising between Toll People and Fasttrack360 vendor to coordinate support tasks and assist with system enhancements.
  • Work in close collaboration with the National Fasttrack360 Trainer and National Training & Quality Manager to deliver IT initiatives which comply with standard operating procedures, meet compliance expectations in terms of data integrity and reports provide relevant and useful data to support operational teams performance.
  • Liaise with Fasttrack360 consultants on fixing system issues, job order, incorrect set-ups and report-running.
  • A commitment to continuous improvement of Fasttrack360 system functionality and accessibility to internal and external stakeholders.

Why work at Toll Group? We\xe2\x80\x99re committed to providing a safe, diverse, satisfying and fulfilling workplace for all of our people. We value integrity, trust, teamwork and being open and transparent. We believe that people perform best when they are empowered, accountable and recognised. We are passionately committed to supporting our people in their career aspirations.

If you feel you meet the requirements stated above, and the role is of interest, please apply via the link below.

title: Senior Receptionist - Prestigious Professional Services Firm - CBD
description:
b'Lotus People are currently looking for a\xc2\xa0full time\xc2\xa0senior receptionist to work for a prestigious and highly respected firm in Sydney CBD - one of our favourite clients! Leading the receptionist team, you will be responsible for delivering high quality and consistent customer experience every day.\xc2\xa0

The Company

This business is a leader in their field. They have stunning offices in the heart of the CBD and they truly value their staff and their development. The offices are traditional yet modern, have a highly reputable name and a truly supportive and down to earth culture, with fantastic tenure.\xc2\xa0

The Role

The senior receptionist will lead a team of three in providing exceptional customer service through face to face meeting and greeting, switchboard management and relevant administrative support and event coordination. This role is perfectly suited to someone who wants to lead a team, have flexibility and can alternate their hours week to week with the following shifts;
  • 8am to 4pm with 1 hour for lunch
  • 9am to 5pm with 1 hour for lunch
  • 10am to 6pm with 1 hour for lunch
The Duties
  • Answering calls on a busy switchboard
  • Maintain a proactive team culture within the reception team, leading by example to provide courteous service to all stakeholders
  • Taking detailed messages and passing them on to the appropriate staff members
  • Redirecting incoming emails
  • Take bookings for meeting rooms
  • Maintaining stationary stock
  • Supporting the Events Manager with events administration
  • Other administrative duties (data entry, mailouts etc)\xc2\xa0
The Candidate

We are looking for an experienced and polished senior receptionist who takes pride in appearance, has great customer facing experience, is well spoken, articulate, and takes a genuine pride in providing exceptional service.\xc2\xa0
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills and an excellent phone manner
  • Ability to work in a corporate environment
  • Previous corporate reception \xc2\xa0and team leader/ supervisory experience
  • Competent in MS Office suite\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
The Process

This is genuinely a fantastic opportunity for a professional corporate receptionist who wants to work in a prestigious and highly regarded organization who places huge value on their employees, along with flexible working hours.\xc2\xa0

If this sounds like the role for you, apply now and Lotus People will screen your resume and come back to you within 48 hours. '

SGS is the world's leading inspection, verification, testing and certification company. SGS is recognised as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. With more than 90,000 employees, SGS operates a network of over 1,650 offices and laboratories around the world.

title: Business Project Manager - HR/Payroll
description:
b"

The Company

News Corp Australia is the nation's largest media company operating over 150 house-hold name brands across print, digital and multimedia including The Daily and Sunday Telegraph and your local community paper, The Australian and news.com.au. We are proud to be a central part of News Corp, a leading global network of powerful brands in news and information services, sports programming in Australia, digital real estate services, book publishing, digital education and pay-TV distribution in Australia including Fox Sports, Dow Jones, Harper Collins, Realestate.com.au and The Wall Street Journal.

The Role

As our Project Manager you will form part of our HR/Payroll Transformation Program. In this role, you will oversee and drive to completion all business-side aspects of the program, ensuring that your colleagues in HR and Payroll can look forward to improved systems, end-to-end processes, appropriate training, and better data management.

At its core, the Program is about implementing and integrating a new payroll system (Preceda) with an upgraded version of our main HR system (Workday) and (in a later stage) extending this with a Time and Attendance / Workforce Management system. But just as important as the IT components is the successful delivery of your scope; improved business processes, business data management, and people management (end-user training and careful stakeholder communications) to ensure business readiness before we roll-out any improved systems.

As the Business Project Manager, you will report to the Program Manager and be part of the Program Leadership Team. You will be managing a blended team of News and vendor staff to drive completion of assigned projects and work packages to appropriate quality standards within time/cost constraints.

The Person:

You will showcase your experience from similar business transformation projects where you have been able to quickly relate to most system, process, data, and people challenges. You will have the ability to identify what artefacts and activities to focus on depending on the nature of each challenge.

Your experience from previous HR & Finance Process and System Improvement Projects ideally involving the Workday and Preceda systems, gives you confidence to not only talk about Project Management topics, but also about how best to approach Business Process Enhancements, Information / Data Management Enhancements, and Business Readiness / End-to-End Acceptance Testing.

Having worked in or near structured IT environments you are also comfortable with Service Management and Continuous Improvement topics, as well as SDLC and PM methodology topics.

You are a friendly team player, possess a \xe2\x80\x9ccan-do\xe2\x80\x9d attitude, take ownership and accountability, are a problem-solver, are detail-oriented, and can be trusted to follow-through on and drive delegated outcomes.

Join Us

News Corp Australia is evolving in response to the expectations and challenges of the digital world in which we now live. We have an amazing opportunity to reinvent our industry and redefine the future of media in Australia. We are passionate about what we do and proud of our heritage of world-class journalism and entrepreneurial spirit. Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.

Please submit your CV or Linkedin profile to be considered for this position. For more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit: www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

"

title: Advertising Pricing Manager
description:
b'

The Company

News Corp Australia (formerly known as News Ltd) is the nation\xe2\x80\x99s largest media company operating over 150 house-hold name brands across print, digital and multimedia including The Daily Telegraph, The Australian and news.com.au. We are proud to be a central part of News Corp, a leading global network of powerful brands in news and information services, sports programming in Australia, digital real estate services, book publishing, digital education and pay-tv distribution in Australia including Fox Sports, Dow Jones, Harper Collins, Realestate.com.au and The Wall Street Journal.

\xc2\xa0

The Role

In this role you will be responsible for optimising revenue and profitability across the full range of our publications and channels. This involves developing the strategy, analysis and recommendations to influence key stakeholders in making data-driven commercial decisions. The scope of the role includes existing and new customers; national, metro and regional publications along with retail and alternative channels. This role also involves the management of a team of analysts.

\xc2\xa0

The key aspects of the role are;

  • Develop a pricing framework which delivers on the financial targets set in the AVM business case (volume, yield, revenue) but also allows the individual state teams to be agile in their approach with a customer
  • Financial modelling of proposed pricing initiatives to determine commercial viability and impacts to the business
  • Using data driven insights to inform a strategy which drives 3 way value \xe2\x80\x93 for News, our advertising customers and our consumers
  • Develop, own, and communicate a clear pricing strategy that will allow us to meet our business objectives, given current market conditions and competitive dynamics
  • Evolve this strategy through future phases as the market, our company and our customers evolve over the long term
  • Establish an appropriate pricing governance framework, including discounting guidelines, approval hierarchy, monitoring and controls.
  • Understand the elasticity of our products and how this varies across geography, customer segment, channel, publication, product type etc.
  • Optimise financial results based on relative elasticity and make recommendations to the business on how to best manage this through our pricing and product strategy
  • Review pricing proposals from the business, providing robust analysis to evaluate the financial impact and make a commercial recommendation
  • Develop team capability with regard to pricing expertise, research into best practice and competitive strategy.

\xc2\xa0

In doing so, you will work closely with the broader marketing team, customer analytics, finance, retail and technology across management levels. You will be a trusted commercial advisor therefore the ability to influence stakeholders is key for success in the role.

\xc2\xa0

The Person

News Corp is a complex business operating in a fast moving and ever changing industry. Your strong engagement, influencing, strategic thought process, planning and delivery skills at all levels will be critical to success in this role.

\xc2\xa0

Your intangible skill set will also be complemented with;

  • Experience in a similar position at a senior level in a large organization
  • Proven track record of pricing strategies and analysis
  • In depth working knowledge of Excel, strong financial modelling skills
  • Passion for driving and delivering complex and large scale change
  • Ability to comfortably work with and advise C-Level executives and their teams
  • Solid understanding of utilizing data and customer insights to deliver tangible commercial outcomes and actionable business cases
  • Experience in leading and managing a high performing team

\xc2\xa0

Join Us

News Corp Australia recognises that the enthusiasm, passion, talent and commitment of our people help shape our future. Our people join and stay with our company because they thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package; a focus on learning and development opportunities, a supportive management team and a fun and rewarding environment.

'

title: Senior Salesforce Administrator
description:
b"

The Company

News Corp Australia is the nation's largest media company operating over 150 house-hold name brands across print, digital and multimedia including The Daily and Sunday Telegraph and your local community paper, The Australian and news.com.au. We are proud to be a central part of News Corp, a leading global network of powerful brands in news and information services, sports programming in Australia, digital real estate services, book publishing, digital education and pay-TV distribution in Australia including Fox Sports, Dow Jones, Harper Collins, Realestate.com.au and The Wall Street Journal.

The Role

Motivated, persistent, independent, self-disciplined, self-confident and goal oriented, our Senior Salesforce Administrator is critical to the support, maintenance and continual improvement of the recently implemented Salesforce instance rolled out across News Corp Australia\xe2\x80\x99s Advertising Sales, Subscriptions & Marketing, and Retail Circulation businesses. The position is a key role in the support process and requires a deep understanding of Salesforce, its integration points and the interactions and processes carried out by the business. \xc2\xa0Whilst the role will provide some break fix capability, the primary function is to triage business requests and assist with resolution through various channels within the support structure, including News IT Service Desk, Salesforce Premier+, ISVs, and vendors.

Some of the key responsibilities would include;

  • Lead teams on the development of solution designs to fit business needs (teams may include representatives of the business, vendor, and other Salesforce team members)
  • Monitoring and resolving calls logged as well as triaging enhancement requests, Jira and interacting with the Business Systems team for prioritisation and scheduling
  • Perform Salesforce configurations including; maintain security for user roles and profiles and security/access settings (user profiles, role hierarchies, sharing rules), reporting, custom object creation, validation and workflow rules, as well as lead & campaign management, provisioning of objects and layouts
  • Manage the integrity of all environments including DEV, SIT, UAT, Training, Production and other special project Sandboxes as required.
  • Adhere to & continuously improve best practices with regards to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, customer engagement and regular backup cycle
  • Manage the impacts and release cycle for all changes and enhancements
  • Contribute to process and system design and documentation

The Person

To be successful in the role, you will be experienced in a highly complex environment with a large user group with\xc2\xa0knowledge and skills in the following:

  • Solid underderstang of project management methodologies and industry best practice
  • Proven experience with change management, release and development processes
  • Understanding of applications architecture and complex application integrations
  • Propensity for innovation and ability to unlock that innovation with minimal adverse impact on the business
  • Ability and experience working in an agile environment
  • Tertiary degree qualification
  • Industry qualifications in Salesforce platform (Salesforce.com Certified Administrators course or the Salesforce.com Certified Advanced Administrators course) are highly regarded
  • Previous experience in a relevant applications support, business systems administrator, system administrator role within a global model

Join Us

News Corp Australia is evolving in response to the expectations and challenges of the digital world in which we now live. We have an amazing opportunity to reinvent our industry and redefine the future of media in Australia. We are passionate about what we do and proud of our heritage of world-class journalism and entrepreneurial spirit. Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.


Please submit your CV or Linkedin profile to be considered for this position. For more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit: www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

"

title: Organisational Development Advisor
description:
b'ORGANISATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ADVISOR
\xc2\xa0
UGL is a diversified services company delivering critical assets and essential services that sustain and enhance the environment in which we live. \xc2\xa0Our capabilities extend across a broad range of services and whole-of-life solutions for diverse industries, utilising world leading, sustainable and innovative technologies. We partner with some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest blue-chip companies, government agencies, private enterprise, and public institutions.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
At present, we have an opening for an Organisational Development Advisor to join the Corporate team at our stunning, conveniently located Head Office in North Sydney.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 This varied and interesting role provides internal consultancy services to the business in relation to OD solutions that are designed to support the achievement of organisational goals and performance.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
ABOUT THE POSITION:
  • Management of the Graduate program including recruitment activities, rotations within and across the Company, and co-ordination of training events
  • Management of annual Talent Review and Succession Planning process, including delivery of training and guidance materials for the People and Culture (P&C) team, as well as analysis of outputs for internal reporting purposes
  • Support the Performance Review process across the organisation
  • Management of the Employee Engagement Survey and associated improvement plans
  • Project management of system solutions to support corporate OD programs
  • Internal and external reporting, with a focus on standard HR metrics and Diversity
\xc2\xa0
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:
  • Tertiary Degree in Human Resources, Organisational Psychology or related field
  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment or relevant experience
  • Intermediate to advanced computing skills including practical knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
  • Demonstrated experience working with organisational development programs and initiatives, including talent and performance management, succession planning, leadership frameworks, staff engagement and development
  • Knowledge of current organisational development theories and practices
  • Excellent project and people management skills along with the ability to influence key stakeholders and build strong relationships across large, complex, and fast-paced organisations
  • Ability to manage spreadsheets and interpret data to drive insights
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Very strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work effectively autonomously, as well as in a team environment
\xc2\xa0
This is a fantastic opportunity for a professional and motivated individual to join a top-tier organisation, working with a close knit and friendly People and Culture team. \xc2\xa0If you are confident you have the requisite capabilities to join us and really hit the ground running, we look forward to receiving your expression of interest.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Apply using the button below or online at http://www.ugllimited.com/join-us, quoting reference number 228047.
\xc2\xa0
Alongside your CV, please attach a covering note clearly indicating your current notice period and remuneration expectations.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
For assistance, email corporate@ugllimited.com
\xc2\xa0
Diversity and Inclusion is a priority at UGL, so we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of gender, age, disability or ethnicity.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 We particularly encourage applications from candidates who identify as Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander.
\xc2\xa0
#RDI
