title: Communications, Media & Technology  Robotics & AI  Consultant to Manager
description:
b'

About the business and the role

Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world.\xc2\xa0 The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.\xc2\xa0Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

In Accenture Consulting, we focus on helping clients achieve profitable growth and solve their most pressing challenges; we do this by operating at the intersection of strategy, technology, digital, operations and security, providing a connected Consulting experience and ensuring our clients are getting the best Accenture can bring.

Accenture Communications, Media & Technology (CMT) helps companies some of the world's most recognizable and dynamic companies connect with digital consumers, launch innovative products and services, increase revenues, and streamline operations to reduce costs, across three industry sub-segments:

  • Communications & Media

  • Software & Platforms
  • Electronics & High Tech

Due to an exciting growth and capability build phase, CMT is currently seeking market leading consulting talent to join our high performing team.

Our Robotics Practitioners define, design and implement Robotics capabilities, operating models and corresponding Data Architectures, Governance and Toolsets \xe2\x80\x93 leading the way throughout the transformational journey.

Key responsibilities:

  • This role will define the overarching architecture that enables and releases the value of Robotic Process Automation; ultimately to gain competitive advantage and to add value.

  • This role will build deep client relationships at senior levels and work with colleagues within Accenture Technology, Accenture Digital and the CMT practice to orchestrate these new technology solutions.
  • Advance thought leadership within CMT on how we help our clients achieve their strategic business and tactical business goals using Robotics & AI

Job tasks and responsibilities

  • We expect our consultants to be always relevant, bringing our clients expertise and experience in Robotics & AI solutions. Our consultants must combine industry and technology relevance with strong delivery experience and capability specific to CMT

Professional experience & qualifications

At least three years' experience in a consulting environment, with specific exposure to some of the following areas:

  • Proven ability to shape and lead IT transformation through provision of strategy, consulting, digital and technology and operations services in collaboration with our partners within and outside of Accenture.
  • Knowledge and experience in Robotics Process Automation Technology and Deployment.
  • An ability to identify opportunities for value creation based on this deep understanding of Robotics Process Automation.
  • A passion and commitment to New Technologies and a drive to influence the way these are evolving and delivered.
  • Clear understanding of key methodologies, approaches and market trends in the Resources industry (Energy, Utilities, Chemicals and Natural Resources).
  • Extensive Project/ Programme Management experience, with professional qualification a bonus. Including evident experience of end-to-end life cycle of products, including evident knowledge of:
    • system and solution architecture design (functional & technical),
    • development
    • testing (strategies, approach and plans - all testing phases (integration, functional and non-functional testing, technical testing End to End, UAT etc.)
    • Support and Change Management
  • Understanding of the Resources industry (Energy, Utilities, Chemicals and Natural Resources).
  • An ability to challenge a client's thinking by diplomatically providing an objective and independent point of view.
  • Ability to effectively communicate the implications of complex technical concepts to senior, non-technical audiences.

Skills and experience

Leadership qualities (for senior positions) / desired Leadership qualities to aspire to (for junior positions)

  • Confidence in presenting challenging points of view to Director- and Executive-level clients (i.e. CTO/CIO)
  • Ability to build and maintain relationships with senior IT and business executives
  • Ability to grow a strong team of Managers, Consultants and\xc2\xa0 Analysts
  • Leading, mentoring and developing our people
  • Experience structuring activities that play to a team's strengths and provide opportunities for others to grow
  • Insights on key methodologies, approaches and market trends in the industry
  • An ability to inspire teams to deliver to a high standard in a suitable timeframe
  • Experience managing large teams through complex situations, adapting quickly and helping others navigate change.

Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

'

title: Marketing Executive
description:
b"

The Role

My client is looking for a hands on, collaborative Marketing Executive to support their Everyday Banking offering. The role will predominantly be focussed on driving campaigns across Everyday Banking but will also be responsible for Local Area Marketing to support the network of branches in Australia.

\xc2\xa0

Role Requirements and Responsibilities

  • Design and deliver data driven customer centric marketing communications across multiple channels for Everyday Banking customers (acquisition and retention)
  • Briefing and management of all key stakeholders regarding the development and ongoing performance of campaigns
  • Ensure campaigns are optimised and refined based on reporting/analysis
  • Ensure campaigns meet the set marketing expense budget and revenue targets/metrics. Liaise with agency partners to deliver best in class creative execution
  • Liaise with branch and regional managers across sponsorships, branch campaigns and events
  • Liaise closely with senior leaders across Consumer Marketing, Product and Distribution and in key business segments to diagnose everyday banking requirements and influence appropriate solutions
  • Cultivate and foster a culture that places a premium on ideas, creativity and innovation to stimulate original thinking and output - bring new thinking and influences to the team
  • Work as a member of the Marketing \xc2\xa0team to ensure relevant marketing \xc2\xa0management skills are developed, enhanced and embedded
  • Partner with internal marketing teams on a day to day basis to ensure work is delivered on time and on budget
  • Utilise market research to ensure communications are on brand, on message and will gain the cut through required to achieve the brand and business objectives
  • Develop regular reporting for key stakeholders and management
  • Provide advice and support on relevant campaign approach, activities and practices to Marketing and business stakeholders
  • Analyse proposed projects, identify budgetary needs and if necessary, develop possible interactions and manage the execution of these interactions to maximise effectiveness
  • Report on and analyse key campaign metrics and usage for the brand
  • Pro-actively develop tangible working relationships with internal business partners to continuously improve processes and drive improved results
  • Implement and drive a customer centric culture making it easy for our stakeholders to do business with us
  • Actively promote the key activities, initiatives and successes to the appropriate internal communication channels
  • Accurate tracking and evaluation of all marketing activity, whilst ensuring maximum return on marketing investment via effective test and roll-out strategies

\xc2\xa0

Background and Experience

  • Marketing related qualification
  • 5+ years' experience in marketing, segment or channel roles
  • Strong data mind set
  • A proven ability to build strong and effective relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders
  • Experience working in complex structures and a fast paced environment
  • Innovative thinking and a passion for fresh thinking
  • Experience in managing 3rd party relationships (including data agencies, mail houses, printers, creative and media agencies)
"

title: Marketing Analyst
description:
b'James Hardie Systems Pty Ltd a division of James Hardie\xe2\x84\xa2, acquired the Ritek\xc2\xae Wall Systems business in 2017. Our goal is to enhance our customer experience and to focus on delivering a leading permanent formwork system across the Australian market.
\xc2\xa0
We promote a collaborative working environment, where people feel comfortable expressing their thoughts and opinions. An environment where people enjoy where they work, who they work with, and are challenged, recognised and developed.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Opportunity
\xc2\xa0
Reporting to the Marketing Manager, and working closely with the Finance Manager, the Marketing Analyst will provide comprehensive market and profitability analysis and interpretation, translating data into commercial insights.

Responsibilities
  • Pro-actively source market information through relevant sources and conduct statistical analysis to transfer data into insights and industry analytical reports
  • Sales and market analysis, including market share, market pricing, price elasticity and trends in the market
  • Monitor and report on competitor activity and market share
  • Provide analysis and insights to market behaviour and usage to identify product positioning and new product development opportunities
  • Assist with customer analysis and segmentation
  • Develop and report on sales metrics
  • Assist in preparing budgets and forecasts, analysing monthly results against budget and previous year
  • Prepare variance analysis for revenue and cost lines including flexible budget analysis
  • Prepare Profitability Analysis for different business segments
  • Assist with monthly Management Performance reporting
Candidate Profile and Qualifications Required
  • Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Marketing, Mathematics or Economics (desirable) \xc2\xa0
  • 3-5 years relevant experience
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Previous experience as a business analyst, in a start-up business environment
  • Experience preparing financial modelling, and translating into market relevance
  • Experience with CRM's, ie SalesForce
  • Self-starter with demonstrated ability to take initiative and problem solve
  • Strong capability for gap analysis, planning and priority setting
If you enjoy working in a performance based culture whereby everyone has accountability for their role, then we are for you!
'

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
b'\xc2\xa0
My client, an agency based in Sydney, is currently looking for an established & collaborative suit to join the team. Reliable and 'on-the-ball', the ideal candidate will work across a variety of projects, big and small.\xc2\xa0

The Senior Account Manager\xc2\xa0will be working across a number of the key accounts at the agency.\xc2\xa0The successful candidate will assist in the annual planning of client requirements/ campaigns and will work across big client briefs

title: Business Development Manager
description:
b"About the Company:
My client is an industry leading and award winning service provider with offices both in Australia and abroad. With over 200 staff in Australia, they are a business with a high calibre of technical resources and capability to engage their customers with. They have some of Australia's most well-known enterprises on their books and continue to evolve and grow their offering to help guide their customers into new ways of delivering IT services to their users. They engage in very complex transformation engagements that require large teams and industry leading expertise to drive success. Due to some recent announcements and growth we have been tasked with growing the sales team in Sydney and Melbourne.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Culture:
The culture of the sales team is described as a fast paced, reward driven environment. There is structured support and training from highly experienced leaders and long standing team members of the team. This is an environment with a lot of energy and finding people with the right attitude is one of the most important things we look for. I have spoken with many members of the current sales team and asked what makes them happy working there. The responses were quite similar. People feel as though they have independence and trust from their leaders. They like to learn and feel they grow with the regular training and the broad range of solutions they can offer customers. The one thing though that resonated with me was that many of those I spoke to felt as though they had a sense of belonging within the team.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
About the Role:
Due to some recent announcements and growth I have been tasked with growing the sales team in Sydney and Melbourne. As such I am looking for an inspired Business Development Manager to join the team.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities include:
  • Be given some existing large, medium and small accounts to manage.
  • Add your own accounts and prospects targets to fully form the map of your territory.\xc2\xa0
  • Build a strategic plan for your territory and collaborate with the team on ideas how best to execute it.
  • Provide technical solutions across the data centre and end-user space both on-prem and within the cloud.
  • Sell complex solutions across Microsoft including Azure & Office 365 as well as Amazon Web Services offerings
  • Research the market and drive targeted campaigns for identified prospects.
  • Become a strong source of knowledge and expertise for your clients.
  • Be a challenger, challenging customers thinking of the market and their own businesses.
  • Strive to grow your market share across your territory\xc2\xa0
  • Facilitate meetings, plugging in the right resources to meet customer needs.
  • Drive opportunities to successful close and repeat business engagements.
  • Work effectively with key vendor resources across your territory to drive business outcomes.
  • Collaborate and build relationships with internal resources.
  • Participate in regular forecast meetings and present your territory plan.
  • Achieve and exceed sales targets and quotas\xc2\xa0
  • Maintain sales CRM with any opportunity updates or customer information.
  • Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Required Skills & Experience:
  • Bachelor Degree or equivalent in relevant field highly regarded.
  • You have had a minimum of 5 years' experience B2B selling\xc2\xa0
  • Experience within the technology space will be highly regarded but we will look outside the industry if someone has the right desire and attitude.
  • You have relationships within the ASX200 and can articulate the challenges you have been able to solve for your customers
  • You can demonstrate experience selling complex technical solutions\xc2\xa0
  • You can demonstrate a background in meeting and achieving quotas.
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • You have a positive attitude and inspire positivity in others.
More Information:
For interest please forward your resume and a cover letter summarising the key reasons you are suitable for the role to robbie@numinous.com.au
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Numinous is a new voice in the IT recruitment industry. You will see more on us soon but for now, follow us at www.linkedin.com/company/numinous "

title: Technical Sales Representative - Compute & Networking
description:
b'

If you are passionate about getting hands-on with technology and eager to further your career in a technically innovative environment, Dell is the place to be. Our enterprise solutions allow companies to efficiently extract value from their intellectual property. Within\xc2\xa0Infrastructure Solutions, we are looking for a\xc2\xa0Technical Sales Representative\xc2\xa0to join us in\xc2\xa0Sydney.

Dell is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. At our core is a commitment to diversity, sustainability and our communities. We offer unparalleled growth and development opportunities for our team members. We believe that technology is essential for driving human progress, and we're committed to providing that technology to people and organizations everywhere, so they can transform the way they work and live.

Key Responsibilities

As the Technical Sales Representative, you will be responsible for architecting, quoting, and selling Dell Server, HyperConverged (HCI), Converged (VxRail/Rack and XC), Enterprise Infrastructure (EI) and Networking solutions in the assigned segment. You will build and maintain customer, both internal and external, relationships by providing leadership and guidance for data center computing solutions while ensuring there is always a rapid, accurate response to customer needs via email or phone.\xc2\xa0

  • Qualifies Compute and Networking sales opportunities in terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding.

  • Prepares detailed product specifications for the purpose of selling high end Compute and Networking products and solutions

  • Requires a high degree of technical competency to respond to customer needs and to discuss product capabilities and applications with technical users/buyers

  • Assists in new account development and/or expanding existing accounts

  • Leverages cross-functional resources to achieve results/meet customers/partners needs

Essential Requirements

  • Previous sales experience and technical background

  • Experience and knowledge of\xc2\xa0Compute &\xc2\xa0Networking\xc2\xa0products, services, concepts, solutions e.g. HCI, Networking, HPC\xc2\xa0and also Enterprise Software knowledge (eg BURA, Virtualisation, Security, Software Defined)

  • Experience of working in a cross-functional solutions based sales team

  • Industry knowledge from either a sales or technical view \xc2\xa0

  • Comfortable dealing with all corporate levels including senior decision makers, Sales, Technical, Financial, Marketing

  • Passion for learning new skills and technologies and proven experience of articulating how this benefits customers.

  • Fluent written and spoken English

A career with Dell means that you'll be working at the cutting edge of technology. You will be selling high-level, complex business systems, software, solutions, storage and services to people who want to hear about the value Dell can add to their organisations.\xc2\xa0Training and coaching will be provided, however successful candidates will need to be highly motivated with the ability to independently determine approach to activities and initiatives.

Benefits

Our people are the most critical component of our long-term success and their health and wellbeing are our priority. You will enjoy a comprehensive, locally competitive benefits package.

Dell is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, genetics, or citizenship status (when otherwise legally authorized to work) and will not be discriminated against on the basis of such characteristics or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell encourages applicants of all ages.

'

title: IT Security Analyst
description:
b'

THE COMPANY

This national Healthcare provider employs more than 1200 staff in multiple locations across Australia and has a strong online healthcare presence.

Data privacy and customer privacy is at the core of their business so they have a strong emphasis on Information Security.

THE ROLE

As the Information Security Analyst your duties include:

  • Log monitoring & incident management
  • Monitor, maintain, & configure security infrastructure (FIM, SIEM. AV, WAP, IDS/IPS etc)
  • Vulnerability assessments
  • Implementation of new security tools & solutions
  • Web application firewall management
  • Threat analysis & advisory
  • Assist with IT Security audits & reviews
  • Assist with PCI-DSS compliance as required

A SUITABLE CANDIDATE?

  • Strong experience maintaining, monitoring and configuring security infrastructure is a must.
  • Strong threat intelligence experience is a must.
  • Proven incident response exposure is required.
  • Background designing and improving security infrastructure is required.
  • PCI-DSS experience is highly beneficial.

This is a full time permanent role based in the heart of the Sydney CBD and is offering $125,000 - $145,000 (including super) - depending on experience.

*Please note, full permanent Australian working rights are required to be considered for this position and successful applicants will be contacted.

Apply Today

Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button. Your application will be assessed within 3 working days. Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Learn more about our Sydney recruitment services: https://www.roberthalf.com.au/recruitment-agency-sydney

'

title: Senior Manager, Model Risk
description:
b'\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Westpac Group\xe2\x80\x98s portfolio of businesses include Westpac Retail and Business Banking, Westpac Institutional Bank, St. George Bank Group (including BankSA, RAMS and Bank of Melbourne), BT Financial Group, and Westpac New Zealand.
\xc2\xa0
Several roles, such as this one, focus on supporting our multi-brand model.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Business Group:\xc2\xa0 Risk\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
Role: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Senior Manager, Model Risk
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Job Description


\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0


The Model Risk team is responsible for the independent validation of all models across Westpac Group as well as other model risk management activities. The team and its members have received a number of awards including Risk Team of the Year in recognition of its high performance culture.
\xc2\xa0
In this role you will lead the independent validation activity across primary asset and derivative pricing and risk modelling across rates, foreign exchange, energy, commodity and equity markets. You will also lead the validation activity associated with Interest Rate in the Banking Book (IRRBB) modelling. This will include extensive engagement with model owners and developers, internal committees, working groups and project teams to deliver the validation activity to a high quality and in a timely fashion.
\xc2\xa0
The will entail:

  • Leading, coaching and providing technical support to a team of senior quantitative analysts;
  • Ensuring the scope of independent validation appropriately challenges a model\xe2\x80\x99s scope of application, methodology, implementation, data used and its documentation; and
  • Present validation outcomes to senior management, model owners and developers.
\xc2\xa0
To succeed in this role, you should have:
  • At least ten years\xe2\x80\x99 experience within a financial market quantitative team with a thorough knowledge of financial markets and an understanding of the associated accounting and regulatory expectations. Knowledge of IRRBB models is a plus.
  • An excellent tertiary qualification in actuarial, statistics, econometrics or other related quantitative discipline. A focus on financial mathematics is a plus.
  • Excellent written and inter-personal communication skills, particularly the ability to explain complicated issues in an efficient and effective manner. You should have demonstrated an ability to communicate with influence.
  • Excellent and enthusiastic people leadership and coaching skills.
  • Excellent time management skills, with the ability to work to tight deadlines and deal with changing priorities.
  • A dedication to continual improvement and knowledge sharing.
  • Played a lead role in delivering or validating financial market models from start to finish. Experience in rates, foreign exchange or energy products is preferred.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel as well as VBA
  • Programming fluency (e.g. R, Python, C/C++/C# or equivalent). Experience with Git or other version control software experience is a plus.
  • Experience using front office and risk systems like Murex, Calypso, Algorithmics RiskWatch and Real Time Credit Engine
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Westpac Group has market leading employee benefits, financial product discounts, wholeheartedly supports Inclusion in the workforce (and we really mean it too), and believes work is something you do and not somewhere you go. Westpac is committed to creating flexibility for every employee so please talk to us about how we could make this role work for you.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

'

title: NA
description:
b'

Huge Global Company, Market Leading Brands, Ongoing Career Training, Sociable Working Environment, Excellent long term career path.

  • Global FMCG Brands
  • Excellent Career Path
  • Market Leading Products.

Generous Base Salary + Super + Car allowance + Bonus scheme

The Company: This Global FMCG Giant has been supplying Australian consumers with market leading brands for decades.

Due to internal movement this role has become available to work alongside the high performing National Accounts team.

The Role:

  • Reporting to National Channel Manager
  • Supporting the NBM to manage the Coles and Woolworths Accounts
  • Ability to analyse, interpret and present data to buyers
  • Presentations to illustrate ways to combat competitors
  • Monthly reporting and pipeline management
  • Hybrid role of office based and client facing
  • Statistical analysis and internal stakeholder management

The Candidate: This is a great opportunity for a Key or National Account Exec to take a step up and build on their current skill set and get more face time with the client as well as gaining exposure to Major Grocery Accounts. You will have FMCG experience ideally in account management, a head office analytical role that also encompasses some previous sales experience or even state account management.

You will need experience having worked on Metcash, Coles or Woolworths to be considered for this role within an FMCG company.

Culture fit is important, the team are dynamic, driven and collaborative, you will need to be able to articulate your achievements and key wins throughout your career to date and talk through what you can bring to the table. It\xe2\x80\x99s imperative that you\xe2\x80\x99re competent using reporting tools and analysing data from Aztec and also proficient using Excel.

Strong presenters and idea driven individuals will succeed in this style of role.

BMS Specialise in recruiting sales professionals in the FMCG, Business to Business and Industrial markets, we have many unadvertised positions, so if you are actively looking or just dipping your toe in the market then feel free to call.

If this position sounds of interest the click apply now or call 02 9434 2100.

'

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
b'

Our client is one of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s leading Education Institutes, they are seeking for an experienced Senior Network Engineer to join their close-knit team ASAP. This is a contract role for an initial 6-month period with the possibility of extension.

Role

  • Provide 3rd level support for all aspects of the Education Institute\xe2\x80\x99s network, including network design, network security, network management, network operations and both project and service delivery. This will be in both Project and BAU support activities.

Essential Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience with medium to large scale enterprise network - operating at the 3rd Level Support
  • Strong network architecture and design skills with Cisco technologies
  • Must have experience in Cisco routing and switching + Paolo Alto Firewall devices; including BGP, OSPF and large scale Layer-2 deployments
  • Good understanding of Data Centres and Cloud network experience
  • Experience with network management tools and system administration of Windows and Linux servers
  • Scripting and automation experience and F5 Load Balancers is highly desirable
  • Strong communication skills
My client is currently accepting applications, and are keen to start interviewing suitable candidates NOW. So, if you meet the above criteria please APPLY NOW for early consideration. '

title: Property Lease Administrator
description:
b'
  • Work on a key client account
  • Strong client service focus
  • Supportive team environment
  • Sydney CBD Location
At CBRE, our people enjoy the flexibility of working in a global real estate and property services organisation with tremendous scale. \xc2\xa0 Every day you are empowered to be better and this is achieved through the platform and resources you have access to and the ability to work in an inclusive and collaborative environment where you will be challenged to grow and be your best every day.

We are currently seeking an experienced Property Lease Administrator to join our Asset Services division on a key client account. The role is client focused and will enable you to build and maintain strong relationships with the Investment Management and Finance teams in particular. You will also gain full exposure to the client portfolio and its tenants. \xc2\xa0The primary focus of your role will be to assume responsibity for the general maintenance and accuracy of lease/tenant information within the CBRE system.

An overview of the responsibilities of the role is as follows;

  • Research, assist, review and issue as appropriate all tenant specific details.
  • Provide instruction to the CBRE Real Estate Accounting Services (REAS) team in relation to all tenant details
  • Complete any tenant account reconciliations as required with the assistance of CBRE REAS as appropriate\xc2\xa0
  • Review and sign off on any tenant specific details relating to outgoings recoveries charges and reconciliations
  • Examine executed leases and other tenancy documentation for data extraction, set up and maintenance of the CBRE system or other appropriate schedule/s, including a diary of critical dates\xc2\xa0
  • Conduct active tenant arrears control with associated communications to all levels as required
  • Maintain a register of bank guarantees and security deposits required to be lodged by tenants\xc2\xa0
  • Maintain register of all tenant insurance required to be effected including details of current certificates held
  • Check recurring monthly tenant charges and sundry charges, and dispatch corresponding tax invoices including any supporting documentation as required
  • Ensure all scheduled fixed tenant charges reviews are implemented
  • Assist with any research with market rental reviews

To be successful for this position you will ideally have experience in a similar property lease administration position. A good understanding of leases and the ability to interpret leases, licenses and other property documentation would be beneficial. You will have a superior customer service focus, strong attention to detail and ability to organise and prioritise tasks. Excellent \xc2\xa0written and verbal communication skills is essential along with intermediate to advanced skills in MS Office particularly Word (mail merges), Excel and Outlook. You will be responsive and proactive in your approach with the ability to build and maintain strong business relationships.\xc2\xa0

If working with the best in an exciting and rewarding team environment appeals to you, then we want to hear from you today.

Please note that due to the high volume of response anticipated for this role; only short listed candidates will be contacted
'

title: NA
description:
b'

Moray & Agnew is one of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s leading and fastest growing specialist law firms. We employ over 550 people and have offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra, Newcastle and Perth.

An exciting career opportunity has arisen in our Sydney office for a full-time People & Development Administrator to join our busy team. This role will report directly to the National P&D Manager, and will assist three P&D Consultants to ensure smooth running of the function nationally.

Your tasks will include (but are not be limited to) the following:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Recruitment - assisting with advertisements, posting jobs on the Moray & Agnew careers page and relevant job boards and/or recruitment sources, scheduling interviews, following up on applications, updating the recruitment database, responding to applicants, conducting telephone interviews and reference checks, completing letters of offer, confirming offers and notifying relevant departments

\xe2\x80\xa2 Managing the P&D diary and administration processes including induction, probation, notification of staff changes, departures, exit interviews etc

\xe2\x80\xa2 General administration - filing, updating award register and preparing and sending letters, updating employee data, processing invoices and corporate credit card expenses, updating the HR Bulletin on a bi-monthly basis, organising and assisting in HR events and any other ad-hoc tasks associated with the role

To be successful in this role you must possess:

\xe2\x80\xa2 The ability to maintain confidentiality at all times
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication and interpersonal skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong attention to detail and the ability to produce work with a high degree of accuracy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional organisational skills, the ability to prioritise work and manage multiple tasks
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

The ideal candidate will have:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Tertiary qualifications in Business or Human Resources Management
\xe2\x80\xa2 The ability to work and develop rapport with people at all levels in the organisation

This is a fantastic role for someone with a keen interest in Human Resource Management. We are open to candidates at different experience levels so you may be completing your HR degree and be available to work full-time, you may have already gained some HR experience or you may be someone with related experience aspiring to get their first role in HR.

If you have a strong client service focus, a flexible attitude, and want to work in a small and supportive team, with excellent mentoring, then this is the right role for you.

Applications will only be accepted via our online careers page and must include a covering letter stating your suitability for the role, a detailed CV and your academic transcript.

We do not invite recruitment agencies to apply at this time.

'

title: Senior Bushfire Consultant - Sutherland
description:
b"

ECO LOGICAL AUSTRALIA PTY LTD, is one of Australia's leading environmental assessment, strategic conservation planning and ecosystem management consultancies. We work as one team, and operate across Australia, rapidly expanding our presence and capabilities in the environmental and bushfire field. We pride ourselves on a unique culture and place high emphasis on the recruitment of people who share our values of:

  • Listen first
  • Share your genius
  • Be courageous
  • Feed the culture

Eco Logical Australia has a nationally recognised bushfire assessment team. We seek an enthusiastic, qualified and experienced Bushfire Consultant to join our bushfire team in Sutherland.\xc2\xa0You will be responsible for project managing a wide variety of projects, such as bushfire management planning, bushfire protection and attack level assessments, and vegetation management.

You will join a team who continue to pioneer national best practice bushfire services and products including risk analysis using wildfire simulations within SPARK software, Fire Decision Support models (encompassing risk, fire ecology, fire behaviour and management zoning concepts), drafting of the recently released AFAC paper on the ecological risks of prescribed burning, etc.

We seek candidates interested in building and managing client relationships within NSW, but you will have opportunity to provide services for other jurisdictions in Australia.\xc2\xa0

The role involves proposal preparation, site assessment, risk and data analysis, applied research, report preparation, client liaison and development, attending meetings and delivering presentations. \xc2\xa0

The successful candidate should have:

  • A passion for fire ecology, bushfire protection and planning;
  • Strong project, budget and time management skills;
  • Considerable experience in preparing a range of high quality reports, such as bushfire protection assessments, bushfire attack level assessments, bushfire management plans, evacuation and emergency response plans, fire ecology reports, etc;
  • Considerable experience in bushfire risk planning and/or bushfire suppression/prevention;
  • Ability to build and nurture client relationships, manage simultaneous projects and project teams, work within a budget and meet deadlines;
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills;
  • Tertiary qualifications in Environmental Science, or Bushfire or related disciplines;
  • Demonstrated \xc2\xa0experience in either bushfire planning or bushfire management (indicatively 5 years);
  • Experience in the application of GIS (ArcGIS) and spatial data analysis in bushfire management and planning;
  • Practical and working knowledge and understanding of relevant NSW and Commonwealth legislation; \xc2\xa0
  • A strong working knowledge and understanding of AS-3959;
  • Knowledge and understanding of the Guidelines for Planning in Bushfire Prone Areas (Department of Planning and Department of Fire and Emergency Services, 2015); and,
  • Current drivers license.

\xc2\xa0

It is also desirable that candidates have:

  • Bushfire Planning and Design (BPAD) accreditation, or
  • have prior consulting experience
  • Prior project management experience.

\xc2\xa0

If you are an Australian resident, are seeking a friendly and professional organisation where workplace culture is highly valued, and where you can grow and further develop please forward your application to Emma Newman, Human Resources Co-ordinator via email: emman@ecoaus.com.au before close of business 26 May 2017. Further information about the position, please call Emma on 8536 8600 view the position description on our website. www.ecoaus.com.au/jobs.

"

title: Senior Commercial Analyst
description:
b"

Senior Commercial Analyst required within a global diversified financial services business.

Your new company
Is a global, diversified financial services organisation who operate across the country and have forged a fantastic reputation within the industry for their innovation and progressive practices. This is a fantastic chance for a business savvy Commercial or Pricing Analyst to take the next step in their career and join their Sydney based team in award winning brand new offices.

Your new role
Will be highly commercial, partnering with Sales and State Management on commercial and pricing decision making on proposed new deals. Specifically you will be involved in the following:

  • Financial modelling of new business proposals
  • Analysis of revenue levers and drivers
  • Amendment and creation of complex Excel models
  • Prepare financial presentation of findings to Business Leaders
  • Manage ad hoc requests for analysis from the business
  • Take a key role in process improvement and automation



What you'll need to succeed
You will have a strong background in commercial/revenue/pricing analysis, ideally with a background in new deal analysis. Experience within the Financial Services sector would be an advantage but not essential. You must however have advanced Excel modelling skills (VBA level) and be comfortable handling and analysis large amounts of data. You will also have first class communication skills with the ability to provide complex financial data to non financial staff in a clear and concise manner.


What you'll get in return
This is a fantastic chance to join a large, complex and successful financial services business in a role where you will clearly see the commercial outcomes of your work. You will play a key role in shaping the organisation's commercial decision making and its achievements of growth targets. It will give you 1-2-1 partnership experience with senior sales leaders and decision makers in the organisation.


What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' or forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to james.odonnell@hays.com.au, or call James O'Donnell on 02 8062 6129 for a confidential conversation.

"

title: NA
description:
b'

About us:

KinCare Group is a privately owned Australian business that is at the forefront of the provision of in-home care services across Australia. A highly regarded and innovative organisation, we hold a wealth of expertise and experience in aged care, disability and allied health services.

KinCare is going through a significant transformation agenda as we move into a retail environment with the deregulation of the in-home care market and as such is now entering into another exciting period of growth. We currently have approximately 2,000 passionate employees whose skills, knowledge and expertise creates a high performing team that ensures KinCare remains a successful, national leader within the industry.

The role:

Based in Bella Vista, the main responsibility for this position is to process all customer claims from the government for KinCare. Utilise your strong financial administration experience and attention to detail to assist the company in completing claiming for different programs and troubleshoot any issues.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Ensure Claims are processed before 25th of every month and manage cash receipts for Homecare payments.
  • Manage the government ACOS portal and ensure data is correctly entered and maintained.
  • Liaise with Government agencies, such as DHS and Medicare, to ensure all claims are processed in compliance with government regulations and reforms.
  • Liaise with internal stakeholders nationwide to ensure correct information is provided in accordance with customer\xe2\x80\x99s agreement and claiming requirement.
  • Administration related tasks including maintain daily banking sheets to provide cash flow to the business.
  • Assisting with month end for accrual purpose including SA Disability, TAC and NDIS
  • Assisting accounts receivable team with GL code for cash receipts.
  • Assisting with the calculation of discharged customers.

Skills and experience required:

  • 2-3 years experience in similar Accounting/Finance/Banking roles
  • Degree qualified
  • Strong attention to detail and problem solving abilities
  • Resilience and the ability to work in a constantly changing environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Intermediate to advanced excel
  • Great customer service skills and continuous improvement focus
  • Any previous exposure to the Healthcare industry would be ideal but not essential

Please note that this position may be subject to mandatory pre-employment checks. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. No agencies please.

Further information about KinCare can be obtained by visiting: www.kincare.com.au

'

title: Customer Support Consultant
description:
b"Are you a switched-on customer service professional looking to join an innovative organisation with bags of opportunity for career development? Do you love talking to customers? Get a kick out of providing the best possible client experience? Then read on...!
We currently have a fantastic opportunity for a passionate and dynamic customer service professional to grow their career within our multi-award winning company!

You'll be working at the very heart of our business, talking to customers more than anyone else in the company! As the voice of the Home Clearance brand, this will be a busy and fast-paced role where you'll be given lots of support to set you up for success. If you love talking to customers, are a natural problem solver and want to work as part of a close-knit team with bags of opportunity to grow your career then this is the role for you!

What Your Day-to-Day Will Look Like

  • Be the first point of contact for our customers - ensuring the Home Clearance brand is championed and represented in the best possible light
  • Respond to queries regarding products, delivery, service issues and processing sales via email and phone
  • Maximise sales and profit levels in accordance with pricing and account structures;
  • Data entry
  • Processing orders, including releasing and updating invoices, as well as other administrative based duties
A Bit About You
  • Previous customer service or retail experience essential;
  • Commitment to providing quality customer service;
  • Problem solving skills, and the ability to think on your feet;
  • A motivated, proactive and positive approach;
  • Proven track record of excellent sales results;
  • Previous experience working within the appliance/whitegoods industry is highly regarded;
  • Previous front line retail customer service is highly regarded
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Able and willing to work 8.5 hour days
You'll be a key member of our Home Clearance brand, Australia's leading clearance outlet for top brand appliances. We are dedicated to making quality whitegoods easy to buy at unbeatable prices. With showrooms in Auburn and Erina combined and a strong online presence, Home Clearance shares the same vision of the Winning Group - to provide the world's best customer experience!!

This is a unique opportunity to help grow a thriving startup environment, with the backing of a multi-award winning fourth generation Australian family owned retail business, whose other entities include Winning Appliances, pureplay online retailer Appliances Online, and national logistics and installation business Handy Crew.

----------------------------------------------

And What Makes Us Awesome?
  • You will be working in a great open plan office environment with a dedicated break out area and fully equipped kitchen.
  • You will be part of a fun and engaging team that is focused on offering the best customer experience.
  • We value your ideas, you will be encouraged to give your thoughts and suggestions
  • We are interested in growing your career - it's not just about owning the role you are working in today, but building your future and developing your skills
  • You will really be part of a family - we are a family-owned and family-run business.
  • We won this year's Online Retailer of the Year and our Customer Experience was also recognised at the 2014 World Retail Awards in Paris!
Our office is located on the fashionable Danks Street in Redfern. We are close to the city and public transport with on-street parking available.

We're always on the lookout for talented people who can help us successfully balance our entrepreneurial spirit with old-world family values. If you are looking for a working environment that's flexible, exciting and fast-paced, and want to work for a company that continually strives to innovate and be a leader in its field, then look no further! "

title: Administration Executive
description:
b"

Employee Relations Strategies has been established for over 18 years and has an outstanding reputation for navigating our clients safely through the minefield of workplace conflict (visit www.erstrategies.com.au).

Continued blue-chip client growth in key client areas including retail, fast food and financial services, in addition to our wider specialised consulting across a broad range of industries, has created an opportunity for an experienced Administration Executive in our client services team at our North Ryde office location.

You will play a key role in the front line handling of \xc2\xa0Employee Helpline calls, manage the scheduling, travel, and communications within multiple audit programs, manage the associated data-entry and client reporting, as well as ad hoc administration tasks to support the team function smoothly.

Your well-developed organisational skills, written and verbal communication and agility to calmly juggle multiple tasks and priorities will be essential to success in this position.

You will be positive, enthusiastic and a self-starter. Customer service, personal integrity, resilience under pressure, sense of humour and the ability to work within a busy team are also high priorities.

We need a practical-thinking, solutions-based person with a terrific balance between 'detail and big picture' thinking so they can hit the ground running, and work with minimal supervision.

We are offering an outstanding opportunity to join this growing office, with excellent systems and processes in place to support you, but with room to make your mark with your own ideas.

This role has a fixed-term of 12-months, with successful completion leading to the possibility of an ongoing permanent position. Ideally full-time hours are required, however part-time and flexible office hours will be considered for the right applicant.

Immediate start is available and desired.\xc2\xa0 For more information about the role please email Tim Hayes at tim.hayes@erstrategies.com.au.

"

title: Strategic Agreements Partner
description:
b'

The Company\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Coca-Cola Amatil (CCA) is one of the largest bottlers of non-alcoholic ready-to-drink beverages in the Asia-Pacific region and one of the major five Coca-Cola bottlers. CCA operates in six countries - Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, Fiji and Samoa. CCA employs 14,000 people across the Group and has access to 270 million consumers through more than 850,000 active customers.

\xc2\xa0

Role Purpose

\xc2\xa0

An exciting role is available for a Customer Agreements -Strategic Partner to join our Finance Centre of Expertise.\xc2\xa0 In this role, you will enjoy partnering with the Sales business units providing commercial guidance to support the negotiation and management of customer agreements from across the business. We are looking for 2 individuals to join our newly transformed team; with one individual based in North Sydney and the other based in Northmead (free parking onsite at Northmead).

You will be providing support to Coca-Cola Amatil\xe2\x80\x99s National and Key Account Sales teams.\xc2\xa0 You will review and analyse agreement submissions in partnership with Sales teams to help maximise national sales revenue and EBIT outcomes, whilst mitigating risk in accordance with Coca-Cola Amatil\xe2\x80\x99s guidelines, policy and performance metrics.

\xc2\xa0

Some additional accountabilities include continuous improvement of processes and tools that enhance and drive value through the agreements process, recognising and solving complex contractual hurdles through analysis and modelling and conducting comprehensive customer agreement reviews [at EBIT] and summarising key drivers and performance outcomes to make recommendations to the business based on risks to agreement obligations.

\xc2\xa0

About you

\xc2\xa0

The ideal candidate will have strong analytical capability with proven experience in building economically sound business cases and influencing outcomes and challenging decisions appropriately using fact based data, proven experience in providing sound commercial advice and influencing commercial outcomes, strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex financial information simply.

\xc2\xa0

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel is essential to your success.\xc2\xa0 CA/CPA/CIMA qualifications is highly regarded.

\xc2\xa0

Additional skills:

\xc2\xa0

  • Strong Customer focus and the ability to build and maintain effective cross functional business partnerships through demonstrated integrity,
  • Highly efficient and effective work practices, and looks for opportunity to streamline and improve routines

\xc2\xa0

The Benefits

CCA fosters an environment where people are encouraged to innovate and contribute to the continuing success of our organisation. We are able to offer highly unique career opportunities to dedicated individuals who enhance and add value to our business; providing uncompromising commitment to customer satisfaction.\xc2\xa0

Apply now to start building a career worth looking forward to!\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Trainee Sales Executive | Mercedes-Benz
description:
b"

About Tynan Motors

Tynan Motors, is one of Australia's largest and most respected motor dealerships. We are a multi-franchise dealership and Service Centre that's has been operating in the Sutherland Shire and South Coast Region for 50 years. From Mercedes-Benz to Hyundai, Tynan Motors has a car for everyone's needs.

About the role

Due to unprecedented growth, a unique opportunity exists for a well-presented, enthusiastic and dedicated Trainee Sales Executive - Light Commercial Vehicles\xc2\xa0to join the Mercedes-Benz Tynan Motors dealership located in Miranda.

This role is an excellent opportunity to work with the Mercedes-Benz brand.\xc2\xa0Reporting to the Light Commercial Sales Manager, you will be responsible for cultivating and promoting this luxury brand.

Responsibilities' include, but not limited to:

  • Understanding customer objectives, buying needs and decision making process
  • Developing your skillset into one of our star Sales Executives

  • Ensuring your product knowledge is up to date and you are able to sell the benefits and features of each model
  • Delivering exceptional customer service while assisting out clients to find the right vehicle

About you

  • Passionate about the automotive industry and the Mercedes-Benz Brand
  • Have a true passion for selling prestige motor vehicles
  • Exceptional customer service and relationship building skills
  • Highly organised
  • An Eye for Detail
  • Motivated and Process Driven\xc2\xa0

title: Marketing Manager
description:
b"

You don't just listen to music, you love music. You don't follow style you elevate it. You don't see a challenge... You seize the opportunity to make your mark.

We want to channel that love, focus, passion and belief into a strong business advocacy and training program that doesn't just inform \xe2\x80\x93 it inspires.

Our client is searching an individual\xc2\xa0to represent an internationally recognised lifestyle brand, a brand with music and lifestyle at its core. The Market Influence Manager (Influencer) role will be the face and voice of that brand, for consumers and retail partners alike \xe2\x80\x93 a culture influencer who communicates product features in a way that creates excitement and drives sales.

Position Summary

A highly visible, fast-paced consumer- and retailer-facing position, responsible for cultivating relationships within a given region, as well as collaborating with the Regional Lead to build and mobilize a staff of brand Specialist (Specialist).

Retail partners will rely on Influencers for product training, communication and support from the brand, in-store promotional event planning and general relationship building. In turn, the brand will look to the Influencers to deliver retail feedback and metrics (both quantitative and qualitative), develop and strengthen partnerships, seek out new merchandising opportunities, and grow brand advocacy in market. The schedule will be tight, demanding flexibility, efficiency and the ability to work under pressure.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain relationships with defined list of retail partners to collect retailer mind share; conduct store training; and grow brand advocacy and influence among store management
  • Collect, report and analyze customer feedback competitive information and sales/marketing data
  • Communicate the brand's sales and marketing initiatives
  • Conduct store visits based on pre-defined schedules and compliance goals
  • Attend regional training events to stay up-to-date on full product line knowledge
  • Provide timely, accurate updates and reports to Regional Leads
  • Plan, coordinate and execute in-store promotional events
  • Meet pre-defined sales and marketing goals, including growth of merchandising opportunities
  • Hire, manage, motivate, coach and train a staff of Brand Specialist
  • Meet staff attrition goals through best practices in hiring and talent development
  • Ensure all staff members are properly trained on product features and benefits
  • Represent the brand with the highest level of professionalism, expertise and enthusiasm

Qualifications:

  • BA/BS Degree in Sales/Marketing preferred
  • 3-5+ years of experience in retail sales, preferably management level
  • Experience managing a team, preferably in retail setting with prior staff management and sales experience and the ability to demonstrate past success in those areas \xe2\x80\x93 specifically in retaining team members.
  • Demonstrated success in meeting sales goals and team attrition goals
  • Experience interviewing and hiring employees
  • Fluency in English
  • Exceptional communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 both oral and written
  • Outstanding organizational skills and ability to put together project plans
  • Experience in event planning desired
  • Outgoing and engaging personality \xe2\x80\x93 you can (and enjoy) talking to anyone
  • Solid understanding of retail business metrics and decision processes
  • Passion for new technology and comfort with describing technical features and benefits
  • Flexible and adaptable; able to manage shifting priorities as projects evolve
  • Proficiency with MS Office products, email and online productivity tools
  • Ability to travel
"

title: Sales Administration Officer
description:
b"

Scientific Games is a leading innovator in the regulated gaming and global lottery industries. We specialise in the development, production and distribution of fun and exciting products such as Instant Scratch products and systems, Electronic Table Games, Gaming Machines and advanced Casino systems.

Beginning with the breakthrough technology that launched the world's very first secure instant lottery game in 1974, Scientific Games has continued to be a driving force behind the success of more than 300 customers on six continents over the last 40 years across 3 divisions \xe2\x80\x93 Gaming, Lotteries and Interactive.

With over 8000 employees around the world, we are always looking for high performing people to join our exciting and innovative business. We want professionals from all types of backgrounds with varying experiences to contribute to our diverse, but strong culture \xe2\x80\x93 to create the world's best gaming and lottery business.

Overview:

This unique and exciting full time opportunity will be based in our\xc2\xa0new Silverwater Head Office\xc2\xa0where you will see yourself an integral part of our Sales & Marketing department, reporting into the Senior Sales Administrator.\xc2\xa0As a Sales Administration Officer you\xc2\xa0will be responsible for the following:

Benefits:

How to Apply:

  • If you believe you would excel in this role please send an application letter addressing the positions key requirements, along with a copy of your CV.
  • This is a unique and exciting opportunity for an outstanding Sales Admin Officer to apply and develop their skills and experience in a fantastic and vibrant environment.

    Australian residents / citizens only need apply

    No Recruitment Agencies Please

title: Head of Infrastructure and Service Delivery
description:
b"
  • Ardent Leisure is a fast growing, ASX company with around 10,000 staff across 150 sites in Australia, New Zealand, and the USA
  • Permanent Full Time role with an attractive remuneration package on offer
  • Located at Milsons Point, NSW\xc2\xa0

About Ardent:
Ardent Leisure is one of Australia's most successful owners and operators of premium leisure brands: AMF & Kingpin Bowling, Dreamworld, WhiteWater World, and SkyPoint on the Gold Coast, d\xe2\x80\x99Albora Marinas, and Main Event entertainment division in the USA.

The Head of Infrastructure and Service Delivery will be responsible for planning, organizing, and managing their teams and the overall operations to ensure the stable operation of the organisation\xe2\x80\x99s IT support processes, IT infrastructure and corresponding to 3rd party vendors. This includes developing, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing the following areas; IT support desk, the IT infrastructure, the data network and data communications, desktop infrastructure, data centre operations, asset management, risk / security, telecommunications systems and vendor management.

  • Strong customer service orientation

Ardent has a dynamic and entrepreneurial culture and is a great place to grow your career. To apply for this role please provide a copy of your resume and a cover letter. Strictly no agencies please.

"

title: Corporate Finance - M&A Advisory - Manager
description:
b'

Do you have extensive M&A experience complemented by a strong market presence or willingness to build a profile?

About our team

Our national M&A Advisory practice is an integrated team of high calibre lead M&A advisers providing transaction-focused strategic advice to private clients, large corporates, private equity funds and listed groups across the mid-market space. We advise our clients on a wide range of corporate transactions including acquisitions, divestments, recapitalisations and capital raisings.

Over the past five years we have advised on over 85 transactions making us Australia\xe2\x80\x99s leading mid-market advisory team.

Following an internal promotion we are seeking a Manager to join our Sydney office.

About the role

This exciting role will see you advising our clients\xe2\x80\x99 most senior executives to evaluate and execute M&A transactions. Importantly you will also play a key role in developing junior team members and raising the profile of the business in the local market.

Specifically the role will see you involved in:

  • A wide range of transactions including acquisitions, divestments and capital raisings
  • Cross border deals with international and national blue chip clients, private companies and private equity
  • Preparation and review of key deal documents including Information Memorandums
  • End-to-end project management of transactions including direct liaison with vendors, bidders and other deal stakeholders (including legal advisers, etc.)
  • Preparation and review of valuation materials and financial models
  • Oversight of the management of the due diligence process including the data room and Q&A process
  • Negotiation of key transaction terms
  • Actively participate and lead business development initiatives, both with the Partners in the team, and through your personal networks


About your experience

The successful candidate will ideally be able to demonstrate:

  • A minimum 4+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in an M&A transaction environment, preferably in a lead M&A Advisory role
  • Strong financial analysis, valuation and modelling skills, including integrated financial models
  • Highly developed project management and communications skills, including a track record of delivering outstanding client service in compressed timeframes
  • Sound understanding of the Australian M&A environment (public market, private company and private equity)
  • Previous experience in supervising / mentoring team members
  • A strong market presence and/or desire to build a profile within the Sydney mid-market M&A community
  • Dedicated industry experience is preferred but not essential (Technology, Media & Telecommunications or Consumer Business experience would be highly regarded)
  • Completed a post-graduate qualification (e.g. CA, CFA or MBA)


About Us: Deloitte Culture

Deloitte is the largest professional services firm in the World by both revenue and number of professionals. Deloitte provides a range of audit, tax, consulting, enterprise risk and financial advisory services across more than 20 industries and with more than 244,400 professionals globally. In FY 2016, the firm earned a record $36.8 billion USD in revenues and was ranked by Fortune magazine as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For and by Bloomberg Business has been consistently named as the best place to launch a career. In Australia, we have been one of the fastest growing professional services over the last decade and pride ourselves on also being often considered one of the most innovative.

We are innovative and different because YOU are\xe2\x80\xa6 we pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one at our firm you\xe2\x80\x99ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life\xe2\x80\xa6.you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.

Next Steps

If you have questions regarding this role the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential discussion. Regarding this role you can contact Juliette Jamoneau on 02 8260 4149.

'
