A key mandate is to IMPROVE & DEVELOP the commercial function.

The key areas of responsibility for this person are:

  • Managing a team of 4-5 commercial staff of varying levels (Commercial Managers to Analyst) \xc2\xa0
  • Overall responsibility for annual budget and quarterly forecast process for the Australian business.
  • Responsible for developing embryonic management information (MI) function within the commercial finance team to develop and manage non-financial metrics to drive operational efficiency within the organization.
  • Work with MD, CFO, COO and Business Development Director and other members of the executive team to evaluate new opportunities, projects and the strategic direction of the different brands within the organization.
  • Leveraging and maximizing systems to drive better business insight and collation of data.
  • Drive change and process improvement within the organisation to optimize business outcomes.
  • Work with the financial control team to ensure a high quality of review each month end to ensure a clean month end close.
  • Drive and embed a culture of cost control throughout the organization.
  • Act as liaison between finance and the wider business to cascade changes coming out of finance to the wider business

We are looking for a qualified accountant (CA, CIMA, CPA or equivalent) who is an experienced FP&A Leader. You must have developed, improved, grown or changed an commercial function quite radically - whilst this is not a 'greenfield' build, it is taking a function and evolving it quickly and dramatically to produce information that is insightful and usable by both the Australian business, Global HQ (London) and Private Equity Owners. If you have worked with PE or have experience in a very demanding, long-hours and high expectation environment\xc2\xa0you will be of interest to this client.\xc2\xa0You must have experience of driving out, managing and monitoring non-financial data as well as financial KPIs. With exprience managing and leading teams of different levels, you should be very comfortable 'in the detail' and consider yourself 'hands-on' as well as having the gravitas to deal with a Global CFO, global Executives and as well as local management and Executives.\xc2\xa0You should be able to answer detailed questions but also talk about the strategic issues effecting the business or sector with business heads and executive teams. You have excellent communication and relationship building skills and can do this in a complex matrix structure. You are prepared to enquire and challenge the status quo in a constructive manner. You have seen different BI systems and can add value in maxmising those systems. Additionally you can operate effectively in fast moving, high-pressure environments.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Corporate Finance - M&A Advisory Analyst/ Senior Analyst
description:
b'

Do you have some advisory experience and sound financial acumen? Are you genuinely passionate about taking a role in Corporate Finance and the Australian / global M&A market?

About the role

Due to continued strong deal-flow and pipeline growth we are seeking a talented Analyst or Senior Analyst to join the technical and highly dynamic Sydney M&A Advisory team at Deloitte, led by an experienced group of ex-Investment Banking and Senior M&A professionals. Your new challenge will see you involved in:

  • Global transactions with international and national blue chip clients, emerging companies and private equity firms
  • A challenging range of transactions including acquisitions, takeovers, mergers, divestments and capital raises
  • Being responsible for the preparation of financial analysis and key deal documents, including information memoranda
  • Leading the preparation of valuations (including comparable companies, precedent transactions and DCF) across a range of industries and transaction structures
  • Management of due diligence processes including responsibility for the data room and Q&A process
  • End-to-end project management of transactions including direct liaison with vendors/bidders/Boards and other deal stakeholders


Over the past five years we have advised on over 85 transactions making us Australia\xe2\x80\x99s leading mid-market M&A advisory team.

About your experience

You will ideally be able to demonstrate:

  • For Analysts, a minimum 12 months\xe2\x80\x99 experience in a relevant field (corporate finance, management consulting, engineering, accounting and other professional services)
  • For Senior Analysts, a minimum 2-4 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in an M&A transaction environment, preferably in a lead advisory role or financial due diligence, valuations or modelling role
  • Strong financial analysis, valuation and modelling skills, including being able to prepare integrated financial models and discounted cash flows
  • Highly developed project management and communications skills, including a track record of delivering outstanding client service in compressed timeframes
  • Good understanding of the Australian M&A environment (public market, private company and private equity)
  • Strong MS Office skills (including Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and experience with research tools (S&P CapitalIQ, Bloomberg etc.)
  • Completed or progressing towards completion post-graduate qualification (e.g. CA, CFA or MBA)


About Us: Deloitte Culture

Deloitte is the largest professional services firm in the World by both revenue and number of professionals. Deloitte provides a range of audit, tax, consulting, enterprise risk and financial advisory services across more than 20 industries and with more than 244,400 professionals globally. In FY 2016, the firm earned a record $36.8 billion USD in revenues and was ranked by Fortune magazine as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For and by Bloomberg Business has been consistently named as the best place to launch a career. In Australia, we have been one of the fastest growing professional services over the last decade and pride ourselves on also being often considered one of the most innovative.

We are innovative and different because YOU are\xe2\x80\xa6 we pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one at our firm you\xe2\x80\x99ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life\xe2\x80\xa6.you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.

Next Steps

If you have questions regarding this role the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential discussion. Regarding this role you can contact Juliette Jamoneau on 02 8260 4149.

'

title: ICT TECHNICAL SUPPORT ENGINEERS
description:
b'

This position assists staff with technical support of desktop computers, applications, and related technology. Support includes specification, installation, and testing of computer systems and peripherals within established standards and guidelines. Activities require interaction with application software and operating systems to diagnose and resolve unique, non-recurring problems.

Resource will provide

(a) Medium-level analysis and technical support for customers and their networked computers and peripherals.\xc2\xa0

(b) Interface with multiple levels of end users, management, VIPs and local technical staff.\xc2\xa0

Duties include (but not limited too)

  • Dedicated and Dispatch engineer roles may vary for on-site requirements but not in skill sets and ability.
  • Accurately testing, identifying, repairing, resolving, and documenting end user technical issues regarding basic network/desktop/laptop support, Printers, PDAs, Blackberrys, and LAN cable drops
  • Break-fix, troubleshoot and resolve software issues; Reimaging computers/hard drives
  • IMACD function including installation and decommission
  • Support the user in local data backup and restore as per the documented process.
  • Assist Service Desk/Remote Desktop Support teams for hands and feet coordination efforts
  • Assist on Incident and Problem management activities
  • Taking ownership of issues through to resolution on all appropriate requests
  • Categorize and prioritize end user support requests (Incidents) and service requests by utilizing ticketing system to track tickets and provide up-to-date status and information
  • Move equipment within the premises associated with escalated help desk incidents and service requests
  • Performing asset inventory activities as needed
  • Recommends and/or performs upgrades on systems to ensure longevity
  • Works with procurement staff to purchase hardware and software
  • Maintain spare parts/ inventory list on a monthly basis and coordinate for any disposal requisites
  • Provide support, setup, test, training, logistics and maintenance of all required Workstation and peripheral equipment at the site.

Requirements:

  • 2 to 4 years of experience in the field or in a related area required.
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc)
  • Strong Microsoft Operating System installation and troubleshooting skills
  • Strong Break / Fix skills Desktops, Workstations, Notebooks and Printers and Handhelds
  • Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of\xc2\xa0 Networks, Servers and Telecoms
  • Strong Customer service skills
  • Ability to provide consistent, excellent customer support to entire staff, representing a variety of personalities and management levels
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be detail oriented and self-motivating
  • Basic Background security check required
  • Preferred experience including remote control of PCs and video conferencing knowledge

MUST HAVE:
Full Working Rights in Australia\xc2\xa0

Advantageous Skills for support at sites would be:

  • MCSA certified
  • ITIL certified
  • IPad and tablets support
  • Audio Video conferencing
  • Basic Networking Knowledge
'

title: Enrolments Administrator
description:
b'

Full-time

Start Date: negotiable for the right applicant

Salary: based on skills and experience

Closing date: 21 May 2017

A great opportunity has arisen for an experienced and enthusiastic Enrolments Administrator to join our Enrolments Department. \xc2\xa0

Working closely with the Registrar, you will be responsible for providing outstanding administrative support in all aspects of the School's enrolment process including liaising with current and prospective families.

It is essential that you have a warm and friendly personality, a passion for customer service, a high level of professionalism, strong organisational skills and are a confident communicator and multi-tasker. Equally, you will need to have strong administration skills with a strong understanding of the enrolment processes, writing reports related to enrolments data, student commencement, student withdrawal and deferral.

Essential requirements:

  • 2+ years experience in administration; experience in school administration desirable, but not essential
  • Advanced proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite packages, background in Mac operating systems (desirable)
  • Working with Children Check Clearance
  • Current First Aid Certificate

How to Apply:

Prior to commencing your application, please review the Position Description on our website http://www.mlcsyd.nsw.edu.au/page/public/about-mlc-school/employment and follow the instructions on how to apply. Only those applications submitted directly to recruitment@mlcsyd.nsw.edu.au prior to 21 May 2017 will be accepted.

The successful candidate will be rewarded with a number of exciting benefits, which are listed on our website.

MLC School recruitment team will commence reviewing the applications before the closing date and interested applicants are encourage to apply early, as the position may close when a suitable applicant is found.

Telephone enquiries about the position may be directed to our Head of Human Resources, Angela D'Amore on 02 8741 3917.

'

title: Business Traineeship
description:
b'

We have a traineeship available in Certificate III Business with a large construction company. A 12 month Traineeship with the prospect of a great career path for the right people on successful completion. There may be the opportunity to progress to Certificate IV.

Duties include data entry, some reception, enrolments for courses, phone work, policies and procedures, learning the data base, telephone enquiries, ordering stationery and other related duties and administration tasks.

Formal training will be on the job with time allocated during work hours plus internal training.

The successful applicant will have an eye for detail, great organisational skills, able to multi task, able to work in a team and individually. Also able to demonstrate adaptability. You must be reliable, enthusiastic and willing to learn, be well presented with good communication skills. Skills required are exceptional customer service skills and a professional telephone manner.

Hours are Monday \xe2\x80\x93 Friday 40 hour week full time 8.30am \xe2\x80\x93 5.00pm. Ideal for recent school leaver. Drivers licence and own transport required as there is no public transport to the area.

No qualifications are required as the relevant training will be provided. Those with qualifications of certificate III or above (including university graduates) need not apply. Trainees will be paid under the National Training Wage. Please forward your resume including a cover letter to kduck@austrg.com.au

'

title: Director - Infrastructure Consulting
description:
b"

Company

The organisation is a truly purpose-led business with the aim of partnering with clients to achieve effective business objectives. The Strategy practice is able to offer clients end-to-end solutions due to the seamless interlock of the strategic function with the wider business. With a current focus on Digital Strategy, Innovation and Big Data, this organisation not only designs strategy, but offers delivery with non biased technology selection.

Role

This global consulting practice is currently experiencing a tremendous level of growth to meet the increasing demand of clients. As such the organisation is looking for a seasoned strategy professional with deep experience in the infrastructure/utilities space to build, drive and grow the heavy industry practice, with a focus on utilities, oil/gas, mining, energy and infrastructure.

There is an opportunity for the right person to make a mark, shape a team and play an important lead role in this. The Director will be tasked with both business development and delivery, and have access to a wide range of high-value clients. There is a real opportunity to gain market share, so the client would also be open to team move options.

Profile

  • Recent local experience as a Director in a brand name consulting firm
  • Sector expertise in infrastructure, energy and utilities, with a solid network in these areas
  • Proven ability to deliver value in a consulting business unit including mentoring and helping with the development of more junior team members
  • Exceptional stakeholder engagement and influencing skills and high level of gravitas
  • Proven internal practice development skills
  • Highly attuned strategic mindset and ability to problem solve logically and fluently

What's on offer

A senior position in a truly global consulting business, with a dynamic and collaborative partnership model. A high-performing team of peers, an exceptional compensation / remuneration package, and world leading professional development.

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Please note that any references to salary or pay rates in this advertisement and in the salary refinement section are indicative only and should only be used as a guide.

"

title: Senior Payroll Officer
description:
b"

Australian Pacific College is a large and growing Australian privately owned RTO that has been operating in Australia for over 20 years. Campuses are located in the Sydney CBD, Bondi Junction, Manly Beach, Brisbane CBD and Melbourne CBD.

Our courses include English Language Intensive Courses for Overseas Students (ELICOS) and Vocational Education and Training (VET) courses. For more information please visit us at www.apc.edu.au www.englishunlimited.qld.edu.au and www.aptt.edu.au

We are seeking an enthusiastic Senior Payroll Officer to join our Sydney CBD office and lead our payroll functions reporting to the CFO. You'll work to ensure our payroll expenses and taxes are paid correctly and on time. A big part of your job will be to review the education industry related awards / contracts, establish process to efficiently and effectively manage fortnightly pay. The first assignment of this role would be to identify, working with all business stakeholders to specify requirements and implement an HRIS / Payroll system that meets the education industry business requirements within the first six months.

Our ideal candidate would be analytical and methodical, with experience in payroll administration and deep knowledge of payroll regulations, to manage payroll of c250 employees We also value integrity, team spirit and strong organizational skills.

Your goal will be to ensure our payroll procedures are compliant, efficient, and accurate for 200 employees.\xc2\xa0 There is also an additional 200 contracted trainers for this growing organization.

\xc2\xa0

Key Responsibilities:

  • Payroll processing

  • Fortnight payroll summary and analysis

  • Prepare payroll journal by campus / cost centre

  • AL and LS Leave tracking / calculations

  • TOIL Management

  • Payroll tax calculations

  • Help co-ordinate and process remuneration reviews / anniversary Level reviews

  • Superannuation quarterly

  • PAYG Submission

  • Annual payment summaries for employees

  • Workers compensation renewal

  • New/separation staff pay calculations

  • Prepare teacher step calculation (Education Awards)

  • Annual post-secondary award rate changes

  • Annual casual education industry award rate changes

  • Review existing employee contracts

  • Prepare payroll related documents for staff visa

  • WEGA reporting annual (payroll data)

\xc2\xa0

Essentials skills and experience:

  • Professional certification in payroll management, Human Resources or related field

  • Three to five years post qualified experience

  • Extensive knowledge and experience with all areas of payroll and employment related requirements (including FBT, Superannuation, Payroll Tax, Workers Compensation, WGEA reporting etc)

  • Proven track record to question and review current processes and implement improvements or automation for repetitive and high volume transactions

  • Proactive, Self-Starter and Fast Learner;

  • Excellent verbal/written communication and comprehension skills;

  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills;

  • Ability to think outside the square for solutions;

  • Experience leading or coordinating projects;

  • Demonstrated capacity to work as part of a team

\xc2\xa0

Desirable skills & experience:

  • Experience with Implementation Payroll and HR Systems;

  • Interest in keeping up to date with current technologies and implement into the current organisation;

A base salary range will be considered between $60K to $75K, with the successful candidate depending on experience and qualifications.

To apply, please send your resume and covering letter to jobs@apc.edu.au

Only successful candidates will be contacted.

Recruitment agencies need not apply.

"

title: Corporate Receptionist
description:
b'

The Firm:

Our client is a leading property and construction firm focused on outstanding client service for their local and international customers. Based in stylish offices in the heart of the CBD this ever growing organisation offers an exciting and fast paced environment

The Role:

Based on their front of house, our client requires an experienced Corporate Receptionist to come on board in a permanent capacity to assist with the management of their busy switchboard whilst supporting the wider business.

Responsibilities:

As the Corporate Receptionist you will be the first point of contact for the firm so an immaculate presentation along with impeccable communication skills are a must as you will be dealing with VIP clients on a daily basis. In this role you will be required to wear many hats at any one time so the ability to multitask and work under pressure is key.

  • Management of a busy switchboard
  • Meeting & greeting of VIP clients
  • Coordination of meetings on behalf of the team
  • Data entry of company files
  • General administration support to the wider office

This role requires a candidate who ideally has previous Corporate Reception experience with an extremely high level of professionalism. You will display the ability to prioritise your tasks whilst assisting with the running of the front office.

If you enjoy working in a fast paced environment whilst juggling an array of tasks at any one time then this is the role for you.

Don\xe2\x80\x99t wait! Send your resume now to Tom on the PKL Team - We\xe2\x80\x99re waiting to hear from you.

'

title: JUNIOR RECEPTIONIST/ADMIN ASSISTANT/OFFICE JUNIOR
description:
b'

We are a Menswear fashion importer/wholesaler based in St.Peters, we are looking for an enthusiastic,energetic, outgoing OFFICE JUNIOR to join our small team.

DUTIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO:

  • Answering incoming calls
  • General Administration duties
  • Data entry
  • Assisting The Sales Manager on a daily basis
  • Tracking sales orders
  • Filing
  • Attending to and sending emails

TO BE SUITABLE FOR THIS ROLE YOU MUST:

  • Be an Australian Resident
  • Must be Computer Literacy-Proficiency with Microsoft Word,Excel,Outlook as this is a major part of this position
  • Ability to Multi-Task and prioritise effectively
  • Enthusiasm and desire to learn a variety of duties
  • Ability to work as part of a team or alone
  • MUST BE AVAILABLE TO WORK MONDAY-FRIDAY 9.00AM-5PM
  • AWARD WAGES

    DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU MEET THE CRITERIA OF THIS JOB\xc2\xa0

'

title: Accounts Payable / Administration
description:
b'
  • Close to Green Square Station
  • Great Career Opportunity
  • Construction Industry

Our client is a well\xc2\xa0regarded construction company delivering high quality Commercial & Residential Projects.

The Role involves\xc2\xa0liaising with the construction and accounting teams and requires someone who pays attention to detail and is accurate in data entry. You will be reporting to the Financial Controller in a team of 4.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Entering Invoices
  • Liaising with Creditors
  • Cheque Runs
  • Filing / Photocopying
  • Petty Cash
  • Maintaining Various Registers
  • Matching Purchase Orders and Dockets to Invoices

To be successful you must have:

  • Minimum 6 - 12 months accounts payable
  • Construction Industry experience highly regarded
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Experienced using Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Must be keen to learn with a positive attitude

If this sounds like you then please submit your resume asap to debbie@eliteappointments.com.au

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Digital Manager
salary: b'Great benefits inc. additional leave with tenure!'
description:
b"Vizeum\xc2\xa0is a young, smart, progressive media agency with an entrepreneurial spirit and a challenger attitude, forming part of the global\xc2\xa0Dentsu Aegis Network. We don't start with a media plan or which channels to invest in. We approach our client's business or marketing opportunities as a strategic advisor and look at the full range of communication options available.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The Digital Manager provides experience and seniority within their team to deliver outcomes that successfully determine a client's relationship with the agency. They are responsible for the successful evaluation, recommendation and execution of client investment on a campaign by campaign basis.\xc2\xa0

Required skills and Experience:
  • In conjunction with the Digital Director (DD), develop best of breed campaigns and strategies for clients
  • Assist DD in procuring and implementing New Business
  • Work with new and existing clients to understand their products, target audiences, communications strategies and key messages.\xc2\xa0
  • Work with the client and/or partner agency to develop meaningful strategies, pitch documentation and other assets
  • Develop accurate schedules and placement instructions to our publishing partners
  • Report how campaign results relate to the strategic intent of the campaign
  • Data input into the media buying system (BCC)
  • Checking media confirmations to ensure they correspond with actual booked activity
  • Checking financial schedules to ensure they match reports which are sent to client
  • Checking pro-forma's and ensuring they match final bought activity
  • Make bookings as directed by Media Planners/Buyers as required
  • Provide assistance to Media Planner/Buyers in the group as required
Skills/Attributes/Experience required:
  • Ideally 4+ Years media experience, including 3+ years in media buying and/or strategy development
  • Demonstrated leadership and people management skills
  • High level communication, negotiation and influencing skills
  • Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with staff and key stakeholders
  • Ability to work under pressure and move effectively from detail orientated tasks to more managerial issues effecting the agency
  • Demonstrated negotiation skills
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Strong presentation creation and delivery skills
  • A thorough understanding of the Australian media landscape
What's on offer:
You will be joining a supportive, friendly and fun work environment where work/life balance is encouraged and access to training and development is provided.\xc2\xa0 You'll never be bored, instead you will have the opportunity to use a variety of skills to deliver a high standard of work to a diverse and fulfilling client base.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
If this sounds like you - apply now! "

title: NA
description:
b'
  • Inner West location
  • Training and career development
  • Discounted health insurance

Our client is looking for an Service Administrator who can assist the Service management team in delivery with the correct administrative requirements and compliance, including safety, quality, contractual responsibilities, subcontractors, company procedures, financial controls and employee relations.

Responsibilities for the role;

Providing Administrative support to the Service Manager they are looking for a strong candidate that can undertake tasks allocated with minimum supervision, whilst working to important deadlines.

Ensure that the confidentiality of information which the position may be privy to is treated appropriately.

Maintaining of booking and dispatching of technicians and Jobs when required

Assisting with the arrangement of meetings and any documentation or amenities required are organized.

Check arrival of all ordered stock and advise Managers accordingly as applicable

Prepare and/or review correspondence, reports, charts, spreadsheets and other related

Gathers, enters, and/or updates data to maintained

And a whole lot more.

WHAT DO I NEED TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN?

You need to have a minimum of 2-3 years solid office admin experience, supporting a team in a fast paced environment

A desire to grow

Extremely strong MS Office skills

Very strong attention to detail, high level of accuracy and diplomacy

Ability to multitask

Able to read situations well, nothing is too big or too small for you to handle

Excellent Presentation

In return you will receive a great career opportunity, A salary to match your skills, discounted health insurance, access to the Employees assistance programme and a great culture and variety of people.

Please send your resume ASAP for a chance to interview.

'

title: Accountant
description:
b'

About Us

Smartgroup is an award winning leading provider of employee benefits (salary packaging and novated leasing) and workforce optimisation services for the government, health and corporate sectors. We pride ourselves on excellent customer service, employee engagement and are continuously looking to improve and grow.

We have won several awards for Service Excellence, Aon Hewitt\xe2\x80\x99s Best Employer and recently ranked in the top 50 Most Innovative Companies.

About the Role

Due to growth we are seeking an experienced accountant to join our centralised Finance team in Sydney. This position is responsible for the management of vendor matsterdata and associated general ledger processes such as bank reconciliations.

To see success, you would possess relevant experience in a similar function with an in depth understanding of accounting procedures, systems and processes with strong decision making capabilities.

The core duties will include:

  • Management of the vendor setup and masterdata process for the Group to ensure timely and accurate payment of supplier invoices
  • Preparation and management of the bank reconciliation for all Group corporate bank accounts including loading transactions on a daily basis or as required
  • Review and posting of non-AP expenses including corporate cards and travel costs
  • Preparation of general journals
  • Preparation of ad hoc payments in an online banking platform
  • Reconciliation of GL accounts
  • Reconciliation of transactional data to customer/supplier data
  • Preparation and maintenance of procedure documentation

About You

We are looking for experienced candidates who have:

  • Diploma or degree qualified in accounting
  • Ideally, working towards undertaking CA/CPA qualification
  • Intermediate level of Excel skills
  • Experience from a similar function partnering with the business
  • A proven ability to communicate effectively, particularly with timeline and issues management
  • A focus on continuous improvement and innovation
  • An ability to work with a variety of systems and automation


Opportunities for career progression and travel will be administered through a generous work-life balance structure. A great time to join a dynamic and fast moving organisation.

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to principles of diversity in the recruitment of all roles.

'

title: NA
description:
b"

Teachers Mutual Bank is one of the largest and most successful mutual banks in Australia. We are proud to be a company that encourages innovation, promotes flexibility and actively encourages diversity in the workplace.

Our Third Party Distribution in Parramatta currently has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Broker Operations Officer to provide high level administrative support to the team.

The Broker Operations Officer has a critical role in ensuring TMBL' s future growth via the Third Party Distribution from both an internal and external engagement combined with a key responsibility of supporting strong broker relationships from an operational perspective.

The main responsibilities in this position will include:

  • Managing the third party administrative process and related dedicated support systems
  • Provides a superior level of client service, whilst taking ownership of all customer requests and issues and follow through to ensure both Aggregator, Broker and end customer satisfaction
  • Adapting existing Internal TMB system changes by identifying and modifying to ensure successful implementation
  • Providing support to the Head of Third Party Distribution on newly identified projects associated with the growth of the channel
  • Maintaining strong relationships with all third party channels both internally and externally

Applicant Requirements:

To succeed in this role, you will have:

  • Strong experience and understanding of mortgage lending products and Third Party Distribution processes
  • Knowledge of compliance and audit frameworks within the mortgage broking industry will be highly regarded
  • FSR Tier 2 accreditation
  • Intermediate MS Word and Excel skills
  • Ability to analyse financial data and draw conclusions

We are looking for someone with high attention to detail, strong data entry accuracy and great organisational skills. Your proven ability to communicate through verbal and written means and deliver on a tight turn-around will see you succeed in this role.

In return we offer an excellent salary package plus uniforms, RDO'S, workplace massages and many other fantastic employee benefits. Teachers Mutual Bank is an Employer of Choice, promotes Gender Diversity and follows EEO principles by appointing on merit.\xc2\xa0 For more information about working conditions as well as our employee value proposition, please visit the careers page on our website at www.tmbank.com.au

Applications can be sent via email to jobs@tmbank.com.au by no later than Tuesday, 16 May 2017. Detailed enquiries can be directed to Jessica Melo on 02 9735 9882 during business hours.

"

title: Warehouse Supervisor
description:
b"

We are looking for a Warehouse Supervisor to oversee and coordinate the daily warehousing activities. You will implement productivity, quality and customer service standards and achieve the appropriate level of volume within time limits.

Ultimately, you should be able to ensure that daily operations meet and exceed daily performance expectations and to increase the company's overall market share.

The role is a full-time, permanent position, after probationary period.

Responsibilities

  • Achieve high levels of customer satisfaction through excellence in receiving, identifying, dispatching and assuring quality of goods
  • Measure and report the effectiveness of warehousing activities and employees performance
  • Organise and maintain inventory and storage area
  • Ensure shipments' and inventory transactions' accuracy
  • Communicate job expectations and coach employees
  • Determine staffing levels and assign workload
  • Interface with customers to answer questions or solve problems
  • Maintain items record, document necessary information and utilize reports to project warehouse status
  • Identify areas of improvement and establish innovative or adjust existing work procedures and practices
  • Confer and coordinate activities with other departments

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as a warehouse storeman or supervisor
  • Highly effective supervisory skills and techniques
  • Basic computer knowledge and MS Office proficiency
  • Basic knowledge of Quickbooks would be advantageous, although not essential
  • Ability to input, retrieve and analyse data
  • Hands-on commitment to getting the job done
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills, which includes phone manner
  • Proven ability to direct and coordinate operations
  • Strong organisational and time management skills
  • South-west Sydney resident preferred
  • Own transport essential

For further details of the role, please contact Garry Cameron on 0418 88 0189.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Customer Support Officer - Multiple Positions - State Government Role
description:
b'

HOBAN are looking to recruit a number of customer service professionals to work for our large State Government Client based in Parramatta - close to the train station

The role offers full time hours (shifts fall anywhere between 7am-7pm), Monday to Friday shifts, an immediate start and great pay.

In this role you will be supporting the client service delivery team by undertaking the following duties:

  • Taking of general enquiry calls and providing information, support and advice on a new internal IT system
  • Refer enquiries and relevant information to the right staffing team
  • Input enquiries and other data into various systems
  • General administration - filing, scanning, archiving, database maintenance
  • Making a number of outbound calls to clients and other third party organisations

To be successful in this role you will:

  • Be able to provide excellent customer service and be able to demonstrate this in your previous experience
  • Be able to complete a range of administration tasks in a timely manner
  • Be able to demonstrate intermediate to advanced computer skills
  • Be able to commit to the full time role for the full\xc2\xa06 months duration of the contract
  • Be able to demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Be a fast learner, be able to work as part of a wider team but also be able to work autonomously
  • Be very personable, friendly and enjoy helping people - THIS IS KEY

If you feel like you meet all of the above criteria and are able to start\xc2\xa0as soon as possible\xc2\xa0please apply now for immediate consideration.

Please note you must be able attend an interview this week and early next week and be able to pass a police check to be successful. Roles due to start next week.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

  • Reception duties\xc2\xa0

title: Accounts Administrator
description:
b"

About us

Our organisation is a national outsourcing company specialising in the hospitality, corporate and commercial sectors. We are look for an experienced and dedicated person to join our fast paced, dynamic team off staff to work in a wide variety of accounting areas.

Key responsibilities

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, you will be expected to work in the following areas:

  • End-to-end payroll
  • Accounts\xc2\xa0payable
  • Accounts receivable
  • Accounts reconciliation
  • Add Hoc, BAS, end of month reporting
  • Data Entry

About you

You will have at least 10 year's experience working in an accounts department. You will have a\xc2\xa0can-do attitude and have a keen eye for details. You will also possess the following traits.\xc2\xa0

  • Intermediate Microsoft Office skills (including prior experience in using Excel formulas)
  • Excellent numerical skills

Prior experience in HR3 is desirable, but not essential.\xc2\xa0Immediate start is available for the right person.

What's on offer?

This full time role offers a competitive salary package, convenient\xc2\xa0CBD location (close to central station) and career opportunities.\xc2\xa0

If you think you are the right person for this role, please submit your resume and apply now.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Administrator - Marketing and Retail Support
description:
b'

ECCO, a world leading brand of shoes combining style and comfort, has built its success on uncompromising quality, innovative technology and the design philosophy, "the shoe must follow the foot". ECCO is the only major shoe manufacturer to own and manage every step of the shoe making process, and its employees are the life force behind its products, designing, developing, producing, and taking responsibility for every detail. ECCO products can be found in 4,000 branded sales locations in over 90 countries, a growth fueled by ECCO's consistent aim of making the best shoes in the world.

We have a great opportunity for an OFFICE ALL ROUNDER \xe2\x80\x93 "Jack off All Trades ADMINISTRATOR", to join the Head office Team, based in Castle Hill.

This newly created position will report to the Retail Manager and work across 2 divisions, MARKETING and RETAIL. It is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys some creative flair and flexibility of the Marketing space which is to be balanced by the processing of orders and reporting in the Retail space.

The ideal candidate will have:

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Exceptional administration and co-ordination skills

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Customer service experience in order to respond to calls and product queries

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Database or data entry experience

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Efficient in MS Office products

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SAP experience highly regarded

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Efficient time management

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Ability to liaise with both internal and external stakeholders is a must

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Ability to work independently and manage competing priorities

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 A 'hands on' approach to managing the variety of tasks that is required from Retail and Marketing

-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Experience in a similar role is essential

ECCO offers an attractive Employee Purchase Program. \xc2\xa0If you are have a PASSION for Shoes and a genuine desire to be part of a successful winning team ....

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 We Want to Hear from YOU....APPLY TODAY!

'

title: FP&A Manager - Banking and Financial Services
description:
b'

This is a high performing team of an organisation that is considered to be an employer of choice within financial services.

The work that you will be performing is valued greatly by the CEO, CFO and Fund Management Team. You will be working closely with the business on their long term budgets and planning.

The role has a lot of variety, ownership and accountability and is a great opportunity for an ambitious finance professional looking for the next step up in their career. The uniqueness of this role is that it requires someone with a mix of exceptional stakeholder management and presentation skills as well as strong financial modelling / technical skills and understanding of financial markets.

\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities:

  • Delivery of annual Business Unit 5 year plan and budget financial model
  • Involvement in board reporting and presentations to build rapport with the business
  • Delivery of annual company\xc2\xa05 year plan and Budget financial model
  • Delivery of\xc2\xa0Capital Forecast model
  • Delivery of quarterly business unit and company forecasts
  • Oversight\xc2\xa0with monthly budget analysis
  • Profit and loss analysis, including variance analysis, analysis to budget, economic moves versus actual investment returns
  • Continuous process improvement to identify and eliminate inefficiencies & high risk processes
  • Management of data\xc2\xa0and liaising with Middle Office, Financial Control and Business Performance teams to achieve accurate and efficient processes
  • Manage 1 staff\xc2\xa0(dependent on level of experience)
  • Scenario analysis and financial modelling
  • Investment analysis and forecasting

\xc2\xa0

Essential Criteria:

  • High level of energy, confidence and engagement
  • Intermediate to Advanced understanding of financial services in particular fund management. (Exposure to other asset classes is a bonus)
  • CA, CFA, CPA or relevant Masters degree
  • Accounting knowledge
  • Advanced excel modelling skills
  • Multi-stakeholder management
  • Advanced communication skills
  • Intermediate data base analysis skills accompanied with intermediate understanding of systems & data flows (e.g. SQL, understanding data bases)
  • Collaborative work style

For a confidential discussion, please contact Iain McLeod\xc2\xa0+612 9003 4909

'

title: Fleet Coordinator
description:
b"


Sibelco Australia mines and manufactures a wide range of mineral products for both local and international markets. Founded in 1872, Sibelco began in Europe and has grown into one of the largest industrial minerals companies in the world - privately owned and multinational, our vision is to be the best Global Material Solutions Company. We are market driven, operationally excellent and offer a compelling culture.

We are currently recruiting for a permanent fulltime Fleet Coordinator to be based at our North Sydney head office. Reporting into the Senior Finance Manager | Accounting & Controls, the purpose of the key role is to provide overall coordination and management of Sibelco's light vehicle fleet, as well as project administration, document administration and control.

This will successfully be achieved by:

  • Coordinating the supply of fuel cards, driver kits, e-tags, infringement notices, roadside assistance, registration, disposal, and report distribution pertaining to all motor vehicles
  • Establish and maintain a strong working relationships with the fleet management company, suppliers, and Sibelco employees for all matters relating to the Sibelco motor vehicle fleet
  • Maintain supplier and contractual document control
  • ERP (Pronto) information updating relating to suppliers records and data
  • Project administration and document administration
  • Coordinate the disposal and replacement of motor vehicles, including the processing of capital expenditure requests, ordering and delivery of same;
  • Process monthly invoices from external fleet management company in a timely manner
  • Analyse fleet data and draw appropriate conclusions to ensure the most cost effective business outcomes\xc2\xa0

You will not only demonstrate proven experience in a similar fleet management role, but a genuine passion for the automotive industry. This passion will highlight your ability to use your initiative to improve day to day fleet operations from a cost and process point of view and also compliment long term business objectives.

Your effective communication and interpersonal skills will be evident, as will your ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholders \xe2\x80\x93 both internal and external. Furthermore, your attention to detail and data analytical skills will be strong and you will have a positive outlook when it comes to completing repetitive, yet necessary key tasks.

With our Customers at the Centre, Sibelco's culture is built on the core behaviours of building positive relationships, explore possibilities, speak up and deliver on promise. The successful candidate will model and foster this great culture and help to shape this agile this agile business that believes \xe2\x80\x98Materials Solutions, Advancing Life'.

Applications (cover letter & CV) can be sent via the careers page on our web site at www.sibelco.com.au no later than Wednesday 24th May 2017.

"

title: Clinical Trials Assistant (Full Time)
description:
b'

Sonic Clinical Trials, a leading provider of laboratory services supporting pharmaceutical, biotechnology & medical device clinical trials, is seeking a Clinical Trials Assistant for its Client Support Services division.

This is an exciting position in which you will be an important member of the team responsible for the smooth operation of our global clinical trial activities.

The role is based within a dynamic team environment at our Macquarie Park Head Office and will appeal to a vibrant, enthusiastic person with a science background and strong customer focus.

As a rapidly growing division of Sonic Healthcare Ltd, this role offers opportunities for great career progression to the right candidate.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Acts as primary point of contact at Sonic Clinical Trials for assigned studies.
  • Liaises with study site personnel, monitors and sponsors for ongoing support throughout study setup and maintenance.
  • Supports Project Management teams in study initiation activities including creation of laboratory manuals, request forms and all study documentation.
  • Responsible for the complete operation of assigned studies from client support, kit production and shipping through to data queries resolution and result reporting.

Requirements:

  • Essential - Degree in Biomedical Science or Science, or Associate Diploma in Medical Technology.
  • Experience in a clinical laboratory setting would be highly regarded.
  • Experience in a customer support role within the health, pharmaceutical or clinical trials industry.
  • Superior customer service skills and phone manner.
  • Excellent oral and written English skills.
  • Aptitude for problem solving and troubleshooting.
  • Time management and organisational skills.
  • Strong Microsoft applications skills (Crystal Reports experience desirable)
  • Ability to work as part of a team and independently.
  • Applicants must have Australian citizenship or Permanent Residency in order for their application to be considered.
'

title: Front Office Receptionist
description:
b"
  • Inner-East of Sydney Location
  • Permanent Full-time position 8.30 am till 5pm
  • Work in a friendly & supportive team environment
About the Employer

Our Client a leading Distributor \xc2\xa0who are constantly changing and expanding and taking\xc2\xa0 on new challenges are seeking a front desk Receptionist to join their head office
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
About the Role

As their receptionist, you will primarily be responsible for the handling of incoming telephone calls, welcoming their business to business clientele, take charge of all stationery needs, and some assistance with invoicing and administrative tasks.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Key responsibilities will include but not limited to:
  • Management of phone calls from Staff, Customers and Suppliers.
  • Distribution of faxes and emails
  • Manage the staff amenities room.
  • Recording of staff attendance
  • Ordering of stationery and staff consumables
  • Booking of staff travel requirements
  • Data entry of selected supplier invoices
  • Organising local couriers
  • Typing and filing of documents
  • Adhoc tasks as directed
To be successful for this role you must have the following:
  • A minimum of 2 Years' experience in a similar role
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook
  • A team player who is friendly and flexible in their approach to work
  • Bright, bubbly and energetic by nature
  • Organised, reliable and punctual

\xc2\xa0Please apply by forwarding a cover letter and resume in word format.
Please note only candidates that meet our client's selection criteria will be contacted.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Job ID: TDR2
"

title: Training Administrator
description:
b'

An exciting opportunity has become available for a Training Administrator to join the L&D\xc2\xa0operations team, based at Chatswood. This role will provide pivotal administrative support for the delivery of Lendlease learning programs across the business.

The key responsibilities will include maintaining program details and learning content in the learning management system; supporting training courses with the logistics such as printing course material; dispatching material to our training venues and handling employee enquiries and general data entry and maintenance.

You will be part of a fast paced operational team within HR Services Learning and Development. Playing a key role within the team, your responsibilities will include administering program details and preparing relevant information.

This role is an opportunity for a highly motivated individual to take their first step towards a career in Human Resources. Ideally, you will have experience in a customer service based role in retail/hospitality and/or administration.

You will have intermediate excel skills either gained from on the job experience or at university. Your ability to pick things up quickly, work autonomously as well as demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels are also key to achieving success in this role. You will have an excellent eye for detail, as well as having strong organisational skills with an ambitious and proactive attitude towards your work.

Lendlease is a diverse, flexible and inclusive employer of choice. We engage, enable and empower our people. Inclusion sets us all up for success.

All applications will need to be submitted via the online system. To find out more about us and to explore all other opportunities visit\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0www.lendlease.com/careers\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

'

title: Media Scheduling Assistant
description:
b'

An exciting opportunity exists for a detail orientated, Media Traffic Co-ordinator who enjoys working in a fast-paced young dynamic team in our North Sydney office. This is a great entry level position for anyone interested in a career in media.

The role involves a variety of tasks, including;
Assisting and reporting to the National Traffic Manager and National Sales Director.
Tasks will include:
Liaising with sales reps nationally.
Preparation of campaign reports for Sales team.
Data Entry- entering of bookings for "on air" activity.
Liaising with all metropolitan radio stations, including Nova, Kiis and all Hit networks.
Liaising with creative department for material for all on air bookings.
Liaising with radio reporters.

To be successful in this role, you will need to be a level headed individual with a keen eye for detail, excellent communication and organisational skills and the ability to comprehend and learn new systems quickly.


Full training will be provided.

'

title: Senior BDM
description:
b'

About the company:

My client is a new player in the Australian Market, focusing on Big Data - mobility intelligence and video analytics. They are having huge success overseas and are now in partnership with one of the large Telco\xe2\x80\x99s here and ready to break in to the Australian market.

About the role:

As a Senior BDM you will be responsible to sell the different services our client offers to businesses Australia wide. This will be done directly as well as in partnership with other businesses. You will focus on Advertising, Research, FMCG, Retail and Hospitality industries. You work closely together with Management and the technical team to create solutions that will benefits your clients.

Duties:

  • Sell my clients\xe2\x80\x99 solutions in Australia
  • Create a great relationship with partners
  • Help with the overall strategy
  • Keep up to date about the industry
Requirements:

  • At least 5 years Sales experience, in a hunting role
  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in a relevant field
  • Experience selling into the above mentioned industries
  • Ideally you have experience with Big Data but a good understanding would be needed for this role
What\xe2\x80\x99s in it for you?

On offer is the chance to work for a company that is extremely successful overseas and is replicating that success here in Australia. You will be one of the first hires here and have immediate impact. There is a good salary and comms plan plus great accelerators.

Recruitment process:

Apply to this position or give me a call/ email on: 02 8298 3826, aj.walburg@randstad.com.au

'

title: Administrator
description:
b'

WhiteCollarBlue is one of Sydney\xe2\x80\x99s fastest growing & respected Business Solutions Provider based in the heart of Parramatta. We genuinely believe that the right culture, team and work/life balance are the main contributors in employee\xe2\x80\x99s job satisfaction and also our bottom line.


We are currently looking for a super star administrator to take lead of the administration duties and tasks at WhiteCollarBlue. The right candidate for us will be motivated by a challenge, be resilient and hungry to achieve goals set each day. This role is to commence immediately for the right person and is offered as full time hours across Monday - Friday with the absolute potential of career progression in the Recruitment Sector.

Being the first point of client and candidate contact, you will need to possess a high standard of personal presentation. Demonstrating strong written and verbal communication skills. You will be a self-starter who appreciates the term \xe2\x80\x98sense of urgency\xe2\x80\x99 in every project or task you complete.

In return, you will work alongside motivated and passionate team members who thrive off of an environment filled with smart working individuals, with the want and determination to build a career for themselves in a flourishing business.


You will:

  • Have a strong focus on service delivery.
  • Have the ability to engage and build strong relationships with clients and candidates.
  • Have experience in a similar role.
  • Have the ability to work as part as a team, take direction from leadership or work autonomously to achieve desired goals.
  • Have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Have a high attention to detail and take pride in the quality of work you produce.
  • Have a strong sense of urgency and the ability to prioritise workloads effectively.
  • Be a self-starter.
  • Be able to take direction and training.
  • Have MYOB, XERO or Accounting Software experience at a data entry level.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Record Management, Updating Client and Candidate Files.
  • Answering Incoming Calls and Transferring.
  • ADHOC Administrative Duties.
  • Data Entry into Accounting Software (Xero, MYOB)
  • Data Entry into CRM\xe2\x80\x99s (Bullhorn & Infusionsoft)
  • Payroll Duties - Entering Timesheets etc
  • Filing, Scanning and Printing.
  • Accounts Payable Duties.


Benefits & Culture:

Our team is made up of smart working, driven, enthusiastic and resilient talent members who focus their days on quality service to all SME\xe2\x80\x99s that we work with. With a family like culture, you will spend your days with a supportive and motivational team who will celebrate the wins with you and support you on your journey. On the job training will be offered, as well as team building experiences and team lunches.


For the right candidate, there is a prosperous career ahead.


If you are looking for a career in a growing, culturally aligned business and you believe that you are the right candidate, here\xe2\x80\x99s what you need to do below!


Ensure that your resume is up to date, with up to date contact details so our Internal Recruiter, Bree can contact you. She will only call if you meet the minimum requirements of the role and these have been outlined in a cover letter addressed to WhiteCollarBlue.


Apply today, start tomorrow. We don\xe2\x80\x99t fluff around with the interview process. If you are the talent member for us, we will work closely with you to commence you in your new role.


Only the candidates that meet the above criteria will be contacted.

'

title: Senior Business Support Officer
description:
b"

Who are we? The Toll Group is the Asian region's leading provider of integrated logistics services, employing over 40,000 staff, generating annual revenue of AU$8.8 billion. Toll operates an extensive network of 1200 sites throughout more than 50 countries across the world

The role: We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Business Support Officer for one of our specialized Toll Divisions. We are looking for an office all-rounder, someone who is career focused and able to support all parts of a busy operational business.

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Contribute as a member of the Business Support team with a focus on proactive service improvement and the provision of information to customers;
  • To work effectively as part of a high performing team and lead teamwork and cooperation within the department and between the department and other parts of the business to ensure our customer requirements are met;

  • Perform Internal Sales related tasks such as quoting and pricing consignment notes. Manually price and cost special consignments as directed.

To be successful in this position you will have:

  • Possess excellent communication skills both written and verbal;
  • Exceptional organisational skills with the ability to take ownership;
  • Enthusiastic, proactive and driven to work in a busy setting.

Our position is located in Villawood and will be required to be in the office Monday through to Friday 8am to 5pm.

Why work at Toll Group? We\xe2\x80\x99re committed to providing a safe, diverse, satisfying and fulfilling workplace for all of our people. We value integrity, trust, teamwork and being open and transparent. We believe that people perform best when they are empowered, accountable and recognised. We are passionately committed to supporting our people in their career aspirations.

If you feel you meet the requirements stated above, and the role is of interest, please apply via the link below.

title: People and Culture Administrator
description:
b'

\xe2\x80\xa2 High performing and collaborative team environment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Join a trusted and respected brand in the market
\xe2\x80\xa2 Exposure across many facets of the organisation
\xe2\x80\xa2 12 month fixed term contract

Perpetual stands apart for our enduring track record of excellence, integrity and partnerships. As a trustee company since 1886, we have been helping generations of Australians protect and grow their wealth.

As an employer we can help you reach your full potential. Our success is based on empowering our people to make a difference in our dynamic and high performance environment.

We are seeking an experienced HR Administrator to join our People and Culture (PAC) Services team to provide basic advice and end to end administration support to all areas of the business for a number of processes. This role is critical to the maintenance of our HR Information Systems (HRIS) and core HR data. This role is the first point of contact for employees and people leaders, responding to a range of requests including on-boarding, talent acquisition, graduates, vacationers, policies, leave, pay, Workplace Health & Safety (WHS), and Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

Role responsibilities:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Administration - preparing contracts, transfer and promotion letters
\xe2\x80\xa2 Data entry of new starters, leavers, and changes in HRIS
\xe2\x80\xa2 Adhere to procedures and escalations for Background Screening and Visa Management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Graduate Program support - organise campus event attendance, CV screening, arrange interviews and assessment centres, candidate responses
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure organisational hierarchy is up to date, following organisational changes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Thorough knowledge of HR process, procedures and policies in order to effectively advise the business and stakeholders
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continuous improvement of processes and procedures. Monitoring and updating of Intranet content
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provision of reports including trends and insights
\xe2\x80\xa2 Comply with privacy and confidentiality
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide administration/ clerical and project support to the wider team.

Key required skills:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional organisational skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 High attention to detail
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sound problem solving skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Customer service / stakeholder management skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Document management in a high transaction volume environment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Self-starter and proactive
\xe2\x80\xa2 Confidence in speaking to clients over the phone and provide education and support to encourage self-service
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to manage a varied workload
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of relevant HR Policies and Legislation
\xe2\x80\xa2 HR, TAFE or relevant degree/qualifications will be looked upon favourably.

At Perpetual we work in a high performance environment and value the employee experience. You will be supported by exceptional people, able to grow your skills and career, as well as deliver outstanding outcomes to clients where partnership, excellence and integrity are paramount.

Your well-being is important to us and we offer a range of flexibility to meet your personal and professional goals. We also have a strong commitment to diversity and our business practices create an environment where your individual differences are valued.

Not the right role for you? Follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter.

Perpetual is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.

'

title: Programmatic Trader
advertiser: Commonwealth Bank  Business & Private B anking
description:
b'

The Business:

The Commonwealth Bank is one of the leading financial institutions in Australia providing integrated financial services to more customers than any other Australian bank.

The Brand, Sponsorships & Marketing Services team is responsible for many of the Group marketing functions, including brand strategy and comms, our major sponsorship properties, media buying, paid search, social media communities, events and operations.

The Programmatic Trading Desk has responsibility for all programmatic activity across Commonwealth Bank as well as CommSec products. This includes responsibility across CBA\xe2\x80\x99s ad server, audience management platform and DSP technology.

The Role:

Reporting directly to the Head of Programmatic, you will be responsible for CommBank\xe2\x80\x99s RTB & programmatic performance campaign management, with responsibility across the implementation, optimisation and management of CommBank\xe2\x80\x99s programmatic strategies. You will also be responsible for stakeholder management and communication to the wider marketing team around campaign performance and recommendations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • You will set up and trade programmatic campaigns for CommBank across Display and Video technologies
  • You will analyse data across all programmatic campaigns and report back on recommendations for optimisations and future campaign parameters
  • You will implement the necessary tracking and creative tagging within the ad server
  • You will ensure all campaigns are hitting target KPIs and make the necessary optimisations within the DSP in order to hit these KPIs
  • Ensure all campaign measurement solutions are in place

What you will need to succeed:

  • Experience in DSP technologies across Display and Video
  • Understanding of performance media planning, testing & measurement across all digital channels
  • Working knowledge of digital ad technologies and operations that includes real-time bidding, ad serving, data management, tag management and website analytics
  • Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management experience
  • Organisation, accuracy and attention to detail
  • Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel

At CommBank, we're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a value's driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focussing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you.

'

title: RF/Communications Engineer
description:
b'

This is a fantastic opportunity for a junior engineer to join the team at Rocket Lab and work on the most exciting engineering project currently being undertaken in New Zealand

\xc2\xa0

Working within our Avionics team you will be play an important role in the design, testing and integration of radio frequency communication components used to support Rocket Lab\xe2\x80\x99s Electron launch vehicle.\xc2\xa0 You will be challenged on a daily basis and to succeed you will need to adapt quickly and thrive under pressure to achieve tight project deadlines.

\xc2\xa0

Our launch date is fast approaching, and we are looking for someone who can hit the ground running so previous experience with RF communication components is vital.

\xc2\xa0

Essential skills required for the position of RF/Communications Engineer

  • A Bachelors or Masters in Engineering or Physics, with major in Electromagnetics or equivalent qualification
  • 1+ years' experience in design, test and integration of RF communication components for high reliability systems (aviation or aerospace systems).
  • Experience with test equipment: network and spectrum analysers.
  • The ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.
  • Proven communication skills and the ability to build strong working relationship.
  • Good understanding of electromagnetic propagation on the atmosphere.

Desirable skills

  • Python, MATLAB
  • Experience with ground stations design and deployment.
  • Familiar with digital modulations, FSK, QPSK, QAM, and SDR radios
  • A good theoretical and/or practical of electronic systems design
  • Experience with TTC systems, space modulations and high data-rate links.
  • Inter-satellite communications.
  • Experience with STK, CST/HFSS toolkits.

Important Information

For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant.\xc2\xa0 These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations.\xc2\xa0 Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality.\xc2\xa0 For more information on these Regulations, click here\xc2\xa0http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.

'

Working knowledge of:
Networks and processing businesses

OTHER

title: Senior Insights Analyst - Sydney CBD - Permanent
description:
b"

Senior Insights Analyst - Sydney CBD - Permanent

With the focus on execution, campaign and analysis experience is essential as well as strong data manipulation and problem solving abilities. This role is a Full Time Permanent role based in the Sydney CBD.

\xc2\xa0Responsibilities in this role include:

  • Work with Sales and Distribution in Direct to support growth opportunities for acquisition and retention
  • Extract and manipulate internal and external data for analysis, modelling and reporting
  • Analyse and mine customer data to address business issues, identifying opportunities and recommend actionable solutions
  • Proactively seek opportunities to improve business processes to optimise sales conversion
  • Be involved in the end to end campaign execution process, working with Marketing, Product, Data Warehouse, Sales and Distribution
  • Ensure campaigns are setup correctly for test and learn, measure sales performance and feedback learnings
  • Setup post-campaign reports to track and monitor performance
  • Overseeing the delivery of solutions to our stakeholders, ensuring objectives are met and project delivery addresses their needs
  • Summarise findings and present recommendations to the business

It is expected that you will possess the following skills and experience:

  • 5+ years' experience in data analytics, campaign analytics, business intelligence, or related area
  • Advanced knowledge of end-to-end process of campaign execution
  • Strong SAS & SQL skills
  • Ability to query complex data warehouses and aggregate data for insight analysis
  • Ability to work independently on complex projects
  • Ability to prioritise work, keeping business objectives at the forefront of the decision making process
  • Strong project management and problem-solving skills;
  • Strong Stakeholder management skill;
  • A willingness to learn new applications and systems;
  • Strong written and verbal communication skill;
  • Commercial experience using\xc2\xa0Tableau and Google Analytics would be advantageous
  • Degree qualified in at least one of the following: Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Finance
"

title: Safety Systems - Engineering
description:
b'
  • Garden Island (Sydney) location
  • Systems safety design on projects redefining technology
  • Supportive, friendly team

\xc2\xa0

Who We Are

\xc2\xa0

Thales is a premier global provider of systems, products and services in the commercial, security and Defence markets. We specialise in fields including avionics, combat systems, armoured vehicles, secure communications and information systems. But this is just the tip of the iceberg, for more info, check out our\xc2\xa0website!\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Our Above Water Systems (AWS) domain are closely partnered with the Royal Australian Navy and provide specialist support, engineering and asset management services, along with systems integration, design and testing elite radar systems.

Our wider\xc2\xa0Maritime\xc2\xa0group supply acoustic and communication systems for anti-submarine and anti-mine warfare.\xc2\xa0


About our opportunity

\xc2\xa0

Our Engineers are the innovative minds behind the design, development, testing and integration of software intensive systems used by the Australian Defence Force.

\xc2\xa0

In Maritime, our design excellence, long standing history and partnership in developing systems and engineering solutions for the Royal Australia Navy, alone, isn't the only factor to our success as key technology and engineering partners.


It's also our outstanding colleagues in our Safety Systems Engineering Hub.


Our Systems Safety team are at the forefront of technology as it is being redefined, working in tandem with our innovative leaders in the formative stages of proposal blueprinting.


Our team mine for safety risks in solution proposals to the Commonwealth and produce environmental protocols to minimise and isolate hazards with initiatives, methods and equipment.

\xc2\xa0

We're looking for a stand out colleague that enjoys mapping project plans, defining safety risks and producing comprehensive preventative frameworks in high risk environments.

\xc2\xa0

You'll also be comfortable in educating our contract partners on protocol scope, ensure partner adherence, produce compliance statistics and commentary as well as partnering with the Commonwealth to share best practice, precedent data and exhibit the merit and "safety trust" in the protocols during the review.

\xc2\xa0

Joining the Systems Safety team, you'll ideally:

  • Bring a dynamic approach and ability to adapt practices in changing environments
  • Have led safety programmes or designed hazard minimisation protocols
  • Enjoy analysing scope, defining risk, evaluating options and positioning protective preventative measures
  • Experience of interest in the engineering cycle of advancing technology
  • Have knowledge in or an appreciation for systems safety and its application in high risk projects and environments

Thales champion inclusion and believe diversity strengthens the fabric of our culture. We are also an equal opportunity employer.

'

title: QC Sampling Technician

b'

  • Above award wage

\xc2\xa0

Bluegum Pharmaceuticals is a successful, TGA licenced complementary medicines manufacturing company based in Banksmeadow, close to the airport. We have recently moved into a new facility and we are experiencing strong growth with new customers and new products.

We are currently seeking a QC Sampling Technician to join our Quality team. In this role you will primarily organise and sample incoming materials, preparing the documentation for testing and completing visual and physical testing.\xc2\xa0Your key responsibilities will include:
\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Sampling of raw materials

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Safe use of materials handling equipment

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Completing\xc2\xa0test records\xc2\xa0and lot documentation

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Following detailed procedures

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 GMP and housekeeping

Ideally you will have past experience working in a pharmaceutical manufacturing environment, with a good appreciation of the standards expected in a TGA licensed facility. You will have an excellent understanding of GMP, be able to follow written instructions, possess superior communication skills, good attention to detail including accurate record keeping and stocktaking, and a willingness to learn. You should be physically fit, have experience operating material handling equipment and fully appreciate the importance of maintaining a clean, orderly and safe working area. You should be experienced in data entry and the use of Excel spread sheets.

As part of a small team you will gain exposure to many areas of our business operations, so this is an opportunity to suit a flexible individual with a desire to develop and extend their skills.

Suitable applicants should send their resume to the address in the link below or directly to vincentq@bluegum.net.au.
