title: IT Manager
description:
b"

McMillen Jacobs Associates is seeking a hands-on IT Manager who is passionate about technology and has a desire for excellent service. Our number-one goal is first rate service to the employees of our company. The right candidate will be team oriented and provide technical assistance and solutions to computer system users. This includes all operating systems, computer hardware and software, telephones and other equipment.

Reporting to the IT Director, the successful candidate will drive initiatives to improve IT performance between offices and connectivity to project sites as required. Seek to enhance users experience, improve efficiency and maintain connected uptime.

Responsibilities

  • Lead project planning efforts, prioritize workload and manage resource utilization across project deliverables.
  • Work with Engineers and Project Managers to facilitate project and deliverable work.
  • Manage and deliver multiple projects with aggressive timelines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Analyse information and evaluate results to choose the best solution to solve problems.
  • Maintain security for email and web sites, including anti-virus updates, monitoring and troubleshooting Firewall, and backing up data stored to Servers.
  • Focus on development and production support by developing and maintaining standards for project development.
  • Answer users' inquiries regarding computer software and hardware operation.
  • Repair and maintain computers and other electronic equipment.
  • Troubleshooting issues with IP Phones, Phone Systems, and voice mail. Experience with Lync Phone Systems a plus.
  • Support our North American offices as required under direction of the IT Director
  • State travel may occasionally be required between Sydney and Melbourne, and to Auckland to provide local support/installation of new equipment.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor of Information Technology or Bachelor of Business Information Systems.
  • 7+ years supporting end users with computer hardware and software-related issues
  • Experience and expert knowledge of Windows operating systems, IIS, SQL, DNS, exchange, routing and switching, Highspeed Connections, and general desktop support
  • Ability to work independently and within a team, requiring minimal supervision
  • Experience with mobile web applications, iOS and Android applications a plus
  • Any combination of MCP, MCSE, MCTS, MCITP, MCSA, CNA, A +, Security +, PMP certifications desired
  • Manage phone systems, along with all the foundational IT systems and software skills
  • Experience with Sonicwall Firewall, Microsoft Office 365, and Microsoft Azure is preferred

Company Bio: McMillen Jacobs is a full-service environmental, engineering, and construction firm in the water resources, transportation and power sectors. Through our 21 offices and over 430 staff members, we offer public and private clients planning, design and construction services. We offer specialist consulting for underground engineering, hydropower, pipelines, marine structures and construction disputes resolution. For additional company information, please visit our website at www.mcmjac.com

No Recruiters, Please.

"

title: Implementation Consultant - Business Analyst - Project Manager
description:
b'

RouteMatch Software is growing our team in\xc2\xa0Sydney\xc2\xa0and\xc2\xa0hiring an Implementation Specialist.\xc2\xa0 The Implementation Specialist is the SME that works directly with clients to gather, understand and translate requirements to consultatively design, train and deliver intelligent transportation solutions (ITS).\xc2\xa0 Every\xc2\xa0project, every day and every solution is different with interesting problems to solve.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0You are critical to the overall success of the project and will\xc2\xa0collaborate with internal and external teams to ensure successful go-live.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

You must live in Sydney and\xc2\xa0will work out of your home when not traveling.\xc2\xa0 Travel is required up to 80% - mostly in NSW but could expand in the future.

\xc2\xa0

The ideal Implementation Specialist\xc2\xa0is a highly motivated self-starter that enjoys the opportunity to work with clients to solve their business needs with technology. The IS has a strong technical aptitude for software and hardware systems, enjoys training, communicates confidently and has a passion for customer satisfaction. \xc2\xa0Time management, prioritisation and the ability to juggle multiple projects are all critical skills.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Founded in 2000, RouteMatch Software is a privately-held industry leader in intelligent transportation systems and mobile data system deployments with over 600 clients worldwide.\xc2\xa0 Our solutions allow transit agencies to efficiently provide public transportation and para-transit services for\xc2\xa0their communities.\xc2\xa0 A career at RouteMatch enables you to contribute your skills and talents to a team of 150+ professionals located in Atlanta, Denver, Ireland and Australia having an impact on people's lives every day.\xc2\xa0 RouteMatch is a place where you can honestly say "my work matters".\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Reporting Relationships

The Implementation Specialist reports into the Program Director and Project Manager. No positions report to the Implementation Specialist.

\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities

  • Following the RouteMatch project management methodology, actively participate in every aspect of the implementation process including project initiation, design, build, education and training, deployment, support and system acceptance
  • Work closely with RouteMatch project managers and support team members to understand specific client requirements, process and software product changes
  • Provide on-site implementation including installation, configuration tuning, training\xc2\xa0and live support of RouteMatch products and services
  • Gather and translate requirements into design documents
  • Configure, test and deploy in client environment
  • Consultatively recommend best practices and usage
  • Assist management in developing and refining on-site implementation processes
  • Create and deliver training to get\xc2\xa0users working efficiently\xc2\xa0on the new solution

\xc2\xa0

Required Experience and Skills

  • Bachelor's Degree or similar experience \xe2\x80\x93 prefer MIS, IT, CS, Engineering or related discipline
  • At least three (3) years of software implementation or integration experience in a software or technology consulting company or within a corporate MIS environment
  • Proven experience as a trainer to a variety of group sizes and skills \xe2\x80\x93 super users to new technology users
  • Proven ability to complete full training cycle (assess needs, plan, develop, deliver, monitor and evaluate)
  • Ability to communicate and develop relationships with all levels of an organisation and a wide variety of personalities
  • Excellent time management and prioritisation skills
  • Resourceful, flexible, adaptable and ability to work well with limited direction and oversight
  • Professional and confident presence with a consultative, customer-focused attitude
  • Enjoys a challenge, problem solving and committed to excellence
  • Strong sense of ownership and the ability to wear a lot of hats
  • Innovative, inventive and curious \xe2\x80\x93 always asking questions and learning
  • Willingness and ability to travel up to 80% of the time

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Preferred Experience and Skills

  • Transportation or logistics industry experience
  • GIS technology experience
  • Technical aptitude and experience with hardware and software systems including RDBMS, MS SQL and Windows 10/8/Vista/2000/XP

\xc2\xa0

Key Challenges

  • Implementing effective solutions that meet business objectives in cost constrained environments
  • Understanding a client's operating model and requirements, then translating those considerations into a system specification
  • Driving improvements in the internal processes of an organisation with varying levels of technical and process maturity
  • Keeping abreast of current and emerging best practice in mobile and transport technologies and driving improvements on internal processes based on these developments
  • Identifying and reconciling inconsistent or conflicting objectives and requirements between stakeholders

\xc2\xa0

RouteMatch Software is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to comply with all Federal, State and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status and other protected classifications. This policy applies to all employment decisions including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotions, pay practices, benefits, disciplinary actions and terminations.

title: Senior Fund Reporting Analyst/Accountant - Private Equity
description:
b'\xc2\xa0
This APAC Private Equity Fund Manager has an enviable reputation within Funds Management due to their Private Equity and Infrastructure investments. With new requirements in the finance and middle office function in Australia and expected further growth this organisation is hiring in Sydney.
An opportunity exists for a current Fund Performance & Reporting Analyst from the Financial Services industry, who has worked in another Fund Manager or similar.\xc2\xa0 Your remit will have responsibility in the operational aspects of the business including fund pricing, cashflow management, performance analytics and reporting, review of Fund Statements and tax distribution
The successful candidate will be responsible for:
  • Monthly and quarterly reporting, and report generation for fund reports
  • Daily cashflow management and resolving client queries
  • Unit pricing of funds
  • Analysis\xc2\xa0 and commentary of Investments
  • Review Fund and Financial statement and tax distribution.
  • Understanding of tax related fund distributions
Key to this role will be your ability to work in a middle office function supporting Fund Managers.
The successful candidate must be CA/CPA qualified, have previous technical experience gained internationally or domestically preferably in the Funds management environment. Therefore strong numerical skills gained within performance reporting, financial and fund reporting
You will also have excellent written and communication skills. Our client will also look at candidates directly from the chartered profession who have a strong technical analytical background within Advisory. Strong data management and process improvements experience.


Must have an applicable visa as this is a permanent opportunity. There is no option to sponsor. Only those applicants that are a fit for the position will be contacted.
If you would like to find out more about the position, please call James Rennie on +612 8011 4430 or +61 422 660094, for a confidential discussion. '

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
b'

We are working with an ambitious company within the Office Supplies sector.

They are looking to add a Strategic Account Manager to their business, maximising potential spend within a defined client base.

Covering both Sydney and Melbourne, you will provide Account Management across key businesses, building relationships with stakeholders and promoting compliance.

You will further penetrate these accounts, identifying range gaps and promting additional services within your remit.

You will provide quarterly businessreviews and take ownership of tenders and contracts relating to your client portfolio.

To be successful you must have:

At least 5 years Account Management experience (in a product based environment)

Ability to engage with corporate clients, comfortable to communicate at all levels

Strong presentation skills

If you are a strong negotiator and able to influence others, forge relationships and become a trusted advisor - we want to hear from you.

An adept problem-solver with a professional and proactive manner, you will succeed here.

In return you will be provided with a high quality BI tool that captures all client data and spend trends. An experienced and knowledgable leadership team, quality product and aggressive pricing structures.

Apply now, interviewing will commence straight away.

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Becci Dobaczewski on 0424165391, quoting Ref No. AZR55.

title: Identity Management Consultant
description:
b"Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?

If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.

We\xe2\x80\x99re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades \xe2\x80\x94 and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be working with teams across the world. We are currently looking for a Technical Consultant who has expertise in delivering architectural designs and roadmaps for complex and enterprise environments across Active Directory, Identity and Access Management Solutions.

This position will require you to provide design, configuration and escalated problem management in complex client environments whilst providing technical advisory and input into presales processes by assisting the account managment team with evaluating and activating new accounts and providing advisory around the design and configuration requirements for complex RFP and RFI proposals

This position will require you to have domain expertise across
  • Active Directory architecture
  • Identity and Access Management
  • Environment authentication and Authorization
Desired Skills and ExperienceWe are looking for a consultant to have a broad range of consulting experience across technology areas such as:

Directory Services
  • Active Directory Infrastructure Design (Windows 2012 preferred)
  • Enterprise Directory Implementation
  • Auditing and Compliance,
  • Topology Design
  • Sites and Services
  • DNS
  • Lightweight Directory Services (ADLDS)
Identity and Access Managment
  • Strategy and Roadmap design
  • Business rules and identity flow
  • Directory Consolidation
  • Forefront Identity Manager
  • Identity Lifecycle Manager
Environment Assessments
  • Office 365 and EMS
  • Hybrid Identity (DirSync / AD Sync / ADFS)
  • Application Analysis
  • Single Sign On and Federation
  • Azure IaaS, PaaS
  • Cloud Computing Platforms
Authentication and Authorisation
  • Directory Service Rationalisation (AD Migrations / Domain Consolidations
  • Privileged Account Management
  • Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)
  • Federation Services (ADFS etc.)
  • Protocol Knowledge (Kerbero / NTLM / SAML / LDAP / LDAPS etc.)

Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!


Diversity in Dimension Data

We have a global culture that embraces diversity. Dimension Data respects the diverse experiences and individual beliefs of its employees. As such, Dimension Data is committed to an inclusive workplace for all and we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to provide equal employment opportunities for all qualified applicants.

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Daniel Farrell on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 225552. "

title: Network Solutions Consultant
description:
b"

Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.

We\xe2\x80\x99re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades \xe2\x80\x94 and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be working with teams across the world.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions. We are seeking a Technical Consultant specialising in Enterprise level Routing & Switching\xc2\xa0Solutions to join our highly successful NSW Networking business.

Our Technical Consultants are SME\xe2\x80\x99s, working closely with our Solution Architects to design cutting edge solutions in their area of expertise, then leading our technical teams through build and implementation. It's the best of both worlds, a fantastic mix of pre and post sales!

To successfully take on this position, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need proven design, technical architecture and delivery expertise and you will focus on:

  • leading technical teams in project delivery.
  • Acting as the QA point for your team, and enjoy mentoring others.
  • Presenting and leading workshops.
  • Analysing and translating client requirements to technical solutions.
  • Contribute to presales by providing Low Level Design input and technical advisory
  • Oversee the delivery of a project
  • Be the trusted advisor for our clients
  • Working on fixed price projects or milestone based engagements.

Key Selection Criteria

  • CCIE Routing and Switching (Or equivalent knowledge and experience)
  • Enterprise Network routing and switching experience
  • Experienced with Enterprise Virtual Routing
  • LAN, WAN Design, Architecture and Engineering
  • Layer 2, Layer 3 Networking
  • VRF Routing
  • vPC
  • VDC
  • UCS
  • ACI, NSX
  • VXLAN
  • Nexus
  • F5 or Cisco Loadbalancing

  • BYOD
  • MDM
  • Cisco WLC
  • PRIME
  • ISE

The most important thing we look for is a great attitude and someone motivated by career growth - we want to help you succeed!!

Next Step?

To join our high-performance team, apply below or contact Daniel Farrell\xc2\xa0for a confidential discussion.

We would like to take this opportunity to thank you in advance for your application and advise that due to the tight turnaround time frames\xc2\xa0we work to for assessment and on-boarding, only candidates that meet the experience requirements and who hold valid Australian work rights will be contacted.




To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Daniel Farrell on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 225931. "

description:
b'

title: Senior Insights Analyst
description:
b'

A leading Australian brand is currently seeking a Senior Insights Analyst to provide actionable insights and support in making effective business decisions.

The successful applicant will have a good understanding of customer data and analysis. You will lead, design, generate and develop actionable customer insight from multiple data sources to provide a 360-degree view of the customer.

Reporting to the Head of Analytics and Insights, you will be responsible for understanding and advancing the company's knowledge of customer behaviour in order to develop strategies and recommendations to target specific customer segments as well as enhancing customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Analysis of customer data to answer business questions and produce data-driven stories that reveal key insights into consumer behaviour.
  • The creation of customer profiles, segmentation, trend analysis and response analysis.
  • Provide stakeholders with accurate customer insights and dashboards that enhance and guide effective decision making.
  • Working collaboratively across departments to understand company goals and develop customer acquisition and customer retention programs

Skills Required:

  • Tertiary Qualification in a quantitative discipline - mathematics, statistics, information technology, data mining, analytics etc.
  • Strong experience working in a commercial analytics environment.
  • Advanced R/SAS/SQL programming skills
  • Capable of managing multiple projects under pressure and meeting deadlines
  • Ability to interact proactively with external customers
  • An inquisitive mind, passionate about deriving insights from data
  • The ability to demostrate initiative and work under minimal supervision

The organisation is investing heavily in 'automated decision making\xe2\x80\x99 using their wealth of customer data; this is a fantastic opportunity to play a key part in shaping a programme that has the potential to revolutionise a fast growing business

Please apply on line below, or to discuss the role more in detail, please contact Marie Thow at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2640

( SK920044A )

http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

'

title: HR Coordinator/Relief Reception
description:
b"

Viatek Technology is a successful and growing technology services company with a broad range of clients in size and industry and provides solutions tailored to specific client needs.

We are looking for a HR Coordinator. Whilst this role is generalist in nature, there is a key focus on driving the end to end recruitment process across our business.\xc2\xa0

Ideally our candidate will be an exceptional communicator, both written and verbal, be well experienced in recruitment , preferably operating within in a similar role within a like minded company, a recruitment\xc2\xa0coordinator, operating within the technology industry, looking to move into a more generalist role or a well experience administrator with considerable\xc2\xa0experience in recruitment.

Key areas of operation are as follows:\xc2\xa0

  • All aspects of talent acquisition
  • Partnering\xc2\xa0with business in end to end recruitment activities
  • Coordinating the on boarding and exiting activities
  • Generating data and metrics for monthly people & culture reporting\xc2\xa0
  • Managing all aspects of employee life-cycle documentation
  • Ensuring currency of content within our internal People & Culture portal
  • Driving commitment within teams for WH&S practices
  • Relief reception for 2 days per week, low volume phone answering, office administration

Minimum Experience Required

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in a HR Administration, \xc2\xa0Generalist or Talent Acquisition / Recruitment role.
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills\xc2\xa0
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
  • Ability to communicate with all departments of the business.
  • Excellent MS Office skills
  • Sound understanding of HR concepts, policies, procedures etc

Viatek openly and honestly commit to attracting those individuals\xc2\xa0who both behave and live our values through their own behaviours.

\xc2\xa0

Our values have been chosen as a reflection of our commitment to our team, our customers and our community, they are:

  • Embrace team spirit
  • Deliver great results, great experiences through tenacity & hard work
  • Honour commitments to our customer's, our community & each other
  • Challenge today for a better tomorrow\xc2\xa0

Viatek is an equal opportunities employer, who values diversity.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Analytics Leader, Customer Insights
description:
b'

An Australian household name is looking for an Analytics Leader to provide strategic direction in the identification of insights focused on the customer experience through the entire brand engagement process and purchase journey.

As the Leader of Customer Insights, your role will be key to the business and will help put customer data & insight at the heart of all decision making. You will also facilitate bringing teams together across various business functions and develop combined roadmaps for the systems and tools.

As part of a large team, you will need to take ownership of multiple challenges simultaneously to ensure that specific goals are reached and evaluate the most appropriate manner in which to measure success.

Key Responsibilities -

  • Plan, design, and implement solutions that deliver and analyse information efficiently for competitive advantage.
  • Develop plans supporting the overall business strategy to expand footprint and supporting revenue growth.
  • Build and manage the internal technology roadmap for marketing and analytics tools.
  • Focus on innovating customer personalisation techniques, real-time analytics and data science approaches to increase ROI on all marketing and CRM initiatives as well as increase customer acquisition
  • Lead and manage a team of advanced insights analysts on a range of statistical projects, including campaign analysis, customer behavior, segmentation, and wider reaching data strategy opportunities
  • Ensures analytics rigor in all areas of the business

Skills and Experience -

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - ability to assess a situation quickly, determine the correct strategy, and address situation immediately
  • Ability to juggle multiple priorities and situations - successfully manage responsibilities to ensure that stakeholder commitments are met
  • Ability to resolve complex situations or problems by defining a strategy, often involving cross-functional teams and leading a collaboration effort through resolution
  • Ability to collect, analyse and develop insights based on large volumes of data
  • Experience in data-mining techniques and procedures and knowing when their use is appropriate
  • Experience with SAS/SQL/R.
  • Tertiary qualifications in quantitative discipline - mathematics, statistics, engineering, information technology or another related degree

This is an exciting leadership opportunity to be at the forefront of how this data driven organisation engages with its data. You will be taking responsibility for driving the strategy and direction of those areas and their engagement with the business including providing high level management and leadership to the team leaders of those teams, defining the analytics roadmap and thought leadership.

For more information, please contact Marie Thow at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2640.

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
b'

Discover a great place to work at Harvey Norman.

If you like to work in a fast paced, exciting and challenging environment, the Harvey Norman IT Operations Team could be the place for you.

About the position:

The successful applicant will be working in a dynamic, responsive IT Operations environment for Harvey Norman Corporate Offices, as well as stores in Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, Singapore and Malaysia. We run a distributed Cisco environment in stores, with Juniper and F5 technologies resident in our Data Centres. We are seeking a Senior Network Engineer to join our highly skilled team to help manage these environments.

The primary responsibilities of the role include:

  • Leading by example \xe2\x80\x93 demonstrate excellent skills in:
    • Operational change management
    • Creating and maintaining network design and as-built documents
    • Developing and delivering training to technical staff
    • Process improvement and documentation
  • Mentoring team members to enable superior performance
  • Customer service delivery through service request fulfilment.
  • Business-As-Usual initiatives including installation and upgrade of network systems.
  • Perform technical evaluations of new technology and products for the use in technical services.
  • Troubleshooting and escalation of Incident and Problem management cases for all retail store, corporate and data centre networks.
  • Analysing the faults raised with external vendors and recommend appropriate measures.
  • Participation in project related activities.
  • Assisting with the development of technology roadmaps and solution designs that align with product and technology releases.

To be successful, you will require the following skills and experience:

Essential:

  • Advanced F5 (APM, LTM , GTM & iRules) management experience
  • Experience managing a Cisco Wireless Controller (WLC) network
  • Advanced Juniper routing, switching and security (SRX Firewalls) experience utilised in a large enterprise network
  • A minimum 5 years experience in a larger enterprise network environment
  • A minimum 3 years experience managing a distributed QoS-enabled network
  • Cisco CCNP Certification or equivalent
  • F5-CTS Certification or equivalent
  • Juniper JNCIS / JNCIP Certification or equivalent
  • Experience in working in an ITILv3 environment
  • Specialist problem solving, analytical and investigation skills
  • Advanced technical writing and documentation skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated skills in time management, building customer relationships, as well as leading and coaching technical staff

Desirable:

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT or equivalent.
  • Cisco CCIE Certification
  • F5 \xe2\x80\x93 CSE Certification
  • Juniper JNCIE Certification
  • Experience with cloud technologies (such as Azure Private, Public & O365).
  • Experience managing remote access solutions such as SSL-VPN, Juniper MAG2600 (Pulse Secure).
  • Administration experience using SolarWinds NPM, NCM, IPAM and Netflow modules.

The Rewards

This opportunity will provide:

  • Excellent career progression and development.
  • Experience working with one of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s leading retailers, and

A supportive team environment.

The Harvey Norman system fosters an entrepreneurial spirit, therefore you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to be customer focused, results orientated, self-motivated, and perform well under pressure.

If you have a high customer service focus, excellent communication skills along with the drive and enthusiasm we are looking for, submitting your application could be the next step in your IT career.

www.harveynorman.com.au

Please note that only people with the right to work in Australia should apply for this position.

Recruitment Agencies: Harvey Norman does not accept unsolicited resumes or appreciate unsolicited calls from recruitment agencies. Agencies attempting to supply to Harvey Norman must direct all communications to Tina Clarisse on 9201 6111. Please do not contact our line managers. Non compliance will result in your company being removed from our approved supplier list or become ineligible to be considered as a supplier in the future.

'

title: AWD Aegis Systems Engineer
description:
b'
Lockheed Martin is a dynamic, growing, and energetic organisation offering stimulating, challenging work at the forefront of technology. Lockheed Martin is a leader in Australias National Security, and our collaboration with Australian industry spans the Aeronautics, Maritime, Surveillance and Defence domains. We employ approximately 98,000 staff worldwide, and over 800 staff in Australia across multiple locations.The Aegis Weapons System Engineer is responsible for the planning, implementation, and coordination of complex system engineering activities for designated work packages and projects. This new opportunity reports to the Surface Maritime Engineering Manager (Programmatic) and Systems Engineering Manager (Functional). The working location is Sydney and frequent travel to Adelaide particularly in the first 3 months of engagement will be required.Your responsibilities will include (not limited to): Support Defence in undertaking on-going test and activation of the Aegis Weapon System for the remaining AWD platforms in the shipyard and AWD land sites. Building on the experience of existing personnel, expand shore facility support as required. Shadow the US Navy engineer currently supporting the AWS. You will have skills and experience in: Familiarity with Combat System Design, and adaptation data processes and tools. Experience testing hardware/software interfaces as a part of an end-to-end solution Experience in engineering maritime systems. Prior naval operational experience. Assignment Detailed Description: Provide engineering guidance and assessment across all elements of the Aegis Weapon System (AWS). Undertake Australian based engineering analysis of the AWS. Provide local advice to RAN on AWS individual element roles & interfaces within the AWS. Provide governance of the AWS design in accordance with ABR6492 - Navy Technical Regulations Manual (NTRM) Manage allocation of resources between acquisition and sustainment obligations. Provide input and advice into work scheduling activities Understand potential modes of degradation of the AWS. Have the knowledge and delegation to provide Judgement of Significance (JoS) to the customer both in build and in service. Provide input for AWS update and upgrade activities, in context of Australian use and experience. Provide preliminary input for AWS update and upgrade activities, in context of Australian use and experience. What we offer you:From competitive salary packages and benefits to training and development opportunities we show our appreciation for your skills, ambitions and potential. Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in Workplace.Applicants are required to be Australian Citizens and eligible for clearance to Negative Vetting 1 (NV-1) level.Please Note: Refer to the detailed applicable position description on www.lockheedmartin.com.au to obtain further information for this opportunity.Employment may be contingent on the satisfactory result of criminal and/or other background screens, which require the collection and transfer of personal information. title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
b'Our client is a global intelligence-focused security company servicing major corporate around the globe in both the public and private sector. Over the years they have developed a unique platform bringing together security detection & incident response, threat intelligence and tailored consulting services. With their innovative approach and a fast-forward thinking corporate culture, they have attracted consistently the best cybersecurity talents. As their global Threat Intelligence team is consistently growing, they are now seeking a "thinking out of the box" and passionate Threat Intelligence Analyst to join their Sydney CBD office.

Part of a team of 8 Intelligence specialists and reporting to the Senior Manager Global Threat Intelligence, your will interpret and analyse large data sets to provide intelligence insights about the evolving threat landscape.

Main responsibilities:
  • Proactively research emerging cyber threats and apply analytical understanding of attackers methodologies and tactics, system vulnerabilities and key indicators of attacks and exploits
  • Analyze threats, including large and sometimes ambiguous data, to deduct\xc2\xa0tactical and strategic intelligence about cyber threats, including their motivations, methodologies and industries/networks impacted
  • Communicate via finished intelligence reports the main risks at technical and strategical levels and present the results to a large audience, internally and externally when required
  • Put in place a framework enabling to track progressions of the threats and to implement relevant defense actions

Requirements:
  • Information Security qualifications (CISSP, ethical hacking or others) with a demonstrated track record in a detection and incident response environment
  • In-depth knowledge of the cyber threat landscape, including actors, targets, malware, pishing, hacking technics, network security and monitoring practices
  • Previous experience in intelligence analysis and ability to interpret internal and open source data
  • Ability to think critically, to provide accurate and concise reporting to a variety of audiences with exceptional communication skills

This role will suit well a passionate cyber security professional with an extensive understanding of the macro-picture, a passion to anticipate the main trends of this market and the willingness to be on the edge of the market. The company offers a global exposure to advanced threats, long-term career progression, high visibility in major projects and an attractive package. Please get in touch with Charlotte Bridault on 02 9641 5134 or by email at charlotteb@charterhouse.com.au should you be interested in a confidential discussion.
\xc2\xa0 '

title: Senior Digital Sales Executive
description:
b"
The new Senior Digital Sales Executive will be a true thought leader and the face of Nine in front of our clients and partners. This will be a diverse role where no two days will be the same. Day one could be working on trading programs with Australia's tier-one advertisers and day two could be testing first to market Augmented Reality / Virtual Reality strategies.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
While already one of Australia's leading content and advertising companies across broadcast and digital, Nine has embarked on a journey of future growth and our Sales Executives are at the coal face of this evolution. They are evangelising new ways of digital advertising in Australia while developing and maintaining relationships with agencies and clients alike.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Our Sales Executives deliver market leading solutions while ensuring great service and results for our customers. This is a role for a passionate and experienced Sales Executive who is excited and driven by emerging trends and technologies.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities:
  • Identify opportunities for new business growth
  • Build and maintain effective relationships with agencies and clients
  • Have a deep understanding of the media industry and its buying models
  • Ability to represent the NEC brand in market
  • Meet and exceed revenue targets
  • Demonstrate a positive and professional communication style
  • Participate in a team environment
  • Communicates in a clear, timely and consistent manner
  • Further, we will look favourably on the below:
  • Demonstrated success at leveraging your networks of contacts within the media industry showing the ability to be flexible when these change
  • Able to relate how you have performed against sales targets and negotiated successful outcomes for both clients and your business with a win/win approach
  • Minimum of 3 years media sales experience is essential
Being part of our Nine Sales team means you will benefit from:
  • Participating in our Sales Academy to further your skills in both digital and broadcast sales
  • Our fun vibrant culture and large recognition program where we reward outstanding performance quarterly
  • Being rewarded through our highly competitive commission structure

About us

\xc2\xa0

Nine\xe2\x80\x99s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. As the home of some of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Lifestyle, Entertainment, and Sport, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want it to ensure they are entertained, informed and connected each and every day.

Our business operates in the following 4 divisions \xe2\x80\x93 FTA Television, Digital Publishing, Video on Demand (advertising and subscription) and Content Production. In addition, we have a long-running strategic relationship with Microsoft, selling their suite of advertising products while leveraging their world-leading technology, data, insights, and innovation as well as data relationships with Data Republic and Red Planet.

Nine also has a 50% interest in Stan, as well as interests in RateCity, CarAdvice, Pedestrian.tv and ASX-listed financial services company, Yellow Brick Road.

"

title: A&A - Accounting/Audit Support Coordinator - 3-6 Month Contract
description:
b'

Our people are our brand, and they play an active role in shaping and driving our brand with clients and each other every day. In this role, you'll be joining a team of innovative and passionate thinkers.

About our team

Deloitte Assurance and Advisory (A&A) is a national practice that offers assurance, accounting technical, carbon reporting, treasury services and advisory services to some of Australia's biggest listed, global multinational and government clients in the market. The team consists of over 900 professionals who work collaboratively with our clients to address their needs. We take the time to understand our clients' businesses and the sectors in which they operate. We do this in order to identify major risks and opportunities beyond the traditional financial reporting function.

About the role

Currently, our business is entering an exciting phase of innovative transformation to support our growth. Underpinning this growth, we have a specialist team driving project delivery and change. This team is responsible for the execution of core audit administration, data processing as well as resolving queries and escalations. Driven and outcome-oriented, the delivery team will be aligned to specific business areas to enable specialism on particular workflows.

The COE delivery team will work with Delivery Subject Matter Experts and Centre of Excellence Leaders to manage peaks in demand and deliver compliant outputs in line with agreed SLAs.

The delivery team will be responsible for completing core audit support which includes:

  • Reviewing documents and performing established procedures relating to audit of financial information, in line with agreed SLAs
  • Connecting with internal and external stakeholders to resolve/ escalate queries
  • Maintaining client service excellence by providing ongoing client support and innovative solutions
  • Ad-hoc administrative support


About you

To be successful in this role you will possess strong communication skills as well as a strong attention to detail. You will have past experience working in a high volume administration or an accounts support position ideally within a corporate environment. In addition, the team are looking for candidates who possess strong skills such as:

  • Delivery/ Outcome focussed
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to prioritise and deliver high volumes of work at a high standard
  • Ability to work autonomously as well as in a team environment


This role offers candidates the opportunity to specialise or be trained to become technical specialists in a particular field, such as derivatives, industry based revenue recognition or forecasting and valuations.

About us

We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one at our firm you\xe2\x80\x99ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities that will set you up to succeed - in every sense of the word.

Next Steps

If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that aligns with your experience and career goals, we want to hear from you. Please call Stevie Nott on 02 9322 3041 or click \xe2\x80\x9cApply\xe2\x80\x9d below and submit your application.

'

title: Smollan -Customer Account Manager
description:
b"

Company Description

Smollan Trade Partners\xc2\xa0brings\xc2\xa0together the global reach of the world's largest field marketing agency, Smollan in partnership with Trade Partners. With specific focus we deliver on our clients' needs in the Australian Grocery Channel by having the right conversations with the right people to deliver outstanding results. With the group working across 25 countries, and with over 60,000 employees, we provide our clients with a world class 'sales focus' within the FMCG retail space, not just merchandising execution.

An exciting opportunity now exists for a suitably experienced Senior Customer Service professional to join the team. Working closely with the Customer Service team, you will be working with our suite of major client accounts, having a real opportunity to build your career in a fun and social office environment.

\xc2\xa0

Job Description

Reporting to the Client Service Manager, as a\xc2\xa0Customer Account Manager\xc2\xa0you will:

  • Be responsible for managing field marketing campaigns for FMCG clients
  • Run weekly conference calls and monthly face to face meetings with clients
  • Setup new campaigns and programs utilising in-house and client specific programs and technology
  • Analyse field data and prepare client reporting to deliver results with real insights
  • Interface with Management, clients, systems and operations staff to ensure clear information and infield execution is second to none\xc2\xa0
  • Work collaboratively with the Client Service team to ensure client requests are actioned successfully
  • Hold briefing sessions for field to effectively communicate the required field strategy
  • Be able to work autonomously and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Present findings and reports to both senior management and clients on a regular basis
  • Provide accurate and efficient administrative support to the Client Service Manager and wider team
  • Record and update data to ensure data integrity

\xc2\xa0

Qualifications

To be successful in this role you will:

  • Have a confident, outgoing, warm and positive disposition with impeccable presentation
  • Display strong client service and relationship management skills
  • Be able to engage with our clients and not only meet but exceed client expectations
  • Be a team player and want to achieve results for yourself and the wider team
  • Have the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Be respected for your exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Have intermediate to advanced skills in MS Office. A solid knowledge of Excel is essential (v look ups, pivot tables, macros etc).\xc2\xa0
  • Be exceptionally organised with a high attention to detail
  • Be a decision maker that can also deliver value-add reporting and analysis
  • Have sound analytical and problem solving skills
  • Keep cool under pressure
  • Have previous experience within a busy client service role where you are required to multi-task\xc2\xa0
  • Most likely have previous experience within a similar role with FMCG experience\xc2\xa0
"

title: SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR | Niche Law Firm
description:
b"

The Company:
The niche Australian law firm has an excellent reputation and a diverse range of legal practices within commercial, corporate, employment, and family law. They foster a collaborative and friendly culture, and they offer their staff a great working environment with term career growth.

The Role:
Currently the IT team consists of one person servicing the needs of all Sydney staff. As the firm continues to grow there is an immediate need to expand the team to cater for increased demands and to free up the time of the IT Manager to focus on more strategic projects.

Being a small team, the ideal candidate will be someone who has a broad range of IT capability that is able to turn their hand to any area of IT that is used within the firm.

  • Desktop and peripheral support and administration
  • Disaster recovery and security
  • Delivery of projects, producing reports, extracting data
  • Configuring systems to support business processes

title: WPP AUNZ Productions - Technical Project Manager
description:
b"

Company Description

We are in the process of aggregating a number of existing WPP AUNZ production businesses into one central entity. This group will initially comprise of over fifty employees and grow to over eighty by the end of 2017. The focus of the new entity will be the production and adaptation of advertising for national and global clients. We will do this across all media: TV, print, digital. Our production expertise coupled with our powerful workflow and asset management technology will deliver quality, control and savings for brands. We strive to bring innovation to the art and craft of advertising production

\xc2\xa0

Job Description

The Technology Implementation Manager will be the leading facilitator of all production workflow software interfaces integrated within the organisation. Requiring the facilitation between intercompany, internal and client stakeholders, both proprietary and third party software applications will be scoped, planned and delivered for the purpose of organisational efficiency and effectiveness. While supporting the global CTO's technology strategy, local workflow uniformity will mirror the worldwide office network and enable the seamless delivery of global and domestic client services.

This role is based in Sydney and will have national responsibilities servicing the Melbourne operations.

REPORTING OF THE ROLE:
This role reports to the COO.

WHAT YOU SHOULD SPEND YOUR TIME DOING:
To help achieve organisational goals you will be required to spend time spend time across all practice areas of the business.

Your key responsibilities include:

Project scoping

  • Work with the leadership team to design and develop technology implementation projects and work autonomously on your own projects
  • Explore client business requirements and develop innovative solutions that support our strategies
  • Together with the client service team, lead Discovery Workshops to gather customer requirements and report these back with methodical assessments
  • Compile system scoping documentation including: Workflows and Process Maps (online and offline), Database Schemas, GUI Guidelines, User Restriction Information, IT Infrastructure Requirements\xc2\xa0
  • Demonstrate a thorough understanding of our proprietary and third party service offerings\xc2\xa0

Planning

  • Develop project delivery and service transition time plans to meet business objectives
  • Work with our global development team, or third party providers, in scheduling system configurations, customisations and delivery dates
  • Identify and schedule key milestones to ensure system deliverables are achieved within project parameters
  • Understanding of relevant contractual obligations, commercial arrangements and SLAs and make informed decisions and problem-solve based on sound knowledge\xc2\xa0
  • Adapt pre-existing working methods to new online workflow solutions

Implementation

  • Project manage the implementation of new services and be the primary point of contact for all stakeholders
  • Ensure key milestones are met to guarantee on-time service activations
  • Manage client expectations of system deliverables including functionality and timing\xc2\xa0
  • Provide on-going project status updates to the leadership team and client relationship managers
  • Manage bulk data ingestions and work directly with clients to define and optimize metadata schemas\xc2\xa0
  • Prepare and provide system training as required, including the documentation of user manuals, production of video tutorials, on-screen presentations and one-on-one tuitions

Support and maintenance

  • Provide helpdesk support as required under service agreements
  • Report and escalate any system bugs or downtime threats
  • Communicate system updates, advances and improvements as modifications are introduced
  • Maintain and update user accounts and access settings or privileges\xc2\xa0
  • Adhere to WPP Data security protocols and protect client and organisational intellectual property at all times
    \xc2\xa0

Qualifications

WHAT IT TAKES
Candidates will have had strong, hands-on experience in delivering workflow technology applications within a creative production environment; with a proven track record of successfully implementing applications such as DAM and marketing content automation workflow tools. Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills, and a strong aptitude for high level client service (internal and external) are a must.
In addition, the candidates should demonstrate the following:

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills;
  • Strong people and team skills with the ability to manage self and influence others in a constructive manner and to build long term relationships;\xc2\xa0
  • Excellent time management skills in order to effectively prioritise simultaneous demands from a variety of different sources and adapt and respond appropriately;
  • Concern for quality and pride in all work produced; consistently careful and methodical with a strong eye for detail to ensure accuracy and consistent delivery whilst retaining an awareness of the bigger picture;
  • Ability to work on own initiative; pre-emptive and proactive; constantly thinking ahead; demonstrating a hands on and highly organised approach to all tasks;\xc2\xa0
  • Strong creative problem solving and lateral thinking skills; ability to join up the dots in ways that others might not and to spot the critical insight in a world of 'information';
  • Ability and desire to embrace and manage change; comfortable with ambiguity - flexible and adaptable with a willingness to learn and 'muck in' where ever needed;
  • Collaborative and astute - able to build trust and respect within our network; great instincts about how and when to pursue a particular agenda and how to build alliances and momentum.
  • Natural aptitude to the role and active interest in the relevant technology\xc2\xa0
  • Knowledge of programming languages and database administration is not required and not used as part of the role but having an understanding of each of the below is advantageous:\xc2\xa0
    - HTML/PHP\xc2\xa0
    - CSS\xc2\xa0
    - JavaScript\xc2\xa0
    - SQL\xc2\xa0
  • \xc2\xa0A high proficiency in MS Office products including Excel, Powerpoint and Visio (or similar process mapping tool)
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud applications
  • 2 - 5 years of equivalent work experience in a similar role or tertiary education in a related area of computer sciences or data management
"

title: NA
description:
b'

IRI is a global information technology business and leading supplier of data information services in ANZ. We source, process, analyse, interpret sales data and shopper behaviours to deliver meaningful market intelligence that enables our clients to make informed decisions.

The IRI Healthcare business is expanding on a global scale! To support our growth in Australia we are seeking an experienced Healthcare Development Manager \xe2\x80\x93 OTC based in our Sydney office that will lead our new initiatives and continue to delight our clients in this channel. This will include -

  • Solution portfolio pricing

To be successful in this role you will possess the following:\xc2\xa0

  • A track record of successful NPD from idea to in-market execution

In return you will be rewarded with:

We are a strong knit team with an open and supportive culture.\xc2\xa0 We are seeking someone who enjoys team contribution with a positive "can do" attitude and lots of enthusiasm. We value employees' who take pride in their own contribution, and we provide extensive training in order to grow and develop you within our business. There is real opportunity to build a career in a positive, fresh thinking and successful organisation.\xc2\xa0 With benefits such as business casual Fridays, Charity Day, regular company meetings and monthly celebrations, this is a company where you can truly make your mark.

title: Senior Web Content Manager - International
description:
b"

At Sage you'll find a company that combines global clout and scale with the opportunity for you to personally impact on the small and medium sized businesses of the people who make it all worthwhile \xe2\x80\x93 our customers. You can expect a challenging but collaborative work environment where we actively encourage innovation and creativity and are comfortable giving you as much responsibility as you seek. But the real attraction of a career with us lies in the opportunity to grow and succeed with Sage.

\xc2\xa0

Sage is transforming its digital experiences and this role is a fantastic opportunity to be at the forefront of the transformation. Leading regional support for in country websites and digital destinations on Sage.com, this role is accountable for delivering world class web content across the International websites and has responsibility for executing global web content delivery in country in support of the One Sage vision.

\xc2\xa0

Key accountabilities and decision ownership:

  • Working in partnership with global web marketing, SEO, ecommerce, campaign and optimisation teams to continually evolve Sage's web presence in country and implement best practices techniques to help optimise the web experience.
  • Acting as a trusted liaison between business and technology teams, developing a strong relationship with IT to ensure efficient support for local websites.
  • Managing a team of Web Content Managers who oversee:

\xc2\xa0

Web content management:

  • Maintaining and updating web content, images, files etc.
  • Managing Sitecore page creation, editing and administration, SEO tagging and meta data, and planning and orchestrating A/B test implementation.

\xc2\xa0

Web project management:

  • Development and management of digital project requirements and prioritisation including creative briefs, documentation, wireframe requirements for new content components, project plans/schedules and meetings.
  • Lead project status meetings and effectively consult and train stakeholders on web content management processes, accountability and workflows.

    \xc2\xa0

Web strategy management:

  • Proactively identify and understand industry and competitive trends and how best practices can be adopted to support the One Sage vision.
  • Drive development of requirements to outline design and content needs to inform development approach.
  • Establish and implement personalisation strategies that align with customer and prospect journey maps, lead gen/buy now, etc.

    \xc2\xa0

Skills, know-how and experience:

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent preferred.
  • Significant demonstrable experience in delivering and executing local web content within a global marketing team.
  • Proven experience managing a team of web professionals.
  • Adept at managing, prioritising, and coordinating client-based requests in either a corporate or agency environment.
  • Approaches role with a consultative perspective, helping to solve issues, create value, maximise growth and improve business performance.
  • Must be organised and capable of managing, tracking, troubleshooting, and problem solving multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Hands-on experience managing websites with a CMS (preferably Sitecore) and the basic knowledge of its building blocks, including HTML, CSS, Javascript, etc. and tools such as Adobe Creative cloud.

\xc2\xa0

Preferred:

  • Familiarity with responsive design concepts and the mobile experience.
  • Contributing to global team processes and best practices around web production and project management and aligning team priorities toward those
  • Excellent time management skills, organisation skills, and attention to detail.

    \xc2\xa0

You must have the Right to Work in Australia to be considered for this role.

Due to the high volume of applicants we receive, only short listed candidates will be contacted.

"

title: Executive Manager Digital Channel Planning & Performance
description:
b'
  • Engaged and enabled team

  • Brisbane/Sydney/Melbourne Location

About the role:

We are currently looking to appoint an Executive Manager Digital Channel Planning & Performance.The purpose of the role is to take an end-to-end view of the Digital channel and associated targets to create a 1-3 year Digital Channel plan for the Group that delivers the digital components of the Group Strategy following consultation with all affected Group stakeholders. The role is accountable for driving Digital Performance capability and Digital Data Strategy, as a CoE across the Customer Platforms division & digital channel, that influences and ensures our +$20m optimisation OPEX is directed towards high value creating activiites and our finger is on the pulse around insights to action. This role is an active agent in bringing areas of the organisation closer together in the context of operating the Digital Channel.

Reporting to the Head of eCommerce, your responsibilities will also include:

  • Taking an end-to-end view of the Digital channel and associated targets to create a 1-3 year Digital Channel strategy for the Group that meets its strategic and financial goals
  • Developing strong relationships and partnerships both internally and externally with a view to maximising potential eCommerce opportunities
  • Managing and driving improvement in the existing external strategic supplier relationships
  • Development of Digital Channel strategy for the Suncorp Group, the Digital Channel being composed of Websites, Secure Transaction zones (sales and service), Applications, and the Digital aspects of the Suncorp Marketplace
  • Providing strategic guidance to enable robust digital performance capability and insights that power priorities across the entire eCommerce team to lift financial outcomes & hit our scorecard targets
  • Leading a team of people who own the end-to-end Digital Data strategy for the Group, in terms of strategy & activation of the the digital data strategy with measurable outcomes across all customer facing \xe2\x80\x98owned\xe2\x80\x99 digital assets.
  • Developing strong relationships and partnerships both internally and externally with a view to maximising potential eCommerce opportunities
  • Managing and driving improvement in the existing external strategic supplier relationships

    Desired skills and experience:

You will be a supportive and dynamic leader who has highly developed consulting and planning skills applied with focus on creation of coherent workplans to deliver an actionable channel strategy. Having a highly developed understanding of technical aspects of digital Channel technology, applied in business transformation settings along with internal capability to create clarity out of complexity for self and others will see you succeed in this role.

You will also have:

  • Financial acumen skills, with well-honed experience in business casing, benefits tracking and Digital analytics insights to action
  • An understanding technical aspects of digital Channel technology, applied in business transformation settings
  • Negotiation skills, with ability to work collaboratively across all areas of Suncorp to negotiate and agree Digital programs that meet internal customer needs within resource limitations.

If you are a highly engaged individual with relevant experience, who is motivated by the idea of a new challenge, then please apply now. Alternatively, for more information contact Annette Frasca on 02 8121 3236.

'

title: Senior Payroll Executive (12 month fixed-term)
description:

title: Digital Performance Coordinator (entry level)  Full-time, Drummoyne NSW
description:

Join an exciting Aussie tech start-up with patented technology, a fast-growing client base and agency partners in Australia and internationally.

Founded in 2013 by an ex-Googler, a successful entrepreneur and a Buddhist monk, Longtail UX is transforming Search: Our technology increases Search channel ROI by 50% across SEM and SEO. title: Client Partnership Manager
description:
b"About us


Link Group is one of Australia's leading fund administration and share registry specialists. \xc2\xa0We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0


About the role\xc2\xa0


We have a great opportunity for a Client Partnership Manager to join our Client Partnership Division in our Rhodes office. This role will see you manage, drive and \xe2\x80\x9cown\xe2\x80\x9d the relationship between the client and the business for a portfolio of funds, the outcome of which is the provision of a value added service that facilitates the retention of existing profitable business and profitable growth of the client portfolio.


Key responsibilities\xc2\xa0
  • Manage, drive and own critical client relationships with a view to achieving client satisfaction, revenue and profitability targets
  • Identify opportunities to further strengthen the relationship between the client and the business, and facilitate the provision of additional services and products
  • Ensure all services are being delivered as outlined in the relevant Service Level Agreement and manage any client issues to a satisfactory resolution
  • Actively manage key internal relationships.
  • Maintain and develop fund profitability through the generation of contractual revenue streams, contract variations and new products and service opportunities
  • Market and promote new and existing products and services. \xc2\xa0Actively identify opportunities to increase the services provided to the client tailored to their needs
  • Negotiate client contracts and performance standards
  • Ensure compliance with APRA, ASIC regulations and SIS

About you\xc2\xa0
  • Minimum 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience working in a Relationship Management role in Superannuation \xe2\x80\x93 Defined Benefits experiences highly desirable
  • Solid relationship and stakeholder management skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to present at a senior level and effectively influence outcomes and deliverables for our clients
  • Budgeting and financial forecasting
  • Sound judgment and commercial decision making skills
  • Ability to market and promote products and services
  • Experience of working with Trustees and Fund Secretariats
  • Knowledge of compliance and legislation applicable to superannuation

Essential Qualifications
  • RG 146 qualifications desirable
  • ASFA 100 qualification or higher, and or other relevant tertiary qualifications desirable

The above list of key accountabilities is not an exhaustive list and may change from time-to-time based on business needs.


Joining our team\xc2\xa0


At Link we believe our people are our MOST important asset. We offer excellent career progression opportunities, ongoing training and development, competitive salary, staff recognition programs, salary continuance insurance and discounted healthcare.\xc2\xa0
