  • Support the Financial\xc2\xa0Advisor's\xc2\xa0with the implementation of financial strategy.
  • Keep up to date with technical knowledge including legislation changes and licensee standards.
  • Maintain client files and entering data into Xplan.\xc2\xa0
Requirements
  • RG146 required.\xc2\xa0
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in a similar role.\xc2\xa0
  • Experience writing SOAs including comprehensive strategies.\xc2\xa0
  • Excellent communication skills; both oral and written.\xc2\xa0
  • Passion to pursue a career in Financial Planning.\xc2\xa0
How to Apply
Please press apply now or call Sophia Adams on 02 8256 5000 for a confidential conversation. "

title: Office Administrator / Customer Service
description:
b"LOCAL PEOPLE FOR LOCAL BUSINESS
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
An opportunity now exists through an\xc2\xa0internal promotion for a person who values customer service\xc2\xa0& can provide a variety of administration support. This\xc2\xa0position is offered\xc2\xa0on\xc2\xa0a full time permanent role working Monday to Friday 9am to 5pm

Our Client based on Sydney's northern beaches specialising in educating potential investors in real estate, mortgagee sales and asset protection strategies.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Working as part of a team, this position is primarily responsible for providing administrative and customer support and answering the customers needs competently and professionally as well as supporting the team to carry out their duties.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Our client is well regarded within the property industry, and currently looking to expand their small and friendly team with the addition of a first class Office Administrator / Customer Service Representative.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Reporting through to the GM, the successful candidate will posses excellent administration skills, demonstrate a high level of communication and professionalism, be able to work in an environment where multi-tasking is the norm. Able to take and accept accountability seeing projects through to completion, this fast paced and varied role offers the potential for movement within the business as it grows.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Key duties will include:-
  • Answering incoming phone base enquiries
  • Handling customer enquiries across various areas of business via phone and email
  • Uploading data to CRM and\xc2\xa0maintenance or customer details\xc2\xa0and mailing list
  • Follow up of customer leads and bookings post seminars
  • Liaise with fulfilment house on distribution of event packs to attendees
  • Coordinate all documentation and\xc2\xa0
  • Manage the email admin inbox
  • Mass email campaigns to the database - through Mail chimp
  • Organise travel and accommodation booking for GM attending seminars
  • General administration duties to support the wider team
  • Preparation of nametags and registration check in lists
  • Creation of web event pages
  • Packing and shipping of products for conferences
The successful candidate will demonstrate:-
\xc2\xa0
  • Excellent interpersonal, professional organisational and communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail, and follow through to complete tasks assigned.
  • Willingness to multi tasks and prioritise workloads and deadlines.
  • Friendly, outgoing personality who adopts a flexible approach to their work and responsibilities.
  • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office
\xc2\xa0
How to apply:

You must be an Australian Permanent Resident or Citizen to apply with no work restrictions.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Please click the 'Apply Now' button below, visit our website www.tempnet.com.au or contact Joanna Gruber or Penny McConaghy at Tempnet Permanent and Temporary Recruitment on\xc2\xa0 02 9997 7777
\xc2\xa0
Permanent & Temporary Recruitment Agency on the Northern Beaches of Sydney specialising in all round Business Services, Contact Call Centre, Accounting & Finance, Warehouse & Logistics.

Locations: Warriewood, Frenchs Forest, Belrose, Mona Vale, Narrabeen, Bayview, Terrey Hills, Manly, Manly Vale, Allambie, Brookvale, Mosman, Avalon, Newport & Palm Beach\xc2\xa0 "

title: HR Business Partner
description:
b"This is a unique member owned industry organisation who offer a range of insights and services to their client base. With growth on the agenda, this organisation are a powerful voice in their industry and are led by a desire for constant improvement and sustainability. Working with highly intelligent and influential stakeholders, this is an opportunity to work with an organisation that has a huge impact on the Australian natural resources market. \xc2\xa0

About the role:\xc2\xa0
Working closely with two Senior Business Partners, you will consult with Senior Managers to deliver the full spectrum of generalist HR initiatives. Some of the key focus areas include:\xc2\xa0
  • Partnering with Senior Leaders on workforce planning initiatives and future operating models;\xc2\xa0
  • Working with the Business Partners on the upcoming EBA negotiations;\xc2\xa0
  • Driving key people insights through the use of data and metrics (Success Factors) and consulting with Leaders on their commercial decisions;\xc2\xa0
  • Revamp of the onboarding and offboarding experience;\xc2\xa0
  • Employment relations including performance management and disciplinary processes;\xc2\xa0
  • Adhoc HR projects in transformation, engagement, org development and succession.\xc2\xa0
This role covers offices in the CBD and Norwest area so some travelling between will be required.\xc2\xa0

About you:\xc2\xa0
With a minimum 5 years' experience, you have Generalist expertise within a unionised workforce, ideally from a large, matrix organisation. You have experience in Change, ER, IR, Workforce Planning and HR projects. You thrive in roles that combine strategic and operational elements and have sound influencing skills. Experience in Engineering, Construction, Energy or Infrastructure highly valued.\xc2\xa0

For enquiries, please phone Emily Haire on 02 8045 2924.\xc2\xa0If you are confident that your experience reflects the criteria outlined\xc2\xa0please apply on-line. "

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
b"

My client is seeking an experienced (+3 years) Business Process Analyst to work on a major operational, organisational and cultural change project - supporting transformation and change work stream in creation of a new program.

You will be responsible for gathering the information / data, modelling the processes, assessing impact of changes to people, systems and processes and creating relevant documentation. 80% of the role will be process modelling.

NB - You're experience needs to be around the process of what people do NOT data and systems workflows.

The role:

  • Design future state processes considering all elements of process design including safety, effort, skillset required, and communication.
  • Undertake process analysis to validate that future state processes support the business vision.
  • Provide concise, clear process documentation to support training, change management, testing and assurance across the program and enable clean handover to the business owner.
  • Support, promote and champion transformation and change initiatives within the Program to assist others to engage with the program.

key accountabilities:

  • Document business processes to internal standards and methodology.
  • Support and/or facilitate process design and playback sessions
  • Manage information in the program repositories to document management standards
  • Undertake analysis to measure future state process effectiveness
  • Undertake current and future state gap analysis, assess changes and impacts to ensure that transformation strategy and transition planning is fit for purpose.
  • Build and maintain working relationships with program and business stakeholders
  • Support business and program stakeholders in utilising process artefacts effectively

About you:

  • Demonstrated experience in business process analysis and/or process redesign for business improvement changes within an operationally critical environment.
  • Experience developing high quality process documentation during major organisational reform.
  • High level conceptual and analytical skills and the capacity to develop solutions for a range of multifaceted issues.
  • Clear and concise written and oral communication skills including the ability to present to varying audiences.
  • Ability to maintain a high level of attention in a distracting environment
  • Ability to maintain a level of consistency in documentation.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the tools and techniques used for process redesign such as Holocentric or other process modelling products.

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below or email Jon White directly at jwhite@caddencrowe.com.au.

Please be aware that only successful candidates will be contacted about this particular position.

"

title: Underwriting Assistant - specialty lines
description:
b'

The company

This leading Corporate Global Insurer within a niche market is currently undergoing rapid growth and expansion. They pride themselves on their innovative approach and engaging professional and knowledgeable employees who can truly contribute big ideas to keep always improving.

The role

They currently have an outstanding opportunity for an ambitious underwriting assistant to join their specialty lines team, initially on a 12 month contract but with the possibility of permanency as the company is undergoing constant growth and expansion. The role is reporting to the Operations Lead and will involve administration support to a team of underwriters working within niche and highly interesting insurance products.

Working alongside another assistant, you will support a team of 4 professionals who are described as progressive, innovative thinkers, dynamic and fun. The culture is one that encourages professional growth and solutions based thinking in a supportive environment.

Responsibilities

  • Admin support to underwriters
  • Inputting data to systems and checking work
  • Providing information and administrative support to external stakeholders
  • Liaison with external parties

Skill requirements

  • Minimum of 2 years experience as an underwriting assistant, preferably with experience in specialty lines or casualty
  • Fast and efficient data entry, attention to detail
  • Fast learner, adaptable and quick to pick up systems
  • Able to work autonomously

Don\xe2\x80\x99t miss this opportunity! Apply now to Sarah Magill at sarahm@porterallen.com.au or call for a confidential conversation on (02) 8247 5719

'

title: Project Manager (Full-Service Research)  Social & Public Sector Research
description:
b'

This specialist unit of one of the world's leading research agencies is recruiting a skilled Research Manager to join a team of passionate and dedicated professionals.\xc2\xa0 This agency is curious about people and society.\xc2\xa0 They conduct research on public policy issues and on the attitudes and behaviours of citizens and consumers.\xc2\xa0 The goal of this specific team is to help clients manage issues, advance reputations, determine and pinpoint shifts in attitude and opinion, and enhance communications.

\xc2\xa0

This dualist role is for a junior researcher/Project Manager with a mixed tool bag of quantitative and qualitative research techniques they can apply to exploring a range of questions.\xc2\xa0 Working with predominantly government and third sector clients:

\xc2\xa0

  • Manage research projects utilising a variety of research techniques.
  • Conduct in-depth interviews and focus groups when required.
  • Develop and implement survey instruments, including questionnaires and focus group moderator's guide.
  • Manage timelines for projects.
  • Undertake quantitative analysis, including data manipulation (in SPSS and Q) and reporting.
  • Summarise and explain research findings and their implications.
  • Undertake focus groups in locations around Australia when required.
  • Create draft proposals for research.

\xc2\xa0

To apply you'll need strong project management experience and attention to detail.\xc2\xa0 This team is full of quick witted, sharp people who are looking for a likeminded team member, ideally with an interest in the following areas: public opinion, stakeholder and corporate reputation research.\xc2\xa0 It's likely you'll have 2 + years' market research experience gained agency-side and a degree in a related field.

\xc2\xa0

This company is one of the world's strongest research agencies and is globally recognised for its high quality insight, as such you will be entitled to big company benefits and a great salary as well as excellent promotion prospects and the chance to gain recognition within the research industry.\xc2\xa0 To apply or for further information, please send your CV to Zoe Crouch at Resources Group: ZCrouch@resourcesgroup.com or call 02 9258 1121.

'

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
b"

Our client, one of Australia's most reputable hosting specialists are looking for an experienced digital marketing specialist to join their team. The client creates flexible and fully certified hybrid IT solutions to their clients and they require an individual to take the lead for a 2 month contract period initially with the possibility of extension.

About the role:

  • Accessing clients marketing needs, offering products and services to increase and broadcast their message in the marketplace
  • Using digital platforms to execute campaigns delivering tangiable results
  • Running digital campaigns through online marketing avenues opposed to traditional methods
  • Solution based selling incorporating the businesses appropriate products and services
  • Successfully strategise plans for the client and execute using the correct digital avenues

Required skills:

  • An understanding of cloud service, cloud computing and managed data
  • The ability to effectively and successfully run and execute digital campaigns creating outstanding results
  • Experience in a similar role and able to take the lead in creating and implementing the Digital Marketing Strategy
  • A understanding of salesforce, marketo and google analytics
  • A visual specialist who is adept to running social media and online campaigns
  • Ability to generate insights to enhance the digital marketing strategy

Reporting to the Director of Marketing, we need a strategic thinker, hands-on digital specialist to join the team - if this sounds like you please send your CV in word format.

"

title: NA
description:
b"

About Rodeo Show

Commencing since 2003, we\xc2\xa0are an Australian womenswear designer brand with 8 retail stores and strong online business. We design locally in house\xc2\xa0and all the manufacturing\xc2\xa0of our clothing is offshore. We are looking for an experienced Bookkeeper and Office Administrator to join our close knit friendly team. Main function is to ensure the reliability and accuracy of our accounts and able to assist and support the growth of the company. Our head office is based in Alexandria.

About the Role

You will work closely with the Director, part-time CFO and external accountant and take full control of the accounts function, accuracy and timing of the financial data of the business. The role will encompass duties from accounts payable, bank reconciliations to cash flow/P&L forecasting along with processing varied types of financial transactions.\xc2\xa0 Experience working in a stock control environment is desirable.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Full ownership of MYOB input and data
  • Daily bank reconciliations to General Ledger and Point-of-Sale systems to bank.
  • Weekly payroll (approx. 30 employees)
  • Manage accounts payable ledger and liase with creditors.
  • Draft monthly management accounts \xe2\x80\x93 P&L, Balance Sheet
  • Prepare weekly cashflow and P&L forecasts
  • Monthly and quarterly PAYG and BAS preparation.
  • HR administration \xe2\x80\x93 managing and maintaining staff records and filing
  • Reconcile sales with 3rd party affliliates and wholesale.
  • Retail stores financial reconciliations
  • Working closely with Production team to manage offshore supplier payments.
  • Finance administration duties including trade finance, bank guarantees, insurances, offshore deposits & forex
  • Business key performance indicator (KPI) reporting

To be successful for this role you must have the following:

  • At least 5 years' experience in a role owning the end-to-end accounting function
  • Experience with MYOB essential as well as point-of-sale systems (though looking to move to Zero so experience there would be beneficial).
  • Experience in fashion industry or retail would be ideal
  • High attention to detail with the ability to meet critical deadlines.
  • Experience in the use of computer systems and web based technologies.
  • Strong planning and organisational skills. Need to be very meticulous.
  • High-level communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Have can do attitude and is resourceful. Do more with less.
  • Able to work autonomously and have strong time management skills.
  • A commitment to best practice and continuous improvement.

On offer is a great opportunity to work for a growing company together with a competitive salary package. If you are a person who is willing to roll your sleeves up and get the job done and wants to work for a company that has a passion for fashion industry, than this could be an excellent opportunity for you.\xc2\xa0

Please send your resume in Word format to Lisa@rodeoshow.com.au

Only candidates that meet the requirements will be contacted.

"

title: Campaign Insights Analyst - Multiple roles
description:
b'

Campaign Insights Analyst

The team prides itself on having a collaborative, sociable culture and offers excellent career development opportunities as well as flexible working arrangements. Renowned for its award winning products and innovative approach, this leading organisation provides the chance to work with a high-calibre team in a high performance culture.

Key Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for data support behind marketing campaigns for delivery of insights around customer behaviour and campaign performance. Communicating your findings in a well thought out manner that is both actionable for the business and delivers results across all direct marketing activity.

  • Full end to end campaign management and execution
  • Pre campaign analysis to define targeted customer segments
  • Post campaign analysis to determine campaign effectiveness
  • Monitor consistency and efficiency of all direct marketing campaigns
  • Drive and increase campaign response and conversation rates
  • Communicate your findings and insights in a well thought out manner

Qualifications and Experience:

This role is best suited for someone that has detailed knowledge and experience in data analytics supporting end to end marketing campaigns. You demonstrate confidence in your abilities and demonstrate a strong ability to proactively impact the business.

  • Experience managing multi-stakeholder relationships
  • Strong stakeholder negotiation and influencing abilities
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks at once and prioritize responsibilities
  • Relevant campaign analytics experience
  • Experience leading or desire to lead a team
  • Intermediate to advanced SQL and SAS skills
  • Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing or other relevant field

Like to know more?

To submit your application, for a confidential discussion, please contact Shelley Barclay on shelley.barclay@hudson.com.

'

title: Tests Administrative Officer
description:
b'
  • Dynamic, friendly and professional environment with great conditions
  • Exciting Higher Education role
  • High stakes language tests

\xc2\xa0

UNSW Global is a not-for-profit and wholly owned enterprise of The University of New South Wales (UNSW) and provides English language preparation programs and pre-university Foundation programs for students wishing to study at UNSW. These programs are designed specifically for students with an international education background.

\xc2\xa0

The Tests Administrative Officer is responsible for providing administrative and logistical support for the high stakes English language tests offered by the UNSW Global testing service. This role requires an organized, proactive administration professional with exceptional communication skills.

\xc2\xa0

The successful candidate will possess:

  • Experience in providing preparatory and logistical support for tests
  • Experience in data/records management
  • Highly developed administrative and organisational skills in a high volume work environment, including ability to multi-task
  • Effective oral and written communication skills and cross-cultural awareness
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain high levels of accuracy in data input
  • Competence in the use of Microsoft Office, databases and spreadsheets
  • Awareness of and commitment to maintaining high levels of confidentiality and security

\xc2\xa0

See our website www.unswglobal.unsw.edu.au/jobs/ for full details and follow the instructions to apply.

To be considered for this position you must provide the following:

  • A CV detailing your qualifications
  • A response addressing the selection criteria as outlined in the separate position description.

Please submit applications to jobs@unswglobal.unsw.edu.au quoting reference number #345 by Wednesday 24th May 2017.

'

title: Database List Researcher, Manly
description:
b'

Quest Events Pty Ltd\xc2\xa0is a fast-growing business information and networking event provider - producing, marketing and staging conferences, exhibitions and training seminars for industry and government alike. Our website address is www.questevents.com.au

This is a 6 month maternity leave contract.

The role requires a dynamic individual to work as part of a team in event attendee prospect research. Database List Researchers work closely with the Production and Marketing teams to\xc2\xa0aid in the execution of marketing campaigns by sourcing and updating contact details of individuals for conference specific marketing lists.\xc2\xa0

Main Duties and Responsibilities

  • Contacting\xc2\xa0companies by telephone to collect full contact details of prospects
  • Contacting\xc2\xa0companies by telephone to complete contact details of a given list provided to you
  • Logging\xc2\xa0the contact details attained as per our database entry standards
  • Verifying\xc2\xa0that all the data collected is correctly entered at the time of research\xc2\xa0and in the correct field before submitting it
  • Maintaining the correct use of our standard codes on all the data you submit
  • Working\xc2\xa0confidently and being familiar with the nature of our business should you be asked for it
  • Ensuring targets the business sets are consistently met\xc2\xa0

Essential skills and attributes required

  • A\xc2\xa0confident and clear telephone manner
  • A can\xc2\xa0do attitude and strong work ethic
  • Typing\xc2\xa0and data entry skills in excess of 50 words a minute
  • Tech\xc2\xa0savvy \xe2\x80\x93 you must be knowledgeable using computers and the internet
  • An\xc2\xa0understanding of keyboard shortcuts and techniques to navigate between\xc2\xa0programs and screens quickly
  • Spelling,\xc2\xa0accuracy and attention to detail
  • Resilient and vibrant personality, tenacity
  • Analytical and interpretive skills, thorough and investigative
  • Fluent\xc2\xa0written & spoken English
  • A\xc2\xa0proven track record in marketing list research would be advantageous but\xc2\xa0is not essential
  • Working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of products
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Interest in current business issues

Prior experience in database research/data entry/call centres will be highly regarded.

Applications are also welcome from candidates in Australia on working holiday visas.

If you believe you meet the above criteria, please send a brief cover letter explaining why, along with your CV to helenb@questevents.com.au

Only applicants shortlisted for interview will be contacted regarding the next stage of the recruitment process.

'

title: Administration Supervisor (Operational Support role)
description:
b"
  • Ref No: A17/0122
  • Permanent Full Time \xe2\x80\x93 35 hours per week
  • Salary package up to $85,000 p.a. (including Superannuation)
  • 9-day fortnight, family friendly policies and other great employee benefits
  • Located in Alexandria (modern open plan office)
  • 10 mins walk to shops and public transport (trains and Bus)

Waverley is a diverse and innovative Council located in the heart of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs taking in some of Sydney's most beautiful and iconic beaches and historic locations.

As Administration Supervisor you will lead and support a team of three (3) office bound staff who provide administrative support to the operational departments within Council. These departments include Open Spaces, Parks and Tree management, Maintenance and Construction, and our Waste services team.

This position will also provide administrative support to the Executive Manager of this sub program.

The Key focus areas for this position include; Team leadership, information and data management, customer service excellence, and continued business improvement.

If you have tertiary qualifications in Office Administration or frontline management, have a solid background in administrative services, are a great communicator and team motivator, then this could be the job for you!

If you are new to the government sector or would like more information on how to apply for this position, please contact Paul Sparks on 0466 541 650 between 8am and 4pm Monday to Friday.

Waverley Council is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all candidates. We encourage applications from women and men from diverse groups, including, but not limited to, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island people; people from culturally diverse backgrounds; young people; older workers; people with disabilities; LGBTI; and other minority groups.

CLOSING DATE: Tuesday 23 May 201

"

title: NA
description:
b"
  • Strong analytical and commercial acumen
  • Love for forecasting and data!

At Novo\xc2\xa0Nordisk, we have been changing diabetes since 1923. If you are ready to strengthen our position as an innovative pioneer and respected industry leader, we encourage you to join us to make the most of your talent in Big Data Analytics.

About the department

You get the opportunity to join a small, high performing team with a variety of technical backgrounds. The role of Business Analytics is to support Novo\xc2\xa0Nordisk\xc2\xa0in gaining a new understanding from data. Mostly this means driving data insights projects in close collaboration with the lines of business specifically marketing and sales.

The Position

As a Senior Business Information Analyst, you will take part in various projects and day-to-day tasks involving business decisions and planning support across the\xc2\xa0organisation. You will be a member of the core team working on big data and analytics initiatives; this could be performing analysis on vast data sets or establishing mechanisms for working with large quantities of data. A key part of the job is also to monitor and report on product sales using local in-market data sources (IMS, Wholesaler). You will be a key contributor to the business understanding of product performance in-market, ex-factory and parallel trading. You will also be integral to forecasting and providing support to the business budget planning process.

Qualifications\xc2\xa0

We are looking for an individual who is passionate about data and analytics. You are master's degree qualified within areas such as computer sciences, IT engineering,\xc2\xa0biostatistics, mathematics, analytics, statistics or other related fields. Your specific degree is not the main criteria to become a successful candidate; however, it is important that you have had prior coursework in data analytics and/or statistics or prior work experience in data analysis. We expect that you have strong verbal and written skills. Finally, you must possess a strong work ethic and the willingness to take responsibility for your own learning.

Requirements:

  • Good knowledge of Excel and SQL
  • Knowledge of big data and/or analytics technologies
  • Experience in Forecasting

On offer is the opportunity to work with a leading global research-based pharmaceutical company committed to providing innovative treatments and devices that make a difference in the quality of care every day to our patients.


To apply for this job go to: www.novonordisk.recruitmenthub.com.au.

Applications close 23 May 2017.
No agencies please.

"

title: Asset Engineer Condition
description:
b"
  • Deemed 'Fit for the Future' as a stand-alone Council
  • Permanent Full Time position including a 19 day four week cycle + access to a leaseback vehicle
  • Dynamic small team working in a friendly environment

Council is seeking a confident, motivated, enthusiastic and experienced Asset Engineer Condition to work as part of a small dynamic work team.

About the role
The Asset Engineer Condition is required to develop, maintain and implement the Condition Assessment and Data Collection Strategy for roads and Drainage infrastructure assets. As the successful applicant you will also be required to manage the Pavement Management System for Council and ensure that outputs support informed decision making.
Salary for this position is based on skills, experience and qualifications and will range from $78,982pa to $91,619pa + super.

About You
This is a 'fast paced' work environment and in addition to being multi-skilled, holding the relevant qualifications and being a team player you must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Degree or equivalent qualifications in Civil Engineering
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in construction & maintenance of road and drainage assets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in asset management including condition assessments and capital works program development relating to road and drainage assets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in manage a Pavement Management System (preferably SMEC).
  • Demonstrated experience in contract management.
  • Demonstrated high level or oral and written communication skills to manage relationships with staff, customers and stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated high level of computer literacy and experience with Microsoft Office suite.
  • Demonstrated understanding of WH&S and traffic control requirements.
  • Current NSW Drivers Licence (Class C)

About us
Located in the Southern Highlands, Wingecarribee Shire Council is within comfortable travelling distance of Sydney, Canberra, the South Coast and the Illawarra. With four distinct and stunning seasons combined with glorious countryside rich in biodiversity and appeal, it's an enviable lifestyle location.

To Apply
To apply for this position please visit www.wsc.nsw.gov.au (Careers @ Council) to view the position description. Please complete the online application process by submitting your resume and a covering letter outlining your background, interest in and suitability for the position. Applicants are also required to address the selection criteria (Essential and Desirable Criteria) by demonstrating that your claims against each of the criteria outlined in the Position Description.

Please note: the online process allows for three items to be uploaded i.e. Covering Letter, Resume and your claims against the Selection Criteria. Only candidates with the right to work in Australia will be considered for the position. Further information can be obtained by contacting Mr Stace Lewer 0408 626 377.


Closing date for applications is Monday 22 May 2017

"

title: Software Engineer | Java| NodeJS| API| | REST| Machine Learning| AI| Analytics
description:
b'Software Engineer | Java| NodeJS| API| | REST| Machine Learning| AI| Analytics ***Mutiple roles***

title: HTML5 Front End Developer
description:
b'

Currently seeking a HTML5 Front End Developer for a new greenfield project. You will provide the skills necessary to implement the desired user experience using HTML5 technologies and the Angular 2+ framework. The role will also include pitching UX ideas to best present concepts to the user, and provide a snappy and responsive experience for a data intensive real time application.

\xc2\xa0

The position is for a fixed term duration of 12 month, with the possibility of ongoing employment depending on the success of the project. Primarily the job will be at Frenchs Forest\xc2\xa0with occasional visits to our Redfern office.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

To be successful in this role you will have demonstrated experience with good understanding of HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Node.js and Angular 2+.

\xc2\xa0

Other desirable experience that you may have include Redux, React.js, javascript build tools (grunt, gulp), working with real-time data, working with APIs, Typescript, Git, and front end frameworks like Bootstrap.

\xc2\xa0

We are looking for Sydney based applicants with Australian Citizenship or permanent residence.

'

title: Sales & Leasing, Marketing Administrator
description:
b"

At Hills Commercial, our people enjoy the stability of working in a firmly established independent commercial real estate group. A position has become available for a Sales & Leasing, Marketing Administrator to join our professional and successful team.

Some of your key responsibilities will include:\xc2\xa0

  • Preparation of sale transaction documents.
  • Preparation of lease transaction documents.
  • Recording the progress of transactions and closing sales and leasing deals.
  • Creation of marketing campaigns, budgets and invoicing.
  • Provide data and reports to assist sales and leasing team.
  • Organise and scheduling of sales and leasing meetings.
  • Inputting and maintenance of sales and leasing properties.
  • Preparation of appraisal letters, submissions and information memorandums.
  • Maintenance of agency marketing.

This role will report to our General Manager and will support the management of all aspects of our office/s as part of our Administration Services team.

To be successful in this role, you will require:

  • Friendly nature and mature minded
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft applications \xe2\x80\x93 Word, Power Point & Excel
  • Experience managing databases
  • Refined personal presentation is required
  • 12 months' minimum administration experience
  • Live within proximity of Norwest and/or the Hills District
  • An understanding of exceptional client care
  • Demonstrated experience in administration support duties
  • Superior organisational skills

The ideal candidate will have experience within a real estate agency or an interest in Commercial Property. You will have excellent communication and presentation skills and be self-motivated. You will enjoy a fun working environment where results matter. In addition to a friendly team, your will benefit from excellent company systems and support.

\xc2\xa0

Apply now by clicking the button below, or for further information please contact Darren Richards on (02) 9680 9200 for a confidential discussion.

"

title: Networking Team Leader  Managed Services
description:
b"Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?

\xc2\xa0If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.

We\xe2\x80\x99re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades \xe2\x80\x94 and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you will be working with teams across the world. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.

Due to promotion, we are currently looking for a Networking Team Leader \xe2\x80\x93 Managed Services to support the business in achieving its strategic objectives.

The Associate MS Manager is an entry-level position in the MS Management job family and operates at low levels of complexity. They work closely with a variety of department heads to assist with the highest level of client satisfaction and the successful continuance of business operations within Dimension Data. Through assisting with the planning, building and supporting of technology solutions.

What we expect you to do:
  • Develop client service policies, procedures and standards and engage with clients to discuss possible improvements to client service.
  • Drive the profitability of all projects and operational services and ensure the delivery of contractual obligations within budget and the agreed time.
  • Promptly resolve complaints and major incidents and identify and develop a feedback, complaints and problem solving procedure to ensure proactive incident management.
  • Analyse statistics and other data to determine the level of client service provided and ensure distribution of the information to the relevant stakeholders.
  • Maintain records and statistics on client correspondence, problem solving and other relevant operational information.
  • Administer IT site infrastructure including the information technology site plan, quality of hardware installations and the identification of potential information technology problem areas.
  • Provide operational support including the effective and efficient allocation and utilisation of resources to projects and operational services and ensure that approved configurations are in place.
  • Identify user and employee training requirements and deliver training on relevant information technology aspects.
  • Compile and distribute reports and make recommendations for service improvement.
  • Effectively manage a team, their resources, development and overall performance
Here's what we are looking for in candidates for this job:
  • Experience as a\xc2\xa0 Managed Services Team Leader in a complex IT environment
  • Strong understanding of Network troubleshooting
  • Technical understanding of internetworking technologies
  • Problem solving and trend analysis
  • Service Management transition projects to/from IT outsourcer (desirable)
  • Any experience in other ITIL functions would also be advantageous
\xc2\xa0
Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Diversity in Dimension Data
We have a global culture that embraces diversity. Dimension Data respects the diverse experiences and individual beliefs of its employees. As such, Dimension Data is committed to an inclusive workplace for all and we\xe2\x80\x99re proud to provide equal employment opportunities for all qualified applicants.

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Kirsty Page on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 226426. "

title: Customer Service Officer (Appliance Spare Parts)
description:
b'

Customer Service Officer (Appliance Spare Parts)

The Stove Connection is seeking an experienced full time Customer Service Officer to join our team based in Hillsdale. Our company is an industry leader, providing appliance spare parts for most major brands, throughout Australia and internationally for over 40 years.

Reporting to management, you will be responsible for assisting the spare parts team to provide clients and customers with information on spare parts

The successful candidate will have an exceptional customer service background with strong communication skills, be highly organised and be looking for a long term career in the company.

Key responsibilities
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Responsible for answering telephones and sorting of customer enquiries
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Entering all customer orders

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Strong Data Entry skills with a high level of accuracy
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Strong computer literacy
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Career minded, enthusiastic and motivated team player
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Solutions focused and customer service mentality
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Have a passion for technical details and ability to read technical drawings\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0

If you are interested in a long-term career with a stable family-owned company that values its people please forward your CV to our general manager: info@stoveconnection.com.au

title: SaaS Security Vendor - Channel Account Manager
description:
b'

Are you a great Sales Rep. used to working with Channel Partners but can also sell direct to corporate clients, with experience of SaaS/cloud based security software looking to travel in the southern regions of Australia as well as New Zealand working with a named territoy for a global software vendor?

If you are looking for a real opportunity to be a client facing BDM selling SaaS/Cloud based software then this job could be for you!

We are looking for a candidate with excellent sales and closing skills who has the confidence and panache to undertake client facing presentations on client sites and who is happy travelling 50% of the time across a Southern Australian territory as well as New Zealand. Your main client base will be Managed Service Providers, MSPs. You must understand the business & process requirements of being successful with security solution/compliance sales & have a proven track record of sales success.

Globally recognised, this Software Vendor has an outstanding history of delivering award-winning, best of breed IT security solutions for consumers, small businesses and enterprise corporate clients. The Company continues to develop innovative security & privacy protection products for Internet peace of mind including anti-virus & parental control applications.

This Company is widely recognised for setting the technology standard by focusing on research & development. The Company has recently created new product offerings so expansion in the marketplace means they need to grow their Sales function in Sydney.

The role:

  • Build and maintain an in-depth knowledge of the Company\xe2\x80\x99s products, partners & markets
  • Qualify all prospects against company criteria for increased chances of sales closure
  • Establish relationships with targeted MSP\xe2\x80\x99s & generate sales revenue with new customers that ensures achievement of assigned sales quotas & targets
  • Generate your own leads & create new target clients (MSP\xe2\x80\x99s) using various direct methods such as calling & face to face meetings, as well as indirect methods such as attending tradeshows & undertaking other demand generation activities as needed
  • Develop & maintain territory plans which show pipeline forecasting
  • Manage all aspects of 360-degree sales cycle
  • Management reporting of sales activity with identification of key accounts


To be successful in this role, you must have the following essential criteria:

  • 2 or 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience selling security software solutions with Channel Partners (SaaS, anti-virus, web security, firewalls & intrusion detection)
  • A successful track record of over achievement with experience selling in a territory in Australia
  • Strong closing & sales negotiation skills
  • Technical awareness & knowledge of multiple software platforms related to Security solutions, competitors & market landscapes are preferred
  • First class communication skills both written and verbal with excellent product presentation skills
  • Management & execution of a sales pipeline to include generating your own leads to gain new MSPs
  • A team player with experience working with other internal resources to get the deal across the line
  • A proven track record of revenue generation via new sales
  • Management of a CRM to manage sales tasks, pipeline and client data
  • The ability to travel Australia-wide for at least 50% of your time

To apply for this job, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, please call Lindsey Morgan on 02 9959 1034 quoting Ref No. #355

'

title: Senior Quality Analyst
description:
b'

Senior Quality Analyst
Sydney

Who are we
We are a tech company that exists to help businesses succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. We believe businesses can do amazing things and it's our job to help them. This is MYOB.

The MYOB way
We simplify, we collaborate, we find new ways to innovate, we set goals, we smash goals and we always make the call. It\xe2\x80\x99s the way we do things around here. We are inspired, authentic, and in the know\xe2\x80\xa6 This is the MYOB Way.

The team
You\xe2\x80\x99ll be part of, and help promote, a diverse and Agile team, building and operating world class services to support our products and clients. Using cutting edge technology, we empower our teams to experiment and innovate when solving important problems for our clients, who are at the centre of everything we do.

The opportunity
You\xe2\x80\x99ll play a pivotal role in ensuring our software is of excellent quality. You have an analytical mind and are not afraid to challenge the status quo. You have a curiosity on how technology and Accounting software are related. Over time you will navigate your way through the features and functions of the MYOB applications.

What you\xe2\x80\x99ll do

  • Ensure quality is built in to all aspects of the product development lifecycle by designing and conducting testing to measure the performance and quality of our products
  • Gain a thorough understanding of the client\xe2\x80\x99s business and gather, analyse, refine and communicate requirements, including functions, process and workflow
  • Design, build and execute test plans and test cases, both manual and automated, using Agile methodologies
  • Perform hands-on software testing including functional, data integrity, performance, integration and regression testing
  • Work closely with your testing peers improving skills in the use of automated tools
  • Collaborate as a member of a cross-functional team and as part of the broader business

What you\xe2\x80\x99ll bring

  • Proven commercial experience as a Quality Analyst or Tester
  • Experience with quality assurance approaches and techniques, including test planning, test automation, TDD, functional and non-functional testing and exploratory testing
  • Experience with Relational Databases
  • Good understanding of Agile and different methodologies, such as Scrum, Kanban and Lean
  • Ability to establish relationships and demonstrate stakeholder management skills
  • Understanding of cloud solutions and cloud deployment is a plus
  • Detail oriented and meticulous

If you want to work in an environment where collaboration is key, your opinion is valued and your ideas can make a difference, you need to work at MYOB.

Apply now! We look forward to meeting you.

'

title: Account Executive
description:
b'
  • End to end management of key clients across the business
  • Market leading face to face engagement agency
  • Work intimately with key clients/retailers across Australia

Our Company

Extravert is the merger of demoplus, Australia's original face to face marketing agency connecting brands with consumers and creative agency Artel.

We form part of the Blueprint Group which employees more than 2,500 people Australia wide, providing sales, marketing, sampling and data management services to Australia's largest retailers.

We offer a fun and engaging work environment assisting some of the most recognisable retail brands in the FMCG market, where you will be provided with continuous training and support

\xc2\xa0

About the Role

Our\xc2\xa0Account Executive\xc2\xa0role based in our Artarmon\xc2\xa0office is pivotal to the success of the relationships we have with our key clients, working across both in-store activations, experiential and events plus a number of smaller in-store only accounts.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage assigned accounts ensuring that all activation are delivered on time, on budget and in line with expectations
  • Actively seek and develop opportunities for organic growth with assigned clients and opportunities for new clients
  • Work with Client Strategy Director to prepare annual business plan for key clients (Plan and manage agreed business portfolio according to a developed account strategy by completing quarterly account reviews and implementing actions.
  • Develop strong client relationships with multiple client/agency contact points
  • Oversee client relationships with reports, attending meetings where appropriate to provide more senior input for the client and training opportunities

\xc2\xa0

Your Profile

Your energy, enthusiasm for success and commercial acumen will define you. With a solid selling track record preferably in an FMCG environment, you will be a motivated self-starter, love cutting a deal and driving for a sales number.

\xc2\xa0

You will be great with people, numbers and have an ability to use sales data, software and field management technology to create insights used to influence key accounts and sales outcomes. \xc2\xa0

You will be results drive, thrive in a fast paced environment, work well both autonomously and within a broader team, and enjoy the challenge that a complex product and brand range brings.

\xc2\xa0

Applications

If you are passionate about sales, and have the skills to support the role on offer, click on the "Apply" link.

'

title: RTO Manager/Trainer and Assessor
description:
b'

RTO Manager/Trainer and Assessor

The RTO Manager will be a key role in establishing a new enterprise which is entering the Australian market. This will be an extremely exciting and challenging role and will have full exposure to activities to do with establishing a new business.

The key responsibilities of this role will be:

  • Implementing the Strategic Business Plan to establish the new business and commence the initial set up of the organisation

  • Creating and maintaining strong links to industry and professional bodies to ensure the RTO's training and assessment strategies reflect best practice and meet the needs of the industry

  • To select and develop trainers and assessors to provide a high quality learning experience for students.

  • Schedule training delivery including assessing the resource needs for an effective timetable.

  • Review student progress during the delivery of a qualification ensuring that all students are up to date by liaising with trainers

  • Ensure the timely dissemination of information to VET trainers and contractors of any changes of curriculum or units within the qualifications

  • In conjunction with the CEO liaise with business and other relevant stakeholders promoting training opportunities, reviewing course content and promoting facilities available to ensure maximum usage and program development growth

  • In conjunction with the CEO review related education policies and procedures as required

  • Prepare and submit timely AVETMISS and RTO compliance reports

  • Management of day to day operations of training, quality assurance and compliance

  • Ensure that the courses offered meet the requirements of the endorsed national training package.

  • Engage with key external and internal stakeholders to strategically explore the growth opportunities for the RTO

  • Oversee the collection, completion and distribution of student data for the Student Management System by ensuring trainers maintain accurate and secure, up to date records of student details, achievements, attendance and information release forms

  • Manage and identify risk across the RTO operations

  • To attend moderation and validation meetings and support other trainers to attend these meetings according to their position descriptions

  • Encourage, foster and actively support the development of an effective team in the organisation

  • To encourage participation in the development of the organization through staff meetings, planning activities and day-to-day operational discussions

  • Prepare a monthly report for CEO

  • Conduct team meetings on a regular basis.

  • Actively participate in the planning, development and review of systems, services and facilities

  • Represent the business at relevant forums, meetings and training sessions as required

  • Maintain confidentiality and privacy at all times

Essential criteria include:

  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40110) or equivalent.

  • Proven industry experience in business/business administration

  • Proven industry experience in delivering classroom based training

  • Necessary business qualifications preferably a Diploma of Business or equivalent

The successful candidate should have:

  • Prior experience in managing RTO's that undertake CRICOS courses

  • Have a passion for education and training

  • Significant demonstrated experience in compliance, development and operational management of adult education and training programs

  • Strong interpersonal skills

  • High level of interpersonal and relationship building skills

  • Certificate IV in Workplace Training & Assessment as a minimum qualification

  • Preferred knowledge of Business training package

For information on this role, including details of the remuneration package, please contact hr.metroinstitute@gmail.com

\xc2\xa0

'

title: QA / Data Tester - Sydney
description:
b'Company
\xc2\xa0
Nationally recognized leader in the online / E-Commerce industry
\xc2\xa0
The Department

The data & analytics team is responsible for building and maintaining insights and reporting solutions from all data collected across the company, as well as building interfaces to downstream systems and services for analytics and forecasting.
\xc2\xa0
This is a great position for an enthusiastic and talented junior, looking to move toward a data analyst, BI and or big data position.

The Role

\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities:

  • Providing specialist input, direction, and support for change readiness and release planning and execution

Your Skills:

  • Experience with dashboard/reporting tools, Tableau and/or Business Objects preferable\xc2\xa0
  • Experience working in an Agile manner is preferred
  • Experience of Single Customer View (across consumer and business) in Australia would be advantageous
  • Any experience with Big Data would be advantageous

Apply now to the link below. \xc2\xa0For more information you can contact Martin Fletcher on \xc2\xa0martin.fletcher@perigongroup.com.au
'

title: Senior Credit Risk Analytics
description:
b"

Senior Credit Risk Analytics job role based at a leading international bank in Sydney CBD

Your new company
This company are a global bank based in Sydney CBD offering a wide range of retail to institutional banking solutions, within a thriving working environment offering excellent global career opportunities.


Your new role
Within this newly role created role, you will undertake the below tasks:

  • Work collaboratively with the unsecured credit risk team on products such as cards and loans to provide risk related analytics around the banks Portfolios
  • You will use SAS for data mining and looking for trends, analysis and monitoring to grow the portfolio within the banks' risk appetite
  • Produce monthly and quarterly reports to senior management
  • Proactively identify areas of high risk and opportunities within the portfolios with processes and policy analysis to enhance the profitability of the portfolios
  • Assist in the ongoing enhancement of all automated credit decisioning systems and strategies implemented by the bank.
  • Analyse data and identify any emerging risks to senior management and support risk initiatives for credit policies, scorecards, APRA regulatory returns.
  • Support new product initiatives, risk projects and any future regulatory changes.
  • Ensure that bank guidelines and procedures are adhered to and that best practise techniques are introduced where appropriate.



What you'll need to succeed

  • Tertiary qualifications, in subjects such as Statistics, Mathematics, Commerce, Quantitative or Computing related discipline
  • Experience in credit risk with an understanding of statistical based decisioning systems
  • Solid experience in SAS programming/analytics and MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Strong attention to detail and an Analytical mindset
  • Excellent communication, organisation and time management skills
  • Be able to work independently and have an aptitude for quantitative analysis
  • Exposure to IFRS9 would be desirable.



What you'll get in return
An excellent new head count permanent opportunity to work for a global bank in Sydney that offers excellent career prospects and offers a thriving and flexible working environment.

What you need to do now
If you feel you fit the criteria and are interested in the role, please click \xe2\x80\x98apply now\xe2\x80\x99 or contact Philip Lewis on 02 8226 9752 or email your CV to philip.lewis@hays.com.au

title: Supervisor - Bookings and Customer Service Team
description:
b"

Supervisor - Bookings and Customer Service Team

  • Well established family company

  • Supervising team of six

  • Customer focussed role

  • Opportunity to improve productivity

About our Company

KK Technical Services (KKTS) is a mid-size family company that operates in a unique position within the Australian printer and photocopier market. Specialising in the delivery and installation of enterprise level printers and photocopiers, KKTS works with many of Australia's largest companies in the print industry.

An exciting opportunity now exists to join the company in the Service Delivery Team in a supervisory role.

Job Description

This role is a supervisory role providing Customer Service and managing bookings in a high volume and fast paced environment where the ability to lead the team, learn quickly, prioritise workloads, think on your feet and multi task is essential. The role is responsible for the customer service process from start to finish. The ability to make decisions, problem solve and operate autonomously is essential, as is previous supervisory or management experience. This is a supervisory role with a strong hands on element.

Your duties and responsibilities will include:

  • Providing leadership and direction to the team
  • Motivating and managing the team towards meeting KPI's and providing exceptional customer service
  • Providing training for new and existing team members
  • Daily interaction with internal and external stakeholders
  • Handling all queries professionally and as promptly as possible
  • Accurate and timely data entry of key information into the company's operating systems
  • Sending, receiving and processing documentation
  • Making bookings with third party providers and following progress to completion
  • Ensuring the correct documentation and data is provided both internally and externally
  • Working with the team to resolve issues and complete tasks
  • Developing and fostering ongoing customer relationships
  • General administrative duties

You will be trained in all aspects of the role. You must be able to work in a busy environment whilst handling queries with care, professionalism and efficiency, maintaining a high level of attention to detail.

What's On Offer

KKTS will offer a competitive package between $70000 and $80000 per annum commensurate with experience coupled with the opportunity to shape and develop your career in an expanding Australian family company.

To apply please send your resume and covering letter to jobs@kkc.com.au.


\xc2\xa0

"

title: National Systems Coordinator

Baiada is a privately owned Australian Company providing premium quality poultry products throughout Australia. At Baiada Poultry our primary objective is to provide our customers with the highest quality products and excellent service.

Baiada are seeking to fill the position of a National Systems Coordinator to drive improvement of Baiada's current systems which aligns with workflows and best practices so that we can deliver compliance to standards and exceed customer expectations. \xc2\xa0This role will be located at our Pendle Hill head office.

This exciting opportunity will suit a candidate that has the drive to focus on continuous improvement and is results driven.\xc2\xa0 In addition, the candidate should possess excellent communication skills with a Food Science background or similar related discipline.\xc2\xa0

Key responsibilities:

  • National reporting of KPI's for the internal Quality Management System
  • Drive further improvements with data base systems and with other Baiada internal programs to improve efficiencies in data capturing and analysis
  • Site support for management systems, designing/maintaining process control forms to represent current workflows and improve operational efficiencies
  • Manage implementation of internal Document Management System across the business
  • Drive the implementation of the vendor management program with key stakeholders
  • Support training of staff for SME's at each processing site
  • Preparing technical material for business review meetings with key customers
  • Support the Customer Service team with the aim of delivering high levels of customer service levels
  • Drive regulatory compliance through focusing on continuous improvement of Baiada systems

Essential skills:

  • Experience with implementation of electronic documentation management systems
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Previous experience in FMCG companies
  • Strong QA background, degree in food science or related discipline
  • Experience with Crystal reports will be an advantage

If you have the skills, experience and desire to be part of a highly motivated team, please apply by selecting the "Apply Now" button quoting position No. B0146-CN\xc2\xa0in the subject line.

Closing Date:\xc2\xa026th May 2017

*No agencies please\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

title: Customer Experience Senior Manager
description:
b"

\xc2\xa0

HomeAway is hiring an Australian Customer Experience Senior Manager focused on delighting our customers by creating a trustworthy marketplace, providing world-class support and relentlessly advocating for customer needs. \xc2\xa0Leading an operationally excellent team, delivering top-notch customer satisfaction and working effectively with key business partners and stakeholders will be critical success criteria for this role. \xc2\xa0The Customer Experience Senior Manager will report directly to the Director of Asia Pacific Customer Experience and will need to work effectively in a matrixed environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage demand forecasting, capacity planning and agent scheduling processes in order to meet service-level and customer satisfaction targets
  • Lead employee development through clear goal setting, training plans, regular coaching and performance reviews
  • Inspire team members toward a culture of customer centricity and continuous improvement
  • Monitor and analyze key metrics and reporting to make sure defined productivity and customer satisfaction service levels are met
  • Regularly review and ensure that policies, procedures and guidelines are being followed
  • Advocate for process and policy changes that improve customer experience and innovate toward simplicity
  • Ensure team members have the tools and training to do their jobs efficiently, advocate for product enhancements, and provide business requirements when changes are needed

  • Assist senior management with special projects, incidents, investigations, escalations, product definition, and training
  • Manage relationships with, and performance of, outside vendors

\xc2\xa0

Skills Required:

  • At least 5 years of managerial experience,ideally across multiple functional areas in services and operations.
  • Ability to interpret information from multiple sources, work with large data sets, and make sound decisions from analysis
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Exemplary communication and leadership skills
  • Demonstrated time management and organizational skills
  • Proven track record of working effectively with remote teams
  • Customer Operations, Quality Assurance, and/or Content Management experience preferred
  • Front-line experience interacting with customers required
  • Experience with CRM systems, WFM tools, and content management tools preferred \xc2\xa0
  • Experience with advanced analytics toolsets preferred.
  • Ability to prioritize responsibilities, multi-task and delegate effectively, and produce both individual and team results.

\xc2\xa0

About Stayz and HomeAway:

Stayz is Australia's leading holiday rental website and part of HomeAway Inc. - a global Expedia Brand with it's head office in Texas with more than 1,200,000 online property rental listings. Millions of travelers visit HomeAway and Stayz every year and our mission is to make every holiday rental in the world available to every traveler in the world through our unique online marketplace.

Through Stayz, homeowners and property managers offer an extensive selection of holiday homes that provide travelers with memorable experiences, including more room to relax with friends and loved ones for less cost than traditional hotel accommodation.

Stayz, HomeAway and Expedia are committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color,religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.

title: Research Services Coordinator
description:
b'

APJ Research Services Coordinator

  • Work for a Global Software company

A Global Software company focusing on Customer Experience and Employee Insights. They have had a massive expansion in the US and then Europe and now they have set up an office in Sydney CBD and after recruiting a sales force they are now focusing on growing their Research services team.

They currently have an opportunity for a Research services coordinator to join their company. It is an excellent opportunity for someone with a Market Research background who loves Client facing roles to work with leading Australian Brands to best utilise their products. They have an excellent benefit program in place and provide a fun, energetic workplace. They are one of the only companies that has 50% growth year on year so it is a great opportunity to be a part of their continuing success and to fast track your career.

They are looking for someone with a Market Research background, ideally within Customer Experience, who loves the client aspect of research and is looking to move away from the more traditional research roles. The position is a high profile, they have some very large client wins and you must feel confident in meeting and presenting senior staff (including CEO's) within these organisations.

As a coordinator, working closely to collaborate with the sales team, clients and internal team, your responsibilities will be:

  • Guide clients to make data driven decisions to improve client brief requirements, including updates to live projects and feedback

  • Interrogating surveys to communicate any relevant useful information to the business/client
  • Build and maintain relationships with current clients,
  • Assist in the project management of research studies including survey program testing, data processing delivery, fieldwork monitoring, project debriefs etc.

You will have:

  • Circa 1+ years' experience in Market Research,
  • Bachelor's degree with strong academic performance,

  • Experience in managing and driving clients to achieve business results,
  • Professionalism, maturity, hungry for results,
  • Customer obsessed, going above and beyond to provide customer satisfaction,

  • Hard working, high attentional to detail and results driven

My client have an excellent benefit program in place and provide a fun, energetic workplace. This is a work hard play hard environment.

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
b'

Roles and Responsibilities

Executive Support

Completes a broad variety of administrative tasks for the CEO including:

  • Managing an active calendar of appointments;
  • Composing and preparing correspondence that is confidential;
  • Oversees approval requests in line with the DFA and reporting lines;
  • Organising workshops for the CEO & Senior Management Team
  • Arranging complex and detailed travel plans, itineraries, and agendas; and compiling documents for travel-related meetings;
  • Booking travel through the companies frequent flyer programs
  • Plans, coordinates and ensures the CEO's schedule is followed and respected;
  • Provides "gatekeeper" and "gateway" role, creating win-win situations for direct access to the CEO's time and office;
  • Facilitates monthly committee meetings; takes minutes and follows-up on key deliverables
  • Communicates directly, and on behalf of the CEO, with Board members, staff, and others, on matters related to CEO's program of initiatives.
  • Researches, prioritizes, and follows up on incoming issues and concerns addressed to the CEO, including those of a sensitive or confidential nature. Determines appropriate course of action, referral, or response.
  • Provides a bridge for smooth communication between the CEO's office and internal departments; demonstrating leadership to maintain credibility, trust and support with senior management staff.
  • Works closely and effectively with the CEO to keep him well informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities, following up appropriately. Acts as a "barometer," having a sense for the issues taking place in the environment and keeping the CEO updated.
  • Provides leadership to build relationships crucial to the success of the organization, and manages a variety of special projects for the CEO, some of which may have organizational impact.
  • Successfully completes critical aspects of deliverables with a hands-on approach, including drafting acknowledgement letters, personal correspondence, and other tasks that facilitate the CEO's ability to effectively lead the company.
  • Prioritises conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively, and follows-through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.

Senior Management Support and Liaison

  • Serves as the CEO's administrative liaison to the Senior Management
  • Assists Senior Managers with travel arrangements and accommodation
  • Maintains discretion and confidentiality in relationships with all board members
  • Adhere to compliance with applicable rules and regulations set in bylaws regarding board and board committee matters, including advance distribution of materials before meetings in electronic/paper format.

Qualifications

  • Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritise multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders, including staff, board members and external clients
  • High level written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated proactive approaches to problem-solving with strong decision-making capability
  • Emotional maturity
  • Highly resourceful team-player, with the ability to also be extremely effective independently
  • Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion, be adaptable to various competing demands, and demonstrate the highest level of customer/client service and response
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve high performance goals and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Forward looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions

Person Specification

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Required

  • Experience of working at Executive Assistant level with senior management and senior level clients, preferably at Board level
  • Ability to manage complex and highly confidential information
  • Comfortable working autonomously and across multiple tasks and reporting into different project working teams and staff members
  • IT literate with some experience of working in a team in a small charity or company
  • Numerate with the ability to present and analyse data
  • Knowledge of advanced MS office applications, including Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Excellent social skills, able to operate with diplomacy, tact and empathy
  • A high degree of personal organisation and self-management
  • Comfortable when working to tight deadlines, and able to turn work around within a short time span where demands are liable to change at short notice;
  • Ability to think proactively and laterally to maximise opportunities to promote the work of the organization
  • Bachelor's degree
  • Strong work tenure: 3 to 5 years of experience supporting Senior-Level Executives, preferably in an educational environment
  • Experience and interest in internal and external communications, in a multi-cultural environment

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Lead Insights Manager - Breakfast
description:
b'GROW WITH US as you lead and manage the Insights and Planning Breakfast portfolio to ensure pro-active and continuous provision of better business insights and recommendations.\xc2\xa0 Reporting to the Insights, Strategy & Commercial Planning Director, this is a senior role responsible for leading the company\xe2\x80\x99s Breakfast Insights agenda across consumer, shopper, customer and category.
\xc2\xa0
WHAT WILL I BE DOING?

  • Initiating and managing adhoc brand, shopper and innovation research in order to generate consumer, category and customer insights, trends, etc and provide research/fact-driven advice and recommendations\xc2\xa0


  • Strategic expert in understanding the breakfast category, K brands and total business performance through regular review and analysis and then driving the organisation to better decisions and outcomes based on this


  • Translating findings and insights into clear, concise and actionable presentations and written reports to guide business decision making\xc2\xa0

  • Managing and guiding one direct report

WHAT DO I NEED TO DEMONSTRATE?
\xc2\xa0
As well as a hunger to learn, you must be able to meet the following requirements:
\xc2\xa0
Required:


  • Tertiary Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Economics, Quantitative Methods or a related field


  • Previous experience in owning and delivering strategic insights, project plans and partnering with key internal and external stakeholders (ideally within FMCG or allied industry)


  • Solid experience in both qualitative & quantitative research methodology both conventional but also emerging\xc2\xa0 (and a willingness to experiment in new approaches)


  • Solid experience with scan sales and in home panel data (Nielsen, IRI/Aztec, Quantium) in both the analysis and the interpretation


  • Strategic skills in pulling together simple and compelling stories based on insights and analysis


  • Strong communication, persuasion and presentation skills \xe2\x80\x93 confidence in dealing with senior leaders


  • Excellent project and time management skills


  • Excellent leadership and team interaction skills


  • A passion for brands and categories
WHAT ELSE DO I NEED TO KNOW?
If you have the drive, passion and ambition to succeed as a professional within the dynamic FMCG industry then this is the role for you. We are looking for a senior strategic thinker with the ability to partner and drive alignment with cross-functional teams.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, wide ranging employee benefits including half-day Fridays, on-site canteen, parking and product discounts plus great opportunities to grow your career in a fun, flexible team environment.

Kellogg Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer providing an inclusive work environment that involves and embraces the diverse talent of its people.
