title: Senior Advertising Value Manager
description:
b"

The Company

News Corp Australia is the nation's largest media company operating over 150 house-hold name brands across print, digital and multimedia including The Daily and Sunday Telegraph and your local community paper, The Australian and news.com.au. We are proud to be a central part of News Corp, a leading global network of powerful brands in news and information services, sports programming in Australia, digital real estate services, book publishing, digital education and pay-TV distribution in Australia including Fox Sports, Dow Jones, Harper Collins, Realestate.com.au and The Wall Street Journal.

\xc2\xa0

The Role

As the Senior Advertising Value Manager, you will lead the development of News\xe2\x80\x99s long term strategy to optimise revenue outcomes through appropriate packaging and pricing of our advertising products, across Metro, Regional & Community publications. The role will be responsible for using data, research and financial modelling to develop commercial recommendations to maximise the value generated from relationships with our advertising customers.

Working collaboratively with key stakeholders including National and Local Ad Sales, Finance, Technology, Operations, Pricing and Marketing to drive business engagement and capability, which is fundamental to a successful implementation of Advertising Value Management (AVM) change program.

Key accountabilities for the role;

  • Be accountable for commercial recommendations which deliver on the financial targets in the AVM business case (volume, yield, revenue), based on data driven insights and analysis
  • Own and communicate the financial models built by the wider team to evaluate proposed initiatives and determine commercial viability and impacts to the business
  • Using data driven insights to inform a strategy which drives 3 way value \xe2\x80\x93 for News, our advertising customers and our consumers
  • Understand the levers of our business that drive financial performance and how these vary across geography, customer segment, channel, publication, product type etc.
  • Develop strategies for future phases as the market, our company and our customers evolve over the long term
  • Review proposals from the business, providing robust analysis to evaluate the financial impact and make a commercial recommendation
  • Identify and assess new revenue streams and provide strategic decision support on these opportunities
  • Develop team capability with regard to revenue management expertise, research into best practice and product strategy

\xc2\xa0

The Person

News Corp is a complex business operating in a fast moving and ever changing industry. Your strong engagement, influencing, strategic thought process, planning and delivery skills at all levels will be critical to success in this role.

Your intangible skill set will also be complemented with;

  • Experience in a similar position at a senior level in a large organization
  • Proven track record of strategy analysis and revenue management
  • In depth working knowledge of Excel, strong financial modelling skills
  • Passion for driving and delivering complex and large scale change
  • Ability to comfortably work with and advise C-Level executives and their teams
  • Solid understanding of utilizing data and customer insights to deliver tangible commercial outcomes and actionable business cases
  • Experience in leading and managing a high performing team

\xc2\xa0

Join Us

News Corp Australia is evolving in response to the expectations and challenges of the digital world in which we now live. We have an amazing opportunity to reinvent our industry and redefine the future of media in Australia. We are passionate about what we do and proud of our heritage of world-class journalism and entrepreneurial spirit. Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.

\xc2\xa0

Please submit your CV or Linkedin profile to be considered for this position. For more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit: www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Assoc Director, Customer Experience
description:
b'

Optus is no longer just a traditional telco, we\xe2\x80\x99ve transformed in to a mobile-led multimedia company that delivers content and experiences like no other. Customer Experience is a top priority for us here at Optus.

About the team

The Customer Experience team is responsible for designing, measuring and improving the customer experience, ensuring translation of the Optus Brand promise into all products & customer touch points and driving a customer centric culture. The team acts as the key transformation interface across front line and business functions to drive significant improvements in customer experience.

About the Opportunity: Associate Director, Customer Experience

An exciting new opportunity has been created within the Customer Experience team for an Associate Director, Customer Experience who will be accountable for improving customers experience at Optus across all of our products and channels, along with delivering improved people experience and business efficiencies.

Want an awesome opportunity to own CX for a critical Journey Segment? With a focus on the Customers and relevant supporting areas of the business, you will determine the key CX metrics, monitor performance of these and develop and lead transformation programs to improve the performance of this segment. You will achieve this in alignment with the CX strategic design and in partnership with business product and channel owners.



With your passion for Customer insights and data you will provide consultation to stakeholders on key CX improvements and business efficiency opportunities. The team will draw on your leadership and expertise in employing detailed analytics, problem solving, Lean Six Sigma and other methodologies. In addition you will scope programs of work, define key problems, identify and implement solutions. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys complex stakeholder management, collaboration, customer journey mapping, process and CX Journey transformation, project delivery and effective change management.

As a leader of this team, you will drive a high performing and engaged team to deliver step change improvements in the CX of your journey segment and where required coach and mentor trainee LSS Blackbelts & Greenbelts through to certification.







About the Candidate






  • Our ideal candidate is a People Leader with a Master Black Belt who has extensive experience in business operations, leading large change projects within Consulting, large customer centric service organisations or similar dynamic and matrix environment.
  • You will have demonstrated success in driving financial results employing your technical mastery of process improvement methodologies specifically Six Sigma and Lean tools including DMAIC and DFSS and Customer Centred Design principles
  • As a lead instructor and communication skills second to none you will have the ability to coach and lead other Green belts and Black belts in the team through project completions.
  • Your ability to influence a varied stakeholder group will be a key ingredient to your success
  • Direct experience in using consulting and diagnostic techniques to understand business issues and make recommendations for improvement

Why Optus?

Optus offers you a wide range of benefits that will enrich your personal and professional life. From on-site health and wellbeing specialists, financial advisers, corporate discounts, gym, groceries, laundry and child care services on site we bring convenience to you.


#LI-GD

'

title: Digital Account Manager (Adtech/ Programmatic)
description:
b"The Company
Multi award winning, data-driven, marketing technology company with a global leading proprietary media buying and campaign management/optimisation platform (DSP/DMP), are looking to bring on board two talented Account Managers.
\xc2\xa0
The Role
The role of the Account Manager is to act as the conduit between the sales and operations functions to ensure the highest possible standard of execution for their clients. The Account Manager is suited to someone who aspires to make the transition from campaign management into client services or sales, especially as there is an opportunity for the right person to take on responsibility for small independent agencies and direct clients.
\xc2\xa0
Success Criteria
To be successful as Account Manager it comes down to someone with a combination of the right attitude, drive to learn and ambition, and someone who has a proven ability to build strong relationships with a broad set of clients and personality types.
\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities
  • Providing pre-and post-sales support to the Sales Managers and Directors
  • Liaising with clients through the lifecycle of their campaigns to deliver service excellence and retained business
  • Build strong relationships and evangalise my clients business within small independent agencies and direct clients to deliver against set targets
  • Generating reports for internal use and for clients during and post campaign
  • Responding to client requests or troubleshooting campaign and/or technical issues in a timely manner
  • Campaign analysis during and post to make recommendations to Ops and to clients that will ensure the best possible outcome and results
  • Campaign set up - IO's, pixel creation, segment creation etc.
\xc2\xa0
What you'll bring:
  • Proven track record in online campaign management and/or account management
  • Experience working with online advertising platforms in a digital operations function
  • Highly effective time management skills and ability to support multiple stakeholders, in particular supporting sales people
  • Experience working directly with media agencies
  • Knowledge of programmatic trading concepts and technology
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to all audiences
"

title: Key Account Manager - Video Gaming Publisher
description:
b'Big Wave Digital is pumped! We are so thrilled to have the pleasure of working with this leading video gaming specific publisher. With established partnerships across the Globe, these guys are on an upward trajectory to be the biggest game changer in the Australian video gaming industry.\xc2\xa0 Still in their infancy, they are absolutely smashing it and transforming the way Brands think about advertising.\xc2\xa0

We are on the hunt for a Key Account Manager to take ownership of a media agency portfolio across Sydney. You'll be responsible for educating your clients on the video gaming industries rise and infiltration into all parts of life, from VR, ESports to education, then selling digital advertising solutions and integrated partnerships to help shoot their brands recognition through the roof.

"Your mission, should you choose to accept it":
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build credible, lasting and profitable relationships with your agency partners
\xe2\x80\xa2 Educating your clients on the video gamers rise to all parts of life, and building innovative, cutting edge pitches that knock the socks of your buyers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Selling digital advertising solutions (display, video, social, mobile) and partnerships
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project managing the implementation of campaigns through local and international affiliate sites
\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing data and insights reports back to your clients on audience reach and results\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0"
I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse":
\xe2\x80\xa2 What's in it for you? A chance to be a key contributor within a game changing start up business.
\xe2\x80\xa2 The opportunity to learn all aspects of the video gaming industry and be mentored by the very best in the business
\xe2\x80\xa2 Whilst there is expectation on commercial growth and owning a revenue target, there is absolute autonomy for you to get there in your own way or process
\xe2\x80\xa2 Passion for learning? These guys will allow for you to put your digital passions to good use, whether that be in content, social, marketing, digital strategy, operations\xc2\xa0 - the sky is the limit
\xe2\x80\xa2 Love gaming? Access to the newest gaming technology, plus some awesome retro machines in the office, where you can play freely with your equally obsessed colleagues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Open planned warehouse style offices fostering creativity, social banter, knowledge sharing and a lot of fun.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Pretty dam impressive commission structures, which by the way are uncapped!

\xc2\xa0"Do I feel lucky?' Well, do ya, punk?"
\xe2\x80\xa2 Do you have established digital media account management experience?
\xe2\x80\xa2 Have you worked within a fast paced digital media or digital publishing business?
\xe2\x80\xa2 Do you have proven experience managing media agency accounts and existing connections in the agency networks?
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience project managing campaign implementations?
\xe2\x80\xa2 Commercially focused, with proven account growth and retention background?

\xc2\xa0Video Gamers are spreading to be part of most brands core audience, so we are looking for a passionate Key Account Manger to change the way brands think, we need you to support Brands to reach this untapped audience and have a lot of fun whilst you're doing it. \xc2\xa0Send your application to Dayna Stewart | Head of Digital & Data Recruitment | Big Wave Digital | dayna@bigwavedigital.com.au | www.bigwavedigital.com.au '

title: Marketing Communications - Industrial Manufacturer - Western Sydney

title: Advisor, Human Resources
description:
b'

Overview

The $8.3 billion Sydney Metro Northwest is Australia's largest public transport infrastructure project currently under construction and a priority rail project for the NSW Government. It will be the first fully-automated rapid transit rail system in Australia.

As part of the Northwest Rapid Transit Infrastructure Joint Venture, the two partners CPB Contractors and John Holland Group have collaborated to deliver world-class rapid transit services, which will provide customers with a safe, high quality, reliable, efficient and affordable public transport solution and meet the specified performance requirements on a whole-of-life basis.

Based in Castle Hill, our People Team is seeking another member to be a part of this iconic project delivering state of the art design and innovative technology for Sydney's future.

Job Description

  • Partner with internal stakeholders to deliver a high level of HR and Resourcing support
  • Assist with and manage Performance Management issues in your area of responsibility
  • Assist with succession planning and talent management across the project.
  • Support the HR team with the ongoing maintenance and implementation of HR policies, processes and programs
  • Contribute to the strategic direction of the HR function
  • Provide data, information, and reports related to human resource activities to support continuous improvement

The ideal applicant will have:

  • Degree or Post-secondary school training or TAFE certificate in HR, Business or other associated disciplines
  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment
  • 4-5 years' experience in a Human Resources role
  • Ability to solve problems and identify process improvement
  • Knowledge of employment legislation, including government policy
  • Experience in HR project work, leading an initiative or desired outcome
  • Experience working in a fast paced, service focused HR team
  • Process-oriented with excellent attention to detail

What's on Offer?

At North West Rapid Transit our project team work hard, and continuously strive for improvement. As a part of the team, you will receive the following;

  • An opportunity to be part of an iconic project team, who are delivering this world class complex rail system to Sydney.
  • Exposure to experts and leading professionals in the engineering and construction industry.
  • An opportunity to work in a fast-paced collaborative and creative environment, supporting various organisations and the NSW Government.
  • Fantastic career development opportunities.

If this sounds like you, don't waste time and apply below.

Please note: this role is being sourced through Northwest Rapid Transit directly and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies.

'

title: Inventory Analyst
description:
b"

Inventory Analyst

Fisher & Paykel Appliances design, manufacture and market a full range of domestic appliances. We are a global company built on a heritage of innovation and pioneering spirit that has seen us consistently deliver products tailored to our customers' needs since 1934.

We know we've got the best products in the market, but our continued success relies upon us having effective inventory management to ensure the best commercial outcomes for the business. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

That's where you come in\xe2\x80\xa6.

We need a high achieving Inventory Analyst who knows their stuff and has a proven record of success to join our National Sales team in Macquarie Park, Sydney.

Reporting to the Inventory & Demand Planning Team Leader, you'll be responsible for managing the in-market inventory for the Retail, Commercial and Air Conditioning teams including;

  • Monitor and control stock movements in all branch plants across the Australian Business.
  • Provide the business with reports giving visibility into F&P and customer warehouse stock levels.
  • Hold regular inventory meetings with sales, finance and demand planning teams identifying excess stock levels, obsolete stock runout plans and new product introduction timelines.
  • Regular review of stock levels with the global team.
  • Setting up new products within JDE at branch plant level.
  • Participate in weekly global scheduling meetings, feeding back information to senior management in relation to air freight costs associated with components used to build finished goods and potential gaps in supply due factory constraints.

You will be a crucial interface between the supply chain and Sales teams. \xc2\xa0Your involvement in continuous improvement of processes will be highly valued in this team and your analysis and reports will impact on key decision making within the business.

So that's us. What about you?

You'll have proven experience as in supply chain, ideally within a consumer goods or retail environment. \xc2\xa0You'll be capable of managing complexity in high pressure situations and be able to effectively communicate meaningful information to different functions of the business in a confident and articulate manner.

With proven analytical capability, you'll thrive in providing commercially focused business insights. \xc2\xa0You'll have strong experience in the implementation of systems and processes and planning along with data management & reporting.\xc2\xa0 Goal and delivery focused, you'll seek continual optimisation and have the ability to make effective decisions.

Strong Microsoft Excel skills are highly desired along with expertise in statistical modelling and 3-5 years' experience working in supply chain team.\xc2\xa0

This is a fantastic opportunity for a progressive individual who is looking to take their career to the next level in a truly premium organisation, apply online now!

"

title: Accounts/Payroll Officer - Cromer
advertiser: Esray Pumps Pty. Ltd. a PSGDover Company
description:
b"

Ebsray Pumps, part of the global PSG-Dover company, is a leading Australian designer, manufacturer and exporter of specialised Industrial Pumps and related Pumping Equipment to a worldwide market.\xc2\xa0Ebsray's experience in the industrial pumping space coupled with the recent successes in the LPG industry, military equipment refueling systems and bulk potable water transfer has confirmed the company's ability to adapt its products and manufacturing capability to the world markets.

Please note: This is a fixed term 12 month maternity leave replacement contract.

The\xc2\xa0Accounts/Payroll Officer\xc2\xa0will be responsible for performing the day to day processing of the AP/AR\xc2\xa0transactions and preparation of weekly and monthly payroll. \xc2\xa0

Working with a supportive and experienced Finance Manager, you will:

  • Maintain supplier records/information and ensure that data is entered and stored correctly
  • Entering and processing invoice payments
  • Calculate daily hours worked and leave applications\xc2\xa0for weekly payroll
  • Prepare and arrange weekly and monthly payroll with ADP for external processing
  • Reconcile the bank account
  • Month end payroll report and payroll tax calculation\xc2\xa0for ADP+

On a personal level, the incumbent will possess:

  • A high level of professionalism
  • Above average interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to work as part of a team and be able to maintain confidentiality.\xc2\xa0
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Oracle experience is highly regarded

This is a very busy and diverse role, suited to a self-motivated individual who can work autonomously as well as within a team environment.

This is a diverse, fast paced manufacturing environment \xe2\x80\x93 are you up for the challenge?!

Ebsray Pumps Pty Ltd\xc2\xa0 (PSG) will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in Australia.\xc2\xa0 Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a medical examination.


If you are looking for a rewarding and stimulating position, please submit your resume and a covering letter - please click the 'Apply Now' button below.

"

title: Are you an Inside Sales Rep. looking to step-up into a BDM job?
description:
b'

Are you an Inside Sales Rep. with experience of SaaS/cloud based security software looking to step up into a BDM role with a global software vendor?

If you are an aspiring BDM and have done your apprenticeship as an ISR and are looking for a real opportunity to be a client facing BDM selling SaaS/Cloud based software then this job could be for you!

We are looking for a candidate with excellent sales and closing skills who has the confidence and panache to undertake client facing presentations on client sites and who is happy travelling 50% of the time across a Southern Australian territory as well as New Zealand. Your main client base will be Managed Service Providers, MSPs. You must understand the business & process requirements of being successful with security solution/compliance sales & have a proven track record of sales success.

Globally recognised, this Software Vendor has an outstanding history of delivering award-winning, best of breed IT security solutions for consumers, small businesses and enterprise corporate clients. The Company continues to develop innovative security & privacy protection products for Internet peace of mind including anti-virus & parental control applications.

This Company is widely recognised for setting the technology standard by focusing on research & development. The Company has recently created new product offerings so expansion in the marketplace means they need to grow their Sales function in Sydney.

The role:

  • Build and maintain an in-depth knowledge of the Company\xe2\x80\x99s products, partners & markets
  • Qualify all prospects against company criteria for increased chances of sales closure
  • Establish relationships with targeted MSP\xe2\x80\x99s & generate sales revenue with new customers that ensures achievement of assigned sales quotas & targets
  • Generate your own leads & create new target clients (MSP\xe2\x80\x99s) using various direct methods such as calling & face to face meetings, as well as indirect methods such as attending tradeshows & undertaking other demand generation activities as needed
  • Develop & maintain territory plans which show pipeline forecasting
  • Manage all aspects of 360-degree sales cycle
  • Management reporting of sales activity with identification of key accounts


To be successful in this role, you must have the following essential criteria:

  • 2 or 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience selling security software solutions with Channel Partners (SaaS, anti-virus, web security, firewalls & intrusion detection)
  • A successful track record of over achievement with experience selling in a territory in Australia
  • Strong closing & sales negotiation skills
  • Technical awareness & knowledge of multiple software platforms related to Security solutions, competitors & market landscapes are preferred
  • First class communication skills both written and verbal with excellent product presentation skills
  • Management & execution of a sales pipeline to include generating your own leads to gain new MSPs
  • A team player with experience working with other internal resources to get the deal across the line
  • A proven track record of revenue generation via new sales
  • Management of a CRM to manage sales tasks, pipeline and client data
  • The ability to travel Australia-wide for at least 50% of your time

To apply for this job, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, please call Lindsey Morgan on 02 9959 1034 quoting Ref No. #355

'

title: Mobility Developer
description:
b"

HCL Technologies is a global transformational enterprise with significant presence in Australia and New Zealand. Our offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Auckland and Wellington offers an integrated portfolio of services including software-led IT solutions, remote infrastructure management, engineering and R&D services and BPO by leveraging its extensive global offshore infrastructure that impact and redefine the core of our clients' business. For more information, please visit us atwww.hcltech.com\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

You will be responsible for development and delivery of mobile applications (experience in both user interface development and Integration).\xc2\xa0To render assistance to the Mobility Support Specialist in triaging of incidents/problems/exceptions, providing resolutions and implementing changes to the live mobile applications.

title: Expressions of Interest - Talent Fulfillment Analyst
description:
b'

About the business and the role

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions \xe2\x80\x93 underpinned by the world's largest delivery network \xe2\x80\x93 Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 384,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression.
Professionals in our Corporate Functions run and manage Accenture's internal operations and all activities across our business, from finance, HR and legal to workplace management, operations and marketing and communications. They are the engine that powers Accenture, enabling us to provide the capabilities and expertise that clients need to help them become high-performance businesses.

Human Resources professionals develop and execute HR strategies, programs and services across one or more parts of the employee lifecycle to attract, develop and retain a highly engaged and differentiated workforce that enables the execution of human capital and business strategies.

Job Summary:

The Talent Fulfilment Specialist (TFS) is part of the Talent Supply Chain organization under GU HR Business Service Delivery.

Job tasks and responsibilities

The TFS is responsible for managing scheduling of resources for their respective resource pool, undertaking the critical set of processes which helps to identify and propose right talent from a resource pool to ensure fulfillment of all open roles and for managing/monitoring people productivity targets.

The TFS works with the GU Supply/Demand Lead to focus on supply/demand management activities in order to deliver resources to fulfill demand at right time and price to meet client needs.

Key Responsibilities:

Supply & Demand

  • Responsible for filling demand and staffing resources assigned to their Deployed to Entity; undertaking processes to identify and propose the right talent to ensure fulfillment of all open roles and for managing/monitoring people productivity targets.
  • Recommend actions with business leaders to size the RP to balance supply with demands and meet chargeability and overdue demand targets.
  • Works with RPSD Leads to understand the business environment to determine, develop and execute innovative solutions which provide guidance and counsel to resolve supply/demand issues, and provide input into resource planning activities.
  • Searches for candidates within the resource pool (available; coming available; people that could be swapped out of current roles).
  • Escalates to GP Lead when Resource Pool cannot identify candidates.
  • Responsible for maintaining accurate supply and demand information in myScheduling.
  • Propose alternate 'sourcing' channels if supply does not exist to fulfill demand.

Forecasting

  • Monthly chargeability forecasting for PCM & GP/DTE leadership sign-off (chargeability reconciliation, follow up)
  • Utilizing Supply and Demand Workbench to communicate with Recruitment and keep this data up to date. Update this tool at least monthly to show the current picture for their DTE.
  • Monitor/responsible for key supply/demand metrics (overdue demand, roll offs, win probabilities, and chargeability forecasts) and collaborate with GP Lead to analyse and interpret the results and action as needed

Skills and experience

  • Bachelor degree and have gained more than 1-2 years experience in a relevant HR role.
  • Ability to meet travel requirements, when applicable

Knowledge and Skill Requirements:

  • Relevant industry, functional and technical knowledge
  • Facilitation skills
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Professional Soft Skills:

  • Negotiation & Influencing Skills
  • Business knowledge and acumen
  • Motivation and Drive

Accenture is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All suitably qualified applicants will receive equal and fair consideration for employment.

At Accenture, our vision is to create a supportive culture that balances the flexibility needs of the business and our people, enabling us to maximise overall performance.

Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

'

title: Content Production Manager
description:
b'

We are looking for a Content Manager & Editor with a strong eye for detail and a flair for the written word to join our team and lead the content strategy for the organisation. The ideal candidate will have proven experience in writing for a large, complex business as well as experience in creating a robust content strategy. All candidates must have a passion for entrepreneurship, high Digital growth and fast moving environments!

\xc2\xa0

You will manage a sustainable, agile and responsive content calendar that reflects the brand\xe2\x80\x99s key messages and propositions over time. Your responsibilities will include:

- Develop and execute a search optimised content strategy that supports and enhances marketing and sales initiatives

- Produce a range of content for online/offline marketing channels; including eDMs, direct mail, PR, web, YouTube, social media, blog posts, infographics, advertising, sales and marketing collateral.

- Analyse content performance and review tracking metrics to provide solutions to increase search engine ranking, traffic and engagement.

- Identify key insights from digital and market data to develop theme/topics and content for multiple business categories

- Measure ROI for communications, including testing alternatives and adjusting approach and messaging based on results

- Support and help drive SEO and SEM strategy

- Work closely with the design team on all creative and branding initiatives to ensure a consistent message across channels

\xc2\xa0

In addition to these skills you will have impeccable attention to detail, exceptional written and verbal communication and developed project management skills.

\xc2\xa0

If you love creating engaging and witty content on variety of topics, then please apply today!

'

title: Education Accountant - Frenchs Forest, NSW
description:
b'
  • Full time, permanent role\xc2\xa0- 38 hours per week
  • An attractive salary package will be negotiated
  • Tax-effective PBI salary packaging benefits
  • Leading Not-For-Profit organisation - based in Frenchs Forest, NSW

What we do: Autism Spectrum Australia (Aspect) is Australia's largest national specialist autism provider, delivering services to people within NSW, ACT, Victoria and South Australia.\xc2\xa0 Aspect provides a range of centre and community based services, focussing on education services, early intervention, skills development, community engagement, and self-directed options for people on the autism spectrum disabilities.

About the role:\xc2\xa0This position reports to\xc2\xa0the Finance Manager & will support the education finance team with the collation of financial data & information, preparation of reports & assisting in the\xc2\xa0budget process.\xc2\xa0Experience in secondary education and not for profit background would be preferable.

Key Responsibilities:\xc2\xa0

  • Manage the day to day financial operations for Aspect Education
  • Manage the month end and year end process
  • Plan the annual budgets and reforecast with Aspect Education Management
  • Manage the grant acquittal\xc2\xa0& school invoicing
  • Supervise the accounts receivable officers

Skills, experience & qualifications:

  • Accounting degree or diploma/certificate in accounting; CPA or CA essential
  • Minimum 5 years' experience in an accounting role
  • Excellent IT skills with sound Microsoft Office computer knowledge - primarily Excel
  • Well-developed written & verbal\xc2\xa0communication & interpersonal skills
  • High level attention to detail & accuracy
  • Demonstrated capacity to utilise financial systems including IBM TM1 & Microsoft Dynamics - Great Plains desirable

If successful, you will be required to undertake a National Police Check which Aspect will arrange.

What we offer: A competitive package will be based on relevant qualifications & experience. As a Public Benevolent Institution (PBI), Aspect employees receive tax-effective salary packaging opportunities including $15,899 each year tax free. This means you can increase the value of your take-home pay.

More information about Aspect: www.autismspectrum.org.au.

The Position Profile is available once you apply.

To Apply: Please include your resume &\xc2\xa0complete the candidate questionnaire as part of Aspect's online recruitment process.\xc2\xa0 A cover letter is optional.

\xc2\xa0Enquiries should be directed to:\xc2\xa0 Christy Ratnakumar, Finance Manager or (02) 8977 8344.

\xc2\xa0Aspect is a Public Benevolent Institution and EEO employer.\xc2\xa0 Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.\xc2\xa0

NOTE: If you have a profile with Seek, you may prefer to click the "Apply with Seek" button below. This will automatically pre-fill your personal details and attach your resume from Seek. To complete your application you must also answer the questions below.

\xc2\xa0

Please note we will not be accepting applications or unsolicited enquiries from recruitment agencies at this time.

'

title: Project Reporting Administrator
description:
b'

The CPB Contractors Dragados Samsung (CPBDS-JV) joint venture has been successful in securing the contract to deliver the $3.9bn WestConnex New M5. The New M5 is the second stage of WestConnex and will run in twin tunnels between the existing M5 East at Kingsgrove and new interchange at St Peters, providing improved access to the airport, South Sydney and Port Botany precincts.

The CPBDS-JV project is seeking applications for a Project Reporting Administrator to join the Commercial team. Reporting to the Project Performance & Risk Manager, the key responsibilities will include the following:

  • Coordinate Project Weekly and Monthly reporting \xe2\x80\x93 including checking & challenging report data

  • Prepare Reports as directed including preparations for Audit and Meeting Minute-Taking as required

  • Identifying opportunities for process improvements (focusing on efficiency, standardisation and eliminating duplication)

  • Act as a liaison for reporting with administrative representatives from Construction teams, Support teams and the Commercial team, as well as external stakeholders.

  • Maintain Calendar of reporting requirements

  • Support the Project Performance and Risk Manager, where required, with the preparation of reporting process and risk reporting compilations

  • Providing general administrative assistance

Suitable applicants for this role will have most or all of the following:

  • Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Word & Excel skills

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate through all forms (face to face, over the phone, via email) and to all levels of management.

  • Ability to work autonomously, employ initiative and prioritise

  • Relevant experience in an administrative support role

  • Ability to build rapport, coupled with assertiveness to be able to request and follow up on information from a variety of stakeholders


If this role sounds like a good fit for you, please click apply!

Note: this role is based at our project head office in Mascot.

'

title: Senior QA Advisor
advertiser: The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation
description:
b"

\xc2\xa0


Excellent opportunity to join the Building & Place Services team


Full time on going opportunity, based in Sydney


Salary package up to $102,993


\xc2\xa0


About Us\xc2\xa0


This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the Facilities Management Quality Assurance team which takes pride in delivering continuous improvement and innovation towards government objectives for the community. We manage the State's significant property portfolio and its places, including significant heritage precincts such as The Rocks, which results in better visitor experiences and services for the people of NSW.


\xc2\xa0


About the role


As a Senior QA Advisor, you will be a part of the Facilities Management Quality Assurance Team responsible for service contract outcomes in regard to cleaning standards, performance and compliance on behalf of internal and external clients including over 4300 Schools, Colleges, and Government Agency sites throughout NSW, to ensure contractual compliance and support the business unit in the delivery of cleaning services. You will be responsible for providing quality inspection, auditing, monitoring and performance management services, provide timely and accurate systems information, data management, project management, support services, prepare and review policy advice on quality assurance and working collaboratively with internal and external stake holders. Provision of appropriate advice on cleaning standards, systems, techniques and related matters to clients and stakeholders. You will also be dealing directly with Cleaning Contractors to ensure rectification of any shortfalls in standards and compliance.


\xc2\xa0


To be successful, you must be able to demonstrate capabilities and the level required for this role in line with essential requirements, including a wide-ranging depth of knowledge of cleaning systems, equipment, and techniques.


\xc2\xa0


Essential requirements:


\xc2\xa0


Appropriate trade, post-trade or tertiary qualifications and/or equivalent relevant working experience in Commercial Cleaning, administration, and client relations.


A current and valid NSW drivers licence\xc2\xa0and willingness to drive to remote locations which will include overnight stays usually for a week at a time. The country travel involved is usually every alternate week for around 20 weeks per annum, leaving home on Monday and arriving back on Friday.


\xc2\xa0


Information:\xc2\xa0Please review the\xc2\xa0Role Description.\xc2\xa0For enquiries regarding your application, please\xc2\xa0contact\xc2\xa0Bill Weir\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x93 Manager, Building and Place Services on 0411 101 238.\xc2\xa0Understand more about the\xc2\xa0Department of Finance, Services & Innovation.


\xc2\xa0


Salary:\xc2\xa0Grade 7 maximum salary package up to $102,993 Package includes salary [$90,215 \xe2\x80\x93 $92,912] and employer\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to superannuation, commensurate with skills and experience.


\xc2\xa0


Apply now: at IworkforNSW, should you encounter any technical problems, please contact their helpdesk 1800 562 679.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


Closing date: 23 May 2017 [11:59PM] Eligible staff must submit a covering letter of up to two (2) pages and an up to date resume of up to four (4) pages, which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to the focus capabilities of the role, which includes your response to the two target questions. There are no selection criteria to be addresses.


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


TARGET QUESTIONS


\xc2\xa0


Provide details of your experience/expertise in commercial cleaning systems and processes?


Provide details of your experience in administration and computer-based systems?


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0Assessments: Applicants invited for interview will be required to complete the following assessments: Psychometric test (Cognitive and Personality), Behavioural Based Interview, Work Sample and/or Technical Assessment. Applicants will also be required to provide the following checks prior to offer of employment.


\xc2\xa0


Pass a NSW Police check


Provide a completed Working With Children Check (WWCC)


\xc2\xa0


Job reference: 000057OI Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact IworkforNSW helpdesk on 1800 562 679.\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


\xc2\xa0


The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation is an EEO employer and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultures and people with a disability.\xc2\xa0At DFSI, we endeavour to make roles flexible. While these roles are advertised as full time, we will consider requests to undertake flexible work arrangements including on a part-time or job share basis.


\xc2\xa0


"

title: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Architect / Practice Lead
description:
b'This multi award-winning Consultancy with offices in the heart of the Sydney CBD are seeking the services of a highly experienced Microsoft Dynamics CRM Architect / Practice Lead to join their rapidly expanding dynamic team.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The successful Microsoft Dynamics CRM Architect / Practice Lead will be a leading position in a new CRM Practice in a well-established Microsoft Gold Partner Systems Integrator based in Sydney. This presents an opportunity for the right person to take on the role of Architect/Functional Consultant with the view of moving into a Practice Lead in the near future upon demonstration of your ability to help grow a new Dynamics CRM Practice.
\xc2\xa0
To be considered for this exciting career-growth opportunity, you must possess the following skills/experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 5 years of experience as a Microsoft Dynamics CRM Developer/Architect
\xe2\x80\xa2 Formal business analysis and CRM accreditation preferred
\xe2\x80\xa2 Hands-on Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2013 and 2016 and CRM Online design, development experience (ASP.Net, C#, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proven experience in developing Dynamics CRM custom workflows, plug-in creation, and creation of custom integration solutions with third-party vendors
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to take a consultative approach, to understand client requirements and offer ongoing support
\xe2\x80\xa2 High level communication skills, demonstrating an ability to communicate at the technical, business and personal levels (both written & verbal)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Previous system integration experience, including data migration
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst or Functional Consultant.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Functional experience implementing CRM
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experienced providing detailed, high quality documentation.

If you are a highly experience Microsoft Dynamics CRM Architect / Practice Lead possessing all the requisite skills and seeking an opportunity to join a MS Gold Partnering Consultancy, working across brand-new and existing client projects, please apply with your latest resume in Word format to jobs@pbisearch.com.au\xc2\xa0immediately and one of our friendly consultants will call you as soon as possible. \xc2\xa0Interviewing now! '

title: Junior Sales Support
description:
b"

\xc2\xa0

Opportunity exists for an enthusiastic applicant to join a well established\xc2\xa0IT Distribution\xc2\xa0company.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

The successful candidate should be well organised with attention to detail and able to multi-task within an often\xc2\xa0busy environment.\xc2\xa0 A professional attitude and common sense is essential alongside possessing strong written & communication skills.

\xc2\xa0

To be successful in this existing and challenging role you must be pro-active,\xc2\xa0adaptable and comfortable going the extra yard,\xc2\xa0and have the\xc2\xa0ability to cope with pressure. Your background in telecommunications is a must.

\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities

  • Qualify inbound sales enquiries and close sale and/or hand-over to more senior sales resource (depending on the type and size of the deal qualified)
  • Outbound demand generation to create qualified leads
  • Create and manage marketing campaigns and plans
  • Keep Partner portal leads up to date
  • Engage proactively with Sales and Consulting to identify and drive ongoing pipeline of case studies with comprehensive data
  • Provide reporting for all demand generation activities to assess investment effectiveness
  • Manage reseller orders
  • Create cross sell/upsell opportunities within the client base
  • Coordinate and attend marketing / demand generation events
  • Demonstrate\xc2\xa0 products and services to potential customers and partners
  • Manage onboarding of new resellers

This is an exciting opportunity for someone to start their career in an entry level Sales role.
If you have experience working in the telecommunications industry and are looking for that next step then apply with your CV as a word document today and don't miss out on this fantastic role.

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Tender Administrator
description:
b'
Our client is a large Landscape Maintenance contractor who requires an experienced Tender Administrator on a permanent basis. Based in Inner Western Sydney they have operated for almost 3 decades and have high values in providing the best training and support for their staff to add to the continued success of the business.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
This position is full time Monday to Friday and they are ideally looking for someone with previous experience in the landscaping space.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Responsibilities
  • Completion and Submission of pre-tender, tender and post - tender documentation.
  • Supporting the team to articulate tender responses.
  • Maintain up to date tender documentation.
  • Maintain records of tender tender submissions and results.
  • Liaise with and support other staff throughout the tender process.
  • General Administration and support when required.
  • Update project data sheets
This is an integral role for the business as the work you do will play a huge contribution for the success of the company and future work they will receive. Due to this it is essential you are able to work to strict deadlines in a high pressure role.\xc2\xa0

As the successful candidate you will have:
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prior experience working in a similar role (in construction or landscaping)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Have advanced Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be very well presented and display a professional demeanour
\xe2\x80\xa2 Have excellent communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to liaise with clients both face to face and over the phone
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be a team player.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proactive and Forward thinking.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
How to Apply
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
To apply please send an updated copy of your resume to Emma Corke via the button below. Please ensure that your resume is submitted in Microsoft Word format.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Please note that due to the high volume of applicants only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. '

title: Payroll Officer
description:
b'

\xc2\xa0

My client is CBD based, vibrant working environment, fun and hard working team.

They are seeking a permanent full time payroll officer to join their team.
This role requires relevant experience in processing weekly payroll, query handling and good system experience.

The role would suit a candidate who is at the earlier stages of their career in payroll with room to still learn and grow - however previous experience working in payroll is essential.

Responsibilities:

  • End to end processing of approximately 300 contractors
  • Data entry of time sheets and accurately check the payroll for anomalies
  • Update and maintain payroll records and setting up new contractors
  • On-going maintenance superannuation records and compliance\xc2\xa0
  • Fast Track system used


Essential Criteria:

  • Experience in processing payroll
  • Good work ethic and able to work to own initiative
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Fast Track system experience or similar

?
If you are interested in this opportunity and feel you have the relevant skill set please send your resume to liza@charterhouse.com.au or apply via link below.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: NA
description:
b'

The Company

My client is a large, international retail company. They have branches throughout Australia, with the APAC headquarters located in Sydney. This company is a major player in the retail wholesale area, with its clients being amongst the largest globally, giving them a massive presence internationally.

The Role

This is an analytical role with a strong focus on pricing & margin analysis. Your duty will be to business partner with the sales and marketing teams to put pricing and marketing strategies in place. On a day to day basis you will:

  • Create costing and pricing models
  • Prepare and review monthly reports, focusing on margin
  • Analyze prices and margins to maximize revenue
  • Responsible for FX risk management
  • Act as key contact to other divisions, including regional offices, to explain all finance or system queries
  • Maintain BI system
  • Act as business partner to divisions to understand the key business drivers for each
  • Create annual budgets, forecasts, and pricing models
  • Any ad hoc projects that may come up

Your Profile

An experienced Analyst from FMCG would be suitable for this role. You will need to have the confidence to present recommendations to senior managers and stakeholders. You will also need:

  • Finance/Accounting/Economics degree
  • 2+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in a similar role
  • Experience manipulating large amounts of data
  • Advanced Excel skills (VBA, Macros desired)
  • Experience with OLAP BI, Hyperion, and SAP desired
  • Ambitious and highly motivated

Apply Today

Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button. Your application will be assessed within 3 working days. Alternatively, you can apply directly to Kristen Pegg at Kristen.pegg@roberthalf.com.au. Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Learn more about our Sydney recruitment services: https://www.roberthalf.com.au/recruitment-agency-sydney

'

title: Recruitment Consultant - Trades & Services
description:
b'

WhiteCollarBlue is one of Sydney\xe2\x80\x99s fastest growing & respected HR Solutions Providers, based in the heart of Parramatta. We genuinely believe that the right culture, team and work/life balance are the main contributors in employee\xe2\x80\x99s job satisfaction and also our business growth.

We are currently seeking a motivated, driven and tenacious Recruitment Specialist to lead our Trades & Electrical department. We are looking for a strong individual who is focussed on developing lasting, professional relationships with a high level of service for both our Clients and Candidates.

The Trades and Electrical Sectors that you will focus on are across the following areas;

  • High-Rise Residential
  • Commercial Construction
  • Office Fit-Outs
  • Data & Communication
  • Fire & Safety Installation
  • Service & Maintenance
  • Much More..

The successful candidate will have a demonstrated sense of urgency, and a clear understanding of the full recruitment cycle in the Trades and Electrical sectors.

In return, our talent members receive uncapped commissions, access to our company car, daily training, team building experiences and so much more. The benefits for working with a business like WhiteCollarBlue are never ending.

Ideally, we are looking for a Specialist who can demonstrate:

  • Experience as an Electrical Talent Acquisition Specialist or someone with sales or recruitment experience.
  • Previous Business Development Success.
  • Highly sales driven with a strong outcome focus.
  • Ability to engage & build strong relationships with clients & candidates from all walks of life.
  • Excellent communication skills both written & verbally.
  • Strong sense of urgency & the ability to prioritise workloads effectively.
  • Flexibility & the ability to adapt to change.
  • Ability to lead and build a team of Talent Acquisition Specialists

There is an incentive of career progression within WhiteCollarBlue. Over the next 3-5 years we are looking at national expansion and have an internal promotions program.

If you want a career with a growing, culturally aligned business where you can excel, apply now.

'

title: Graphic/Gaming Software Specialist
description: b'As one of the most reputable high technology companies in the world, Raytheon is a trusted partner in delivering mission solutions to our customers. A career at Raytheon will provide you with competitive remuneration, flexible working conditions, world class employee benefits, and a commitment to equal employment opportunities. '

title: Social Policy and Planning Officer
description:
b"

UTS has a bold vision to be a world-leading university of technology. We are a dynamic and innovative university in central Sydney, consistently ranked the top young university in Australia. With a culturally diverse campus life and extensive international exchange and research programs, UTS prepares graduates for the workplaces of today and tomorrow.

The UTS Institute of Public Policy and Governance (IPPG) is an independent research institute focused on public policy, governance, social research, strategic planning, monitoring and evaluation and leadership. The UTS:IPPG incorporates the UTS Centre for Local Government, which supports the advancement of local government policy and practice.

The institute is currently recruiting a Social Policy and Planning Officer with experience working for local government or in local communities to focus particularly on all areas of social policy and planning such as social impact and infrastructure assessments, CPTED assessment, stakeholder and community engagement, and community planning, development and services.

The Social Policy and Planning Officer is responsible for contributing to the Institute's applied policy consultancy projects by conducting thorough and detailed research and analysis, and preparing proposals for external funding opportunities. This work contributes to the Institute's research consultancy objectives by assisting with the effective and efficient delivery of high quality research consultancy projects in accordance with set milestones and budgets.

Main duties/responsibilities:


  • Undertake projects with a focus on policy, planning and impact assessment for a wide range of social issues across different local communities and places
  • Undertake community engagement activities - such as interviews, focus group and workshop design and facilitation, and survey design and analysis
  • Prepare and contribute to projects so they are completed on time and budget
  • Prepare applications and proposals for external funding of research and consultancy projects, in particular social planning and policy work at the local level
  • Liaise and collaborate with organisations, such as local councils, industry partners, UTS faculties, and departments and agencies at State and Commonwealth level
  • Write project reports relating to commissioned research consultancies
  • Develop, present and explain research and consultancy findings and recommendations to a wide range of audiences including local communities and stakeholders, policy and decision-makers
  • Design and carry out high quality, innovative and evidence-based change processes and projects with local governments, communities and stakeholders using appropriate quantitative and qualitative research and engagement methods
  • Conduct analysis of demographic, socio-economic, crime, health and other relevant data sources so that projects are strongly evidence-based.

Main skills/experience required:


  • An understanding of the context and approaches to social and community planning, service design and/or delivery at the local level
  • Demonstrated experience in undertaking projects with a focus on social planning and/or social impact assessment either within or for local government
  • Knowledge of current trends across a wide range of social policy areas, and ability to quickly grasp new social policy and service delivery issues
  • Demonstrated experience engaging local communities and stakeholders on complex policy issues including ability to build rapport, understand and empathise with them
  • An understanding of the industrial and risk context within which local government operates
  • Financial and project management literacy
  • A solid understanding of project management
  • Demonstrated knowledge of social research and policy development, implementation and evaluation processes and methods.

Remuneration

Base Salary Range: $85,681 to $94,795 pa (HEW 7)

This role attracts 17% superannuation in addition to the base salary. Employee benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities.

This appointment will be on a continuing full-time basis.

How To Apply

Prior to commencing your application for IRC94585, please review the Position Description and the relevant selection criteria - click on the apply link to be taken to the relevant page. You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document.

Please note that only those applications submitted via the UTS online recruitment system will be accepted. Current UTS employees should apply through their UTS Employee Self Service function.

As you will be unable to save your application once started, please have all required documents and information available prior to commencing.

Please ensure that the file name for each document submitted includes IRC94585.

Specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to the UTS Recruitment Team at recruitment@uts.edu.au or on +61 (0) 2 9514 1080.

Closing Date: Tuesday 23rd May 2017 at 11.59pm (AEST)

We are committed to diversity and social inclusion, evidenced by our WGEA Employer of Choice citation, Wingara Indigenous Employment Strategy and the UTS Access and Inclusion Plan. We welcome applications from women (particularly for senior and non-traditional roles), Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those who identify as LGBTIQ and applicants from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.


"

title: Accounts Payable Officer - $60k + Super + 5% Bonus
description:
b'

Location: Northern Beaches (onsite parking)

Salary: $60K + Super + 5% Bonus

Role Benefit: Join this global company as an Accounts Payable Officer during an exciting period of growth and expansion.

Role Overview / Description

Reporting directly to the Finance Manager, this Accounts Payable officer will manage a standalone accounts payable function and work closely with the Reporting and Systems Manager. You will take ownership of the end to end Accounts Payable process from processing supplier payments to the reconciliation of supplier statements.

On a monthly basis, this Accounts Payable Officer will assist in the month end reporting activities and the preparation of accounts payables reconciliations. On a weekly basis, you will also assist with the weekly pay run and cash flow forecast as it relates to current and projected supplier commitments. On a daily basis, you will identify and resolve all issues arising from supplier invoices and payments, therefore your problem solving and customer service skills will be critical to the success of this role.

The Job/ Duties / Responsibilities

  • Invoice data entry
  • Reconcile the Goods Receipt and Invoice Receipt account ensuring accuracy
  • Assist with weekly cash flow and capital asset reporting
  • Manage adhoc payments throughout the month
  • Resolve disputes regarding vendor payments
  • Be actively Involved in the Continuous Improvement initiatives and projects within the Finance team

Candidate Profile

You have some experience working as an AP Officer for a medium sized company. You have worked in a standalone role or within a small team where you have had the full responsibility for AP and all related SLAs.

  • Some experience in working as an Accounts Payable officer
  • Demonstrate knowledge in processing and assisting in supplier payments and reconciliation of supplier statements
  • Experience in month end reporting and the creation and maintenance of reconciliation of supplier statements.
  • Strong PC and communication skills
  • Sound decision making and problem solving skills

The Company

This leading global manufacturer of pharmaceutical goods employs over 9,000 people globally and boasts a competitive footprint in the Australian market. A recent acquisition has accelerated this company\xe2\x80\x99s fast-paced growth presenting new challenges and exciting opportunities for a high calibre Accounts Payable professional. The successful Accounts Payable Officer will be quarterly remunerated for their efforts through the bonus incentive policy. This organisation truly rewards high performers.

Apply

If this sounds like you, please send your resume by clicking the \xe2\x80\x9capply\xe2\x80\x9d link below addressing Clare Williams quoting reference number CWAP3334 in the subject line.

'

title: Pre and Post Sales Security Engineer
description:
b"

Job Specification:\xc2\xa0 Information Security - Pre-Sales and Service Delivery Engineer

\xc2\xa0

The Goal:

\xc2\xa0

Securite is entering a new phase of business growth in 2016. We are looking to add a security and network engineer who can help us exceed our goals and add value to the company. We need somebody with some experience in pre-sales and service delivery to provide services to our Enterprise IT class client.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

About Securite:

\xc2\xa0

Securite (formerly known as McEvoy Thomas) is a highly respected, award winning, Information Security Integrator that has been supplying leading edge solutions for more than a decade. We work with Tier 1 leading vendors delivering new technology to blue-chip organisations and have garnered a global reputation for our focus on deploying innovative security solutions across Australia. We are well known for successfully partnering with new market entrants to launch new solutions into the marketplace. Because of this, we spend much of our effort seeding new opportunities at the cutting edge of the security spectrum.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Our Culture:

\xc2\xa0

We promote family values, offer exceptional service levels and take great pride in the calibre of the engineering and support services we offer our enterprise level clients. Our workplace is family friendly and we believe in striking a work/life balance that recognises the importance of dedicated effort.

\xc2\xa0

Location:

\xc2\xa0

We are located in the North Sydney technology precinct, are close to all amenities and just minutes away from North Sydney and Milson's Point train stations.

\xc2\xa0

Role:

\xc2\xa0

We seek an exceptional engineer who understands security engineering and is ready to assume more responsibility. Our clients expect nothing but the best from our engineering support and you will be responsible for delivering on this promise. You will serve a dual role as pre-sales and service delivery and need to understand how large organisations use security within their organisation. You must be willing to learn every step of the security process and understand the OSI layer intimately. We represent many IT vendors (visit our website -\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 www.securite.net.au) and offer first-line service and support for the solutions we sell.

\xc2\xa0

Remuneration:

\xc2\xa0

A competitive base salary is provided in line with industry standards $80K to $100K for the right person .

\xc2\xa0

Experience:

\xc2\xa0

  • Experience in client facing roles
  • In depth knowledge of Information Security engineering
  • Junior to intermediate level engineers ready to make the move up will be considered for the role
  • An attitude that's customer-centric
  • Any Cisco, Palo Alto, Forcepoint\xc2\xa0and security skills will be highly regarded

\xc2\xa0

Goals:

\xc2\xa0

  • A self-starter who takes ownership of engineering challenges
  • A problem solver and lateral thinker
  • A researcher and learner \xe2\x80\x93 we are growing and want to pick winning solutions
  • A career oriented person \xe2\x80\x93 someone who has a 5-year career plan
  • A leader \xe2\x80\x93 ready to build an engineering team that will lead the way\xc2\xa0

Skills:

\xc2\xa0

  • Network Infrastructure and Architectures: Domain Controllers, Domains, Firewalls, DMZ, Access Control, Application Firewalls (Web Proxies / Email Gateways)
  • Windows Servers and Operating Systems \xe2\x80\x93 administrator with some DevOps awareness if possible
  • Windows Clients and mobile endpoints
  • Proxy methods \xe2\x80\x93 build and troubleshoot
  • Linux Server Commands
  • Web and Email traffic data flow. HTTP / HTTPS / SMTP
  • Security (controls and countermeasures are put in place to minimise risk to assets from threat)
  • Infrastructure architecture and challenges \xe2\x80\x93 XaaS - the benefits and trade-offs
  • SQL Server skills (run a simple SQL query)
  • Analytical problem solving (problem solving methodology)
  • Cisco CCNA,CISSP and other current\xc2\xa0 industry certifications will be highly regarded
  • Understanding the business drivers that underpin IT Security
  • Palo Alto Networks
  • Forcepoint

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Do it:

\xc2\xa0

Please reply in the first instance to careers@securite.net.au with a cover letter and a current CV.

Att: Recruitment agencies - thanks, but no thanks. OK? \xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Management Accounting Officer
advertiser: The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation
description:
b'
  • Parramatta location
  • Salary ($79,384 - $87,591) + employer\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to super
  • Great exposure to corporate environment \xe2\x80\x93 gain visibility across the cluster
The Department of Finance, Services & Innovation (DFSI) is a service provider, regulator and central agency of government. We are transforming the way we do business to help make NSW great.
\xc2\xa0
As the Management Accounting Officer you will be primarily responsible for providing assistance with the timely and accurate preparation of monthly management reports, forecasting, budgeting and detailed cost analysis for the business.
\xc2\xa0
Your role as Management Accounting Officer will be responsible for assisting in the provision of management accounting services, reports, advice and support to management to enable well-informed business decisions to be made.
\xc2\xa0
Sitting in the Head Office the role offers plenty of scope, where you will gain exposure across the various divisions in the agency, developing working relationships with senior management.\xc2\xa0 This is a hands on role that will provide you will the opportunity to let your initiative and analytical skills stand out.
\xc2\xa0
Key requirements of the role include:
  • Assists in the preparation of Treasury reports in Treasury Online Entry System (TOES) and PRIME
  • Assists in the preparation & consolidation of budget (OPEX and CAPEX) and monthly forecasts by compiling financial data
  • Update and maintain data in the financial management systems (SAP) to ensure accuracy and integrity of data
  • Assists in the\xc2\xa0 preparation of core and related entities Statutory reports for Audit Office and Cluster to ensure compliance with reporting requirements
  • Compile data for finance reports, submissions and correspondence on financial matters to address queries and assist management decisions
  • Contribute to the development, review and documentation of management accounting policies, procedures and processes in accordance with legislative requirements and guideline\xc2\xa0
Experience and capability required:
  • Experience with computer based financial systems as well as a high level of proficiency in MS Excel, with exposure to MS Access highly regarded
  • Tertiary qualifications in Accounting, Commerce or an equivalent related discipline
  • Sound communication and interpersonal skills with a strong customer focus and desire to build effective working relationships with a diverse range of professionals
  • Proven ability to work autonomously and as part of a team with a results driven focus
The following skills and experience are not essential but will be highly regarded:
  • Commenced studies for or obtained CPA or CA designation
Within your 2 page cover letter please address the following questions:
\xc2\xa0
  1. Describe how you have managed a complex budget process for a large organisation. In your answer, describe the methodologies adopted, how you engaged with the various internal and external stakeholders and how you went about informing Executive management of the outcome and obtaining approval?
  2. Provide an example where your technical accounting and financial analysis expertise has been called upon to provide input into a business case/proposal for a new business project or initiative. How did you present your analysis and what was the outcome?
\xc2\xa0
Learn more\xc2\xa0Please review the Role Description For enquiries regarding this position, please contact Farooq Ali - Finance Manager Fair Trading,\xc2\xa0 02 9895 2022. Understand more about the Department of Finance, Services and Innovation.
\xc2\xa0
Closing date: 22 ^\xc2\xa0May 2017 [11:59PM] your application should include a two page cover letter and an up-to-date resume of no more than five pages which clearly details your skills and experience as relevant to this role. Applicants invited for interview will be required to complete additional assessments. There are no selection criteria to be addressed.
\xc2\xa0
Salary Grade 5/6, maximum salary Package up to $97,095 Package includes salary ($79,384 - $87,591) and employer\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to superannuation.
\xc2\xa0
Job Status ongoing (Permanent) under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.
\xc2\xa0
Apply now at I work for NSW Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact their helpdesk 1800 562 679.
\xc2\xa0
Job reference number - 000059D4
\xc2\xa0
The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation is an EEO employer and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultures and people with a disability. At DFSI, we endeavour to make roles flexible. While this role is advertised as full time, we will consider requests to undertake the work flexibly. \xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0


APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED FROM RECRUITMENT AGENCIES

'
