title: Marketing, Communication and Events Manager
description:
b"

About the Public Relations Institute of Australia

The Public Relations Institute of Australia (PRIA) is the peak professional association for public relations and communication professionals in Australia. The PRIA represents and provides professional support and recognition to individual professionals and businesses nationwide.

About the Opportunity

Working as part of a small, enthusiastic and committed team, you will work with the staff, volunteers and management of the Institute, to manage the PRIA's events, marketing and communication. This is a full-time position; however, hours of work may vary depending on the timing of events etc.

Responsibilities in this role include a combination of the following:

Your role is to work proactively with PRIA staff, management and volunteer committees to assist in delivering an effective and interesting event calendar for the year and to develop and manage an integrated marketing and communication program. You will promote/market and\xc2\xa0and engage all audiences about the PRIA's programs (events, professional development, key pillars of industry leadership i.e.\xc2\xa0Professional Framework, Measurement & Evaluation Guidelines)\xc2\xa0and\xc2\xa0demonstrate experience in delivering outcomes for engagement and PR around event based activities. \xc2\xa0

You will be member-focused, have exceptional writing skills, and a strong background in social media planning, monitoring and management. Working as part of the communication and event management teams, you will undertake tasks, including (but not limited to):

  • Management of communication and marketing\xe2\x80\x93 i.e. developing communication strategies using insights and other research, driving social media campaigns, writing and distributing media releases, maintaining strong media relationships, developing web content, etc.;
  • Undertake strategic analysis of marketing and data to ensure communication strategy is effective;
  • Event management \xe2\x80\x93 i.e. working with volunteer committees, managing suppliers such as venues, AV providers, caterers, graphic designers, etc.;
  • Provide volunteer committees with relevant and timely reporting;
  • Track and control event and marketing/communication finances in accordance with PRIA's policies and surplus targets for each event;
  • Prepare and/or provide any supporting, membership and/or branding materials for the event;
  • Other ad-hoc administrative duties as required.

Required skills/attributes:

  • Minimum 3 years' experience in communication;
  • Tertiary qualifications in marketing/communication or related discipline is essential;
  • Exceptional communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 both written and verbal;
  • Experience developing social media strategies and audience insight development; managing communication measurement and evaluation tasks, and managing media relations activity;
  • Enthusiasm, professionalism and initiative;
  • Experience working with a CRM/customer database is highly advantageous;
  • Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high quality work;
  • Proficiency using basic computer software (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite);
  • A positive individual who is willing to work collaboratively in a constantly changing fast-paced environment.
"

title: Finance Program Lead
description:
b'

This high profile division within a major government department responsible for the the delivery of some of the key projects within the agency. The Program Management Office (PMO) provides systems, process, resources and expertise in program management, as well as full oversight of the portfolio.

The PMO is leading several key initiatives to lift the capability and service to the business, including: governance review, management systems, operating frameworks, controls management framework and reporting reform.

We are recruiting for a Program Lead to focus on Project Controls, Finance, and Funding & Reporting. You will facilitate and deliver the following across 60 programs and over 500 projects. The key responsibilities include:

  • Baseline the costs against the Business Case
  • Re-structure Control Accounts so they are reflective of the project outcomes required
  • Code mandatory milestones for Business Cases (pre and post awarding of the tender)
  • Ensure projects are forecasting monthly at the appropriate level
  • Increase maturity of contingency determination, review and reporting
  • Increase maturity of the scheduling and schedule use
  • Align activities to milestones
  • Design, develop and code confluence for an integrated management system
  • Scope, develop and write frameworks and provide accurate forecasting
  • Develop style guides for new content
  • Transfer all existing QMS documents and processes to the new integrated management system and decommission old ARIS process flows
  • Integrate data models using ODBC, SQL, tables and logic to drive common program project views
  • Work with executive to define and deliver reporting outputs
  • Rollout of Tableau live server to programs and projects
  • Link approximately 10 core systems to produce a self-service data model for the division into Tableau


You will have a strong finance background (CA/CPA/MBA Qualified) within a corporate project environment, with specific experience around the capture of OPEX requirements for large and complex Business Cases. You will have had oversight for a large volume of projects and had exposure to the deployment complex ETL solution

'

title: Senior Modelling Analyst
description:
b'

Your New Company & Team
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers.
The Customer Decisioning team is accountable for delivering world-class capability to understand, respond to and meet the needs of our customers in all the channels that they use (and prefer to use) in communicating with us.
The team comprises a mix of pure analytics roles developing customer, product and channel insights and modelling, alongside business facing stakeholder teams who are embedded into the business, ensuring we understand the needs of our internal customers.

The Challenge & Project Description
Reporting into a Senior Data Scientist, the Modelling Senior Analyst is to deliver innovative analytical and statistical solutions to enhance the capabilities of the Group\xe2\x80\x99s customer communications engine. This is an exciting opportunity to influence analytics strategy for one of the key strategic priorities for the Retail Bank. Specifically, the Modelling Senior Analyst will work with the Senior Data Scientist to:

  • Proactively seek to improve, enhance and promote the team\xe2\x80\x99s analytical and statistical modelling capabilities and the value it generates for our stakeholders
  • Engage stakeholders to ensure business buy-in and further the use of statistical and modelling capabilities by the business
  • Develop, maintain, document and monitor statistical models (e.g., propensity models, profitability models) for our business partners within RBS, Wealth and other BUs; driving incremental value within their business by identifying customer needs
  • Source, prepare and manipulate data for use in statistical models
  • Further the enjoyable, rewarding, dynamic and market leading ethos of the Advanced Modelling team, and excel in customer service

Key Skills & Experience

1 \xe2\x80\x93 Hard skills

  • Commercial modelling / analytical experience
  • Proven experience in the use of advanced statistical algorithms, such as machine learning or data mining
  • Knowledge of SAS, R, SQL, and Hadoop

2 \xe2\x80\x93 Soft skills

  • Project management skills desirable
  • Good verbal, written and presentation skills

3 \xe2\x80\x93 Academic background

  • Degree in a quantitative discipline required, e.g. mathematics, economics, econometrics, statistics, computer science or engineering
  • Post graduate quantitative degree desirable

Highly regarded

  • Knowledge of the financial industry and how analytics impacts business decisions

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we\xe2\x80\x99ll support you at every stage of your career.
The role offers excellent opportunities to enhance technical, project and stakeholder management skills
The successful applicant will be able to influence analytics strategy, and will be involved in one of the key strategic priorities for the Retail Bank
Your development will be managed via clear and structured processes for performance review and development planning

Tags
Logistic Regression, Gradient Boosting Machines, GBM, Random Forest, Linear Regression, Decision Trees, Naive Bayes, Neural Networks, Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Clustering, Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Statistics, Confidence Interval, Experimentation, Hypothesis Testing, A/B Testing
QPM01

'

title: Senior Modelling Analyst
description:
b'

Your New Company & Team
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers.
The Customer Decisioning team is accountable for delivering world-class capability to understand, respond to and meet the needs of our customers in all the channels that they use (and prefer to use) in communicating with us.
The team comprises a mix of pure analytics roles developing customer, product and channel insights and modelling, alongside business facing stakeholder teams who are embedded into the business, ensuring we understand the needs of our internal customers.

The Challenge & Project Description
Reporting into a Senior Data Scientist, the Modelling Senior Analyst is to deliver innovative analytical and statistical solutions to enhance the capabilities of the Group\xe2\x80\x99s customer communications engine. This is an exciting opportunity to influence analytics strategy for one of the key strategic priorities for the Retail Bank. Specifically, the Modelling Senior Analyst will work with the Senior Data Scientist to:

  • Proactively seek to improve, enhance and promote the team\xe2\x80\x99s analytical and statistical modelling capabilities and the value it generates for our stakeholders
  • Engage stakeholders to ensure business buy-in and further the use of statistical and modelling capabilities by the business
  • Develop, maintain, document and monitor statistical models (e.g., propensity models, profitability models) for our business partners within RBS, Wealth and other BUs; driving incremental value within their business by identifying customer needs
  • Source, prepare and manipulate data for use in statistical models
  • Further the enjoyable, rewarding, dynamic and market leading ethos of the Advanced Modelling team, and excel in customer service

Key Skills & Experience

1 \xe2\x80\x93 Hard skills

  • Commercial modelling / analytical experience
  • Proven experience in the use of advanced statistical algorithms, such as machine learning or data mining
  • Knowledge of SAS, R, SQL, and Hadoop

2 \xe2\x80\x93 Soft skills

  • Project management skills desirable
  • Good verbal, written and presentation skills

3 \xe2\x80\x93 Academic background

  • Degree in a quantitative discipline required, e.g. mathematics, economics, econometrics, statistics, computer science or engineering
  • Post graduate quantitative degree desirable

Highly regarded

  • Knowledge of the financial industry and how analytics impacts business decisions

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we\xe2\x80\x99ll support you at every stage of your career.
The role offers excellent opportunities to enhance technical, project and stakeholder management skills
The successful applicant will be able to influence analytics strategy, and will be involved in one of the key strategic priorities for the Retail Bank
Your development will be managed via clear and structured processes for performance review and development planning

Tags
Logistic Regression, Gradient Boosting Machines, GBM, Random Forest, Linear Regression, Decision Trees, Naive Bayes, Neural Networks, Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Clustering, Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Statistics, Confidence Interval, Experimentation, Hypothesis Testing, A/B Testing
QPM01

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
b'

Be part of an creative, innovative and savvy marketing team who enjoy a fast paced and collaborative working environment.

  • Elite software company who lead the way in the legal industry
  • Autonomous position where your ideas will be counted for
  • Motivated and friendly team who encourage each other and work collaboratively

THE FIRM

Global elite and leading software provider with over 100 people based in Australia alone. Based near Wynyard Station, this firm is an easy commute for most. An organisation that cares about what they do and how they deliver it. This software firm understands the importance of a healthy culture in the work place and so invest time and money in ensuring morale is consistently high and everyone feels like they are winning.

DIGITAL MARKETING SPECIALIST POSITION

You will be a Digital Marketing Specialist within a team of 5 highly experienced marketing professionals. In this team you will be required to voice your ideas and project manage the implementation of those. This is a Digital Marketing position that requires innovative, strategic and analytical skills. The team have been described as fun, knowledgeable and motivating to work with.

  • Create convincing and dynamic strategies for marketing automation
  • Work with the Data Manager to find the right target groups
  • Construct beautiful and enticing marketing campaigns
  • Analyse, report and optimise all marketing automation campaigns.
  • Curate content for social media, email, web, online and offline advertising
  • Conduct marketing testing and analyse success rates to identify future opportunities.

THE SUCCESSFUL DIGITAL MARKETING SPECIALIST

  • You will have a minimum of 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in legal marketing in a similar end to end marketing role
  • A proven track record of building, testing, tracking and execution of all campaigns
  • Confident in taking on projects and managing them
  • Excellent copywriting skills
  • Motivated, organised and fun personality.

IS THIS DIGITAL MARKETING SPECIALIST POSITION FOR YOU?

Great! If you match the skills and experience required please waste no time in getting in touch with Farah Kompani on 02 8227 7204 or by clicking apply now.

Farah Kompani (SK924997A)

Ref No: FK.DMS
Email: farah@legaleagles.careers
Phone: (02) 8227 7204

title: Online Store Coordinator

Happytel is the global industry leader in mobile device accessories and repairs with over 20 years of experience and 73 stores across Australia, USA and New Zealand.

As an exciting and innovative retailer, we are looking for a passionate, motivated Online Store Coordinator that enjoys working in a dynamic team environment.

Requirements;\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills;

What we can offer you:

hr@happytel.com

title: Transport Analyst - ANZ
description:
b'

  • \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Newly Created
    role
  • \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Permanent
    opportunity
  • \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Located at North
    Ryde, NSW

Be Vital in
this Role

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0At Johnson & Johnson, we are
embarking on a journey to strengthen our transport capability across our Family
of Companies in Australia and New Zealand. We are seeking a Transport Analyst
to engage
with suppliers & key stakeholders to provide top class analytical support
& insights on transport operations for the Johnson & Johnson Family of
Companies.

\xc2\xa0

You
will have responsibility for the partnership with key transport suppliers, evaluating
& monitoring their performance, KPI reporting and maintaining related compliance
and data integrity. Additional duties include: \xc2\xa0

  • Conducting regular review & analysis of performance, KPIs,
    cost etc, and identify key themes & opportunities and remediation
  • Support & analysis as needed in day to day supplier management
  • Deliver analytics for budget estimates
  • Oversee Freight audit process

\xc2\xa0

Be Valued for who you are

\xc2\xa0

You will be
a strong team player with excellent communications skills allowing you to
develop partnerships with key stakeholders. You will take a flexible approach
to your work and have a commitment to delivering quality analytical insights.
Other requirements include:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated
    strengths managing stakeholders at all levels
  • A number of years of experience in logistics and transport in a similar
    capacity
  • Experience in domestic logistics and freight
  • Strong analytical skills providing insights & results
  • Ability to work in a highly complex and fast paced environment
  • Strong skills working with analytical tools
  • Tertiary qualifications in business, logistics or finance
  • Excellent attention to detail\xc2\xa0

This
is an opportunity for you to join a global leader where you have the
opportunity to grow and develop your career. We are looking for someone who has
the potential to be a future leader within the J&J Family of Companies.

\xc2\xa0


Be part of something bigger than yourself

\xc2\xa0

Caring for the world, one person at a time, has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.\xc2\xa0


Johnson & Johnson Customer & Logistics Services (CLS) is a global Supply Chain organization that supports operating units across all of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.\xc2\xa0CLS strives to deliver an exceptional customer experience through leading critical customer facing-functions such as distribution and transportation. In addition, CLS oversees critical business enablers, including how we gather and manage supply chain master data, safe and secure supply chain practices, product identification standards, and market/channel access capabilities. CLS supports all three sectors of Johnson & Johnson: Medical Device & Diagnostics, Pharmaceutical, and Consumer Products.\xc2\xa0 This team is represented in multiple countries, and continues to grow globally in both visibility and responsibility. \xc2\xa0The CLS team reports to Johnson & Johnson Supply Chain and partners closely with groups throughout the supply chain organization.


Please apply online using the link below. You will receive an automated email confirming receipt of your application. Should you have any questions pertaining to the role outside this advert, please contact\xc2\xa0Megan Liu in the Johnson & Johnson Talent Acquisition team on 02 9815 3623. Every application is reviewed by the Talent Acquisition team and candidates will receive notification of the outcome of their application in a timely manner. \xc2\xa0

'

title: Team Leader, Operations Support, Sydney
description:
b'Opportunity for a Team Leader, Operations Support, Sydney
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The Job
\xc2\xa0
Western Union is currently looking for a Team Leader for Operations Support to join our team in our Sydney Office.
\xc2\xa0
As the Team Leader, you will be responsible for ensuring that service delivery within the Western Union Business Solutions (WUBS) customer portfolio meets and exceeds agreed contracted Service Level Agreements (SLAs)\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
You will manage and develop a highly customer focused team to deliver a high quality service, and are required to maintain high levels of motivation and target focus whilst holding customer satisfaction as paramount. You will ensure the team is aligned to the goals of the Corporate Go To Market Teams, instill the \xe2\x80\x98See, Own, Do\xe2\x80\x99 attitude and will work to aid retention and growth for WUBS.
\xc2\xa0
You are also responsible for the development, training and coaching of all Team Members, ensuring behaviours, standards and service offerings are exemplary and commensurate with client and business performance management. Team performance will be managed on an individual and team basis using highly effective performance data.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
In this role, you will:
\xc2\xa0
Performance

  • Build and maintain an excellent rapport with our Clients and offer robust solutions to their requirements


  • Ensure all performance, service and Client standards are met


  • Review and develop Service Level Agreements with other Operational departments and Go To Market Teams with excellent customer service at the forefront.


  • Maintain focus on goals and results whilst striving to exceed SLAs.\xc2\xa0 Develop effective KPI reporting on performance and Customer Service standards


  • Maintain effective relationships with Operations, Support, Dealing, Relationship Management and Account Management teams to maximize and sustain service quality for all customers.


  • Act as the escalation point for Client dissatisfaction


  • Ensure internal policies are adhered to


  • Manage performance on an individual and team basis.


  • Manage poor performance in accordance with our policies and procedures.


  • Ensure team objectives are in place and reviewed on a quarterly basis.


  • Develop and maintain effective training plans to ensure continuity on service levels and regulatory requirements.


  • Review case standards on a monthly basis and provide evidenced feedback for team objectives.


  • Track and trend Clients deemed at risk
    \xc2\xa0
Team Management

  • Lead by example and act as a role model.


  • First point of referral for consultation, advice and shared learning.


  • Hold regular one to one to discuss successes and issues.


  • Annual Training Schedule implemented and managed.


  • Induction and Validation Testing to ensure knowledge of businesses products and services is maintained in the team.


  • Identify any areas of shortfall in knowledge or training which when addressed will improve the ability to provide exceptional customer service.


  • Conduct regular team briefs.


  • Regular review of processes and change management.


  • Ensure staffing levels are in line with business requirements and within budget.


  • Support the regular reviews of departmental structure and planning in place to accommodate the future growth of business.


  • Conduct interviews and assessments of prospective team members
\xc2\xa0
Development

  • Proactively seek knowledge and understanding on prospective Clients and their support requirements


  • Ensure complete understanding of new internal policies and procedures to ensure Client Service Delivery and support is not compromised


  • Identify opportunities for improvements to processes and service delivery


  • Share leading / best practices and Client trends / behaviours with GTM team to ensure knowledge is leveraged.
\xc2\xa0
Leading Self

  • Proactively reaches out to other areas to resolve Client queries/issues


  • Sets high standards for own performance.


  • Demonstrates excellent attention to detail, accountability, ownership, accuracy, and the ability to meet strict deadlines


  • Shares knowledge and expertise to develop and increase departmental capabilities.
\xc2\xa0
Travel will be required across Western Union Business Solutions and Client Locations as support for GTM team as and when requested.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
About You
\xc2\xa0

  • You have at least 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience leading a Client facing Team


  • You are an autonomous individual who works to exceed personal and team targets


  • You have excellent communication, listening and influencing skills


  • You are highly driven with a strong desire to exceed


  • You have passion for excellence in customer service and a proven track record for embedding this passion in the team culture


  • You have High degree of professionalism, with a confident, assertive style.\xc2\xa0


  • You can meet deadlines/sense of urgency


  • You lead by example and motivate team to deliver service excellence to Customers


  • You are a team player


  • You build networks to establish internal/external relationships


  • You have solid computer skills with ability to use MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint and the Internet
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
What we offer
\xc2\xa0
Ongoing learning and career development opportunities with the ability to be involved in process improvements, initiatives and project work.
\xc2\xa0
A dynamic working environment, opportunities to work with a world class global team, while same time with the high level of autonomy on ways of doing things.
\xc2\xa0
An interesting multicultural working environment with the ability to collaborate and link across borders with sector and technical experts in all parts of our business supported by cutting edge technology and systems.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The Pay
\xc2\xa0
An attractive base salary is on offer depending on skills and experience. As a member of our team you will be also be involved in our global employee recognition program.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
To Apply
\xc2\xa0
Growth and innovation are the story of our past, and they will define our future so if you are looking to be part of an exciting and innovative organization where your hard work can make a difference then please apply below \xe2\x80\x93 we would love to hear from you!
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
#LI-POST

'

title: Fleet and Services Coordinator ANZ
description:
b'
  • Innovative Global Market Leader | Great Team Environment
  • Coordination of Motor Vehicle and Mobile Phone Fleet across ANZ
  • Based Macquarie Park | Close to Public Transport

Every day, we make the world cleaner, safer and healthier \xe2\x80\x93 protecting people and vital resources.\xc2\xa0 Ecolab is the global leader in water, hygiene and energy technologies and services.\xc2\xa0 Around the world businesses in foodservice, food processing, hospitality, healthcare, industrial, and oil and gas markets choose Ecolab products and services to keep their environment clean and safe, operate efficiently and achieve sustainability goals. Our global workforce of over 48,000 employees is consistently delivering comprehensive solutions that meet the unique needs of our customers.

In this key role, you will assist with the acquisition, finance, issue, allocation, maintenance and insurance of Ecolab's motor vehicle (c. 600) and mobile telecommunications (c. 1,000) fleet across Australia, New Zealand and Fiji.\xc2\xa0 Key responsibilities will include:

  • Maintaining the ANZ Motor Vehicle and Mobile Telecommunications Fleet inventory data base.
  • Ordering, storing, maintaining and disposing of assets.
  • Controlling, ordering, issuing of all company E-tags.
  • Preparing monthly management reports.
  • Educating employees on all category policies.
  • Analysing Fleet data to ensure vehicles are being serviced as per manufacturer guidelines, correct fuel type used and compliant maintenance procedures.
  • Managing vehicle insurance and accident repairs to effectively control accident claims.
  • Managing, tracking and reporting vehicle infringements and policy breaches.
  • Maintaining business relationships with Suppliers and conducting supplier performance reviews.
  • Co-Ordinating Facilities Management activities for Macquarie Park Office and Warehouse.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Demonstrated strong administration skills and excellent customer service focus.
  • Previous high volume vehicle and mobile telecommunications fleet experience preferred.
  • Exceptional organizational skills with an aptitude to build strong working relationships with internal and external customers and suppliers.
  • Intermediate Excel skills.
  • Ability to work within a high performing team and autonomously as required.
  • Some exposure to procurement practices.
  • Ability to communicate, both written and verbally. Negotiate confidently and effectively at all levels.
  • Current NSW Drivers license required.

At Ecolab, we are dedicated to ensuring our associates are provided with an environment geared toward the recognition of achievement, growth, safety and well-being. \xc2\xa0We also offer our associates opportunities to participate in Ecolab stock ownership, health and well-being subsidies, study subsidies, product and service discounts, and the opportunity to champion community activity programs.

Ecolab is an equal opportunity employer that relies on diversity of our work force to drive innovation and growth.

Please apply by clicking the "Apply Now" icon and following the online application process.\xc2\xa0 However, if you experience technical difficulties in submitting your application, please forward your CV and cover letter to anzrecruitment@ecolab.com, quoting reference 71498BR

'

title: Site Engineer
description:
b'

About The Company

At Fulton Hogan we work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we're only as good as our people, so we are committed to hiring, developing and retaining only the best in our teams! Fulton Hogan is a major civil contracting company offering clients services in civil contracting, construction, infrastructure maintenance, quarrying and asphalt production and surfacing.

We have been awarded the contract to deliver various major infrastructures as part of the new Northern Beaches B-Line bus service in New South Wales. The entire B-Line project is valued at about $234 million.

The Opportunity

As a result of this exciting project win; opportunities have arisen for Site Engineers with a proven background in major civil works, Transportation, Earthworks and Drainage to join our project team based at the Northern Beaches.

Reporting into the Project Manager, you will be responsible for duties including;

  • Follow short term programs (2 and 4 week look a heads)
  • Identify risks to health and safety for workers and public through SWMS, Special Processes and Corrective Actions
  • Support the coordination of subcontractor activities
  • Report incidents, non-conformance's and near misses
  • Daily interaction with the Project Engineering team
  • Ensure that Environmental risks are identified and follow documented processes as such as Progressive ESCP
  • Collate field records and input data for accurate daily productivity and monthly forecasting costing's

About you

  • A Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Civil) or equivalent tertiary qualifications
  • Proven background as a Site Engineer with experience in Earth works or road engineering
  • RMS experience would be advantageous
  • The ability to communicate across all levels of the business
  • Have a practical a hands on approach

Benefits

  • An opportunity to join a multinational civil contractor that genuinely cares for its people
  • Unique opportunity to grow your career and run your own projects sooner under our flat hierarchy
  • Excellent compensation structure in place to attract the industries best
  • Structured career progression into Project Management

IfyoufeelthispositionisagoodfitforyourskillsandexperienceandyouarepassionateaboutworkingforacompanythatprioritisesourREALvaluesofRespect,Energy,AttitudeandLeadership,pleaseapplybelow.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

*No agency applications will be considered*

'

title: Membership & Marketing Officer  National Disability Practitioners (NDP)
description:
b"

Reports to: Executive Officer,\xc2\xa0National Disability Practitioners (NDP)

Direct Reports: \xc2\xa00

Location: Sydney

Status: \xc2\xa0Full Time; 38 hours per week. Fixed term contract until 30 June 2018.

Company Overview:

NDS is the national industry association for disability services, representing more than 1,100 non-government organisations. Collectively, our members operate several thousand services for Australians with all types of disability. \xc2\xa0NDS's members range in size from small support groups to large multi-service organisations, and are located in every State and Territory across Australia.

NDS promotes the full inclusion of people with disability and this commitment is outlined in our Disability Action Plan (DAP).

Position Overview:

National Disability Practitioners (NDP) is a professional association for the disability workforce and operates as a division of NDS.\xc2\xa0 NDP launched in December 2014 with the purpose of increasing the professionalism of the sector's workforce and raising the standards of disability service delivery. \xc2\xa0NDP is committed to inspiring, developing and supporting the Australian disability workforce. There are more than 14,000 individual NDP members across Australia, ranging from disability support workers, to sector leaders, allied health practitioners, students and those undertaking business support roles.

An exciting opportunity exists to join the NDP team in the role of Membership & Marketing Officer. The purpose of the role is to provide exceptional customer service to potential and existing NDP members (including group subscribers); to manage NDP's marketing and communication of membership benefits; to actively promote the program and assist with the identifcation of new business opportunities; and to manage NDP's website and CRM functions. Working closely with the NDP Executive Officer, the role will support the establishment of NDP as the leading association for the disability workforce.

Key Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Oversee, respond and report on all membership related queries, applications and engagement;
  • Lead the operational aspects of NDP's communication strategies, including creation of e-templates; development of content; tailoring of messaging; creative design direction; distribution of communications; sponsor requirements are met; and reporting on activity. Channels include the NDP website and SEO, social media, collateral, e-newsletters, webinars, advertisements, multi-media applications etc.
  • Coordinate, develop and actively promote NDP's member benefits program (including NDP's learning and development hub) to deliver a range of relevant products, resources, events and services for NDP members;
  • Manage NDP's CRM, ensuring data integrity and accurate reporting;
  • Undertake membership acquisition and retention activities to support program growth;
  • Coordinate advisory committee elections and meetings;
  • Develop and maintain strong and productive working relationships with a range of stakeholders (including NDS internal divisions and corporate services);
  • Other duties as required.

Key attributes:

  1. Demonstrated task and time management skills with the ability to organise and complete multiple activities to a high standard within a high volume environment;
  2. Excellent customer service skills with a member focused attitude;
  3. Highly developed communication skills, with experience in creating engaging written content, delivering presentations and in face to face and telephone interaction;
  4. Experience with social and digital media;
  5. A high level of administration skills and knowledge of office information technology, including the Microsoft Office Suite. Experience with Dynamic CRM and website maintenance are an advantage;
  6. Excellent interpersonal and influencing skills, with a demonstrated ability to effectively consult and negotiate with a range of stakeholders to achieve beneficial outcomes;
  7. Experience with professional membership associations is highly desirable;
  8. An independent self-starter with travel capability.
"

title: Retail Management Support Specialist
description:
b"

The Company:

JIVARO are currently working with a premium homewares brand in search of an experienced retail support specialist to join their head office team in Sydney!

The role:

Reporting into the national operations manager; and working collaboratively with all levels of the business,\xc2\xa0you will be responsible for providing effective management and communication of all retail operations such as

  • operational administration and cost centre management
  • coordination of building maintenance and WHS
  • effective stocktaking management and data integrity for all channels
  • Store network communications to the retail teams such as VM directives, promotional activity, mystery shop results

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
b'
The Company:
TEKsystems has been engaged exclusively by a highly respected market leader in Western Sydney to recruit for an exciting Business Intelligence Developer role on a permanent basis. With over 100 years of market presence, and an instantly recognisable brand name synonymous with high quality products, this company is seeking a technically sound and commercially focussed Business Intelligence Developer to join their high performing IT team on a permanent basis. The business is primed for an exciting period of growth and are looking for someone to grow with the business and add value to senior internal stakeholders. This is a highly visible role in the business, working closely with the CIO and other senior stakeholders in a culture built around integrity, respect, high performance and collaboration. Ongoing training and mentoring provided for the successful candidate.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The Role:
  • Reporting to the IT Manager, this role is responsible for building the systems capability of the company around business intelligence and analytics. Key responsibilities for this role will include:\xc2\xa0
  • Designing and developing new financial, sales and operational reports, reporting packs and dashboards.\xc2\xa0
  • Consulting with users on their reporting requirements, defining required outcomes, implementation of the agreed plan and solution.\xc2\xa0
  • Developing and documenting functional requirements with business stakeholders.\xc2\xa0
  • Writing reporting and data flow specifications.\xc2\xa0
  • Perform technical and functional testing.\xc2\xa0
  • Providing and maintaining user/technical documentation. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Providing end user system support and training.\xc2\xa0
  • Investigating reported issues by consultation with user groups.\xc2\xa0
  • Deploying modifications/reports to live environments once final approval given.\xc2\xa0
  • Any additional ad-hoc duties as requested by the IT Manager.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
The Successful Candidate:\xc2\xa0
You will have a minimum of 5 years in a similar Business Intelligence Developer role, ideally with strong IBM Cognos experience. You will also have strong experience in SQL, SSRS, SSIS and Qlikview. You will possess strong data analysis and reporting skills, and enjoy solving business challenges through your work. You will be a natural communicator, who enjoys partnering with stakeholders at all levels, and have proven track record of results.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
In return, you will be given an exciting opportunity to be mentored by a highly experienced IT Manager and work on exciting upcoming projects that add true value to the business.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
For more information please call Gemma Grierson from our Greater Western Sydney Office on (02) 88942704 quoting job reference number 495636 or alternatively, apply online below.
'

title: Media Executive
description:
b"As the Media Executive, you will assist the media team to drive strategic and innovative media solutions for all clients, identifying the optimal media channel mix to maximise business outcomes for each. Assist in the growth and profitability of the media team within the agency, while also generating cross-functional business growth for complementary services such as content, data & analytics, attribution, SEO etc.\xc2\xa0

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Start to have responsibility for buying across all media channels.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Accountable for the buying and delivery of all campaigns within client portfolio (buying competencies across all channels, including Television buying, tracking, R&F Goals, TARP delivery, Budget Management and quality parameters).\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fully responsible for implementing your deliverables, on time and in an efficient manner. Your managers and clients should never need to chase overdue work.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Completing weekly tracking on campaign parameters on all TV buys.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Media Manager in delivering accurate, punctual and high quality pre-, mid- and post- campaign reporting for the client across all relevant channels.
\xe2\x80\xa2 100% proficiency and accuracy with all financials, budget control, account queries, loading MI's and Proformas.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Active role in briefing the media owners\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proactive in terms of highlighting issues with buys, media developments, trends or marketplace conditions that impact buying performance, to be raised with the Media Manager when identified.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 In conjunction with Media Manager, assist in the training and development of Media Assistant.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Media Manager throughout the planning process, to help deliver a media recommendation across all relevant channels that is innovative/creative, will achieve the client's objectives and is cost-effective.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Media Manager and Media Director in analyzing and evaluating media responses.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Start to develop key relationships with the media, clients or creative agencies.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Considerate of client expectations and ensures delivery on all client deliverables.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the business and team on new business pitches and other ad hoc projects when required by the Media Director and/or senior leadership team.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Approach your work with a 'can-do' attitude and deliver best in class client service every day.\xc2\xa0

QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 12-18 months experience media planning/buying in an agency environment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing media buying/negotiation skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of all implementation and buying systems (BCC, eTam, Asteroid, eRam, Move)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing an understanding of all media channels, with the ability to identify the strengths and weaknesses of each channel and the impact these have in delivering on the client objectives
\xe2\x80\xa2 Critical analysis of all Survey/market data ensuring informed buying decisions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attention to detail with high levels of accuracy.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Basic understanding all key mediums and how the marketplace impacts media buys.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Has the ability to gain insights from competitive data and understand the impact on our clients business, looking for insights that will guide the media strategy.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Start to think laterally about the potential solution to a request or client issue.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to effectively communicate - written and verbal.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Start to develop presentation skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Problem solving mentality.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to manage a broad scope of tasks and manage time & workload to deliver on deadlines.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Shows initiative and seeks out new projects and tasks whenever possible.

title: Marketing Coordinator | Leading Australian Charity | $65k base + super |
description:
b"Ref: 2499090C
Marketing Coordinator | Leading Australian Charity | $65k base + super


About the role:
Reporting to the Appeals and Acquisitions Manager, the primary goal of the Marketing Coordinator is to support and\xc2\xa0develop the 4 major appeal campaigns they run annually\xc2\xa0through full end to end direct marketing activities in order to achieve key fundraising objectives.

It's an all encompassing role where internally you will also work collaboratively with the Digital team, Data and Insights team as well as the Donations Data Entry team to ensure the smooth execution of all direct marketing campaigns.

Externally you will work with the Partner agencies, Print and Fulfilment houses as well as other key suppliers. Here you will be responsible for:
  • Cross channel activity management through the following key channels: direct, mail, web/digital,\xc2\xa0media (print, outdoor, radio, TV)
  • Supporting project and activity briefing documents\xc2\xa0
  • Assisting with all creative and copy development aspects of campaigns, including management of internal stakeholder input/approvals
  • Direct Mail data checking and live laser sign offs\xc2\xa0

About you:
You are a self-starter, professional but personable, organised but creative and have a great understanding of direct marketing and a proven track record in a similar role either at another NFP company or Agency or just have a real passion for the NFP space. You will also possess the following:
  • Tertiary qualification and/or a proven track record in a similar NFP/charity or a strong desire to work in this sector with a proven track record of executing end to end direct marketing campaigns
  • Minimum of 2/3+years of end to end direct/digital marketing experience\xc2\xa0
  • Demonstrated experience in managing 3rd party suppliers (eg agencies, mail houses, designers) to achieve objectives in a timely and cost effective manner
  • Exceptional communication skills both written, verbal and presentation
  • Exceptional ability to deal with and influence key stakeholders both internal and external
  • A positive can do attitude with a solutions seeking mindset who can work well in a team environment and at the same time work autonomously
  • Strong attention to detail with highly developed time management and prioritisation skills
  • A willingness to learn and develop in the role

About the company:
My Client is a renowned\xc2\xa0Australian NFP whose primary vision is to improve the lives of people who need it most\xc2\xa0through food, shelter, clothing, support and most of all giving them a voice in society.\xc2\xa0


Apply now so we can discuss the role in more detail
John Corrigan | john@iknowho.com.au | 8925 9208 "

title: Digital Account Manager Planner Buyer
description:

title: Senior C++ Software Engineer - Trading Applications - Amazing Environment
description:
b'
This is an excellent opportunity for a talented Senior C++ Developer to work with an exciting Hedge Fund client, which offers one of the best working environments around. Small but very established, they only hire the very best.

We are seeking a Senior C++ Developer to join an\xc2\xa0existing high performance team. You will have extensive experience with C++ and have worked with modern Agile Techniques - Continuous Integration, Test Driven Development, etc.
\xc2\xa0
The candidate we are seeking will use their programming skills to develop state-of-the-art real-time, distributed applications to service trading requirements.\xc2\xa0The development environment is Windows, Visual Studio, C++ and MS SQL Server.\xc2\xa0Part of a small team of highly skilled developers you will be expected to produce high quality work, adhering to software development guidelines.

title: Billings Officer x 2 | West Ryde
description:
b"About Them
\xc2\xa0
A true ICONIC family owned company based close to Meadowbank are seeking the talents of 2 x hands on Billings Officers who are meticulous & down to earth. This is the perfect role where you'll work hard but also get the chance to work within a close-knit team who are lots of fun.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Day to Day

The primary purpose for these exciting roles will be to coordinate\xc2\xa0the smooth and accurate creation of Billings in accordance to the companies guidelines, targets and KPI's. Another focus will be to work within their busy Shared Services team. \xc2\xa0
  • Produce billings in accordance with associated departmental schedules and KPI's.
  • Provide reporting to identify areas of profit vulnerability and communicate with Divisional Teams as required.
  • Attend to Auditing, Analysis & Reconciliation requests\xc2\xa0by clients both internal and external.
  • Identify areas where efficiencies may be gained within processing functions and procedures.
  • Co-ordinate the preparation of invoicing from SMART, Powerforce, Microster, Great Plains, and Ebis
  • Ensure the accuracy of client information within the Billing databases.
  • Co-ordinate the daily functions of the Billing Team
  • Identify Training opportunities for Team members and implement same
  • Identify areas where process improvement may be of benefit and implement where required
  • Respond to and resolve queries within the acceptable timeframe as indicated within the divisional KPI's.
  • Provide professional and superior Customer Service to clients (internal and external)
  • Provide accurate and efficient Auditing, Analysis, Reconciliations and Reporting as required by clients (internal and external)
  • Liaise with clients to ensure accuracy of billing and that clients needs are met in accordance with billing requirements.
  • Monitor and maintain the accuracy of invoicing data within the various billing systems.
  • Ensure Billing Manager is informed where client dissatisfaction exists.
  • Raise invoicing adjustments as required.
  • Ensure fee increases are applied to customers as and when they fall due in an accurate manner.
  • Monitor and implement billing structures for Tender clients to ensure a smooth transition into our systems.
  • Co-ordinate billing schedules for all invoicing cycles
  • Identify Training opportunities
  • Identify areas where process improvement may be of benefit and implement where required
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
You'll Need
  • 3-5 years exp as a Billings Officer essential
  • Advanced Excel ESSENTIAL (proven test results will be required)
  • Billing system and process knowledge
  • Working in a team environment
  • Experience with new system implementation and development (desirable)
  • Good communicator - Convincing
  • Outcome driven
  • Target orientated
  • Organised
  • Focused - Excellent time management skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Initiative - Self starter / problem solver
  • Flexible - Adaptable to change
  • Team Player
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
"

title: Finance Assistant / Broker Support / Finance Executive

b"
  • Do you currently have experience in\xc2\xa0administration, finance, sales, retail or customer service roles?

If you're a highly motivated, target driven person looking to break into the finance and insurance market this could be for you.

If you have the required skills and the passion to join our team, please click APPLY ONLINE. Please do not apply if you do not meet these requirements.\xc2\xa0

You should only apply if you are looking for a long term career opportunity and are able to meet the requirements of the role.

Short-listed applicants will be contacted.

"

title: Lending Support Officer
description:
b'Mortgage House\xc2\xa0is, quite proudly, Australia's largest independent and privately owned Non-Bank Retail Lender.\xc2\xa0 We offer a wide range of financial products and services that are not only highly competitive, but offer true financial lifestyle benefits to our customers.

  • Handling data entry of lending applications and imaging/ scanning lending related documentation within privacy guidelines
  • Managing e-mails and correspondence to ensure they are actioned the same day
  • Maintaining and actioning items using inimitable systems and processes
  • Providing administrative support to the broader team as needed
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
We are looking for an engaged and highly motivated individual who enjoys working as part of a high performing team.
\xc2\xa0
You will receive full training and coaching with the view of expanding your career within the mortgage/lending arena.\xc2\xa0 We represent an open and highly collaborative environment where we reward and celebrate successes as a team, offer incentives and support each other to go further.\xc2\xa0

Take the first step and join Mortgage House today!
'

title: Procurement Specialist
description:
b"

Excellent permanent procurement opportunity , located in Sydney CBD. This role will offer the successful candidate a fantastic working environment.

About the company

MetLife are a leading provider of life insurance and retirement solutions, partnering with employers and super funds to help more Australians create a lifestyle they love.

This permanent role offers an amazing opportunity to join an organisation that is poised for growth as the next challenger brand in the Australian market, with a presence supporting customers in more than 40 countries worldwide and market leader in corporate insurance solutions in the US, Japan, Latin America, Asia, Europe and the Middle East.

Based in Sydney CBD, for the successful candidate this opportunity will offer a modern, fun and collaborative working environment, a good work/life balance, personal/professional development training and access to health and wellness programs.

About the role

The Procurement Specialist will be responsible for supporting the Corporate Services Manager and working with various stakeholders across Finance, IT, Marketing, Legal, Operations and regional offices.

This is an excellent opportunity for an energetic, enthusiastic procurement professional who is on the upward curve in their career looking to work towards a future in Procurement Management.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analysis, governance, sourcing, contract management, vendor management and purchasing
  • Maintaining up-to-date and accurate vendor/supplier list
  • Maintaining and building existing working relationships with Regional and Global Corporate Services offices
  • Keeping up to date with industry best practice to ensure highest benefit to the company
  • Stakeholder engagement - working internally and externally with stakeholders and suppliers
  • Data analysis to identify areas of opportunity, vendor listing , build consistent reporting
  • Drive annual savings through expense management - managing corporate cards and travel
  • Educate stakeholders on the sourcing process and procurement best practice
  • Negotiation and supplier relationship management - monitoring SLA agreements
  • Ability to negotiate and work on complex sourcing projects
  • Ability to understand and interpret contracts, due diligence, identify risk, partner with the Corporate Services Manager and Legal to develop and implement contracts
  • Work and collaborate with the group/regional procurement team and support group initiatives

Key Skills & Experience

  • Experience in end-to-end procurement
  • Demonstrated strong networking, influencing and negotiation skills
  • Attention to detail and demonstrated experience in managing and solving stakeholder issues
  • Experience ensuring and documenting due diligence on sourcing events
  • Customer service focused and ability to demonstrate the value of procurement
  • Working knowledge of contracts and the ability to liaise with legal counsel
  • Experience and demonstrated ability to deliver projects on time, identifying and overcoming obstacles and/or challenges
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Must have a proactive and flexible approach and a can do attitude
  • Experience is Ariba is desirable but not essential

MetLife offer a great place to work where you will be part of a professional team, with opportunities to grow both locally and globally.

To apply please click apply or call Mairead O'Halloran on +61 2 8289 3123 for a confidential discussion.

"
