title: Environment Coordinator
description:
b"

About us\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Link Group is one of Australia's leading fund administration and share registry specialists.\xc2\xa0 We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

About the role\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Working in our Group IT function you will coordinate the usage and management of various system and application environments.\xc2\xa0You will support the Systems Administration team, scheduled release upgrades and deployments; provide technical support to core business application environments and ensuring 24x7 availability for critical projects.\xc2\xa0This role is offered on a fixed term contract until June 2018

\xc2\xa0

Key responsibilities\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

  • Liaise with the appropriate stakeholders to coordinate the usage and management of various system and application environments
  • Maintain dashboards related to environment usage management, issue management, state of diagnosis, resolution, root cause analysis of issues and problems
  • Ensure IT Systems stability through suitable monitoring and capacity management reporting and provide IT support to business users\xc2\xa0 and ensure 24x7 availability of critical projects where required
  • Provide support to the System Administrators to implement and administer Enterprise Application servers, Databases and associated system environment solutions
  • Work with business users and IT colleagues to ensure timely resolutions are provided to identified issues
  • Contribute to improve efficiency of IT Operations process and procedure
  • Provide effective support and minimise downtime to the business by liaising with developers, back end support, database administrators and vendors
  • Collaborate with other team members to improve the overall performance delivered to customers
  • Participate in after hours and weekend support as and when required\xc2\xa0

The above list of key accountabilities is not an exhaustive list and may change from time-to-time based on business needs.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

About you\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

  • 3-5 years? experience in coordinating the support of large complex application environments in financial services industry
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills with the ability to translate complex technical issues to non-technical stakeholders
  • Previous experience of organising and chairing meetings with IT stakeholders
  • Experience of building and maintaining multiple application environment status dashboards
  • Experience in supporting multiple Application Servers including JBoss, Websphere, Weblogic, J2EE, Java, JSP, Apache and Tomcat
  • Knowledge of RDBMS and SQL
  • Background in financial services and securities industry such as Registry, Broking, Exchange, Superannuation or Trading highly regarded
  • Ability to work on call after hours and weekend in a rostered 24x7 environment as and when required\xc2\xa0

Joining our team\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

At Link we believe our people are our MOST important asset. We offer excellent career progression opportunities, ongoing training and development, competitive salary, staff recognition programs, salary continuance insurance and discounted healthcare.\xc2\xa0

"

title: Manager - Evidence Based Services
description:
b"

We\xe2\x80\x99re working relentlessly to give vulnerable and at-risk children brighter futures.

Have you got what it takes to help us transform lives?

  • Use your Social Work / Psychology experience to make a difference to the lives of Australian Children
  • Develop your career alongside sector leaders at this high performing non-profit
  • Enjoy salary packaging options, training and development options and generous additional leave

About us

For more than 160 years OzChild has been looking after children who are vulnerable, and supporting their families and the community to ensure a better future for all...

Every year, we work with over 6,000 children, young people and their families to achieve safety, wellbeing and permanency. We do this through the delivery of evidence informed foster and kinship care and a range of early intervention and prevention services that are aimed at strengthening family functioning.

The Opportunity

We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for an experienced Manager who wants to be part of an ambitious organisation who are leading and influencing sector change.

As the NSW Manager of Evidence Based Services you will be accountable for the operational leadership of our evidence based programs in NSW.

Some of the duties working in this role will include:

  • Working closely with the program developers and implementation support providers to set up, implementation and ensure sustainability of these new services by adherence to the developer\xe2\x80\x99s requirements.
  • Team leadership and hands on coaching to ensure employees in the programs have the resources, skills and support to deliver the services within the fidelity standards provided by the developers and implementation support team.
  • Ensure outcome measurements and data management systems are successfully established and utilised to ensure optimum program performance. Reporting on all outcomes, cost effectiveness and overall success of the program and communicating these to relevant internal and external stakeholders.
  • Develop a productive relationship with FACS by ensuring OzChild achieves excellent outcomes for children and families by ensuring a high quality implementation of any adopted EBP\xe2\x80\x99s, providing timely and accurate performance dashboards and being proactive and responsive in addressing implementation challenges including feedback from FACS.
  • Develop collaborative and respectful working relationships with Aboriginal lead agencies to ensure cultural safety in our practice to achieve positive outcomes for Aboriginal children, young people and their families.
  • Proactive stakeholder management with key internal and external stakeholders who are required to be informed of outcomes, compliance to accreditation standards and integration with other internal services. You will also be required to develop networks and partnership within FACS, other government bodies and other community welfare agencies.
  • You will need to provide positive leadership to all employees of the Evidence Based Services team encouraging a team approach, professional practices, removing barriers to allow them the autonomy to roll out the programs as per their training and consultation to achieve positive outcomes for clients. This will be managed by:
  • Developing a strong team that is built on inclusiveness and respectfulness operating with a high level of professional management in a complex and demanding environment.
  • Conduct meetings with supervisors to ensure all employees are receiving the appropriate support resources and to ensure clinical practice meets contract expectations and to review employees\xe2\x80\x99 competency needs.
  • Manage all people, risk and quality policy and practice matters as they relate to your services and the standards OzChild works with. Establish and review quality, OHS and risk management systems for the program.
  • Contribute to OzChild\xe2\x80\x99s growth strategy and assist in establishing the delivery of Evidence Based Services in different geographical locations both in New South Wales and interstate.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll be part of a collaborative and supportive work culture and operate in an environment underpinned by integrity and honesty. Our commitment to our staff is to provide them with opportunity to be part of a team that sets one another up for success; opportunity to thrive in their career and; opportunity to be part of positive change to children, young people and their families lives.

We will recognise your dedication, skills and knowledge with generous salary packaging, additional leave entitlements and continuous training and support. In joining an industry leader, you\xe2\x80\x99ll also have opportunities to develop and progress your career further in the future.

The successful applicant will be required to complete a National Police History Check and Working With Children Check.

OzChild is an equal opportunity employer and encourages individuals of diverse backgrounds to apply. This includes, but is not limited to, those from the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse and GLBTIQ communities.

To submit your application in strict confidence, click the 'apply' button. If you require further information, please contact Nathan Mills on 02 8083 8929.

To view all Austra Health job opportunities visit www.austrahealth.com.au

"

title: Junior Quantitative Analyst - High Frequency Trading
description:
b'
  • Quantitative Trading Strategies
  • Sydney Location
  • Competitive Salary Package + Incentives


A unique opportunity has transpired for a junior or entry level graduates in quantitative trading to work for a global proprietary trading firm as a quantitative analyst. With an outstanding presence in Asia Pacific, Europe and the UK, my client boosts an impressive team of dedicated quantitative traders, analysts and computational scientists.


Headquartered in the UK, the quantitative trading division has rapidly expanded with the intention of continually evolving their trading strategies in Asia Pacific. To ensure this growth they are seeking junior quantitative analysts with experience in developing trading strategies. Preferably these strategies will be developed using either Bayesian inference, Kalman filters, data mining techniques, stochastic processes, Fourier transform, time series or theoretical and computational physics based models. We are also seeking candidates with a strong programming background in either Python, C++ or R.


This would also be a fantastic opportunity for a PhD graduate or post-doctorate in computer science, theoretical physics (nuclear, astrophysics, plasma, computational, particle, quantum, mechanical, bio and atomic) or engineering (aeronautical, mechanical, mechatronics, electric, acoustical, thermal and nano) with good programming skills in either Python, C++ or R. For entry level candidates, a passion and keen interest in financial markets is highly desirable. Otherwise candidates with experience in statistical arbitrage or high frequency will be highly regarded.

Please note that in order to be considered for the role candidates must have a High Disinction Average in their undergraduate degree. Candidates must also submit academic transcripts. This can be submitted through the cover letter section.


For more information please contact Maria Shevelev at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2612

( SK912965A )

IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.

http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

'

title: Producer/Project Manager
description:
b"

As Project Manager, you will be a key member of the delivery team working closely with and

reporting into the Director Delivery

& Operations on specific clients and their related projects.

Your primary role is to ensure that all Edge work is delivered on time and within budget. Your role

encompasses technically skilled project management, and a combination of account, production

and creative management.

You are highly organised, a creative problem solver and a doer \xe2\x80\x93 someone who isn't afraid to roll

up their sleeves or pick up the phone and get things done. You will manage a number of projects

at any one time and selfmanage

your time effectively to prioritise and deliver requests for each.

The Project Manager tends to own the endtoend

production of a project once the strategy,

overarching idea, and creative direction has been signed off and set. Prior to this point, the

Account Director/Manager will be the lead.

You:

\xc2\xb7 are a rigorous and logical thinker

\xc2\xb7 are creative and able to think around problems

\xc2\xb7 have impeccable attention to detail

\xc2\xb7 have strong presentation skills

\xc2\xb7 have good business skills

\xc2\xb7 have good written and spoken communication skills, able to articulate concepts clearly,

succinctly and convincingly to the internal teams where necessary

\xc2\xb7 are able to work well as part of a team, with a range of people

\xc2\xb7 have a good memory for facts and figures

\xc2\xb7 have numerical ability

\xc2\xb7 have computer skills

\xc2\xb7 have stamina and drive

\xc2\xb7 are able to work to tight deadlines

\xc2\xb7 have a smart appearance and professional manner

\xc2\xb7 are persuasive and diplomatic

\xc2\xb7 are naturally inquisitive and eager to learn

\xc2\xb7 have good negotiating skills

\xc2\xb7 are passionate about the industry, consumers and creativity

\xc2\xb7 have a good, if not some knowledge of all the main digital

and print processes and procedures

\xc2\xb7 proactively develop an understanding of new technologies and the process involved in

delivering them.

CORERESPONSIBILITIES

\xef\x82\xb7 Produce projects endtoend

\xe2\x80\x93 from production brief through to finished product

\xef\x82\xb7 Create cost estimates for projects based on brief

\xef\x82\xb7 Manage the budget and deliver to it, identifying cost savings where possible

\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare project schedules (timelines and milestones)

\xef\x82\xb7 Manage project schedules to deliver on time

\xef\x82\xb7 Monitor project lifecycle

\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare and share task, dev, or production briefs

\xef\x82\xb7 Coordinate

internal meetings and project reviews

\xef\x82\xb7 Client management, either as standalone projects or in partnership with an AD

\xef\x82\xb7 Plan resources based on project plans and budget, balanced with capacity

\xef\x82\xb7 Monitor timesheet data to ensure that we are not over servicing clients and/or underresourcing

projects. Identify efficiencies and opportunities to adjust client retainers.

\xef\x82\xb7 Involve department heads at quotation, QA and signoff

stages

\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare comprehensive Statement of Work documents for projects up to the value of $150k

\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare risk assessment documentation to support projects

\xef\x82\xb7 Control change request and scope creep

\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure contracts, NDAs, and any other paperwork as required is completed, signed and

stored safely

\xef\x82\xb7 Work to ensure client retention achieved through delivery on brief

\xef\x82\xb7 Apply flexibility in managing numerous projects

\xef\x82\xb7 Where possible, understand your clients' business, goals, deliverables and strategies

\xef\x82\xb7 Take light/production focused briefs and identify and develop new business opportunities

where they present themselves from clients

\xef\x82\xb7 Source and manage external freelancers

\xef\x82\xb7 Involvement in the UX and IA of digital projects

\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare callsheets

\xef\x82\xb7 Running casting sessions

NB. We do not expect expertise in all of these disciplines, but would expect expertise in at least

one, and would appreciate a willingness to learn.

Financialresponsibility

\xe2\x80\xa2 Create accurate cost estimates with input from department heads or key team members

\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure budgets are reviewed Director Delivery & Operations, Account Director, Client

Services Director (CSD) and Finance Director (FD) where required

\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor, analyse and feedback timesheet data on all projects

\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor profitability and look for ways to achieve it

\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage cost budget effectively

\xe2\x80\xa2 Handle and communicate change requests/scope creep clearly to client

\xe2\x80\xa2 Inform/notify invoicing based on billing schedule where applicable

\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all budgeted hours are uptodate

on resource capacity sheet

\xe2\x80\xa2 Input key milestones into project management workflow tool

\xe2\x80\xa2 Inform forecasting

Strategicandcommunicationplanning

\xc2\xb7 Clear and regular communication with team delivering project \xe2\x80\x93 includes briefing, budgeted

time allocations, reviews

\xc2\xb7 Understanding and ability to interpret briefs in any media

\xc2\xb7 Ensure QA plan is referred to and monitored

Leadership\xc2\xa8managementandcommunicationsskills

\xc2\xb7 Ability to argue point of view coherently and concisely and provide clear & constructive

feedback

\xc2\xb7 Is motivating and inspiring to others, brings out best in others and is a positive role model

\xc2\xb7 Can manage conflict effectively both internally and with the client

Edgeprocess

\xc2\xb7 Adherence to agreed processes

\xc2\xb7 Represent Edge to the highest standards and to promote company values

\xc2\xb7 Clear reporting to line manager: contact reports, financial updates, timesheets etc

\xc2\xb7 Content publishing orientation: passionate about the subject and enjoys talking about it

\xc2\xb7 Proactive in taking on responsibilities within the agency

\xc2\xb7 Build relationships with other departments

Competencies

\xc2\xb7 Cheerful and energetic

\xc2\xb7 Amazing attention to detail

\xc2\xb7 Super organised

\xc2\xb7 Naturally inquisitive and eager to learn

\xc2\xb7 Calm when under pressure

\xc2\xb7 Neutrality across all business projects

\xc2\xb7 Tactful at handling conflict

"

title: Business Development and Sales Manager
description:
b'

We are looking for a results-driven and highly motivated BDM with a flair for sales and business acumen to expand a Sydney-based local clinical orthodontic practice (Clean Clear & Correct Smiles) as well as its\xc2\xa0inter-related business (Best Orthodontic Seminars & Sessions) which delivers education and mentoring to dentists and allied health\xc2\xa0professionals with an immense\xc2\xa0potential for global expansion.

Key benefits - Work alongside results focussed and excellence driven\xc2\xa0leader in the field of Orthodontics and eventually progress the role to salary + commission\xc2\xa0as opportunities and sales increase. \xc2\xa0Incentives can be negotiated for financial targets and growth achieved.\xc2\xa0

Our clients are multi-varied,\xc2\xa0extending from\xc2\xa0general public to\xc2\xa0dentists, health professionals and dental industry managers & leaders. Pleasing personality and ability to communicate with people from all walks of life is very important.\xc2\xa0

The over-arching objectives of this role will be to -\xc2\xa0

1. Increase Revenue

2. Improve Team Competency

3. Identify cost-saving opportunities\xc2\xa0and improving profitability

4. Develop & execute efficient Ways of Woking

The main duties of the successful candidate as the Business Development Manager are summarized as follows:

New Business Development

  • Prospect for potential new clients and turn this into increased business.\xc2\xa0
  • Cold call as appropriate within your market or geographic area to ensure a robust pipeline of opportunities. * Meet potential clients by growing, maintaining, and leveraging your network.\xc2\xa0
  • Identify potential clients, and the decision makers within the client organization.\xc2\xa0
  • Research and build relationships with new clients.\xc2\xa0
  • Set up meetings between client decision makers and company's practice leaders/Principals.\xc2\xa0
  • Plan approaches and pitches. * Work with team to develop proposals that speaks to the client's needs, concerns, and objectives.\xc2\xa0
  • Participate in pricing the solution/service.\xc2\xa0
  • Handle objections by clarifying, emphasizing agreements and working through differences to a positive conclusion. * Use a variety of styles to persuade or negotiate appropriately.\xc2\xa0
  • Present an image that mirrors that of the client.\xc2\xa0

Client Retention

  • Present new products and services and enhance existing relationships.\xc2\xa0
  • Create new clients from exisiting client networks and referrals.
  • Create systems and protocols for client feedback and incorporating these in business strategies.

Business Development Planning

  • Attend industry functions, such as association events and conferences, and provide feedback and information on market and creative trends.\xc2\xa0
  • Present to and consult with mid and senior level management on business trends with a view to developing new services, products, and distribution channels.\xc2\xa0
  • Identify opportunities for campaigns, services, and distribution channels that will lead to an increase in sales.\xc2\xa0
  • Using knowledge of the market and competitors, identify and develop the company's unique selling propositions and differentiators.\xc2\xa0

Management and Research

  • Submit weekly progress reports and ensure data is accurate.\xc2\xa0
  • Establish CRM for the companies.
  • Ensure that data is accurately entered and managed within the company's CRM or other sales management system.\xc2\xa0
  • Forecast sales targets and ensure they are met by the team.\xc2\xa0
  • Track and record activity on accounts and help to close deals to meet these targets.\xc2\xa0
  • Work with marketing staff and creative designers to ensure that prerequisites (like prequalification or getting on a vendor list) are fulfilled within a timely manner.\xc2\xa0
  • Ensure all team members represent the company in the best light.\xc2\xa0
  • Present business development training, sales training and mentoring to business developers and other internal staff.\xc2\xa0
  • Research and develop a thorough understanding of the company's people and capabilities.\xc2\xa0
  • Understand the company's goal and purpose so that will continual to enhance the company's performance.\xc2\xa0

Education

This position requires a minimum of a bachelor's degree in Business or Management\xc2\xa0with atleast\xc2\xa03-5 years of proven sales or marketing experience. An MBA is preferable but not essential.

Other Skills and Qualifications

Networking, Persuasion, Prospecting, Public Speaking, Research, Writing, Closing Skills, Motivation for Sales, Prospecting Skills, Sales Planning, Identification of Customer Needs and Challenges, Territory Management, Market Knowledge, Meeting Sales Goals, Professionalism, CRM, and Microsoft Office.

HOURS - negotiable from part-time to full-time depending on the candidate. Weekend work and ability to\xc2\xa0travel nationally and internationally is a must. Own car/transport is also required.

'

title: Administration Assistant
description:
b"

About the Company

TPG Telecom Limited is a highly successful telecommunications business listed on the ASX. We have one of the largest internet, data and voice networks in the country, and we offer some of the most competitive products in the market to a range of customers including residential, SMEs, large corporates and many government institutions. Our business now has over two million customers and approximately 6,000 employees. We are continuing to invest in our people and our network infrastructure to cater for further expansion of our business.

About the Role

We require an enthusiastic and dedicated individual to coordinate our employee's business travel needs, manage employee mobile device services and hardware, and assist the Payroll team with administrative support. This position reports to the Payroll Supervisor and is located at TPG's head office in Macquarie Park. Working hours are 9 am to 5.30 pm, Monday to Friday.

This is a highly administrative and at times repetitive role as you would be required to:

  • Complete business travel requests, this includes domestic and international flights, accommodation, car hire bookings primarily using a third party booking system.
  • Manage the allocation, dispatch and issues associated with the company's supply of mobile handsets and services for it's employees.
  • Assist with the review and maintain the company's time and attendance system.
  • Filing and other general administrative duties.

Opportunities to progress with broader responsibilities are likely to be available for the right person during their employment with the business.

About the Person

This entry level role is ideal for someone living local to the Macquarie Park area, seeking permanent full time work with a stable and successful business.

The successful candidate must have:

  • Customer Service or Office Administration experience,
  • Strong IT/computer skills are essential,
  • Excellent English written and oral communication skills,
  • Confident phone communication and interpersonal skills,
  • A high level of attention to detail,
  • Strong organisation and time management skills,
  • Ability to multitask and prioritise tasks appropriately,
  • A professional, positive can-do attitude with effective team work skills.
  • Ability to maintain at all times the highest levels of confidentiality, honesty and integrity.

Experience using the following systems and applications is not essential but will be highly regarded:

  • Microsoft Outlook
  • Corporate Traveller

For more information about TPG Telecom please visit www.tpg.com.au.

Only persons with unlimited rights to work in Australia will be considered.

Due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

This role is currently not open to introductions from recruitment agencies, thank you.

"

title: Accounts Payable Officer
description:
b'

About the business and the role

Our client is based in a newly furnished office and has been operating in Australia for many years, successfully providing its customers with its products and services they need to succeed.

To be a part of this success story you must have 3-5+ years Accounts Payable experience within a shared services environment.

Job tasks and responsibilities

Reporting to the Accounts Payable Manager you will be responsible for the full Accounts Payable function.

This includes:

  • Beginning to end Accounts Payable duties
  • Processing and payments of all supplier invoices in AUD and foreign currency
  • Responsibility for all related party payments/netting
  • Reconciliation
  • Supplier Statements
  • Produce FX gain and loss reporting
  • Assist in cashflow forecast
  • And\xc2\xa0much more!

Skills and experience

The successful candidate will have:

  • Minimum 3-5 years Accounts Payable experience
  • Working knowledge and understanding of SAP system and Dynamic AX Systems
  • Excellent reconciliation skills using Excel - Pivot Tables & VLookUp knowledge, essential!
  • Strong understanding of Accounts Payable principles
  • Demonstrable experience in a Shared Service environment in a large organisation
  • Excellent communication and high level customer service skills
  • High attention to detail with excellent problem solving ability
  • Strong speed and accuracy data entry skills
  • Demonstrable interpersonal skills to work independently as well as part of a team
  • Ability to work to tight deadlines, to prioritise workload accordingly and timely execution of completion of tasks

This great career opportunity is one not to be missed! APPLY NOW!

'

title: Engineer Professional 1/2 (Civil or Environmental)
advertiser: The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation
description:
b'Engineer (Civil or Environmental)
Manly Hydraulics, Public Works
\xc2\xa0
  • Great opportunity for a tertiary qualified Civil or Environmental Engineer
  • Ongoing role with a great team based in Manly, some travel may be required
  • Salary package to $63k?95k (Professional Grade 1/2)
\xc2\xa0
This is a great opportunity to join a supportive team of professional Engineers delivering specialist water and civil infrastructure projects and services to the community.\xc2\xa0 With the opportunity to work on projects involving flood and estuary modeling, experience in both physical and numerical hydraulic modeling is essential.\xc2\xa0

Who are We?
Manly Hydraulics Laboratory (MHL) provides specialist services in the areas of water, sewer, stormwater, irrigation, coastal and environmental solutions including physical and numerical modelling investigations and delivery of extensive data collection programs.
\xc2\xa0
To be successful in this role, you will:\xc2\xa0
  • Have a strong customer service focus with the ability to meet challenging deadlines
  • Have the ability to think outside the square and be solutions focused\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Be Degree qualified in Civil or Environmental Engineering\xc2\xa0
  • Have demonstrated experience in both physical and numerical hydraulic modelling\xc2\xa0
  • Have sound written and verbal communication skills
  • Ideally have computer programming experience
You will be rewarded with the opportunity to work on interesting projects in a collaborative team environment while providing innovative solutions to clients.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Learn more by reviewing the Role Description. If you have any further questions, please contact Bronson McPherson, on 02 9949 0244.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Click here for more information about Manly Hydraulics Laboratory which forms part of the Department of Finance, Services & Innovation.

title: Engineer Professional 1/2 (Civil or Environmental)
advertiser: The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation
description:
b'Engineer (Civil or Environmental)
Manly Hydraulics, Public Works
\xc2\xa0
  • Great opportunity for a tertiary qualified Civil or Environmental Engineer
  • Ongoing role with a great team based in Manly, some travel may be required
  • Salary package to $63k?95k (Professional Grade 1/2)
\xc2\xa0
This is a great opportunity to join a supportive team of professional Engineers delivering specialist water and civil infrastructure projects and services to the community.\xc2\xa0 With the opportunity to work on projects involving flood and estuary modeling, experience in both physical and numerical hydraulic modeling is essential.\xc2\xa0

Who are We?
Manly Hydraulics Laboratory (MHL) provides specialist services in the areas of water, sewer, stormwater, irrigation, coastal and environmental solutions including physical and numerical modelling investigations and delivery of extensive data collection programs.
\xc2\xa0
To be successful in this role, you will:\xc2\xa0
  • Have a strong customer service focus with the ability to meet challenging deadlines
  • Have the ability to think outside the square and be solutions focused\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • Be Degree qualified in Civil or Environmental Engineering\xc2\xa0
  • Have demonstrated experience in both physical and numerical hydraulic modelling\xc2\xa0
  • Have sound written and verbal communication skills
  • Ideally have computer programming experience
You will be rewarded with the opportunity to work on interesting projects in a collaborative team environment while providing innovative solutions to clients.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Learn more by reviewing the Role Description. If you have any further questions, please contact Bronson McPherson, on 02 9949 0244.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Click here for more information about Manly Hydraulics Laboratory which forms part of the Department of Finance, Services & Innovation.

title: Senior Systems Analyst
description:
b'The role of Senior Analyst, Data & Reporting is accountable for the maintenance and strategic development of the data and system architecture.

YOU\xc2\xa0

To be appointed, you will have demonstrated:
\xc2\xa0
  • Experience in development of operating models within investment management.
  • A high level of experience in front-office order management systems and the broader systems architecture interacting with them.
  • Understanding of best-practice in data governance frameworks and procedures.
  • Experience in strategic management of data and systems vendor relationships.
  • Experience in contemporary DevOps practices relating to architectural change and code release.
  • Broad familiarity with differentiated asset classes and associated financial instruments.
  • Appropriate tertiary qualifications

THE ROLE

\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure internal architecture is industry best practice and remains compliant with ongoing regulatory changes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continue to develop a robust governance framework to ensure future changes to data sets or systems are implemented with minimal operating risk and are well communicated\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure a clear set of design principles for ongoing internal systems development
\xe2\x80\xa2 Adherence and contribution to internal control framework to meet compliance policies and mitigate key risks within the team
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage internal queries to ensure data accuracy
Participate in development and maintenance of core processes and procedures covering the team functions
\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa2 Build and maintain effective relationships with external providers (including custodian / middle office provider, system & data vendors, auditors and member administration) with aim of achieving FSS business outcomes.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the management of vendors & service providers by monitoring agreed deliverables & timing, updating issue & open query logs and providing general feedback for regular review meetings.
Trouble shoot with various data providers ensuring high integrity/quality and accuracy of the data '

title: Customer Experience Manager
description:
b"

Genesis Energy is New Zealand's largest electricity and gas retailer, supplying energy to more than 650,000 customer connections across New Zealand. We are rethinking, refreshing and reimagining how we use energy in everyday life as the convergence of digital applications, low-cost solar and the development of battery storage is gaining pace and leading to greater choice, convenience and control for our customers.

We have a newly created opportunity for an experienced and ambitious Customer Experience Manager. This is a senior, critical role with responsibility to develop and deliver a customer experience that is built through understanding our customers, through measurement, data and insights.\xc2\xa0

Reporting to the Executive General Manager Customer Operations in Hamilton you will play a key part of the Customer Operations Leadership team in addition to being the conduit between Customer Operations and other key stakeholders across Genesis Energy. In addition to setting the strategic direction for customer experience it's essential that you have a strong delivery focus and are happy to get your 'hands dirty'. Ultimately this role is accountable for delivering an experience that drives customer loyalty for the future of Genesis Energy Brands products, services and that adds significant value to the business.

To be considered for this role you will demonstrate the following skills and experience:

  • At least ten years' experience in senior operational management roles in similarity large, complex contact centre environments within customer centric organisations (such as Telco, Banking, and Insurance).
  • Experience in leading and coaching teams to drive high engagement, personal development and high performance, and experience leading significant change within a contact centre environment.
  • Demonstrated influencing and stakeholder management skills, strength of character and a strong, credible track record of delivery and excellence in execution.
  • Experience working cross functionally to deliver strategic goals, and customer experience enhancement.
  • A tertiary qualification in business, commerce or similar is preferred and experience in working within an Agile Framework would be advantageous.

We are embarking on a transformative journey to re-imagine energy, so that customers come to see Genesis Energy as their first choice for energy management. If you're a customer centric, driven individual who wants to join the start of this transformative journey, then this is an exciting time to come on board.

We reward our staff with a strong remuneration and benefits package, a collaborative, high performance culture and ongoing leadership and development opportunities. Please apply online.

"

title: NA
description:
b'

An inspired career is life's best accessory.

Tiffany & Co., a Symbol of Excellence. The name instills images of Beauty, Romance and Effortless Style. For over 175 years, Tiffany has created a legacy of exquisite designs and romantic ideals.

An exciting opportunity is available within our Human Resources team for a\xc2\xa0Human Resources Coordinator. This is a truly varied role where you will support\xc2\xa0all facets of Human Resources.\xc2\xa0You will find yourself collaborating with a highly talented team on work that's challenging, engaging and incredibly rewarding. You will be trusted, empowered and supported to make a lasting impact on the very future of our Australia and New Zealand market.\xc2\xa0It's a chance to use your knowledge, skills and experience to shine brightly and achieve your ambitions.

Since 1837. Join the Legacy.

Based at our beautiful Martin Place office and reporting directly to the Director - Human Resources,\xc2\xa0Australia and New Zealand, this role will be\xc2\xa0responsible\xc2\xa0for\xc2\xa0providing administrative support to the Human Resources team.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Providing accurate and timely general administrative HR support\xc2\xa0
  • Supporting all employees with a variety of HR queries
  • Maintaining currency and accuracy of HRIS\xc2\xa0
  • Supporting\xc2\xa0the Talent Acquisition Specialist with recruitment for\xc2\xa0all positions, including conducting interviews, background and reference checks
  • Facilitating the offer and onboarding process for new hires
  • Data collection, reporting and\xc2\xa0analysis of HR metrics, specifically: employee turnover, employee onboarding/exit data, compensation, performance
  • Executing and promoting compliance of all Tiffany policies and procedures

A career with Tiffany? Say Yes.

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • Minimum of 3\xc2\xa0years' full-time Human Resource generalist experience, preferably in a retail environment
  • Bachelor's degree in\xc2\xa0Human Resources or related discipline
  • Demonstrated experience in recruitment administration, in particular high-volume recruitment
  • Previous experience in\xc2\xa0employee relations and data reporting/analysis is essential\xc2\xa0
  • Must be organized, detail oriented, autonomous and collaborative and able to handle multiple priorities\xc2\xa0
  • Strong influencing, interpersonal, communication, problem solving, follow-up and creative solution generation skills
  • Previous experience with HRIS, and candidate management systems
  • Strong computer skills with MS Office

To thrive in this role, you will enjoy working with data, streamlining processes, and pride yourself on your attention to detail. Equally important is a\xc2\xa0sense of humour and an interest in fashion.

If this sounds like you, this is a great opportunity to join a global luxury organization at an exciting year of growth.

In return for your hard work, we offer a competitive salary, benefits and a friendly, professional work environment in the heart of Sydney's CBD.

Blue Box. White Ribbon. That's a wrap.

'

title: Finance Business Analyst
description:
b'Reporting directly to the Business Analyst the primary focus of your role would be to create and update dashboards for management monitoring. You will be required to identify and report trends, spikes and anomalies from using high volume transactional data and\xc2\xa0identify and articulate changes required to improve data quality monitoring.
\xc2\xa0
You must be an effective communicator and be able to work undependably and well within a team. You will business partner with operational teams within the business and be responsible for assisting with any queries. You will be responsible for establishing reporting format for new reports suite and monitoring and evaluating reports based on parameters for issue.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
It is essential that you have advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables/Graphs/Charts, Formatting/Formulas) and are able to build reports using different software applications. You will also be required to design and create presentations.\xc2\xa0It is essential that you have an understanding and knowledge in standardised processes and \xc2\xa0Corporate Systems.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
This is an exciting role within a creative and dynamic organisation. If you have the relevant experience please contact Emily Sharkey on 9775 5919 or click "apply" to submit your CV. '

title: Supply Chain Analyst
description:
b'

My client is an FMCG leader based in Sydney, they are going through an exciting stage of growth and are looking for an experienced Supply Chain Analyst to join the team. This is a great opportunity to join a forward thinking, ambitious, analytical\xc2\xa0and positive team and really make a difference.\xc2\xa0

Main Function

To work on a variety of projects including Supply Chain, Customer Operations Transformation, Analytics and Information Management to drive efficiency throughout the\xc2\xa0value chain.

Main Accountabilities

Supply Chain Analytics:

  • Conduct qualitative analysis and business insights.
  • Capturing data from APO, BI, WMS and transport systems for Numerical Analysis and reporting.
  • Provide accurate information on Supply Chain Key Performance Indicators and productivity.
  • Present analytical reports to key internal stakeholders to drive CI improvement initiatives.
  • Influence leaders by providing accurate data analysis, interpretation, with well-founded insights.\xc2\xa0
  • Impact and influence key decisions throughout the project life cycle in conjunction with senior leaders.
  • Identify new reports, dashboards and to highlight opportunities in efficiency and cost reduction.
  • Initiate and drive simplification to existing reports.

Continuous Improvement:

Reporting to the CI Lead you will conduct change impact analysis and support CI manager with change deliverables for business change initiatives. Specifically you will be responsible for:

  • Gathering change opportunities from Supply Chain and wider team.
  • Developing, recommending and preparing detailed Change Impact Assessments.
  • Analysis of longer term business impacts.
  • Participate in project health checks.
  • Lead peers in the development of process documentation related to Supply Chain procedures and systems, forecasting, and inventory planning.
  • Ensure consistency and clarity so all processes stay current and are updated on schedule.

Stakeholder Management:

  • Liaise with AU and NZ Supply chain teams
  • Respond to Sales and Marketing enquiries \xe2\x80\x93 Reporting and analysing data

Working\xc2\xa0with:

  • Logistics Team \xe2\x80\x93 all
  • Sales
  • ANZ\xc2\xa0Logistics
  • Third party co-packers

Essential:

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Inventory and planning experience in fast moving supply chain environment.
  • Advanced SAP R3 experience.
  • Advanced Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Advanced Business Objects and Business Explorer.
  • Strong negotiation, influencing and communication skills.
  • Achiever who can demonstrate key results.

If this role is of interest please click "APPLY" or call James Slaven on 0414668181 for a confidential chat.

Please note only candidates with full working rights in Australia with relevant experience\xc2\xa0will be contacted.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Digital Recruitment Consultant
description:
b"When you join Paxus a leading provider of technology and digital talent, you will see what sets us apart from our competitors. We have longstanding relationships with clients going back decades and exceptionally long tenure of staff. We are our proud of reputation as we provide staffing solutions to some of the biggest names in industry.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join our successful team located in North Sydney as recruitment consultant for the Digital division.

Our Digital practice is the newest and most exciting addition to our successful brand. Our Digital team works with a broad spectrum of clients - from start ups to SME's to Blue Chips. \xc2\xa0Our digital expertise covers the digital talent landscape: eCommerce, marketing, strategy, UX and UI, web and data analytics and everything in between. \xc2\xa0

This is a complete 360 recruitment role which requires you to be both client and candidate facing. We are looking for recruiters who want to work within the digital space and we are happy to consider consultants who have worked in different sectors who are interested in joining the digital space. No recruitment experience, that's ok, if you have a good understanding of all things 'Digital' we'd love to speak with you.\xc2\xa0

At\xc2\xa0Paxus, it's not about working long hours, it's all about results. We offer great rewards and incentives and the chance to earn significant commission in this rapidly expanding market.\xc2\xa0

What we want:
  • Passion for growing a new market in our up and coming Digital division
  • Strong exposure to Digital in a sale environment\xc2\xa0
  • Ability to provide\xc2\xa0innovative staffing solutions to clients
  • A strong track record in building sales pipelines
When you join Paxus you will enjoy;
  • A high profile and well trusted brand
  • Long standing professional relationships with our clients with exclusive and preferred supplier agreements
  • Established operations with embedded business processes which support your success
  • Our highly successful, fun, friendly and flexible working environment
  • Fantastic incentive program, sales comps and access to multiple reward avenues.
If you are looking to join a great company with a focus on quality, which fosters success, professional growth and offers genuine rewards for success, this is your opportunity.
\xc2\xa0

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Sarah Strahan on 03 86804354. Please quote our job reference number: 226104. "

title: Workforce and Resource Planner - Advisory Oceania Sydney/Melbourne
description:
b"The\xc2\xa0Workforce and Resource Planner\xc2\xa0is a resource management and workforce planning specialist who works in our Advisory Service Line.\xc2\xa0 The role is to ensure we maximise business performance and deliver on our talent promise through proactive management of our talent pool. This is obtained by:

  • Allocating the right people, to the right role, at the right time
  • Supporting project demand prioritisation and supply augmentation
  • Identifying and providing insight in regards to workforce planning and skills, capability and trends

The\xc2\xa0Workforce and Resource Planner\xc2\xa0acts as the key contact for the talent pools strategic experience allocation and capacity management.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

The Workforce and Resource\xc2\xa0Planner uses their specialist knowledge and relationships to ensure we maximise productivity and develop our talent through their on the job experiences.

In your role you\xe2\x80\x99ll:

  • Allocate staff in a dynamic ever-changing environment
  • Monitor staff availability through the firm's resource management system (Retain)
  • Deliver timely staffing solutions for our client projects
  • Assist our people to get on the job experiences to enable their development and growth
  • Escalate skill gaps for recruiting and upskill opportunities
  • Assist leadership providing key information on their resource pools and becoming a trusted advisor in resourcing matters
  • Stakeholder Management \xe2\x80\x93 Responsible for managing key relationships within the talent pool and leadership
  • Pipeline & Demand management \xe2\x80\x93 Ensuring direct connectivity between pursuits teams and the experience manager
  • Talent pool management & experience optimisation \xe2\x80\x93 Actively managing bench, available capacity by understanding capability and proactively identifying opportunities for all available resources
  • Experience optimisation \xe2\x80\x93 Highlighting capability outside the home talent pool via cross-functional, cross-border or cross-region allocation to maximise productivity
  • Experience management \xe2\x80\x93 Promoting identification and delivery of career experiences as part of every engagement
  • Leakage management and data quality \xe2\x80\x93 Ensuring ubiquitous and effective use of key enablers and data quality that supports rapid decisions
  • EYU & Development \xe2\x80\x93 Building individual capability and personal brand through a detailed development plan that deliver the learning, coaching and experiences needed to grow
  • Continuous improvement \xe2\x80\x93 Supporting roll out of initiatives on behalf of the resourcing leader and identifying opportunities to improve team performance
About you
\xc2\xa0
We are looking for people with the following experiences:

  • Experience in resource management and planning or business operations within professional services environments
  • Refined relationship and stakeholder management skills
  • Strong knowledge of business systems and refined data analysis skills
  • Experience working closely with colleagues in a high-performing team
  • Strong communication (both written and oral) and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrates a positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Strong personal integrity and adherence to strict confidentiality
  • Able to build relationships at all levels
About us
\xc2\xa0
EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world, to help create wider economic and social benefits today, and a strong legacy for a better tomorrow.
\xc2\xa0
Apply now\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Across every part of EY, we dig deeper in pursuit of better working. Does better begin with you? Click apply online to find out. For a confidential discussion please email Suzie Barker on suzie.barker@au.ey.com
\xc2\xa0
The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by Ernst & Young or by their external third party provider.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa9 2017 Ernst & Young Australia. All Rights Reserved.

"

title: Junior - Mid Level Software Engineer
description:
b"

Lorica Health provides advanced claims analytics solutions and services to the healthcare sector. Our specialist team of data scientists, domain experts, analysts and engineers develop industry specific solutions which target fraud, abuse and waste, while also making markets that improve the quality and safety of health care. Lorica software already analyses data from 30 of Australia's 33 private health insurers as well as a number of public sector agencies.

Lorica is a Best Practice Equal Opportunity Employer selecting candidates from a combination of soft and hard skills measured empirically wherever possible; be prepared to take state of the art online tests, interviews and questions.

\xc2\xa0

Junior - Mid Level Software Engineer

Responsibilities:

  • Design, code and automatically test applications in PHP and Java

  • Write scripts to build, test & deploy to AWS

  • Be a proactive and collaborative SCRUM team developer

  • Assist with verification when required

  • Assist with company growth activities as required (e.g. recruitment)

  • Share knowledge with others in a learning environment


Required qualifications:

  • University degree in Software Engineering or equivalent


Required skills/experience:

  • 1-5 years experience

  • Solid skills on core Java (Preferably on Java 8)

  • RESTful web service development (Spring Boot or PlayFramework)

  • Relational database, PL/SQL, ideally on PostgreSQL

  • PHP (Laravel 5.3, SQL and Javascript)

\xc2\xa0

Desired skills/experience:

  • Agile

  • SCRUM

  • Healthcare

  • Data processing using Spark

  • AWS

  • Docker

  • Jira & Confluence

  • Bamboo


Role specific characteristics:

  • Inquisitive by nature

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

\xc2\xa0

Lorica Purpose:

To use data science to improve the quality of health care markets.

Lorica Vision:
To improve the fairness and efficiency of health care markets so they can in turn better improve the \xc2\xa0health of the populations they serve.

Lorica Mission:

To be the foremost trusted intermediary providing health care data products and services that \xc2\xa0demonstrably improve the performance of the Australian healthcare system.

Lorica Values:

Health,Respect,Integrity,Rigour,Improvement,Curiosity,Diversity,Courage

Lorica Personal Attributes:

Approachability,Collaboration,Enthusiasm,Expertise,Flexibility,Proactivity,Reliability

Working at Lorica:

Lorica respects family and \xc2\xa0flexible working requirements. We practice Agile throughout the company, \xc2\xa0promote continuous improvement and learning. Above all we want to make a difference and have fun.

We look forward to your application, please apply here or send your resume and cover letter to \xc2\xa0stephen.winnick@loricahealth.com

No recruitment agencies please.

"

title: Production Assistant
description:
b'

Background

Mood Media is the leading provider of "sensorial" (audio, visual and scent) marketing solutions to retail and hospitality clients in Australia, Asia and Europe. As the retail market becomes more competitive and consumers become more discerning, retailers are looking for new and innovative ways of differentiating themselves from their competitors and connecting with potential customers; Mood Media's services provides that "edge".\xc2\xa0

Globally, Mood Media services over 120,000 locations in 35 countries. In Asia Pacific we service approximately 10,000 locations and whilst the majority of these are in Australia, our Asian customer base is growing.

Position Outline

The role of Production Assistant will support the Creative team in the timely distribution of audio, visual and scheduling updates to ensure the customer receives the correct content. \xc2\xa0

This entry level position also provides general production support to the Creative team, including, but not limited to, cover for messaging productions when required.

Key Responsibilities

  • Through the use of proprietary software ensure that all audio, visual and messaging updates are made and sent on time\xc2\xa0
  • Assist in the production of new units and configuration changes
  • For legacy platforms (CD's & DVD's) ensure that content is mastered on time for reproduction and dispatch of updates
  • Ensure updates are processed through the proprietary system (Unity) and that any errors are captured with appropriate troubleshooting and resolution
  • Ensure CD/DVD burners (Rimage units) are attended to on a regular basis to maximize uptime
  • Report any delays or likely delays to Creative Department Manager
  • Ensure appropriate inventory such as media and required consumables are in stock at all times
  • Database management - ensure client and related product data is kept up to date on a timely basis
  • Cover for audio messaging production when required

Required Skills and Attributes

  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Ability to consistently adapt to change
  • General knowledge of personal computer systems
  • Strong written, documentation and personal skills
  • Must be positive, have a strong work ethic and be a team player

Key Reports and Relationships

  • Reports directly to the Creative Department Manager
  • Key relationships:
    • Customer Service Team
    • Sales Team
    • IT Team

Qualifications and Experience

  • Entry level position suited to a recent graduate\xc2\xa0
  • Related qualifications and experience favourable but not essential

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Tech Lead
description:
b".NET Tech Lead required by the firm that Microsoft used to trial their new technologies and who are in currently building a new 'Engineering First' team within their already established development function. This team will sit separate to the main hub of the organisation and focus their attention on:
The complete redesign and development of the existing platforms to a cloud-hosted, Microservices environment
Ensuring that moving forward new technologies released by Microsoft (be it on a test-trial basis with Microsoft OR beta) are adopted early with a view to deploying across the business.

This new team will eventually be circa 20 strong and include Tech Leads, Senior Dev's, Dev's, QA, Devops Product Owners and Scrum Masters. This function will follow a strict Agile Scrum approach to all projects and adopt an 'engineering mindset' to all projects that are scheduled for the next 3 years.

The Tech Lead role is awesome!!!! You're the person who is involved in designing and truly shaping the project from the get-go. You'll be liaising with senior members of the business, working with your team to define the requirements, design and architect the proposed solution and then work with your team to build it. This is very much a hands on role working with your team to ensure deliverables are met to the highest possible standards.\xc2\xa0

Your responsibilities\xc2\xa0

Take ownership and ensure delivery of tasks requested by the internal and external stakeholders, which could be in the form of changes and project work.
Provide technical thought leadership and value add opportunities to the business and other stakeholders in relevant areas.
Adhere to the SDLC principles and be responsible for creating and managing technical project schedules, estimations and providing work break down structure.
Responsible for creating technical roadmaps for relevant areas and ensuring deliverables are in line with the long term plan.
Liaise and manage external vendor/partners/business SME/developers to help resolve issues and deliver the tasks at hand.
Provide and maintain a technical schedule outlining all the technical-related task, dependences, resources and timeframes
Hands on coding in .Net, together with the responsibility to peer review other developer's code
Manage the agreed outcomes with vendors, partners and test teams
Manage technical team adheres to the governance and standards
Deliver quality and efficient solutions with agreed timeframes
Responsible for ensuring a smooth transition from Project to BAU
To ensure your success in this role, ideally you will have:

Good understanding of SDLC
Relevant tertiary qualifications and Microsoft Certifications
Solid experience with vendor management
Be a self-starter, take ownership and show initiative
Good understanding of Web, Mobile, Data, BI, Reporting, Integration and emerging technologies
ESSENTIAL technical skills in areas such as .NET, SQL, and Mobile development
Excelling influencing skills coupled with the ability to manage stakeholder relationships
Proven ability to develop and implement strategy technical initiatives that align with the long term roadmaps and strategic goals
Ability to do hands-on development, application and system configuration as required
Must be customer focused and have can-do attitude

Please send your CV to darren.ruane@2xmtechnology.com.au "

title: Digital Marketing Executive
description:
b"

One of the world's leading sustainable product manufacturers, Kingspan Environmental (part of the Kingspan Group) needs an energetic, driven and innovative Digital Marketing Executive (Australia).

Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the successful candidate will be responsible for supporting the growth and awareness of Kingspan Environmental in key Australian and International markets. Digital marketing, technical/website build skills are highly desirable. This is a fast paced environment and other general marketing skills are also essential. The successful candidate will need to be able to keep up as we're super busy and handle this dynamic digital marketing role. Location: Kings Park

  • Support the Marketing Manager in the rollout of localising Kingspan initiatives with the launch of new products
  • \xc2\xa0Help manage and build the Kingspan Water's ecommerce site and global site
  • Work with Marketing Manager in managing third party suppliers ranging from PR agencies, design firms etc
  • Build the global site for Au and help with the build of the Ecommerce site. Essential to have Concrete 5 and Wordpress, Woo Commerce experience
  • Manage and deliver content on a regular basis for our Social media platforms
  • Develop and manage the SEO activity, Adwords campaigns spanning across the different channels of business
  • Day to day digital marketing activities across the Kingspan Environmental business unit. Water, Wastewater, Service, Commercial and Rural. Environmental will be growing their product offering and as such more online activity and support is required.
  • Create and manage content on divisional country websites. (language support will be given)
  • Develop and execute creative digital campaigns across the different channels, per product offering
  • Copywriting, execution and management of email marketing campaigns, and company bi-monthly newsletters for a diverse range of target audiences such as homeowners, builders, engineers, architects, consultants, resellers
  • Report, analyse and evaluate ROI from online activities. Google Analytics including PPC, email marketing and social media.
  • Create social media content and creative, objective driven campaigns Actively research and evaluate changing online market conditions, competitor data, trends, consumer habits and best practice online marketing tactics and strategy.
  • Offer support to the development of a global SEO campaign for Kingspan Environmental.

The successful candidate will have:

  • Relevant Marketing qualification with a minimum of 3 years working in a digital agency with strong digital experience
  • Broad knowledge of online\xc2\xa0 marketing tactics, channels and activities on a local and international level
  • Experience creating and executing\xc2\xa0 successful digital marketing campaigns and online PR for multiple brands, websites and countries
  • Proven experience of SEO, SEM, Adwords management (no agency involvement)
  • Copywriting, technical marketing skills with the creativity\xc2\xa0 to keep our websites dynamic and current
  • Experience writing and delivering content for social media channels
  • Excellent time management and able to deliver to tight timeframes
  • Strong Attention to detail
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills including presentation and interpersonal skills
  • Desirable to have skills in InDesign and Photoshop design

title: Sales Support Administrator
description:
b'

Are you an experienced Sales Support Administrator looking to join a global ASX listed organisation and take the next step in your career?

You could be part of the company that helps move Australia!

As part of the Sales and Service team, your role will be to act as a professional resource to efficiently deliver support nationally to CHEP's field based team members by providing proactive and responsive assistance to the sales team in report generation, insight, record keeping and administration support. This role will be based at our Lidcombe, New South Wales office and reports directly to the Team Leader, Sales Support.

The key responsibilities of this role include

  • Prepare periodic reports and analysis for internal/external parties as required.
  • \xc2\xa0Accurate and timely record keeping of activities and actions against set targets, key milestones and SLA's
  • support administration of\xc2\xa0load containment and safety division (LC&S)\xc2\xa0
  • Undertake root cause analysis when a problem is identified to assist with improving the customer service experience
  • Build a strong ongoing relationship with internal stakeholders to facilitate customer outcomes by attending monthly sales meetings, creating ways to pro-actively monitor accounts and making recommendations based off report analysis
  • Update the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system with information provided by Business Relationship Management Team
  • Create new ideas and effectively present useful suggestions for continuous improvement of existing processes, and be ready to implement them to ensure high quality customer service.

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, experience and qualifications

  • Has a proactive mindset with strong administrative and time management skills
  • Excellent customer service and relationship building skills
  • Intermediate to Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
  • experience with high volumes of data entry
  • High level of attention to detail with strong analytical and problem solving skills including\xc2\xa0process design and implementation\xc2\xa0
  • Solid experience in a previous sales support, sales administration\xc2\xa0or customer service role

About CHEP

As a market leader in supply chain equipment pooling, CHEP is continuously setting the industry standard and providing the latest innovations in reusable supply chain packaging and solutions. CHEP is an inherently sustainable business and helps our customers to achieve leaner, greener and safer supply chain logistics processes.

CHEP Australia offers a range of employee benefits including a competitive salary, generous super contributions, bonus opportunities, a supportive learning and development culture and a wide range of opportunities.

CHEP Australia celebrates the diversity of thought, backgrounds, style and working arrangements of our people to ensure that we reflect the communities and customers that we serve.

Agencies please note: recruitment for this position is being managed directly by CHEP Australia. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners in the rare instance we require additional talent options. Your respect for this process is appreciated.

Interested? To apply please click the 'apply now' button below. Please include a covering letter addressing the above criteria with your application.

You must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for this role

title: Bid Manager / Estimator  Complex Projects
description:
b'

Who are we?

Schneider Electric is a global specialist in energy management and automation. We are dedicated to supplying our customers with safe, reliable and sustainable energy solutions. We invent technologies that will transform the places where we live, work and play.

What do we stand for?

When you work for Schneider Electric you work for a company focused on its people. We are proud to promote diversity, inclusion and work-life integration \xe2\x80\x93 we\xe2\x80\x99re a great place to work but we are continually striving to be the best place to work!

What is the role?

Based in Sydney, we are actively recruiting for an experienced Bid / Estimator specialist to join our Pursuits & Programs team. You will be responsible for conducting estimates, bid proposals and viability modelling including variable options for the organisations strategic pursuits to ensure value for money and suitable ROI. Specific activities include;

  • Lead the pursuit management lifecycle for major opportunities, develop life cycle and whole life cost analysis, manage proposal pricing, margin movements, models and estimates
  • Work with internal partners to develop variable modelling; providing options that enable informed decisions around tender submissions
  • Apply international and local knowledge (quantity surveying, modelling & estimating) to develop benchmarking, models and cash flow curves
  • You will gain an in-depth understanding of our commercial strategy and provide input to tender/project risk assessment to determine financial viability
  • Facilitation of strategic planning, value proposition building, communications and scoping of relationships

Why you?

You are someone who gets excited by innovation. You are a highly driven and confident professional who wants to work for a values based organisation whose solutions are leading edge. You are focused, collaborative and passionate about the work that you do. In addition, you possess the following attributes:

  • Tertiary qualified in economics, construction management, property or quantity surveying with experience as a feasibility modeller, estimator or quantity surveyor
  • A sound understanding of pursuit processes, successful track record of winning and delivering complex bids, leveraging prior learnings
  • Commercial experience in some or all of the following; defence, infrastructure, transport, cloud & data centres, hotels, healthcare, agribusiness, F&B or solar
  • A clear understanding of relevant WH&S and Australian codes & standards
  • Your understanding of procurement models including for PPPs, JVs, consortia, alliances, T1-3 contracting; will be complemented by sound commercial acumen and costing analysis
  • Familiarity with FX & commodities will ensure hedging and related factors are captured within the modelling

Why us?

At Schneider Electric, we are open, we value differences, we listen, we learn, connect, and collaborate with others.\xc2\xa0 We are passionate about our customers, our people, our business and our technology. We are positive in our approach to finding solutions that better our lives.

'

title: Team Leader - Laboratory
description:
b'

Boral is an international building and construction materials group, with its headquarters in Sydney, Australia. With more than A$5.5 billion worth of annualised sales, Boral has around 12,000 full-time equivalent employees working across over 550 operating sites.

Boral Materials Technical Services (NSW) is seeking a responsible, organised and experienced individual to join our team as a Laboratory Section Head - Concrete. Working independently this role reports to the Laboratory Manager and involves undertaking tasks in relation to sampling, testing, physical analysis, maintenance of records, reporting of resultsfor our concrete, cement and quarry related products.

The main responsibilities are, but not limited to:

  • Provide technical leadership and support to all clients and ensuring turnaround times are met.
  • Conduct testing in accordance with laboratory work instructions, test methods, preparation instructions and manuals.
  • Ensure that data is collected, collated and validated for high quality management practices.
  • Calibrate laboratory equipment as required.
  • Liaise with technical and sales staff in relation to internal/external customer requirements and complaints.
  • Maintain, observe, and take part in the statutory safety requirements of the Laboratory operation.
  • Exhibit and demand good housekeeping practices in all lab areas.
  • Maintenance of the Laboratory according to NATA accreditation requirements.
  • Other duties as directed by the Laboratory Manager

To be considered for this role, you must have:

  • A commitment to safety and quality
  • Previous laboratory/concrete technology experience, plus some prior supervisor experience.
  • NATA Signatory in Concrete Testing would be an advantage.
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in science or another relevant discipline e.g. Civil, Chemical or Materials - (desirable but not essential).
  • Well developed skills and understanding of computer systems for monitoring and reporting of data (especially with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel etc).
  • Good time management and organisational skills
  • An ability to cope with competing priorities and deadlines
  • Knowledge of Australian and Industry standards
  • Good communication and organisational skills
  • Strong analytical skills and a customer focus

If you are interested in this role please press APPLY now or visit http://careers.boral.com.au

'

title: Business Development Manager - Cards
description:
b'Some careers have more impact than others.
\xc2\xa0
Retail Banking and Wealth Management (RBWM) serves more than 50 million customers worldwide with a complete range of banking and wealth management services to enable them to manage their finances and protect and build their financial futures. It is a global business that brings together management responsibility for Retail Banking, Wealth Management, Insurance and Asset Management with a focus on customer-centric propositions and innovative and efficient distribution channels.
\xc2\xa0
Retail Business Solutions (RBS) is HSBC\xe2\x80\x99s third party distribution network for credit cards via a broad range of merchants. Customers of these stores use a HSBC credit card to facilitate interest free purchases of goods. Retail Business Solutions plays a significant role for HSBC as a distribution channel for a profitable segment of customers, and contributes materially to the overall HSBC credit card portfolio.
\xc2\xa0
The Business Development Manager is a newly created role which will be responsible for defining and delivering the growth strategy for RBS, while bringing a structured approach to business development.
\xc2\xa0
The key responsibilities of the role are:
\xc2\xa0

  • Analyse the performance of the current merchants within the RBS portfolio to identify best performing merchants and industries, and understand the key drivers of this performance.
  • Create and maintain an extensive database of potential merchants across all target industries.
  • Develop a strategic list of merchants to target across a diverse range of preferred industries.
  • Manage the initial contact and communication with target merchants, and support the key senior leaders in preparing for any formal presentations. In addition you will create responses to any formal tenders and participate in negotiations where necessary.
  • Develop and maintain a suite of business development materials to be presented to target merchants, customising as needed for specific industries, business needs, distribution channels etc.
  • Work with Product and Financial teams to developing pricing proposals for target merchants.
  • Develop this role as a subject matter expert on retail financing to understand industry trends, global solutions, new propositions, competitor moves etc. and work closely with the Product team to develop the HSBC proposition in line with this insight.
  • Demonstrate leadership in delivering a structured strategy to drive material growth for the HSBC business.
  • Maintain HSBC internal control standards, and operate with continual awareness of operational risk.

To be successful in this role, you will need:
\xc2\xa0

  • A minimum of seven years\xe2\x80\x99 experience within the retail financial services industry;
  • An analytical mind and approach to work;
  • Strong communication, influencing and people skills, to enable you to get the best out of the multiple merchants and stakeholders with whom you will work;
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to build strong robust business relationships.
  • The ability to work autonomously, and to be comfortable in setting your own agenda and taking your own decisions
  • Proven success in structuring strategy and approach to business development.
  • Degree qualification in business or related field.
\xc2\xa0 You\xe2\x80\x99ll achieve more when you join\xc2\xa0HSBC.
www.hsbc.com.au/careers
\xc2\xa0
HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.
\xc2\xa0HSBCKTS

'
