title: Senior Administration Officer
description:
b"

Do you have a high attention to detail and strong accuracy skills? Do you want to work in a dynamic and challenging environment that not only offers you the opportunity to enhance your expert skills but will excel your career? Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry unrivalled in the Australian marketplace?

About us

Accuweigh\xc2\xa0is an organisation offering an unrivalled range of technologically advanced products and services that enable our customers to weigh, measure, identify, package and inspect products. Our customers span the Transport, Agriculture, Food, Chemical, Pharmaceutical, Waste, Mining and many other industries.

Our offices in every mainland state are staffed by skilled teams with a reputation for having a 'can-do' attitude and exceeding customer expectations. Our solutions provide customers superior value, enabling them to optimise operations and meet compliance requirements.

Driven by the continuous improvement of our people and our operations, we invest heavily in training and technology. With a global customer base and long standing relationships with prominent international suppliers, the company won numerous business and entrepreneurial awards and prides itself on the contribution it makes to society through a range of charitable programs.

As an organisation, we only employ the most talented people who deliver exceptional services through the lens of our values.

OUR SENIOR ADMINISTRATION OFFICER OPPORTUNITY IN LANSVALE

Monday \xe2\x80\x93 Friday

Reporting to the State Manager, we are looking for an experienced Senior Administration Officer to join our team based in Lansvale, NSW. Working within a team, the role is responsible for providing a professional point of contact and administration service to ensure the efficient and effective operation of the administration office. The Senior Administration Officer fulfils an essential\xc2\xa0role within the organisation, and as such, we are looking for an individual who is highly motivated, team orientated, enjoys a fast paced environment, variety in their role, can think on their feet and has a strong passion for customer service. Such an essential role means you will have outstanding communication skills combined with a 'can do attitude' to enable results to be delivered for both internal and external stakeholders. The successful applicant will need to be flexible around role requirements, taking on tasks that will ensure the continued success of the business.\xc2\xa0

Key objectives include:

  • Establish rapport with all customers and suppliers by answering & responding to all telephone calls, emails and faxes in a timely manner.
  • Provide support to internal departments by organising in and outgoing freight, raising sales and internal jobs, creation of\xc2\xa0 purchase orders for sales and stock orders, and the creation of invoices for all jobs where required.
  • General office administration including providing accurate data entry and creation of reports.
  • Completion of end of month processes and reports within the given time frame.
  • Reconciliation of bank and petty cash statements and accounts receivable.
  • Customer service and reception duties.

Essential criteria include:

  • Currently working in a similar role with at least 3-5 years experience as a competent administration officer.
  • Strong customer service skills, confident verbal and written skills, a positive and proactive outlook and good attention to detail in completing documentation.
  • Demonstrated experience in providing an efficient, accurate and effective administration support across the organisation.
  • Ability to work well autonomously and within a team, multi task and prioritise work to ensure deadlines are met.
  • Strong team player and commitment to both individual goal achievement and team goal achievement.
  • Problem solving ability combined with a decisive judgement in escalating to management when it appears that tasks might not be achieved.
  • Accurate data entry with minimal errors and strong proficiency in all Microsoft packages particularly Excel and Word.
  • Car license is essential as there could be intermittent tasks requiring basic short trips.

We offer a zero harm culture in the workplace and excellent opportunities to grow professionally in a progressive learning environment.

Do you have what it takes?\xc2\xa0

To apply, please submit your CV with a Cover Letter addressing our Values and the Essential Criteria through Seek.

"

title: Personal Assistant to the Business Office (Permanent, Full-time)
description:
b"

Wenona values professional services staff who demonstrate a positive and proactive approach to their work and have a willingness to participate fully in the life of the School. We look for enthusiastic, dedicated and capable staff who demonstrate initiative, good humour, and professional behaviour and support the values and aims of the School as a global learning community.

This position reports to: Business Manager, with support to other roles such as the Accountant and Business Office Manager.

Overview of the Personal Assistant to the Business Office role

This position has primary responsibility for ensuring that the day to day operations and strategic goals of the Business Office are coordinated and supported.

It achieves this by proactive and well executed administrative, operational and logistical support, providing timely and accurate document production, correspondence, diary management and customer service to staff, parents and the wider Wenona community.

The position also presents an important impression of the School and the values that it represents. Professionalism, confidence, presentation and a calm, positive attitude under pressure must be maintained as well as the ability to maintain high levels of discretion and confidentiality in all circumstances

The position also contributes to the maintenance of a positive internal culture where service, integrity, kindness and humour are valued.

Key priorities

Indications that this job is being done successfully would include:

  • Understanding and managing competing demands in the Business Manager's diary in order to meet the organisational and personal goals of the Business Manager to enable the desired outcomes be achieved.
  • Screening/protecting/prioritising workflow and issues management for the Business Manager and establishing a professional, proactive culture.
  • Preparing and managing the timely production of professional correspondence, documentation, and materials according to Wenona style to effectively represent, educate and communicate with all stakeholders and promote the reputation of the School.
  • Coordinating and supporting the requirements of the Business Manager's activities including, day to day office tasks, taking minutes of meetings, assisting with budgets, accounts receivable and payable and providing administrative support to all staff within the Business Office.
  • Ensuring timely and accurate responses to requests for logistical, operational and administrative support for the Business Manager and the related activities, and be the first point of contact within the Business Office for staff, parents and other stakeholders.\xc2\xa0
  • Providing administrative and operational assistance across the School to meet functional requirements and uphold the reputation of Wenona.

Education and Experience

  • Qualifications in Business Administration or similar
  • Relevant experience in an educational environment or similar
  • NSW Working with Children Check
  • Experienced at producing complex documents and minute taking.

Personal Attributes

  • Evidence of and commitment to continuing professional development
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills and communication skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Ability to multitask and prioritise
  • A sense of humour

Wenona is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion, sexual orientation or age.

General conditions of the role

Award

Independent Schools NSW (Support and Operational Staff) Multi Enterprise Agreement 2017

Classification

Clerical and Administrative Staff:

Level 3 ($67,497 - $70, 083)

Hours of work

Full Time, Monday to Friday, 38 hours per week

Daily hours will generally be 8.00am \xe2\x80\x93 4.00pm (including 30 mins unpaid lunch break)

School Holidays

Annual leave should only be taken during the student holiday period.\xc2\xa0 The School has mandatory closure between 21 December 2016 and 04 January 2017 (10 days) and you will be expected to take this time as annual leave

Selection Criteria

  1. Demonstrated high level customer service and communication skills with experience producing business correspondence, reports and meeting papers and an ability to liaise effectively with parents, staff and other stakeholders.\xc2\xa0
  2. Experience of working within a finance administration environment
  3. Proven organisational skills and ability to prioritise competing demands and to work effectively both independently and collaboratively, meeting deadlines and delivering high quality outcomes.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  4. Highly developed computer skills, including proficiency using the MS Office suite and experiences with data management platforms.

Application process

All applications should be addressed to Wenona Principal Dr Briony Scott, Wenona School, 176 Walker Street, North Sydney, 2060 and emailed as a PDF to recruit@wenona.nsw.edu.au

Applicants should send full curriculum vitae, a cover letter which addresses the selection criteria, copies of qualifications and names of two referees. Please direct any questions or enquiries to HR Coordinator, Ms Samantha Drabble on (02) 9409 4416.

Closing date

Tuesday 23 May, 2017 at 12pm.

The successful applicant for this position will be required to provide the school with a current Working with Children Check.

"

Department of Human Services is home to one of the largest in-house IT operations in the southern hemisphere. title: VET Compliance Manager
description:
b"

The Careers and Industry (C&I) division is a newly formed division within Navitas resulting from the merger of the Australian College of Applied Psychology (ACAP) and the SAE Creative Media Institute (SAE) and Government Services. The Quality, Compliance, Risk & Regulation (QRCC) team are a shared resource across the Division that manage risk, delivery quality and ensure compliance with ever-changing regulations and requirements of the Higher Education and VET Landscape.

\xc2\xa0

The key result areas for the Manager, VET Compliance include managing the ongoing registration of ACAP, HSA and SAE as vocational education providers to domestic and international students; \xc2\xa0managing submissions and compliance declarations to regulators, professional associations and other stakeholders re VET compliance and course accreditation; providing advice re VET compliance to internal stakeholders; ongoing analysis of quality benchmark data; dissemination of VET sector risk intelligence; and monitoring the implementation quality processes that support the compliant delivery of VET programs.\xc2\xa0

This role reports directly to the Director of Quality, Compliance, Risk and Regulation and works closely with the Academic Leadership Team of ACAP, HSA and SAE.

\xc2\xa0

Essential

  • Relevant tertiary qualification in education, risk management or a related discipline
  • Demonstrated understanding of course accreditation and compliance management in a VET and CRICOS delivery environment
  • Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to produce high quality written reports and deliver presentations to staff and stakeholders

    \xc2\xa0

    Desirable

  • Demonstrated experience of risk management frameworks and methodologies in a Vocational Education environment
  • Demonstrated knowledge of the Australian legislative and regulatory environment (Consumer Law, Privacy, Equal Opportunity, Health & Safety, Copyright, etc)

    \xc2\xa0

    What we offer

    An attractive remuneration package will be negotiated with the successful candidate. \xc2\xa0The Navitas Group offers outstanding long-term career opportunities within Australia and abroad, and is values driven and an equal opportunity employer.\xc2\xa0 Successful applicants will be subject to relevant pre-employment checks, which may include a National Police Check and/or a Working with Children Check.

    \xc2\xa0

    Enquiries and applications, including a cover letter addressing the above selection criteria and a resume, should be forwarded to Veronica Keating, Director of Quality, Compliance, Risk and Regulation, by clicking on the 'APPLY' button.

    \xc2\xa0

    Applications close Monday 22nd May 2017 at 5pm AEST.

"

title: Recruitment & Payroll Support Coordinator
description:
b"THE COMPANY

Stopgap is a boutique marketing & advertising recruitment agency with offices in London and here in King Street Wharf, Sydney (hellooo harbour views!). As the business grows, we're now on the look out for a Recruitment & Payroll Support Coordinator to join our fun loving and hardworking team!

THE ROLE

Your role is to help ensure that our candidates receive the positively different experience for which Stopgap is known. You will be the main contact link between our recruitment consultants and our candidates. This is a unique opportunity to work in a busy and caring team providing prompt advice and assistance for our candidates & clients and supporting the Sydney team at large.

Main duties involved with this role include...

- Being the first point of contact for our office by answering all incoming phone calls, client/candidate enquiries & managing our company contact email account
- Giving feedback on job applications, updating candidate records in the company CRM system and highlighting candidates to specific consultants.
- Ensuring that candidate CV's are accurately registered into our CRM system through daily monitoring of our recruitment management software.\xc2\xa0
- Assisting the Financial Controller with inputting candidate timesheets, running & collating invoices / credits & supporting with general payroll duties.
- Adhoc office administrative support including ensuring office supplies are stocked, arranging couriers & gifts, purchasing weekly groceries and managing our taxi service account

To be considered for this role you must...

- Be proactive, empathetic and have a genuine interest in helping others.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
- Demonstrate exceptional all-round communication skills and be comfortable dealing with people at all levels. \xc2\xa0
- Have a great telephone manner and be entirely at ease making totally assured out-bound calls and not one to hide behind emails! \xc2\xa0
- Be computer savvy, experience working on Mac platforms & previous experience using CRM systems.
- Excellent numeracy skills as well as fast & efficient data entry skills
- Have a can-do attitude with a solutions focussed outlook \xc2\xa0
- A sense of humour!\xc2\xa0

Ideally we would like this person on board from the beginning of June, so if you are interested in learning more about this role don't delay contacting us.\xc2\xa0 This is a great opportunity for a junior administrator who perhaps has always had an interest in recruitment or in marketing.\xc2\xa0 It provides great opportunity for personal and professional growth.\xc2\xa0

On top of the above, Stopgap offers an amazing company culture, a friendly, supportive & inclusive working environment & a very cute office dog named Zac! While this is a permanent opportunity that will not be offering sponsorship, we are also open to considering standout candidates on Working Holiday Visas for a 6 month contract.\xc2\xa0

To apply, please email over an updated CV and cover letter explaining why you would like to work with us to people@stopgap.com.au "

title: NA
advertiser: Australian Curriculum, Assessment and Reporting Authority
description:
b'

The Australian Curriculum, Assessment, and Reporting Authority (ACARA) is an independent statutory authority responsible for the overall management and development of a national curriculum, the National Assessment Program (NAP), and national reports, including the My School website.

ACARA currently has an exciting opportunity for an Assisting Psychometrician to join the Assessment and Reporting business unit. This position will conduct applied research in the field of computerised adaptive testing and large educational data analyses and modelling.

Reporting to the Lead Psychometrician, the Assisting Psychometrician will conduct psychometric and statistical analyses and provide measurement advice in relation to the NAP and NAPLAN assessments and reporting needs, and conduct and contribute to the research efforts and activities.

The successful applicant will have a PhD and a research record in psychometrics, statistics, mathematics, psychology, or related disciplines. Alternatively, the applicant will have considerable industry experience in conducting complex statistical and psychometric analyses and modelling. Strong communication skills and collaborative work style to deliver project commitments to quality standards within deadlines will be essential.

This role is a 3 year Fixed-Term Contract. For more information about the role, please view the Position Description - Assisting Psychometrician

Commencing base salary range: $104,310 \xe2\x80\x93 $111,308 per annum plus 10.5% Super.

Applications will close at\xc2\xa011.59pm,\xc2\xa030\xc2\xa0May 2017.

See Job Description

(Google Chrome web browser recommended)

'

title: Cloud and Infrastructure Graduate Program
description:
b'

Unisys is a leading provider of high-value services, software and solutions that deliver sustainable value to many of the world's largest companies and governmental agencies. Unisys provides secure, consultative, industry-specific solutions and services for government, financial services, travel and transportation, life sciences and commercial organizations. With Unisys as a partner, clients can secure the trust of their own customers \xe2\x80\x93 and deliver today on the demands of tomorrow.

This program begins with\xc2\xa0Graduates from all over the world converging for a month of intensive, in-the-classroom and online training introducing them to Unisys and the Cloud and Infrastructure Services (CIS) service lines. This will be followed by 11 months of on-the-job training gained through working on various special projects, client deals, and specialized training.\xc2\xa0 The 12-month program provides broad and deep exposure to Unisys and its leaders.\xc2\xa0 Graduates will have exceptional visibility to strategic initiatives and the opportunity to build mentoring relationships.\xc2\xa0

Upon successful completion of this 12-month program, associates will be placed in full-time roles based on business priorities, performance to-date, and their preference.\xc2\xa0 Subsequently associates are expected to continue developing toward other positions of increasing responsibility, based on performance and opportunity.\xc2\xa0 Typical roles for\xc2\xa0Graduates include IT consulting based work for Unisys clients: These roles may require travel to client locations throughout Asia-Pacific.

Responsibilities:

  • Successfully engage in accelerated training and deployment to special projects
  • Effectively escalate needs
  • Actively participate in internal meetings as well as with clients
  • Demonstrate "ownership and accountability"
  • Succinctly summarize/present the value, relevance, and impact of your work contributions
  • Provide candid and lucid feedback to\xc2\xa0Graduate leadership to help improve the program
  • Develop an alumni relationship with fellow Graduates
  • Share personal experiences to help Unisys accelerate its success

Skills, Experience & Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled or recently graduated with a degree in a Bachelor's of business administration, engineering, economics, mathematics, IT, or a similar discipline (Graduation dates between June 2016 and June 2017)
  • Excellent communication skills; present data and conclusions in organized manner
    • Ability to thrive in a performance-focused and results-oriented environment
    • Exceptional levels of ownership mentality, self-motivation, ambition, and entrepreneurial spirit
    • Strong interpersonal skills; ability to form effective business relationships
    • Ability to collaborate across peer groups and with senior IT and business management
    • Self-starter with sense of ownership for their department, its output and the satisfaction of the business.
      • Strong work ethic and determination to achieve success
      • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
      • Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate others
      • Your work home base will be at Rhodes, Sydney
      • Fluent in the English language

\xc2\xa0

Travel Required

'

title: Receptionist
description:
b'

Harley-Heaven Western Sydney (Blacktown) is seeking to appoint an experienced Receptionist. \xc2\xa0


Work with the worlds #1 motorcycle brand

Make a difference.

Enjoy going to work.

About us. We are a family owned business and are proud to be Harley-Davidson dealers. We have been servicing the Australian Harley-Davidson Community for over 30 years and also\xc2\xa0have Harley-Davidson dealerships in Melbourne, Dandenong, Ringwood and Adelaide.

The position. This is a new position, created through the continued growth or our business.\xc2\xa0We are seeking to appoint an experienced and proactive receptionist who is a team player and ready to assist us in our goal to be the best Harley-Davidson Dealer in Australia, offering the best possible service to our customers.

The Receptionist role includes but is not limited to providing excellent customer service and monitoring the Reception area, including, incoming phones calls, internet and email enquiries, customer follow up, data entry and general office duties. You will be organised, have attention to detail, sense of urgency, good written and oral communication skills as well as a positive work ethic. Experience in Outlook, Word & Excel is required.

Days/Hours (10 Day Fortnight)
Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday 9:00am - 5:30pm (every Wednesday off)
Saturday - 9:00am - 4:00pm (every Saturday is a must)

We are looking for a positive, vibrant, enthusiastic and diligent receptionist to work cohesively within our team. You will be people oriented and enjoy providing the best possible service to our clients and staff.

Previous experience in a Automotive reception role, ideally in a medium sized automotive or motorcycle environment would be an advantage

Once you are successful. To assist you achieve the agreed team goals you and your team will have the daily support of your Dealer Principal and the ongoing support of our groups, Dealerships Manager,\xc2\xa0Business Development managers, and our senior management team, as well as the training and support provided by Harley-Davidson MC.

We are looking to get interviews underway ASAP. If you believe you are the person to make this happen, please submit your covering letter and a copy of your CV to, attention Daniel Browne

A pre employment police check and medical is a requirement for this position.

b'

Based in leafy Alexandria just a short walk from Green Square station, this leading online provider of short and medium-term loans to customers is well established globally and is experiencing strong growth here in Australia. title: Account Business Management Analyst
description:
b"

DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world's leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. title: Customer Service Collections Officer - CBD
description:

title: Recruitment Administrator l Resourcer
description:
b"

HOBAN Recruitment is a\xc2\xa0national provider of professional recruitment and people management services. For over\xc2\xa050 years HOBAN has enjoyed a reputation for providing recruitment services to many major Australian businesses, Government Contracts and Projects/Events.

Due to growth within our\xc2\xa0Seven Hills branch, we have an exciting opportunity for someone with a drive to learn and succeed in the recruitment industry. Your role will be to provide administrative support to our key Consultants. This will initially comprise of data entry and file development, candidate interviews and administering assessments. You will have the ability to develop your role further to conduct client visits to assess the environments available for our candidates to work in. title: Regional Bowls Manager - Sydney Metro
description:
b"

Bowls Australia (BA) is the national sporting organisation responsible for the leadership, development and management of Bowls in Australia. We are a not-for-profit organisation governed by a voluntary board that provides the strategic direction for the sport and the strategies that are implemented by the staff at the national office. BA's members are the nine state and territory bowls associations. There are over 1,870 clubs and over 640,000 participants nationwide. BA is affiliated with World Bowls and the Australian Commonwealth Games Association where it is a core sport in the Commonwealth Games held every four years.

\xc2\xa0

As a member of the Bowls Australia Bowls Operations Team and reporting to the National Participation Manager and the relevant State and Territory Association CEO's, this position will provide direct assistance to Clubs in the areas of business planning, member recruitment/retention, governance, funding, programs, information technology and volunteer strategies. The Regional Bowls Manager is the on the ground liaison with Bowls Clubs, Regions/Zones/Districts and Local Government Authorities with the main target to increase participation and membership of the sport of Bowls.

\xc2\xa0

The success of the program has been based on Team Members' living and understanding the intricacies of their region. As such, the successful applicant will live within the Region, ideally residing in or around the Sydney Metropolitan area.

\xc2\xa0

To be successful in this role you must meet the following criteria:

\xc2\xa0

  • Tertiary qualifications in Sport Management or experience in the sports industry desirable.
  • Experience in business operations/management or accounting/finance would be advantageous.
  • High-level communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 both verbal and written.
  • Excellent time management skills, prioritising tasks to meet daily and weekly programmed activity targets or longer term organisational objectives.
  • Ability to deal calmly and consistently with demanding responsibilities and conflicting priorities from a range of customers and staff utilising standard negotiation and conflict resolution techniques.
  • Data entry, word processing and scheduling skills ensuring efficient production of letters, documents and reports within required timeframes.
  • Comprehensive organisational skills to meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • An ability to fit in with and form effective working relationships with a varied range of groups and people.
  • Current drivers licence.

\xc2\xa0

The suitable applicant will be required to work remotely and perform significant travel within their appointed Region.

"

title: National WHS Officer
description:
b"

Safety / WHS Officer

TABMA Workforce and Career Development is a nationally registered Group Training Organisation placing apprentices and trainees under group training arrangements with host employers across Australia.

We are seeking a WHS Officer to conduct workplace inspections to ensure the safety of TABMA trainees and apprentices primarily within the timber, manufacturing and construction industries.\xc2\xa0 You will be required to complete hazard identification reports, system analysis reports and advise on risk assessment and the implementation of safety controls for our host employers.

In addition, the Timber and Building Materials Association (Aust) Ltd offers a workplace inspection service to our members.\xc2\xa0 You will be involved in conducting on-site inspections, safety system analysis, developing SOPS and / or SWMS, conducting hazard inspections\xc2\xa0and participating in the WHS Consultation processes.

The Role and Responsibilities
You will report to the National Training and Development Manager and with appropriate training, maintain, co-ordinate and provide support across a national company of 350 employees and growing. In addition, provide WHS support to members of the association across Australia.

You will need to have a proven record in a similar role (min 2yrs) along with the ability to assist in the implementation of company systems, policies and procedures and in addition, be able to develop and maintain relationships with the team to achieve the best safety outcomes. You will also need to have a practical working understanding of current WHS legislation, Codes of Practice and relevant Safety Standards and Regulatory Guidance Material.

As a Safety Officer/WHS Advisor\xc2\xa0you will be responsible for the following (but not limited too): \xc2\xa0

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Proactively looking at how WHS can be improved and risk in the field minimised

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Promoting our positive safety culture and initiatives at all times

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Analysing the Safety Management Systems of various organisations

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Conducting compliance inspections.

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Provide advice and technical support

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Carry out workplace incident investigations in a\xc2\xa0timely manner

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Maintain safety documentation and prepare for inspections

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Share learning's with the broader business in regard to Safety Management

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Deliver site inductions, provide first aid, and assist in consultation processes \xc2\xa0

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Conducts all forms of Hazard identification risk assessment e.g. general, manual handling, supervision, effectiveness of controls and safety systems

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Coordinate site safety inspections and assist in consultation processes \xc2\xa0

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Review first aid and return to work initiatives

  • Assisting in the administration and facilitation of employee WHS inductions, with investigations, the production of injury reports and preparation of employee 'return to work'

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Data entry of WHS documentation and maintaining a filing system for prompt retrieval.

\xc2\xa0

The ideal candidate will have:

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Relevant qualifications with several years' experience in a similar role

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 First Aid Basic Certificate

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Technically competent with Microsoft office suite, with good excel \xc2\xa0 knowledge, excellent report writing skills and document management experience.

  • Expert understanding of WHS+E Legislation & Regulations
  • Articulate and professional communication skills\xc2\xa0
  • Energy, enthusiasm and passion to be part of a team driving cultural change\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Critical to the success of this role will be your ability to develop strong internal relationships; communicate with people at all levels; influence positive change; and advise management and employees to expand their knowledge base and understanding of quality standards and WHS.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

If you believe you are the right person for the role and wish to apply, please send your cover letter and resume to alicia@tabma.com.au.

title: Client Services Officer / Paraplanner
description:
b'

About the business and the role

This is a new role for an energetic, confident and motivated person in a dual CSO / Paraplanning role.
You may be someone returning to the industry or looking for a greater challenge.

This is a critical role in our growing\xc2\xa0company and will provide the successful candidate with the flexibility to put their stamp on the organisation.

Job tasks and responsibilities

We are a small\xc2\xa0private company\xc2\xa0with\xc2\xa0considerable experience in the financial planning industry.

The main responsibilities of the role include:\xc2\xa0
Responding to client queries - including answering the telephone.
Administration, data entry, client mail/email queries,\xc2\xa0write record of advice documents.

  • Preparing compliant, personalised Statements of Advice for new and existing clients.
  • Assisting with strategy development and modelling in conjunction with the Adviser.
  • Working closely with the senior adviser to meet deadlines and client service standards.
  • Providing technical support and advice to clients.
  • Remaining up to date on legislative and industry changes and investment market developments.
  • Providing research and analytical assistance.
  • Ensure high level financial planning software skills are developed and maintained.

Skills and experience

To be considered you will have:

  • Experience across Risk, Investments and Superannuation
  • Must have recent experience and be competent in the use of XPLAN
  • Strong understanding and knowledge of compliance requirements for Financial Planning.
  • A level of confidence and not afraid to be continually on the phone talking with our greatest assets - our clients.

To be considered for this unique & fantastic opportunity please email\xc2\xa0your resume via the link below with\xc2\xa0a one page cover letter.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Receptionist/Administrator
description:
b'

A vibrant modern Receptionist required for front desk and basic administration. Full MS Office suite knowledge is required as used daily. Clear communication skills required as you will be the first point of call for all telephone enquiries and visitors into the office. Full training provided.

The Position:

  • Reception duties
  • Answering the phone
  • General administration
  • Monthly reporting
  • Data entry in TRACCS
  • Receiving job requests and creating file
  • Staff communication
  • Stationery management
  • Post
  • Research

The Successful Candidate:

  • Administration or Reception or Customer Service experience required
  • Competent in W4W, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Be able to work Monday to Friday office hours


To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, please contact Wendy on (02) 9972 2944, or email Wendy@peninsulapersonnel.com.au quoting Ref No. PPRAOH.
Visit www.peninsulapersonnel.com.au to view more jobs.

'

title: Collections Administration Officer  Asset Finance
description:
b'

Company

In a world of "no", Pepper was founded on saying "yes".\xc2\xa0 Since 2001 Pepper has transformed itself from a small company in Sydney to a 1700-strong force across Australia, Asia and Europe.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 We offer a unique, diversified, global portfolio of financial services. \xc2\xa0We provide specialist experience in our core disciplines of Lending, Advisory and Asset Servicing across the residential and commercial property sectors \xe2\x80\x93 as well as in consumer, auto and equipment finance.\xc2\xa0 We are one of the top 500 companies listed on the ASX (ASX:PEP).\xc2\xa0 With the continued growth of our brand and the ongoing expansion of our business, we are currently seeking a Collections Administration Officer to join our growing workforce.\xc2\xa0

Opportunity

This is a unique opportunity for a dynamic, flexible thinker to complement a specialist asset finance collections administration team working with a diverse and challenging range of asset classes.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

The role itself covers a broad range of duties, but we are specifically looking to capitalise on your previous experience in a system administration capacity of an outbound dialler \xe2\x80\x93 everything from creating campaigns to analysis of results to optimisation strategies.\xc2\xa0

In addition, you will be a play a key support role for our collections and asset recovery teams \xe2\x80\x93 statutory letters, data entry, document retention, mailbox management and other ad hoc administrative tasks will keep you busy and provide an opportunity to learn multiple facets of the end-to-end collections, recovery and insurance processes in an asset finance business.

You will have exceptional attention to detail, but this will not slow you down in completing your tasks.\xc2\xa0 You will also have excellent communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 a large part of this role is to develop and maintain relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.

You will need to be self-disciplined, self-managed and self-driven to deliver results in this role.\xc2\xa0

What You'll Need to Succeed

  • Relevant back-office consumer financial lending experience
  • Expert knowledge of NCCP & Privacy Act
  • System administration of dialler campaigns
  • Ability to apply learnings (particularly legislative) very quickly
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Enjoy working in a\xc2\xa0fast-paced environment\xc2\xa0and are able to prioritise tasks

You're a proactive professional who brings passion to the table.\xc2\xa0 You solve problems for people who don't know they have them and find answers for questions that haven't been asked.\xc2\xa0 You're a team player with a customer centric focus.\xc2\xa0 You're a doer who thrives on exceeding targets.

Our people are our business.\xc2\xa0 And we're a business that will take you on your merit and can offer exciting career opportunities and rewards, competitive remuneration and an incredible benefits package.\xc2\xa0 Join us, and you'll be part of a company that values integrity and respect, and actively inspires you to set people up for success.

If this is the career you can own, then we want to meet you.

'

title: Senior Network & Security Engineer - Design & Project role - CISCO, F5, Juniper
description:
b"

The Organisation:

@AC3 we love technology and we get a big kick out of helping companies use technology\xc2\xa0to create a competitive edge and be ready for the unexpected, whatever that may be. We understand the challenges that today's businesses face and we enjoy finding innovative and cost-effective technology solutions.

We believe that the true benefit of information technology is utilising it to unlock innovation that enables greater operational efficiency and better business effectiveness. Ultimately, this is why we get out of bed every morning.

Based in the Channel 7 Building in the Australian Technology Park (Eveleigh), we offer a very unique workplace (with lots of celebrities to be spotted!!) in a convenient location with public transport and street parking.\xc2\xa0

Along with\xc2\xa0competitive remuneration,\xc2\xa0we offer training, company benefits, and an exceptional\xc2\xa0culture of high performers and collaborative teams!

The Opportunity:\xc2\xa0

Join our Project Services\xc2\xa0Group, as a Senior Network Engineer and you won't look back!

We are seeking interest from people\xc2\xa0who\xc2\xa0believe they embody our company behaviours by being\xc2\xa0SMART, NIMBLE & STRAIGHTFORWARD, are truly passionate about Networks & Security, and get\xc2\xa0a kick out of developing the best solutions for our customers.\xc2\xa0

You will be providing technical expertise in the areas of Networking and Security, with a particular focus on R&S, Wireless, Security. Utilising your extensive hands-on experience across a multitude of networking and security products, you will be tasked with consulting, designing,\xc2\xa0planning, installing and configuring customer environments.


What's in it for you?

  • Overtime paid at penalty rates
  • Development and career progression
  • Genuine autonomy and ownership\xc2\xa0
  • Flexible working hours/ work-life balance
  • Facilities for socialising and relaxing

Role\xc2\xa0Requirements:

The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, solution-oriented, collaborative and approachable with a focus on best practice:

  • Previous experience working for a Systems Integrator across multiple clients
  • 5+ years of experience working in a similar role
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt to rapidly changing technology and apply it appropriately to fit business needs/requirements
  • Proven experience working with sales people and customers directly to develop solutions that expertly fit their needs
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong end-to-end project delivery experience
  • Proven experience putting together detailed design documentation (HLD + DLD), SOW's, BOM's and other relevant documentation
  • Expertise in\xc2\xa0Networking and\xc2\xa0Security\xc2\xa0with\xc2\xa0relevant certifications (CCIE OR CCNP (in R&S, Security, Telephony, etc),\xc2\xa0CCVP, F5, Checkpoint)
  • Other network and security technologies experience such as Juniper, Checkpoint, WAN optimisation, F5 Load balancing, etc
  • Knowledge of Microsoft technologies, Linux, VMWare, Citrix, etc\xc2\xa0

You will be taken through a technical interview process which will involve complex problem solving relating to your previous experience and test your ability to learn new technologies & adapt to varied technology environments.

If you are interested in this position and believe that your experience is closely aligned with the requirements listed, then please forward your application via the APPLY Button.

Due to the large number of CVs we receive we cannot always respond to every applicant. If you do not hear from us within two weeks of applying then you can assume that on this occasion your experience was unfortunately not an exact match for the position, but please do not hesitate\xc2\xa0to apply again in the future!

All positions at AC3 must undergo a criminal background check.

"

title: ADMINISTRATOR/RECEPTIONIST
description:
b'

Join this well established medical devices organisation who is seeking an exceptional receptionist/administrator to be the face of the organisation and assist with processing orders and liaising with customers.

.

Responsibilities:

  • Front desk reception - meet and greet
  • Follow up with marketing material for conferences
  • Assist with monthly newsletters

  • Organising quotes
  • Making appointments for customers and follow up with reminders to their mobile telephone
  • Enter client orders into the relevant system - from email, faxes and telephone
  • Generate picking slips for stock to be allocated to an order
  • Follow up on back orders

Skills:

  • Exceptional telephone manner
  • Minimum 5 years experience as a receptionist/administrator essential
  • Superior customer service
  • MS Word and Excel
  • Fast accurate data entry
  • Good eye for detail
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Good time management and ability to prioritise work
  • Willingness to learn and adapt

Personal Attributes:

  • Good team player
  • Willingness to go the extra mile
  • Reliable
  • Mature attitude

Own transport highly desirable because of location, parking available.

This would suit an organised, flexible and team orientated person who enjoys working in a friendly office environment.

PLEASE NOTE; To ensure your application reaches interview stage please complete all the details on the Edge Recruitment database

ONLY AUSTRALIAN CITIZENS OR PERMANENT RESIDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Suzanne Edge on 9804 0400, quoting Ref No. 252888E7-2D50-479E-B4F8-CD3183D101AD. '

title: Accounts Payable
description:
b'

Freyssinet Australia \xc2\xa0Pty Ltd, a subsidiary of the global Soletanche Freyssinet Group of companies, is a market leading specialist design and contracting company providing innovative solutions to construction industry.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

We are currently seeking a full time Accounts Payable Officer to join our Finance team based in Macquarie Park. Reporting to the Finance Manager, this role covers the full function of accounts payable for the company.

\xc2\xa0

Duties will include:

\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa2Processing supplier's invoices to financial system in a timely and accurate manner;

\xe2\x80\xa2Verifying accuracy of invoices received against purchase orders & delivery dockets;

\xe2\x80\xa2Reconciliation of creditor & supplier invoices/statements each month;

\xe2\x80\xa2Liaising with suppliers, contractors & internal staff & group inter companies regarding invoices and account queries;

\xe2\x80\xa2Processing weekly payment runs via EFT or cheques;

\xe2\x80\xa2Data entry of overseas supplier invoices and liaison with the bank regarding international EFT's;

\xe2\x80\xa2Providing support and backup to other Finance team members when required.

\xc2\xa0

The successful candidate will have a strong working knowledge of Accounts Payable with a minimum of 3 years of full time experience in an Accounts Payable role. You will also have general computer skills in Excel and exposure to large ERP Systems.\xc2\xa0 Experience in Workbench will be advantageous but not essential. You will have strong communication and time management skills and a very reliable approach to your work.

\xc2\xa0If you would like to be part of a progressive, successful operation that values its employees' contributions to its business, please forward your application and resume by clicking on the "Apply Now" button below.

'

title: Receptionist
description:
b"

Sydney Motor Group is a family owned and operated dealership, providing new and used high-performing vehicles designed to thrill and inspire our guests.

Within flagship brands such as Nissan and Renault,\xc2\xa0have an excellent career opportunity for a Receptionist to join our Dealership in the heart of Sydney - Alexandria.

This permanent full-time position is required between 8am and 5:30pm, Monday to Friday, and will be responsible for:

  • Telephone reception;
  • Meet and Greet of Incoming Guests;
  • Filing;
  • Data Entry \xe2\x80\x93 such as daily entry of all incoming sales enquiries into our systems;
  • Mail distribution;
  • Managing office/beverage supplies;
  • Word processing and preparing documents;
  • General office duties, as required.

Skills and experience in the following areas will be highly valued:

  • A 'can do', mature and self-confident attitude;
  • Exceptional personal presentation and professionalism;
  • Sound communication skills - both verbal and written;
  • High level of organisational skills, with the ability to prioritise and multi-task;
  • Computer Literacy \xe2\x80\x93 Microsoft Office;
  • Administration experience will be highly regarded.

Your reliability, professionalism and true guest-focused attitude will play a major role in achieving success.\xc2\xa0 If you have what it takes to excel within our business, we would be pleased to hear from you \xe2\x80\x93 apply now!

\xc2\xa0

Sydney Motor Group is an equal opportunity employer.

Only Short-Listed Candidates that meet the criteria will be contacted.

"

title: Administration and Accounts Officer
description:
b'
Our client, based in a home office in Randwick, is currently seeking an experienced Accounts and Administration Officer to join their busy team. Paying $60,000 inclusive of Super

About the role:

This company are looking for an Accounts and Administration Officer to handle their daily accounting and also provide administrative support to the office.\xc2\xa0

The position will suit an individual with a hands-on positive attitude and a customer orientated approach.\xc2\xa0

Accounting duties include but are not limited to:\xc2\xa0
  • Accounts receivable and payable\xc2\xa0
  • Ensure bank and credit cards are reconciled on a weekly basis
  • Perform weekly and monthly payroll
  • Reporting for BAS returns
  • Monthly reconciliation with all accounts, credit cards and bank records
  • Produce and distribute monthly invoicing to clients
You will also be expected to:
  • Assist with database management and data entry
  • Order processing
  • Diary management
  • Preparation of facilitation packs \xc2\xa0
  • Travel bookings
  • Other Ad hoc administration
To be successful you will have:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of using Xero (desirable)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Financial Experience\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attention to detail, ability to multi-task and work autonomously
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent time management and verbal and written communication skills
\xc2\xa0
If you feel you meet the above criteria and\xc2\xa0are happy to work within a small team\xc2\xa0then please APPLY now! Alternatively contact Claire 02 9279 2777 for more information. '

title: Customer Service Officer - Parramatta Location
salary: b'Attractive salary with great staff benefits'
description:
b'
  • Showcase your communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrate your commitment to providing a high level of customer service.
  • Work for an industry leader with great staff benefits.

About the role:

Our Apprenticeship\xc2\xa0Network Provider (ANP) Division is currently seeking to appoint a full-time Customer Service Officer\xc2\xa0to be based in our Parramatta\xc2\xa0office.

Reporting to the Administration Manager\xc2\xa0this role\xc2\xa0is responsible for providing internal and external clients excellent customer service with resolved outcomes.\xc2\xa0This must be provided in line with measured Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), as well as being compliant with all aspects of the Australian Apprenticeship Federal and State Guidelines, together with any administrative processes required to achieve this goal.

This role requires a\xc2\xa0self-starter who can efficiently manage time frames and display\xc2\xa0energy and enthusiasm for the various programs and activities of the company in all dealings with internal and\xc2\xa0external clients.

Selection Criteria:

  • excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • experience in providing a high level of customer service
  • ability to work in a team environment and be receptive to change
  • proven experience in meeting set targets, KPIs and customer service standards
  • ability to prioritise and time manage effectively to successfully achieve results
  • accurate and efficient data entry skills with attention to detail
  • ability to interpret and apply relevant policy and legislation
  • high level of computer literacy across a range of devices and programs.

An attractive base salary along with\xc2\xa09.5% superannuation will be on offer to the successful candidate.

About\xc2\xa0the\xc2\xa0Company:

Established in 1982, MEGT is an Australian not-for-profit organisation that has been supporting local employers, apprentices, trainees, job seekers and students for over 30 years. MEGT is a large organisation, employing over 700 staff across more than 70 Australian offices.

Our services include

  • helping businesses plan for appropriate workforce skills
  • assistance with the processes involved in Australian Apprenticeships and facilitating the Australian government's Australian Apprenticeships Support Network
  • employment, management and labour hire of apprentices and trainees
  • general staff recruitment
  • Indigenous apprenticeship and traineeship employment and project management
  • vocational education delivered either in the workplace or classroom
  • English language education for people from non-English speaking backgrounds
  • campus training in Children's Services
  • campus training in carpentry and electrotechnology.

Why work for MEGT?

Here are just some of the great reasons to work for MEGT.

We offer:

  • 17.5 % leave loading
  • salary sacrifice
  • option to purchase one week's additional annual leave
  • 3 day Christmas -\xc2\xa0 New Year closedown as\xc2\xa0 a gift from MEGT
  • cash out of annual and personal leave
  • optional corporate uniform
  • Employee Assistance Program for staff and immediate family members
  • Employee Benefits Program
  • Study Support program
  • opportunity for career progression within a national organisation
  • Staff Recognition of Service Program
  • take pro rata Long Service Leave after 7 years.

And of course, great people to work with!

The successful applicant will be required to undertake a Police Check and any State/Territory Working with Children Check (where applicable).

To obtain a position description, please visit our website\xc2\xa0www.megt.com.au:

  • Desktop/PC:\xc2\xa0Job Seekers/Careers at MEGT.
  • Handheld Devices:\xc2\xa0Select the menu icon (three parallel bars)/Jobs - select the arrow /Careers at MEGT.

If you would like to take advantage of this opportunity please submit an application including a cover letter, detailing relevant industry experience, a document addressing the Selection Criteria in the position description (in one file, uploaded via the cover letter portal), and a resume (uploaded via the resume portal).

For all further queries please email megtrecruitment@megt.com.au quoting the reference number 1322.

To apply, please click the 'APPLY' button below. Please note: Only applications received via Seek will be accepted.

Applications close 5pm Tuesday 16th May, 2017.

Please note - Applications submitted in Word/PDF format are preferred.

To find out more about MEGT, please visit our website at www.megt.com.au

**Strictly no agencies**

'

title: Fleet Administration Clerk
description:
b'

title: Office Administrator/Secretary in Milsons Point
description:
b"

We are a dynamic and innovative accountancy firm in Milsons Point. Our focus is exceptional client service and providing value adding, accurate and tailored accountancy and taxation compliance services. An\xc2\xa0opportunity has arisen for an\xc2\xa0Office Administrator. Hours can potentially be flexible and/or part time for the right candidate.\xc2\xa0

As you may be the first point of client contact with our firm, applicants are required to possess a high standard of personal presentation and an excellent command of the English language, demonstrating sound verbal and written communication skills. Applicants must also be able to prioritise work duties, pay great attention to detail and work well under pressure. Competence with Microsoft Word and Excel is essential.

Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Electronic imaging of documents

  • Record management and updating client files

  • Data entry

  • Preparation and distribution of incoming and outgoing mail

  • Welcoming clients promptly, efficiently and assisting clients with general enquiries both in person and via telephone

  • Management of various aspects of the practice's internal accounting system such as accounts payable and debtors.

  • Other ad-hoc administrative duties.

  • Other more complex tasks as your knowledge and skills develop.

\xc2\xa0

As the successful applicant you will have:

  • Professional presentation

  • A friendly, confident and proactive persona

  • An ability to work efficiently independently

  • Energy and enthusiasm

  • A passion for excellence and customer service

\xc2\xa0

Experience involving use of the following software packages will be highly regarded:

  • MYOB Accountants Office

  • Xero

  • MYOB

  • BGL Corporate Affairs system

  • BGL Simple Fund

An appropriate salary plus superannuation will be offered. Applicants with previous accounting secretarial experience can expect a salary at the high end of the market. Two referees are required to be provided with your application and will be contacted for successful applicants.

If you believe this role is for you we look forward to receiving your application today at accountants@hartfordpartners.com.au . All applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence.

"

title: Office Administrator and Document Controller
description:
b'

Global Rail Australia Pty Ltd is part of the Global Infrastructure Group and is a leading Australian provider of design, construct and commission services for clients across a wide range of engineering and infrastructure industries including Mainline, Metro and Light Rail Systems and Utilities, whilst also offering general contracting and building services in the commercial and industrial sectors.

Global Rail Australia and GRA Networks are currently looking to employ an Office Administrator and Document Controller to join their Sydney Office (Botany, Sydney).

We are looking for a professional and reliable individual, with excellent communication skills and attention to detail. The successful candidate will need to have a can-do attitude in order to join our dynamic and hard-working team. The role is varied and includes data entry, customer service, receptionist duties, preparing tender proposals, and supporting the accounts department.

Location

Sydney, Australia

Experience

Successful applicants must have the following:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Previous similar experience & Qualifications ( 3 years minimum )

\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent written & verbal communication skills

\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent computer/software skills and advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Suite of products

\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent data entry skills

\xe2\x80\xa2 Self-starter with strong initiative for process improvement, and ability to work well both alone and as part of a team.

Salary

Competitive

Job description:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Receiving and managing incoming calls and emails.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Inputting information quickly & accurately from a variety of sources into databases & spreadsheets.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Communicating information internally between staff & externally to valued clients via email & telephone.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting office and field staff as required

\xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting in the preparation of tender proposals and marketing support.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Office Administration \xe2\x80\x93 maintaining stock levels, ordering supplies, general filing & administration.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Basic IT administration, setting up email accounts and field staff laptops etc. liaising with our IT provider to troubleshoot more complex IT issues.

About us:

Global Rail Australia has an outstanding reputation for employee retention and our success lies in the quality and diversity of our people and our commitment to training and developing our staff.

We value diversity and inclusion as an employer, which is why we invite applications from all individuals regardless of background or education. However, for some positions, we do assess role-related expertise.

How to apply:

To apply online please click the \xe2\x80\x98Apply\xe2\x80\x99 button below. Please ensure that you include details of all relevant qualifications and competencies with your application. Alternatively please forward a copy of your curriculum vitae to careers@globalrail.com.au. Quoting Reference 114.

'

title: Customer Service & Office Administration
description:
b'

The Company

Wilson & Gilkes are a leading manufacturer of Audio Visual products, Workplace and IT storage solutions.\xc2\xa0 We are seeking an experienced and professional Customer Service and Administration Assistant to join our team located at Moorebank.\xc2\xa0 As a part of the Customer Service team, you will be responsible for accurate order entry, meeting the customer needs and communicating with all the relevant departments to ensure service levels are met and maintained.

\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities

Handle customer enquiries (phone and internet)

Order processing

Provide quotes, data entry, invoicing

Liaise with manufacturing and accounts department to ensure orders are expedited timely and any issues are addressed

Handling freight, con notes and liaising with transport companies.

Maintain administrative filing and document management.

Undertake ad- hoc general administrative tasks as required

Provide an effective and timely response to all customer enquiries.

\xc2\xa0

Required Skills

Minimum of 2 years customer service experience preferably in manufacturing or transport

High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office, Outlook, Excel and Word

Excellent communication skills both written and verbal

A positive "Can Do" and pro-active approach to work

Well organized and with a high level of accuracy

Ability to work as part of a team with minimum supervision

\xc2\xa0

If you feel you have the necessary skills, commitment and attributes to be successful, then please forward your resume to hr@gilkon.com.au with a covering note addressing the above criteria.

Confidentiality is assured with all applications.\xc2\xa0

Wilson & Gilkes Pty Ltd is recognized as an EEO Employer. Please visit our website for more information about our company www.wilsongilkes.com.au

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

No recruitment agencies please

'

title: Business Analyst
description:
b'UXC, CSC and HP ES have come together to create one of the largest IT services companies in Australia and New Zealand - DXC Technology.

As part of the\xc2\xa0DXC group, DXC Professional Solutions (formally UXC Professional Solutions)\xc2\xa0provides its employees with an unrivalled opportunity to work with the best clients and IT\xc2\xa0Consultants, as well as the best tools, technologies and expertise in the industry.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Our business is growing and we have several opportunities for\xc2\xa0passionate and engaging applications focused Business Analysts and Senior Business Analysts to join our growing team.\xc2\xa0

You will stand out from the crowd,\xc2\xa0enjoy being client facing,\xc2\xa0seamlessly work\xc2\xa0with, and manage a variety of different stakeholders\xc2\xa0whilst delivering tangible and value add solutions across\xc2\xa0digital transformation projects.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
To be\xc2\xa0successful, you must demonstrate the\xc2\xa0following capabilities;
  • Ability to coordinate, negotiate and facilitate with key stakeholders\xc2\xa0from end users to CXO executives
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver clear and\xc2\xa0concise documentation
  • Broad industry exposure\xc2\xa0with a track record delivering across\xc2\xa0applications focused data and digital\xc2\xa0initiatives\xc2\xa0
  • Ability to adapt your approach\xc2\xa0in line with both the agile and waterfall delivery\xc2\xa0methodologies\xc2\xa0
  • Strong time management skills with the ability to prioritise and deliver outstanding results\xc2\xa0
  • Ideally, you will\xc2\xa0hold an industry recognised\xc2\xa0certification across either CBAP or BABOK\xc2\xa0
  • With a\xc2\xa0positive,\xc2\xa0passionate and ambitious approach to your work, you strive to learn and grow as a business analyst

In return, DXC Professional Solutions\xc2\xa0is a business who will provide you with growth and development opportunities across a number of different industry sectors. If you are seeking a company that truly believes in their people and want to be part of an exciting future then this is the role for you.
\xc2\xa0
DXC Professional Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

You must be an Australian Permanent Resident to apply for this role. '

title: Data Analyst & Support Officer
description:
b'

My client is looking for a Data Analyst & Support Officer for an initial 12 month contract working within a Government organisation.

\xc2\xa0

  • Advanced Excel skills are a must for this position, you will need to be switched on in terms of data e.g. what is happening with the data and what it is applying to.
  • It is a very hectic and exciting fast paced work environment so you will need to be flexible and adapt well to change on both a daily basis and within the role.

\xc2\xa0

Key\xc2\xa0Responsibilities:

  • Extract and manipulate routine to complex data, ensuring the accuracy, integrity and relevance of information pertaining to comparative and impact analysis activities to support efficient processes.
  • Comparative assessments, impact analysis, and verify data.
  • Schedule and prepare for meetings, briefings, pool assessments and interviews, preparing correspondence for impacted staff.
  • Contribute to and support the creation, and ongoing maintenance and analysis of complex data sources, and communicate identified risks promptly to the BP Implementation to support efficient processes across the program.
  • Draft templates and other documentation related to the consultation and implementation processes, including at the various stages of the placement process to support consistency and effectiveness across the program.
  • Manage communication channels efficiently and effectively, directing inquiries as appropriate to facilitate the effective operation of the change process across the relevant business area.
  • Gather, collate and provide background information to support informed decision making and planning.
  • Maintain appropriate and accurate HR and records management systems, to ensure the integrity of data and to support the efficient retrieval of information at all stages of the program.
  • Provide panels support during the pooled assessment processes to facilitate a consistent and effective process.
  • Work in collaboration and provide support in recruitment, assessment, placement, onboarding and related processes to enable the delivery of outcomes for the business.

\xc2\xa0

Key Challenges:

  • Experience in facilitating and providing administration support for Human Resources and/or Recruitment within a high volume environment.
  • Excellent MS Office skills, particularly in word, Excel and PowerPoint. Advanced Excel skills are essential including skills in presenting, manipulating and analysing accurate data.
  • Working through a significant period of transformation where changes to structures, processes and cultures will be ongoing and it is critical to maintain confidentiality and deliver to strict deadlines and stakeholder expectations.
  • Keeping both outcome driven and strong customer focus in a complex environment with multiple work streams and high volume and often competing workloads that will challenge the delivery of timely outcomes.
  • Maintaining systems and processes to effectively coordinate the activities of BP Implementation and while providing high quality customer service to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical and written communication skills
  • Experience working in a confidential environment with excellent organisation and coordination skills.
  • Preferably have Visio skills (Microsoft office for org. charts) would be advantageous.
  • Must have SAP experience.
'

title: Client Services Executive
description:
b"

About the business and the role

RFi Group is a global intelligence, media and events provider focusing exclusively on financial services. \xc2\xa0We offer a dynamic, fast-paced environment with opportunities for fast career growth and development. RFi Group has had an annualised growth rate of 50% year on year since 2007 and was listed on the BRW Fast 100 6 years in a row from 2011 to 2016.

We have offices in Sydney, Singapore, London, Hong Kong, Toronto and Washington DC and are rapidly expanding around the world providing new opportunities for employees who excel.

RFi is looking for a personable, highly-organised and ambitious individual to join our client services team.\xc2\xa0 Initially based in Sydney, upon successful completion of training period (maximum 3 months) this role moves to Singapore.\xc2\xa0

Job tasks and responsibilities

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Responsible for 3 major global clients in relation to their Asia contract deliverables

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be responsible for the client feedback process for these clients, to ensure that their needs and requirements are fully accommodated in the programs of which they are a member.\xc2\xa0 Includes sending requests for feedback to market and regional contacts, chasing and clarifying feedback.\xc2\xa0 Escalating to the GM-Asia where required

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Book presentations for clients

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Sending any pre-read information to clients, or any set deliverables that are not associated with the presentation.

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Being the key day-to-day contact for the multiple stakeholders from each of the client accounts.\xc2\xa0 Including responding to email and phone requests.

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Taking additional analysis and other service requests from clients, responding in a timely manner and sending deliverables back to the client.

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Some travel to countries within Asia to attend client presentations

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Onboard new contracts secured by the GM-Asia with these three clients using Salesforce and Jira software

Internal and team responsibilities

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Participating in weekly check ins with the research team to ensure that client deadlines can be met

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Coordination of travel days in line with sales/CS staff and presenter availability to schedule presentations

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Creating workflows in Jira for the deliverables and timelines in each client's contract

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Creating workflows in Jira around the three clients' additional analysis requests, including negotiating client priorities with research

Excellent file management practice to ensure that your clients' deliverables are accessible to all staff who need to access them while maintaining data privacy and confidentiality standards

Skills and experience

Role requirements

Demonstrated excellent communication skills in English - both written and spoken

Confident ability to use own initiative

Excellent interpersonal skills

Bachelor's degree OR at least 3 years' client service experience if no tertiary qualifications

Willing to travel to and within the Asia region

Advantageous to this role

East Asian languages

An understanding of banking and finance a

Existing knowledge of Salesforce and Jira advantage

Job benefits and perks

The RFi Group way:

Full 'on the job' training, specific to this role will be provided, underpinned by RFi's comprehensive formal training program which includes:

  • Employee onboarding process \xe2\x80\x93 mapping out the first 100 days so you know exactly what to expect
  • 30 noteworthy skills sessions to create a strong understanding of the various components that make up the business.

RFi is committed to fostering a positive culture and workplace environment, and provides:

  • Employee success team \xe2\x80\x93 Regional project teams driving new initiatives in employee engagement
  • Monthly drinks \xe2\x80\x93 Facilitates networking with employees from other departments
  • Bi-annual companywide strategic offsite events - where all employees are encouraged to contribute ideas to the company's strategy for the next financial year
  • Volunteer initiatives and charitable community partnerships
  • Annual employee awards \xe2\x80\x93 recognizing high achievers across the board
  • Social events for special events throughout the calendar year
  • Casual dress and 4pm finish Fridays
  • Birthdays off work and monthly cakes

Our recruitment process focusses heavily on individual attitude and drive to succeed - ensuring that we hire passionate and hardworking individuals who to learn and thrive within the company.\xc2\xa0This is a fantastic opportunity to accelerate your career in digital marketing media and events. Apply now to join the RFi team!

"

title: SHEQ Advisor
description:
b'

Visionstream provides telecommunications and ICT services across Australia and New Zealand, focused on design, construction, operations and maintenance for carriers, government, channel partners and enterprise industry segments. With a heritage in design, construction and maintenance services, Visionstream is a trusted partner to leading telecommunication and ICT network providers, and industries who rely on mission-critical infrastructure.

We are also proud to be part of Ventia, one Australia's largest services businesses providing comprehensive support and management services to clients across the resources, telecommunications, transport, energy, water, health and industrial sectors. Ventia is structured for growth across Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea and New Caledonia.

About the role

Reporting to the NSW Safety Manager, we have a fantastic opportunity for a SHEQ Advisor to join the NBN project team. in meeting the health and safety strategic objectives, and drive the ongoing implementation of the health and safety management system. This role will see you responsible for:

  • Promoting and maintaining the company's ongoing determination to improve its performance in health, safety and environmental management
  • Communicating and promoting the safety leadership value of "Everyone Safe Everyday" and promote the corporate safety culture initiative
  • Looking for opportunities to improve the accuracy, efficiency and effectiveness of standards, guidelines, policies and process, and ensure compliance with all applicable policies and procedures. Identify and mitigate for risk management and opportunity capitalisation.
  • Ensuring compliance with the business and HSE systems as developed and implemented. Continually reinforce requirement to conduct activities in accordance with stated values, policies & procedures, and legislative requirements. Act in accordance with and as a role model for the Code of Conduct, HSE culture and the Values.
  • Coordinating and leading project level safety audits or reviews.
  • Assisting and advising the project in managing external governance requirements.
  • Providing quality control for incident investigations.
  • Reviewing the consistent implementation of the project HSE plan to ensure continuous improvement.
  • Analysing data and monitoring project HSE performance, identify trends across multiple projects and develop reports accordingly.
  • Keeping abreast of changes to legislation and communicate such changes to line management
  • Recommending corrective actions that focus on systematic improvement and transferable lessons.

About you

To be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in heavy industry, services or construction
\xe2\x80\xa2 OHS Diploma / Degree, Cert IV TAE 40110
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 5 years previous experience in a SHEQ Coordinator or similar position
\xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional communication
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent time management, organisational and problem solving skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Leadership

What Visionstream can offer

  • Autonomous environment
  • Work as part of a team
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Opportunity to work on the largest telecommunications project in Australia.

Apply today to join an organisation that delivers innovative, safety-focussed and performance driven solutions that can provide genuine opportunities for growth and development of your career.

For further information regarding this position please contact Fiona Martin fiona.martin@visionstream.com.au

N.B. We respectfully request no agency approaches

'

title: Personal/Executive Assistant

title: Channel Sales | Cloud Sales Representative | Vendor Sales
description:
b"About the company
\xc2\xa0
Our client is an emerging global software vendor with a well-established market presence and functional office in Sydney for the ANZ region.
\xc2\xa0
Their growth for the last 6 years has been solid, averaging at 20-30% year-on-year which is a clear indicator of their market demand and penetration.
\xc2\xa0
The Company offers solutions in cloud infrastructure, virtualization, data centre, backup, disaster recovery and storage\xc2\xa0software.
\xc2\xa0
About The Role

This role has a unique blend of both channel sales and cloud sales. It is an inside sales role reporting to the Inside Sales Manager with a dotted line into the Channel Sales team.

The role is responsible for sales and relationships activities such as developing, managing and growing small to mid-market cloud services and hosting providers as your target customer territory. In addition, you are also responsible for onboarding, relationship management, training, marketing and sales with the Company's aggregators.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Your success is primarily measured on revenue generation and achievements of set KPIs.\xc2\xa0

About You

The ideal candidate should have some IT industry B2B sales experience (minimum 6 months to 5 years) with technology software companies, technology resellers or managed services providers.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
In additional to experience, the ideal candidate needs to possess a natural ooze for sales and business development, who thrives on winning business and deals, hitting targets, willingness to succeed with grit and determination.

Benefits

The company is technology powerhouse - anyone IT Infrastructure will know or know of them. Their solutions offering is well rated and is a Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader.

The OTE is realistic. The territory for this role is a well-performing patch. In fact, overachieving OTE is not out of the question.

This is the fast track pathway into Field Sales (channel or direct) provided your performance is satisfactory.

Last, but not least, this is the opportunity to play an integral part in a business that will continue to grow and be at the forefront of its industry.
\xc2\xa0
Apply now using the 'apply' button or if you have questions, please call:\xc2\xa0

Michelle Cheong on 0422 632 655 or email mcheong@humanisedgroup.com "

title: NA
description:
b'
