The role of Data Analyst, is to partner with Marketing and Product to identify and define the business problems, recommend optimal Marketing activity, deliver campaigns using campaign management systems and make continuous improvements based on customer insights derived from campaign analysis.

title: Change Management Team Leader
description:
b"Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?
\xc2\xa0
If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.
\xc2\xa0
We\xe2\x80\x99re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades \xe2\x80\x94 and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be working with teams across the world. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.
\xc2\xa0
We are currently looking for a\xc2\xa0Change Management Team Leader to support the business in achieving its strategic objectives.
\xc2\xa0
This is a senior role within Change Management with Team Leader responsibilities
\xc2\xa0
The goal of Change Management is to respond to both Internal and Customer\xe2\x80\x99s changing business requirements while maximising value and reducing incidents, disruptions and rework.
\xc2\xa0
The role of the Change Manager is to create and manage an ITIL compliant Change Management Process which includes the following elements: -
    • Recorded
    • Evaluated
    • Authorised
    • Prioritised
    • Planned
    • Tested
    • Implemented
    • Documented
    • Reviewed
  • To build a structure to ensure that Change Management is established within the Services business
  • To manage the Change Management requirements/life-cycle is delivered
  • To ensure changes are properly researched and that all relevant parties have input into the assessment of changes.
  • To establish/maintain the effort involved in building, testing and implementing.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
  • To establish/maintain the process introduction of new and changes CI\xe2\x80\x99s into the IT infrastructure with the CMDB team.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0What we expect you to do
  • Lead a team of Change Administrators
  • Establish a costing framework to establish Change Management into the organization\xc2\xa0
  • Establishing Change Management into the Managed Services accounts
  • Configure / Align toolsets to meet Change Management requirements
  • Work closely with Services Business to ensure Change Management discipline is applied
  • Ensure RFC assessments ensuring all rules are abided to
  • Maintenance of Change Management documents
  • Provide input for CMDB to be updated with all change related info and documents.
  • Ensure close working relationship with the CMDB team.
  • Recommend and make enhancements to the change control process, as agreed by all key parties.\xc2\xa0
  • Co-ordinate the change build, testing and implementation of changes
  • Establish communication workflows with all parties
  • Manage the complete change cycle from logging of call to signoff.
  • Assist with the Rollout of change Management process and procedure to new clients
  • Assist with Conducting \xc2\xa0Change management performance surveys with clients
Here's what we are looking for in candidates for this job

We have a global culture that embraces diversity. Dimension Data respects the diverse experiences and individual beliefs of its employees. To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Kirsty Page on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 226077. "

title: IT Sales Champion
description:
b"

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Founded in 2002, Arrow Voice and Data are a highly successful company, specialising in the B2B Mid-market sector delivering the latest in communications and IT whole of business solutions.

Join our youthful and dynamic team of 50 staff to take your career to the next level.

100% Australian owned, based in the Sydney CBD, Arrow holds an excellent reputation for a great work environment and outstanding customer satisfaction.

Arrow is a leader in its category and has experienced significant growth over the recent past.

We are excited to hire an enthusiastic go-getter to fill an IT / Managed Services sales role.

\xc2\xa0

JOB DESCRIPTION

Reporting to the State Sales Manager, you will be responsible for the selling (IT Software / Hardware and Managed Services) to pre-qualified existing customer leads as well as expanding our product offering into our extensive existing and new customer base.

Dealing with CEO's, Directors and IT Managers you will manage a dynamic, fast closing pipeline of sales opportunities.

Working with a growing sales team who are regularly exceeding their KPI's and targets to earn amazing commissions.

You will be supported by a skilled and dedicated presales technical team and can look forward to joining a buzzing and close-knit environment with no two days the same!

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

To be considered for this opportunity you must have:-

  • Bright and intelligent Personality
  • Previous Sales Experience- B2B highly desirable
  • A Passion for Sales and career expansion
  • Excellent Communication Skills both Written and Verbal
  • Previous experience with CRM desirable
  • Drive and Determination to Meet and Exceed KPI's and Target

\xc2\xa0

Technical Experience\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

  • Able to confidently scope, present and explain IT solutions
  • Understands Microsoft Server configurations and software
  • LAN & WAN Networking and (DHCP, DNS, VLAN)
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Surface and Office 365
  • Understanding of Virtual environments and solutions (VMware and Microsoft Hypervisor)
  • Knowledgeable with PC hardware (CPU, HDD, SSD, RAM etc.) and compatibility between them
  • Knowledge of wireless technology

"

title: Electrical Project Engineer / Internal Sales

We are a long established Australian owned manufacturer of Electrical Power Distribution Systems (Busways), providing quality solutions to Industrial, Commercial, manufacturing, mining and Data Centre sectors.

Your responsibilities will include:

title: Order Fulfilment Coordinator (Gift Hampers)
description:
b"Gift Hampers are the perfect gift for so many occasions - Mother's Day, Father's Day, Birthdays, Christmas, Anniversary's, Get Well wishes, Valentine's Day, New Baby or just because...

Here you will be working with a growing Australian company taking responsibility for processing on line orders for gift hampers, to ensure their accurate and timely delivery.
You'll be working in a close knit, operational hub between Sales, Production and Logistics for this gourmet, fresh fruit and gift hamper company.\xc2\xa0

Previous experience using SAP, or working within a warehousing / dispatch / logistics / customer service environment would be ideal.

In this role you will be:
  • Processing daily orders and producing reporting outputs
  • Processing stock orders and receipt of goods
  • Data Entry of invoices, courier run information and other data into excel and SAP
  • Office administration tasks
  • Ad Hoc support to customer service as needed, this may include answering phone calls and responding to customers.
  • Special Projects from time to time as needed by the business.

Ideally you will have:
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to solve problems
  • Strong organisational skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Process focused
  • Proficient with Microsoft Excel (Intermediate level).
If you care about your work and love bringing a big smile to work each day, along with your 'can do' attitude - you will thrive here!\xc2\xa0

The role is currently situated at Lane Cove, however from August, they will be relocating to Lidcombe.\xc2\xa0
It is a fulltime role - with some flexibility in hours - but normally 8.30 - 5pm daily - except pre-Christmas which is their peak time and things can go a little crazy, so some overtime will be necessary to meet demand.
The company is growing ... who knows what opportunities this role may lead to in the future!
Besides an attractive salary, working for a small friendly team, you also get to take a complimentary, beautiful fruit box home each week (all part of the quality control)

Don't miss out on joining this great company - send your resume today to Tamara at RecruitLoop, or call 0413 345 325 if you have any other questions - an immediate start is available.

This position is a full-time, permanent role. Only those eligible to work permanently in Australia need apply. "

title: NA
description:
b'

What is this client and role about?

My client is one of the most successful software fintech\xe2\x80\x99s in Australia. Their success comes from building the first and only sophisticated cloud solution to automate highly complicated financial services funds management functions. Their products have transformed an industry.

As part of their ongoing expansion, they are now looking to hire a technical leader for the build of a greenfield automated and AI driven Data Feeds product. In this role, leading a Scrum team you will oversee the transition from the existing data feeds solution to the new solution which will be designed and built by your team. This is a genuinely diverse role (coder, leader, designer and BA) which will include:

  • Team and technical leadership
  • Circa 50% coding (mostly complicated back-end C# and SQL)
  • Be heavily involved in the design of the new product
  • Leading the build and integration of the new product
  • Overseeing modification and enhanced features for the existing data feeds solution.

The right culture and fit?

The developers at our client are logical, considered, calm, thoughtful, curious and analytical. They know they are good and this is reflected in quiet confidence, completely devoid of smugness or ego. They are not extroverted but are skilled communicators who can both explain and constructively debate complex ideas and logic, as well as engage effectively in product and domain conversations (their senior developers are expected to be pseudo BA\xe2\x80\x99s). The fact that you are a great coder and can translate algorithms into code is the base-line of your capability. Your design thinking and ability to look at complex problems from different perspectives is outstanding, as is your ability to then articulate the reasoning behind your solutions and views. You will be someone capable of applying independent critical thinking. You can problem solve autonomously and independently as well as help others around you solve problems and become better at what they do.

Why would you want this role?

You will be working with committed and skilled developers all pulling in the same direction

You and your team will engage with product daily, and have direct influence over product direction. You will always know why you are building what you are building and have a voice in deciding how to deliver the highest user value through what you and your team build (they do not hire \xe2\x80\x98code monkeys\xe2\x80\x99).

You will be attempting to build a solution which has never been built before, and if successful would be transformational for the Australian financial services industry - build something which could have an industry wide user impact

You will be working with proven developers who have built, and build, \xe2\x80\x98first of its kind\xe2\x80\x99 solutions which make incredibly complicated finance functions, simple and intuitive for users for the first time

You will be involved in \xe2\x80\x98ever evolving technical and domain challenges\xe2\x80\x99.

You will have a genuine interest in learning a lot about financial services, and how the \xe2\x80\x98guts\xe2\x80\x99 of funds management and wealth management industries work

You will have an interest in building products, making complex things run fast, working with high volume real time data, and having the chance to apply AI and automation to these areas.

A different recruitment experience?

Please apply or call if the above resonates with you, but please note you must have Australian work rights. This role is being managed by Account Director Dan Gordon on 02 9409 4805. Dan is a certified Scrum Master and Product Owner, and from face-to-face interviews with the clients Head of Development, Lead Architect and Tech Leaders, will provide suitable candidates with a clear account of all aspects of this opportunity.

'

title: Claims Case Manager, Insurance claims
description:
b'

Our Business:

Our Life Customer Solutions (LCS) team within CommInsure, is the centre of excellence for all life operation areas. The functions included are underwriting, claims, administration and operational call centres. Customers include policyholders, financial advisers and trustees.

We focus on our customers. We are a strong, stable and secure provider for the community and our teams have genuine conviction for the work we're doing

CommInsure is a division of Wealth Management and is a leading player in the Australian insurance industry and part of the Commonwealth Bank Group.

The CommInsure Retail Advice department is responsible for the management of the Retail Advice portfolio \xe2\x80\x93 distributing predominantly life insurance products (Death, Total and Permanent Disability, Trauma and Income Protection) through financial advisers \xe2\x80\x93 be they bank aligned channels or Independent financial planners.

We are focused on developing expertise across all teams and committed to individual development across the business.

Our Opportunity:

An exciting opportunity currently exists to utilise and develop your Life Claims case management skills whilst managing a portfolio of Retail Income Protection claims.

You will assist our customers on their path to wellness by providing a tailored approach, early intervention and ongoing support. You will be responsible for the management of your own portfolio whilst providing support to the wider team to ensure we deliver for our customers. This involves working closely with rehabilitation consultants, treatment providers and other stakeholders, regular customer contact, ongoing assessments, monthly benefit payments and expenses among other duties. This role will allow you to further develop your case management skills and provide you with the education, experience and exposure to continue to progress within your career.

What will success look like?

\xc2\xb7 You will manage a portfolio of Income Protection claims comprising of Physical and Mental Health conditions

\xc2\xb7 You will provide exemplary service to our customers and stakeholders over the phone and in writing

\xc2\xb7 Managing the payment of claims including the accurate entry of payments into our system and the creation of accurate correspondence to customers

\xc2\xb7 Implement sound case management strategies with clear objectives that result in sustainable health outcomes

\xc2\xb7 Analyse financial, legal, medical and policy information to thoroughly assess and manage legitimate claims

\xc2\xb7 Liaise with treating Specialists, General Practitioners and other associated Professionals with the ultimate goal of supporting and educating our customers and ensuring all claims are assessed and paid in accordance with the policy terms and conditions

\xc2\xb7 Liaise with other internal and external stakeholders to support effective case management outcomes, including medical practitioners, advisers, solicitors, accountants, investigators and rehabilitation consultants

\xc2\xb7 Make liability and payment decisions in line with Delegated Authority

\xc2\xb7 Adhere and work within all Service Level Agreements and aim meet or exceed all determined Key Performance Indicators

\xc2\xb7 Following up outstanding claims requirements to ensure timely decision making and action on claims

\xc2\xb7 Ensuring high levels of data quality are maintained across all claims systems

\xc2\xb7 Ensure you adhere to all operational risk and insurance risk controls and measures

\xc2\xb7 Ensure that you comply with the Group's Occupational Health and Safety policy, all other internal Group policies and procedures, and any relevant external legislative requirements.

What will help you succeed?

In order to be successful in this role you may possess sound experience in managing life insurance, workers compensation or CTP claims. You may also bring a wealth of experience gained from healthcare or rehabilitation.

You will be an articulate communicator, highly self-motivated and look to positively contribute to the culture of our team. You will apply your strong relationship management skills through liaison with a range of internal and external stakeholders whereby you will assess and manage claims.

'

title: Payroll Officer - Parental Leave Contract
description:
b'

Operating across Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia, John Holland is a fully integrated infrastructure, building and rail group. We offer our customers a total service solution, participating in every link of the project lifecycle from origination, financing and development, to design and construction, operations and maintenance.

Working from our offices in Parramatta and reporting to the Regional Payroll Supervisor, an opportunity has become available for an experienced Payroll Officer to join our team on a parental leave relief contract. This role will be involved in the end-to-end payroll services for wages employees. We are looking for someone who is eager to learn more about the payroll function and willing to take on a variety of tasks.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Meet all payroll administration deadlines and schedules;
  • Administer the setup of employee wages and maintain as required;
  • Complete terminations of employees ensuring current legislation is met;
  • Liaise with the Workers Compensation and Income Protection team, HR, Finance, and Supervisors/Superintendents;
  • Maintain shifts/rosters in T&A system in consultation with Supervisors;
  • Ensure time and attendance data is entered accurately into the system and is maintained;
  • Reconcile T&A and payroll system for billing purposes;
  • Create and maintain employee payroll master files;
  • Answer payroll queries from employees, management and external agencies;
  • Ensure all paperwork is filed accurately

To be considered for this role, you must have:

  • Minimum of 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience within a team-based payroll environment
  • Exposure to Chris21, Time and attendance and Excel
  • Sound knowledge of relevant statutory legislation relating to payroll and HR (desirable)
  • Exceptional attention to detail and ability to consistently meet deadlines
  • Strong numeracy and accurate data entry skills coupled with strong verbal and written communication skills
  • A positive attitude towards learning and development

At John Holland we understand that our greatest resource is our people. We pride ourselves on being a market leader in targeting training, career development and remuneration. We provide long-term career options within an equal opportunity workplace where we recognise the importance of flexibility and a healthy work-life balance.

John Holland is a wholly owned subsidiary of CCCC International Holding Limited (CCCI). CCCI\xe2\x80\x99s parent company, China Communications Construction Company, is a global leader in engineering and construction operating in more than 130 countries.

John Holland is an Equal Opportunity, Quality Assured employer.

'

title: Web Developer
description:
b'

About the business and the role

Our company provides a cloud based platform service connecting suppliers and online retailers across multiple industries currently in Australia and New Zealand with further international expansion planned.

We are seeking a talented web developer, graduate or new generation, to join our team based in Sydney with support from both our NZ and Melbourne offices.\xc2\xa0

Job tasks and responsibilities

The role of Web Developer will be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of our website, applications and e-commerce systems.

Responsibilities:

  • write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices,\xc2\xa0either from scratch or by adapting existing software codebase\xc2\xa0and graphics packages to meet business requirements
  • liaise with designers, system architects and other staff to help design and maintain the software
  • integrate data from various back-end services and databases

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Skills and experience

We have pitched this role and salary range at talent graduates or new generation web developers that firstly must have the natural talent of a good developer / programmer and preferably some work experience and understanding of being a productive fast learning team player.

For the right talented candidate we will provide additional training in the latest cloud technologies plus provide excellent growth opportunities within our group of companies.

title: Superannuation Product Operations & Projects Officer
description:
b"Our client is one of Australia's leading boutique superannuation funds. A\xc2\xa0recipient of numerous industry awards, they continue to boast record inflows and strong investment returns for their members. They are seeking a Senior Business Analyst Officer to join their small, highly experienced team.

This is a broad role that will see you working closely with the Head of Product Operations to analyse the company's client facing business processes and data requirements, and manage projects for change and improvement in those areas.\xc2\xa0 You will also provide Trustee Office, superannuation and managed funds operations activities.
  • Management and improvement of key business processes and data flows to support client service and business operations.
  • Undertake projects and change management responsibilities including development of project plans and ensuring projects are developed, managed and implemented to required time frames and budgets
  • Work closely with the company's outsourced service providers to maximise efficiency and accuracy, deliver high quality service to members and investors and obtain timely and usable customer data to provide analysis.
  • Work with Compliance to review legislative changes and define how they apply for superannuation and managed funds
  • Analysis of customer transactions for data integrity / compliance checking
  • Undertake projects and change management responsibilities including development of project plans and ensuring projects are developed, managed and implemented to required time frames and budgets
  • Provide support to the Head of Product Operations for management and Board reporting \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
This is a key role within the business therefore a solid background within Super, Product and Projects is a key. You should demonstrate;
  • Strong knowledge of superannuation administration systems (requirement)
  • Working knowledge of SIS legislation and an ability to understand legislative requirements for superannuation and managed funds (requirement)
  • Experience in data analysis and management reporting (highly desirable)
  • RG146 or ASFA Diploma (highly desirable)
  • Experience with project management methodologies (highly desirable)\xc2\xa0
  • Strong oral and written communication, negotiation and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work independently or co-operatively with team members having a range of competencies and disciplinary expertise
This is an exciting opportunity to work within a\xc2\xa0small,\xc2\xa0collaborative team\xc2\xa0environment, using your communication skills and industry knowledge to be an integral part of the business.\xc2\xa0

This is a 12 month maternity contract.

For more information please call Claire Tate on 02 9216 6733, or apply for the role by following the 'APPLY' link attached. "

title: Plant Manager
description:
b'

Bingo Industries is an Australian owned and operated waste management and recycling company in New South Wales with more than 10 years' experience servicing both the building and construction industry as well as the industrial and commercial industries. We pride ourselves on always exceeding our client's expectations with our exceptional service.

Due to our expansion, an opportunity has become available for an experienced full time Plant Manager.

The Plant Manager is responsible for the supervision of Plant Fitters and Mechanics that maintain Bingo's state of the art plant and equipment.

Your Benefits:

  • Generous remuneration package with bonus scheme
  • Safety first environment

Your Role:

  • Plan, organise, direct and run optimum day-to-day operations to exceed our customers' expectations
  • Increase production, assets capacity and flexibility while minimising unnecessary costs and maintaining current quality standards
  • Be responsible for production output and product quality
  • Allocate resources effectively and fully utilise assets to produce optimal results
  • Implement strategies in alignment with strategic initiatives and provide a clear sense of direction and focus
  • Monitor operations and trigger corrective actions
  • Share a trusting relationship with workgroup and recruit, manage and develop plant staff
  • Collect and analyse data to optimise throughput
  • Commit to plant safety procedures
  • Develop systems and processes that track and optimise productivity and standards, metrics and performance targets to ensure effective return on assets
  • Address employees' issues or grievances
  • Stay up to date with latest production management best practices and concepts

Your Skills and Experience:

  • Heavy Mechanical Trade Certificate (Plant & Machinery) or similar qualification
  • Proven work experience as a plant manager
  • Proven effective managerial experience
  • Superior knowledge of business and management principles (budgeting, strategic planning, resource allocation and human resources)
  • Have a focus on safety, quality, productivity, demand creation, inventory and stewardship processes
  • Strong computer literacy with intermediate to advanced excel skills a plus
  • Ability to create accountability and to lead by example
  • Strong team building, decision-making and people management skills
  • BS degree in Business Management or related field a bonus
  • In our business safety is paramount; we have a zero tolerance to drugs and alcohol. Only experienced applicants who meet the selection criteria need apply.

If you have the above essential experience and are looking for a new challenge please call Jim on 0401 227 590 or submit your resume.

'

title: Pricing Actuary - Retail or Group Insurance
description:
b'

Pricing Manager/Pricing Actuary - Life Insurance

The Role

  • Multinational life insurer
  • Exposure to retail and group insurance
  • Sydney CBD location

\xc2\xa0

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Conduct pricing of Group and Individual quotes, including: Data analysis and risk assessment in order to set pricing assumptions\xc2\xa0
  • Modelling of reinsurance transactions utilising Excel and AXIS software
  • Appropriateness of reinsurance design/structure o Analysis of pricing results and competitiveness of terms
  • Assisting Senior Pricing Actuaries in the formation of recommendations
  • Documentation of pricing reports for all quotes performed
  • Technical and peer reviews\xc2\xa0
  • Identifying and implementing efficiencies into the pricing process
  • Ensuring sound pricing processes and procedures are followed by the pricing team, demonstrated by the achievement of positive results within regular internal pricing audits.

Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in maths, finance, statistics, actuarial science or related field essential.
  • Recently qualified FIAA or near qualified
  • Experience in an actuarial role within life insurance
  • Reinsurance and/or pricing experience strongly preferred
  • Experience in an actuarial modelling software, as well as applications such as Word, Excel, Access
  • Highly motivated and results orientated
  • Strong client service focus
  • Solid understanding of life insurance market and products
  • Sound understanding of legislative and corporate compliance requirements
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to negotiate and influence others

To discuss the role in more detail, please contact Aliza Yau (CA) on 0499 888 857 or aliza@sklactuarial.com.au or Jas Singh (FIAA) on 0412 738 567 or jas@sklactuarial.com.au

'

title: Coordinator - Operations - Functional Family Therapy
description:
b'Make an impact
At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. \xc2\xa0We work to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice.

We are embarking on establishing a brand new intensive Functional Family Therapy (FFT) \xe2\x80\x93 Child Welfare (CW) home based treatment model.\xc2\xa0 This newly created team will be based in the Fairfield area of New South Wales.

This exciting new program is an evidenced based intensive intervention program aimed at keeping families together. \xc2\xa0FFT \xe2\x80\x93 CW works with families where there is child abuse and neglect and they are at high risk of being placed in Out Of Home Care (OOHC).

This is an excellent opportunity to work collaboratively with the Uniting Supervisor Clinical Practice FFT \xe2\x80\x93 CW to co-lead a team of Therapeutic Practitioners.\xc2\xa0 You will be supported by program developers and both an international and local intermediary to deliver this evidence based model.\xc2\xa0

We are looking for an experienced and passionate Coordinator who will oversee the operations of the program. Your duties will include monitoring data recording, program KPIs, program reporting, administrative supervision, liaising with NSW Family and Community Services and program intermediaries and the administrative supervision of a team of Therapeutic Practitioners and an Administration Assistant.

About you
To be a success in this newly created team we are looking for a self-motivated individual who has:
  • Degree in Social Work or Psychology, or a related Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree. \xc2\xa0
  • Minimum of 5 years experience in working with children and families.
  • Relevant clinical and / or casework experience using evidence based models with children and families in a child protection, OOHC, family services or a family therapy setting.
  • Demonstrated supervisory experience and ability to partner with the Supervisor Clinical Practice and co-lead the team.
  • Ability to flexible hours and be available to participate in on-call.
  • A current NSW driver\xe2\x80\x99s licence.
  • Ability to ensure a culturally appropriate service is delivered to families and that a cultural lens is integrated into practice.
  • Fluency in community language particularly Arabic, Spanish, Vietnamese and Serbian and / or strong connections to a diverse culture would be well regarded, but is not essential.\xc2\xa0

About Uniting
Everyday has meaning when you work for us. \xc2\xa0Your work makes a real difference. By enriching the lives of those we serve, we add value to the experience of life.\xc2\xa0 As an industry leader, we value our staff and our clients. \xc2\xa0We are bold, imaginative, respectful and compassionate because that is what gives us the edge and satisfaction in what we do.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Love Your Work. \xc2\xa0Join Our Team. \xc2\xa0Make a Difference.

Uniting is proud to be an EEO employer. Uniting supports an inclusive approach in the workplace. \xc2\xa0We celebrate our diversity and welcome staff regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices. \xc2\xa0Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.


Contact Us
To discuss your interest in the position, please contact Niamh Nixon 02 9376 1525 (nnixon@uniting.org)
To apply, please include a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role and attach a copy of your resume.\xc2\xa0

#LI-POST '

title: Network Product Manager for Global Company with a Small Company Culture
description:
b'This is a great platform to work closely with the Sales and Engineering team in Sydney on driving an innovative initiative and taking ownership of a key cutting-edge Network product offering.

You will manage the product creation and lifecycle process to lead teams to launch new services, and manage current services as a product\xc2\xa0owner. Deliverables include service descriptions, being involved in creating sales\xc2\xa0documentation and ensuring that commercial and operational support tools e.g. the list of services sold are accurate and kept up to date.

\xc2\xa0Experience required:\xc2\xa0
  • You come from a strong background in networking (Presales/ Solution Architecture/ Network Engineering & Operations) and you are either already in a Product Management role/ interested to move into one
  • Understanding\xc2\xa0of common private network technologies (MPLS, VPLS), and a good understanding of common\xc2\xa0routing protocols
  • Familiarity with data centre, network, cloud and managed service markets\xc2\xa0
  • You are passionate about building the network product - from building high level solutions with the engineering team, to building and taking ownership of processes
Due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be notified. '

title: Administration Officers x 3 | NSW Government
description:
b"\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
About Them

Major NSW Government Department based in Parramatta are seeking the well-honed skills of 3 meticulous Administration Officers who are articulate, energetic & organised.

Working within a down to earth & super friendly team, these brilliant 3-month contracts are perfect for people who thrive working within a fast-paced environment, where your day will involve juggling a variety of duties. Utilising your past Government experience as well as having a can-do attitude could definitely ensure your contract could be extended.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Day to Day

\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide administrative and clerical support including maintaining diaries, arranging appointments, handling or redirecting enquiries, dealing with mail and correspondence and providing a high-quality keyboard services to support the operation of the Directorate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain administrative systems and registers including asset registers, travel records and credit card reports to effectively manage and report on the use of the Directorate's assets.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain TRIM computerised record management system and coordinate the creation, storage, retrieval and archiving of files to ensure the accurate and safe storage of information and its compliance with Departmental policy.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare and follow up purchases for equipment and supplies to support the operation of the Directorate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enter and retrieve data from databases to inform the operations of the Directorate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with undertaking of research and projects to support the work of the Directorate.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
You'll Need
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 2- 3 years minimum experience ideally working within a NSW Government Department
\xe2\x80\xa2 Meticulous organizational abilities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Articulate & confident communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Intermediate MS Office
\xe2\x80\xa2 TRIM knowledge ideal
\xe2\x80\xa2 You'll possess an engaging & down to earth personality
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to go above & beyond what's expected "

title: Junior Account Manager
description:
b'
SaaSRec are happy to bring to market an exciting opportunity in Sydney for a Telephone based Account Manager. Our client are a huge name in the IT space and currently have an opening in the team for a motivated and driven junior candidate. This role would suit someone with tele sales experience or a recent graduate, looking to join a company with real career progression and great perks.

The successful candidates day to day will involve managing a large portfolio of accounts, proactively calling existing customers and discussing the product range benefits. You will build relationships and ensure customers re-subscribe to the companies key products and services.


Role Responsibilities
  • Managing existing customers and accounts.
  • Proactively calling customers in your portfolio.
  • Ensure all contracts are renewed.
  • Ensuring invoices and charge rates are correct.
  • Build strong relationships with your portfolio of accounts.

Candidate Requirements
  • Recent Grad or Junior candidate.\xc2\xa0
  • Experience contacting/dealing with customers over the phone.
  • Experience with entering data and CRM systems.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Previous tele-sales experience very beneficial.

\xc2\xa0
All applicants must be eligible to work in Australia at time of application!
\xc2\xa0
Apply now by following the link or sending a CV to mattbrennan@saasrec.com '

title: Asset Finance Broker / Business Manager
description:
b"

Are you currently a\xc2\xa0car finance or an asset finance broker? Are you a business manager sick of working for a car yard and want weekends back, or would you like to work your own flexible hours? Would you like to get hundreds of opportunities to make your own income every month?

If you answered yes to any of these questions please read on.

About the company
We are looking to recruit\xc2\xa0an\xc2\xa0enthusiastic person to join our growing\xc2\xa0team in our city office. We Are Loans is a company that has been in the industry for over 15 years, providing asset finance solutions through alliances and dealerships. The business primarily operates as car finance specialists for dealerships and consumers Australia wide.

We are looking for an asset finance broker to join the asset finance\xc2\xa0team, with immediate start available to the right applicant.

To succeed in this role, we are looking for staff who\xc2\xa0will be\xc2\xa0customer service orientated, timely/prompt, have good phone rapport with customers and stakeholders, show ability to work with our diverse team and possess the ability to process data & paperwork through to credit and settlement teams.\xc2\xa0

About the position / for you:

  • A friendly, dynamic team, in a good location close to public transport
  • A career that rewards hard work, uncapped commission and potential earnings
  • Work from home options available.\xc2\xa0
  • Open accreditation to an extensive 27 funder and insurance panel. Tier 1, 2 and 3 equipment and motor vehicle funders, fully maintained novated lease and motor vehicle operating lease, operating lease , commercial property, insurance premium funders, marine and aviation funders and cash flow funders
  • Leads will be provided from various sources, explained in detail in the interview process.
  • Training and\xc2\xa0and ongoing mentoring from dedicated managers

Your duties will include;\xc2\xa0

  • Reporting to the state\xc2\xa0manager daily, following tasks set and targets (KPI'S)
  • Contacting and generating revenue from internet and phone leads
  • Gather applications and process through to various lenders on the panel
  • Responding to clients queries and stakeholder queries
  • Administration support including general data entry and upkeep

What you must have to apply for this role:

  • A driven, tenacious sales mentality
  • The ability to succeed in a competitive environment
  • A genuine desire to work hard and earn big\xc2\xa0
  • Previous phone-based sales experience
  • The role would ideally suit someone who has a minimum 12-18\xc2\xa0months\xc2\xa0experience in either one or more of\xc2\xa0the following categories
  • Asset finance / Mortgage Broking / Car Yard Finance / Business Manager
  • Lending / Credit / Settlements /\xc2\xa0Personal or Mobile Banking / Finance Assistant Role
  • Advantage if applicant holds Finance Cert IV Certificate OR has detailed knowledge of application systems with several asset finance lenders \xc2\xa0(MAC LEASE, ESANDA, ST GEORGE, LIBERTY etc)

You will be highly regarded if you also have:

  • Previous experience in consumer or any other asset finance role
  • Proven track record of over achievement in an internal sales role
  • An existing network of referrals

If you are interested in finding out more about this exciting opportunity and the benefits in working with our business, please apply online with a resume and cover letter. Any questions can be sent through to the email below.

"

title: Regional Relationship Manager - NSW/ACT
description:
b'

Specsaver\xe2\x80\x99s arrival in Australia and New Zealand has been one of the most exciting retail success stories. We are a multi award winning retail organisation with achievements in innovation and have been recognised as an Employer of Choice. We are currently seeking a talented Regional Relationship Manager to join our dynamic field team in NSW. This vital role will lead in the delivery of our annual plan and provide operational support to 20-25 stores across NSW and assist in the implementation of store/company objectives and targets.

The successful candidate will be responsible for:

  • Building key relationships with store partners to develop a tailored business plan to maximise store performance
  • Develop performance and improve strategies for people, sales and service
  • Build and maintain effective communication channels with internal stakeholders and relevant departments
  • Active involvement in store relocations and partner selection process

What we are looking for

The Regional Relationship Manager will report to the Divisional Relationship Manager and will possess the following skills:

  • A strong career history to date within retail operations or consultative field based role within the retail industry
  • Experience/exposure in dealing with Franchisees will be highly desirable
  • Previous experience developing business plans for multiple retail sites
  • Ability to utilise Profit and Loss data and provide financial forecasting, budget and income management
  • Strong ability to map out competitors and awareness at local, national and international level
  • Experience with managing multiple projects and stakeholders
  • Strong communication and written skills with excellent influencing and negotiation skills

At Specsavers we value our people and not only offer competitive reward and benefits but also on-going training and development. If you are interested in this position please submit your application via the link below.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: NA
description:
b'

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG's Tax division are looking for a highly talented Tax Manager with a financial services focus to join our Delivery & Data eXcellence (DDX) corporate tax team.

Your new role

  • Ensuring all tax compliance deliverables are high quality, technically accurate and delivered on time
  • Utilising your wide ranging experience and knowledge, and leveraging our data delivery tools and technology, to enhance our core services to clients
  • Leading high performing teams that work efficiently and collaboratively with other parts of our Tax Division and our clients in delivering tax compliance services
  • Innovating and supporting continuous improvement initiatives in tax compliance and process based activities
  • Providing guidance, mentoring and training to junior staff to enhance technical and work management skills
  • Reviewing tax effect accounting calculations and financial statement tax disclosures

You bring to the role

  • Tax experience in either a Big 4 or tier 2 firm, or large in-house tax team
  • Australian and/or other Commonwealth country tax experience
  • Strong Tax compliance experience, including preparation and/or review of income tax returns and tax provisions
  • Successful completion of a Masters of Tax or CA qualification and Legal and/or commerce degree (desirable)

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices to drive innovation and entrepreneurship.

'

title: Sales Coordinator Property Development
advertiser: Poly (Australia) Real Estate Development Pty Ltd
description:
b'

Poly (Australia) Real Estate Development Pty Ltd are excited to be currently recruiting for a Sales Coordinator.

Poly (Australia) is a fast-growing and dynamic property development company engaged in the design, development, construction, marketing and sale of quality residential and commercial properties.

Our rapidly expanding culturally diverse company is looking for our next awesome team member to join our Sales & Marketing team.

This amazing opportunity offers amazing benefits:-

  • Free Gym Membership
  • Professional Mentoring
  • Professional Development
  • Great Team and culture

Key responsibilities include:

  • Administration for Sales & Marketing Team
  • Preparing marketing/advertising material & follow up documents
  • Liaising with the Sales agencies to educate, update and inform of upcoming and existing projects
  • Assisting the Sales Team in stock preparation by liaising with the project development team.
  • Typing correspondence, proposals and reports
  • Supporting agents with client communication, data maintenance and management of the sale process from appraisal to post-settlement
  • Liaising with solicitors to ensure all legal documents are complete and up-to-date
  • Day to day coordination with marketing, sales teams, contracts and settlements team members
  • Day to day coordination with agencies for project preparations and continual updates
  • Commission calculation

Successful applicants will have:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Fluent in Mandarin and English
  • Previous experience in the Real Estate Industry would be highly regarded.
  • Demonstrated organisation skills with strong attention to detail \xc2\xa0and high accuracy
  • Solid computer literacy including industry specific software
  • Genuine customer service focus and a flexible attitude
  • Able to prioritise
  • Ability to work individually and in a team environment
  • Great time management skills
  • Outgoing and professional
  • Passionate about the Property industry
  • Experience using Salesforce would be highly regarded

This position is an excellent opportunity if you are looking to gain industry knowledge and build a career in the development industry. Please send your resume with a covering letter to Julie.Kelly@polyglobal.com

\xc2\xa0

'

title: NA
description:
b'

About us

Forever New is one of Australia's fastest growing fashion clothing and accessories brands, proud to be founded in Melbourne during late 2006. Now celebrating our tenth year, Forever New has been on a journey of global expansion and today operates in over 300 stores in ten countries.

The Forever New brand celebrates the feminine beauty of women, with a signature style flowing through every creative element. Each monthly collection celebrates this beauty, drawing inspiration from global trends in fashion, art, music, film and theatre.

About the Position

To succeed in this position, you must be a motivated, solution focused leader who can develop and inspire your teams to drive performance and achieve maximum sales potential. You will do this through strong leadership, coaching & development and a strong commercial focus which you will have the ability to communicate to the retail team and in turn translate into results.

As a Area Manager you will be responsible for approx. 10 stores with a substantial turnover.

To be successful as the Area Manager, you will be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Ability to build & develop high performing teams
  • You are an innovator \xe2\x80\x93 you can Identify and implement simple, practical solutions to problems
  • You have a broad and commercial perspective on business issues / understands the financial impact of decisions
  • You can influence others to support key business initiatives
  • Interprets data to make informed business decisions and actionable recommendations

Experience:

  • You will come with previous multi-site management experience
  • Experience with both formal & informal training of new & existing team
  • Experience in woman's fashion apparel is preferable
  • High level of professionalism & polish both in terms of your communication style & your own personal presentation
  • People & culture oriented, will deliver sales results through an engaged & motivate team

What we can offer YOU!

  • Generous salary package on offer
  • Car allowance
  • Fabulous product discounts

Company and Culture & Benefits

Join a privately owned globally growing business who are dedicated to team collaboration and innovation whilst promoting our values: Think Customer; Respect for All; Keep it Simple; Take Responsibility and Act with Pace. Forever New is a fast paced retail environment who promote work life balance and ensuring the customer remains at the forefront of our objectives.

'

title: Property Enquiries Manager
description:
b'

Legal Searches - Team Manager\xc2\xa0

Sydney CBD location

This Company was voted one of the best places to work in Australia by BRW in 2014, 2015 & 2016!

Our client\xc2\xa0is a technology company \xc2\xa0that provides intelligent search and automated workflow for professionals across the legal and conveyancing industry.

They are an indispensable partner, whose\xc2\xa0software platform helps businesses swiftly find critical information pertaining to property, company, personal and national search data.

Objective: Manage the\xc2\xa0Property Enquiries team to deliver customer satisfaction and performance outcomes.\xc2\xa0

Reporting to: General Manager, Operations

Responsibilities (key tasks and requirements of the role)

  • Manage Property Enquiries\xc2\xa0Team, including recruitment, setting and managing performance measurements, staff development and training, efficient resourcing and reporting.
  • Develop and implement measurable process improvements.
  • Provide strategic input for department\xc2\xa0
  • Budgeting and ongoing management of costs.
  • Consciously create a workplace and team culture that is aligned with our clients culture\xc2\xa0

Competencies (essential behaviours required for the role)

  • Strategy Execution - Translating business priorities into operational reality; aligning communication, accountabilities, resource capabilities, internal processes, and ongoing measurement systems to ensure that strategic priorities yield measurable and sustainable results.
  • Coaching - Providing timely guidance and feedback to help others strengthen specific knowledge/skill areas\xc2\xa0
  • Innovation - Generating innovative solutions in work situations
  • Communication\xc2\xa0
  • Client focus
  • Facilitating Change
  • Driving for Results\xc2\xa0

Job Style (types of activities/responsibilities required in the role)

  • High Responsibility/Accountability\xc2\xa0
  • High-involvement Leader\xc2\xa0
  • Coaching Others\xc2\xa0
  • Challenging Work\xc2\xa0
  • Continuous Learning\xc2\xa0

Knowledge and Experience (knowledge and experience required for the role)

  • 3+ experience in managing local and remote staff to achieve targeted outcomes.
  • Legal, Conveyancing or Searching Industry experience and/or qualifications.
  • Knowledge of Legal Searching systems and services.
  • Experience in budgeting and managing costs.
'

title: Sales Operations Co-ordinator
description:
b'

The Company:

TPG Telecom Limited is a highly successful telecommunications business listed on the ASX. We have one of the largest Internet, data and voice networks in the country, and we offer some of the most competitive products in the market to a range of customers including residential, SMEs, large corporates and many government institutions. Our business now has over two million customers and approximately 6,000 employees. We are continuing to invest in our people and our network infrastructure to cater for further expansion of our business.

Overview of Role:

The Sales Operations Co-ordinator is tasked with assisting the Consumer Sales Supervisor with the day to day running of the Broadband & Mobile Sales teams. The position reports to the Sales Supervisor and is located in Sydney.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the supervision of day to day operational activities of sales teams ensuring that functions are delivered effectively and in accordance with established expectations and quality indicators.
  • Oversee and participate in daily QA activities, including call validation exercises, agent QA & Net Promoter Score verification.
  • Analysis of Hourly/Daily/Weekly sales reporting.
  • Administration of sales leads management software.
  • Provide support and advice in relation to escalated queries and performance management.
  • Participate and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders across business areas as required.
  • Assist in the recruitment of sales agents.
  • Other duties as directed by the Sales Supervisor.

Experience/Qualifications:

  • Minimum 12 months\xe2\x80\x99 experience within a consumer sales environment (preference towards consumer telecommunications).

Skills:

  • Experience within a consumer sales environment.
  • Able to demonstrate strong coaching techniques.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Highly organised and a self-starter.
  • Excellent customer focussed attitude.
  • Excellent investigative, analytical and information presentation skills, with an attention to detail.
  • Ability to balance company and external requirements.
  • Ability to balance productivity targets with quality of work.

Personal Characteristics:

  • Customer-focused attitude at all times.
  • Positive, can-do attitude.
  • A flexible, critical thinker.
  • Internally driven and motivated to succeed.
  • Handles dynamic and fast-paced environments well.
  • Adaptable in changing conditions.
'

title: Midweight Graphic Designer
description:
b'

About the Company

TPG Telecom Limited is a highly successful telecommunications business listed on the ASX. We have one of the largest internet, data and voice networks in the country, and we offer some of the most competitive products in the market to a range of customers including residential, SMEs, large corporates and many government institutions. Our business now has over two million customers and approximately 6,000 employees. We are continuing to invest in our people and our network infrastructure to cater for further expansion of our business.

About the Role

An exciting opportunity exists for an exceptional Midweight Graphic Designer looking to take the next step in their career. The successful applicant will work closely with our marketing team to produce high quality, creative and effective solutions for both print and digital platforms.

About the Person

The successful candidate should possess:

  • Tertiary qualifications in design/visual communication\xcd\xbe
  • Minimum 3 years design industry experience\xcd\xbe
  • An outstanding portfolio of current work across print and digital applications\xcd\xbe
  • Highly proficient in Adobe Suite (photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign and Flash)\xcd\xbe
  • Strong understanding of colour and typography\xcd\xbe
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment\xcd\xbe
  • Ability to work independently and also part of a team\xcd\xbe
  • A proactive approach and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously\xcd\xbe
  • Speed, accuracy and strong attention to detail\xcd\xbe
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills\xcd\xbe
  • Able to produce jobs from concept through to print ready artwork;
  • Experience with HTML5 is desirable.

If this sounds like you, we can offer you a challenging and rewarding environment that supports your career goals and aspirations.

'

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
b'

The Enterprise Architect will help build an IT road map. The role will focus on digital architecture, incorporating both infrastructure and applications for our rapidly expanding business; demonstrating core competencies of strategic systems development, business change implementation and resource management.

Projects are centred around cloud-based solutions, such as building a CRM, expanding our current product offerings and additional services to clients, such as risk management tools and aclient portal.

A very successful Property management company.

Role Purpose:

  • Developing and maintaining the high-level design plan (\xe2\x80\x9croadmap\xe2\x80\x9d) for the overall enterprise architecture (incorporating both infrastructure and applications).
  • Develop a target Enterprise Architecture (EA) as a guide to drive consistent business processes, rationalisation of systems, access to accurate and timely information and the delivery of a reliable and efficient technical infrastructure.
  • Initiating projects which evaluate technologies and methodologies to establish and evolve the enterprise architecture.

Responsibilities:

Information Technology Leadership

  • In conjunction with the IT leadership team, develop, communicate and maintain the IT Strategy (vision, objectives and priorities) ensuring alignment with the business strategy.
  • Understand, advocate and augment the business and IT strategies and, more specifically, Enterprise Architecture development and service delivery.
  • Maintaining up to date knowledge of the organisation\xe2\x80\x99s strategic business plans and possible impacts on Enterprise Architecture.
  • Reviewing new and existing Information Technology projects to ensure compliance and integration with Enterprise Architecture by developing, documenting and communicating strategies and standards.
  • Ensure the alignment of stakeholder groups\xe2\x80\x99 technology projects and infrastructure with IT architecture standards and policies.
  • Lead in the research, evaluation and selection of hardware and software technology and product standards, as well as the design of standard configurations.
  • Providing advanced technical consulting in multiplatform IT environments.
  • Identifying and investigating opportunities to utilise and integrate emerging technologies to provide cost effective, flexible solutions.

IT Operations and processes

  • Participate in the analysis of the current technology environment to detect critical deficiencies and recommend solutions for improvement. In addition, lead the analysis of technology industry and market trends to determine their potential impact on the enterprise as well as on the Enterprise Architecture.
  • Developing, maintaining and communicating high-level plans for investing in IT environment/ applications/ infrastructure, including identification and management of cost reduction opportunities.
  • Documenting the strategic direction for business systems planning and architectures, IT infrastructure, voice and data network planning and architecture.
  • Working with users and other IT practitioners to define the requirements of an application and specifying an optimum design for subsequent development.
  • Developing, managing, and undertaking Solution Architecture, either IT infrastructure or applications, typically within project constraints and address any issues considering existing solutions, components and standards. Investigating pragmatic alternatives if they better meet the need and undertake to develop and provide estimates, involving other key stakeholders in the process.

People Leadership

  • Lead, coach, direct, evaluate and develop direct reports within your team to ensure that the organisations plans are implemented effectively, consistently, and according to established guidelines and budgets.
  • Manage and review performance of employees to agreed goals, discuss developmental goals and career aspirations to retain key talent and enhance business performance. Implement plans, developed with the management team to lift performance to necessary levels and act to address unsatisfactory performance.
  • Demonstrate and promote our Values with the aim to facilitate greater internal communication between various teams and promote a positive, high-performance culture.

To apply please click apply or call Sean Canning on +61 2 82893170 for a confidential discussion.

'

title: Customer Service/Provisioning Officer
description:
b"

We are seeking a talented Customer Service/Provisioning Officer to join a talented team to support the business through the effective support and management of the current product range. The roles including provisioning and assurance and assisting the Operations team to deliver high level Customer service.

Furthermore, you will be required to work with multiple service providers and carrier ordering systems.

title: Senior Traffic Engineer
description:
b"

THE PROJECT

The $1.6 billion Toowoomba Second Range Crossing is a 41km\xc2\xa0heavy vehicle route jointly funded by the Australian and Queensland Governments on an 80:20 funding split arrangement.

The route is designed to increase freight efficiency and significantly improve driver safety and community amenity by removing heavy vehicles from Toowoomba's CBD.

ABOUT NEXUS DELIVERY

Nexus Delivery is a joint venture between Acciona and Ferrovial Agroman, established to design and construct the TSRC. The construction phase is now well underway and on schedule to be completed by late 2018

THE ROLE

Nexus Delivery is currently\xc2\xa0seeking an experienced Senior Traffic Engineer to join our Construction Team. This position is responsible for the implementation and maintenance of the Project Traffic Management System. The successful candidate will responsible for\xc2\xa0but not limited to the following duties;

  • Implement and maintain traffic management plans and procedures
  • Implement safe work systems for all traffic related activities
  • Develop, implement and maintain long term Construction Traffic Guidance Scheme and short term Traffic Guidance Scheme designs
  • Involvement in the road safety auditing processes ensuring that road safety audits are carried out as per the requirements of the project deed
  • Analysis of traffic data for temporary traffic works design inputs
  • Liaising with Road Authorities to ensure approvals are received within the required timeframes without causing delays to construction works
  • Liaising with the wider Project Team to identify\xc2\xa0 forthcoming traffic management requirements
  • Undertake onsite surveillance inspections of temporary traffic management operations
  • Implement systems to track productivity and develop strategies to improve performance
  • Management of traffic control resources and equipment
  • Assist in incident and road maintenance management requirements

THE PERSON

  • Must have working knowledge of the MUTCD or interstate equivalent
  • At least 5 years' experience in a Senior Traffic Engineer/ Manager role or similar
  • Experienced in preparing Traffic Management Plans for TMR or equivalent
  • Previous experience working on large infrastructure projects, understanding of construction sequencing and have demonstrated technical background
  • Traffic Management Level 3 or Traffic Management Design qualification or able to obtain Traffic Management Design qualification within 6 months of commencement
  • Civil Engineering Degree would be highly regarded

TO APPLY

If you believe that this position and Nexus Delivery are right for you, click on 'Apply for the Job'.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON THE PROJECT VISIT

www.nexustsrc.com.au or nexustsrc on Facebook

This role is being sourced through Nexus Delivery directly and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies.

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

"

title: Incident/Problem Manager
description:
b'

\xc2\xa0

Immediate start

Location \xe2\x80\x93 North Ryde\xc2\xa0

Individuals with relevant experience looking to move into this role as their next step in their career, will be strongly considered.\xc2\xa0

Are you ready to make your mark and join one of the largest Australian owned professional IT Services providers? \xc2\xa0

Datacom, as a partner to our customers, employees and suppliers, strives to be professional, collaborative and quality focused, looking to create mutual success for all parties. We readily embrace change and regularly demonstrate corporate adaptability, helping to build relationships that enable us to truly achieve our customer\xe2\x80\x99s business objectives.\xc2\xa0

The Datacom Service Centre is responsible for the provision of IT outsourcing services to a varied profile of clients, with the Incident/Problem Manager being a key resource in ensuring stability of service and rapid resolution of Major Incidents. \xc2\xa0

The role of Incident/Problem Manager is to own and drive the Incident and Problem Management Processes. \xc2\xa0This will ensure that the goals of the Problem and Incident Management processes are achieved.\xc2\xa0

Core Responsibilities will include:\xc2\xa0

  • Lead the awareness of Incident Management processes
  • Own and develop Incident Mgmt. &Problem Mgmt. documents
  • Recommend improvements & changes\xc2\xa0
  • Ensure Problems are raised from Incident trends or Major Incidents
  • Raise Problem tickets where necessary to help reduce incidents in the clients environment
  • Document Root Cause actions
  • Interface with customers on resolution of major incidents and problems
  • Provide Problem and Incident reports
  • Ensure aged tickets receive focus and are discussed in Problem meetings
  • Ensure that all Post Incident Reports are delivered according to client SLA
  • Facilitate internal Problem and Incident Management review meetings
  • Handle Major Incidents both within Business Hours and Out of Hours (on a rostered, on call basis).\xc2\xa0

To be considered for this role, you should:\xc2\xa0

  • Be an Australian\xc2\xa0Citizenship
  • Possess demonstrated experience in Problem and Incident Management under ITIL processes, including:
    • Reactive & Proactive Problem Management.
    • Incident Management experience
    • Ensuring operational effectiveness and efficiency
    • Managing compliance of Service Provider Groups
    • Facilitating Problem Analysis, Major Incident Reviews
    • Tracking Corrective Actions to completion
    • Tracking and communicating progress of Problems and Incidents with client and/or (senior) management.\xc2\xa0
    • Problem and Incident Management reporting and metrics
    • Use of key performance indicators for Continuous improvement
    • Process writing and improvement experience
  • Be an analytical thinker
  • Possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Have produced daily, weekly and monthly reporting
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Have driven resolver groups to resolution of Problems
  • Possess strong Excel/data manipulation skills \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

Qualifications/Specific Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

  • 2 years experience in a similar role
  • ITIL Foundation Certification at a minimum
  • 3 - 5 years broad experience within an IT environment
  • Ability to work well in a high pressure environment
  • Outstanding customer service skills and attention to detail
  • Prior experience in dealing with 3rd party vendors
  • Expert knowledge in Incident/Problem Management and Service Desk tools
  • Good knowledge and practice of RCA methodologies and Tools
  • Use of tools such as: Remedy, CA USD or Cherwell. \xc2\xa0

This position would be well suited to individuals who have relevant experience and who are ready to step up and contribute to a fast moving SMO team.\xc2\xa0

All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. To Apply please respond to this advert.

\xc2\xa0

'

title: Business Analyst (885-040)
description:
b'

Who are we?

At Zinfra, we take reputations pretty seriously.

Not just ours, but the reputations of our clients. Our expertise, delivering a comprehensive range of engineering, maintenance, operations and construction services to the utility infrastructure sectors across Australia ensures our clients gain the most value from their critical network assets.

It\xe2\x80\x99s a focus that guides our 1,500 employees who are passionate about delivering safe, efficient and high-quality services to ensure our clients can stake their reputations on the work we do for them.

The opportunity

This is an excellent opportunity for a Junior Business Analyst to be involved in the business and add value through analysis and partnering. This role is perfect for an individual with a drive to succeed. Reporting to the Business Analytics Manager the primary purpose of this role is;

  • Provide operational and financial reporting and insight to all company stakeholders and leadership teams through the identification and analysis of the key business drivers, while ensuring accurate and efficient reporting methods
  • Co-ordinate information to support monthly management accounting, financial reporting and analysis processes.
  • Develop reporting tools and packages to assist management in the decision-making process to promote operational efficiency, employee engagement and overall effectiveness of the business.
  • Act as a subject matter expert [SME] on reporting and analytical needs of the business.
  • Work with the business to facilitate any training needs regarding newly generated analytical and reporting tools.
  • Aids business units with quality assurance, end-user documentation and software development as needed.

Who you are

The ideal candidate for this role will possess the following skills, education and experience:

  • Accounting qualifications in business, finance, commerce or similar.
  • A strong knowledge of SAP, BI, databases
  • 1 to 2 years experience in a similar role
  • Experience working in Civil/Construction, manufacturing, engineering industry will be highly regarded.
  • Advance excel with experience and working knowledge of VBA and Macros
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills including the ability to extract large data from various sources, interpret and present information
  • Excellent interpersonal skills; excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively communicate with operational colleagues.
  • Ability to self-direct with minimal supervision
  • Understand business performance, and secondly be able to articulate this to management.

Working at Zinfra

At Zinfra, we also believe in building the reputations of our people. We provide a diversity of career pathways to allow our employees to reach their full potential and build on their initial career choices.

We are passionate about what we do and we are proud of who we are. We offer a friendly and supportive environment, promoting teamwork, open communication and career development. Are you up for the challenge?

'

title: Commercial Analyst
description:
b"

About the business and the role

Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam has evolved into one of the world's leading premium spirits companies... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with a legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory Inc. is the World's #3 premium spirits company\xc2\xa0with unparalleled expertise in whisky globally!

We have a great opportunity for a commercially astute accounting professional to join the Oceania Business in an Analyst role supporting the Commercial Management team.

Job tasks and responsibilities

Responsibilities

  • Provide commercial analysis within the Beam Suntory business, providing actionable insights that improve Beam Suntory commercial outcomes
  • Support the Marketing team, Marketing Business Partner and Commercial Manager by developing financial information to support and evaluate Innovation/New Product Development (NPD), including price builds
  • Ensure rigour in the NPD gate process by ensuring price builds are aligned between Beam Suntory and its distribution partner and reflect innovation & agreed pricing strategies
  • Conduct analysis and running of share reports to support recommendations to the Beam Suntory business
  • Supporting the Monthly Business Review process and deliverables where required
  • Ad hoc reporting & analysis
  • Assist with commercial and category insights to support the budget processes
  • Manage data resources such as Aztec, Roy Morgan & Millwood Brown
  • Provide weekly / monthly reporting of sales & market data with insights into the drivers of performance

Skills and experience

Key Skills & Competencies:

  • Excel (advanced)
  • Aztec (advanced)
  • Strong Communication and influencing skills (written & oral)\xc2\xa0
  • Understanding of FMCG business operations
  • Demonstrated analytical abilities
  • Comprehensive IT literacy, preferably including SAP
  • Proactive
  • Team player who is flexible and adaptable in their approach
  • Positive approach
  • Able to influence senior managers
  • Innovative; discovers new ways of looking at problems and developing solutions

Qualifications & Experience

  • Business Degree with Accounting/Finance Major
  • 3 years relevant industry experience
  • Demonstrated achievements in identifying business improvements including cost analysis, project reviews and product proposals
  • Strong track record in Commercial Reporting & Analysis

title: Junior Merchandise Planner
description:
b'

We\xc2\xa0are seeking an enthusiastic and energetic individual to join\xc2\xa0our family of motivated and driven women as we continue to rapidly expand our business.

This role will support the management of a portfolio of product categories, as well as ensuring that we have the right product, in the right place\xc2\xa0at the right time!

________

An exciting opportunity is now available for you, a Junior Merchandise Planner,\xc2\xa0to use your forecasting and analytical skills to support the business.

Reporting to the Operations Manager and Managing Director, you will be responsible for managing all ongoing lines\xc2\xa0to maximise sales, analysing style and category performance and ensuring that all weekly allocations are achieved so that product is located in the right place at the right time.

You will also manage the open to buy in conjunction with the Operations Manager and Managing Director, ensuring stocks are managed in line with forecasted sales.

________

Other key responsibilities also include:

- Ensuring core lines are managed within given stock targets, both in the business overall, online and at store level
-\xc2\xa0Monitoring order quantities and ensuring system reflects accurate intake data in line with plan and buy
-\xc2\xa0Managing allocations to ensure they are completed on time, that replenishment systems are running smoothly and store stock levels are optimised in line with targets
-\xc2\xa0Ensuring consolidations are actioned within given timelines and complied with at store level.
-\xc2\xa0Ensuring store gradings are actioned quarterly
-\xc2\xa0Maintaining promotions in the system
-\xc2\xa0Forecasting weekly sales in line with trends and proposing relevant actions to ensure financial and inventory targets are met for relevant department
-\xc2\xa0Recommending markdown and promotional activity based on stock levels and opportunities to maximise sales in line with margin targets
-\xc2\xa0Participating in the post seasonal analysis to identify opportunities and drive the strategic direction of the brand

________

The successful applicant will:

- Have at least 2 years previous planning or allocating experience, preferably at a similar level
-\xc2\xa0Possess highly developed analytical skills and strong commercial acumen
-\xc2\xa0Have a can do attitude and be adept at prioritising appropriately
-\xc2\xa0Be an excellent communicator and have strong interpersonal skills
-\xc2\xa0Have advanced excel skills

________

For the successful candidate, we\xc2\xa0offer:

  • A competitive salary
  • Monthly clothing allowance
  • Excellent staff discounts
  • Excellent team\xc2\xa0culture

This role is perfect for someone who is keen to progress within the planning function.

If you think you have what it takes,\xc2\xa0then this could be the role for you!\xc2\xa0APPLY NOW!

G&H\xc2\xa0

We look forward to reviewing your application.

'
