title: Product Development Technologist
description:
b'

Overview

CSG have been briefed on an exciting opportunity with a leading FMCG manufacturing organisation here in Sydney. This role has the flexibility for the successful candidate to be based out of the Hornsby area or Newcastle.

\xc2\xa0

The Company

This\xc2\xa0privately owned company are a leading FMCG based business here in Sydney who produce a range of food products. They have been around in Australia for over 100 years and have a very reputable within the Sydney market.

\xc2\xa0

The Role

This role will involve managing the product development from concept right the way through to launch for all key product development projects. The successful candidate will ensure new products are commercialised to appropriate food and quality standards, in line with both customer and business standards. Provide technical expertise across our portfolio, developing new products identifying efficiency improvements, managing cost down projects and identifying commercial opportunities.

\xc2\xa0

\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and provide leadership on technical aspects of projects; including all approval steps, documentation, risk identification, management of technical resources and project timelines
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate raw materials and functional ingredients for suitability and quality for use in new and/or existing products and processes.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of trials and the collection and processing of data (including Sensory, Consumer and Nutritional) to ultimately develop the product, specifications and recommendations.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Review existing formulations with the objective to reduce costs and improve quality
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure internal procedures are followed when commercialising new products (e.g. line trial reports, NIP & Organoleptic testing, Product Specification Development, PLM maintenance etc.)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure projects follow the NPD Stage Gate Process to ensure key metrics are achieved in commercialising new products.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regularly update the weekly status reports for NPD projects.

\xc2\xa0

The Person

This successful candidate will possess all of the following attributes:

  • Minimum 1-2 years in a Product Development or very similar position
  • Degree in Food science or a related\xc2\xa0discipline
  • High level of attention to detail
  • Exceptional verbal and written communications
  • Competent\xc2\xa0computer skills

If this exciting opportunity is of interest to you, please reach out to Marc Jenner on\xc2\xa0marc.jenner@csgtalent.com.au\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

'

title: Data Integrity Officer
description:
b"

About the business and the role

At 1,800 employees and growing and consistently strong financials (NYSE:VEEV), Veeva was named\xc2\xa0among the top fastest growing public technology companies on Forbes' annual Fast Tech 25 list. We\xc2\xa0build innovative cloud solutions for some of the world's largest pharmas and biotechs, and we need great\xc2\xa0people like you to make it happen.

title: Planning & Administration Manager
description:
b'

Viridian, part of the CSR Group, is the nation's largest and most successful manufacturer, processor and distributor of glass, for industrial, residential and commercial applications. We are committed to excellence in everything we do, and to achieve this we rely on the enthusiasm and team spirit of our people!

We Love Glass! We believe in a safe workplace and are committed to excellence in everything we do, achieving this through innovation, enthusiasm and teamwork.

The Opportunity

Based at our state of the art Glass manufacturing plant at Ingleburn, reporting to the Operations Manager you will focus on supporting the business by leading an \xe2\x80\x98achievement focused culture\xe2\x80\x99 and structuring the overall planning process to deliver industry best practice in safety, quality, yield, productivity, equipment maintenance, cost control and on time delivery of product to the customer, all with a focus on safety. Responsibilities will include;

  • Champion Workplace Health, Safety and Environment policies in the pursuit of zero harm
  • Provide stellar Customer Service through prompt and accurate order processing; timely resolution of any issues; clear communications; and ensuring on time product delivery
  • Constructive leadership of a small team to ensure engagement and development within the planning department
  • Development and implementation of continuous improvement programs
  • Accurate administration; data collection & management; and reporting.

Skills & Qualifications

To be considered for this diverse position you will be known for your analytical skills, your strategic thinking and your ability to achieve planning excellence. You will have a strong customer focus and be motivated by leading a team. Requirements will include:

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications
  • A proven planning / scheduling background within a modern manufacturing environment
  • Previous experience managing a small team
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders across all levels
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft office suite and experienced with planning and ERP systems (SAP ideally)
  • Understanding of the glass industry and LiSEC will be well regarded

You will enjoy an attractive remuneration package (including 12% super and annual leave loading); ongoing learning and career opportunities; and the opportunity to work with great people!

Apply online today with a cover letter and resume. For more information see www.viridian.com.au and www.csr.com.au or email Lisa, Recruitment Advisor on lmcdonald@csr.com.au

Note: CSR has a strong commitment to health and safety, with a pre-employment medical policy (including a drug and alcohol screen) requiring successful completion prior to an offer being made.

title: Marketing Co-ordinator - Seven Hills/North Ryde
description:
b'

Marketing Coordinator \xe2\x80\x93 Seven Hills

CSR Bradford, a business unit of CSR Limited, is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium energy efficiency products and services including insulation, construction fabrics, ventilation products, solar and hot water systems, and associated products and services.

The solar energy market is exploding with the advent of new game-changing technologies which are revolutionising the way we consume energy. Our business is at the forefront of this change and our business unit is growing fast.

The opportunity!

We are looking for a creative and enthusiastic Marketing Coordinator to join our upbeat, professional and rapidly growing team at Seven Hills. Reporting to the Campaign Manager-Energy , this role is needed to support the marketing of new, innovative technologies as we lead the way at the forefront of the clean energy space.

What's involved?

This is a busy role with a lot of moving pieces to juggle; you will be working with several key stakeholder groups across both B2B and B2C channels.

The role will be responsible for creating, maintaining, optimising and improving business marketing collateral across digital and print platforms, including:

  • Supporting social media plans with post commentary
  • Liaison with external media agencies according to our marketing plan
  • Website content review and maintenance
  • Customising digital and print collateral for unique customer groups
  • Maintaining and updating marketing communications across web and print platforms
  • Extracting system data for generating monthly reports
  • Support with market research and customer satisfaction tracking
  • Writing and executing EDMs to our customer and lead databases
  • Coordinate and design marketing literature including flyers, brochures, presentation materials, and POS

The ideal candidate - Is this you?

  • Love working with digital and web platforms
  • Exceptional organisational and prioritisation skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Passionate about the environment
  • Natural flare for copywriting

Skills and experience required

  • Highly competent in social and digital media
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • HTML and CSS knowledge would be a bonus
  • A qualification preferably in Marketing, backed up with experience
  • Experience developing social media content and executing effective campaigns
  • Experience managing direct mail campaigns
  • Graphic Design skills to create or edit content
  • Confident in copywriting

If you are a tech savvy marketer who enjoys a fast paced and fun working environment, then this job is for you.

Do you have what it takes?

If this role sounds like you, and you are ready to work alongside an awesome team within an innovative and fast growing business, apply online today! Please include a cover letter outlining why you think this is the job for you (this is an opportunity to showcase your communication skills).

Applications close Monday, 22 May. For any additional enquiries, please contact Emilia from the CSR Recruitment Team on 02 9964 1361.

To learn more about us, visit www.csr.com.au ; www.bradfordenergysolutions.com.au

Please note: CSR has a process of reference checking and pre-employment medicals (including a drug and alcohol screen) requiring successful completion prior to an offer being made.

Agencies please note: recruitment for this position is being managed directly by CSR Limited. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners in the rare instance we require additional talent options. Your respect for this process is appreciated.

'

title: HR Business Partner
description:
b'

We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic HR Business Partner to work with the HR Manager within the Nine Digital and Sales business. The new HR Business Partner will contribute to HR & Business strategy by helping to identify, prioritise and build organisational capability, behaviours, structures and processes.

\xc2\xa0

Serving as a liaison between the assigned groups and the HR team the HR Business Partner will assess the Human Resources needs in areas such as performance management, employee relations, compensation, career development and leadership development, and\xc2\xa0will maintain an active presence in the business, remain up to date on the context of people issues the business is facing and represent HR on respective Senior Leadership Teams.

\xc2\xa0

In addition, we are looking for someone with the ability to identify issues and use data and insights to influence solutions and outcomes that balance the requirements of the team and the business. The HR Business Partner must be able to engage effectively with leaders and peers at all levels of the organisation and demonstrate a strong commercial acumen, excellent communication, and influencing skills, and an ability to think and plan for both the short and the long term.

\xc2\xa0

Responsibilities:

  • Coaching leaders on people decisions that align with business strategy
  • Provide performance management support to leaders and employees as required
  • Lead HR processes and operating rhythms for assigned groups, including driving key people processes, performance reviews, remuneration reviews, and development plans
  • Provide coaching to front-line managers and senior leaders
  • Provide input into remuneration strategy
  • Act as a true HR Generalist by taking a lead on specialist project work in the HR team, including;\xc2\xa0
  • Support HR Management to efficiently manage and forecast the impact of people costs on the business.\xc2\xa0
  • Manage specific projects as determined by the HR Managers as well as participation in functional and cross-functional initiatives.\xc2\xa0
  • Continually review the internal and external environment to improve the people practices to maintain a competitive advantage.\xc2\xa0
  • Work collaboratively with the Talent Acquisition Lead, providing insight to support the attraction and selection of Talent for your business groups.
  • Coach and develop junior members of the HR team

\xc2\xa0

Experience required:

  • Degree or certification in Human Resources Management
  • Previous Experience in an HRBP role with broad knowledge and experience in human resource management.
  • Excellent knowledge of Australian employment law
  • Ability to adopt a business, practical, common sense, consultative approach when advising on people issues
  • Experience in partnering with senior business leaders to build strong relationships and align business needs and people strategy and plans
  • Strong business and HR acumen, including strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, analysis and multi-tasking
  • Ability to prioritise both short and long term plans

Must be able to demonstrate:

  • Understanding of the commercial business and processes and the link between HR strategy and business strategy
  • Knowledge of best practice principles for people practices including reward, performance management, talent development, engagement.
  • Understand engagement with the ability to monitor the effect of business decisions on people and culture
  • Experience in organisational change initiatives in support of business strategies
  • Understanding of the external marketplace and business context for decision making
  • Understanding and application of coaching principles
About us:
\xc2\xa0

Nine\xe2\x80\x99s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers.

As the home of some of Australia\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Lifestyle, Entertainment, and Sport, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want it to ensure they are entertained, informed and connected each and every day.

\xc2\xa0

Our business operates in the following 4 divisions \xe2\x80\x93 FTA Television, Digital Publishing, Video on Demand (advertising and subscription) and Content Production. In addition, we have a long-running strategic relationship with Microsoft, selling their suite of advertising products while leveraging their world-leading technology, data, insights, and innovation as well as data relationships with Data Republic and Red Planet. Nine also has a 50% interest in Stan, as well as interests in RateCity, CarAdvice, Pedestrian.tv and ASX-listed financial services company, Yellow Brick Road.

'

title: NA
Post-Doctoral Fellows
description:
b'
  • One of Australia's leading research & teaching universities
  • Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion
  • Enjoy a career that makes a difference by collaborating & learning from the best

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

UNSW Art & Design leads Australia with a focus on media innovation and emerging technologies. Our approach is interdisciplinary, advancing tradition and challenging existing thinking. At UNSW Art & Design we foreground experimentation and exploration, fostering collaboration across science, engineering, the humanities and social sciences.

\xc2\xa0

About the roles

  • $89K-$95K plus 17% superannuation and leave loading
  • Fixed Term, Full-time, Research only
  • 3 X Post-Doctoral Fellow positions available; one each in the:
    1. 3D Visualisation Aesthetics Lab
    2. Interactive Media Lab
    3. EPICentre

\xc2\xa0

Position 1 [Job Opening ID 58419]: 3D Visualisation Aesthetics Lab

We are looking for an outstanding Post-Doctoral Fellow, with a research background in arts-led 3D CGI; and with experience in data capture and visualisation. The applicant should be familiar with VR Head Mounted Displays (HMD) platforms such as HTC Vive and Oculus Rift, and have an understanding of the creative process surrounding 3D real-time content creation. Applicants should also have published academic outputs in one or more of the following fields: 3D CGI, 3D visualisation, VR, Interactive Computer Arts, Media Arts and Serious Games. Applicants with experience with 3D visualisation in any of the following areas are strongly encouraged to apply: Patient rehabilitation research; Biomedical data visualisation; and Reality capture - topographical data capture and visualisation. Working in the area of 3D Computer Visualisation Aesthetics; this Post-Doctoral Fellow will apply skills in 3D computer visualisation, 3D CGI, Virtual Reality \xe2\x80\x93 HMD and arts-led research, contributing to research outputs in collaboration with the Lab Director, Associate Professor John McGhee.

To view the position description and to apply for this role, please click here.

\xc2\xa0

Position 2 [Job Opening ID 58421]: Interactive Media Lab

An exciting opportunity is available for a talented early-career researcher to join UNSW Art & Design, working in the area of either generative content creation, or creative computing for the Internet of Things (IoT). The Post-Doctoral Fellow will apply skills in coding and research, contributing software-based arts research outputs to one of these two research areas, in collaboration with Dr Oliver Bown of the Interactive Media Lab (see previous publications here).

Applicants in generative content creation will be familiar with the research field of Computational Creativity, and related conferences and journals, and will have a good understanding of at least one relevant algorithmic technique, such as machine learning or evolutionary computation, as well as experience of creative practice in one area.

Applicants in creative computing for the IoT (the use of IoT technologies in media artworks such as media architecture, live music or theatrical performance, interactive experiences and locative media experiences) will be familiar with one or more creative coding platforms such as Processing, OpenFrameworks or MaxMSP, and/or hardware platforms such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi or C.H.I.P, as well as an understanding of the creative and interaction design issues surrounding these technologies. They will have experience of the academic work in contexts such as Computer-Human Interaction, Tangible and Embodied/Embedded Interaction, Ubiquitous Computing or the International Symposium on Electronic Art.

To view the position description and to apply for this role, please click here.

\xc2\xa0

Position 3 [Job Opening ID 58325]: EPICentre

The third Post-Doctoral Fellow will play an active role in the research activities and projects undertaken at UNSW's EPICentre into high performance visualisation, graphics and novel mixed reality techniques as applied to medical data, imaging and other interdisciplinary fields. He/she will contribute towards conceiving and implementing new visualisation outputs, new interactive techniques, software packages and demonstrations as part of EPICentre projects and programs of research. They will also be involved in the training and supervising of students and presenting findings in the form of publications and conference presentations. EPICentre has brought together UNSW's world-leading leading researchers in visualisation, to build the world's highest resolution omnispatial interactive and immersive 6.4m diameter 3D 340-degree visualisation environment. The Expanded Perception and Interaction Cylinder (EPICylinder), is a cluster-driven system of 120 million pixels in 3D. Another key visualisation environment in this facility is DomeLab, a 6m diameter 4K fulldome. EPICentre also aims in using mixed reality techniques that would combine existing visualisation systems with the power of augmented reality (e.g. using Microsoft HoloLens's in the mix). All these systems offer unique opportunities for transformative data-driven research and accelerated scientific discovery. The Post-doctoral Fellow will be contributing to research outputs of the EPICentre, in close collaboration with the Head of Visualisation, Associate Professor Tomasz Bednarz.

To view the position description and to apply for this role, please click here.

\xc2\xa0

You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description of each role in your application. Please apply online through the Jobs@UNSW portal and search using the reference numbers provided - applications will not be accepted if sent directly to the contact listed.

\xc2\xa0

Applications for the EPICentre role close: 19 May 2017

Applications for the 3D & IML roles close: 18 June 2017

\xc2\xa0

Find out more about working at UNSW at https://www.artdesign.unsw.edu.au/

UNSW is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity



'

title: Shopping Centre Marketing Manager (Job Share 2/3 days)
description:
b"The Company
A leading private property investment business with an established national portfolio of property that typically sits in either retail shopping centres & hospitality sectors. A well capitalised business, with the opportunity to acquire and reinvest capital into growing the portfolio.

The Company is well represented by key senior executives with track records at some of Australia's leading property companies such as Lendlease, Westfield (Scentre Group), AMP Capital, etc - so the level of sophistication and expectation is equal to an institutional investor.

The Opportunity
A very rare opportunity for a senior shopping centre marketing manager to undertake a JOB SHARE on either two or three days per week. This will be providing in-house marketing management across a national portfolio of shopping centres. These vary from neighborhood centres to large format retail.

Role responsibilities;
  1. Coordination and implementation of marketing campaigns and events including retailer communications.
  2. Work with Marketing manager to determine objectives and desirable outcomes for promotions
  3. To improve Centre traffic and retail turnover.
  4. To build on and improve relationships with tenants.
  5. Monitor and Manage the marketing fund budgets together with the marketing manager
  6. Summarise and analyse the Centre's SWOT having regard to the competition.
  7. Develop & implement plans for advertising, marketing, Centre promotions, public relations and other required areas.
  8. Online and digital marketing
  9. Website management
  10. Electronic data base collation including data entry
  11. Monitoring retailer promotions and adding value where possible within the social media space for each project.
  12. Prepare detailed monthly marketing reports on all activities for the following month.
The Candidate
You will be experienced in shopping centre marketing, and able to swiftly manage the required seasonal campaigns, specific bespoke marketing requirements for each centre, and brochures - specific for the bulky goods assets.

To find out more information please contact Jessica Fowler on 02 9146 6660 or email your CV to; Jessica@capstonerecruitment.com.au "

title: Accounts Payable Officer

Working for a dynamic and forward thinking business, this is a great career move for a passionate Accounts Payable Professional looking to gain career enhancing experience.

title: Investment Analyst | Leading Industry Super Fund
description:
b"Our client is a very\xc2\xa0well-respected Industry Superannuation Fund\xc2\xa0with an expanding and highly-regarded Investment team\xc2\xa0that is now taking control of an increasing amount of the Fund's investment activity in-house. Due to some internal re structuring a rare opportunity has arisen for an exceptional candidate to join their Investment Strategy Team.

This role will see you use your strong\xc2\xa0quantitative skills and deep understanding of economic principles to assist in\xc2\xa0the\xc2\xa0maintenance and development of active asset\xc2\xa0allocation models. \xc2\xa0You will need to liaise with multiple stakeholders both internally and externally and\xc2\xa0ensure the relevant\xc2\xa0research and relationships are developed to support the active management of the Funds various asset class exposures.\xc2\xa0

You will be responsible for:
  • Developing, enhancing and maintaining systematic active asset allocation models
  • Undertaking macroeconomic, policy, markets and asset class research\xc2\xa0
  • Leveraging the insights of external managers to influence internal strategy
  • Compiling reports on the funds investment options and broader commentary on the market and topical economic issues
  • Maintaining relevant economic and financial market data and chart packs\xc2\xa0
  • Research, monitor and manage relationships with external investment managers.

They are looking for:
  • Tertiary qualifications in Economics or Finance or related quantitatively based discipline.\xc2\xa0
  • Progress towards a post-graduate qualification such as a Masters, CFA, or other relevant qualification is viewed favourably.\xc2\xa0
  • Relevant industry experience (2-3 years), at an asset consultant, fund manager or other institutional investor.
  • Strong quantitative skills - VBA and econometric/statistical modelling \xc2\xa0
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills - ability to synthesize complex information into concise conclusions and communicate them in a comprehensible manner.
  • A strong desire to develop a career in Superannuation/Investments
This is an exceptional opportunity to\xc2\xa0join a collaborative team in a growing and dynamic setting with highly capable and intellectually robust people.\xc2\xa0With ever increasing investment activity and FUM, this is a chance to join\xc2\xa0a 'best practice' consultancy within a highly regarded, 'employer of choice'.
\xc2\xa0
If you would like to explore this opportunity further please send your resume via the APPLY link below or, alternatively, call Rebecca Brazier at Keegan Adams for a confidential chat on 0292166714. "

title: Category Development Executive
description:
b'

We are searching for a talented Category Development Executive to fuel strategy and innovation through integrated analysis across a range of different data/insight sources (market, shopper, demographic, consumer etc.) and recommendations to advise portfolio and channel strategies across all KCA categories.

This perm, fulltime opportunity is for a talented individual who is strongly committed to contributing to the achievement of our overall categories & strategic vision.

Reporting to the Head of Category this is a highly autonomous, project focused role with a large amount of influence across the sales and marketing strategies for the business. With a high focus on the analytical piece, you will support Category Management team to build the category strategies and provide expertise to assist with the price and promotional strategy. Finally, you will drive the category framework for Innovation/NPD launch into customers.

We are looking for an individual with proven experience and a personal brand that aligns with our culture. The Category Development Executive will act as role model and will champion our One KC Behaviours and KC Values. The type of person who is successful in this role has strong analytical skill, the ability to create recommendations and engage key stakeholders to work collaboratively with a team to develop strategy, and a strong bias to execute against that strategy. We are seeking accountable, highly engaged and prepared individuals who are interested in building their runway to more Category Development opportunities in the future.

We are seeking a Category Development Manager who will:

  • Integrate consumer insight/shopper/market/demographic or other relevant data to validate/debunk strategic hypotheses and formulate recommendations for action as required by the Senior Category Development Manager or other strategic project team
  • Monitor and advise on the size, growth, penetration trial and repeat purchase in all KCA categories. Identify interaction with KC brands, current manufacturer, product performance (work with product techs) and period of tender renewal. Build case for tender internally and work with Customer Business Manager externally to secure opportunities for KCA
  • Project Manage successful tender initiatives through the project development of stage-gate signoff and go-to-market with the customer & supply team.
  • Ad-hoc support to sector Category Development Managers
  • Add value by active participation in the development and sell-in of Customer specific plans.
  • Communicate fully with Cross Functional Teams, Leaders within our business and the wider Category Development Team Members. Communicate in a way that is appropriately prompt, complete and concise, being both candid and accurate.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Education: Degree in Business and or Marketing
  • Extensive experience in marketing, sales or category management
  • Experience in leading and influencing a team
  • Effective Communication and influencing skills
  • Analytically strong with strong strategic thinking ability
  • Project Management and organisation skills
  • Effective presentation skills
  • Research - shopper and consumer
  • Space Management / Range Assortment
  • Promotion Strategy

What\xe2\x80\x99s on offer?

Competitive base salary, Consumer Sales Incentive, up to 10% Superannuation. As an employee of Kimberly Clark you are entitled to a suite of benefits as we partner with Apple, Citi, Bupa, Converge.

The type of person who excels in this role has an enthusiastic approach towards supporting their team and building collaborative relationships with their internal and external customers. This person will be able drive and lead change through utilisation of their sound experience and potential to continuously develop. The ability to display a strong level of initiative as well as exceptional communication skills is essential for this role. We are excited about the opportunity we have to take new talent on a journey with our Category Development Team.

#LI-AC1

'

title: Research Associate
description:
b'
  • One of Australia's leading research & teaching universities
  • Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion
  • Enjoy a career that makes a difference by collaborating & learning from the best

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

The School of Civil and Environmental Engineering at UNSW Sydney comprises 45 academic staff, 80 research centre staff, and 32 professional and technical staff. Its recurrent income is $22M per annum, with a further $12m in research income. The School has 1,700 undergraduate students, 620 postgraduate coursework students and 220 postgraduate research students. The School is one of the most active in research at UNSW.

\xc2\xa0

About the role

  • $71K - $95K\xc2\xa0plus 17% superannuation and leave loading
  • 3 Years Fixed Term
  • Full-time

The position objective is to contribute towards the research effort in the field of Water/Environmental Engineering so that the outcomes can be strategically used by the School/University to improve its research reputation and strengthen collaboration with industry partners. The position is primarily based at the Water Research Laboratory at Manly Vale.

\xc2\xa0

Key Duties and Responsibilities

  • Undertake novel research in the field of wetland restoration, eco-hydraulics and/or sediment dynamics, including the assessments of ecosystem response from restored hydrologic conditions.
  • Prepare high impact research publications and related plain English summary documents within the area of research.
  • Conduct research under limited supervision either as a member of a team or, where appropriate, independently and the contribution to the production of conference and seminar papers and publications from that research.
  • Involvement in professional activities including, subject to availability of funds, attendance at conferences and seminars in the field of expertise.

\xc2\xa0

About the successful applicant

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • A doctorate in environmental engineering or a related area of physics/science.
  • Proven research work in the field of environmental engineering or physical sciences.
  • Desired skillset in tidal ecosystems (particularly saltmarsh vegetation), data management, groundwater investigations and field monitoring.
  • Proven capacity to undertake field work investigations and assess ecosystem response, preferibly in\xc2\xa0wetland/tidal environments

You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description in your application. Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent directly to the contact listed.

Contact:
William Glamore, Associate Professor
E:\xc2\xa0w.glamore@wrl.unsw.edu.au\xc2\xa0
T:\xc2\xa0(61 2) 8071 9868



'

title: Senior Digital Marketing Manager
description:
b"

Unique opportunity manage the Digital strategy of a global IT business with a fantastic culture!

Ensuring the digital presence of our client\xe2\x80\x99s brand in the APAC, your responsibilities will include but not limited to:

title: Senior Corporate Recruiter
description:
b"

About the business and the role

When you join InterSystems, you will be working for a global technology partner, with a local focus. We have offices across the APAC region, including in Sydney, Melbourne, Beijing, Hong Kong and Bangkok.

With a number of prominent projects on the horizon and a growing customer base across the region, now is an ideal time to join InterSystems and work for an innovative technology partner with a passion for excellence and customer success.

The Recruitment Team is 12 strong group aligned geographically to support the business in the Americas, EMEA and Asia Pacific.\xc2\xa0 The team is a tight-knit group of professionals with high personal standards for excellence and together we hire roughly 250 employees each year ranging from individual contributor software engineers to senior VP's.\xc2\xa0 The recruitment process is designed to be highly selective and the recruiters are tasked not only with finding the best candidates through a variety of resources, but also with helping the business to make the right selection.\xc2\xa0 We use a variety of methods to determine fit including a personality survey, logic tests, and behavioural based interviewing.\xc2\xa0

Job tasks and responsibilities

  • Implement sourcing strategies to provide a qualified and diverse candidate pool
  • Maintain sourcing activity and pipeline reports to accurately report progress of candidates
  • Responsible for developing a pipeline of candidates through cold calling, networking, internet searches/research, marketing campaigns, and social media networking
  • Passion for creatively identifying strong, passive candidates
  • Ensure hiring manager and team preparedness during the interview process and that interviews are conducted efficiently and professionally
  • Interface to negotiate and exchange information with all levels of management
  • Maintain relevant and accurate candidate data using a Web Based ATS system (ICIMs)
  • Manage candidate process and act as a candidate advocate
  • Evaluate skill level; manage offer process, including reference checks, salary recommendations, offer letter generation and offer acceptance
  • Negotiate offers by partnering with hiring manager, senior management and other groups as necessary
  • Responsible for sourcing candidates through networking, internet postings, university relations, etc.
  • Passion for improving the customer experience with customers broadly defined as candidates, new hires, hiring managers and recruiters. Continuous follow-up with clients to confirm staffing plans and candidates needs are met.
  • Able to work independently. Ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage work time efficiently
  • Self-directed, detail-oriented, problem solver with a burning desire to contribute to the organization's reputation and success
  • Proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a high-paced, changing work environment

Skills and experience

  • Substantial full cycle recruiting experience with a track record for building strong teams either in Operations, Sales and Engineering functions
  • Professional integrity, discretion and confidentiality
  • Experience recruiting internally for the HR department or Recruiting department of a multi-national firm
  • Evidence of creative sourcing skills which will include use of multiple current channels\xc2\xa0
  • Long-term tenure with proven success working inside high technology software companies
  • Understanding of the technical requirements of a wide variety of technical positions
  • Experience working with all levels from executives down to individual contributors
  • A strong customer service ethos\xc2\xa0
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to maintain accurate records and reports
  • Excellent spoken/written English absolutely required
  • Excellent computer skills
  • Ability to understand company needs and prioritize workload focus
  • Assertiveness, sense of urgency, ability to work under pressure, ability to work independently
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • University Degree in applicable field of study

"

title: Support Coordinator
description:
b"

Disability Macarthur has been providing support to adults and children with a disability for over 30 years within the Macarthur Region. We are a client focused organisation and strive to enrich and empower the lives of our clients.\xc2\xa0

Disability Macarthur is seeking to employ a Support Coordinator, which is a new role to support people with a National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) plan to connect with the community to reach their goals.

This position is being offered on a full-time, fixed term basis for 12 months (possibility of extension). This role is covered under the SCHCADS Award.

Key Responsibilities for this position include:

  • Research, coordinate and manage a range of supports to suit individual needs across multiple providers.
  • Coordinate access to support items in an NDIS Plan.
  • Work with the client and their natural supports to assess the quality and value of the supports provided and ensure that they are meeting the client's individual needs.
  • Actively support clients to connect with their communities and encourage participation in informal, mainstream and community options.
  • Support clients to build their capacity and networks with the aim of greater choice, control and independence in managing their personal life choices.
  • Work within the funding levels associated with each client including tracking and monitoring billable hours associated with Support Coordination service delivery.
  • Work closely with external and internal stakeholders to achieve positive outcomes for the organisation.

The successful applicant will have:

  • Certificate IV or higher in community services/disability Work or cert IV/Diploma in case management and or have extensive demonstrated experience in a case management or care coordination role (at least 3 years or equivalent).
  • Knowledge of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) and the disability sector.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills are critical.
  • Experience working with multiple stakeholders in a formal and informal partnerships to achieve outcomes for clients.
  • Advanced computer skills
  • Data base entry skills
  • Current NSW Drivers Licence and Comprehensively insured Vehicle
  • Right to work in Australian
  • Working with children's check
  • Criminal Record check.

    \xc2\xa0

Disability Macarthur is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

\xc2\xa0

How to Apply:\xc2\xa0 Submit your CV and Cover Letter addressing the criteria of the role attention to Assistant Manager -\xc2\xa0 y.werner@disabilitymacarthur.org.au . Please include two direct\xc2\xa0 supervisor referees.

\xc2\xa0Applications will close COB 19/5/17.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 www.disabilitymacarthur.org.au

title: Broker Relationship Officer
description:
b'Some careers have more impact than others.

title: NA
description:
b'

Senior Risk Services Developer

CLOSE COLLABORATION WITH FRONT OFFICE

Risk Services Business Platforms and Integration DevOps Team supports the Commodities and Global Markets Group. As a senior member of the team you will have the opportunity to work alongside experienced front office developers and interact directly with the business stakeholders.

ABOUT THE ROLE

You will be responsible for project delivery, production stability and development productivity improvement. Others include:

  • Develop, test and deploy code in a variety of programming environments

ABOUT YOU

The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. title: Business Development Manager
description:
b'

Next Telecom is a leading service provider in Australia. You will be responsible for selling IP Voice and corporate data and International data links to medium and corporate businesses within Australia.

As a Senior Sales Consultant \xc2\xa0you will be responsible for driving growth and maximizing sales opportunities and you will be based in our North Sydney head office. This is a true "hunter" role in a dynamic and fast paced industry.

To succeed in this role you will have the ability to develop strong relationships at all levels, demonstrate a high level of written and oral communication skills, professional presentation skills, a dedication to customer satisfaction, and be driven to achieve results.\xc2\xa0 You will have experience having sold services to the SME/mid corporate space within the telecommunications industry. Your ability to be able to get on the\xc2\xa0phone and work on vertical markets to achieve your own appointments is mandatory.\xc2\xa0 You will already have a strong business network with many SME /corporate customers of which you will be able to get the ball rolling with from the get-go. Your ability to get infront of potential customers is critical and is a key element of being chosen for this role.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Maintaining selling activity to\xc2\xa0ensure objectives are being met

  • Searching for new business on an ongoing basis

  • Building new partnerships

  • Achieve monthly sales targets

  • Providing outstanding customer service with product and sales support

In addition, you will be a self-starter, have persistence, excellent organizational abilities, strong negotiation skills, and have the ability to work unsupervised and as part of a team.\xc2\xa0 Previous experience in business to business sales role is\xc2\xa0required.

The critical criteria to fit into the company culture is to be highly motivated, passionate about sales and wanting to work for a dynamic team.\xc2\xa0

Next Telecom is growing a reputation in the business world as one of the fastest growing service providers in Australia with outstanding customer service. We are looking to appoint now.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0

Recruitment agencies need not apply.

To apply for this position,\xc2\xa0email sales@nexttelecom.com.au\xc2\xa0 or "Apply Now" on the link below. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

'

title: ION | Front Office | Application Support Analyst
description:
b"

This renowned banking organisation has an excellent reputation and an equally strong brand name. As a member of the Fixed Income IT team, you will provide end-to-end support services for all Fixed Income related application & system issues, with a user base spanning the AsiaPac region.\xc2\xa0A truly high performing individual, you will focus on both BAU and multiple high profile state-of-the-art projects within this front office environment:\xc2\xa0

title: Inbound Sales Call Centre - MAPFRE Assistance
advertiser: Polyglot Group, SEEK Best Recruitment Agency 2014
description:
b"

The company

Mapfre Insurance Services Australia Pty Ltd (InsureandGo Australia) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Mapfre Asistencia, a multinational insurance and assistance services provider. Mapfre has offices in more than 47 countries and cover a wide range of insurance services (travel, car and home).

Since 2012 Mapfre / Insure & Go is expanding its operations in Australia by offering travel insurance. Due to its continual growth, Mapfre is looking for expressions of interest from a highly dedicated person that is looking for an Inbound Contact Centre Sales Agent position within a leading organisation. This\xc2\xa0is an opening this will be a full-time permanent position!
\xc2\xa0

Purpose

You will be part of the sales and customer services team, represent the brand by being the 1st point of contact, building rapport with customers, understanding customers' needs, answering their enquiries and increasing sales' growth by creating further interest in Mapfre Insure&Go's insurance products. Ensure that all inbound telephone enquiries are dealt proactively and effectively.


The role

- Answer calls from customers enquiring about travel insurance products and services

-Share your product knowledge and assess customers' needs to close sales while matching customers' expectations and needs
- Use your exceptional customer service and sales skills to provide customers with the best product to suit their needs as well as up selling and cross selling
- Provide a high level of customer service, over the phone and via email

- Ensure that all quotations and sales are dealt within a compliant manner

- Accurately record all client data on our relevant systems/databases.

- Meet targets and increase your salary with monthly bonuses

- Achievable targets to reach & ongoing coaching will be provided to achieve your targets
- Work in a social and supportive environment

Working hours:
- Work full time on a rotating roster from Monday to Friday ; 8.30am\xc2\xa0- 7pm (8 hour shifts).

- Weekend shifts\xc2\xa0once per month, Saturday\xc2\xa0between 8.30am 5pm \xe2\x80\x93 compensated with\xc2\xa01 day off beforehand of after - ideal to complete your own errands!


The candidate

- Passionate about sales and customer service
- Previous sales and service experience as a contact centre Agent, ideally within the travel insurance industry or previous sales experience within a face-to-face environment with sales targets to achieve

- Confident when speaking to customers

- Demonstrated planning and organizational skills in order to meet deadlines

- Outstanding communication skills with the ability to communicate on all levels

- Strong listening skills

- Empathic, dynamic and outgoing

- An ability and willingness to take initiative

- Targets-oriented and a proven track record of meeting and/or achieving KPIs both in sales and customer service
- A reliable, punctual and loyal attitude is essential

- A good knowledge and understanding of insurance products and of the Australian travel insurance market is a plus
\xc2\xa0

This is a unique and exceptional opportunity to advance your career in Sales and in the Insurance Industry with this highly inspiring and fast growing company. Thus, if you are self-motivated, dynamic and have passion for sales then do not wait, apply now!
\xc2\xa0

If this sounds like you, please apply by submitting your CV in WORD format + a cover letter highlighting your motivations to this specific role and organisation.

Mapfre Insure & Go is committed to promoting individuals with disabilities and highly encourages you to apply.

Please note that due to the high number of applications only successful candidates would be contacted.

"

title: Accounting Officer  Business Support
description:
b'

Temporary full-time, 35 hours per week for a period up to 12 months
Closing Date: 17 May 2017
Vacancy No. FS-1705

Are you looking for an exciting career in a place of limitless opportunity? The city of Penrith sits at the foot of the Blue Mountains, alongside the Nepean River, and is home to approximately 198,000 people. We employ approximately 1200 permanent, temporary and casual employees across a diverse range of fields and are committed to attracting and retaining the best people. We offer a diverse range of career paths with a strong commitment to training, education assistance, paid parental leave and flexible working arrangements.

In Financial Services we are responsible for the effective and efficient management of Council financial functions, including corporate and financial accounting, rates and purchasing & supply. We are fit for the future and our hard working team of finance professionals are building on our strong financial sustainability and facilitating the delivery of our Community's and Council's vision for our City.

An opportunity is available within our Business Support team to fill the position of Accounting Officer \xe2\x80\x93 Business Support for a period of up to 12 months on a temporary full-time basis whilst the substantive occupant is on secondment to another department. This role provides an excellent career development opportunity for an experienced candidate looking to transition from an Assistant Accountant role.

The Accounting Officer - Business Support provides financial advice and assistance to Council's Community based Committees, Leisure Centres, and Entities and supports these groups in meeting their financial reporting obligations. In this busy and varied position, you will be responsible for:

  • Coordinating the financial yearend process and producing financial reports for Council's Community based Committees
  • Producing tax reports to meet Councils tax obligations
  • Providing training to members of Council's Community based Committees, Leisure Centres, and Entities
  • Rostered Cash Room functions
  • Completion of Council's long services levy statutory requirements
  • Completion of bank reconciliations for, and providing assistance to, Council's Children Services Cooperative

Essential Criteria:

  • A tertiary qualification, or working towards, in Business, Accountancy or relevant field
  • Demonstrated ability to analyse and comprehend financial data and produce financial reports
  • Sound understanding of Goods and Services Tax (GST) and Business Activity Statements (BAS)
  • Sound reconciliation skills, including Bank Reconciliations
  • Strong computer skills (preferably Excel, Word and Financial Software packages)
  • Ability to work autonomously in a deadline driven environment

Desirable Criteria:

  • Previous Local Government experience in a similar role
  • Experience with Technology One products, including Finance One
  • A current Class C Driver Licence

Commencing Salary: $62,900 per annum

To view the position description and submit your application before 5pm on the closing date, please visit www.penrithcity.nsw.gov.au. Alternatively, for further information about the position please contact Dana Daghero on 4732 7895.

Council practices EEO and WHS principles.

'

title: Asset Engineer Condition
description:
b"
  • Deemed 'Fit for the Future' as a stand-alone Council
  • Permanent Full Time position including a 19 day four week cycle + access to a leaseback vehicle
  • Dynamic small team working in a friendly environment

Council is seeking a confident, motivated, enthusiastic and experienced Asset Engineer Condition to work as part of a small dynamic work team.

About the role
The Asset Engineer Condition is required to develop, maintain and implement the Condition Assessment and Data Collection Strategy for roads and Drainage infrastructure assets. As the successful applicant you will also be required to manage the Pavement Management System for Council and ensure that outputs support informed decision making.
Salary for this position is based on skills, experience and qualifications and will range from $78,982pa to $91,619pa + super.

About You
This is a 'fast paced' work environment and in addition to being multi-skilled, holding the relevant qualifications and being a team player you must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Degree or equivalent qualifications in Civil Engineering
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in construction & maintenance of road and drainage assets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in asset management including condition assessments and capital works program development relating to road and drainage assets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in manage a Pavement Management System (preferably SMEC).
  • Demonstrated experience in contract management.
  • Demonstrated high level or oral and written communication skills to manage relationships with staff, customers and stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated high level of computer literacy and experience with Microsoft Office suite.
  • Demonstrated understanding of WH&S and traffic control requirements.
  • Current NSW Drivers Licence (Class C)

About us
Located in the Southern Highlands, Wingecarribee Shire Council is within comfortable travelling distance of Sydney, Canberra, the South Coast and the Illawarra. With four distinct and stunning seasons combined with glorious countryside rich in biodiversity and appeal, it's an enviable lifestyle location.

To Apply
To apply for this position please visit www.wsc.nsw.gov.au (Careers @ Council) to view the position description. Please complete the online application process by submitting your resume and a covering letter outlining your background, interest in and suitability for the position. Applicants are also required to address the selection criteria (Essential and Desirable Criteria) by demonstrating that your claims against each of the criteria outlined in the Position Description.

Please note: the online process allows for three items to be uploaded i.e. Covering Letter, Resume and your claims against the Selection Criteria. Only candidates with the right to work in Australia will be considered for the position. Further information can be obtained by contacting Mr Stace Lewer 0408 626 377.


Closing date for applications is Monday 22 May 2017

"

title: Procurement Business Analyst
description:
b"

The goal is to reduce members indirect spend through delivery of categories such as Travel, Electricity, Catalogues, Packaging etc. My client is looking to expand the team to meet the growing membership base and increasing spend within the categories they manage for members.

City Location

Training, mentoring and on the job learning

title: Commercial Director - Global Consumer Business
description:
b"

Commercial leadership role driving a global consumer business during an exciting phase of growth.

Client Details

My client is a global iconic household consumer brand with unmatched growth and opportunity in its field. The organisation has bold plans for the ANZ region and is seeking a progressive Commercial lead to drive its operations to new heights.

Description

This position leads a billion dollar business with a healthy EBIT, #1 market share and double digit growth for the last 5 years. Leading a small, yet effective commercial team, you will be responsible for;

  • Driving the annual operating plan and quarterly forecasts for the business
  • Liaison as required with head office on earnings, margins, performance against plan and forecast and progress on local initiatives to improve returns, margins and sales
  • Provide commercial leadership within the cross-functional teams charged with planning and executing the marketing calendar and longer term brand projects
  • Lead and participate in various project work groups as the commercial lead. For example, sales growth and margin improvement initiatives, competitor analysis etc
  • Provide leadership and development to your team
  • Demonstrating your ability to be a future Finance leader in a more senior capacity

Profile

You will be a commercial leader with future CFO/GM potential and come from a consumer, big data, multi-site, sales environment. You will have experience taking board level projects from inception to fruition, working across finance, sales, marketing, IT and operations environments. As strategic you are, you must not be afraid of rolling up your sleeves and being hands on with due diligence, financial modelling, detailed analysis etc. You will either be CA/CPA/MBA qualified and ideally be wanting to progress into a GM level position.

Job Offer

  • An attractive remuneration package
  • An opportunity to progress into a GM/CFO role
  • A generous STI program
  • Options to join an LTI program
  • Global opportunities
  • Parking on site

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Sung Ho Lee on +61 2 8292 2035

title: National Youth Jobs PaTH Manager
description:
b"About Australian Employment & Training Solutions (AETS)

AETS is part of PeoplePlus Australia, a large, successful group of companies that are building the most reliable integrated workforce solution in the country. We help people to transform their lives and businesses through work and training.\xc2\xa0

About the role\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team in Sydney CBD, as a full time\xc2\xa0National Youth Jobs PaTH Manager.\xc2\xa0

In this role you will be responsible for driving a high performance culture within your teams, by managing trainers / facilitators and resources to ensure operational excellence, contractual compliance and successful financials, Australia-wide for the Federal Government's Youth Jobs PaTH programme.\xc2\xa0

Youth Jobs PaTH is a new and flexible approach for youth training which is designed to support young people in gaining the skills they need to get and to keep a job. The training will help participants to identify and improve the employability skills that employers expect and to develop the interview and application skills necessary to win jobs.


You will do this by:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Leading, inspiring, encouraging, motivating and supporting all personnel to meet and exceed operational and financial targets
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and implementing strategic business plans to help achieve the organisation's vision and direction
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing strategic networks and relationships with a broad range of external stakeholders: senior government representatives, employers, education, industry associations, jobactive providers and community organisations\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Being responsible for facilitating growth of the Youth PaTH programme and seeking out any other potential business opportunities as they arise\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing strategic networks and relationships with a broad range of external stakeholders to ensure success of the Youth PaTH programme
\xe2\x80\xa2 Building relationships and driving engagement with Community Organisations, Educational Institutes, Employers and young people
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding employers needs and proactively work with employers to generate employment and/or work experience for young people\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
A little about you\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

You will have the following:

\xe2\x80\xa2 A results-oriented approach, with demonstrated experience in achieving performance targets, budgets and contractual compliance\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sound knowledge on performance management and how to drive successful teams
\xe2\x80\xa2 Robust interpersonal, marketing and business development skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to manage, monitor and analyse data of key performance indicators and implement corrective actions as necessary to ensure the achievement of required targets\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Passion to adopt an engaging, positive, motivational and strength-based approach in delivering the Youth PaTH programme across Australia\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Passionate about 'start ups' and building a program from early beginnings to best practice operational performance
\xe2\x80\xa2 \xc2\xa0Experience working with disadvantaged and unemployed cohorts and have an understanding of the barriers that unemployed youth face when in a classroom would be desirable.\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of jobactive operations would be desirable
\xc2\xa0
You currently either have or are willing to obtain a Working with Children's Check for paid employment and a National Police Check.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Why we want you to work for us
If you are interested in embarking on a rewarding career, we would like to hear from you. We are always looking for committed, talented and target-driven people to join our movement in connecting our youth to skills and jobs.\xc2\xa0

Our Company's culture fosters Teamwork, Respect, Commitment, Reliability, Creativity and Integrity.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Benefits
\xe2\x80\xa2 Competitive Salary Package \xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Employee Assistance Program
\xe2\x80\xa2 Challenging and rewarding work
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and grow within your career\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xa2 Your chance to be part of a new team based learning model to improve prospects for young people

Apply today and leap into a rewarding and progressive career with AETS. Please attach a\xc2\xa0cover letter\xc2\xa0outlining your suitability and attach your\xc2\xa0resume.

At AETS we value cultural diversity within our organisation. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are strongly encouraged to apply.\xc2\xa0 "

title: Marketing Coordinator - Expression of Interest
description:
b'
About the Role:
As specialists within marketing, we are constantly seeing new roles come through across all levels of Marketing Coordination.

We work closely with a number of industry leading and well established clients within the Retail/FMCG and Consumer Durables space and we are always on the lookout for candidates who are interested in new opportunities.

Skills & Experience:
  • Tertiary qualifications within a relevant discipline such as Marketing, Commerce\xc2\xa0
  • 2+ years within a Marketing role within consumer, retail or FMCG
  • Experience with developing and executing brand marketing strategies

  • The ability to build strong relationships and work closely with both internal and external stakeholders\xc2\xa0
  • Experience with managing multiple campaigns and projects at one time\xc2\xa0
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills\xc2\xa0

title: Senior Management Accountant
description:
b"

Currently undergoing a complete finance transformation project this $1.5b group is looking to onboard 1/2 Senior Management Accountants. Key projects have emerged that require candidates who have a background in business partnering / commercial analysis & management accounting.

You will work with the CFO and Head of FPA to ensure that the groups management accounting requirements are met. As the organisation is working through a finance transformation the ideal candidate will be able to deliver BAU activity whilst sporting the group through a period of transition.

The responsibility of the Management Accountant will be to business partner with senior executives across the business and deliver on the following:
  • To prepare accurate and timely management accounts.
  • To improve the timeliness, relevance and quality of management information reporting to relevant cost centre managers.
  • To help maintain and develop the monthly management information pack, including focus on key drivers and variance analysis.
  • To assist with month end planning, to ensure timely and accurate production of management accounts and to manage month end in line with plan.
  • To work with the rest of the Management Accounts team across the business to help analyse and interpret both financial and qualitative information in order to make sound recommendations.
  • To analyse and interpret historic data and forecast results and prepare trend analysis to predict future performance.
  • To maintain high levels of service to the business and become an effective partner to senior decision makers.
  • To provide financial input to multi-functional projects and provide insightful analysis.
  • To work with operational departments on management accounting issues and improving the level of cost control within the business.
  • To work with department heads on ad hoc requests covering current and prospective business activities.
The successful candidate will be a fully qualified CA or CPA accountancy professional with a proven background within a mid to large organisation. They will have a proven track record of commercial insight, month-end control and business partnering experience with senior stakeholders.

Does this sound like you? Interested? Please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this position contact Daniel O'Brien by sending your CV to daniel@acquiretalent.com.au \xc2\xa00421 526 393 "

title: Accounts Payable & Payroll Officer
description:
b" SOPRANO DESIGN's vision is to be the world's leading, most inspiring and innovative supplier of mobile application software for mobile network operators to sell to enterprise and government customers. It provides value to its customers, staff and shareholders by delivering a powerful cloud-based enterprise platform that powerfully integrates IP, SMS, MMS, voice, and location into a seamless secure business mobile messaging experience. Soprano offers a revenue acceleration resale model and today partners strategically with 13 MNOs in 4 major global regions.

Reporting to the Director of Finance, you will be responsible for performing the day to day processing of the accounts payable transactions across 3 of our entities (Australia, New Zealand and United States).\xc2\xa0 We operate 2 payment runs per month - and this position needs to ensure that all bills have been entered, approved and are ready to be included in these processes.\xc2\xa0 The monthly reconciliation of the corporate credit card is also required to be undertaken and finalised within the required month-end time-frames. This role is also responsible for the input and maintenance of the Vendor details/information which is maintained in our Netsuite (accounting package).

As the Accounts Payable/Payroll Officer, you will be accountable for the following:
  • Maintaining Supplier records/information in Netsuite across 5 entities;
  • Entering invoices for Australia, New Zealand and US entities;
  • Reconciling monthly credit card statements;
  • Collating and submitting for approval, all expense reports received from domestic and international employees and contractors;
  • Coordinating the preparation of gross payroll data and submit to outsourced providers per agreed timeline (Australia, New Zealand & US);
  • Processing new starters and terminations (Australia, New Zealand & US);
  • Maintaining and updating employee records;
  • Undertaking payroll related regulatory and compliance reporting, including PAYE, Superannuation, payroll taxes and workers compensation on a monthly and annual basis.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE (Essential)
  • Minimum of 1 year experience within the AP environment, including the processing of invoices and maintaining accounts payable information;
  • Preferable a minimum of 1 year experience in a Payroll Position - at the bare minimum - some exposure to the Australian Payroll processes is required;
  • Intermediate - Advanced Excel skills;
  • Ideally be CPA/CA qualified but as a minimum have diploma or degree qualifications in Accounting;
  • High attention to detail and accuracy;
  • Efficient time management skills;
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills and ability to communicate across a broad audience.
If this sounds like the role for you please apply via this website or alternatively forward your details torecruitment@sopranodesign.com "

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
b'

Leading legal software provider with an amazing team culture are creating new opportunities in marketing! This is your opportunity to be a part of a brand-new retention team.

We are looking for a savvy, proactive and ambitious email marketing specialist to join a fast paced, innovative client marketing team based in Sydney CBD. The role will be to create the strategy, execution and analysis of all email marketing activities using automation and journey building.

Reporting to the Client Marketing Manager, you will be part of a close-knit team who love to share ideas, innovate new ways of doing things and who are driven to be the best.

Responsibilities

  • Working with the Client Sales team and Marketing Manager to create effective strategies for marketing automation
  • Write and construct beautiful marketing automation journeys that delivery high open rates, click throughs and conversions
  • Analyse, report and optimise all marketing automation campaigns
  • Conceptualise, project manage and brief any accompanying graphics, social media posts, web pages or videos etc. that need to be created to support each email journey
  • Conduct campaign testing and analysis to report on success, retention and future opportunities in the realm of marketing automation and data capture

Selection Criteria

  • Minimum of 2 years in a similar end-to-end marketing role
  • Exceptional writing skills
  • Stakeholder management experience
  • Email composition skills and experience
  • Exposure and use of a database/CRM system previously
  • Exposure and use of an email marketing system previously
  • Some experience over all other marketing channels
  • Confidence with building, testing, tracking and execution of all campaigns
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills

This role would suit an individual who has high attention to detail, brilliant writing skills and a passion for changing client behaviour through the use of email. They should have a desire to progress their career in a high performing culture and high growth company and be able to work under pressure as well as having exceptional time management and a \xe2\x80\x98get the job done\xe2\x80\x99 attitude.

Next Steps

If you believe you have the required skills to join this progressive team and want to work with a business that will look great on your CV, then apply now or call Lisa Morell on 0405 381 550.

'

title: Commercial Analyst - Rebates & Claims - $100-120k + Super
description:
b'
  • Location: Sydney, CBD
  • Salary: $100-120k + Super
  • Role Benefit: Global household names, exposure to all areas of the business and work with large suppliers.

Role Overview/Description

Reporting to the CFO, your duties and responsibilities will be focused around the relationships between the Buyers within the business and their Suppliers. You will be required to set up and maintain customer accounts ensuring all data inputted is 100% accurate and up to date. As the Commercial Analyst you will be taking inbound calls requiring attention to rebates, pay back disputes and enquiries around trading term agreements in place. This complex role will require you to be pro active and knowledgeable around making decisions and solving problems that may arise within the current terms. Your seamless communication skills will have you liaising with accounts, buyers, suppliers and management to ensure the correct information is being used to assist you in making important decisions.

You will also review supplier trading term agreements and ensuring risk assessments are completed within commercial guidelines. Your strong analytical and problem solving skills will allow you to implement and monitor robust internal controls and ensure risks are identified and mitigated. Your \xe2\x80\x98out of the box\xe2\x80\x99 thinking will also allow you to identify process improvement opportunities in the business and recommend changes to your internal stakeholders.

The Job/ Duties / Responsibilities

  • Commercial \xe2\x80\x9cinsight and analysis\xe2\x80\x9c performance reporting over rebates providing commentary across commercial metrics.
  • Own the financial rebate calculation for all supplier trade agreements.
  • Identify and drive systems and operational process improvements to deliver rebate insights faster to a dynamically growing business

Candidate Profile

You have extensive experience analysing rebates and claims and also performing transactional responsibilities such as accruals and general ledger work. Your excellent verbal and written communication skills are key strengths and you feel confident in making decisions around dollars. You are a team player who can multi task around your day to day duties. You will possess strong Excel skills and have a high level of accuracy. As a quick learner you will be welcomed into an organisation that will recognise your achievements and give you the chance to develop into their business.

Culture & Benefits

Top Australian retail company, this organisation has begun its transformation to become a leading online retailer and has rapidly gained the interest of high profile Australia CEO\xe2\x80\x99s and industry leaders. It boasts a best in class customer service culture and retains a high NPS that is a testament to their core values. The organisation will provide the right candidate the opportunity to lead a major pillar of the organisation and be instrumental in growing the organisation.

  • Grow your career - be part of an Iconic Australian success story
  • Be rewarded for your efforts - $100k-120k + Super
  • Genuine business partnership to the business; drive growth for this revenue line.

Apply

If this sounds like you, please send your resume by clicking the \xe2\x80\x9capply\xe2\x80\x9d link below addressing Tony Nguyen on quoting reference number TNTRM3348 in the subject line. For a confidential chat, please call Tony on 02 8211 3488.

'

title: Distribution Team Leader
description:
b'

Longing for a career, not a job, working with a team of people who are dedicated to creating premium quality, scientifically validated natural health products and love making people healthier and happier?

Swisse Wellness could be it!

With over 40 years' experience in the Wellness sector, we are a leading Wellness brand in Australia. From our vitamins and supplements, to our superfoods, sports nutrition and skincare ranges, when you work for Swisse, you are working across multiple wellness categories, full of premium quality products all formulated to help our customers "Celebrate Life Every Day"!

THE ROLE:

We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Distribution Team Leader to drive the global distribution of goods to customers both domestically and internationally. This is a great opportunity to leading a team with a strong focus on load planning, analysis and data reporting to allow the business to make optimal decisions and ensure customer expectations are met to the highest standards.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

This is a fast paced and varied role with the requirement to work in a fluid environment with multiple competing priorities.

Your responsibilities will be broad and will include:

  • Manage the logistical planning of global distribution, including required export documentation
  • Lead a small, high performing team
  • Oversee the execution of the load planning and maintenance of a daily pipeline of work for the warehouse
  • Create and maintain benchmark data reports & reporting tools for internal/external stakeholders to inform business decisions
  • Monitor and analyze monthly transport spend and distribution KPI performance
  • Provide visibility to the business (internal/external) regarding the short, medium and long term distribution plan

EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:

  • Understanding of international trade, contracts and tariffs
  • Ability to multi-task and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Tertiary degree in logistics/supply chain, statistics or related analytical field
  • 3+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience with a WMS (SAP or AX)
  • 3+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience leading a high performing team
  • 3+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience analysing large volumes of data and making solutions-focused decisions

You must be able to work proactively and collaboratively in a fast paced and constantly evolving environment.

Of vital importance is that you will be a solutions-orientated and self-motivated person who will possess an abundance of positivity, initiative and a passion for making "People Healthier and Happier as well as demonstrate Swisse Wellness' Team Spirit to "Celebrate Life Every Day!

Does this role sound perfect for you? If so, please 'Apply Now' by submitting your cover letter (essential) and CV to the Swisse team.

'

title: Research Assistant
description:
b'

Nanosonics Limited is a publically listed ASX200 Australian medical device company. We develop, manufacture and commercialise innovative and unique medical device disinfection solutions for global markets.

Our Company's mission is to improve the safety of patients, clinics, their staff and the environment by transforming the way infection prevention practices are understood by introducing innovative technologies that deliver improved standards of care.

What you will be doing...

  • Working collaboratively with the team to run experiments and record experimental data appropriately
  • Undertaking and effectively managing the conduct and timely outcome of experiments in area of responsibility
  • Write reports on the experiments conducted in a timely manner. Generating, analysing, interpreting and reporting data
  • Assistance with the development of procedures
  • Perform daily laboratory functions which may include laboratory equipment calibration & maintenance
  • Perform other duties as directed by Chief Chemist/ Product Development Chemist & Laboratory Administrator
  • Ensure equipment and laboratory are kept clean to avoid contamination and protect the company's assets

The experience & skills necessary to succeed in the role...

  • Minimal requirement of Certificate/Diploma in Laboratory techniques/research or equivalent discipline
  • Sound time management & organisation skills
  • Ability to follow detailed instructions
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy is essential
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills with ability to communicate to people in a range of positions
  • High degree of personal and professional integrity and ethics. Able to maintain confidentiality as it relates to aspects of the work
  • Highly proactive, collaborative and self-motivated with ability to work effectively both individually as well as part of a team
  • A team player with 'go the extra mile' attitude

This is a great role for candidates who are looking to start or further their career.

To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below.
